Roku has access to your info when you log into the Youtube channel.  Roku is to "Big Brother" invasive for my taste.  I simply don't log onto my Youtube account on the Roku.All in all it streams great and id faily easy to use.  I like that I do have some privacy and security options to choose.

It has saved my sluggish (and constantly freezing) HiSense 43-inch "Smart" LED TV .The tiny Roku stick is blindingly fast to my remote comannds, and manages to control my TV's volume and power from its single remote. It saves all the available wi-fi configs, so less typing passwords when switching to a better signal a/o internet provider.NO voice command outside USA, a inconvenient caveat that was not disclosed anywhere only after the thing is connected to my TV set. Buy the cheaper model that skips "voice" command and get the other useful features.

I just received my first smart TV and the Roku streaming stick+.  It was a learning curve getting it set up, but fairly easy considering I'm not a techie.  Everything works great and the online support for the Roku was concise. The instructions with the stick were simple and well-written.  I'm watching my favorite YouTube shows now.  Unusually enough, YouTube wasn't on the introductory list of channels to link to, but I just asked the internet how to add the YouTube channel and it was easy enough to do.  This from a 60 year old who has not had a TV for 10 years and who has never used a Roku.

  
Roku Streaming Stick+ | 4K/HDR/HD streaming player with 4x the wireless range & voice remote with TV power and volume

I have 3 Roku devices. One old slow non 4k stick, the Roku Express, and now the Streaming Stick, for 3 TVs. Originally the Express was being used on our primary TV but I bought the Streaming Stick for it because of the additional capabilities of the remote. That works as well as it should. The Streaming Stick, however, is not near the Express as far as visual quality, including clarity and color. And it is also much slower than the Express. I keep all of them updated, and occasionally power cycle them just to keep them cleared of residual bits of data that build during normal use. The Stick requires a reboot or power cycle constantly, especially after shifting from say Hulu to Netflix, or other services. Is it enough to make me drop it and get another Express? No. It's a streaming device for a decent price that does what it's advertised to do. To expect perfection, Champaign on beer money, would be foolish. I would recommend it to anyone else, but if they aren't particular about the remote, I'd go with the Express.

I bought this from Amazon to use with my LG OLED TV.  I wanted something that would support all that my LG TV can be.  This stick is amazing.  It's very easy to set up.  The setup is quick.  We like the large menu display (we are in our 60s).  We were watching shows in ten minutes flat!  It helps to register online using your computer first then sync your account with the stick.  It will ask to do that so just follow the directions.  Then it will do an automatic update to the latest firmware.  Adding content is easy from you computer or directly from the TV screen.  It's super easy.Signal strength is very strong for us.  Picture quality is excellent.  Sound quality, also excellent.  No latency or video slowing or stopping.I had to fix one thing during setup because of my ignorance.  The stick recognized 4K at 30fps but I know my LG can do 4K at 60fps.  A quick google showed me I needed to pair the HDMI slot with the HDR LG deep color setting which I did and re-ran setup.  The stick then recognized 4K at 60fps.  Problem solved.By the way there are many, many free channels and live channels along with all the standard premium content offered by Roku.  All easily accessible from Roku's simple menu.  If you are looking to break from cable, this Roku stick will greatly aid in that endeavor.I am very happy with the Roku stick plus.Buy it.  You will be happy too!

I recently purchased the streaming stick plus and have been blown away by it. The home screen is nice, simple, and easy to customize, while the video playback is snappy and responsive. I've been very happy with it and love the device. My only complaint is that Disney plus requires an HDR tv to play 4k content. My 4K tv is not HDR compatible and as a result Disney plus only plays in 1080p. This is a limitation that Disney has set and my FireTV Stick 4K exhibits the same behavior. Great device and better than my firestick.

I was in the process of buying a smart tv because the one I have do not have smart functions, low and he hold I thought about buying one of those sticks that's on the market, due to Covid and locked in all I do is watch movies on Prime but in another room and not the comfort of mine. Anyway got this in at an earlier date than originally told and set up was easy and I started enjoying the stick very quickly. yes I would recommend everyone who does not have one and would like wider options than regular tv or if you do not have a smart tv in this case this stick comes in very handy and again setup is easy and the price is great. I would buy from this seller again

For the money, Roku has the greatest palette of apps - HBOMax, Apple TV and so many more. However, they appear to have equipped this Streaming Stick+ with the cheapest, weakest WiFi receiver possible. We have high-speed Spectrum cable internet, and our router is right in the living room with our TV, about 12 feet away. All our devices (computer, iPad, phones, etc.) show full bars anywhere in that room, and the LG OLED TV itself has no trouble getting a strong signal on any other app - Netflix, Prime Video, etc.Yet the Roku stick, plugged into the HDMI port on the side of the TV, showed a weak connection of only 3 out of 5 bars, and buffered miserably upon watching. Moving the router within 5’ got us up to 4 bars and less connection glitches. Getting up to a strong 5-bar signal required moving our router RIGHT NEXT TO the TV.Unacceptable, period, for a 2021 WiFi-dependent streaming device...so cannot recommend.

Most older TVs require an HDMI dongle  to connect because the Roku stick is too long. Recently Roku stopped supplying the dongle, and you have to contact them to get one. Eight days later I still do not have it (perpetually listed as "Shipped" perhaps because Roku cheaped out and send it via USPS). Unless you have a new TV, just be prepared to stare at the Stick in its box for a week or more before seeing it it even is a good product.Update: after nine days I got the dongle...which was defective (I tested on a second tv which did not need an extension: works without the dongle but not with it) ... back to roku requested a second dongle be expedited. Six days later nothing. If I could give zero stars just for terrible customer service.Update 2: another week and a half and the second extender arrives. It also does not work (tested on a TV and two computers). More time wasted on chat and Roku discussion board, with no useful information provided. I finally solved this buying an HDMI extender on my own (I just picked the first one coming up on an Amazon). Presto it worked. So in total about three weeks of time wasted (plus cost of extender which was supposed to be supplied).

Why must we have a credit card to signup? Shouldn't it be optional to make it "easier to buy things later", THIS FEELS PREDATORY!And SO MUCH PERSONAL DATA is required just to get this thing to bring me to a home screen. ugh.Took my Dad about an hour to get this thing setup... really disappointing, this was supposed to have the easiest setup with minimal overhead, but instead we have to open browsers, make accounts, register credit cards, fill in personal information, tell you about our TV watching habits, etc.  What happened, Roku? You used to be the one consumers could turn to fight against the big companies, now you have become one, and just want to push products and sell our data... sigh

This is just a device that you need to either link your cable provider or sign up for the channels you want to watch. For instance news and sports, it has abc and NFL channel for free but if you want to watch fox or Newsmax you need to pay. It's capable of streaming Netflix and all the other entertainment platforms but as far as live TV or specific channels you need a subscription. Can't download mobdro or kodi on this device either. I will be returning. I'm not keeping something I have to pay for if I want to watch certain channels.

I know there was some issues with the remote not working, but mine only seemed to be a battery issue. I put new batteries in and it works as it should. You can also download an app remote that works great for typing in the search as well as being able to plug in head phones and listen privately from my phone. It works great so far and is my third Roku product. The other older two continue to work great. I can’t say about the Alexa integration as I have not attempted to utilize that tool. It sits flush with the HDMI port in my LG tv (it’s not a smart tv) and does not have to be plugged in to an electrical outlet.

I have had Amazon Firesticks since 2015 but they always were slow or laggy right out of the box. The last Firestick I bought had a horrible remote that would scroll way too fast (probably defective). The Amazon stick couldn't even load it's own Amazon content - I often would end up only using the Netflix or Hulu apps because the Amazon content was so slow to load.I was worried about the Roku being the same way, but the remote is so much better and it's not nearly as bloated as the firestick. I have complete control over the apps I see and download.I had no problems setting it up - works great! I wish I had bought it sooner and that I didn't put up with the firestick frustrations for the past 5 years. Will never look back!The only thing I wish is that I could reprogram the buttons for the 2 buttons / apps I will never use. Also wish I could pair the remote with my soundbar but doesn't seem possible.

I simply wanted to update my existing Roku box which is now too old to carry certain channels like Hulu. Once installed and connected to my router, the stick said it was updating it's software - only to return to its Let's Get Started page. Frustrating. But the real kicker is that Roku has no dedicated support. They sent me to an utterly worthless third party called JustAnswer which sent me info I had already read and told them didn't work.Looked on their community page - I'm not alone. No solutions (that work) offered. Very frustrating and time wasting. DO NOT BUY.

I have 2010 Panasonic 42 inch TV in my bedroom.  The TV has a superb 1080p picture and it works great, the only thing wrong with it, it came out right before the whole built in "Apps" feature came out to where you could connect all the online video (Netflix, Hulu, Amazon video music streaming, etc...)  Ordered this little unit for a mere $46 and now the TV is just like a brand new smart TV.  This Roku boots up fast, apps open fast, and the remote even operates my TV power and volume.  The remote has a great feel to it, not cheap.  From the time I press the power button on the Roku remote(which powers up the the TV and the Roku) it takes 12 seconds to be on Netflix.  Everything streams in 1080P and is sharper than ever.  Highly recommend.

Edit Dec. 9 2019. My Roku stick has completely died. It doesn't work AT ALL.I have had issues with this since day 1. Unfortunately I set it up after the 30 day return window. I have had several Roku devices. This is my first no plug necessary type. It's HORRIBLE! I am assuming mine in particular is defective. The remote has a very hard time "speaking" to the stick. Pressing buttons and nothing happens. It is beyond frustrating to say the least & only getting worst. I have very strong internet as I work from home, so I assure you that I have the best. Wish I could return this or exchange it. Waste of $50

I found installing the Roku Stick+, especially the software, extremely complicated. Sometimes you’re using the Roku remote, sometimes you’re using the TV remote, sometimes you’re using the sound bar remote, and then they send you an email, so you have to go to your computer and work from your computer. Also their installation software is a little strange. It really doesn’t work like you think it’ll work. Picture quality is good, and I’m watching property brothers on discovery plus, which I couldn’t get on my new $2000 LG TV.

Forced to get this to get the Fire DVR to work. Only used it for that purpose as all the other features are already built into my TV.The dongle that plugs into the TV was frustrating as it can not be powered by a USB on the TV (like it’s competitors can), it has to be plugged into a 120v outlet. They provide a short USB cable for this purpose which was nowhere near long enough to reach the power strip. Had to go get a long one and then it finally worked properly.

I am still disappointed with the quality of the item. I have received two replacement remotes because of defective workmanship. The first remote worked for a year then the it stopped working. The battery compartment was corroded. Amazon replaced with no problem, so customer service is always great. I recently purchased one on black Friday and the remote stopped working after one use. They are mailing another one.

It seems to work mostly the same as our old fire tv (2014). We don’t care that the remote has no voice control but the stick won’t connect to our echo dots, which is frustrating. I haven’t had a ton of time to problem solve but the first couple things I’ve tried haven’t worked. We are slowly buying more Alexa devices and Alexa controlled devices so it’s a bummer that this Amazon device isn’t connecting easily.

It works for what I wanted, to have fubo tv and other apps on my tv. I dont like it that I have to unplug it every time or I have no audio. (update: customer service was helpful and let me know to update the device. This fixed the issue)

I really like how easy it was to set up and get connected to my streaming services. And I also like the lightweight remote and voice controls (those are really neat). My only complaint is that I couldn't tell that the middle of the circle pad was a button to start with. It needs to have a marking on it so you know it's the select button lol Other than that it's a great product and super easy to use.

Works well and is easy to set up.  I have several standard Fire sticks and this is significantly faster booting up and loading apps.  Streaming is flawless and it doesn't drop the network connection.  I don't use the remote to control the TV volume etc so I don't miss that feature.  I do wish Amazon would stop cluttering up the home screen with so many ads but the fire stick itself is great.

This is my second Fire TV stick. The first one powers all the streaming on our Family Room TV.  It receives search results from our Alexa and does a great job of aggregating results from multiple streaming platforms.I bought this one for a new Dr. J projector I will use in my backyard. I plugged it in and found it was already connected to my WiFi - presumably because it was pre-configured by Amazon based on my Amazon and Alexa account. While that's a tiny bit creepy, it really cut down the setup time. Before I knew it, it was downloading its updates and prepping my services. A few streaming service passwords later we were projecting Hulu, Netflix, Disney and Prime Video.

The description states its a jailbroke firestick which is a complete lie. Movie channels need subscription and only free apps are ones you can get on your roku tv fir free and if you had subscription already with Disney+, hulu, prime video Starz ect. Jailbrike fire stuck give you access to all cable channels and local channels fir free no subscription needed period!!! My brother has one.

My other firestick was outdated and was therefore slow and not responding properly.  Decided to go with the Lite version because I don't need the added buttons to turn TV on and off and volume up/down.  So this one works fine for me.  I have had no issues with it thus far and have been using it for about 2 weeks. I also got it while it was on sale and so I feel it was well worth the price.

I was looking at buying a bigger 4K smart TV to replace a 14 year old plasma TV, but I am very very happy I purchased one of these instead.  I only regret not getting one sooner, but I had been under the false impression FireTV required a Prime membership to make any use of it.  One only needs to have an account with Amazon to enjoy all the available content, except for any Prime Video related content.  This stick also enabled me to replace the laptop computer I had hooked up to that TV.  The wi-fi connector in the stick has no problems getting a signal in the basement.

Added this new Roku to my account with 3 others, set up took less than 10 minutes, no issues, recognized my “range extender” easily, no buffering, great picture. Running off the tv power without an issue.These replace cable TV for us at this location. Roku can stream Prime video and channels I pay for through them (Acorn, Britbox), and some others are over the air. Only bummer is no live streaming of PBS, through PBS Passport you can watch many shows, through Locast one of the local PBS channels, but not the sub-channel. I pay for a few channels, but if you have a cable account anywhere you can sign in with that account and get some of those pay channels that way. Did not want cable TV with hundreds of stations I didn’t want, this solution has been great.

I don’t know what the user below is talking about with having to pay an additional fee for a third Roku but I have three in my house running at the same time and never had a problem with the set up or streaming at the same time and was never charged any fees. Another great product by Roku!

I really appreciate the convenience of the streaming stick, and Roku overall. This is my sixth Roku device and third streaming stick. I originally purchased a Roku after I switched from a traditional cable provider to YouTube TV. My Smart TV didn't have the firmware/hardware to support YouTube TV. Instead of buying a new TV, I bought a Roku express.. and then I bought two more. After changing the look of a number of different rooms, I ended up mounting every TV I owned. I ended up switching from the Express to the Streaming stick due to its ability to be hidden behind a TV and draw power from the TV via a USB cable. I'm glad I did. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking to remove the amount of clutter, cables and connections. The remote supplied with the streaming stick also has the ability to control your TV's functions (on/off and volume). So again, you won't really need your TV's remote with this device. Overall though, from my experience, I would recommend the Roku brand. Especially if your TV is lacking the software or hardware to support the latest streaming technologies. A Roku will turn any TV with an HDMI port into an up-to-date device.

We have been thinking about cutting the cable for years wish I had then. Easy to use once it's set up. Getting another unit for the other tv. Good picture and sound quality. Didn't need the hundreds of channels cable pushes and we're able to use what we what with more flexibility than cable. Cable tv is dead to me!

When I tried to activate the Roku Firestick on my TV, the attempt failed.  When I contacted the vendor via the phone number given in the instructions, the Amazon Vendor attempted to collect $90.00 to activate the Roku fire stick.  The explanation was that I already had one Roku unit and the new Roku policy would require a one time activation fee of $90.00.  I refused and hung up.  Several minutes later the vendor called and offered to activate the device for $45.00.  Knowing this was a scam, I decided to pay the $45.00 because he offered to help me set up the device for PBS Passport.  I realize that I accepted the scam for expediency.  The device itself works great.  The 1 star is for the total experience.  Amazon should be aware of this type of scam.

I have a couple of Roku TVs and one Roku box on another TV. This Roku stick is my favorite. It handles the Xfinity software like a champ, much faster than the Roku TV does. Perfect reception a floor away from the wireless router.Very easy to install and takes up no room behind the TV. This is a winner. You don't need to buy the Roku box. This stick does it all.I do not use Alexa so cannot speak to the voice control feature.I will note that the Roku home page will not list an external antenna as an option with the stick. You only seem to get that option on a Roku TV. So if you use an external antenna, you'll have to use your TV's remote to scroll channels. (The Roku remote controls the listings on the Roku home page.)I don't know if it will list cable on the Roku menu if the TV is connected to a cable box because my TV receives cable via Xfinity's software, not a box. That option shows up on the Roku home page as "Xfinity."If the TV is also connected to a Blu-ray player, that shows up on the Roku home page as whatever HDMI port it's connected to, e.g., "HDMI 2." That's probably the same for other ancillary equipment like game consoles.

I bought this stick because after I extended my home network, I discovered that my older Roku premier stick was not compatible with the extender a.c. network while streaming Hulu. But now that I have it, I am really appreciating it. The stick is RF so the unit in the HDMI slot does not have to be visible to my remote. There is new functionality as the remote now controls the on/off of my TV and JBL soundbar, as well as the volume (things my Roku Premier never did). In addition, there is a new Wi-Fi booster on the stick that picks up the signal from farther way and enhances it. This means my Hulu Live stream has never looked better. Everything looks better, and sounds great too.  Setup was easy, and I now have two Streaming Stick+ running on both of my TVs, living room and bedroom. I really love the simplicity of the Roku remote and I know that my wife does as well. Totally pleased so far.

Over the years, we've purchased pretty much every Roku plug-in device on the market, given handfuls of them away as gifts to family and friends, and kept the newest ones for ourselves.  This one is a breeze to use, it popped into our 4K television and worked like a charm, right off the bat.  At first I was a little concerned on two counts - first, the TV we have has its USB ports recessed, so the Roku Streaming Stick had to accommodate a bit of an angle; it took perhaps an extra 30-40 seconds to finesse it in without doing any damage to the Stick or the TV, but it worked.  The second potential issue was the fact that the USB port for this particular television is in the back, and I was afraid that its location would interfere with the remote's operation.  Nope - a breeze.  As with the other models, this streamer seemingly has unlimited channel capacity, so you can grab as many new channels as you need.  The remote also has the headphone jack to allow you to watch television without bothering others in the room.  In all, this was a great purchase.  I cannot say enough great things about the Roku family of streamers.

So I finally upgraded from my old Roku.  Take into account that I am technically challenged, I was able to set it up in just a few minutes!  I am so happy!  For one, I have an older tv, but the picture is so clear, my tv remote doesn't work so I could use my 4 yr old Roku remote but it doesn't have the volume control on it so I would have to get up and manually change the volume on the tv.  Now it's on my new Roku remote, yay!  I have also noticed that my programs don't buffer like they used to all the time with my older Roku, bonus!

i red a lot of reviews stating roku wanted $60+ to activate the device. I have 6 roku devices and have paid $0 to activate any of them. DO NOT CALL TO ACTIVATE. If you call in, yes you will be asked to pay to activate. Its simple, go to the website it tells you to fallow the on screen display type in the code and create a account when it asks for credit card imformation to be on file scroll to the bottom and click SKIP. Done, roku activated. On a quality note, this stick has great video output compared to the lower 1080p models worth the money if you want 4k

The set up was fairly painless and quick. I haven’t tried the voice recognition but the streaming quality was also fine. All in all it’s an awesome product. I was glad to get it at such a low price compared the the regular fire stick because we never use the tv controls any way, so it was perfect for our needs. I’d absolutely recommend the fire stick LITE version to all who don’t use their remote to control the actual tv.

I liked that when I ordered this, it asked if I wanted it to be connected to our account. When I installed the fire stick to the tv in the kitchen (we have one on the main tv in the living room) I said yes. Once I signed in it was easy to get it set up! It was working in less than 10 mins.  Now I can watch the shows I like on Pluto, Xumo, Youtube and Tubi that I like to watch in the kitchen when I'm cooking!

Bought this as I just wanted a voice control remote but I was pleasantly surprised by how eell it works annd the number of shows/movies it presents me in the geanra I ask for. I have a smart TV that's a couple years old with several hdmi ports luckily as they are all i use now plus a Prime movie subscription so I'm never at a loss for something to watch now and it is so much easier to find what I want with this Fire Stick.

We love the new Stick . Being able to speak for search has made it a winner. We also love Fire so might be prejudice. It is saving me a fortune in cable it is all we use along with broadcast TV. Each of us pay for 1 service so it costs me 20.00 per month for TV.. my kids each pay 10.00 per month. We really do not need all the services but when your not paying 100.00 a month for cable you do not mind 10.00 . All together less than 40.00 a month for premium and TV. Gotta love that

I bought this because it was on sale. I soon realized that it was on sale for a good reason: it does not have a volume control. Is it crucial to have a volume control to use it? Maybe not. But it makes life a lot easier is it does. Now, every time I use it I have to look for the volume control on the remote that comes with the TV. It just makes it a hassle to use this device. I am not recommending it for this reason.

I ABSOLUTELY love the firestick; wasted mad years with cable! It's almost like specially designed television just for you and with NO COMMERCIALS or a significant reduction. I can watch Game of Thrones and Miami Vice and wrap it up with The Borgias all AT MY LEISURE! I love it and wish l had this when the pandemic was at it's peak. I DO NOT like Suri, Alexa or any of these voice activated devices and will not utilize it, hence the 4 stars, but if I had a regular one with no voice intergration, it definitely would have received 5 stars. A lot of free programming channels with classics like One Day At A Time, Silver Spoons or the A-Team. Get this and get rid of cable; bill went from $170 monthly to $70, including what l pay for STARZ and Hulu and got HBO max for free when I left cable and went to AT&T

My old fire remote stopped working suddenly.  So, I took a chance on this new version.  Huge mistake, the interface is terrible, the play button often takes you to the home screen.  Plus the old one goes into a landfill.  I hate making people rich when they're destroying the very planet we need to survive. Sad shame, all my extra $ goes to buy the same product over & over to fill a landfill & make a rich man richer. Let's find a saner way to live!

The quality of the streaming, as well as the availability of same (depending on what we'll chose to subscribe to), are all we could've hoped for, especially at the price point. However, the autoplay feature(s) are little short of infuriating. No matter what I've tried, no matter how often I've followed the instructions provided, autoplay just keeps happening. I want to be the one to start something, not the device!

It'll work fine for a week or two and them it just crashed out. Even after jumping through all the hoops of installing updates, restarting the device, and restoring factory settings, this just isn't working. Amazon replaced the first device and the second one is giving me the exact same trouble.

My family and I are new to the streaming world as the main source of television watching. We have had cable for over 25 years and as time has progressed the service price kept increasing, but the quality decreased. So, in hearing about the wonderful things of the Fire Stick we decided what better time than Now to try it out. We are so happy that we did and was able to kick the cable bill of $200.00 a month. The Fire Stick World with Alexa voice is saving us money in the long run.

I've certainly watched FAR more movies with this installed than I had watched when only on my laptop.  I wasn't able to install, but mjy children came to town and installed it for me.  It almost always recognizes my voice (I don't have Alexa).  I doubt I would be able to use it without the voice activation as it seems to require 3  implements to switch between TV & videos/movies.  But I've really enjoyed having it.

New menu style for the lite version and it sucks, packed with recommended apps and advertisements. Your actual apps are like in a small tiny place that you can barely see, they put the price down but pack it with advertising.

Okay, hear me out on this. I have some Old TV's at home and I don't upgrade unless the TV breaks. If you are like me and have some old tv's at home and want a software upgrade be sure to buy this Firestick! The Firestick allows you to have all your streaming services in one place and ready to use whenever you feel like it. You can even play around with it and sideload some cool apps. Overall, a great experience so far.

I have the only Samsung TV that does not have internet or Bluetooth capabilities.  When I first purchased the TV it had YouTube and Amazon Prime apps and for some unknown reason Samsung removed them.Because I really like the picture my Samsung produces I purchased the Fire Stick and love it.  I get YouTube and Bluetooth, and I can download other apps.  The picture is great.

Just new, so haven't had much time to try everything out.  Still learning the ins and outs of the remote.  Wish it had an ON/OFF switch, throws me every time to turn it off.  Have not figured out what channels I have that are free vs pay.  Thought there would be more free channels/TV shows to be able to watch.  Will keep working on getting to know the system.  Don't use voice or Alexa.

Skip the Lite & spend extra for the TV control version. I've owned 4 Firesticks & this was the only one I ever had major issues with. It's also the only "Lite" version I've purchased, or ever will again. It's obvious they've changed the firmware from the older versions, the menu is terribly laid out and hard to navigate, downloader functions are severely restricted and you must download an app that needs to  be given permissions before you can even change certain settings. I use my other 3 Firesticks to stream with ILML through SOPlayer & the files would not install. I don't use "Alexa" so I can't comment on that functionality. Ultimately, what I thought was a $20 bargain turned into the biggest headache I've had with a streaming device. Definitely NOT RECOMMENDED!!!!!

Great deal for black friday ! this firestick is light but powerful. It loads fast, set up was super easy and I have had no issues so far. I have owned 3-4 firesticks in the past and each one has caused me issues very quickly. But this one is a great updated version and like I said its fast. I can use the voice controls and Alexa, but I don't use Alexa often, don't really care for that feature. Also this firestick does not have TV controls, so that can be annoying at times having to switch remotes to turn up the volume or turn the tv on in general. Not a big deal at all. For the price, I think I got it for 17 bucks and i used a gift card so really this was free for me! I didn't need a new firestick but for the price I said why not. This firestick works excellent and I am extremely pleased with this purchase!

Not sure what they did to this fire stick but this is my 4th one and this one is by far the slowest thing I have... it constantly disconnect to wifi. Never works right with my echo show. Also when will you be allowed to watch spectrum TV on the Fire Stick. Thank God the Fire Stick allow you to mirror so I can watch cable TV. Other then that I do like the Fire Stick.not a fan of the new home screen either

Wh have an older flat screen in the dining room which is not a 'smart TV'.  This allows us to stream all the channels and content from our Samsung 55" in the TV room over our home network.  For the price, it's a real bargain and saved us from having to purchase a new 32" smart TV.  Easy to install, worked right out of the box and I was watching the History channel within 15b minutes.

Is anyone else having issues with the sound? It doesn’t seem to be sending a sound signal all the time. Some days it works, some days it doesn’t. Amazon sent me to an Indian call center to try to troubleshoot with no avail. They also won’t return it because the call center said without knowing the issue, they can’t say it’s broken.

Setting up the fire stick is fairly easy. Also it is easy to associate your different accounts with the fire stick. The only glitch that I have come across is one time the volume did not work and the other time the screen options were not showing up at all on the television. The fixed to these two problems was to unplug the fire stick from the power and then replug it in after 10 seconds to allowThe memory to clear itself. Otherwise I am very happy with the product and would recommend it to anyone wishing to move away from the high cost of cable television.

Recently i purchased a projector in Amazon its not smart and i was kind of sad not able to view my favorite content using my projector.I found a deal for $17 and extra $5 off for some prime credit. So i got the Stick for effectively$12 such a low price. Now i am able to make my projector smart by connecting fire tv stick.After using for few days i realized google just launched google tv app and claimed we can watch all the content at one place. Amazon is doing the same thing for years with fire stick

My daughter bought this for my birthday.  She helped me to set it up and get it working.  I like the content it has.  I'm still learning how to use everything on it.  The only problem I have is signal.  My WiFi in my house can be weak.  I wish Amazon still included the Ethernet port on the device.  But I see they separated it so they could price gouge you to buy the Ethernet adapter if you need a wired connection.

Update: Amazon reached out but I missed the call. My son suggested restarting the firestick which seems to have fixed the problem.  I should have thought about that.  It works OK.  Original: Plugged in, looked like other fire sticks.  Will open your aps like hulu, cbs and netflix but will not load and will not play. Old firestick went kaput after 5 or so yrs, thought this one would do but it will not open anything inside the cbs, hulu or netflix aps, just sits there spinning.

this seems to be a quality product, however, was quite disappointed . . . as my electronic abilities are limited this product offered [aside from how to plug it in] nothing in the way of instructions on usage . . . "refer to on-screen  guide" was of no use to me and have to just struggle along trying to figure out how to take full advantage of the devices offerings . . . still don't get it after a month . . .

Firestick user interface is clumsy and does not have the Spectrum app.  I am a Spectrum customer and prefer to have access to my Spectrum channels.  Plus, the Firestick just would not work.  Got the circle thinker repeatedly and no show would come on.  Lots of buffering.  I bought 4 and returned all 4.  Bought Roku instead.

The fire TV device, has no controls on the device itself - so you're totally dependent on a remote that1. Eats batteries for breakfast2. Stops controlling the fire Tv device for no reason and has to be "re-paired"3. Has no lights to indicate whether the batteries are good or that the device is working and speaking to the fire TV device4. Is not guaranteed to pair with the device even when both are working

I had an earlier model that was a few years old. It had become slow slow and difficult to use. I resisted buying a new stick. I was concerned it would not be compatible with our older TV. I didn't want to get forced into buying a new TV (I have an 8 year old Vizio). I'm so glad I bought it! The new model works great. It's compatible with the TV. It's fast and easy to use. It functions the same as the earlier model.

Because of CoVid we find ourselves watching more TV.  It was fairly easy to hook up the firestik, though we found on our TV one of the HMDI connections wasn't working.  Luckily it worked in another plugin.  It is now working great and we don't need the Echo Dot or Alexa to use it.  It looks like more and more channels are going to subscription services though.  Oh, and having Amazon Prime is a good thing.

Love it so far simple, easy to set up, wish you came a little travel accessory bag so we travel we can throw the cables, the remote and the device into a small pouch or bag.  Someone gave us an older 40 inch LED screen that was not smart capable… But with the fire stick we can Watch all our streaming shows in a second room so there’s no argument between the kids over who can watch the streaming show and when... and not be relegated to an iPad...

We bought both the Fire TV Stick and this Roku Streaming Stick Plus for two different tvs.  The Roku has a nice clean home page, but we couldn't get any further than that because we could not get any audio from our sound bar when using the Roku. And apparently the remote will not work to control the volume with a soundbar (which we didn't know before we ordered it), even IF we could have had audio.  It worked with our tv audio, but it does not have the sound quality we liked.  So then we tried it on our 2nd tv which uses just the tv audio.  It played audio, but through the remote setup, we discovered that the remote was not compatible to control Roku audio.  This may be a great option for some if you have the right audio setup, but it didn't work for us.  We'll be getting another firestick instead.

I bought this to watch tv in the bedroom and not have to use a cable box anymore (so tired of the fee monthly for that). I have a Firestick and an older version chromecast on other televisions.  The chromecast can be annoying since it has to be controlled with an app on my phone (or tablet) so it's not a direct comparison to this. But I like the Roku better than the Firestick- I don't have to go through multiple layers of Amazon suggestions to get to the "stations" I want. I use the Bravo and HGTVgo apps and watch live tv without a hitch. One annoying this is that i do need to periodically sync with my cable provider before watching the live streams.

Bought this to replace the previous stick which went belly up, and since I have bought at least 10 iterations of the streaming device from stick to 4khd, this recent device came with a new issue.  Apparently, Roku and Spectrum are having a disagreement over fees, which means that the recent devices are shipping without the TimeWarner/Spectrum app. For a Spectrum customer, this means you have to lease/purchase additional cable boxes to watch their programs, and you may not be able to register your Roku apps to the cable provider services that you pay for.  My only other gripe is the device stops working if an update is pending, and/or wipes settings after an update.Take care of the older devices that still have the Spectrum app, but be forewarned that if they are not being updated, they will eventually fail.

I ordered a Roku Stick+ for my TV and I kept my Satellite TV (Direct TV) for 1 more month, thinking I might not like the Roku and in case I didn't have the channels that I am used to watching. I have found that I never switch back over to the Satellite to watch TV. I plan on dropping Direct TV, after this month's bill is up. I also ordered a Roku Stick for my kids.If you are looking for a way to cut the Satellite/Cable bill, this is a great option. Saving me hundreds of dollars. A one time payment of $50 for the Stick+ and no monthly cable bill.  We have a subscription to Netflix ($9.99/mo) and Hulu ($4.99/mo special and bundled with Spotify and Showtime). So for $14.98/mo I can get all the shows and movies that I want. Great Deal. Was paying $170/mo for Direct TV and that didn't even include any Movie channels.

Just received my Roku streaming Stick plus. It would not activate with a code I was sent to a toll-free number to have it activated. Was then told by the service tech that I had to pay $99 for a lifetime subscription nowhere in the purchasing of this item does it say anything of the subscription. Tell them I had no intention of paying $100 for an item I have owned before and never had to pay a subscription fee. Needless to say we are severely disappointed and Roku customer service told this to this promptly return the device so that's exactly what we're doing.

The Roku service itself is great. Excellent interface, apps, etc. The problem is that you can’t actually experience it because the remote that comes with the newer Roku Streaming Stick+ has a defect that causes it to drain brand new batteries in as little as a few days. It’s a well-known issue (look at the hundreds of posts in their support forums) and will require you to invest in rechargeable batteries that you’ll have to put in every time you use the cursed thing.Save yourself the money, hassle, and frustration and buy another roku device - or just go with another vendor.

This is our 3rd Roku.  I'm back on Amazon to buy a fourth, another one like this.  It's so much easier to search with the voice function.  Our 1st Roku won't update anymore, so I think our experience will be seamless with them all working the same way on each TV.  On New Year's Eve we returned our cable box and are saving over $125 a month. So far we seems to have a better selection of shows WE want to watch with the Roku Channels and our Fire Stick.  We haven't had any problems with the remote recognizing the stick, which is in an HDMI port in the back of the TV.  The only time we lost our signal was the power plug falling out of the Roku.  That was from the repeated moving of the TV to hook up a new antennae. My fault!  Very happy the transition has been so easy.

So I have an apple TV and amazon fire stick. But this roku streaming + stick is better than both. The navigation interface is a lot more intuitive than the amazon fire stick but maybe not as elegant as the apple tv.PROS- Easy to set up- Tons of free streaming content- Remote controls TV- Strong Connection- Bluetooth headset connection so no need for wired headsets. Use the bluetooth headsets you have.- Can cast your ios photos, videos, and music to your tv.Cons- The remote keeps randomly losing connection. I have to remove the batteries and put it back in to get it to reconnect.- The voice search doesn't work in different apps. So you can't be in Youtube or hulu and use voice search to search for content. It has to be used in the main Roku menu.- There is no mute button. This shouldn't be an extra feature you need to pay for.- The bluetooth headset connection can be spotty and it doesn't connect directly to the roku stick. Instead it's connecting to the app on your smartphone. So I don't know if that's the issue.- Can't mirror your ios device on the screen like an apple tv.Despite these cons, I still plan to purchase others. But I need a resolution to the remote control issue before I do that. It's not a deal breaker but it is annoying.

These are my first Rokus, bought two at once, and overall, I’m pleased with the outcome, but there is a problem with the remotes eating up the battery charge.Installation: 2 large TVs up close against the wall.  Power outlets right behind, no wires hanging down.  For both TVs, just not enough room back there to connect the stick directly to the power outlets, therefore had to connect the power to the TV’s USB port.  As noted in other reviews, not optimal but I really don’t notice it.  The Roku Stick goes to an HDMI port, and for the older of my TVs, this port is at the back middle of the TV, not off more to the side.  When plugging the Roku stick into this HDMI port, it is sticking out perpendicular to the wall, and sticking out too far for the TV to be put back close to the wall.  (The Roku stick is a few inches long.)  Problem solved with UGREEN HDMI Extension Cable 4K HDMI Extender Male to Female Compatible for . . . Roku TV Stick, 1.5 ft., at Amazon of course.  So, the Roku Stick hangs from an extension behind the TV, not a problem.Setup and activation: Entered a couple of items, went so fast and smooth I can’t remember much about it anymore.  Wireless reception excellent but I wasn’t expecting problems here.  Watching mostly the local PBS station’s “Passport”, Netflix, Amazon Prime.Remote: Reason for only 3 out of 5 stars. It’s easy to use and controls the TV power and volume without a second remote needed.  However, as also mentioned in a previous review, there’s an issue with the remotes eating up the charge of the batteries.  After only about 5 weeks, the first remote needed a battery change.  The second remote needed a battery change after 7 weeks, and these were Duracell batteries.

These are replacing my mom's DirecTV service. Super easy to install, only the power cord to the TV shows, no other nasty wires. No dust magnet genie or satellite boxes. Setting up the channels you want to add is amazingly easy & can set up control to curb inadvertent movie purchases.The only negative I can find is Roku uses a LOT of bandwidth. I have xfinity plan with 1Tb of data and that is used up by the 20th of the month - mom is elderly & watches a LOT of TV. Had to upgrade internet to unlimited data, but even so it is still less expensive than the DirecTV plan.So weigh your options, do research. All I can say is I'm very pleased (and I pay for it).

I had purchased this same item about a year ago and had issues with the reliability of the remote.  But, after reading they had upgraded the firmware AND rethinking my whole setup around my TV, I decided to give it another go.  I have to say that I think part of the whole reliability issue was my setup.  It simply did not dawn on me how many other WiFi devices were so close to the TV, many of which I never use.  I had 1) an old Wi player still on, 2) a WiFi enabled DVD player still on, 3) a WiFi enabled amp, 4) a WiFi enabled cable set top box, and 5) the stick.  That's enough to drive any device insane.  So, after deciding to either disable or remove what wasn't being used, the stick worked flawlessly.  I honestly have not had one little flicker of trouble.  Sorry to Roku for all the flak I gave them in the past.  Probably mostly my fault.  So, 5 stars this time !

Turned it on the other day and went to an app to stream a show, 5 min. into the show , WARNING DEVICE OVERHEATING . It was hot to the touch after 5 min. That is ridiculous. So here was my setup. I had a three way splitter with a BluRay DVD player in one slot, a Firestick in the next, and Roku SS+ plugged directly into the splitter. After the overheat , I connected the roku to a different HDMI slot with a 3 foot cable and moved it a few feet away from the other devices. I watched for 2 hours and had no issues, although the stick was still quite warm, that might be normal. I give it 2 stars because it is a wealth of entertainment choices, if only it did not overheat! Thousands of people complain about this and the answer is always plug Roku into an HDMI cable and not into the HDMI port on your TV. Hope this helps.

I plugged it into a year old 58" 4K Samsung T.V., and it plugged into a recess in the back cover, parallel to the screen, versus sticking out in back, and I initially had problems with the Remote.  It just didn't see it, until I went up to the T.V. and held the remote around the right side edge of the screen, then it was able to make inputs.  I found a block in the Manual that indicated if it didn't fit well, they would send an "Extension Cable" for the stick, which I immediately ordered.  Until it arrived about 5 days later, the Remote worked about 50% of the time, and the others I had to go and hold it around the edge.  Since the extension cable arrived, and I installed it between the Stick and the T.V., it works fine.  So if you get one, I suggest you order the "Free Extension Cable" too.  The streaming is fine.

Lately I use two types of devices AppleTV and Roku Roku I use when I travel or for gas and the Apple TV is pretty much for me for my main television so this is one of the Roku is that I use in this when I take with me when I go places are use it for hotels and Airbnb’s and when I go to anywhere that I need to have my own stuff with me it’s absolutely wonderful that you plug it in and you connect to Wi-Fi and you’ve got all your stuff already on there ready to go so I absolutely love it it’s it there’s nothing bad I can say about it it’s great

For nearly 10 years, we've used the full Roku unit, never a stick version. However, because portability is something I was looking for, getting the stick seemed to be preferred choice to be able to use it on different TV's or carry it for travel. Without a discount or sale, I find Roku pricey compared to its competitors.In any case, setting up the Roku stick was about as tedious as a full console unit. I find it tedious because there is no keyboard to enter characters upon set up.  But once you get past that, the Roku stick is pretty awesome. You can use an app to control the stick also.Unlike the Amazon stick which has a chintzy weak-feel remote, the Roku stick has a great feel and solid remote. Compared to Amazon stick, I definitely prefer the Roku stick.

To be fair, I ordered this Roku for the guest bedroom. But then I thought, gee, it'd be kinda nice to only have to use one remote. So I removed the one in the living room and installed this new streaming stick. Alas, got through the installation, only to find that the "Roku enhanced remote is designed to control volume and power for your TV. It cannot directly control other devices connected to your TV, such as an audio/video receiver (AVR) or soundbar." Well, now you tell me! Apparently you may be able to have Roku send volume to your TV that can send it to the soundbar, but my older TV/Bose won't support that.So the good news is that my guests will get the streaming stick with one remote for the TV in the guest bedroom. And I'll continue to use two remotes in my living room. Or maybe I'll look up some new enhanced remote that will do all three.

Really nice looking and small piece of technology. Transformed my TV into a Smart TV like it was nothing. BUT before it was able to work properly, I had to investigate why the Roku stick wasn't working after downloading it's first update, it rebooted then downloaded the update, again and again. After about an hour looking for solutions I fixed it by connecting it to a mobile wifi network (my laptop's). After that I connected it to our regular home wifi and now it works like a charm. It didn't replace the tv remote tho, even thought the brand was in their list and I bought this TV about two months ago so it is a new model

I have Comcast Xfinity and the cost just got to be prohibitive so something had to be done to lower my monthly bill. I'd love to cut the cord but...I ordered this for my bedroom and so far it works great and saves me 10 bucks a month. Setup was easy, signal is good with no issue's thus far. The Xfinity app works well but the Roku remote has no number keys on it so changing channels is a bit more difficult. I have started storing all my usual channels in Favorites so that makes it easier to get to the channel I want. One issue is the "stick" has a little light on it so at night I see the glow from behind my TV, just letting you know in case you need complete darkness at night while sleeping. Everything else like Netflix and Amazon work great.I'll update if any issue's occur but so far so good. It will pay for itself in 5 months.Quick update on the light, it does go off after the Roku being off for a extended period so the light issue is not a problem as long as you don't want to crash right after shutting the tv off which I unfortunately usually do...

I bought this specifically for my mom to watch streaming kdrama on the Viki app with japanese subtitles. Setup is very simple and i was able to download the Viki app.  Its a very good streaming media player (quick, good video quality and simple navugation) however unlike Tivo 4k stream, you cant select a language or language subtitles within each app.  You have to go to Roku’s system settings to select the language.  The problem is that they only support English, German, Spanish, French and Portuguese.  No asian languages. They support more subtitles in addition to the above languages they support Russian, Turkish, Polish, Ukrainian, Romanian, Dutch, Croatian, Hungarian, Greek, Czech and Sweedish.  Again no asian languages.  For the price, this is a good streamer if the support your language.

ALERT! If you intend to power your stick with the included USB extension power connector (recommended), do yourself a favor and buy a USB EXTENSION cable (I recommend 10ft), NOT POWER cable, along with your Streaming Stick+. I use it on a 55in oled and Roku’s included extension isn’t sufficient. If you read the fine print on Amazon’s list of power cables, they are NOT COMPATIBLE with the Streaming Stick+. That said, this little remote is still so satisfyingly sturdy, dependable and functional it brings a smile. For streaming I much prefer the Stick+ over my TV’s bells & whistles remote. Connecting the Roku was a breeze and it integrates as if it is native to the TV. I don’t use voice commands so I can’t comment on alexa integration but streaming quality and app availability (the reason I bought it) is superb.

Have been a long time Roku user, however, when they improved the speed of the devices they no longer work with slower Wifi. Tried the Stick, Express and Premier, non of them would give clear picture on sports channels. (worked well on all other channels) After talking with Roku Support, they walked me thru the troubleshooting process and determined I needed to increase my router speed, however, that isn't available in my area. I will add that I still have and use a Roku stick that is several years old. It's much slower but does not have a problem with the slower internet speeds. Both Amazon and Roku were very helpful trying to resolve the issue, however, it just doesn't work with slower internet speeds. Recently purchased the Amazon TV Fire stick and it works perfectly adapting to the slower speed.

I bought a $50 Streaming Stick+, and was excited to connect and begin using it. The Stick turned out to be too long to connect to our TV without an HDMI extender (a little device to connect the Stick in these situations). Roku doesn't include an extender in the package, but promises to send a free one to customers who need it (it probably costs  Roku about $1 plus shipping). I went to Roku's website to request one, and got this message: "Your request for an HDMI Extender has been placed on backorder and is expected to ship 2114 -12-31" - i.e., in 94 years. I wrote customer support and received this message back: "Unfortunately, the HDMI extender is out of stock for now. We do not have enough resources to look into the information to ship the HDMI extender. ... Your request has been marked as resolved. ... Have a great day!" Roku could have included the HDMI adapter in its package since many customers obviously need. It could have charged a dollar or two more for that. Instead, it's made me, and I'm sure many other customers, spend hours trying to get the device, only to be told to wait 94 years -- and so permanently alienated customers, and provoked this review. And BTW - once you solve the connection problem, try "activating" the Stick - that was a 2- hour process with Roku that repeatedly failed.

We've been a Roku user since 2006 and our previous Roku 3 was giving us an issue where we would be watching a show on Amazon Prime and the show would disappear and it would then go to the Roku menu and we would see our saved channels disappear one by one. We thought it may be due to the old Roku 3 so we bought this Roku 4K Stick and the same thing started to happen. We thought our Roku account got hacked so we changed our password and still the same problem. So we contacted Roku and they suggested to delete our account and create a new account. That solved our problem! We decided to keep this 4K Stick since we have a 4K tv, was inexpensive and is more portable for travelling. It has been working great ever since. Love the voice command and the cleaner look of the 4K Stick vs the Roku 3 device you need to plug in with power. Also the Roku 3 gets rather warm when plugged in all the time.

I have a Poloroid 4k tv in the bedroom and it only had Netflix on it so I bought the Roku streaming stick plus for Hulu, Disney, Vudu, Amazon and a myriad of other apps that I have already paid subscriptions for however when I set up the Roku, it didn't have any of those apps. only Netfix and a bunch of junk channels. I tied factory reset, un plugging and re entering everything but still the same. WTF!

I've had Roku boxes from the beginning, but this is the first stick I bought. I was leery on getting the stick because I thought performance would suffer, but nothing is far from the truth. I purchased the Roku stick + because of great youtube reviews. I have the Roku Premium plus box in my family room and truthfully this stick performs just as good or better. Very quick response and love the fact that the remote now can be programmed to turn on and off my TV plus can also control the TV volume. I don't have a cable box in the bedroom so with different apps on Roku, I can watch LIVE channels 4,5,7, History channel, Travel channel and many more as long as I have my Optimum cable on my other sets. With the new Roku remote, now all I need is that remote and I can control my TV and Roku just like a cable box. Amazon was having a deal on the Roku during the holidays and if you use a Prime credit card you were also getting an additional 20% rewards bonus.  VERY VERY happy with the Roku stick +. Make sure you get the  '+"  and not the older regular Roku stick

There is a 32-year-old TV in the basement of my house that works great, so I didn't want to send it to recycling. I didn't want to get rid of it just because it's old, but I wanted to be able to stream programming when I'm crafting or exercising because over-the-air channels weren't really what I wanted to watch. I bought an HDMI-to-RCA adapter and this Roku Streaming Stick+ and voilà! My ancient TV is a smart TV. The Roku was super-easy to connect and set up--much easier than I imagined it would be, given the circumstances. I was immediately able to connect and log into my streaming services such as Hulu, Netflix, Prime, Peacock, etc. Today I figured out how to connect the Roku to Sirius XM and Alexa. So far, I'm thrilled with this purchase.

First all I love the Roku streamers.  I have an Roku Ultra downstairs in our dedicated Home Theater.  It works flawlessly.  The remote works with the Roku being out of site.  This Roku Stick is used on our upstairs TV.  And it the remote is always losing connection with the stick.  I’ll get up and use it close to the stick and then it activates.  But when it’s idle for awhile, again it loses the interface.  It’s a disappointment and I’m going to replace it with another Roku Ultra.  One question for Roku-When are you going to be able to stream Dolby Atmos through other streaming services like Netflix?

UPDATE 3/17/20:Product began overheating intermittently while in use, after a couple of weeks. Seems to work good otherwise.Strong WiFi signal to unit, & not in an enclosed area (cabinet) either. Ordered the "free extender", but it's back ordered until 4/20. Can't get a live agent on the phone to address the issue. Wondering if this is a model, or individual device issue.Considering the initial product cost, plus the surprise registration fee (total $100.00 +/-), not a happy camper - at this point.--------------------------------------Nice product, but in order to activate, I got stuck by ROKU - for a $57.00 "one time" registration fee. Well OK, after expressing my EXTREME displeasure to the friendly ROKU customer service rep, I received a $10.00 (WOW!) discount.My whole point was, that at the time of purchase, I saw no mention of a $57.00 "one time" registration fee. Either here on Amazon, or on the ROKU web site. If it was there, I somehow missed it. Should have been posted right up front - bold letters, & in plain English.Would I have purchased anyway? Maybe. That, or opted for the Amazon version. Really dislike "GOTCHA'" surprises...

The interface is fast, switching between apps is quick and easy. The remote could use a jump forward button like the jump back button. It jumps back 15-20 seconds which is handy. There are 4 preprogrammed shortcut buttons to instantly open those 4 apps. It would have been more handy to be able to reprogram them for app shortcuts I actually use. I don't use sling or Hulu so those buttons are useless. I'm also not a fan of volume buttons on the side of the remote that are easy to accidently press just holding the remote. The streaming quality so far has been surprisingly top notch. From HD to 4k, the picture is consistently beautiful. Even the high definition audio is passed through instead of being downconverted to regular Dolby digital, when available. I think physical blu ray and 4k discs still offer better uncompressed audio and video resolution, but this streaming stick+ performs better than I expected. And since I ditched expensive satellite, I'm glad to have more money in my pocket every month.

This was a really super easy system to set up on an older TV with HDMI and powered through a USB port on the TV. It only took 20 minutes, most of that time was spent filling out the Roku online form to set up the account. You will need a credit card or debit card as they want a payment in place, it's something you can't skip. Otherwise everything worked great, super easy to use, did exactly what we needed it to do.We did not set up for alexa, so left that blank on the review.

This is an inexpensive answer to stream all of your apps. We have 2 different smart TVs - Samsung and Vizio - and they each have different apps available. The Vizeo didn’t allow us to download newer apps (Discovery+ and HBOmax) but with the fire stick you can set up all of your apps and easily stream them. My husband likes the voice feature of the remote. I cannot review the Alexa integration as we don’t use Alexa but our friends have the same fire stick and Alexa seems to run their entire home and they are very happy with it. We highly recommend it. Easy solution to stream everything you like!

I like this product although I wish I would’ve picked the one with the volume control because I still find myself changing remotes to moved the volume. My fire stick would not fit into the back of my TV so I had to use the little extension cord that comes with it other than that it seems to work for just fine. This unit will work just fine if you’re not an Amazon prime reader however I recommend using this with prime if you already have it or want to get it

I don't have Alexa so don't use the feature. My device came with some other apps downloaded and I also added a  few more. There are a few i still need to add but have to find a way to do it fom sources other than amazon as they don;t have the app i want.  The device i have is great, is HD and looks excellent.  I do have a occasional problem with sound loss.  To correct this you need to unplug the device from power source for maybe 10 seconds then plug it back in and the sound comes back. It's  an issue in the PC board you can't fix. I had this hapen with TV's in a hotel I worked at quite often.  In general I am satisfied with my puchase.

I actually downgraded from a old regular Fire Stick to a new Fire Stick Lite because it has Alexa remote. However, this seem like an upgrade to me because my old Fire Stick was from the first generation. Great quality picture, easy to navigate, no problems whatsoever (so far!). My old Fire Stick wasn't able to view new apps like Disney+ but this has no problem. Glad I upgraded!

Love the new fire TV stick. Works way better than my 1st generation as expected.  My only complaint is the round back on the remote. The remote wiggles around catching light and is a distraction.  Why it doesn't have a flat back like all remotes is beyond my brain.  I submitted a complaint direct to amazon on this and I hope you will too.  Remotes should have a flat on the back to keep them stable.

The price is great and I like the remote. The user interface itself is too cluttered and clunky. I would prefer to have my last used apps at the top then scroll down when I was interested in seeing what was available in Prime. It seems to be a trend with this kind of interface and is very similar to Microsoft’s XBox interface only not quite as bad. The Firestick is a great product, but the UI leaves lots to be desired.

My TV was having issues with Netflix, like it would just stop playing after like 45 min, so we just got the firestick lite for a special price. It works great, it's plug and play and whatever you wanna play, just ask Alexa and she'll find it for you, even if you don't have a service where something is streamed you can suscribe from the firestick UI. Great way to give an older smart TV model a few more years of use

Update: went front two stars to one due to bad customer service. They called to “see how they can help”, then asked me to emailed them since I wasn’t able to pickup the call. I emailed them and never heard back. Disappointing!I had bought the older fire stick a couple of years back and was very happy with it. But I can’t say the same about this one. I’ve had this one for a couple of weeks now and it freezes quite often. I had several times where sound would somehow stop and I would have to unplug or reset the fire stick for it to work again. Not a fan of this one.

This is a big upgrade from my 2018 model. Apps load faster and no lag. I have fast internet (75mbs) and my older version at times seemed slow to load apps and shows/movies. This solved that issue. This is the model w/o volume control as I prefer my TV remote for that.Also I noticed an improvement in picture quality. This definitely delivers and I'm glad I upgraded my old Fire stick.

I signed up for PBS Passport and needed a device to have access to the APP.  The Fire-stick lite was highly recommended. And so far I am totally pleased. Any problems I have encountered are from my limited knowledge of “streaming.”  I have not yet ventured into voice recognition/Alexa.  Hence I have not rated either feature and have given only a 4 star rating overall. I do not want to rate something that I have not used. I am sure that when I do venture into these features, my overall rating will be a 5 star

We bought this because my DVD player no longer could stream Amazon and we have lots of movies on Prime Instant Video.  I compared this to the Firestick.  I initially was going with the Firestick.  What changed my mind was the fact that Roku was updated for Disney+ and Apple TV. Which I also have subscriptions for. They have the buttons for these right on the remote as well as Amazon and Netflix.  I did not see that with the Firestick.  The Roku was very easy to install and even came with a smaller cable where you can connect the Roku to using the USB port so that you don’t have to plug it into the wall.  Other devices have that sold separately and can run an additional 10$.  The remote paired easily with my TV remote.  So you can use the Roku remote to turn your TV and manage the volume/mute.  The only thing you will need your TV for is to change the Input. We also got the Roku because we are thinking about cutting our cable and this remote is compatible with many TV streaming devices.

I mostly use Plex on my Roku devices, with some Amazon Video / Netflix / Hulu in the mix. This Streaming Stick is, like all Roku products I've tried, easy to set up, fast, responsive and works brilliantly with the above-mentioned services.I just wish the #&*@! branded shortcut buttons on the remote could be reprogrammed or at least disabled! Few things are more frustrating than accidentally pressing one of them and being abruptly kicked out of whatever I'm watching and dumped into a different service.

Looking for a cord cutting service that's like my cable service.  Just want a "live tv guide" with movies integrated for free.  With the choice of my paying for newer movies . not older movies.People always say you can watch movies / tv.  But they don't say that movies/ tv shows are limited , Basic and old. You have to pay for 99c to 3.00 plus to watch a movie or episode.It's actually just a thumb drive with downloaded files consisting of applications similar to ( hulu-netflix- crackle) offering "basic movies and TV" shows older than what's on your actual cable to paying for intermediate to more recent content. I'm disappointed.Ex. Men in black (1) can watch on cableFree.  With Roku-firestick. Etc. They request 99 to 2.99 to just watch.  Rent at a higher price.I think "kodi" is the best device. Not always stable but stable enough. You can see everything movies just leaving theater, all seasons TV shows and don't have to pay.  You just have to be a little tech savvy to do the same things in Roku and fire sticks downloading the  apps like hulu, crackle, to get their movies /TV shows, News networks to see their content.But with Kodi all contents is free.  The sites databases "mdb" the content come from can choose. But you just go to another.With these sticks- they are usually always working because you pay to watch that 1 episode TV show or movie and they will keep it stable for you.With Kodi the developers work to build this app to keep mdb open /stable for you to watch content free. I'm still looking at it Roku. But I may be going back to Kodi.
Switched to Roku recently and have enjoyed it so far. Less lag, simple interface, unique options and the dedicated channel buttons are sweet.

I bought a Roku for my mother a couple of months ago. She was looking to cut her cable but didn't know any alternatives to traditional cable. I did some research, and I saw that for people like my mother, who were used to conventional television and had no clue how to use streaming devices, Roku has the best user interface. The application buttons on the remote mean 9 times out of 10, my mother doesn't even have to navigate the menu! She just clicks a button, and she is in the app!Now fast forward to a couple of weeks ago. I decided I wanted a Roku for my bedroom television. I picked this up and wouldn't you know that my TV is a 4k television and I had no clue! I bought the thing like three years ago, and I used it primarily to play my switch on there. So I am now using my TV to its full potential. The remote has those same helpful buttons and the addition of the voice remote AND Alexa integration. So for those days when I am feeling extra lazy and don't care about looking for the remote, I can yell at my TV.All in all, for me, it has been a pleasant experience. I would recommend Roku to anyone who is looking to stream in one place on their television.

I had ordered a basic Roku streaming stick a couple of years ago.  That one was enjoyable but we experienced quite a few slowdowns during our viewing of some movies and tv shows.  Recently after reading reviews about the latest 4K Roku streaming stick, I decided to purchase one for our main viewing tv and connect the original to one of our bedroom tv's.  Very pleasantly surprised by the viewing quality and the speed of our streaming movies with the 4K Roku.  Extremely satisfied with its outstanding performance and have watched quite a few movie series on Netflix and Prime streaming.  Roku streaming stick has replaced many of the tv shows which we have normally viewed in the past and has become our go-to viewing media.  Cannot say enough good things about Roku 4K except that it is Awesome and has more than exceeded our expectations.  And I certainly have enjoyed some of the old Westerns that I watched as a child on your Roku Channel Old Time Westerns.  Who needs cable tv when you can hook up with Roku.

My mom is more tech savvy than people half her age (80!)  What she can't figure out for herself she knows to come to me for help.  Years ago I bought her a Roku 3 so she could easily watch Netflix in her Living Room.  She asked about getting one for on for her bedroom TV.  I got the Stick+ because there was no ethernet connection in there and I'm not big on depending on Wifi to work consistently.  I hooked it up and it wouldn't plug into the back of her TV because of the HDMI jack placement.  I checked and Roku will send you a short HDMI extension cable for FREE!  Got the cable 3 days later and it all setup great with a very strong Wifi signal.  She recently cut the cable and went all internet and uses the Rokus for her Streaming TV service (she likes Philo the best for price and channels she wants).  I used the enclosed power supply as her TV's USB port doesn't put out enough juice.  So all is good.

Recently decided to cut the cable cord and go with Roku + YouTube TV. So far things are fantastic for my use. The Roku is easy to install and set up. Platform agnostic with a very nice and snappy menu user interface.There is room for improvement with the remote control + YouTube TV guide controls, I would like to be able to do more voice commands like "Watch CNN on YouTube TV" etc. You can't do that yet. Also a little confusing if you hit the wrong button on the remote it might take you out of the YouTube TV app and back to the main menu. Once you figure out what does what, it's pretty straightforward. Hopefully they work on making it even better and intuitive. These services are still pretty new, so things are still being developed and getting dialed in. Otherwise it works very well and I'm saving on my monthly bill while still getting all the channels and services I need.I wish the remote control was rubberized, it's hard plastic and kind of small and slippery. Also wish the buttons were backlit so I can see what I'm doing in the dark at night.

It was difficult to plug the stick into my Samsung TV, but Roku sent (for free) an HDMI extension cord, so that problem was solved.  (Instructions for ordering the extension were in the box.)  I bought a second Roku remote from a physical Walmart store and now my wife and I each have a controller.  We watch YouTubeTV, Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Hulu with the Roku.  After a month or more of confirming that we could live without cable TV, we cancelled it.  Now we're only paying the cable company for internet service.YouTubeTV is our replacement for regular cable, and while the cable company overall offered more features (like the ability to get a synopsis for what is currently playing), YouTubeTV's unlimited cloud recording capability at least partially makes up for whatever other shortcomings it has.I like the ability to unplug the Roku stick and take it with me.  As long as there's Wi-Fi internet, I have access to all of my shows.  I certainly couldn't do that with cable.

Back story of why I purchased it. The Sony TV in the living room is a smart tv that is getting old. The smart functions take a long time to load and the tv is not very responsive when trying to scan on Netflix or Hulu. I have an Amazon Firestick which works very well but is very cluttered with Amazon services and adds. My girlfriend wanted something easier to find the apps she wanted and something easier for her 7 year old to use. So I did some research and ended up buying this. Setup is easy and the UI is clean. After some tweaking to the UI I have the most used apps at the beginning and the least used apps at the end. I also was able to delete apps that I didn’t want on the Roku, which I think is great. The remote has 4 buttons on it and they are Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ and Sling TV, 3 of the 4 services we use so that was a very nice plus. The volume buttons work wonderfully. We can turn the TV on and off using the remote power button as well. The picture is clear and crisp and it’s being powered off the TV’s USB port. All in we are very happy with this device and I recommend it.

Why did I not buy this sooner ! I’m loving this fire stick. Usually I use my Apple TV to watch things or mirror my apps to my tv, but it was always a pain to lose what I was doing while they were paired. This has so many more apps and is so easy to set up and use. I ended up buying two more for my other TVs. I love that I can just say what I’m looking for and bam, it’s right there.

My Grandma got me this for my room and I did not like the fact that it did not have the volume and the powe off button. When I was setting it up it didn’t ask me for the Tv information, There fore it doesn’t work other than that I am super happy with the fact that it recognized my voice when I wanted to play something the other thing is that sometimes the thing will not work at all and I checked the internet connection and everything was ok and this is my second one. The other one was the one with the volume and the off and on button. And if anything else happens I will upgrade my review. And just as a side thing we do have another one in the living room and it’s been working fine and we love it so it may be just this one that isn’t working.

I have one in all of the TV's at home. It provides fast access to the best apps if you don't have a smart tv and even if you do have a smart TV. If the internet is weak my smart tv seems to have problems loading Netflix, but my amazon stick always seems to gain access to a better connection so if my TV isn't working I can just use my amazon stick and watch my movies without a problem. Highly recommend !

So this was me buying a replacement because the same unit that I bought 3 years ago simply crapped out. I think that I paid 35 dollars for the original. I kinda expected the unit to last more than 3 years. Also I have to keep freshening the battery contact on the new unit so yeah, not a high rating as I know that the equipment from other companies last longer with no maintenance.

Device works as it should.  I got the fire lite for a old "dumb" lg tv.  All the apps you need.  So why the 3 stars?  You get tons of emails.  How to setup.  Welcome to the fire stick family, wifi issues, etc.  The real annoyance is getting an email for downloading a free app.  You get an email like you placed an actual Amazon order.  EVERYTIME!!!
