Completely unnecessary.

Does what it's supposed to do. You just have to know what you're getting. I personally don't mind the lack of TV controls. But the low resolution takes some getting use to though. Can't complain though since (a) I was fully aware of what I was ordering and (b) it's just for a spare TV.  Over-all, it was a great buy for me because I caught this bad boy for $17. Go me! LOL!

I just replaced my 2016 version of my Fire Stick with the new Lite version and I love it!  The Lite is so much faster than the 2016 version!  I am so happy I bought this!  Connection was an absolute breeze and once updates were done, I was off and running!  If you have an older Fire Stick, you should upgrade to this version!  I bought it for $21 and it is a great value!

Not sure if we got a dud but when it works the voice recognition is fast and the streaming quality is clear and crisp. There are occasions(1-2 times a week) when the Amazon video app runs in slow-mo so we have to reset(unplug for 30 seconds) the fire stick. Strangely, the Disney app will reset the fire stick too. We've learned to live with these issues but it's annoying.

The fire stick was easy to install. I just followed the simple directions on the tv screen. My tv picture is so much clearer. When I download a movie on my old stick it jumped , stalled and pixellated at the beginning of each show. Now my new stick automatically by my voice down loads a bright crisp movie or show for me to watch. No more waiting for circles to finish spinning.

Plugged it in as a replacement for an earlier model without reading the manual.  Works fine but has a different home screen.  More options available but more steps to reach same program than the earlier model.  The extra button tunes to TV.  It is very close to the pause button and accidentally hitting it takes a few extra button presses to recover.  This happens often.

These work well when they work.  This one is a backup since I have purchased others and they have lasted an average of 9-10 months.  Hopefully this will last longer.  Don't have much choice but to buy another when they go bad since you need them to stream and use prime to its full capacity.  I refuse to buy the more expensive models for fear they will not last either.

I've had my fire stick for 3 years now. I thought I would try this to see if I can get better and more constant reception so I bought one. I love it. Gets a much better signal to the TV and has a bonus feature for me a channel guide which lists the channels that I have subscriptions to and it's content. Really like that part.Just ordered another one for the other TV.

I already have a Roku, which I have never had a problem with. I ordered this because I wanted to be able to use HBO Max (which isn’t available on Roku) so I thought I’d try this. It wouldn’t turn on. I tried different outlets, used the WiFi extender it comes with, removed the WiFi extender, changed the batteries in the remote, etc. It came to the point that thought I just had to unplug it and plug it in every time. But even that isn’t 100% effective. As I am sitting here writing the review it comes up, flickers, then goes back to “No Signal”.Short story is that when it works, it works. But it’s not worth the stress that comes with trying to get it to work.

Streaming is simple with the Fire TV Stick Lite. The TV remote is required to change inputs to the HDMI with the device, so TV controls on the Fire TV Stick Lite remote are not needed. A slight glitch in the first few days: the Stick was inoperable when we switched to its HDMI input. We had to unplug the power supply from the device and replug it. This rebooted the device right away. The glitch appears to have settled down with no intervention required for more than a week (we have had it 2 weeks). The initial glitch is why I gave rating of 4 rather than 5.

I wanted something simple and low cost for my parents, so they could watch church services on the TV instead of the small laptop screen.  This was easy to setup and works very well.  I have been able to use it to show them several things they have enjoyed.  I have not tried using Alexa since it works just fine using the remote, even if it takes a bit longer.  When they are on sale again, I'll buy one for myself.

My only complaint about the Fire TV Stick is it constantly warns you of insufficient power capabilities while using the USB cord in one of the TV's USB ports for power. Therefore, it forces you to use with the power adapter, which needs to be plugged in an outlet. Not sure if this is a design flaw with the Fire Stick or TV USB ports are worthless for power sources.

I love the fire sticks in general. I purchased the Lite version for my smart TV that has gone stupid and have had no major issues. My only complaint is, lately both my Lite and regular fire stick are continually signing me out of Disney plus. Not sure if its due to Disney plus itself or the sticks themselves. I love the different streaming options I have with using the Fire Sticks and can usually find something to watch.

I bought this just to stream my AppleTV movies and TV shows. This is a great inexpensive alternative to the AppleTV streaming box. It won't let you directly purchase or rent content from AppleTV however, so you have to do that through your AppleTV app on your computer or tablet/phone first. Not a big deal for me considering the price. Easy set up. It even automatically synced with my wireless sound bar. Picture quality is very good (it's 1080p but my TV upscales to 4K). The only negative is the sound quality is a little off, making it hard to understand dialogue sometimes.

I love that amazon came out with an affordable fire stick! I love my fire stick, it is easy to use and allows me to stream my favorite shows. The only down side to this product is that i have to unplug and take apart the fire stick part that plugs into the tv. If i do not do this when i want to access the program then it doesn’t even pop up on my tv. hopefully this problem goes away on its own, if not that would be annoying.

Since I'm using lots of Amazon services, I said it's time to move from Roku to Fire TV Stick, so that I'm getting a more "integrated" experience. This cannot be further from the truth. The Fire TV Stick becomes unresponsive many times, and the only solution to recover it is to reboot it. Also, when streaming movies, many times the video will freeze while audio continues.I never = zero times, experienced that with Roku. I'm switching back to Roku.

I love this thing! I have used my PS4 for years as our home's "media center device". We use it for Hulu, Netflix, youtube, Amazon and many others. I bought the Fire Stick lite for my "dumb" TV upstairs. This fire stick is more intuitive and swaps streaming apps quicker than the PS4! I love the voice search option and you can easily see if you have the required app to view your search result. I have not integrated it with Alexa in my household yet. But I'm sure that'll be an adventure. If you're looking for a "smart upgrade" to your TV, you can't go wrong with this item.

Highly recommend the firestick.  It was my first time purchasing. Next time I would get the upgrade with the volume and on/off settings so I don't have to keep track of two remotes. Manu free channels come with the one time purchase. All streaming services are available that you can sign in to your existing account or add more for a monthly fee ( if you choose).

This is my 5th firestick I have bought!!! I love them!!! Easy to set up, easy to use!  Just plug in and follow the directions on screen! Each remote can work on different tv's with a fire stick! I just love them!!! We have three for the tv's here at home and two for the tv's on my houseboat! Makes life so much easier without paying an arm and leg for cable!!!!

It is not entirely intuitive for non-techy folks but does work very well. It could be our internet connection, but the interface to the main menu in Prime is laggy. Alexa search is very accurate and helpful. This was actually our second one that we purchased for another tv in the house. I don't mind that there is no volume control since we are used to two remotes.

I live in an area where the only internet is via satellite. So I got this for 'casting' to an older smart TV. That feature works great. What I didn't realize was how much better the fire stick is at pulling in the wifi signal. My TV is over 7 years old and doesn't see the 5.0 freq. It also has very few apps to choose from. This saved me from buying a newer TV.
Mines doesn’t work. Worked for a good 2hrs than the screen went pink.

Very pleased with the improved streaming performance of this model over my older/original fire stick.  My rural internet service is not the  fastest but the increased memory, in this model,  has improved buffering making most streaming content seamless.  Other features pretty much same as my old model.  Remote control is OK for scrolling and selecting content.

I had an older fire stick and when I was watching tv the sound would go on and off and I was getting a lot of pauses during shows and constantly had to reconnect to wifi. I thought I would try a new fire stick and see if that was the problem and sure enough it fixed all of the issues. My old stick was about five years old so I guess it was time for a new one!

I mainly bought the Lite Stick to connect to a projector in my bedroom. As the projector model is not listed in the TV brand list when I had a 4k stick connected, not having volume controls on the remote was no big deal. Setup was fast and easy, along with sideloading of apps as well. Speed on this new stick is great, and I look forward to adding external memory to pimp it out even more in the future.

I have been quite pleased with this "Lite" version of the Fire Stick.  I can monitor all my blink cameras on my TV screen with a simple voice command "Show _(camera name)__".  The Fire Stick itself is a great little device for TV's that may not be connected to cable or satellite but within WiFi range.  There is nice variety of things for your viewing pleasure.

After a month the stick began changing channels all by itself including swapping apps.  Something that they never heard before.  CS thought it was the controller, the stick updates and tried 3 times until they just swapped out the stick itself.  Seems to be working fine. I have no problem working with tech staff. My previous fire stick lasted more than 10 years.

Easy to set up.  Very user friendly, even my 5 yr old is able to use it.  The voice recognition works for all of my family members. Mainly purchased for the Disney + app since my TV doesn’t support it.  Works great with the fire stick though.  I have used this for a little over a month and my only complaint is that periodically there will be no sound at all coming from the TV when in firestick.  I will have to unplug it from the back of the TV and then replug it back in to get the sound to work again.

Working good now - not a good look when your flagship software does not work properly on our own platform!  ------- Its been two weeks now and I'm still waiting for an update from Amazon customer support on a fix for the Audible app running on this Lite unit - works fine on the 4K version.  Basically, the app runs BUT your audio book library is not accessible.

I don't like how it is set up now. In my opinion, it is much more difficult to use than previous fire sticks. So I put it on a tv that is in a bedroom only used when we have guests, and moved the older model to the tv I use frequently. I rarely use the voice recognition, and have never used the Alexa integration. But at least it works and the price was good.

We already had a Firetv stick in the living room and was moving it to the exercise room then back to the living room.  It was time to get a second one to eliminate the rigamarole each time.  So glad we did. We are now considering two more, one for the Man Cave and one for the RV.As long as you have an Internet connection it is great!Excellent value!

Bought this as an add-on for our guest bedroom. It's very much like a 2nd-gen Fire Stick, only with a newer interface and possibly a bit stronger processor. So, really, the difference between this unit and the non-4K 3rd-gen unit is the lack of TV controls, on-off and volume. So, you use the TV remote for those functions. AFAIK that's the only difference.

We never could figure out the voice part, but that's fine as I got it for my kid anyway. I wish I'd have gotten one sooner after my last broke, as these are wonderful for tvs that don't connect to cable or are not smart tvs (older tvs) my kid can pretty much enjoy Disney plus, Netflix, hulu, whatever she wants (within parental limits) so it's perfect for me!

Our old stick was about 7 years old. One day it wouldn't turn on anymore. Because of new models with 4K capability and universal like remotes, the closest thing to our old FireTV Stick was this model, but it runs the newer version of the software and the remote works even better than the old one. But the price was just right. Very happy with the purchase.

It’s got a different layout, and it no longer has easy access to second party apps, amazon wants you to purchase apps from the stick, and to boot the icons for apps it tiny. No , I am glad I have the older ones, this one made my head spin. And to boot, it did not carry over all my apps, I had to re down load everything. What a pain . Do I recommend, no.

love the fire stick! the lite version doesn’t connect with tv as a remote but that’s fine with me! i have my alexa speaker connected to the tv so alexa does lower the volume when i ask her too! i love that it’s like apple tv! i can airplay my tv and it’s fast, buttons from remote work very well. all in all i love amazon and this is just another awesome product!

So I ordered this due to no place to mount a roku box and it works perfectly however due to the fact my TV is wall mounted the cord that comes out of the USB roku unit itself from the TV creates weight so as you can see from photograph if your electric outlet isn’t high enough it’s going to get pulled down on. The wire has already pulled out once so I will have to improvise and plug all cords into thick electric cord and mount it up behind tv to prevent it from pulling out due to the weighted force of the cord. Other than that it’s perfect.

Works in my basement far from our WiFi box.  There is a lot of electrical wire, furnace ducts, flooring the signal needs to get through.  My previous one went bad after a few years, now it’s working much better.  Our internet provider may have something to do with the slow load speed.  The TV it’s connected to is also getting old so that doesn’t help.  Overall though it works well.

1. Like the wireless extender2. The  volume controls3. Voice commands4. Nice to have the one time, single sign on to multiple apps for cable provider setup5. Noticed apps like NBC and CNNgo don’t buffer/freeze nearly as much as on other streaming brands.6. Cool to see the The new Disney apple command button on remote as well as Hulu7. Also, the ROKU has way more apps that aren’t found on Fire or Apple like surprisingly the Paramount Network. Was happy to know that so I can watch episodes of the popular Yellowstone series for FREE.8. Like the commercials timer countdown so you know exactly how many minutes remain before your show returns9. Finallly received the update HBOMAX that replaced HBOgo.

I probably just jinxed myself for putting that out there but this is almost too good a deal to believe, Comcast has a (beta) Roku app which allows you to watch everything you would through your Xfinity box with this Roku stick and there is no additional monthly fee.  I didn't think it was worth the money to pay for an extra Xfinity box for the bedroom but there were plenty of occasions where we wished we could go up to the bedroom to finish watching a movie or TV program but couldn't.  Now everything we can do in the living room on the main TV we can also do in the bedroom, watch recorded programs, pause live TV, watch on demand, etc. Can't recommend this enough, just worried Comcast will figure out this is too good of a deal and screw it up.

Installed easily.  Works well with PBS, Sling and AirTV2.  Muting the sound was almost a deal breaker, but it seems Roku finally conceded that a mute button is a necessity.  If you buy, be sure you're gettting a remote with a mute button.  There are probably still a bunch, like mine, without one.  Otherwise, you'll have to pay $20 for a replacement remote.  For me, not having mute, was like going back to the 60's.2 issues that might be important: 1. support is off-shore and, from my experience, of the quality people make jokes about.  Support people seem to have almost no experience with the product and their only priority is getting you to give up.  You'll have to depend on the user group which is good.  2. The user experience is clumsy, not intuitive, awkward and poorly documented but if you work at it you'll usually figure it out.In the end, it is a good replacement for cable TV when used with some of the other products ("channels") it supports.

Make sure you go to the roku  page to activate, there are scammers trying to get you to pay to set it up.I made a few errors before I got to the  correct page, but then It was pretty straight forward, and NO COST.I plan to use in different rooms in the house, and take on the road when traveling. I had no issue with the plugs not being long enough, they provided all that was needed. Our cable company doesn’t have Hulu rights so this was one way to watch our. Hulu subscription.Happy with purchase.

I have several Roku streaming sticks and have been happy with them. My WiFi signal was weak in some locations in my house so I decided to purchase a WiFi mesh extender. The installation of the mesh extender was simple and I had the benefit of single SSID. All my phones and laptops connected to the mesh network without issue, and would switch to the which ever access point had the strongest signal. The problem is that my Roku devices will not connect to the WiFi mesh network. The Roku can see the network, but it is unable to connect after I enter the network password. If I disable the Wifi extender, it can still connect to my router. I contacted Roku technical support and they suggested resetting the WiFi settings, which did not work, or that I contact the router manufacture. I reached out to Netgear and they spent a long time on the phone with me, but the only solution they could come up with was to switch the extender out of mesh network mode with single SSID. With the extender functioning as a separate access point, my Roku devices can connect, but I have lost the benefit of a WiFi mesh extender. Roku tech support is a terrible robo email system with automated responses. I could not get a hold of a person and they refused to even look into this being an issue with Roku. While researching this problem, I found that there are many other people online who have reported the same issue. I usually do not pay much attention to bad reviews, but if you have or are considering purchasing a WiFi mesh extender, then you should consider looking for a different streaming device unless Roku decides to upgrade their devices.

Tough to select stars for this - I do like the Roku price and the user interface, picture quality and general usability are all 5-star but the overheating and power warnings are a 1 star regular issue. As I have both I might return and try another.This Plus stick is connected by cables only so there is no relevant heat from the TV or receiver. This is in a ~70 degree-F room so ambient temp should not be a factor either. The only way to prevent overheating is to lay it flat against a heat sink. Also, it is already connected with the included AC adapter and extension cable but regularly indicates there is not enough power.

I finally decided to take the plunge and get a streaming stick. So I did my research and chose to go with Roku. And I’m sure glad I did! Set up so easy, and I haven’t had any issues with functionality at all. I was uncertain whether to get the 4K stick or not, especially since my big screen television is not a 4K television. However, despite having a HDMI television, the Roku stick has worked fine. I recommend going with the 4K stick anyway, because the decision has already been made by the industry; 4K, whether you feel it’s overhyped/overrated or not will be the next wave.I love the interface of Roku. I couldn’t imagine an easier interface to navigate around and select what apps I want to watch. Another thing that swayed me toward Roku over the other streaming devices was that Roku doesn’t have a dog in the race so to speak. They will add any app that they feel is worthy to their system. Compare that to the other streaming sticks, who will heavily push their own apps while omitting certain apps, and Roku was the no brainer. You really get a whole lot of options with Roku. I’m very happy with my purchase!

I have several Roku & Fire sticks and all work very good.  But I like the Roku little bit more.  This one "Roku Streaming Stick+ | HD/4K/HDR Streaming Device with Long-range Wireless and Voice Remote" started having problems with connectivity after a week and by the 2nd week I had to restart it many times in order to get connected.  Eventually, in the third week there was no connection at all.  Called Amazon and they were nice enough to send a second one the next day.  After testing the second one, I noticed that the stick and remote is working fine.  The only culprit here was the advanced wireless receiver.  If you have a connection problem, the most likely reason is the little cord that gets directly attached to the Roku stick.

I've had an amazing fire stick, which I've loved for years now. I needed a streaming device and since I had several fire sticks, I (reluctantly) gave Roku a try. My son needs a streaming device and asked for one of these. I love it. It was easy to set up, easy to download all the apps, works beautifully with my Amazon accounts, and the Roku channel just about covers everything I watch! I will save so much money ditching satellite ask together now! Versus the first stick... If say they do the exact same things. Fire stick allows the Roku channel to be downloaded and Roku allows the Amazon video app, so they're basically equal. Both have the ability to ask it to find what you want, and both were equally good at it! I'm glad two great companies carry such great products. That being said, Roku is just a tiny bit easier to add apps, only because it goes through one account (roku) instead of having to order through each seperated company. Highly recommended!

I cannot count on this devise to work.I cannot count on being able to listen to the programs or movies - Prime.Prime is also suggesting not Prime content...but, that which I would have to pay for.???WHERE IS THE VOLUME?  It will sometimes come through, with previews, and then....nothing.Again, where is the volume?  And Shame on you for Prime content, not necessarily free or me.Lastly, this device hangs down and gravity - I think - Un plugs it.  Thus, nothing works at all.km.

This upgrade to the original fire tv stick is much improved.  It is very easy to install and its use has been much improved by using Alexa.  Just ask Alexa for a specific movie, genre, or actor/actress and presto, the search appears on the screen immediately. If you wait until the fire tv stick is available in a package deal on either HSN or QVC,you'll save yourself some $$.

I'm an older guy who had cable tv and was paying a fortune. I switched to this and have unlimited amount of programs and can locate new stuff using voice remote. This package was on sale when I got it and I consider one of the best bangs for my buck ever. Added Discovery+ and Disney+ for $18 a month extra but still saving over $100 a month for way more programming. Bought rabbit ears for $12 and get free local programs. Tons of free program apps on Firestick too. I can't brag on this any more.

This product is junk. Literally you get what you pay for , It is keep freezing after second day i have it. All Movies and all shows old and what i can find on internet and what is free it's not even here. Mostly you have to pay for what you watch on top of that why would I pay for old movies or old shows what been 1 year or 2 years ago??? For 18 bucks this is just waist of time and money. Do not buy you will be disappointed.

I bought it so I could have access to the hbo max app and roku didnt have it at the time. Now it does. . . . This thing doesnt let you sign into your tv provider on half the apps it offers. You go through the trouble of typing it all out only for it to ask again. And again. . . And again.  . . There is no easy way to close apps (not even the alexa will do it) and it freezes up all the time so you have to uninstall the apps and reinstall and enter login info all over again. Cool idea. Bad execution.I enjoy having the screensaver but there is no option to get it to continuously play. It always goes to sleep.

When HBO expanded to include HBO Max, as I subscribe to HBO, I was eligible to receive both. I have a ROKU model that unfortunately was unable to link to the HBO Max app so I picked up this firestick. Not only did it make receiving HBO Max possible but the other apps that I had on my ROKU work better on the Amazon product. Low price and great performance, easy to install and use.
The description states it can instal HBO max but it is no where to be found???

I'm so glad I bought this. We finally cut the cord on cable TV and we don't miss it. There is far more interesting free content to watch than we will ever get around to watching. The video and sound quality are great. It is easy to use once you play with it for a while. We loaded the Disney+ app and several free streaming services and it all works well. We will save $1500 per year by cancelling our cable.

Love my Fire TV Stick Lite with Alexa Voice Remote Lite (no TV controls) | HD streaming device | 2020 . So awesome to be able to watch a lot of different channels, more then you imagine. Highly recommend this fire stick!

Roku  has not evolved into a customer friendly tool to enhance your TV experience because it is too complicated in its application.  The directions are clear and simple, except they don't work,  Following these directions  you go on line to the ROKU site only to discover many, many separate entities advertising how they will help you bring ROKU on line, for a price.  I could not find the real ROKU . com in all this maize.  I therefore gave up on google on my PC and went to another search engine Apple, success, but at a price.  Simply put, I would do it their way, via computer interaction.  You know the routine, check the correct box, etc..  Never are you allowed to talk to someone on the telephone, text yes, talk no. I could have progressed through many telephone conversations in the time I spent texting with ROKU.  Meanwhile ROKU advertises that it does not charge for installation.  Unfortunately, Amazon Prime was and yet remains the most difficult application through ROKU,  The directions for PRIM take you to Amazon, period.  No, Prime through ROKU directions, just Amazon and where do you want to go from here.  I finally did locate the page on directions for PRIME listing  every instrument of access except ROKU, as in Fire Stick, Play Station,  Apple, etc..  ROKU INSTALLATION of today is not easy as it was before.  It is very, very, difficult.

OK...I've got three LG TVs. None have an app for ESPN+. One (my OLED) is just old enough it won't run CBS All Access. I've used my Apple TV with the third. Why not go Apple TV all the way around? The remote sucks (and yes, I'm an Apple guy). If the Apple remote was as good as the Roku remote I'd run with it. I bought a Logitech Harmony remote. WAY to complicated for my wife. So, I decided to try the Roku after researching features and the remote. Took less than a minute to explain to my wife how to use it. Setup was brilliantly easy (as easy as my Apple TV). This thing was so simple to setup and use that I ordered two more for the other tvs. The Apple TV is going to be my home hub and no longer do TV service. All because of a remote.

The remote sucks to high heaven!!  You can put all the fresh new batteries in all day, but the remote may not work.  For some inexplicable reason, the remote will just stop working at random times.  SOO ANNOYING.  The first time it happened to me, was less than a week after I got the ROKU brand new.  I think the device is good, but if this is what I have to deal with, with the remote, I'll never purchase ROKU again stick.  Maybe I'll give the Firestick.

I was using a 4k Roku Ulta with my Onkyo Amp as Pass Thru.  It flicker a lot and I am not sure is it the cable I had or what causes the problem. (it does'n't flicker with my other TV that I connected straight to it)  So I purchase this 4k Stick when it was on sale and it solved the problem.  At first I was afraid the wireless won't be fast enough to handle 4k quality Pic content, but I wouldn't see the difference compare to my ultra connected with wired connection.Update 07/28/2020The Roku Streaming Sticks + started to randomly restarts itself like 10 times a day.  I know that is not normal with Roku.  I contacted Roku and they are willing to do a replacement with me. I don't like they will have me pay the shipping and ship it off to them before I can get a replacement.  So I had a week without having a Roku in my living room to watch shows with.  SO I changed it from 5 stars to 4 stars

I've had 3 Roku streaming devices for approximately 12 months and have become disappointed with all. I have 50 mbps internet download speed, ROKU connection check indicates excellent Wifi  and I continue to have several problems that I haven't experienced with Fire TV. 1) Frequent buffering that causes screen to go blank and 2) System locks up at times when 1st turn on and during channel search 3) The recommendation and procedure to clear the Cache does not work for me (maybe doing something wrong but did not work while I was being helped online). I have to go to Home, System, Restart... yet this doesn't always correct the buffering. Extremely frustrated. Primarily occurs with HULU but also occurs with NETFLIX at times.

Not sure why we didn’t do this before! I installed them in all of our TVs and in minutes I was watching hundreds of channels and movies for free.  We  immediately cancelled our cable subscription and are adding more and more channels, most for a minimal monthly fee.The Best feature is the remote, it cannot be more simple to operate! And I love the voice recognition feature - just say the name of a show, movie or actor and it finds all channels where you can find said movie, etc.

I love the Roku UI. It truly surpasses the Fire Stick, so I was looking to replace my older generation Roku for our living room. This connected very easily to my existing Roku account and downloaded all of my previous apps. So far the interface is working well and the streaming quality is wonderful. The seller was awesome, they shipped the item super quickly and I received within 4 days of ordering.

We first tried the Chromecast by Google and it was very annoying.  It doesn't have a remote, so you have to use your phone.  The interface was clunky and it had problems connecting. So we returned the Chromecast and got this Roku and it is simply FANTASTIC. Here are the bonuses:1) The apps load much faster than the TV's own built-in apps (for Netflix, for example)2) It has a remote!  The remote has a microphone which allows you to search for shows across ALL AVAILABLE streaming apps.  This feature is incredibly helpful.3) The remote acts as a power button and volume button. It somehow knows how to control the volume controls on your TV.4) You can take it anywhere, such as on vacation, and it works just like at home as long as you have access to WiFi.

I would like to start this review off by noting the ups and downs of my experiences owning this item. To start, what is included with this item? You get the streaming stick +, a plug, a USB extender to make it easier for the plug to connect to the TV, and the remote. Roku will ask you to set up an account. This is no issue if you do not plan on buying anything extra.The first stick I got had to be returned due to the remote going out and connecting/disconnecting to the TV. The next one I got did not have this issue. I tested this stick out using different apps on the device including YouTube, Spotify, Netflix, and Prime Video. My main purpose for getting this device was for Prime Video as I wanted to be able to watch shows included with my Prime membership without having to watch on my PC. Prime Video lacks in quality when streaming. For example, I watch the show Grimm although, for some strange reason when the video is supposed to move to the next episode, I often get an error message stating that Prime Video is having difficulties. I am then either forced out of the app, or have to exit the app and go back in and hope that the app allows me to click on and play the next episode. Another issue with Prime video, is that there seems to be this "noise" like effect on the TV screen when watching episodes of Grimm which is very notable in dark scenes during the episodes. I have no issues with noise happening through YouTube, Spotify, or Netflix so I believe that this a Prime specific issue.Speaking of these other apps, they have had their issues in the past. Spotify has been highly stable with basically little to no problems. YouTube, however, has this weird affect when starting or going back to a point within a video, the audio speeds up super fast for 2 to 3 seconds. It is nothing terrible, but noticeable. What was further noticed by me was when I rented a movie, Batman Hush, on YouTube through the stick, and was not able to watch the movie with a friend through the device. Fortunately, I had a smart TV, and we were able to watch the movie though it. Though it is unfortunate that I had to switch to the smart TV in order view what I had purchased.Netflix also had its fair share of problems when streaming through the stick. When first starting up the Roku stick, the device gives you the option of auto detecting the TV. This option ultimately did not work well for me.  My TV is a Westing House 50-inch 4K ultra-HD TV-HDR. I had to change the setting on the stick to 4K 60Hz. The reason being was that Netflix would have this "stuttering" effect when trying to watch any movie or show in a higher quality than what I described. Ultimately this would result in needing to unplug the device so it could reset itself.The verdict:Personally, this stream stick + has been an advantage to have. I can listen to music on my TV through Spotify, Netflix no longer has the issues as described, and the voice controls work very well. Although, I would encourage people to have a smart TV if you want truly reliable streaming in apps such as Netflix and YouTube.

it plugs in to an HDMI jack on the TV. It comes with a cord that will connect to a USB port on the TV to provide power, meaning no wall wart or extra cable running from the TV to the wall. Easy setup.

This is a simple plug and play device.  With good WIFI, you can stream all kinds of free and pay programing.As I do not use Alexa in my home, it integration is something I cannot comment on.The installation instructions were easy and the software installation was fast.Very happy to extend the life of an older TV for use in a guestroom.

This is the 5th Firestick the other higher end models never a issue I have this is the 2nd one of the base model do yourself a favor spend the extra money.  I have to pull this model in and out to get the audio to reset and work.  I have 2 Sony TVs XBR 1 Bravia and a Panasonic and a Vizio ugh Hot Tub TV the base model has issues almost on all of them.

Everything was great as expected with a Fire TV except the fact I was reminded more times then a care to upgrade from my first generation fire TV which had a USB plug for my Bluetooth keyboard. The least Amazon can do is include a measly $1-$2 dollar cord to add a USB port. I had to spend extra money to buy an additional adapter to add a USB plug since the fire tvs don't have the USB anymore. Honestly not happy about it. Amazon charges $20-30 for a replacement remote and other 3rd party vendors sell firetv remotes with keyboards on back for the same price. Maybe Amazon can offer a fire TV remote with keyboard on back.

This is the 3rd power tv stick I have bought.  The first 2 worked fine.  The 3rd one does not.It will not power on unless I unplug and replug the power from the power stick.  I have to do this each time I want to use it.  The voice command system gives a blue light bar but no beep and won't respond to commands.I have read numerous reviews of poor quality on this item and cannot understand why the manufacturers don't improve it.

I don't care for or use voice control. For me it is a useless feature. It is harder and slower trying to find things. Instead of clicking on choices that are presented you end up having to drag a blue circle around and click  on what you want to watch once you locate it. To scroll up and down it is necessary to place the blue circle to the top of the page if going up or to the bottom if going down. When doing a search it is not possible to jump from the letter display to titles listed to the left , a process that could speed up locating shows. I mainly watch u-tube it is harder to get on to u-tube now its gone from about2 steps to 3-4 steps now. I still have my older model firestick CE0984 and would gladly trade the current firestick light version for  the older version. Unless I am not using this device correctly I don't think that this is an improvement

Very pleased with this!  Up and running in minutes.  Plenty of 'free' viewing options with my account login for my cable company in addition to Prime options and included free apps.  Purchased for the TV in a spare room...I didn't want the expense of renting yet another cable box or the hassle of running the cables.  This is the perfect solution.  Minor streaming delays if my WiFi is being used by too many devices, but this happens rarely

We have a 10 year old high definition TV. With the wireless cable box we have excellent  sound and picture. With the fire TV stick we have excellent picture terrible sound. There must be something wrong with the fire TV stick .I will be sending it back to Amazon for replacement. I Like the way the fire TV stick works except for the sound quality. We have high speed internet service and the wireless cable tunerbox has no trouble streaming a excellent picture and sound on the same TV. So it not our internet. The fire TV stick was very easy to set up the controls on it worked perfectly I would of given it 5 stars if it did have a sound problem.

I love being able to use the apps.  This is very easy to use, I’m not very tech savvy.  Even I was able to hook it up.  I had an older fire stick but it quit working plus I had to constantly buy new batteries.  This one is great and the batteries ate lasting so much longer.  I highly recommend this.  I haven’t actually tries using the voice control.

This is just a very basic model with no bells or whistles and that is what I wanted.  We have the ultimate premium deluxe version in the family room and love that too.  This model doesn’t have the voice recognition feature but I knew that.  It still provides all the same channels and experience and works with the Google home.  Recommend for the thrifty who don’t need to be pampered.

This works great but for like $10 more you can get it to where it will turn on and off your TV and turn up and down your volume so you only have to use 1 remote. So unless your just really broke or prefer to use 2 remotes I recommend buying the fire stick with tv controls but it works fine Alexis works fine I love having a fire stick it has saved me so much money every month by not having to pay a cable or satellite bill. I get all kinds of tv for free plus you can buy your favorits too.

The product itself functions well. Easy setup, decent menu system, and you can use the phone app as a remote when the batteries die and you're too lazy to get out of bed. However, one of the biggest reasons I went with Roku years ago was that they were an agnostic device that wasn't pushing their own streaming service. That also meant they were largely separate from the disputes that were affecting the Fire TV and restricting app choice. Well here we are almost 3 months after the HBO Max launch and still no agreement and no app. If that's not fixed in the next month or so then I'll just put my Rokus on Craigslist and buy Fire TVs because at least I can sideload apps on that device.

The only terrible thing about this amazing device is that it uses all of our WiFi and we have to unplug and put in airplane mode all of our iPads and cells just to get it working. Service Electric is our provider and if you know about them then you will understand. But it’s wonderful I can’t believe we have gone this long with out the fire stick.

I tried to get HULU on my 4 year old Vizio Smart TV. Although Netflix and Amazon Prime worked great (or so I thought) HULU kept starting and stopping while it buffered. A major disappointment since it had content not available on the other two.A little research suggested that the receiver on the Vizio was the problem. I ordered the Roku on the assumption that if it didn't work I could return it.The setup was amazingly simple! Plug it in, attach the cord, follow the on-screen prompts. 10 minutes and I was up and running. When the content was up on the screen I realized what I was missing. I had a 4k monitor but was only streaming 780 because of the receiver. The Roku bypassed this to deliver the full 4k + better sound!! As the title said, it was like getting a brand new TV for only $60! Plus the Roku remote controls the TV and sound bar better than their own remotes. One control to do it all.One minor complaint that is more a note to Roku than a problem. Why no back lit remote? TVs operate in the dark and I would have happily paid an extra dollar for the feature.

I have an older Smart Tv and I was having issues with the apps crashing while I was using them. Or they would lose connection to the WIFI. A friend recommended getting a Roku. I did some researched and I felt that this one was what I needed for my TV and steaming needs.When I went shopping, I saw that Amazon had the best deal and because I have Prime it was here the next day!Installation was pretty simple and straight forward. The only thing that might cause problems for others is the cord from the stick to an outlet. Mine stretched justs fine but someone else might find it too short depending on how far your TV is from an outlet.Once it's up and running you do have to take the time to sign in to all your accounts but after that, it's done.Since I have bought this I have not had any of my streaming apps crash. It's easy to use and the voice option is amazing! I love how it will look for titles that are on all streaming services and not just one.I would definitely recommend this to anyone that is on the market for a streaming stick.

We were using a Sony Blue Ray DVD player for streaming and the experience was far from perfect. As the product aged its performance grew worse and worse. At the end we couldn't get through a 30 minute episode of a TV show without suffering the dreaded spinning wheel and the message "Insufficient bandwidth to play your program."Then we bought a Roku.It was like walking out of a dark cave and into the light. Superior picture quality, easy set up, simple but functional remote and an overall superior viewing experience was suddenly our reality.Don't hesitate if you are considering this purchase. You won't be sorry and you'll never look back.

I was expecting a bit more out of this more expensive product. I don't have 4K but I wanted the voice remote  so I bought this one.  It works well just too things, I get 1001 errors spastically that cuts off the video I'm watching which is a disconnect from the network thing.  Not sure what the issue is (I understand they interrupt the streaming if you have been idle for quite awhile so you don't blow up data from mobil services) and I did do some research that says go into Roku settings, screensaver and unclick "timeouts" to off.  This is a feature that once again if idle on one station for how ever long you set the minutes too, it goes to sleep with a screensaver you select.  My biggest disappointment is the voice remote because it only works with the Roku home page does not operate on the app menu for live TV....Update: You have to be right on top of the TV for the remote to work so that means I have to get off the couch and go to the TV to increase the volume change channels etc. The purple rubber select/directional part is flimsy and I have to press it several times to get it to react.  You know this is a real disappointment given Roku has been out there and a main player in Streaming to wind up with such a cheaply made product and given what this cost.

Love this thing! The biggest reason I bought this is because it has a Beta app to stream from my cable company. I love that I can connect with my cable company's DVR and watch shows in the bedroom and not have to pay for another box or run wires over there. There is nothing better than sticking it to my cable provider,  they suck eggs. I use Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video and others. The High Definition is clear and fast. Personally I think this is far better than any of the Amazon or Google products. Hook it up and enjoy. Plus save yourself a few sheckles buy not having to pay more to the Cable Gods!

I just installed it and watched a few minutes of Netflix so this is an initial review. If things change I'll edit this review and add additional comments in the future.I bought this device because Netflix will no longer stream on my Wii game box after Jan 30 2019 so I thought I'd upgrade.Installation took me about 40 minutes using the roku remote on my TV and also signing up for  a roku account online with a code provided on the TV. I only wanted Netflix and nothing else at present so online I had to uncheck all the other services roku automatically wanted to sign me up for.Roku also requires a payment method in case you buy services in the future so I was glad to see I could select Paypal instead of a credit card as a payment method. Whenever there is a Paypal charge Paypal sends me an email the same day so this seemed more secure to me than providing a credit card number.I had to enter my router and router password on the TV while initializing the roku, and also login to my Netflix account.Hopefully this info will be saved and so I can get to Netflix by just pressing the Netflix button on the roku remote in the future.Once on Netflix it took a while to realize that tapping the left arrow twice was required to get to the Netflix controls on the left side of the screen, like search, my list, etc.Netflix on my Wii was upscaled 720 P  so I had a fairly large black box border around the movies. On the roku I selected 1080P in the settings and got a great full screen image without black box borders on the first movie I tested. It's likely 1080P would have been selected automatically had I not gone to the roku settings menu.I plugged the roku device into my Vizio TV hdmi 4 slot and used the extension cord in order to plug the roku into a power supply near the TV. It was just long enough, but if it hadn't been I would have used an electric extension cord.

I got this so I could get local stations and have found I can't.  Disappointed in that.However, it is easy to install and after a few false starts, easy to use.  I have caught up on all the programs I missed when my satellite company cut off some of my stations and I'm finding lots of movies I want to watch and older programs that I had forgotten about, I'm watching again.Definitely worth the money, even if it doesn't get my local stations.

Had no problem with any of the functions with this Roku Stick or hand remote communications even though the Roku stick was located in back of my TV. Setup was a breeze! Just plugged it into one of my LG 55" Smart TVs HDMI ports on back of TV. Then installed the USB power pig tail to the TVs USB port located close by. Than went online with my computer to activated my new Roku stick. Supplied installation/activation instructions were easy to follow.  Found my new Roku stick was responding much faster with greater picture quality over my old 8+ year old Roku box/cable player. Really love the voice command and TV volume control functions on the new remote.

My brother and I were splitting a cable package for about $150.00 a month and he told me they were raising  the price again! I said get rid of it and he did, then I baught this Roku unit not expecting much but it was cheap and had to better than nothing.My old cable was pretty lousy, I could hardly ever find a good movie to watch so I was astounded to see the quantity and quality of the movies available on Roku. I only watch the free channels and there seems to be thousands of great movies from 1937 to the present, more than I could ever watch.I am amazed that expensive cable companies are still in business, if everybody knew how good Roku is they would be out of business in a month.  To think we were spending $1700.00 a year for garbage and for a one time cost of $ 44.00 got something 100 times better!It is a no brainer to buy a Roku unit.

Price  for only 17.99$ this is a Best media streaming if you know what a do you have a all in OnePictures and Audio sound incredible amazingYou just need a Good internet connection  new update  display free movies series news sports a lots lots just for 17.99$  Thank you Amazon you save me from crazy price from  Android or Apple Box

I spent two hours trying to get this things hooked up to replace a Roku device I had for years.  It would take me through all of the stages and would say that the connection was complete.  But as soon as I pushed the "home" button it went back to the original set-up routine.  "Customer service" didn't help--the chat person kept referring me back to the instruction video.  Now, when I have tried to return it, Amazon no longer sends you the label you can print but gives a scan code.  That is also totally useless because it will not print!  Amazon has dropped the ball on customer service,

Shari from Amazon’s Technical Support team call me shortly after I posted my 1 star review and after trying a few things to fix it she agreed it needed replacing and poof got the new one and it works perfect. So fast and I like a lot and will say I do give it 5 stars now.Customer service was awesome and Shari was very professional...

I've been a Roku user for around 3 years.  Bought the Firestick on sale for Black Friday.  I much prefer the user interface of the Roku compared to the Firestick.  The only reason to buy it is to get the Firestick exclusives not available on Roku.  Maybe I'm just too used to using the Roku system, but if someone had never used either, I would steer them to the Roku.

Tengo un TV que no es Smart con un sólo puerto HDMI y recibí un Fire Stick Lite 2020 como regalo para poder ver la app Rakuten Viki que no funciona en mi otro modelo de TV Box. El Fire Stick sólo funciona en el puerto HDMI del TV, no reconoce el adaptador de puertos múltiples uno a tres HDMI que tenía en funcionamiento con el Cable Box y TV Box conectado. Las aplicaciones integradas como YouTube tengo que proyectarla desde mi celular ya que tengo dos nombres de usuario bajo una misma cuenta y el app de YouTube en Fire TV sólo reconoce una. Las app de las redes sociales OK.ru y VK.ru no las reconoce, aún utilizando un programa de transferencia de apps del celular al Fire. Programa como AllCast tampoco funciona se instala correctamente pero no proyecta. Más adelante podré dar más información según vaya utilizándolo. Yo lo recomiendo. 🙌

By far MORE SUPERIOR than a ROKU (which I had previously).  VERY EASY to connect to TV and download apps and streaming services.  If you DO NEED HELP, the are PLENTY of helpful WEBSITES on the internet!!  NO DROPPED WIFI CONNECTIONS which was a CONSTANT ISSUE with the ROKU device.  This is the second Firestick I purchased so I can connect another TV!!!

Amazon lockers are located in an unsuitable area, the area that my package was located at was a 7 eleven in Benning road n.e Washington, D.C. the lockers are located outside of the 7 eleven on a dark side of the store and no security cameras were visible or any lighting where the lockers are. As I was retrieving my package I observed what seemed to be a hobo on the side of the building nearby the lockers with his pants halfway down defecating.. the experience was terrify and I feared for my safety.

This is my 3rd Fire Stick.  I replaced the first one because I lost the remote (of course, then I discovered the Google app to control it from your phone).  The 2nd one has always worked well, for several years now.  The new one is going to a new TV.As always, it just works.  Voice control calls up movies, etc., without a hitch.  If you are a Prime member and/or have an Alexa device, this is the streaming device you need.

I like the easy installation and the Home Screen layout.  What I don't like is the difficulty to integrate with my Alexa... she keeps telling me she can't recognize the TV so the microphone doesn't work.  I set up my old fire stick and integrated it so not sure what the issue is here. I also don't care for the remote. It doesn't have volume control or turn on/off TV feature; I now use two different remotes.

It is fast and fun to use! Much faster than our 9 yr old Roku. It also offers the ability to download more Apps like YouTube than the Roku (which we couldn't seem to watch with the Roku) and news Apps like CBS and the other main ones. Uploads of movies and TV shows are faster. Everything seems clearer and more colorful, too.  We are enjoying it a lot!

Easy instructions and installation. Easy to use voice control if you know the title of what you want (English and Spanish). Can’t speak for the rest of the rest of it because I didn’t play with it after I didn’t find what I wanted- Spanish language channels.To give as a gift, I just needed at least the two big ones- Univision and Telemundo. Oh well- back in the box it goes.

I replaced my first generation Fire stick with this, and it is much improved. The set up is a breeze, controls are intuitive, and it has worked without any issues. Most importantly, our aging smart TV was constantly having issues with network connections and buffering. This solved all of these issues for a really low price. If you have Prime this is a no brainer.

This purchase has the most efficient and nice on the pocket for its cost is peanuts comparing to Satellite or mediacoms fiber optic  Had I checked years ago I might of built my credit a bit more than what route I chose to follow what everyone else has .....  THE WIFI IS A MUST TO MAKE IT OPERATE in that you don't need Prime more over y wouldn't ya get prime it is the 2nd Best decision I searched out and learn as I go already tho I PROMISE in economy MY AMERICAN READERS  if I still had my cable wifi an the few other crap I had my bill monthly just for bundled medical  348.98 every month my phone pay as you go but I was done with cable same show same commercials  This new deal cost what ive already been paying Netflix wifi and the cost 4 the stick 26.00  The Alexa is not that user friendly 4 ME I didn't buy it 4 that anyway

I love that I can legally locate most any shows or movies I want to see. I have cable and some apps that give me more choices for viewing, but frankly, I think I waste a lot of money because the majority of the shows on cable are awful. The same is true of the network offerings. With my fire stick, I am seriously considering canceling my cable or at least cutting back to the absolute basics.

It works fine. The only complaint I have is that 70% of the time when I turn my TV back on or wake up the fire stick I will not have any sound and will then have to restart the fire stick to get the sound back. It doesn't sound like a huge deal, but it can be very annoying when it happens so frequently, and to do a restart you have to hunt through some menus or go physically unplug the device. If the remote had a power button, it might not be so frustrating.

This is my third fire tv product. The first froze up and, after 90 minutes on the phone with tech support, it became obvious that it was irreparable. So I bought a second one. After almost a year of use, it began returning error messages about no memory space available, even though we added nothing to it. I am told that Amazon pushes ads and other junk to it that take up space. We bought the third unit to replace the second and we wiped the second unit and loaded current versions. It now functions as before. However there are two issues: 1. Both units are creeping upwards in used disk/memory space. 2. all units come loaded with "features" that have no practical application in our world. We'd like to delete them, but we cannot. Sadly, these features take up a lot of disk memory and contribute to the issues I described.

A friend who has and uses this system had to spend TWO HOURS installing this product and that is while using the services of Amazon-the lady involved was very helpful.While it finally worked and is continuing to work, I would not recommend Amazon's product and believe that Amazon itself is negligent in the way it sells this product.
It was very easy to set up.  I have had to restart because volume stops working every other day.  Now suddenly,  i can't livestream.  Not sure if this is the firestick issue or not

Purchased one 4 yrs ago and the remote stopped working or so I'm guessing. So I purchased my second one for the tv in the living room. I like using my Fire stick, it's easy to maneuver. I have one on all three of my televisions, I know they say you can use one on all 3, just move by moving them around but I didn't want to have to disconnect it and wait for it to reprogram. So it was worth it to put one on each tv and they are not that expensive when you buy from Amazon. Thank you Amazon.

Love it! Especially that I can control the volume from my Roku remote. I had an older addition in my living room that did not have volume control on that remote. I read reviews before buying & can happily say that I had no issues with the signal from my remote reaching my Roku device from across the room. The only thing is it does stay running even when you turn the tv off, therefore when I go to the living room to watch Netflix it will say that too many devices are using this account, & it's because the bedroom was streaming it when I turned the tv off but the roku stayed on. No big deal though, not Roku's fault. I now have a smart Roku TV that I absolutely love. Team Roku over here!!

I don't understand why they wouldn't have added at least a small heat sync to this device. It works well, but if the temp of the room gets above 78 or so, it can overheat. It warns  you, but the only option, since it also doesn't have the ability to power off, is to reach behind the tv and pull the power, or shut off the TV. While ideal for a guest room where they would mostly only be using the device, that would be fine. For your main living room media center it can present an issue. The whole time your TV is on, the stick is on, even if you are watching cable on another input. Would it overheat and you would never know? I don't know yet.

I always read reviews, check out review sites like TechRadar...  After reading many glowing reviews on the Roku Streaming Stick+, I decided it was worth a go.  Installation was extremely easy.  I live in a 3000+ sq ft house, and the wireless access point is downstairs on the other side of the house.  The Roku stick picked it up immediately and has yet to drop it.  After 2 weeks and nearly flawless performance, I pulled the plug on my provider.  I don't miss 800+ channels (many redundant) and my nearly $300 monthly bill.  The kids one demand was a TV channel that rhymes with 'Rick'.  So for the cost of wireless, an Indoor antenna (sold in a green box) for local channels, and minimal subscription costs to 3 streaming services (First letters N, H and P, in case I'm not supposed to mention names), I get everything the family wants and only a wireless bill.  I advise providing power to the stick via AC power vs USB.  In my case, every time the TV power was turned off, power to the stick was removed, and it had to go through a reboot cycle next time the TV was turned on.  Doesn't happen on AC power.  Gets a bit hot, but nothing out of the ordinary.  And unless I have to change the TV Input source or TV channels to select signals provided by the Indoor Antenna, the Roku remote controls my TV power, volume  and allows me to select programs via voice input.  For the cost, a GREAT bargain!  Goodbye, cable TV.

Install went smoothly. There is/was no activation fee as clearly stated in manual. They wanted a credit card but clearly install was not chargeable and there were no hidden fees. There is nothing nefarious in requesting a card if it's for their own protection. You still have to pay for for subscriptions such as Amazon Prime and Netflix which are separate from the purchase price of this hardware. I had no connection problems with this stick. I still see some buffering issues but I'm not sure how much is due to my provider or the hardware. Either way it's been minimal and far better than my original stick which was one of the first ones made by the company. I'm satisfied. If I had any wants on the controls it would be for them to be backlit and maybe the mute button placement. I don't know what that would do to battery life or costing. Either way it's not a deal-breaker.

it disconnected access to internet on what ever I had it connected to... my l/r tv. bedroom tv, and my computer.  so I returned it.  my daughter's roku stick (not this model) worked fine on my stuff.  While the one I bought was hooked up to the tv, it couldn't connect because it said no internet.  but at the same time my kindle, phone, and computer had access to internet.  My internet supplier couldn't help me... they said everything was fine on their end.

I've used a cheaper Roku device for years and have been pleased with the streaming speed and really like the interface. It's easy to set up and doesn't take long to get to my favorite channels.  I recently cut my cable and went with Hulu for local/live channels not available on my antenna. I needed a new stick since my TiVo's won't do Hulu live. I had been happy with Roku so I went with Roku Streaming Stick+.That's when I learned how painful it was to get through to a real live person. I realize that companies would like you to check for help online but Roku has made it into an art form.I do have a product-specific comment that I hope will help. I've included a photo to show the location of the Mute button. I love the remote but I can't use it without continuing to press the mute button. Luckily, the mute button doesn't make a major impact on my use or it could be a real problem.

In my bedroom, my computer hardly gets a signal, not steady. The TV is beyond the desktop, further from the router, but the Roku keeps a steady stream so far. I'm impressed and glad I paid extra for the longer reaching device. Also, this device is much faster than the roku in my living room, right by my router. Can't compare much to the Firestick cause it arrived defective, only I didn't know it. I thought it was the TV, and nearly scrapped my 3 year old 40+ inch tv. Super glad I didn't! Go Roku!!!

I have or had one of just about every type of streaming box/stick but this 4K Roku streaming stick + has a cleaner interface, seemingly more options (or at least easier to setup & use), more comfortable remote and more that has made it my streamer of choice. So much so, I've ordered one for myself and set this purchase up for my wife to provide a faster processor for our broadband cable service rather than use the app from our 'smart' TV whose processor was slower and less dependable. I have one pet peeve though. The little buttons at the bottom of the remote that has pre-programmed Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ & Sling would be better to user-defined for other prefered services since there are so man out there to choose from. Still, the Roku Streaming Stick+ 4K is awesome.

If you are new to these types of devices and are trying to decide between Roku and FireTV, just stop right there and get a Roku.  The Roku just works all the time without any hassle.  Every major streaming service is available and Roku makes it easy to sign in and watch.  It connects to wifi just fine and works on every TV I have.  I have several Fire's too because they are cheap, and I thought I could make the switch because I am invested into a lot of Prime stuff.  The Fire's always give me grief with needing to reboot all the time, disconnects from wifi, Netflix locks up in between episodes, and other problems.  Save yourself the aggravation and just get a ROKU.

Like all products on Amazon, reviews are all over the place on this Roku streaming stick. Some say it was hard to set up, some say they got a faulty unit. I had no issues at all. I opened the box, plugged it in to a HDMI port and connected the power to a USB port. I guess some USB ports don't supply enough power to run a Roku but the Roku will tell you if it has the power to work and my Samsung tv was able to do this. Set up was very simple, just follow the on screen directions. Someone also said the remote would not control a sound bar so I was ready to use a separate remote to control the volume. The remote connected automatically to my TV AND sound bar! My sound bar is an older model and is plugged into the optical  audio out. When I hit the Roku's power button the TV comes on and so does the sound bar. Volume is also supported! Our TV is a  pre 2016 75 inch Samsung smart TV with a lot of apps like Netflix but didn't support YouTube TV which we are going to use after we dump DirectTV which is costing in the $150 range now. It's available on the Roku. I upgraded our router at the same time as ours was getting a little long in the tooth. Bottom line is Roku is easy to set up, simple to navigate and has lots of great features, some of which aren't even listed in the description. On the fence? Buy it!

Sound is out of sync. Sometimes it seems to be off by a half second or so.A common issue is when an ad starts, the sound becomes extremely loud. (Thought there was a federal statute requiring that sound should remain the same.) When I verbally request music the unit automatically wants to load Pandora. I ask for Prime Music and Roku always loads Pandora. I removed pandora because I have subscriptions to I Heart and Prime. It will actually reload Pandora. Actually my old Roku III hat Amazon as a control button but it was removed and replaced on my Ultra controller. Same issues on my Streaming Stick +es. (Have 2) How about putting Prime back on and maybe putting YouTube TV instead of Sling. YouTube TV is better by the way. Next DirectTV will be buying their way onto Roku’s controller. Last item. Sound. TV sound is required. Remote will not work with add on sound systems. I want to use my 5.1 Visio surround system. Ear buds are better. On/off button is great and volume control good. Need a “mute” button.

Liked:- 4K/HDR capabilities- excellent remote functionality and layout (controls TV vol and mute)- compact sizeDislike:- can't cast from Windows 10 PC but can from phone. Had no problems with previous Roku 3 and can also cast direct to TV (not through Roku) from Windows 10, so the PC is not the issue.- video quality when casting from my S10+ phone "seems" to be less sharp than with my old Roku 3

This product streams programs well but may not fit well in all TV's depending on how their HDMI sockets are oriented (especially if they are aimed straight out the back of a TV close to a wall).  I had to buy a separate HDMI "gender bender" adapter to hook mine up to an existing HDMI (double male) cable, just so it could fit my TV.  Once set up though, it works well and produces an excellent 1080p picture from a variety of streaming sources.  The voice remote works well too, but is limited at finding programs inside some of the separate streaming apps provided by various content providers.  The remote control also lacks a mute button, which seems a clear oversight.

I wish I had cut the Xfinity cord earlier! Hooked this up in less than a minute.  Downloading my netflix, youtube  and amazon prime took about another 5 minutes. Then added sling blue for $30/month which took about 2 minutes. Bought my own modem for $70.00 instead of the $14/month rental I've been paying comcast for 7 yrs. I still have to use them for internet but my bill went from $160.00/month with no premium channels to $80.00. Streaming quality excellent (was having issues before with netflix and amazon). You will have to adjust to the different format but it's not hard. The voice remote is a dream! I ask it to turn on closed captioning whenever I watch my british shows on PBS lol. I did not expect to get local channels but surprisingly I do here in northern MD. So, don't procrastinate any longer like I did, throwing away $80.00/month! Get this ROKU and then add Sling!

Have a number of Roku streaming sticks and one Roku TV purchased over the years. Bought the latest for 4K and because my new 75" 4K Android TV since for some unknown reason is not allowed to run either Amazon Prime Video or the Spectrum/Charter cable app.Setup was easy except that the unit is in two pieces and the wireless is inside a bulge in the power cord and reading the setup instructions is important. That said it has Amazon Prime and Spectrum capability and works about like every other Roku device I have.The reason for degrading a star is that it runs way too hot (too hot to touch and shudder to think about internal temps) so I added a gaggle of 1/2" square heat sinks using thermally conductive grease and also placed a very small box fan behind the TV to blow on the Roku. This keeps it cool enough to touch.So working well but may need addition cooling for long life.

I bought this stick to replace a several year old Roku stick that had a laggy interface since year 1.  This is almost the perfect stick.  Very snappy and I swear my 1080P image is much sharper with this stick.  Whereas my old stick was powered by the TV USB, this stick requires more power than my TV USB offers... so have to use the plug-into-socket option.  The only downside is the ROKU stick is always on, which is not bad, except when I'm streaming live You Tube TV and forget to hit <HOME> <Power off> and just hit <Power Off> (which just turns off the TV).  A day later if I've not watched this TV I'll find this stick has been streaming continuously: Bandwidth Hog.  I'm getting better at remembering the turn-off procedure... not so much for my wife and son.

I have 3 Roku 3800s in my house, and they work great.  I  needed another unit so I decided to get the 3810 since it was on sale. I gave this unit one star, because the unit repeatedly failed to pair with the remote. I went to the Roku blog site and noticed many similar complaints with no resolution. I will be returning this item for a replacement. I will update this review if the replacement works as expected. In the meantime buyer beware.Edit:  After spending some time with Roku's Customer Service via Instant Messenger, it was determined that it was my fault I could not pair my remote.  Due to the extremely short cables that are provided with this product, I substituted their USB mini cable with one that I had on hand. Unfortunately, theirs contains a device "in line" which is necessary to operate the Roku, and I unsuspectedly removed it (I thought it was some sort of surge protector for the Roku stick). Do not remove the Roku cable with the USB mini connector!!

This product does not work as advertised when it comes to audio support.  Video is okay.Do not expect to get dolby atmos out of netflix/amazon and do not expect support.My receiver works fine with LG TV apps and atmos works on all available atmos content, but with roku as input and same titles you only get 5.1, Disney + is the exception, I get Atmos there. Support keeps trying to pass the buck and offers no steps to actually troubleshoot.LG -> Netflix / Amazon/ Disney + -> Receiver = AtmosRoku -> Netflix / Amazon -> Receiver = 5.1 suckRoku -> Disney + = AtmosLogically, the problem is with Roku's compatibility with Netflix/Amazon, but to their support team it is "receiver fault, netflix fault".If Atmos is your thing I would look elsewhere.

It works like other older ROKU devices,  maybe faster.BIG COMPLAINT....it only works with advanced HDMI ports or ARC,  my less than 2 yr old TV doesn't have the "advanced" HDMI port,  so have to use the ARC port, which negates using my  soundbar effectively.I cannot use it on  my other two TV's, 5 yrs old, as they have no "advanced" HDMI nor an ARC.  There should be some way to bypass that restriction.

This worked great for our purposes, and vendor was very helpful with small problem we encountered.  Although I am not great with this sort of technology, there was enough help on the screen to get me through the set up.  IMO this is an excellent value.  One small thing:  If I wanted to order an additional remote, I couldn't seem to find enough detail on the roku site to be sure that I was getting the correct remote.  We have two different ones, with MUTE and without.  They look the same except for the mute button on the site of the device, but I could not find enough information to be sure what I was ordering.  Maybe I missed it, but if not, the technical writers at Roku might want to get on this.  Thanks again, basically, good value for the money.

I got my Roku stick and was excited to set it up; I must have pressed something as the device setup started in French - with no way to go back to change it. I got all the way to what I assumed was pairing to my account. At the same time I also connected to the device from my Roku app. Well, the Roku app said that the stick was associated to another account. Strange as I though I was just setting it up. I would expect that this would simply work and would associate my stick to my account, but oh no. In the end I had to clear all my settings and start from the beginning with reentering my wifi password. This should not happen in 2018. Luckily, I could choose English setup now, but not much better experience in the end. It now keeps saying I didn't confirm that automatic selection of the TV resolution, even though I confirmed it twice. Well third time's a charm. But wait! I again can only link the stick to my device on the web and not on the app. And my previous channels on my old stick are not automatically migrated to this device. WTH? At the end of the registration channel tie-in page - when I press Continue - I get treated with a "You're signed out..." message. Why did activation sign me out of roku? Naturally, the device is still waiting for activation... ??? Okay, on second try "Continue" did not sign me out... at least be consistent here. Next screen Roku offers me to sign into my existing accounts, e.g. Amazon. But wait, when trying to do that I get "The website experienced an unexpected problem. Close and reopen your browser..." Okay, I'll hit Back and skip this instead. Yay, finally I get to "you're done" screen and surprise! my existing channels do show up now, yet the website gave no hints and wanted me to add some of these channels again.

The product works well for a Roku on the go.  It comes with a Mini USB to USB A cable for power.  It's a 2019 device and using a port that is long outdated.  This was a major source of dissatisfaction since I now have to have this cable along when I travel along with a standard Micro USB and USB C.  Even if you aren't using USB - C yet for a device, you should definitely be using Micro USB.I've noticed some issues with connecting to a wireless network at hotels.  It's the same network every time so it's possible it could have stored my credentials (with a room number) and trying to connect off of that each time.  It seems to take a few trying and some messing with it to force it prompt my phone for the network for the hotel signin page.  It could be the network at the hotel though since that has been spotty in the past.I used to use a firestick while travelling but it took forever to get it connected and working on the network.  The Roku stick loads everything much faster and is a much better UI.

The Roku stick works fine with out an issue but the remote is horrible. The battery is draining like any thing. I am replacing the battery every two months. This is after one year of Using Roku stick.I have changed the battery 4 - 5 times already. Initially I thought the issue is because of the batteries but that is not it I tried different batteries and all has same issue, It works for couple of months and then its dies out . Please refer the photo, Every time there is a discharge from the battery and it looks like some issue with the remote which is shorting or some thing and it dies out. Then I started reading blogs and found Roku already knows this issue and there is no fix for the same. I am not sure why ROKU is knowingly Fooling PPL by selling this Defect remote.I will definitely not recommend this product to Any one, What is the use of having a Roku Stick with a non functional Remote. - So bad.

I bought this because I don't have an HD receiver in my bedroom and I want to stream sports in HD quality to my HD TV in my bedroom. My family used to be able to watch sports on the one TV in the house with an HD receiver, but we have had family members move in and completely ruin the experience. I have used Chromecast for years, and there have been so many issues with it but it generally worked well enough. But since football season started, I have been especially frustrated with a lack of smooth streaming, and I knew I couldn't go through a whole football season struggling with streaming issues. To top it off, we switched several months ago from slow DSL to a much faster ISP, and we should not be having the same types of streaming issues at all...but we were, at least with respect to Chromecast performance.So, I decided to look up Roku and I was curious about what channel apps were available. I read that any channel that has an app would be available on Roku, so that was good enough for me and I purchased it. It has worked great...very few streaming issues at all, and the little bit that exist clear up pretty fast and then you have a smooth streaming experience.A few problems, though, most of which have been fixed/worked around at this time:1) The BTN2Go app does not play live TV. It says, "This video is currently unavailable. Please check back later" every time. Thankfully, you can watch the Big Ten Network through the Fox Sports app.2) It takes a little too long for each app to start up.
