This is pretty annoying when you're trying to flip back and forth between various games.3) Roku does not, in fact, have every app associated with streaming live TV. If you want to watch CBS and CBS Sports Network games, it's pretty hard to do so because Roku does not have the actual CBS Sports app. They have this crappy, worthless CBS Sports HQ app that does not show any games, and they have the CBS app that expects you to pay monthly to stream CBS programming. Yet, the CBS Sports app and the CBS Sports site both let you stream SEC games and games on CBS Sports Network (usually AAC and military academy games) for free. I spent hours on Saturday trying to figure out how I can get around this issue and finally figured out how to mirror my laptop screen to Roku. But I really had to dig around online for this info. I really would rather not have to mirror my laptop at all for games; I'd like the real CBS Sports app to be available on Roku.4) It's pretty annoying how every time you want to use an app for the first time that requires your TV cable subscription info, you have to go to your phone or PC/laptop and go to some link to get access.5) I did have an issue with the Roku connecting and disconnecting repeatedly when I first hooked it up and went through set up. Once I reset the stick, unplugged it and plugged it back in and went through setup again, this issue was resolved.--After getting these issues figured out, except for the slow app load times, there's nothing wrong with Roku at all--it's the best $60 or $70 you'll ever spend. Great video quality and great performance. It has saved my football season, and probably my basketball, tennis, softball, etc, seasons, as well. It works so well that it's easy to leave it on and stream up my internet bandwidth usage because I forget it's not the actual cable. It just streams seamlessly.

So great, so great, so great.  What was I thinking all these years?  Here's the deal: A lot of these cord-cutting options don't really pan out, because you have to pay $40/mo for YouTube or the other big ones.  What's the point, then?  you save some, for sure, but... it's never seemed worth it, to me.  But now there's Philo TV, which has ALL the channels I watch - no other service does, under $25/mo.  Philo is $16.  !!!  Awesome!  And it has Comedy Channel, History, DIY, FYI, and HGTV.  If you have Amazon Prime, you get PBS Masterpiece!  Through in another $5/mo and you get all of PBS, as a subscriber - and it's a tax deduction.As for Roku Streaming Stick+... I like it much better than the Fire Stick.  It's just more fun, and you can change the "theme" for free now.  Easy to use, and the remote has Voice Commands!!  Awesome!  It instantly learns how to control the volume and Power for your TV, too.  Now you're down to one remote.  My only gripe would be it would be REALLY nice to have a backlight on the remote.  But that's a minor thing.  Still... it would be nice.Picture quality is excellent.  Programs never pause.  The interface seems pretty fast.  You do have to wait sometimes when going between shows, but look at it this way; it's a lot quicker than sitting through even one short commercial.One other thing that takes getting used to - in a good way - is you don't really need to "tape" anything.  you just say what program you like to watch, and it "saves" all upcoming episodes for you.  They're not "recording" anything except a link to the program you want to watch.

After watching video reviews of the Roku products, I selected this one.  It was so easy to install and takes up no space.  The USB port of my tv provided enough power and I did not need to use an extension.  Picture quality is excellent and I can watch so many programs that it will take a long time to decide on favorites.  Also, since I subscribe to Prime, Britbox and Acorn services already, I can now watch these in the bedroom.  Cost was extremely reasonable.

I have four Roku TVs - that means the Roku App is built into the TV from the factory. I also have a Roku Streaming Stick+ on a dumb TV, and I have just added a new Streaming Stick+ to my smart Samsung TV.  None of these devices have cost one cent to access and watch anything from Roku.  The reviewers that say they are being charged are probably not talking to ROKU. They are being scammed.The only thing that a subscriber has to pay for, after buying the Roku device, is a subscription to a premium content network provider, such as Netflix.  As to the Streaming stick+  - it works great on my smart TV and delivers 4K images if the channel is sending 4K images.

I brought my rating from 4 to 3.My main criticism concerns the remote. It has only very limited functions and there is no performant alternative to be found on Amazon or elsewhere. For $25 Sideclick can add a few functions, but it still is incomplete.The shortcut keys are useless to me since I don't watch the Hulu, Sling and Netflix imposed shortcuts. I do watch Amazon Prime, but there is no shortcut key for that, nor is there any possibility to reprogram the imposed keys. I deplore the inexistence of any user programmable keys altogether, which exist in higher end Roku models. Therefore, the Roku remote cannot take control of the TV sleep function or the image and sound settings. Neither does it allow to mute the sound, if you can believe that. I have no alternative than to juggle with 2 remotes.Technically, the remote doesn't work well. It often becomes unresponsive while the batteries are still good. When this happens, I can wait a minute or two, and if this isn't enough, take the batteries out and back in,  turn the TV off, and if this still doesn't work, unplug the stick, reset the router... It happens more and more often - at least once every hour when I zap between channels.Finally, there are buffering problems and frequent sound-image coordination problems, which do not exist on my Roku Ultra.This stick wasn't the great buy I initially thought.

I got this after verifying that Roku would do everything that I hoped. I first got an Ultra 2020 then after testing this model got a couple more just like it from a local store. It surprised me how well it worked and how convenient it is. The number of free viewing options is unbelievable and the way it manages both free and paid streaming services was simply incredible.  I feel a sorry for the satellite services. Every time I show this solution to a friend they too cancel their satellite service, get a streaming service at less than half the cost, and use the first month's saving to buy a Roku to manage it all. Only wish I had done this years ago as I am now saving $115 a month.

This has been one of the best purchases I've made. So I got a few roku sticks because our whole family basically streams from a few streaming services, but we also have cable and can use our cables app to stream instead of having their box which costs extra just to have it. It was definitely worth the buy! I've had other streaming sticks or devices and nothing honestly compares to Roku. I love how you can organize your streaming apps on the homepage and can also set parental controls for certain devices, like my son's room. I also like how there are many free streaming options and just about every streaming app out there for whatever your needs are. It's simple to use that even my 65 yr old mother can use it with ease. Worth the purchase, if your thinking about getting it, then get it. You will not be disappointed.

Every time I try to use it the screen says “ Home is currently not available “ go to network settings when I go to network settings it shows that I’m connected with very good signal strength. Then I go back to my profile and it says I’m not connected to the internet. This is the one in my living room. The one in my bedroom doesn’t have any issues.

I was gifted an Amazon Firestick when my Chromecast stopped working. It's a whole new experience in convenience. I no longer need a second device to cast to my TV - it all downloads to the stick. I should have done this years ago.I haven't yet ventured into the whole Alexa/voice recognition thing. (Hey, you know, us old guys are slow adopters!)

Something is wrong with this dick every single day the sound will just go out on any program running through the fire stick I have to completely reset the stick in order for the sound to come back this has happened every single day since I've had this particular stick it does not happen with any other stick on any other television

A nice inexpensive Firestick. The Home page is completely different but I'm getting used to it. It works well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I'm so used to the other Firesticks layout and I don't like change LOL. Good product at a reasonable price, I got mine when it was less than $18. Basically all the same features.

This firestick is wonderful. I purchase 2 before Christmas. There no TV controls, but still is an upgrade from my 3 year firestick that kept shutting off. Since, I've purchased this firestick, I haven't had any issues with dysfunctional components, no shut offs, no required updates etc. It works soothingly well! Highly recommend.

This Fire Stick is much faster than my original 1st generation one. I do like the Alexa involvement although it’s not 100% accurate in the requests. The fact that volume is not controlled by this version provides no problem. I’m so used to using the DISH control for that, I’d probably not use voice control on a Fire Stick anyway.

It’s great! We purchased it for our daughters room and they love the access to Netflix, Disney, and a bunch of other apps. It’s very easy for my 6 year old to use on her own. It’s easy to use from tv to tv.  I’ll end up getting a second one for our main tv since it is unable to update and get the latest apps. Definitely an awesome option!

I know it isn't a new product but considering the fire stick just got updated, I'm very pleased with its performance. I've got two older sticks and they don't perform anywhere near as good as the new ones. No buffering issues. Great picture quality. And the new remote has volume control. What's not to like. Tremendous value too.

I noticed that this streaming stick seems to be somewhat sluggish when it comes to menu updates and navigation.  This isn't an issue that I've found using the Roku streaming stick on another TV around the same price.Also, the ads for new Amazon shows on the home screen are kinda annoying. Other than that, it works fine.

I use my Firestick to escape the crap on the regular TV channels such as GMA selling junk within their program (along with advertising along side the program). As I said above almost everything you want to watch must be paid for, you must be selective or you will be spending a chunk of change!  I am not sure promotional information for Fire Stick makes this clear. One thing that irks me is the storyline description is not complete for programs on Amazon Prime: the storyline ends with a small rectangle with three dots as though I can click on something or push a button on the Firestick remote in order to see the remaining storyline description, but forget about that! Iguess a person must resign to the fact that there is no free lunch - everything has a cost.

2 cons. Have to unplug and replug it in to the t.v. 2-3 times weekly because the sound to the t.v /soundbar stops. Apparently, a common problem with this firestick, when Google, and this is the only fix i have found.2nd MAJOR PROBLEM!!!! While it is plugged into any t.v. in the house, it picks up any pictures you have saved to Amazon Photos and on your phone and plays them on the t.v s at random as screen savers. Not good when you have pics that you may not want everyone to see. Called Amazon and they said there is no way to disable that function, only to get rid of Amazon photos completely...

I am a Tivo user and when HBO Max took over for HBO Go  - I was not able to stream HBO - although I pay for it through Verizon.  I do not need a Verizon box with my Tivo - so rather than pay for an unnecessary and costly verizon fios box  - this firestick lite is the perfect answer.  Its so easy to use and HBO Max is included!!

Got this for my guest room as a cheaper alternative to purchasing another appleTV.The bad: The user interface is unbelievably bad for such a major brand product and is clearly designed to benefit the advertisers, not the end user. Several of the apps (including Twitch, which they own) crash almost constantly. The remote is not particularly responsive.The good: mostly does what it is advertised to do, which is pretty decent for how cheap it is. Very easy to set up and sync with services. The remote, while not particularly great, is at least simple and easy to use.Overall, can’t say I would really recommend it, but if you’re looking for a cheaper alternative that won’t be used all the time then it’s still a decent choice.

I previously bought a Fire TV Stick and loved it so much ! During the Black Friday weekend sale I noticed it was on sale for almost half price so I bought another one only to find out after ( I didn’t do any homework) it wasn’t the same, the Lite means it doesn’t control your TV ,so you have to use two different remotes to power up the TV ! Other than that everything else works the same as far as I know. In my opinion I would of rather of paid full price for the regular Fire Stick, it’s worth it for the extra convenience!

Basically I bought it because it was on sale, we'd lost the remote to the old one and ours was getting a bit dated. Works great. Was supposed to be "pre setup" with my Amazon account. I don't think this happened because I had to do all the setup in the quick start guide. Works just like the old one, slightly faster and less glitch prone.

Don’t be diswayed by the Lite, it is a full functional, normal storage fire stick. It just doesn’t have the volume or power button, which many of us don’t need as we probably have a dozen other remote options:tv, cable, sound bar. I love the fire stick and am happy there is a version i don’t have to pay extra for button features I wouldn’t even use most of the time.

I bought this for my second smart tv that I was gifted recently. It works perfect with the TV. It was easy to set up, even while having one already on my main TV in the house.The only thing I would recommend is for the option to choose which power cable you want to receive, instead of having to buy a separate attachment to be able to power it with just the tv and not the wall power outlet.

Very easy to set up.  Even includes the batteries.  Good bang for the buck, I guess.  BUT, like every other Amazon product that streams movies, etc., they're built to deteriorate/die after a few years.  It kind of forces you to buy another one lest you have other options.  Guess that's just another reason Bezos is the richest person in THE WORLD.

Love it. Simply made my life easier. It was super cheat and a great product. If you are willing and able, spend some extra bucks to be able to control volume and tv power all in one remote. But if you are like me, who does not care much about having two remotes and prefers a cheap product that has great feature, this is it for you.

I bought this to upgrade my old fire TV stick.  It is a great improvement over the old stick.  No more broken up in streaming with better preview feature.  Very happy with this deal as I have to throw the old one away.  I bought the lite version because the TV control part is incomplete as that only controls power and sound.

I got this for my Vizio “Smart” TV that wouldn’t play movies for Netflix and Hulu despite having the installed app on the TV. EVERYTIME I would select the app for those they would start to stream the movie I would pick and return with a code that would say it was unable to play movie. I had written to Vizio without any response. Finally after some searching in the internet for solutions, it came back with a cheap solution for a dongle. I picked this one because with the Chromecast you had to use your phone to stream it. This Roku comes with a remote that works for your tv and even has voice search. It installed over 130 channels with more to select from.  I have tried Netflix and Hulu and HBOGO and it plays every movie I select with no problems. I am so satisfied with this. I have even heard it will work on other TVs that aren’t smart and will turn them into a smart tv. This is a great cheap device and works great. Sound and video looks great.

It takes just minutes to plug in and set up. The instructions are easy and clear and the packaging is nice. I have had no issues with the remote or connection at all. It's a good product for the price.

The "Point Anywhere Remote" is probably the worst remote I've ever had. From day one it was a problem getting it to pair and work. It would work fine and then suddenly you would have to get the remote within about 10 inches of the roku stick to get it to start working again. Then you could walk away. Now it wont work at all when you walk away. The effective range of the remote with fresh batteries, and a full factory reset is about 6 inches if you're lucky. It will not work at all beyond 6 inches. Have ordered the free hdmi extender that they offer, and we'll see if that works. But quite frankly I'm not sure why thats not something thats included if its a problem enough for them to offer it in the troubleshooting video.

I purchased the Roku to add a few more streaming options like YouTube. I also have a Fire TV that I purchased 4 years ago. What I liked right away was that the Roku remote also controlled the volume on the TV. Just need the one remote, big plus. The setup was easy, added a few apps too. The first thing I noticed was the picture quality. When I went through the setup, I let the device do the automatic setup. The edges are not crisp. Comparing the same video between the Fire TV and the Roku, the Fire TV has a much clearer and crisper image. I went into the TV setting and reset to the default, no improvement. It is more noticeable with text. The lines are not clean, kind of zigzag with a haziness around them. Just like if you enlarge an image and it starts to get pixelated. I tried adjusting the settings on the roku. No help. Problem #2. If I use the Fire TV or Blu-ray player and then use the Roku. The Roku remote will not work. I have to pop out a battery from the Roku remote and put it back in for the remote to work. Disappointing.I thought this was going to replace my Fire TV, but no. I can't get past the poor image quality.

I've had many Rokus for a good number of years, but needed 2 of them to put behind tvs without having a cable hanging down. This is why we I purchased 2 sticks.Plugging this device into the USB on the back of a TV (or any powersource that isn't always on like a switched outlet) causes the batteries in the remote to run dry in less than a week (without even being used!)While this is an engineering flaw that could probably be sorted out with a firmware update, my low review comes from Roku choosing to ignore this issue for years, and continuing to give its customers the runaround. They haven't owned the issue or worked on a fix...instead just directing customers to simply plug the USB into a power outlet instead of their TV.If you're planning on plugging this device into the USB power on the back of your TV, and aren't 100% that your USB stays powered when your TV is off...then best to find a different solution than this.Roku wants this device to always be on...that way it can monitor your entire network and sell the information advertisers...so don't expect a fix for this!

I had the Roku Premiere in my Family room but my router is upstairs so it kept losing connection throughout the day so I purchaser the Roku® Streaming Stick®+ which works great and it has been staying connected. I've had it for 10 days but today it went offline so I thought it would go back online shortly but it didn't so realized that they end of USB Power Cable with Advanced Wireless Receiver end that plugs into the streaming stick doesn't fit as tight at it should. I had to put tape around it to make it fit tight and now it seems to be staying connected. I am very disappointed about this part of it because I just purchased it and now it's loose. I also purchased one for my daughter's bedroom because her Roku 3 was staying connected and now the Roku® Streaming Stick®+ works great in her bedroom.

Setup is super simple, 4k picture is stellar (if programming is captured in 4k) and the fact that this eliminates another dust catcher is a plus.A secret bonus is that this is small enough it can be taken on vacation.  Most hotels already offer free WiFi along with an HDMI capable TV.  No longer are you limited to the few channels available, nor do you have to touch that icky hotel remote. Just don't leave it behind!

I finally broke down and upgraded my Roku 2 after being informed that it was no longer going to be updated. OMG! It’s so amazing! Transforms my 10 yr old HD TV into a viewing pleasure. The speed, the clarity, being able to use my iPhone/iPad as a remote and speaker! So I ordered another Roku for my senior dad who can now plug in his headphones into his iPad to hear the TV vs blasting it to the point the walls shake.

Overall I'm happy with this product. Had some issues with wifi on my smart TV that I bought for cheap (it's an LG, but I guess you get what you pay for if you're going cheap) so the Roku was a much cheaper alternative to fixing it or buying a new TV. The remote is simple and works great, I wish it was lighted so I can operate it in the dark (I use this in my bedroom) and the interface, though not great, is very functional. The voice search is a nice feature but the integration with Alexa is not simple enough and we ended up not using it that much. Wifi reception and streaming quality is very good, although I tried to check my internet connection via Roku the other day and it said the connection was slow, but I was able to stream HD content with no issues. So not sure what the test does, but it seems to be testing something else that doesn't have to do with streaming.

This is my 4th or more Roku. all worked fine and then stopped. This lst one is voice activated which is excellent. I tried a very simple request to Roku for being able to return all my failed sticks and remotes, to see if any could be rescued. I wasnt looking for any refund or even warranty replacements. Other than acknowledging my contact, nothing more. A good product with poor support

Roku streaming stick + is the best streaming stick you can buy. The Wifi range pickup on this Roku is amazing. We have it in our master bedroom a ways from the internet in the center of the house. It has never had any problem streaming high quality video and im only running 20mbs internet. Our tv can power the stick via USB but the cord is long enough to reach your outlet/surge proctor if you need it too. I also have a Roku Premiere + and the streaming and menus run just as quick. Great product any app you would need only downside is no internet browsing application but today we can get on the internet on anything so no issue for me. GREAT PRODUCT!

I had very high hopes for this device, and tested it in two distinctly different environments: one where it was two rooms away from the router, and in a different house where the device was only seven or eight feet away from a good router signal. The result was about the same: inconsistent signal retention at best. Frustrating.

As mentioned above the voice control to select what you want to view does not work!  To get what you want, you have to repeat your selection numerous times or simply go and type in your selection!  I preciously complained about this item, and was contacted by your rep, and she said she was forwarding the complaint, which was verified in real time, and that I would be further contacted by your tech dept., but no one ever contacted me to resolve the problem!!!  Very, very  poor customer service by Amazon!!!

I’m not going to lie. I’ve always been a roku fan. I only got the firestick because I wanted to get it “unlocked” to see what the hype was about. It’s pretty good but there are still some movies and shows that won’t play or episodes may play a previous season so I have to keep going over the links. Now I won’t be trading all of my rokus because fire sticks are more complicated for my 6 year old to use especially since he’s used to roku but I use it in my living room for movie nights.

What I like about this product is the speed, the latest model even at the lowest price point is still very fast. Easy to figure out, like Roku I use of course Amazon, Spotify, IMDB, and off and on Netflix and Hulu.I would like this item to be more energy efficient, when plugging the USB cable into the television it said low power, so I needed to use a wall plug.The benefit of the device is that with the smart tv the apps might not be updateable, sort of like an old operating system. With the Fire Stick at about thirty dollars, recycle and get a new one, get a tv/monitor with good sound or image, not connectivity, now my tv needs to update no thank you.

This was a gift. I really knew nothing about it. It took a little while for me to figure out that I had to change my TV input setting from cable to HDM-1. I think that's missing in the instructions. Customer service helped me over that hurdle, & then all was good. I haven't used it much yet, but I expect to use it a lot!

What a great product! So simple to set up and at $17.99 a colossal bargain!We’ve been using the original Fire TV Stick and this is superior in every way. Alexa can get a little dodgy at times but not bad at all and what a joy to be able to just ask for your programs instead of scrolling through a bunch of screens.

In all honesty, I got it to use as a streaming device for my projector also, I'm able to connect it to my echo dot. Got the fire stick to plug into my projector which has an HDMI port, also I'm able to power through the projector using the USB port.The volume on my projector is trash, so I use my echo dot as my speaker.The volume control sucks on this because the remote doesn't have buttons to control volume. It's okay though because I just leave the echo next to me and I'm able to control it that way. I have not tried asking Alexa to open apps using the echo but im pretty sure you can. I recommend buying this.

While watching Hulu after a few minutes it freezes up.  You can back out by hitting the home button, force stopping it through settings doesn't seem to help.  It does force Hulu to reload, but as soon as you pick something it locks up again, not even waiting a few minutes.  I was hoping this was already addressed with a software update, but checking for updates didn't show anything new.  Perhaps it will be fixed in the future, but for now its a 3 star device since Hulu is a major use app for it.
I really love the Amazon fire stick . I actually bought this for my grandma and she really likes it . Easy to set up and has every app you could possibly need . User friendly and easy to navigate

I seem to have to reset the remote control almost every time I use it. Plugged directly into the TV. When I turn the TV in it is instantly there. However when I push ANY button including home, it does nothing. I have to push the reset on the Roku unit EVERY TIME, then wait for it to reboot. Then it works fine. I do watch 4K Blu-ray’s and then switch back to Roku. Even then I still have to reboot the Roku. Other than single pain in the neck I’m pretty happy with the unit. If I could get the reboot every time to stop I would rate it higher. Great looking picture. My internet speed is outstandingly high, so when I decide what I want to watch it starts almost instantly!

I like how smooth it works. It loads programs fast with very little buffering even with my VPN on. I have 25 mbs internet speed. First, it doesn’t have Google Store which is a bummer. Second, when I try to install a program and I try to highlight the install, I have to guess because it doesn’t highlight anything. This fire stick light is a big disappointment.

This seems to be a great streaming stick, minus the fact that Amazon forced Roku onto removing Twitch and all 3rd party Twitch apps. I feel bad giving it less than 5 stars because it's not roku's fault that Amazon is being greedy and wanting to force people's hands into buying a fire TV if they want to watch twitch, but I felt it was necessary to let people know in the reviews. Besides the lack of any twitch support, this streaming stick is great, and I would recommend it over the fire TV as long as you don't need the twitch app.

I have one with every TV in our house! Had two and just got our third. We bought a smart TV and it’s UI is just terrible. The smart TV is slow/laggy/disconnects, all terrible and we didn’t know what to do for the longest time. Then light bulb went off to also try Roku, and ta-da... works PERFECT. Thank you Roku for fixing a what a thousand $ Smart TV couldn’t do.We have the Roku app on our phones so it easily switches between all our devices and is way better than the remote it comes with in my opinion. For some reason, the remote batteries on the Roku remote drain so fast for us... so opt into the App and you’ll love it even more!

My husband has been using a Roku streaming stick for several years, while I've been using an older, early version Amazon Fire Stick. Awhile back, I decided to try the Roku -- and he gave me one as a Christmas gift.While I've definitely enjoyed using my new Roku, my biggest complaint (and why I couldn't give it 5 stars) is the location of the off/on sound button. As I'm right-handed, I tend to hold the control in my right hand, switching channels with my right index finger. Since the sound controls are located on the outside of the unit on the right side, I find I'm constantly turning off the sound because my hand is inadvertently squeezing the button.Can you say ... annoying?Other than than, I'm enjoying the opportunity to expand my TV viewing ... and trying to use my left hand to control my new streaming stick.

I had absolutely no problem setting these up. I Didn't have the youtube tv app on my tv and couldn't download it so I bought 2 of these sticks. There is much more than I expected as far a free channels.  I find myself watching old tv shows quite a bit.  A lot of content. Some good some bad. I think anyone could find things they like though. A feature I like is from the app on your android or Iphone you can turn on headphones for late night and not bother others who are trying to sleep. If I had known they had so much free content to offer I would have bought one of these a long time ago. Great  company, great product. My experience dealing with Roku was easy and pleasant. I sent an email requesting HDMI extender cables, received a confirmation follow up almost immediately that they would send them. A few days later they were here.

I like this better than my old roku device. i owned a roku premiere. Dont get me wrong both devices were awesome i just didnt checked the wifi features of my Roku Premiere because it only supports 802.11bgn. It still load fast enough in streaming, my only issue is that i cant maximize my internet which is 5G connection. And this Roku Streaming Stick+ supports it. Its 802.11ac MIMO dual-band wireless so it loads much faster and better on 4k video streaming. So Roku Rocks!!

I specifically bought this to use as a remote with my TV.  I have a Sony, and yet it is not compatible with this Roku, so it's not doing what I bought it to do.  Is understand if had some random no name brand, but it's a Sony for crying out loud.  I already had another Roku which worked just fine.  That said, it works well as a streaming stick.  One thing I'd like to see, is a way to reprogram the preset buttons, so that it would go to the apps I use most.  My old stick has an Amazon button, but this has ESPN.  I only use one of the four preset buttons.

It's a little stronger than the one it replaced. Easy installation and it brings in  YouTubeTV, which is a big set of channels. Very satisfied.I've had these two streaming sticks (plus) for almost two years -- one in the bedroom and the other in the living room. Oh, and  a third in the basement. Almost forgot that one. The router is in a different room down the hall from ALL the rooms. Yes, there are problems, but the problems are mostly the result of glitchy service from Charter/Spectrum. Now, with COVID and everyone at home -- apparently permanently -- they don't have enough servers to manage the number of customers online all the time. Also, change batteries when the remotes get wonky. I have a lot of high quality (Panasonic Eneloop) batteries rechargeables and at least I know I'm not adding more poison to local dumps. You can bury the batteries on Amazon and they really ARE the best by far. Buy rechargeable batteries and change your batteries before they go completely dead because while they are dying, they get very intermittent and weird. If you have any doubt, change the batteries.

We just ordered a second for the living room because I'm loving the one in my bedroom so much. Both rooms have Samsung Smart TVs and they really aren't smart. On our Samsungs the operating software and all the apps lag, they never seem to stream the newest apps, streaming quality sucks, etc etc, so I turned to Roku for a solution. TV is now perfect! I no longer use the smart features on my tv and now rely entirely on my super-fast, high-quality stream, easy to use Roku for everything! I also now have more content and channels than I'll ever know what to do with! Let's let the TV be what it is and Roku be the master for all things streaming! Perfect solution!!!!

This unit can only be operated with the provided roku remote. The remote consistantly loses contact with the unit, making the roku unusable until the remote and roku are sistered together again.Remove the battries to the remoteUnplug the unitre-plug the unitreplace batteriesreprogram and re-set up the roku again, and again, and again.... This gets old real fast.Yes, I tried a few sets of fresh batteries, and I have the roku plugged into the usb and 110v outlet. On the plus side,  shipping was quick  and when working, the picture was good. ( two stars for that)I am returning the item ( joy joy) and looking for a better product.

It’s just good enough. It connects me to the internet apps and make it a pseudo smart TV.Few down points, it doesn’t support Korean language, the curser only moved with button not razor beam that can move around.Some of the apps have off screen fitting and some contents are outside of the screen. I don’t yet know how to fix this.

So I have amazon fire devices associated with the two other primary TVs in the house, working well, and the low price for this one lured me to get it for the third TV that doesn't get used that much.  Had initial problems with keeping it working, screen would go to fuzz, etc.  Worked with amazon support and got the device straightened out.

I Love My Fire Sticks, which is why I had to buy this new one when I lost the remote during a move. I just want to point out that the free Kitchen subscription offer is stamped on this box too, even though I didn't pick that option when I checked out because it required me to put in subscription payment information right away. So yay.

I purchased this as a replacement for my old Firestick which was showing its age. It has proven to be much faster than the old one. However, it has one problem and that is it will sometimes go to sleep and can only be waked by unplugging the power supply and then replugging it. This is annoying.  I hope this doesn’t indicate a problem which will get worse in time.

Ok, this is a repackaged olde firestick from 2 years ago or so.No 4k and internal memory is a bit slowFine for those who want a spare stick for a spare tv in a RV or room.  1080p mode is fine and starts up in a decent amount of time.  I have had no memory issues so far.Recommend if it goes on sale.

I remember when things like this were in the 100's. It might not be the newest google home or the newest apple product, but I freakin' love it. Voice works great, apps are great, easy to install. Great product Amazon.I'm poor and live alone, but I imagine this would work amazing for side TVs such as kitchens, bathrooms, or bedrooms.

I’m so disappointed in this product!!!! I have used one of these in the past and it was great. So we ordered a new one and it was such a disappointment!!! I hooked it up by following the instructions and all steps. Once I did the fire stick kept rebooting. Then when I called support the stick function with no issues for 5 hrs and then started Rebooting every five minutes.Now due to this I’m seriously considering not using a fire stick again.

EDIT: Luna is now available. I wish my apps were easier to get to.If you dont need 4K or Luna, then this is the stick to get. The interface is snappy and have had no issues streaming. Huge upgrade coming from 1st gen. The main reason i got this was to use it for Luna, but it is only compatible with the 4K stick. So get that one for best/total experience.

I was hyped up about this firestick. I did the break n all that. The pic quality is at most alright. The constant freezing is absolutely horrible. Just imagine getting your popcorn out and favorite blanket, really getting into the movie and then....FREEZE, FREEZE, FREEZE, FREEZE. Yeah, sound awesome doesn't it. Just use Netflix, XboxLive, ect.

I got this to replace a two year old Roku Express . That unit was overheating where it was mounted under the tv, so we thought the stick would perform better and it was a good call.Super easy set up. Streaming speed is excellent, but my wireless modem is right underneath it. I did wish that the USB power cord would have sufficed, but the power coming out of that TV port was not sufficient. You can get them to ship you a hdmi extender for free if your port won't fit the stick( it's about 5 inches long I would reckon) best of all it came with a remote that automatically linked to my smart tv, so it controls power/ volume etc.Defintely worth the price.

We love this except for the problem we (an several others) experience when watching YouTube TV. It will go to the ads and then when the ads are over, it freezes and will not come back. Lately even when going completely out and going back in, it will not allow me to finish watching the program that I was watching. One day will be fine, then will go off for three or more day in a row.BTW, Amazon will not allow you to purchase more than three devices. No idea why not. I had to order from elsewhere for the rest of my TV's.

I needed to find a replacement for the streaming applications that I had been using through my Blu-Ray player. Wanted something that would allow for the software to be updated. The software in my Blu-Ray player was very rarely updated and while it worked the newer versions of the the Hulu, Netflix, and Prime apps available via the Roku Streaming Stick+ were very welcome. Software starts up much quicker than with the previous Blu-Ray player apps. Works well enough that I bought the 4k Ultra box for the TV in the living room to replace the Fire Stick. So far very happy with the performance of both this Streaming Stick+ and the 4k Ultra Box. The box is faster than the stick. Considering moving this stick to the guest room and putting a 4k Ultra Box in the bedroom to replace it. Even if I don't this stick works great. Thoroughly enjoying it.

Stick has been working great for a while, but recent updates have some apps suddenly rebooting and sometimes requires rebooting the stick. Not sure if these issues are specific to the apps or the stick.Overall a great buy for cord cutters - you can access things like Amazon video, which aren't accessible through Chromecast. Biggest drawbacks are the dated interface and inability to sync app authorizations across multiple Roku devices, the latter scenario requires you to authorize each app on each Roku device.One recommendation for Roku and other buyers - if you're putting this in a rear HDMI port on a wall mounted TV you'll need to purchase a separate, flexible HDMI extension so the stick can hang down flat against the wall.Update @ 1 Year:We've had a lot of issues with the audio going out of sync and the video automatically zooming in making shows unwatchable. Seems to only happen on the Hulu app, but that is one we use heavily in our household. I imagine that's a software issue, but I have to put it on Roku to get it fixed.Never had these problems with our other two, older Rokus.

I bought this for my mom, for Christmas.  She loves it! We got it plugged in,  and logged in to all of her subscriptions,  and it works great. We were especially happy with the voice search, which works extremely well!I was also pleasantly surprised to learn that you can use your tv's usb port to power it! That saves a lot of trouble when your surge protector is full.

I have Samsung smart TV and Amazon Fire Stick and TiVo and I've used all as an Operating System (OS) for my TV for streaming content from Netflix, Amazon Prime and PBS passport. The Roku OS is by far the best.1. it plugs into HDMI port on any TV and powers via the USB cable that also plugs into TV. So I can move it from bedroom TV to family room TV. Heck I could use in any hotel room.2. it uses 5 GHz wifi band for connecting to my wifi. I wanted that vs lower speed 2.4 GHz band3. has voice control. I use it for search. e.g., "Pixar movies". Then it shows me which streaming services have the Pixar movies (e.g., Netflix, Amazon Prime, ...) and I jump directly into that service to watch that movie.The Roku OS and interface updates often, so I'll get latest available. Better than using Smart TV OS, or streaming services via DVD or other devices.

DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY. I have 3 Amazon Fire TV sticks so I decided to give Roku a try to see if it’s better. What a horrible waste of my $50. Roku is not user-friendly at all. It is hard to hook up because you have to pair it with the TV. Navigating is a pain because it’s confusing. And most of all, it suddenly decided to stop working. So I called Customer Service but got none because of the pandemic. I don’t see why Roku doesn’t have IT people work from home. I have had no trouble at all with Amazon’s Fire Sticks.

When I tried to set this up, for some reason, it would not connect....said the account was locked.  When I contacted the phone number on the screen, it was from a company called WINSOC IT.  They said they were the official third party biller for Roku.  The phone number was 855-256-4555.  It is a SCAM!  Go to roku.com for help.  The website showed up as official-roku.com....they tried to explain it as a “registration” charge and was new billing as of October.  Nothing shows up on roku website.Great product, great streaming, but be careful when activating....

Worked great except it has to be plugged in to power and didn't work on USB to tv which in my case required a USB extension cord.  Don't use it without starting with the power cord and do use USB plug it comes with.  Great picture quality and sound and no lag or breaks in reception. Used an extension you can get for free from roku that drops it lower behind the tv to increase communication w the remote. The mute button on the remote is poorly placed as you hit it easily whenever using it for any of the face buttons. Should be on face. All other operations work well. Hated that it didn't have a choice of movie screening apps for one button access. Not as easy to set up as expected unless you do it exactly right at first try and don't have to start over...

This is one of those pieces of tech that works well out of the box. I set it up in a few minutes and was easily able to pair with my harmony universal remote. The remote it comes with is very simple and works well; added bonus it automatically recognizes the TV so the volume and power buttons work without programming. I needed something for HBO max and Disney plus mostly as my tivo doesn't have that option, but will certainly try for other services and will probably try apple+ since there is a 3 month trial offered. All in all great product and glad I did some research before settling on this one.

I love the Roku interface.  It's simple and straight to the point which I appreciate.My main complaint though would be the voice remote.  It is poorly designed and for me completely useless.  If you want to find out if a certain movie is streaming on one of your installed apps, ROKU's voice function will not help you with that.  It will only take you to where you can rent or buy the searched for movie.  It does not help you search for anything.  It is only there to help roku make money.Amazon's fire stick & Apple TV's voice remotes work as expected.  They show you which streaming service has what you are looking for as well as other excellent search functions.

Lot of free movies(old), some free news channels and lot of free streaming apps. The stick is a very slick and compact. Works with the power from TV's USB. It's 4k but I use it with 1080p TV and video and sound quality is excellent. As long as apps continue to provide updates and support this device, I will have no regrets. Roku customer support is good. Few things that don't work well:1. Inbuilt screen mirroring to mirror videos from windows laptop or iPhone does not work well.2. The remote is not very good. Needs new batteries every 2 months.3. Sometimes the home screen does not respond to remote button press during start-up. After couple of retries, it works and continues to work normally thereafter.

I got this for my mother for Christmas. She isn't very techy but recently learned about streaming, so I wanted her to have an easy way to browse for shows (without needing to call me every time). If she can't figure it out with this, she just can't figure it out!There's buttons on the remote for Hulu, Disney, Netflix and Roku, voice commands, home button, back button. And on the home screen there is a "free" section where she can browse for things to watch that are included in my subscriptions. It also allowed me to customize the channels shown on her home page, which let me remove anything she didn't need and add things I thought she'd use. She was super excited!

My first experience with Roku was on a TCL TV, I was amazed at how easy it was to navigate and how well it works.  I bought my first Streaming Stick + to use with our projector, which we usually use in the backyard.  Previously we had either used a laptop connected by HDMI or a Chromecast, this is a much easier and better option.We have an older AppleTV and I think these are easier to use and have almost as many apps available.  With the latest update you can now use Airplay with these as well.  The only thing you lose is the ability to watch content you purchased on iTunes, which isn’t that much for us.  For the price these simply cannot be beat!

DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO USE THE REMOTES!We bought 2 Streaming Stick+ on Black Friday. We don't watch more than 20 hours of TV a week on 2 TVs. We are now at our 3rd set of batteries in each remote. I hardly had to replace the batteries in the old remotes. Thankfully I'm sending this back within the return window. I will just go back to the older Roku sticks till I find a better replacement.

This is the 3rd Roku Streaming device that I have purchased and I have been happy with all three. Very easy setup and I was watching within minutes.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because of the extra channel buttons on the remote control. Apparently, the extra channel buttons at the bottom of the remote (Netflix, SlingTV, Directv, etc.) are RANDOMLY different. I was expecting to get the remote shown in the picture with Netflix, SlingTV, Directv and Hulu buttons but, instead of a Hulu button, I got an ESPN button (ew, yuck!) I hate sports of any kind and would rather die than watch any type of sports channel. So, having an ESPN button on my Roku remote is just a waste of space. Plus, it just annoys me to have to look at it.

I bought this as a gift for a friend who has a weak router.  It picks up the WiFi signal (incl 5Ghz band) and streams smoothly.  Note that several other Roku products don't support 5Ghz, and if you live near other people, old 2.4Ghz band can get congested and flaky.  This one advertises it's more sensitive WiFi antenna and that seems to be a valid claim based on what I can see.Otherwise, it is a Roku, which is a fine, no subscription, and low cost alternative to AppleTV or other similar TV and streaming devices. A little heavy on the ads (unobtrusive mostly, and only when you're picking a service, doesn't affect the streaming content in any way).
There's nothing wrong with Roku, but at the end of the day we prefer the interface of the fire stick.

I had two of these, one a present, one I purchased. One stopped at 5 months the other stopped at 5 1/2. This seems to be a common problem with these. They were very warm to the touch when in use. Most likely the heat is causing an early breakdown. I tried looking into warranty or service, without help. I do think it is poorly engineered, and the company knows it.It worked fine for us when it was new, but the short life made it a poor choice.Updated 5-12-19, I did get both devices working again, after restarting internet connection, the router and going thru the entire setup for the Roku stick again. Now both work fine. Why the last restart worked, but others did not, is a mystery to me. I changed my rating from the 1 star to 3 because of this.

Overall, Im happy with this product. The one gripe I have is that Roku doesnt include an HDMI adapter for these streaming sticks.  The Roku stick is long and most newer TVs have this concaved back where the HDMI inputs are.  So this Roku stick will not plug in and fit properly.  You need an HDMI adapter/extender.  The manual states that you can order it for free and it arrives within a few days.  But why is it NOT INCLUDED to begin with?  Also, the part that they provided does not even work.  I dont know if it fails to convert HDCP 2.2 through the extender, but the Roku stick would not get detected by my TV as an HDMI source.  I created my own extender using a regular HDMI cable and attached an HDMI coupler to it, and that worked well.  This is the reason why I gave it 4 stars.  If Roku addresses this, it would have been 5 stars easily.

Very simple, basic, inexpensive version. Useful if, like me, you want to add another unit cheaply to a very small TV in a room you only watch in sporadically. In that case, the picture not being HD isn’t very noticeable and if the volume has to be controlled by the TV remote, so what? Perfect price pint for what it is.

So I bought all 3 versions of the fire sticks. The light, for stick and the ultra.Regarding the lite version it’s just as good as the other ones except it doesn’t have the control that also controls the TV. The new controller. That’s really the only difference I noticed. I use this for my daughter’s room. Works well
Half the time there is no sound, not sure what that is about. We have to turn the whole thing off and load it back again 2-3 times to get the sound to play with the video.

for Prime members, of course. It has been a few years since my 1st gen Fire TV. It offers the same look and easy navigation but much snappier performance.  Wi-Fi connection is more stable and reliable. Remote control works as it should be. This device will simply turn your older TVs (with HDMI input) into smart TVs.
This was very easy to install.  Works just as expected.  Great assortment of apps.  Speed is great for streaming movies, watching Youtube and V-live!  Great purchase!

As long as your cognizant of the fact (and it's not like they are hiding it) that it doesn't control the TV this is a little hidden gem.The difference in speed/performance between this "lite" version and my non-4k fire stick is not even comparable. Huge upgrade and I got it at a great price.Recommended.

This product has worked very well for my family. I love the parental controls to keep my kids from being able to open apps or make purchases without my permission. It’s very user friendly, my six year old is already a pro. You can’t control the volume of the tv with the fire stick remote on this model, which for me is not an issue at all, but if that does matter to you I would consider going with the regular fire stick and not the lite. Alexa seems to have great voice recognition again, my six year old can use this function with no issue to have her play music and open apps. Overall a great purchase and you can’t beat it for the price
1st  time fire user love it

I had some sort of issue between this item, a Fire Blaster and and Echo 5. Called and spoke to one service person and she "didn't know how to update something and then the next guy thought he was a comedian and I still have the same problem.  Regrettably decision and I am returning all the stuff, that isn't funny.

I tried all of the AV sync settings and no matter which one I choose, it goes out of sync. It works fine with apps like Netflix, HBOmax, etc. However, watching Amazon shows & movies, it goes out of sync within 5 minutes or less. Congratulations Amazon for producing a device that won't work for your own original content.

i use this as a stand alone product to stream stremio exclusively, so it is essentialy a portal for unlimited free movies and shows in HD, making it the only product in its price range able to do that. At this point, if you pay a cable bill or subscribe to any streaming services, you are a chump. Sorry not sorry.

I wanted to love my fire tv stick, and when I first installed it I was impressed.  About every other day it will simply freeze, requiring that I disconnect power, and then restart it.  I returned the original to Amazon, thinking it was a fluke.  The replacement unit they sent me does the same thing.  I spent an hour on the phone with tech support, and they could not  get it working reliably.Its a nice idea, but buggy.

I purchased this to use with my projector and the price was much lower than Roku. It was a simple set up. Basically plug and play. Works great with the projector. I’ve used Roku devices for years and I personally find the navigation easier and visual display a notch better than the Firestick. Works great though.

Be sure to adjust your privacy in settings. There are YouTube videos to show how to do this. This device works well turns any tv with hdmi inputs into a smart tv. Good to use in hotel room tv when traveling. Works anywhere as long as your account is good and you have Wifi. Maybe hotspot can work, never tried it

Alexa voice was easy to set with just a few steps. The voice recognition feature is a plus and it’s also works good with Alex if you have that in your home. Just pair to access all the smart features very good buy would advise to get the remote with the volume buttons it’s about 10 dollars more worth it in the end. Other than that works great

Hope they didn't mess things up, on PURPOSE !!! Last 1 I had worked fine for YEARS, got VERY buggy & stuttered ALOT. Got this 1 & now every thing works fine.ALEXA app: it NEVER shuts off & do NOT like that some thing is always listening to me !!!!! Their is NO option for it to sleep, when not being used.

Love the ability to quickly search for any artist or song that I'm interested in - provides good information on the searches - is a breeze to use - not sure what I did without it - sure beats trying to use a remote to select a character at a time to perform a search - was easy to set-up and install on the TV.  Love it.
Could not successfully pair the remote.  I’m guessing it’s a technical glitch with his new firestick.  Extremely disappointed.  Should have bought the 4khd model.

I bought this for my wife because of the voice remote. The Fire Stick Lite was easy to set up. Plug and play. I also got it because the wife wanted Discovery +. The remote is easy to use. Not complicated, Which is good for her because she doesn't like technology. Happy wife happy life. Glad I made this purchase.

Very Slow Load time (compared to Roku stick) often not loading at all.Built-in HDMI Cable too short. Sensor is handing in the back of TV ports.Requires dedicated power from wall (can’t use weak USB port from TV)Remote control is hard to use (too few functions. Need more buttons for navigation)

Not a good start.  The "UP" direction on the 4-way rocker switch was bad upon arrival so they're sending me an entirely new stick and remote.  I also noticed that when I came back to the device after a 12-hour idle period it just sat there on its screen saver and failed to respond no matter which button I pressed.  I guess it was deep in REM sleep.  Finally after about 1 minute of this nonsense it did start to work again.  I don't know if this is how it's supposed to work or not but I've never had these kind of problems with any of my four Amazon Fire TV sticks.  I'll try the replacement they send but I have a feeling I'll be returning it too and just getting another Fire TV stick.  Too bad!

Remote is wonk..refuses to work properly..Roku support says it will not work properly on roku TV can damage the TV.  I only bought this because my TV would not support Apple TV. well this would not either on a Roku TV.  it does work on non roku TV but ......you cannot change to cable from the roku remote..it is not an option..The Roku remote doesn't work properly..does not always work on side arrow buttons..it over heats...it stops working..unplug try again tomorrow..what a waste when not working...when it works it is ok other than the remote is not fully functional all the time..better to spend and get a cheap smart tv

I am real happy with this purchase. This stick does get warm, not an issue, and it's a bit long. If you have a TV that won't give you the length to clear the TV then you will need an adapter cable. Wasn't a problem on my Magnavox 1080p. This stick very much improves the resolution on the set, above what the TV is capable of! I was blown away by it. I downloaded the xfinity app as I have their service, but the voice remote is useless to call up channels with it using the xfinity app. It works fine on the roku app, but nothing else to date I have tried will work using the voice control on the remote. I can turn tv on by pressing just about any button BUT the power button on the remote, but the power button will shut it off just fine. I don't know why the power button won't do both. These are the reasons for the loss of a star on versatility. Still though, all in all, saving $$$$ on not paying rent for a box for the bedroom I bought it for, combined with the fact that it improves the picture quality so much, it's a sure bet to purchase!

Bought this Roku Stick after finding out my Samsung 4K TV was old enough that the integrated app store on it was out of date and didn't have new apps on it. I use this now and have the USB powered by the 3.0 hub the TV has. I like that it turns on the TV so no need for the original remote. We have noticed (this is very seldom) that a message will appear in the top right corner and say the Roku is overheating. This message might stay for less than 5 minutes and go away. The Roku has never shutdown from it though. Not sure why it does that as the stick has adequate ventilation behind it. This does have a better processor being the 4K version and it is lightning fast when switching between apps/channels.

Haven't cut the cable cord yet. This Roku is amazing! So many channels, I cant believe it! Have this hooked up to tv in the garage. No problems with reception. My router is all the way at the back of the house in our back bedroom. The extended range feature is well worth the money. So much to see and not knowing where to began. Love it!!! Highly recommend! Tried digital antenna. Forget it! Roku is the answer! Easy setup. It takes a while to set up because you choose what you want in channels. Well worth the effort! Do yourself a favor and get one for yourself. The voice remote is outstanding! ENJOY.

My Roku delivered yesterday and I got it set up last night. We have one Roku TV already so I was able to sign in to our Roku account which really simplified things. The setup did take a while but it got all the channels we already had downloaded on our other tv which was awesome. I was NOT asked to pay an activation fee; it actually said at one point, (not word for word) that Roku will not ask for an activation fee. So far so good!UPDATE AFTER ONE WEEK OF USE: Everything is working great except I seem to have to be within like 5 feet of the tv to use the volume or power buttons so that’s kind of annoying.

I’ve had several streaming devices and I always come back to Roku. I wanted a new 4K device and saw this one at Amazon. So I picked it up. Just like all other Rokus I’ve had it Waes super simple to setup and like to Hulu, PS Vue and other content providers. The UI is quick and I like it better than other streamers (sorry Amazon Fire TV). The only drawback I see is you have to use the provided mini-USB power cable as it has a built in antenna for WiFi. You can not use any old mini-USB you have around the house, and if this one breaks I have to go back to Roku to get another. But, that aside, it’s a great device and works just great.

I switched from Direct TV to You Tube TV. I purchased 4 Roku Streaming Stick Plus sticks, one for each TV. I decided on these over other streaming sticks because they were the most affordable and had the highest ratings.I am super impressed on how easy they were to set up and use.  They have great WiFi speed with no buffering. My Samsung smart tv’s often buffer especially while watching 4K programs, but not these Roku’s.  They offer great performance and value.  You Tube TV is pretty awesome also.

Works awesome. Simple easy to use.  But it doesn't have a TV tile on the home screen.  My other roku TV has the TV tile on the home screen.But this does not have the TV tile to select on the home screen.  You have to change the "source" and come out of the hdmi source and enter the TV source.Other than that.  I love the fact that you can use the roku remote for the TV as well!  This one has the power button and mute button. Other models don't.  This was a deal breaker for me.I like this one.  It can use dual bands of wifi as well.

This product is well designed and an upgrade from my first model that enables off/on and volume control which eliminates the need to use two remotes. The picture quality and versatility are excellent.....when it works correctly.  For whatever reason, accessing Hulu or any other streaming service almost always requires that I turn it on, then shut it down and turn it on again.  Even more frustrating, often once on the first time, it becomes difficult to shut down.  It often takes 3 or 4 minutes to turn it on and secure access to Hulu.  I've tried all of the reset requirements, none seem to help.  My frustration is there is no help to fix it.  I'm likely to return the upgrade and go back to the 2 remote program, which worked fabulously.

I love that the Fire TV Stick Lite comes with so many choices!  It seems like there is an endless selection of what I want to watch next.  The Alexa integration is a very nice convenience as well.  Though this Stick did not come with a remote, that's not a drawback for me since I already had more than I needed.

I have been thinking of getting this for awhile. I received the lite version as Christmas gift and have been enjoying it. Do think having the regular firestick with the full TV control would be convenient but really I can access the same content and am pleased I'm finally getting all my prime benefits.

Plugged it in. Got stuck for about an hour on updates. Once I finally got it working every app that I tried to use played for a minute or 2 then froze. Backed out and went back in and same thing happened. It would be different if I hadn’t paid for these apps. Don’t waste your money on apps or this device.

The Fire TV stick was very easy to set up.  New screens are brought up faster than my old stick without time outs.  My only complaint is poor picture quality for a few minutes when starting a new program.  After a few moments, the picture clears up.  Sound quality is very good.  Very satisfied with my purchase.
I don't have to talk too much about Amazon's productsExcellent product , super fast .I love the bluetooth remote and it's microphone it's so cool .Highly recommended

Able to run an Android APK of OpenVPN and stream from home NAS media server remotely without buffering issues on an adequate internet connection. Additionally, this Fire Stick is able to handle intermediate login pages for hotel WiFi making this is a great device for streaming from your preferred services and a NAS back home while you're traveling.

The thing I enjoy most about the firestick is the ability to get almost any streaming app I desire. Dish Anywhere app is available on Amazon firestick. For any of you that have Dish Network as your television provider, you can stream from your hopper, live tv, your recordings, and even on demand right to your phone, tablets, or Amazon firestick. When ever I travel I always bring mine with me and plug it into my hotel tv. I then have the ability to watch the programming I subscribe to and I can also stream Amazon Prime, Netflix, and many others. Amazon has been able to make my viewing and streaming needs far more accessible and hassle free.

I've had this for 3 months and recently it's been glitching a LOT. Every day. Multiple times a day. I would say its biggest flaw is the fact that you can't turn it off. You can put it to sleep but the device never has time to reset. That is, until you've had it 3 months and you have to unplug it multiple times a day.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I got my first fire stick in November and it worked for a while. Then it started logging me off my apps or programs. Sometimes it would buffer forever. I would plug it, unplug it, restart it, update it and so on... sometimes it would let me hear the sound of a show but show either no image or a frozen image. I called customer service and they told me to return it with all the pieces except with the controller so I did. I got my “new” later than expected, without a power cord or extension cord. I tried it with another cord I have at home and it won’t start... I wish I could get my money back...

The device itself is a decent replacement for cost/cable cutting, but the Fire software could use work.Built in Web DVR works but doesn't always record scheduled shows and requires you to delete old watched programs and movies twice in order to fully get rid of them on your screen.UI is clumsy, finding shows and movies is awkward, (unless you use Alexa) and frankly just an overly-complicated mess.Most importantly; We frequently have to reset (Power Cycle) the device due to a black screen.No KTLA, no Comedy Central, and a few others, but nothing that would prevent me from buying it again....

I bought this because of VUDU! I love VUDU and have all my movies from there. The only thing bad about this highly priced 4K streaming stick is that it doesn't include an HDMI extender! Why? Because my Samsung TV's have an indent where the HDMI ports are located. This stick is too long to fit, thus, an HDMI extender was needed for me to use this stick.The $10 cheaper, Amazon Fire 4K stick comes with an HDMI extender. So, I just assumed since this is its competitor device, that this would include one also. It didn't. Had to acquire my own HDMI extender :(Outside of that, it's a great streamer, if you need one that has VUDU (which the Amazon Fire 4K stick didn't have).

At first I couldn't figure out how to use it but I called Samsung, and it plugs in the back of the tv and I then attached the 4 inch wire that came with it to the stick and plugged the other end in to the closest plug.  It works great.  I have no Idea how to use voice recognition or Alexa integration.  I am a retired Lady, and not very tech. I am happy with this new (to me) type of Roku and picture quality.

This is the third Roku device that I've purchased, and it is considerably better than the two previous versions that were purchased years ago. Voice recognition works reasonably well. Easy setup. I find that I don't have to be as concerned about recording programs anymore, that I want to watch later, since all the network channels provide free streaming if those channels are included in your paid cable or satellite package.

I replaced my old Roku Streaming Stick with this "Plus" model after upgrading my TV to a 4K projector. The interface is exactly the same, but is MUCH faster. Almost no lag loading apps, and menus are instantaneous. Voice recognition works well, and audio and video quality are great.My only complaint is with the 4:2:0  video compression detracting from subtle details like skin tones and skies. There is an option to use 4:2:2, but I think the real issue is that the streaming services are sending them in 4:2:0, so up-scaling them back to 4:2:2 does no good...in any case, I don't think I can blame Roku for this, and from normal viewing distances it's not really all that noticeable anyway...but on a 100+ inch screen, you don't have to get very close to notice it.

I put a tv on our patio and was worried about running cable through the walls (brick). Such a fuss!  I read on all the different streaming devices and chose the Roku because it has an Xfinity app which is our cable provider. We can now sit on the patio and watch all of our channels and no wires through the wall!  Also, the Roku just plugs into the USB on the tv!  No need for a power supply but I’m glad it came with one and you didn’t have to pay extra for it!  I plan on getting another for our projector to have movie night in the back yard!I had trouble at first getting a solid connection to the internet. Signal would drop and movies would pause to buffer. I decided to upgrade my router. Wow!  Big difference!  It wasn’t the Roku at all!  The Nighthawk router cured that. Will also do my review on the Nighthawk too!The stream stick is larger than most but I had no problem using a different HDMI port. However, if you do have problems with plugging it up, they will send you an HDMI cable for free. So, either way, you’re covered.About the apps- yes, I bought the Roku because it has an app from my cable provider. Yet, that doesn’t mean that you can’t use it if you’re not with Xfinity. There are plenty other cable tv apps available!  Additionally, you can simply load the channel app that you want. I also enjoy the free tv apps like Pluto TV. Older movies but good ones and plenty to choose from!A built in web browser would make this unit complete!  Still won’t prevent a 5 star rating, though. I have used old desktops for years to connect to projectors and TV’s in my home and shop. The space savings is incredible - going from a desktop to a device the size of a USB jump drive!!  Not to mention the power savings!!We love it!

I mostly got this for private listening. It works perfectly. That was the most important thing to me. The headphones I use pair well with my phone, so that part is where people would have problems. I really like that I can put apps that I only had in my tablet, some that didn't have casting ability on app, so now I can watch anything I want on the TV, and without disturbing sleeping people. There is also an option to level volume. So those super loud intros aren't so much louder than the show your watching. I haven't tried the voice search, since I usually only watch late at night and don't want to disturb people, so I can't comment on that. My TV supplies enough power to the stick even when off. If you look at the light and it's green it does, and if it's red it does not.

We bought a new 4K smart TV.  You would think a plug in streaming device wouldn’t be necessary with a new smart TV.  But no... our operating system is based on android and they haven’t figured out how to play nicely with Apple, so we were forced into buying an add on streaming device.  We had a first generation Roku device which was just marginal.  This new Roku 4K streaming stick is a huge improvement.  Excellent 4K picture quality and HDR.  Easy set up and comes with a great remote.  I was shocked at how much content is  available.  Somewhere down the road I am sure we will cut ties with our cable provider.

Plugged into HDMI input to my Samsung TV first, worked great. I'm only watching free shows, and signed up without a credit card on the Roku site. But it was a hassle to switch to the HDMI input to the TV, since I usually use my Marantz to watch DVD/Blu-Ray and my DVR for free Over-The-Air shows from my antenna. So I unplugged the HDMI from the TV, and plugged it into the HDMI input for Cable in the back of the Marantz. It has been working perfectly for several days now, and my remote lets me switch between them all. My only regret is losing the DVR functionality I have with my OTA reception - setting up recordings in advance, pause/play/skip capability, and having copies of things I recorded while I was doing other things.

I have to reset my ROKU almost daily. Everything will be playing fine and then, without any warning,  the audio gurgles and echos.  I have to go into the settings for the ROKU and reset it. I also have issued with lip sync. I use the forward button for 2-3 frames and the lip sync is good. I tried this with the gurgling issue, but it does not help. in fact, no matter how far I go forward, when I reset the ROKU and restart my program it starts where the audio started actin up. Even if I have gone 10 minutes more into the show. Not happy. I am beyond the return window. so I have a $59 light paper weight. When I do rest the ROKU the screen says it does not have enough power even though it is plugged directly into the wall. When the ROKU does come back on the screen, it is dead. Just keep pressing the over button to get to the app you want. Eventually it will work. I guess I will have to try Amazon Fire and see if it is any better. I have been in contact with Roku and they say try these fixes. I have tried all the fixes except buying a new TV to see if it has issues on it. Their customer service is horrible.

Already own another 2 of these devices, purchased this one to be a travel bag throw in so I can watch my streaming apps regardless of where I'm staying and not having to go through my phone or laptop to get to Netflix/Disney+/ESPN+/Hulu and what not.  These sticks are also great to replace the dated roku or Samsung smart apps built in on tvs that are no longer getting updates to apps.  Highly recommend this product.

Although this Fire TC stick lite includes all the feature like the other Fire devices. But this one is extremely slow. Especially it updated last month, the App list is empty. To launch a third party app, it needs to go to app setting and find the app, to launch it. It's absolute not like what it describes in the product page.

Sound randomly stops working, remote also randomly stops working. We even got an exchange from Amazon and it does the same thing. Not worth trying another exchange as they tell you to restart it etc, things I have already tried before reaching out to customer service. Our old fire stick works fine. Not sure what the problem it but we will just keep restarting it when he have problems and hope it keeps working

Absolute garbage. Contacted Amazon support and they said I had a faulty fire stick. Sent it back and they sent a replacement TWICE and neither worked. Starts up fine and Amazon apps work great but if you try to use any other apps or streaming service you are sol. Apps have all been updated and data cleared uninstalled and reinstalled and still nothing. Think I might go buy an Apple TV or Roku for less hassle.

the Alexa remote works great. You can turn off the TV, but you can't use Alex to  turn it on. In some channels I have to crank up the volume, not sure why. A great feature, is that it doesn't get overheated like my Roku, because it is plugged in back of your TV via the USB. Overall, I'm very happy with it and soon Prime Amazon members will get HBOMax added for free

Thought I was getting a good deal on a 1080p streaming stick and coming from Amazon, I had decent expectations like for the device to ACTUALLY WORK. It did not, instead it was stuck on the unable to update screen after connecting it to my Wifi. It seems like this is a widespread issue a lot of people with this product are having yet no solution has been offered by Amazon. Even after following every troubleshooting guide, third-party forum, and discussed with Amazon Device Support team, it was still a useless paperweight. They issued me a refund, but its ridiculous that a product as popular as this has such a basic and common problem amongst so many people, "budget" option or not.

I do like the ease of set up of the fire stick. I was able to find everything I was looking for and add all the other streaming services with ease. I have been using the product for three weeks now and noticed sometimes it doesn’t respond, almost as if the batteries are not working. I have changed them and it still does this. Eventually it will respond but it does have that fault. My daughters works fine. Maybe I just got a defective one?

If you have a remote with your TV, then save some money and buy the Firestick Lite. The exact same remote without volume. Easy to install, works great. Sound quality is better streaming from my Wi-Fi than my blue ray player. Picture quality Perfect!! No interruptions easy to see what you get and what is extra $$.

This is the lite version. It does not have volume control on this remote.  So far it works ok. I am still trying to figure out how to fast forward and rewind while watching shows. It was easy to set up and the picture quality is great. If you purchase one be sure to have it linked to your account before it ships. It makes the setup easy.

All it does is fire tv, which is fine for me. I can't "judge" how it does w/ Alexa itegration or voice control because the Fire TV Lite does not have that, so why is Amazon asking me to "judge" it. Not sure. I have a TV remote for TV and I don't have alexa components in the house so I didn't buy the more advanced Fire TV stick. The Lite does well and I'm happy with it. Would I buy it again - Yes.

I wish I didn’t have to use these but that’s what happens when you have vizio tv’s. Only issue is that I have to reset it quite often. Not sure why I use it every day but I keep getting error saying it’s not connected to internet but it is. Troubleshooting online says if it’s off for a long time you get this error. Dunno

First time Roku owner and skeptical over the product setup and usage.  Set up was amazingly easy and ordering other streaming content is a breeze.  Found reviews that recommended using the outlet power to keep power to Roku powered up to avoid constant booting when power is removed.  The Roku does tend to get warm so an HDMI extention cabe is A MUST.  I have been DELERIOUSLY happy with the prchase and look forward to purchasing more units!

Upgraded from a 3 or 4 year old 29.99 basic stick which became slow in response to functions.  Internet performance was good - not the problem.
