Saw the ad for the stick+ frp, Amazon, got it within a few days.installation was a snap and performance terrific.  Voice command works well.  Am happy with the unit.Miles Levy / Virginia Veach,  Va. (New YorkTransplant in 2002)

My girl set it up for are little one. Said it was supper easy and worked as should. We got a roku tcl tv so we are familiar with the interface. I have used vizio and Samsung smart tv and can say from experience roku has a far better set up and quality. Quality of the stream depends 100% on your internet and if any physical objects can interfere. Dont blame roku if your internet isn't good and you want to stream 4k. Thats your fault.

This is now my 3rd roku, of all different generations. In short they all work very well and I'm a big fan of the new stick approach. One thing to note is that the product gives the option for a USB or outlet powered use. As the instructions indicate, a red light will illuminate and a notification will present on the screen if the USB does not have enough power. However, I find this is  also potentially a temporary problem as the TV starts up and starts feeding power to the device. After about a minute or so, this message disappears and the device works as normal. While your results may vary, if you are pressed to find an outlet and have a a little older Samsung lcd TV, in my experience it's only a minute or so, tops, before the TV is able to power the device. That said, it may function a bit better with even more power via an outlet, however I have had no issues yet.

This has been super easy to use so far. Really simple plug and play, I even used the USB port on the back of my TV to power it and haven't had any issues yet (Samsung nu6900, if you're wondering). It detected 4k HDCP and hasn't given me any problems yet, but I've had it less than a day so I'll update if I come across any issues.The remote has a nice sturdy feel when you "click" the buttons, but I haven't used the voice option yet (and probably won't, tbh). I'm amazed at all the free content. My main reason for getting this was for HD streaming, but also because there's a Wow Presents Plus app. I was using my Chromecast to access that before, but the Chromecast is so moody and relies on my phone. It was always losing the wifi connection too. The Roku has a 2G and 5G wifi, which is exactly what my Spectrum router offers. I'm a convert so far.

I had a little difficulty installing at 1st but I think it was me trying to rush installation.  It is plug and play but you need about 30 min to let everything upgrade, locate in install your wifi and such.  If you hurry it won't connect properly.  It took me two attempts but the 2nd time around I took a seat and let it do all it's installation without immediately jumping into the next step.  That time installed perfectly and when you hit the remote button TV turns right on connected to everything.  So love this thing just can be a little difficult to install

Sent two usb cable instead of the HDMI cable. ( factory pack defect)Had to pay extra to buy correct cable.Also buy HDMI extender to keep from overheating! Also not in the box!I called the customer support on the extender cable and was told to buy my own extender cableIt working ok since I purchased and installed missing cable.

These things are amazing. We have 4 primary TVs (and 3 in the kids bedrooms that they use w/ DVD players only), and 2 are really newer smart Roku-based Smart TV's...and even they are not as fast as these Roku Streaming+ Sticks. We upgraded two "other" larger TVs (in the guest room & upstairs living room) after completely switching to streaming TV (vs land line AT&T TV), and by god I could not be happier. Each unit was easy to install / supports virtually all streaming applications / is super fast / and the thing even automatically programs itself to control the volume & power of your TV (on the included Roku remote) *automatically*. Wow, is all I can say. Upgrade your old TVs, or even newer TVS (any TV older than one year with an HDMI port) with this thing. You won't regret it.

Oh happy day ! ! ! !  Roku is awesome! I should of done this " a week from last Tuesday." I recently cancelled my cable TV as it wasn't worth the $100. bucks a month I was spending on it.  It was so disappointing , most everything offered I didn't want to watch anyway, besides I needed to cut expenses.  With Roku, ( a ONE TIME affordable cost,) the free channels and my Amazon Prime membership offer me everything I could want, and more!  Amazon Prime has some great movies and shows to watch , as good or better than Netflicks, HBO, etc.  There is no downside to this, as long as you have a good wireless internet you are good to go! Added plus- it is easy-peasy to set up.

Please note there is a scam that will redirect you to a site that will charge you to connect your Roku box.  Please ensure you entered the exact URL you see on your screen when you are setting up the box.  ROKU will NOT charge you to setup the box.This streaming stick is incredible.  you can rid yourself of multiple remotes and just have one remote that operates our TV and streaming.The buttons that take you straight to SLING and net flicks are very nice.The rage of this remote is incredible.  I can adjust my TV  from across the house.Overall its a great buy

DONT BUY A ROKU this is 1000 times better ... Works fast and good ... Pluto, roku channels, tubi, dbmi tv, cartoon network, and so many more but those are the good free ones i recommend  you can look up any movie in search and it will tell you if you can watch it for free or give you a list of places that you can rent or buy... BUT PHILO is only 20 bucks a month and 63 channels and you can get it on 3 devices plus DVR all your favorite shows and on demand just putting that out there ...

I'm on my 8th fire stick since 2016.  I have bought a disproportionate amount of fire sticks in the last year.  They have become more glitchy and last around half the time they once did.  Only thing that changed during this time was that I upgraded my Internet to a faster speed with the same company.

I don't think the light has enough "juice" for my tv or internet speed... It hangs up a LOT or makes me restart. It reminds me of when ur playing a DVD but it gets stuck on the same spot. Wish my daughter would have bought me the next better. It might be how in addition to the 3 or 4 channels I want it makes me load the Disney channel and others I don't want. 😕

Bought this to replace my Roku.  My main use is for AT&T TV and I found this does not provide a small preview window in fast forward or reverse so I  have to guess at the time remaining to skip commercials.  It may be a function of the AT&T app, but the window is there in Roku.  There is a fast forward window in Netflix so the stick would seem to have that capability.  I also prefer the Roku home screen which is cleaner, showing only my installed apps.I also have issues with the remote buttons spaced too closely together so it is too easy to press the wrong button, especially the bottom button instead of the play button.A positive is to be able to tell Alexa to open an app.

After you install it, you will have to do power cycle because the firestick loses connection. You have to remove the USB cord from the HDMI and the batteries from the remote for 1 minute.  When you reconnect it will work again. Hopefully its just a time thing, I will change rating if it is continuous.

got for my kitchen area TV . Not a smart TV . But with firestick it is now ! All entertainment venues , web access , streaming , and screen cast are now just a click of the remote . Completely satisfied . Not using for Alexa home integration . But I would presume it would perform just as admirably .

It's somewhat confusing when trying to determine what is free and what has a price attached to it. It's almost as if the bottom line is the last thing you're informed about. The item needs an instruction booklet included that informs the purchaser how to navigate using the devise.Mostly what we've used it for at this point is music selections. We've found that very rewarding.

I have been using my Fire TV Lite for about a week now and it looks great I like the new look of it and easy control to apps but the volume just stop working every time I turn it off.  I have to unplug it for 10-30 sec and it starts back up.  I don't freeze up like the older one I have so that a plus.

I cannot believe it has taken me this long to buy one. Now I can enjoy Amazon Prime and Netflix on my kitchen TV. Unfortunately my verizon internet service sucks at certain timed during the day resulting in picture freezing and poor picture quality during the these times. Otherwise the picture is good.

Form a low price this made all the difference to my older TV. Fire TV adds so many advantages to a older less than super smart TV. The streaming apps are better designed and work better with richer interfaces.  And the voice control makes it easy to get to the program you want to watch. Set up is easy.

This generation of Roku Stick is much improved over previous generations with a smooth and seamless integration with the smart TV. Now, the Roku can control the TV's volume! Because the stick is powered by a USB cord, it can be powered off of the TV's USB ports resulting in a clean and hidden installation. The smart TV and the Roku function as one seamless unit after install.This is the best generation Roku yet.

I had grown sick and tired of Directv, after AT&T had merged with them, despite a 20 year relationship.  Before I left them I ordered one of these Roku Streaming Stick+ units to try streaming.  In addition to free streaming channels I tried Playstation Vue and Sling Blue as my subscription services.  The installation was easy in my system, the hardest part being setting up the various accounts and passwords and that wasn't very hard at all.The Roku passed the test with flying colors.  The picture and audio quality have been awesome on my 4K system.  I have had one or two dropouts, but that was prior to me receiving the Roku OS 8 upgrade.We have since purchased a second Roku for the bedroom, cancelled Directv and are saving $50+ per month.  We are very happy with the unit and the results.

I bought this for one reason and one reason only - I wanted to watch our Vudu movies with Dolby Atmos on our Samsung MU8000 TV and HW-K850 soundbar.  I couldn't do this with the Vudu app on our Sony Blu-Ray or the Vudu App on the Samsung TV.  I got tired of waiting and waiting, so I just bought this.  After all, I bought the sound bar for Atmos and the only way I could do this is with a UHD disc and since I don't buy discs anymore, this makes this quite difficult to play movies in Atmos.It works pretty good for this - why pretty good?  The Vudu app is glitchy on Roku.  If I preview movies, the sound will cut out entirely and I have to power off everything and back on or I can cycle the soundbar through various sources until I get back to the source connected to the Streaming Stick.  Either way, it is a major pain.  If I fast forward, rewind or do anything else, the sound may cut out and I have to revert to one of the two solutions mentioned.  Once a movie starts with Atmos, it will usually continue to play in Atmos without an issue.The only workaround I found and this is not a good one, is to change the sound settings in Roku to stereo, preview the movies I am interested in, make up my mind (which can take a while, something which my wife can attest to), change the Roku sound settings back to Dolby XXX+++ (just made that up) and select the movie and hope to god the streaming doesn't pause and cause my Atmos to go out.I don't know if this is Vudu's issue, Roku's issue, or if this issue can only be solved by the god of thunder, but it is highly annoying.  Please somebody fix this and I will bump my rating to 5 stars!

Installed the latest one on my mom's TV. I new it would not fit by itself in the recessed slot on her TV so I ordered a six inch hdmi extension dongle at the same time. Installed easy and works great.Update 9/2019: Bought another one for a new 4k TV and is awesome. Picture is outstanding and wifi enabled remote works fantastic - no pointing, just use it. Ended up attaching the stick to an hdmi extension to move it away from the hdmi interference from the TV in order for the remote to work well. Not Roku's fault, just certain TVs (you know what I mean Samsung) put out a lot of signal noise from the connection panel.UPDATE: Bought second one for a better 4K HDR TV and results are excellent. I use this to control a Smart TV over the TVs built in features. This Roku produces an outstanding picture. I use it with my cable TV companies apps (I have Spectrum and Xfinity in different locations) and it produces better picture and sound than the cable hookup does. Highly recommend it.
This is quite fantastic - can use to stream anywhere in the house.

Bought this for my mom, who is stuck home and wanted to stream different shows. Easy to set up but to get started, they send a code to your computer and you have to enter your name, address, gender and birthdate. Also your credit card should you choose to get pay-per-view content, I guess. A lot of information needed, and I never trust these companies keeping it private.

Wanted to get rid of my 2nd cable box and this fits the bill. I have an older 22 in. Insignia flat screen tv. With ROKU streaming stick it's like a smart tv now. I have prime video, netflix, vudu fandango, peacock, pluto, Showtime and many, many, more.plus I do get a couple of my local news stations. For the price it is a win, win situation.

I purchased this item to replace an Xfinity box that Comcast charges $10 per month to rent.  Download the Xfinity app for Roku and the thing works great.  The voice remote works.  However, with that said, it does have some limitations.  Using the Roku voice remote you can search for Roku apps, but you can't search for channels within the app.  Example.  in the Xfinity app, you say "History Channel" into the remote, and Roku pulls up the History Vault app for Roku, not the History Channel.  Otherwise, no complaints.  And I'm saving $120/year on rental.

The product worked as advertised. I had an LG tv that was a problem child in all 5 years that it lived in our bedroom. Despite being within 15 feet of the WiFi router, it had a spotty connection at best. On top of that, the LG store didn’t have all of the streaming services that we use. I decided to try Roku to help with both problems and it absolutely does! Strong, constant connection and all of our streaming services and then some. Have never had a problem out of it. Of course, 3 weeks after that, the tv died altogether... But the roku continues to work wonderfully in another TV.

This is my fourth Roku device. I turned in all but two cable boxes. It is night to be able to get apps like Netflix available on all roku attached TV's. Now and then it doesn't open up and I have to reset the button on the device and then it usually goes back online. I gave up cable boxes and got these. I hoped to save money but the cable company raised its prices so I am paying the same as I was but not what the raises would have cost me! Cable of course is faster to turn on. Roku takes about 20-30 seconds to open and get to the apps. Something to get used to, but as long as it works, I like it. I only have one remote, maybe two with voice recognition. I haven't used it so I gave it a neutral rating.

I bought 2 different Roku devices for my family when we discontinued our cable. This one, for about $50 which we use in our family room, and the “express” version for $25.00 for the bedroom. The less expensive one in the bedroom work fine, no problems. THIS version however doesn’t.  The audio doesn’t line up with the video, so you’ve got a news reporter movining their lips, with their words lagging a couple sentences behind.  The only way to “fix” it is to turn off the tv, then  unplug the Roku for a few minutes.So, if im really trying to listen to something that I’m interested in, I either have to deal with looking at the video without the audio lining up, OR stop everything for abou 5 minutes to reboot. This started happening about a week ago and I know the problem is with this unit, because my son streams the same channels in his room, and I stream the same channels in my room, using different streaming devices with no issues.I hope it’s not too late to return this.

Love the Roku device! Bought as a gift for my in-laws and they don't do any streaming services at all. After going through the set up process, which they thought was a bit long and intense, they really liked it. However, after a couple uses the remote stopped working. I contacted Amazon support and all they'd do is give me a refund with return of the device. Which is understandable. That being said, my in-laws already have cc info on device so decided not to return it, so I canceled it and will be purchasing a new remote for them, essentially unnecessary. When I asked about doing an even exchange I was told the product was OOS, but I was able to click on same item I purchased and reorder it. Not OOS than right? Maybe someone can enlighten me on this. The main kicker is that of course I had gotten this item on sale during the holidays so I wouldn't be able to reorder it with the refund, it'd end up costing me more. I was offered a $5 promotional credit but that would not have covered the difference. I understand they can only do so much and from where I sit, I just needed a remote! As I was searching for a new one, many of them were not compatible with the device either...It's not like it was a big ticket item, didn't think it'd be that difficult just to get a remote replaced, but guess I wasted my time, Amazon's time, and now additional money to replace this remote. I hope you can understand my frustration here!

Used to replace Roku built in to TV. TV is in bedroom some distance from router and often lost signal. Roku stick plus seems to pick up signal much better than built-in Roku. It solved my problem with losing signal. I see people claiming Roku charges for additional devices--this is not true! I have seven or eight devices registered and never paid extra. I am limited to two devices streaming at once because I pay the lowest monthly fee.

I bought this Roku Streaming Stick+ to first try out in our bedroom. I figured if it worked well there, I'd get a couple more for living room and guest room in our effort to move away from the ridiculous price of standard DT or DN cable providers for mostly a bunch of channels and shows I don't care about.I just wanted to be able to chill out in my bedroom and watch something without having to call DT to fix the box in there that stopped working forever ago. I was curious if the wifi connection would be strong enough as our router is several rooms away. It works great and I've never had an issue with it working. Setup was straightforward and simple.I'm here to buy another one!

Bought both the Roku Streaming Stick+ & Fire TV 4k at the same time a couple of months ago.  Both work well with my TVs and either should satisfy most users.  At the time only the Roku could get YouTube TV and I wanted to evaluate that vs. Hulu to cord cut.  I like the Roku live TV menus and the fact that it's "neutral" in it's programming emphasis, so I thought that's the way I'd go for my other TVs.  But . . . the remote.  Hmmm.  Fire TV remote is MUCH better.  Can't believe the Roku doesn't have a "Mute" button.  The other thing I didn't know until I hooked these up on my family room TV is that the Fire TV remote can also control surround sound components like a receiver; the Roku can't.  I only have one TV where this makes a difference, but there it's a deal breaker for the Roku.

Here's something you should know. Don't be fooled by the "quad processor" being used to sell this as a quick little device. It is incredibly slow and Roku is struggling to keep their hardware up to par with the power needs introduced by the software. This thing constantly crashes, constantly resets, has great difficulty changing the cursor and menus (freezes), and apps like Netflix and Sling commonly will not start and an error message appears to "please force close the app and wait 1 minute." Do yourself a favor and stay away from Roku. Their time has come and passed.

My TV is finally obsolete-after 5 yrs w/ one prime streaming service. I remember the old Roku prior to the "new" TV and dreaded using a device again. I ordered the stick based on ratings and my current need. WOW......it is sooooo much user friendly than the old days(5 + yrs old) with very good picture resolution. And it comes w/ free channels, no hassle, & easy to use-incld setup. I actually LIKE IT-alot, something I never thought I'd say when it comes to having a device for streaming. Better pic, with unexpected benefits.

The Roku was reasonably priced, easy to setup, and use.  Setup only took a few minutes. My family and I were able to watch movies with in 20 minute after taking the Roku out of the box.  There is no need to subscribe unless you want to as there are many free channels. You can quickly channel surf through the channels. I plan only buying another for my bedroom. Roku will help me save on my cable bill. I’ll be able to save about $250 a year off my cable bill.

I’m new to Roku and it’s been great. I’ve always had Apple TVs but having change to YouTube TV away from traditional cable I opted to buy this Roku streaming stick plus as it was compatible with YouTube TV.  I also use quite often prime video, Netflix, HBO now, UFC fight pass, Amazon music and YouTube, all of which are easy to navigate to from the home screen. I do wish I could customize which of the short-cut buttons were on my remote as I will never use any of them other than Netflix and perhaps Hulu.  Also I wish there wasn’t an advertisement on the right side of the homepage, but it’s really not so invasive.  Ultimately this is cheaper, more compatible with the things that I use, and just as effective as any other device I’ve had, so I am happy. The one thing I miss is “mirroring” whatever is on my phone screen to my Apple TV. But this has been very simple to use, I think I’m going to set my parents up with Roku and YouTube TV.

Sick and tired of AT&T playing all the tricks on the cable/internet bill. Decided to try it before cutting the cable.Turned out it was one of the best buys of the year. Easy to install and use, with a lot of choices of programs to choose from, the picture quality is terrific 99% of the time (guess it depends on the internet connection), the user interface is very friendly, almost no effort to learn anything new to use it, even a 5-year old can easily figure out by herself how to get to her favorite cartons.  And it saves a lot of money every month, why do I have to pay $60+/month for a cable package of which 80% of the channels I never watch? Cable TV is dying!!!

Easy setup. We keep having issues with sound though. Often we'll try to use the fire stick, but the audio won't come on. We've tried trouble-shooting. It's def a problem with the stick - not the tv. Unsure what gives.

Works fine. Only issue I dislike is that if you put it to sleep, to bring it back online, you have to disconnect it from power and reconnect then wait for it to boot back up. I solved this issue by just connecting it to a smart switch so I don't have to deal with squeezing behind the TV to unplug the power.

My old Fire stick's remote stopped working, and it was too confusing to try to use our cable company's with it....so just bought this one. I never use the alexa function, and it does what it needs to do to get me to hulu, netflix and amazon prime video. Amazon products, overall, make me happy.

This turned out to be a real problem because it didn’t work.  When we called customer support they told us it was reported lost or stolen so they deprogramed it and evidently put it back on the shelf and ultimately ended up sending it us.  After some back and forth we got it straightened out.

I bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift.  He had really been looking forward to trying this and now even he hates it, which is hard to accomplish.  It worked for two weeks before we started having serious issues with it.  We had to unplug and plug it back in because it often wouldn’t even load shows or movies and sometimes, it would quit altogether and I’d get a black screen when I went to do something as menial as switching from Disney+ to Netflix.  I know that this was an issue solely with the Fire Stick because my other streaming devices worked and loaded shows and movies just fine.  If you’re buying this to save money instead of buying the Apple TV, don’t make the same mistake I did.  Do better, Jeff.

I bought it because my last fire stick was having issues. It was an impulse purchase and was on sale. It is definitely worth the price but was a little bit difficult to set up. My wifi kept kicking it out and I had to reset it twice. It finally took and now works beautifully. I love it and will probably buy another one for my other room.

The voice recognition and Alexa integration makes this a great buy. It’s easy to connect everything and has worked great since being connected. It was an easy install and because we have other fire sticks, all we had to do was put in the passwords for our streaming services and it was great.

This was purchased for a bedroom TV, one that will be furthest from the WiFi hub.  That being said, the installation was simple, and it works like a dream.  I especially like the "Alexa"-enabled remote.  It may be the lite version, but comes with all the features I needed.  Couldn't ask for more!

Why a 1 star review? Because the last 2 fire sticks died rather quickly and Amazon will do nothing to help. I had to buy the protection plan this time incase the device stops working again like the last one did in less than 6 months of owning. It’s a great device when they work, but they don’t seem to last long at all.

Worked for a few hours then remote would no longer communicate w/ Firestick.Tried to return 3 TIMES but Amazon did not offer the RETURN option without speaking with the Firestick Support Desk.Before I could return I HAD to speak w/ one of their Firestick "experts".  I kept putting that off because I knew the product was defective and did not want to spend 20 minutes on phone and presented with all their pre-scripted fixes.  Believe it or not, I AM smart enough to make sure the batteries were good, and the TV was turned on, etc.TODAY I finally decided to call BUT now I have somehow missed the return period for this POS.NOT HAPPY.

I've had the Roku Streaming Stick+ for about a week now and I am very impressed with it. I have used a Sony Blu-Ray player with streaming capabilities for about thee years, but it has quirks and the software is rarely updated. It's usability had become so poor that I began checking into other players such as Roku. I almost bought the same model at Costco but decided to see if  Amazon's prices was better - which it was, to the tune of $10, and with Prime I got it delivered the next day.Installation was quick and easy, as was setup. There are literally hundreds of additional streaming channels, both pay and free, to download in addition to those pre-installed on the device. Since I bought it, we have used it every day almost to the exclusion of my cable subscription and our DVD/Blu-Ray library. It's not only the selection of material, but also the quality of the picture (I'm running 1080p on a 60" plasma TV) and audio. There's never any pause for buffering like the Sony player would do on the same internet connection, no skips or dropped frames. The controls are simple and easy to use, even for my wife who's often hopeless with technology. I'm very pleased with my Roku and can't wait to upgrade to a 4k TV so I can take advantage of the device's capabilities at that resolution. I would buy it again and recommend it to anyone who wants a quality streaming device.

This item is of the high quality I expect from Roku. Set up was very easy and navigation is what we have learned to expect from Roku. I have this device attached to a 13 or 14 year old Toshiba TV we have in our bedroom and the improvement in the TV picture is amazing! It works great and I'm very pleased. My wife is a Brit so she hasn't tried the voice recognition and I personally don't mind manually searching for shows or movies as I often come across something better than what I was searching for so I have not used the voice commands. Besides, with the pandemic, I'm in no rush. For the money, this is an especially good product. I recommend this product!

For the most part I haven't had any issues with this device. It seems to work fine. However, there's one BIG issue that drives me nuts! When the company updates the software on the device, it wipes out all my settings, and I have to set it up again as if I were installing it for the first time. I hate it when I turn on the TV to watch a movie and discover I have to go through the 20-minute process of reconnecting the remote, registering the Roku device online, picking my settings again, and then logging back in to my channels. Any programmer worth their salt knows to save the user's settings before doing an update. I'm going to look for something else to replace this device.

Roku makes transition to cord cutting extremely easy (way easier than I imagined possible.)  I now have 4 of these units and have cancelled my Cable TV about 2 months ago - never looked back... a shocking world change.  One thing you should be aware of:  make sure you have a relatively high quality, fairly new WiFi router before you switch over.  These devices need a lot of buffering and router interaction for them to work smoothly.  With good internet service, these ROKU devices deliver a smooth, high quality experience.

Out of the box, this device was great for the first few weeks. Streaming quality is as expected, the user interface is easy to use, has all the apps i need. The remote that comes with the device was easy to set up with my 10 year old LCD display.  This advertises with Long-Range wireless, but i find that my standard run of the mill Firestick did a better job of picking up the wireless and staying ahead with buffering. This device constantly has to lower the quality and buffer to keep up. That being said, i have 300mbps fiber service using a gaming router so i don't believe the wireless is an issue. All that aside, my biggest issue with the device is the UI is unresponsive more times than not. While watching youtube tv, netflix, etc and when trying to exit the program it almost seems as the remote batteries are dead, though the volume and tv power buttons still respond.  Even when flipping through the home page menu, every so often the screen will lock up.

This device is capable but has many annoying quirks that sometimes seem unbearable, especially if you don’t have time to have something you pay for not exactly do what it is supposed to do. Example 1: the forward/reverse 15 seconds function goes much farther than 15 seconds, like an uncontrollable amount of minutes. Anyone have time for that BS? Not me. Note that the Amazon Firestick has the same function but it actually works. Example 2: sometimes the remote control button functions do not immediately command the screen display, sometimes with many seconds between when you press the button and when the display responds. This makes it uncontrollable and very frustrating.In summary, don’t waste your money. I have an Amazon Firestick and it performs flawlessly and is what this piece of junk should be.

I have now cut the cable cord.  This works just fine.  Once you have it set up, it is very easy to tab through and see all the shows you would want.  Connects with Netflix, YouTube TV, Prime, etc.  The voice control part of the remote is a life saver.  Gets you to where you want to go fast.  Only minor drawback is where the volume buttons are located.  They are on the side and my finger hits the mute button sometimes when I change stations.  No biggy though.  I have not tried to connect this to Alexa so I don't know about that function.

I got this hoping to avoid hooking it up to a power strip. Unfortunately it wasn't getting enough power from the usb port on my tv so every few hours it refused to work until I plugged it directly into the power strip. Other than that it is a roku device and all the roku's are an incredible deal considering what you're getting so I will still give it 5 stars.

Awesome product! Set up was a breeze and the update took maybe 60 seconds total with the restart. I'm honestly pleased with this device although I did have some concerns. One concern was over some reviews saying they were being charged but I will quote the set up guide "Roku does not charge for activation support - beware of scams." I was not charged at all. I was also wondering if my TV could power this stick or if it required a wall outlet. The box provides both a cable for your TV to power the stick if you have a USB port and a wall outlet in case you don't or if your TV does not have sufficient power. This stick is working amazing so far and is quick and easy to use. I highly recommend it. I needed this particularly for an app we use called living scriptures for us and our kids.

This a great device but...SCAM ALERT, it does not cost anything to activate a Roku. There is something wrong in the setup procedure that tells you to call a number you think is Roku support. It is not and they will try to get you to pay them  to "activate" the unit for you. This is a scam and the Better Business Bureau has gotten multiple complaints. Do not fall for it; my husband hung up when they said it would be $250.00 to activate it. Also, this product was brand new, not refurbished in anyway.

I was pleasantly surprised at how well the Roku stick works. After reading the reviews, I opted for this since it was a little easier on my wallet than the Roku Premiere. I have a Roku 3, but I wanted to get something that I could use to enjoy UHD on a newer TV. Besides the fact that I can access UHD content, I think the stick actually might work better than my Roku 3 does. I've only had it for a couple weeks, though. If I run into any significant issues with it, I will be sure to update my review.One note, in case it might help some, is that I had originally hoped to plug the stick into my A/V receiver, which would then feed to my TV. However, my A/V receiver could only output a maximum resolution of 1080p. So that kind of defeated the purpose of getting the new stick. I ended up plugging it into my TV directly and then using an optical audio cable to run to my A/V receiver. I am not sure if the sound that is 5.1 surround, as I am only running a 3.1 system on this particular TV.

I purchased this Roku Streaming Stick+ for an older flat screen TV that I have (that's not a SmartTV with all the apps already built-in). It works great!. If you are used to regular CableTV/SatelliteTV, you won't have every channel option on the planet, so it's not for everybody. But I save over $150 PER MONTH on CableTV, so I'll get used to a few less options. It still has 90% of what I watched before anyways, and the savings will pay for a brand new Quantum processor SmartTV in just a few months. NOTE: You will need a basic internet connection for this to work (doesn't need to be a super fast connection--it even streams well over a VPN connection).

Product works as expected EXCEPT that the battery life in the remote is HORRIBLE. If I don't take the batteries out of the remote when not in use they will be dead in three days or less! Seriously, I am not kidding! This is UNACCEPTABLE!I turned to the Roku Community Forum hoping to find an answer but instead I find this is not a new problem. In fact it has been a HUGE issue for MONTHS and Roku has done NOTHING to remedy the problem. Again, UNACCEPTABLE!If I don't hear from Roku within a week with a reasonable remedy I will return this product and purchase a non-Roku related product.If I get a satisfactory resolution I will update my post.VERY DISAPPOINTED!

After having a nice Fire TV for a few years, we went with a Roku Stick. Bad choice. I am very unhappy that in under 60 days, the darn thing overheats! They say to put it onto an extender, and keep it away from other items. What? I don't care to have extraneous things hanging off the back of my TV. To have something almost brand new come up with overheating issues is terrible. I would not recommend this to anyone!

I have no complaints. This is my third and I'll likely get a 4th, and maybe a 5th and 6th (which I believe is the max for one account). My wireless router is kept inside a cabinet in the center of the house and it still works with my tv hanging on the inside of an exterior wall in my garage.  The reception I receive really is surprising which is why I buy only this Roku model with it's improved wireless reception capability.I do wish I didn't have to reactivate all my streaming channels with the installation of each device. It would be nice if it just carried over the activations from my Roku account every time I installed one.

I have only been using this a few months. I had the original roku several years ago, even gave a few as gifts, but I have had nothing but problems with the roku stick. For the past week every time I sit down to watch something I have to do my own research, tech support and maintenace and I am tired of it. The audio stopped working, searched online because due to "Covid" no phone support. Could not get directed to email support because my problem was not listed. So, after researching and finding MANY people having problems, I had to disconnect and reconnect EVERYTHING. This works for maybe a day and then starts all over again. No audio, garbled audio, stick overheating...EVERY DAY!  Check online about reviews, problems, etc before you buy.

I have had this product less than 5 months and already it is broken. Used it maybe a couple of times a week and now trying to use it the screen is green and has lines going all across the screen. I have tried a reset, still hasn't worked. Double checked it was my TV itself, but it isn't the TV because the applications on the actual TV does work. Tested out all HDMI ports and even using different HDMI chords, but still no change.Wouldn't recommend or buy this product again.I should have just purchased an Amazon Fire TV Stick.

I have it's competitor from the online marketplace with the stick that's on fire and I prefer the Roku due to the fact I can organize the layout of the short cuts. In both cases you have adds that you can't disable but I find the ones from Roku less obtrusive (took me 2 weeks to notice add were being displayed).  This one is a little more expensive than it's competitor but the remote is also much better with the on/off button and the volume buttons. I still give it a 5 star rating but a back light in the remote would be really nice.

Can't say enough about this Roku streaming stick. I didn't have good luck with the Express version of this product so I thought I would give this streaming stick a try. The streaming aspect is really great. Brings in Discovery+ beautifully and I have voice in the remote. Love it. My tv had only 2 HDMI ports and unfortunately the only available port was almost unreachable. I took my makeup mirror, laid it on my dresser and using it I guided the Roku into the port. Now you can't even see the Roku streaming stick. My husband was impressed!

I upgraded to the Roku Streaming Stick+ about 3 weeks ago. the streaming signal is glitchy. I did everything they said to get the "best" streamig quality, but every few minutes the picture and audio cut out for a second or two, or the picture will start flickering every few seonds. once these starts happening, it slowly increases in frequency.when I unplug the device from the tv and plug it back in, it sometimes stops doing these things for a short while. if I had it to do over again, knowning what I do now, I would not have gotten this device.and then I found out that the upgraded HBO isn't going to be available on Roku....when I have slack in my budget again, I'll have to research other, non-Roku, streaming devices.
Excellent and very easy to install and set up. You can add apps like Netflix, HULU, DAZN, ESPN+ and even Disney+. You can even program other firestick remotes too work with lite.

When I ordered this thing it gave me a notice that the device would be scanned and registered to my Amazon Account.  Really?  It took me 5 minutes and 4 web pages to enter a code it gave me to "REGISTER IT TO MY ACCOUNT".  It works as advertised, but how about a little truth in adverting?

Got this because my PS3 is no longer supporting a lot of apps. I should have upgraded to a fire stick ages ago. It’s fast, doesn’t freeze, I don’t have to close out one app to enter another, I just tell Alexa to open up the other app and she does it all. It’s great. Plus I can ask Alexa anything. It’s great for me. I love this fire stick.

I have an older fire stick with an older OS (5.4) and recently bought this one for a second TV. The new OS (7.x) has a new OS that is a downgrade from the previous one. The old one was pretty intuitive and the new one is clearly trying to push amazon apps and their TV. It sucks. Buy a roku instead.

The device works well when it works, but it doesn't work often. Every time I turn on my TV, the firestick doesn't connect to the input. I have to physically unplug it, wait a couple minutes, then plug it back in. When I turn it on again, it does start up, but usually with no sound. I then have to go to the settings menu and choose the option to restart my firestick. It rarely works after the first try, so I have to then restart it again to get it to connect with sound.When it all works, it's great and I love how easy it is to navigate between apps and find things to watch. But most days, I get tired of all the rebooting, so I just default back to my chromecast.

Not sure what the difference could be between the lite and the regular 🤔 It has a good amount of memory, graphics are great, you can play games and it still has all the streaming services that I subscribe to plus more 😲.. Not to mention the voice control perk. Seems heavy duty for it to be called a lite. Extremely satisfied with my purchase 😃👍 Oh but I don't know anything about volume control because it doesn't have it 😳
This was easy to set up. It improved the picture on my tv, but since the Lite doesn’t have volume controls I need to use two controllers. Nevertheless, I’m very pleased with this purchase.

Couldn't believe this was so cheap.  It makes any TV smart.  Even better, I actually used it to turn a dumb computer monitor that I had lying around (with an HDMI in port) into a TV by adding the TV Stick and then linked it to a blue tooth speaker. Now it works just like a TV!  So happy.

and I'm very disappointed so far. At least when i was able to watch on my Roku, I did not have to keep restarting the device so that the screensaver would not come up in the middle of watching. I am CONSTANTLY restarting the device after the video freezes while playing an advertisement while the stream audio continues to play in the background. Other times it just refuses to start playing a stream. This might primarily be a Twitch app problem but Amazon forced me into buying this device if i wanted to continue conveniently watching Twitch on my TV. It wouldn't be so bad if the device actually worked well. Not even kidding--the screensaver came up in the middle of a stream while I was typing this review.

Still cannot believe all that is available on this Fire stick.  Much of the tuning easily done by Alexa.  This Alexa and our home Alexa apparently know each other, no conflicts.  The remote Alexa will even do some of the home Alexa skills.  Again, so much is available with this Firestick.

Very easy set-up.  Not quite plug and play, but not much more difficult than that.Since streaming is the way of the present/future, and not everyone has smart TVs, this is a nice alternative.  Let's face it, smart TVs aren't going to be able to keep up with all the new streaming services that are added monthly it seems, whereas Fire Stick will be able to add the aps needed for the services you choose.There are some limitations to what Alexa can do from the Fire Stick, but all in all, "she" does what you need within that environment.

So much for the claims of easy installation. I could not get this to work. I tried any number of combinations, three sets of new batteries, I even switched the power cord with the one for my Kindle. Nothing. And I missed the deadline for returning it. I hope other people have better luck with it.

Dumped Satellite TV and now watching everything I want on YouTube TV and Amazon Prime on two formerly non-smart TVs and two that were only somewhat smart. They are really smart now. Very easy setup and works great. Have now added several other streaming Apps with 1000s of free movies. No more boxes, no more dish, no more contracts...

I've dealt with a number of different streaming devices and Fire Stick/TV is the best I've seen.Best Home screen layout.  Still has all the busy ads and junk like all the rest, but I can get past that.  Very easy to add apps.Like all these devices, it gets slow sometimes but not often.  I have to reboot it maybe once a month.

I am 82 yrs old hearing ads  i don't hear that  good , i don't see that good,I just want something that is easy to use ,I am certain  that others probably  use it with no problem I just like myold  tuner just seam like the buttons are bigger. My son and daughter in law they like it a lot they  see nothingwrong with . With out a douthit it just this old man to you older folks try it it may work great for you

This lite little device has been upgraded to the same processor as the 4k and is easier to add your preferred apps. Same speed as the 4k and quite the price on sale. Very impressed. I have the cube, shield, and the chromecast newbie but  this firestick lite is the best bang for the buck and handles everything I've thrown at it. Sending a few to friends for Christmas that don't have cable and won't need it now...
I was disappointed with this firestick.  No up and down button, no on and off button.  Is there a way I can get the remote with the power button and the up and down buttons?

I love the Fire Stick Lite. Purchased 3 when they were on sale for 17.99. We are exploring cutting the cord and I like that I can try the fire stick for less than 20. The app choices are great, love that I can turn my 3 non-smart tvs into a smart tv for such a small cost. The Alexa Voice integration works well, no issues with that. Don't really care that it doesn't work for controlling our tvs, we have remotes for them so not a huge deal. Overall I am happy with the product

I love my fire stick! Unfortunately I have to unplug it and plug it in every time because nothing on the remote wakes it up from sleeping. Maybe I just got a bad remote. I've watched multiple Amazon movies and often listen to music while working. Highly suggest buying one of these. You won't regret it.

I bought the Firestick lite from a big box retailer and was hoping for good things.  I had been using Roku and thought I'd upgrade.  After using the Firestick for a short time it started having issues with no sound.  I searched out an answer and found that if I pushed the home and play button at the same time, it would reset and the sound would come back on.  Great, or so I thought.  It kept doing it more frequently and I have just gotten fed up with it and have gone back to the Roku.  If you buy, I hope you have better luck than me.

Our cable bill got ridiculous, we were paying $259 a month, so We bought four Roku’s  for a bedroom living room family room and basement, I need to buy two more for other televisions. We are pleased with how many programs are on that we really like and a lot of free television. We pay for a couple channels that we like but they only cost us 4.99.One great thing about Roku as we are watching the full series of programs several years ago and it’s exciting because we don’t remember watching them so it’s like watching them from the very beginning. We definitely are going to buy a couple more Roku’s, it’s way better than cable

Roku RF remotes are the worst remotes I've ever used. I've had three in one room. Three. They all had the same problem, which was that they froze frequently and failed to work. After enough times replacing the batteries and unplugging the Streaming Stick and plugging it back in it just got easier to realize that Roku remotes are garbage. Replacing them has become tiresome. I now use an app on my phone to operate my Roku Streaming Stick, and because the Roku remote turns the TV on and controls the volume I have to do those things with a separate remote. The seller isn't bad, and tried to work with me. I did get stuck paying for the last replacement because it is too much of a hassle to keep multiple remotes straight, but that's not their fault. But the Streaming Stick has nothing that really makes it better than competing products and the remotes are really garbage.

I just installed my new roku and within thirty minutes had a message pop up on my screen saying that my roku was overheating. It was hot to the touch and after some research it is a common problem especially if your device is inside a cabinet which mine is but I have had an amazon fire stick in the exact same spot for a couple of years without a problem. Roku does offer an extender for free that you have to order online. Not sure why they don’t just put it in the box in the first place. The extender will only move it off the back of my home theater system a couple of inches so that probably will not help since it will still be in the cabinet. They’re only true fix for the problem is to move it to a cooler spot which is not an option for me so I’ll have to try something else.

This was great the ability to make a dumb tv smart by plugging in this stick is superb. We can talk to it and it will open the app and find shows and show you which app. No regrets... however some improvements they could make:(1) When requesting certain titles it might show you options for purchase even though there is an option on one of the streaming services you have for free so don't trust that completely.(2) It doesn't turn off the tv with alexa or turn on the tv with alexa.(3) you have to hold the voice button to speak to it but I think you can use alexa to speak to it though alexa isn't that great at understanding and interfacing with the rokuother than that it is pretty great

I like this Roku Stick. Bought it for my TV in the craft room and it works perfectly.Love that the remote has volume buttons and may be synced to turn TV on/off.  My Roku box in another room does not have those features.I would have given 5 stars, however, this Roku Stick did not fit the TV in the bedroom. Disappointing, due to the design of the stick being long and not flexible to fit the port on some TV's. The TV that it didn't fit has a curvature below the port and the stick and curve are not compatible. Hopefully, Roku will improve the design to allow more use. I would buy it again, after inspecting my TV for compatibility.

I had an older model Vizio TV for the bedroom. It was not able to recognize my 5G wireless network, resulting in video problems, buffering lags, etc. Bought this little baby,plugged it in, and Wallah! Great video, no more Vizio bloatware. Immediately recognized my TV and paired remote. Took five minutes! Screen now comes up instantly with the same Roku screen from my living room TV, all my channel selections from Roku account already there. Added attraction, the remote has volume control  and muting. Old Vizio remote now retired! Highly recommend for older flat screens manufactured before 5G became available. A winner!

Bought two of these as gifts for family members during the holidays 2020.  Batteries that came with them had an expiration date of September 2020.  Of course, we didn't notice this until after we installed them, and returned to the infrequently used TV a couple weeks later and the remote didn't work.  A week ago, we put fresh batteries in.  Remote doesn't work 7 days later.  Guess we'll try new batteries one more time...  If it fails, we'll just use the less convenient Roku app as a remote.  Didn't have these problems with 2 Rokus bought earlier in 2020.

The stick worked great but recently it’s kicking the remote off and unpairing it. I’ve been able to unplug the roku and plug it back in and that fixed the problem, but now it’s not anymore. It’s completely useless. I’ve had this for a little over 3-4 months.

The remote is terrible. Either it's being unresponsive or the batteries are dead.I spend half my time with a remote that just wont switch apps and I'm changing batteries about every 2 weeks.I wish xfinity would work with Fire Box, then I could toss this where it belongs.Update: I cannot possibly stress enough how much I hate this box and remote. My Fire TV box is available immediately, while I have to wait for this thing to fire up for minutes I go through batteries every couple days and half the time I have to shut off the roku box and restart to get the remote to work.I wish my cable company would get it together so I can toss this piece of crap.

Of the various streaming devices that we have, this is our favorite. It's very affordable, it's small, it was easy to physically hook up, and easy to set up and use. It's got an extensive list of popular apps, as well as some apps we've never heard of that we plan to experiment with. Aside from the great variety of apps, what makes it a favorite for us is the remote. It fits very comfortably in the hand, the buttons have a solid tactile feel, and the button functions are sensible. There's a volume control for the TV that's very convenient, but unfortunately it doesn't have a mute button. The primary reason we didn't rate this Roku device 5 stars, however, has to do with the prolonged difficulty that we had to get the advertised $50 Sling credit from our new Roku account for a new Sling account. Roku and Sling repeatedly pointed responsibility to each other. After a week of attempting to get the credit and spending over 8 hours on the phone with both Roku and Sling, Roku ultimately rejected our claim for the credit even though we are new subscribers to both! I subsequently requested a return authorization from Amazon. After a short cooling off period, however, we decided not to give up and I'm happy to say we figured it out.

In order to use their stick Roku demands your credit card number nor could I find a way to restrict it's use. I bought it because the Amazon Fire stick could not connect to Britbox. The Roku does that quite well but the menu and voice recognition are not quite as good as the Fire stick. Several times, it was easer to use the menu rather than voice. I do believe Roku is the absolute master of meaningless error messages. Particularly frustrating was having to enter my information five times because I kept getting, "an error has occurred, please try again."

About 6 months ago my Visio TV was identified by Netflix as no longer able to support or stream Netflix, even though it had the Netflix app. I was effectively "Cut Off" . Once I added the Firestick to the Visio I am able to stream Netflix and a whole lot more. Sometimes technology is a good thing.

I bought Roku units specifically because they offer the Spectrum App. Yesterday, my Spectrum App failed to load as it does from time to time, so I tried to delete and reinstall (this usually fixes the problem). The Spectrum app has disappeared from the Roku channel menu. I reached out to Roku, who absurdly told me to call Spectrum! Last time I checked, Spectrum doesn't run Roku software. If you need Spectrum, DO NOT BUY ROKU.

This is probably my fifth or sixth ROKU!  I have loved them so much in the past that I have given them to friends.  I replaced one that I had with a Firestick and (sorry Amazon) I like the Roku better.  I just think the Roku's apps make it easier to find what you want to watch.  I do like that with the Firestick, I can just say the name of specific show and it will take me to it but the Roku is better for browsing, in my opinion.  Anyway, my old ROKU finally bit the dust.  (I've probably had it for five or six years) so I replaced it with the new ROKU.  I got one that is supposed to pick up the WIFI from lengthy distances so I'm hoping to use it in the backyard this summer. But, for now, it's in the living room all plugged in and working fine.

Easy to set up and the interface is easy to use. However, Be aware that you will be forced to sign up for a Roku account and give them your credit card number before being allowed to use the product.  The good news is that you can remove the credit card immediately after setting up the account.  The batteries also get used up quickly and I find myself having to remove the batteries after I’m done using it.

I like Roku because it can be used with more of my favorite apps than most others like it.  It does not cost anything to connect & use as long as you go to the Roku site not a fraudulent site; just make sure that you get your web address correct & write just exactly what the Roku app tells you to.  It has a lot of apps to use with it; most are free.  My only complaint is that most of the free apps show  so many commercials so often that it makes it very difficult to watch a show.  Also, most free apps show lower quality shows; part of the problem is some of the free apps allow just anyone (professional or not) to make movies & etc & post on the free apps so stay with top rated apps.  It offers a great selection of shows & apps so it is well worth the money. It goes great with or without cable.

what a fantastic device.....if you have this and an internet connection you can free yourself from the monthly fees just to watch TV/movies/news etc.  this gives you the ability to download all the free apps that have thousands of really good free movies, along with the Roku channels................I should have gotten this a few years ago...it would have saved me a fortune.  I installed in on the tv in my bedroom and liked it so much that I just ordered another one for my main tv and as soon as I get it......I am planning to cancel my expensive provider.

We have a HD dumb TV. This is the device I chose to upgrade our many hours a week of watching to while the many hours of quarantine of the Pandemic. This is one of the best purchases of my life. It's easy to use (fun even) and replaxes our regular remote. It has a moderate learning curve, because there are very few buttons, that have several functions. Past that it really works great. We have two homes with other dumb tvs, this device is pocket portable and  remembers what you programed so it should take your choices with you!

The streaming device works well and is easy to connect. Package delivery was great. The disappointing feature is getting an answer to a question from customer support. I have now been waiting 3 days and so far have had only an automated response apologizing saying it doesn’t usually take this long. Kind of like the phone message saying we are busier t usual.
Never again! My Apple TV broke so I decided to save the money and go with Roku. Big mistake! Constantly have to sync remote and the system keeps resetting making me set it up all over again. Garbage!

The instructions were way, way way to complicated,#1...#2 You don't ask a customer to buy your product and then...after they've purchased it tell them they "may" need something additional to make it work!! #3 IT IS EXTORTION to sell a person a product and then...then tell them they can't operate it UNLESS THEY GIVE YOU THEIR CREDIT CARD INFORMATION!!! And, this, after they've already installed this product. NEVER AGAIN WILL I PURCHASE A ROKU PRODUCT...NEVER, NEVER, NEVER. This was a nightmare. And, you should know that... It is this kind of an experience that sours people on doing mail order. Mail order is suppose to be fun and relatively easy. And, it is problems like this that take ALL the joy out of making a purchase. I will DEFINATELY inform ALL my friends, neighbors and relatives, ect. P.S. I was ACTUALLY in tears with this thing and had to hire a television repair person to come in and help me to install it. And, another thing...THERE IS NO #800 number...NO contact number to get any help THIS IS THE NUMBER ONE PROBLEM...THE NUMBER ONE PROBLEM!!! The second is that extortion situation I mentioned earlier here. (Who in the world writes these instructions? Doesn't anyone - a few people, at least - try out these instructions BEFORE you sell this stuff to the public? Shame on you... Shame on you all. RR

Just installed and bought on a black Friday sale.Very happy with this purchase. Easy install and setup. Using on a Sony none-smart led tv. Great picture and smooth Wi-Fi without buffering. If you don't mind using two remotes, one for the fire stick and one for the tv, a very good deal!

I got this to enhance my “dumb” tv. The tv is older, is connected to basic cable, but doesn’t have the features or apps like new smart TVs have. So by adding this Fire stick lite, we now have access to Prime, Netflix, and everything else!  Brilliant solution for under $25 (lightning deal).

I bought an older Vizio smart tv from a yard sale that while it was made to support streaming, it was no longer supported and therefore turned off. The fire stick restored everything and now I have another great tv in my study for watching movies while I work. I highly recommend this device.

I've been a Roku user for almost 10 years now and got this due to the integrating of the live TV features (Pluto and Sling) into a single app so they can all be combined into a cable like service but so many different services are still unsupported.I hope that eventually they get Stirr and Xumo integrated into it as well in which case I'll be more excited.  Don't get me wrong, I like the fact that Pluto and Sling are combined together into one giant cable like service, but until I see Stirr (Comet, Charge! and Dusk) along with a couple of offerings from Xumo included so that I can combine it with my favorites from Sling and Pluto, I'll be unsatisfied.

Excellent device. Installation was simple. Downloading my paid streaming services very straight forward. Remote very convenient, only a few buttons. Might upgrade to the slightly more expensive model to include the volume control buttons on the remote. Very satisfied with this model though.

The Fire TV Stick Lite is a great little device. I love the ease of use allowed by voice commands. Was happy to learn you can ask it a ton of things from, "open YouTube" to "find me a recipe for fettuccine alfredo" to "tell me a joke."It works great and is easy to use.Also, it now has HBO Max! You no longer have to side load the app to be able to access HBO Max... Roku does not offer access to the HBO Max app, so if that's one of the things you're looking for the fire stick is the way to go!

i love the fact that i could watch youtube anytime i want now on my tv. i NEVER used my tv before. i always used my laptop for everything. now i could watch whatever i want on the big screen, play music whenever i clean my room, etc. i love it! for $17 this surprisingly improved my life tenfold!

Replaced a roku that stopped working with the firestick.  So far it has been working flawlessly.  Great picture quality and easy to understand menu options.  With increasing problems occurring with roku updates and wireless connectivity,  I maybe switching all my TVs to firesticks

This Fire Stick is strictly for the beginner. It is very basic. I have it on my office TV so it suits its purpose but it does require you have the TV remote as well. No volume control, no off/on. I guess I am spoiled because I have the Cube and the regular Fire Stick as well as this one...It works, it's just very basic.

I couldn't get the HBO max on my roku. HBO recently made the HBO max app available on the Fire platform, so, I've been happily streaming since  I received the Fire stick lite.  It works great and since I don't need the integrated tv controls or  want 4K , I'm delighted with the product.

Omg this is amazing! It's something that you thought you never needed until you started using it! Searching for movies/ the shows/ YouTube videos, anything really is so much easier it's crazy! The voice recognition is spot on and impressive! No glitches so far. The remote fits my hand nicely too.

With this device, when I power up the TV the home button on the remote does not activate the device.  I have to unplug then plug the device back in for it to recognize power and come on.  A fix for me was my Insignia TV has a USB port that I can plug the device in to so when I power up the TV the device comes on BUT usually without sound.  I usually have to unplug and plug it back in a few times in order for it to work properly.  That's too much sugar for a quarter.  If I'd not got it as a gift I'd take it back for a refund, a regular fire stick or a roku stick.

I went back and fourth for awhile trying to decide which firestick to go with. I'm glad I chose the lite version. It does everything we need it to do and more! Set up was easy and had no issues getting all of accounts linked up and running. Great low cost option with all of the necessary features you'd expect from an Amazon product.

This should have volume controls.  TV controls I thought meant power on/off.  Voice controls are sketchy, it doesn't really work.  I tell it to open a show on an app and it just brings up a place for me to buy it on amazon. Revised my review as I think i maybe left it too quick while angry.  Its a solid product

Purchased one of these on a whim when it was on sale to upgrade an older HD TV to be able to get “Smart TV” type content. I am new to the world of streaming TV, but this seems to do the trick. I do think the features for searching for content could be better, wanted to find a comedy movie to watch and half of what was listed as comedy was not. Oh well. The stick works, the Prime video organization needs a bit of improvement.

I have been using the first generation for about 4 years and so I purchased this one for a great price. In my opinion, I don't have a need for TV controls. This version works just as great as the first one. The interface is slightly differernt but still very user-friendly. A+ from me.

Alexa saves time and works often enough to be a benefit.  I already have Roku which is a better around but isn't voice enabled at least in the inexpensive versions. It has lost sound often with is a bother; have to move off a streaming service an then come back to it to get the sound.

Using for a tv in the bedroom and is good for that.  I don't use Alexa or voice controls so can't say anything about that.  Runs most of the tv apps I use although some won't run due to a lack of Google. Probably won't bother with that since it's for the bedroom.  Easy to install and use.

This gets a 50/50 rating. Sometimes there is no sound on any app and I have to reboot the stick often.The HOME button should be in a different place. To easy to press by accident. Otherwise is works well for all my apps that I pay for. Now I have to get used to this new update.

I was looking for a good streaming device to upgrade my TV, i already own a google chromecast but my mother doesnt like the idea of having to use her cellphone every time with the chromecast, so we started investigating all the streaming devices: Roku, Fire sticks, etc. With such great reviews, the Alexa voice integration and the discount price of december, the FireStick won. We bought 2 , they are so fast and smooth with 15mb they work great. It is  friendly user and it is so easy to download apk files to stream also. My mom loves that she doesnt have to be looking for anything, she just tells alexa to open it. We love it, really good at a great price.

We received the firestick as a gift only a week ago.  So far, we have been delighted with the results: easy to install and use, many choices of programs, excellent picture and sound, and easy to switch between our regular TV reception/programs, and those offered on the firestick.

Not quite sure but  the unit overheats in my kitchen, had to replace it so I could get rid of the streaming issues that occur with this also. The box that it came in smells musty and stinks . Hopefully this on will last longer than the previous on. You might want to purchase from someone else not sure why this smells like it has been in storage for a long time.

Absolutely love this! We bought this to replace our Roku stick that was constantly having issues. I got this in sale for $17.99. So happy I bought it! The Alexa feature is great. You don't have to spend forever trying to click each individual letter on the keyboard. Just tell Alexa and she will do all the work!

I had an old lagging version of my smart tv.  (not so smart)So, someone suggested just getting a firestick to update.I wasn't so sure about the "lite" but got it anyway.  It all works very well.  I did not need the volume or tv control so this lite was the perfect fit.

I finally broke down and bought a newer Firestick.  It's so much faster than the first generation model that I've had for several years.  I don't use the Voice, Alexa, or Volume Control features, so I can't comment on those, but this Firestick is blazing fast compared to my previous model.

Remote stopped working five weeks after getting fire stick. Yes I did double check and make sure batteries were charged and in working order before writing this review. Voice recognition never worked once. No issues with playback, except with Hulu which from time to time states they are unable to play a title, however that’s a Hulu issue not a fire stick issue. I do love ease of use with the fire stick when it does function properly.  This is my second fire stick and I believe I will be making the switch to Roku going forward.

HONESTLY bought the wrong one. Im used to being able to adjust my volume and turn off and on the tv with the fire stick. THIS ONE does not do either. Also very glitchy randomly stops working and it is NOT my wifi. The "channels" button/ feature is pointless. UPGRADING ASAP. Newest version is awesome but this one is just okay.

This was my 2nd Firestick I purchased and is happy I did. The Firestick Lite was very easy to setup and has a lot of viewing options and app's to download.It has voice recognition which is handy when searching for a movie, music or etc.  It also has plenty of free movies and live TV to watch.I'm glad I purchased this for both TV's in my new place instead of cable  for the viewing content is was definitely worth the $.

When it worked correctly, it was great. But the sound was erratic. Most times  I could not get any sound. Spent quite a long time with tech-support. Although the technician was helpful, she could not solve the sound problem. Amazon replaced it with a  refurbished fire stick although I did not purchase a refurbished one.  The new refurbished one has the same sound problem. I don’t think this is unique to me because when I Googled the problem, I found the sound problem to be fairly common.

If you want to turn your HD tv into a smart tv without paying smart money this is definitely the way. I was able to order all the same apps I use on my apple phone or tablet to watch shows. Super easy to setup of connect to your tv. I’m definitely happy with this $20 purchase

Got this for my dad, as he is considering dropping cable... he is loving it. He’s not the best with technology (at 74 years old), but he’s learning quick as it’s easy to navigate and customizable. There is a lot of free content that he’s enjoying. The voice control is a great bonus that he didn’t think he would use/like.

This is the second Firestick that I've purchased and I'm just as pleased.  This time, I purchased the Firestick Lite and it works as expected.  Set up is a breeze and I love being able to easily choose the apps that I want.  Additionally, I appreciate the profile set up which allows you to choose shows and movies that you enjoy seeing.  The only criticism is that I wish I'd gotten the regular Firestick for this television as well since I've discovered that I like having the features of the tv buttons (like volume, etc) on one remote.  However, this is simply a personal preference and does not impact the quality of this product.

I purchased this unit for use on an older 32 inch TV in my kitchen, and it is just fine. Doesn't need a lot of bells and whistles as the TV doesn't have them either. I bought this to replace an older first generation Fire Stick which doesn't work well at all anymore on any TV. It works great.

This is a time saver.I use to connect my TV to my laptop using HDMI but boy it was hell when I had to get up and change the movie or turn up the volume. With this remote my TV is like a smart TV. The voice commands work pretty well considering it's not the most advanced. Changing movies and turning up/down the volume of the tv has never gotten easier. Even surfing the wen has got interesting but the screen of my TV does not properly support that.

Incredible price, tons of mostly free content, very fast and now that I have Amazon Prime I am watching tons of free movies with no commercial interruptions. All I needed was a hot spot. I do have a no data cap and no throttling hot spot that assures me I will not run out of data when using my hot spot for streaming movies.
This edition of Fire stick is a piece of crap...I get this message every time I try to use it. I guess it’s because it the cheapest version.

I found it very simple to set up. The one thing that I really don't like is the length of the cord. It's too short for the tv that I bought it for; I plugged it into the surge protector on the floor and it doesn't reach the HDMI port on the tv. I honestly considered returning it for that reason because I needed it specifically for that tv. In theory, it would've worked well, which is why I'm giving it 4 stars.Edit: I’ve changed my review from 4 stars to 3. Every other time I turn on my tv, it says no signal even though the fire stick is plugged in. I have to unplug it and plug it back in.

The WiFi chip in our TV stopped working so this was an easy way to restore wireless connection to our modem.  Haven't figured out how to use Alexa smoothly yet, and was confusing which remote control to use the TV or Amazon Fire TV remote.  When I switch to watch a DVD using the TV remote it quickly shifts to the Fire TV connection requiring me to re-select the DVD source.  But, overall am happy with it.

We've had a Fire stick for several years. Ordered one from Cyber Monday and wow, Amazon doesn't disappoint. I thought the early edition was pretty amazing, but this one is even better. Love being able to talk into the remote and having Alexa search all of the streaming services to find what I'm asking for. Highly recommend!

This is my second one. I like it. It’s easy to set up but the plug is too short and it doesn’t reach the outlet. I had to purchase an extension cord to plug it into an outlet.  Just make sure you don’t overload the outlet it can and will cause a fire. This is the only set back.

It's been almost a month I've used this thing, and I'm beginning to see the idiosyncracies. Some apps. take a while to download (the little spinning circle ?), but if it doesn't get worse it's ok. My thinking is you don't get something for nothing, so they get you one way or another. I get 14 Mb. down so I'm thinking thats fast enough for one tv. I'm also ditching my DirecTV as AT&T have taken over and are raping customers. I'll put up a roof antenna and point it at Mpls/St Paul. I should be in range, and with this rig I can quit supporting the Parasites.

I needed to purchase an updated streaming device, after five years, to access Hulu.  My Blu ray player and Wii, though they still work fine and access other media services, were no longer compatible with Hulu's format.  I purchased this particular Roku streaming stick because it came with a voice remote that also controls TV power and volume.  I can access all my TV apps in one place, which is what I needed.  Roku also provides movies and classic TV shows, at no additional charge.I would have given 5 stars for the "user interface," if not for the inconvenience of the incompatibility of the streaming stick with my TV (shown in photo).  I had to wait two extra days to receive an adaptor, to use it.  Upon request, Roku does provide an adaptor at no cost, and they shipped it the same day I requested it.

2.5 stars1 point off for it’s dated looking interface.  Slugish compared to the ultra Roku. Huge negative is it actually has a huge ad on the main home screen. Guess they saw amazon was getting away with it, so they started doing it too.Blows away the Amazon sticks IMO. The amazon stick is all about shoving prime, ads, and amazon down your throats. Between the two, go roku for sure. Personally I'd either get the Roku ultra, or the cheapest Roku available. This product isn't really any faster than the cheaper models

Great purchase! I’m thoroughly enjoying using my Roku. No connectivity issues and it was simple to install. Primarily I use it for my Xfinity cable box solution. After speaking with an Xfinity rep she mentioned that I wouldn’t be responsible for renting the 2 extra cable boxes I was going to pay $10 more each for. That’s $20 plus tax monthly. Now I can watch all my cable stations on the Xfinity app plus this is portable.  After downloading the Xfinity App on my Roku I also did the same on my iPhone. Anyway the 2 Roku’s will pay for themselves in a few months. Much easier to use than my Firestick. Loving the 1 click Hulu and Netflix buttons. Lastly my iPhone is also a remote control since I utilized the Roku app. If you’re on the fence don’t be. I highly recommend.

Can’t say if it works or not. I ordered the basic  Roku on 11/26 and it arrived on 11/29. Went to set it up on my new Vizio tv so we could watch Disney + and it only fits the side facing hdmi port. But, we got a message indicating hdcp error. Roku says I can get a FREE dongle to access the other ports on the tv so I ordered it right away on 11/29. It is now 12/5, the mail has arrived, no dongle. We missed watching Disney+ last weekend and now it’s looking like we will miss another weekend. Funny thing is it worked on a small older Panasonic tv we had but watching on the small tv kind of defeated the purpose. I’m very disappointed.Update: The dongle arrive in the mail today. It worked so hurray.... a week later.

My old roku bit the dust so I needed a new one. Other models were cheaper but I decided to go with this one because of the all in one remote (I was tired of having a roku remote and a tv remote to turn on the TV and adjust the volume).  It all works great. The stick is plugged in behind the TV but we have no trouble changing the channels and adjusting volume which is such an improvement over our older version that you had to make sure you had a clear line of site and point it exactly right.I have only owned this for a month or 2 but I am very happy with my purchase.
