This Roku is a great device but the remote has a big problem , it drains the batteries even when not in use and you need to be replacing batteries almost every week or every two weeks , I have bought 4 of them and all of them have the same problem.

Bought three of these after abandoning our pricey satellite TV.  Have found in general that the Rokus work well, though they are quite prone to locking up, meaning they need to be rebooted 1-2 times per week.  That is frustrating but acceptable considering I’m saving a bunch of money by ditching the satellite. Streaming quality is variable, from super high resolution to glitchy and pixelated but that is more to do with our bandwidth and my gaming son than the Roku. Overall I like the ROku and would buy it again

Never realized there was another TV world out there.  I am amazed and surprised that there are thousands of streaming channels available there are, with ones that I truly want to watch!  You just plug in The Stick+ to an open HDMI port on your TV, set up the wireless network, and voila, streaming!Stick+ internal menus are very easy to understand and maneuver. Simple but effective remote control without 2000 buttons makes for effortless viewing options. You do have a short learning curve on installing "private" channels, getting the codes that recognize your stick+, but really easy once you have registered a couple of channels.I am a recently retired TV Cable technician, and if my customers knew about how nifty and neat this product was, there would have been less TV Cable customers.  Very satisfied and can't wait for the weekly channel releases for literally "anything" you want to watch...

Without bad-mouthing other streaming devices manufactured to lesser standards, this one is the genuine article by which all others will forever be judged. After experience with Roku for 15 years or so, I've flirted with a little 'strange' now and again. I apologized and reconciled with my reliable streaming brand: Roku. No device is perfect, but for my money, this brand pays serious attention to manufacture quality. This remote feels the best in your hand, and the receiver holds onto signals better than rival brands.

Roku's interface is by far the best, in my opinion, and the ease of use is so good i can even put then throughout my parent's house.  If you have any 4K setup and you need a streaming stick this one fits the bill.  Set-up is a cakewalk with the Roku interface walking you through your options.  We've owned the standard streaming sticks but this one comes with a remote that lets you control your tv's volume (only works with the TV's volume not a separate soundbar which we have)  It would be nice if they allowed control of other sound devices.  The remote also has a voice search feature that i found myself using more and more to search for movies or shows i want to watch instead of scrolling through an endless list of media.  Overall this is a great streaming stick, and if you're looking to upgrade to a 4k stick this one is the one to get.

Cutting the cord is the single best thing we have done to save money in a long time! Our traditional cable bill was $350 and we cut it in half buying the Roku stick and going with Hulu Live and Netflix.I'm absolutely impressed with everything about the Roku stick. Easy to setup and install, easy to navigate, easy to add, delete, and change channel apps, works great on our medium speed wifi, have had almost no streaming issues at all, and the couple of issues we did have could have been the apps we were watching.It has been such a big hit in the house all the kids want one in their room now. If you're thinking of cutting the cord, Roku is definitely the way to go!

Trying to set up the stick with Amazon video was a hassle. It did not let us download the app even when going online as others have tried to so don't recommend it if you have Amazon prime. I wanted to give them a chance because they are less advertise on their streaming device unlike the fire stick but honestly it wasn't worth our trouble so I went with a fire stick from Amazon.  With the Amazon fire stick we also had a small issue signing in to my Amazon prime account. I had to call customer service and they did it for me somehow but now it streams well on our projector and we couldn't be happier

I purchased the Roku Streaming Stick+ to replace an Amazon Fire Stick for our basement TV. The Fire Stick was able to detect both my 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz networks, but did not work reliably when connected to the 5 GHz network. I decided to try the Roku device based upon the supposed high sensitivity receiver. The result was the Roku does not even detect the 5 GHz network. It has been working okay with the 2.4 GHz network, but as we spend more time in our workout area in the basement, I don't believe I will have good enough bandwidth at 2.4 GHz to stream 4K content. This is somewhat of a minor issue overall, however. I like the remote and simple UI that the Roku has, which is really beneficial for my wife since she is not the most tech savvy person. The downloadable app options are enormous.I would say that the Roku device, despite the inability to make use of my 5 GHz network, is an upgrade over my old Amazon Fire Stick.

It's easy to set up. There are YouTube vids if you want to go that route. I had a bit of trouble at first using it with my Panasonic plasma TV, but I got it figured out. You will need an internet connection to use this, of course.UPDATE:  Dropped this to 2 stars from 5. The Roku has developed a serious audio to video lag on most of the apps (channels) I get. Evidently, this is a problem for a LOT of users. There are some apps where this is not - or barely - noticeable, but Amazon Prime is terrible. The audio is at least a half second behind the video, sometimes more. Resetting the Roku hasn't helped. The Roku forums don't help much either.

This was a Prime Day Deal that I decided to splurge on to replace my existing Roku 3 which has the tendency to randomly power off. The Roku Streaming Stick + has been rock solid. Plug & Play. Launches fast, solid streaming. The dependability of this unit has me one step closer to cutting the cord on cable.This is a five-star product that I only gave 4-stars so that readers would know that I am a real user of the product and not one of the way-too-many on Amazon who give 5-star reviews in exchange for payment or free product.

We have gone to all Streaming TV. The Roku system is the greatest as it makes available & gives you control of all Streaming Programs that you desire to use. Some programs are free, some charge a monthly fee. You choose. The only cost is for the Roku units for each TV.  Roku also has a movie channel that’s free. The Roku Streaming Stick can be used on any TV as your traveling!!! We dumped the high cost AT&T, Direct TV to our own desired programs. We added Spectrum internet services with no limit as to the # of TV’s & Spectrum Mobile with unlimited phone calls or texts. Get on board to the Streaming World and save money; see exactly what you want when you want...

We had 5 tv's connected to ROKU Expresses; we were very pleased with the service, but experienced occasional sustained buffering. After looking into options, we decided to upgrade one tv with a ROKU Stick to allow us to put it on a separate 5G network.  It has solved our problem (so far) and we LOVE the ROKU remote with all the upgraded features.  Happy Campers in Georgia:)

I bought this unit 10/10/18 and it worked fine until around 7/10/19 (9 months) then had chronic problems as follows: the remote would not communicate with the Roku stick and when it did it was so slow you never knew when it would respond.  I contacted Roku CS on 7/13/19 and they said they would replace it with another unit after I return my bad unit first.  It took more than a week to receive another one which after several months had similar problems as the first unit.  In November of 2019 I bought an Amazon Fire-stick on sale for around $15,  The Roku cost was $60 when purchased.  I kept the Roku by mistake and today (3/19/20) decided to try it again just in case it might work again "Hope over experience" but it doesn't.  My Fire-stick works great but there were some apps that were on the Roku I liked that are not available on the Fire-stick albeit not really important.  I would not recommend this Roku to anyone who would be considering it.

I have bought two of these every time you turn it on you ha e to disconnect from tv and reconnectAnd it freezes. I sent one back for a new one. It does same thing. the other one was a gift for a friend it does sameThing. I have Purchased several fire sticks in the past few years I have never had any problems except for this model

Not perfect, it has the occasional server lag (could be my internet, but I doubt it - based on the type of lag behavior and the fact I get about 50mbps), but these are rare and momentary occurrences.I enjoy the home screen functionality a great deal. The user interface is VERY functional and offers a wealth of viewing information right from the moment you power up (which takes only 2 seconds).Indefinitely recommend if you want a smart tv (without replacing the tv you already have).

I have an older TV in the garage and was about to ditch it but remembered that for under $20 I could upgrade it to a smart TV with the Fire TV Stick Lite.  This is great!  I am able to watch YouTube, Netflix and so on with this.  It has given my old TV a breath of fresh air!

How or why would you make a device without an on and off button or volume button.  Had to use a separate remote for the volume.  Contacted Amazon about it and it also wouldn’t connect for us.  Went back to the original firestick which we love.  This lite version is horrible.

Much better we have had the same fire stick for about 6 years finally gave out on us new fire stick looks exactly the same but is much faster and better menu layout the only thing I would improve on is the spring design for the batteries in the remote and sturdier battery cover retainment

I do like the fire stick, however it was difficult to register with Amazon, took me forever. Also, the tv I originally planned to use this item with did not work!  However, we had another tv that would work so we used that one.  I would recommend this product; if you can deal with the small hassle of registering it.PS - The Customer Service I finally did reach was AWESOME!

Purchased for our boat. Works great! Pleased with it. Perfect picture quality. User friendly. Happy I bought it. Easy to install. Fast shipping. Plug it all in and begin viewing. Must have streaming subscription to view multiple content. And WiFi. It’s perfect for the lake!

Works as well as the regular fire stick but much cheaper. Using it on an older tv that doesn’t have 4K so this was perfect as the only difference seems to be 4K. I really enjoy the browsing button. You can view channels and free apps like cable which is a really nice change.

Love the alexa feature less use of my hands & doesn't effect my carpel tunnel with having to do a lot of surfing or typing. The only problem I seem to have with it is when I switch to using my roku & come back to use my fire tv I have to unplug the fire tv to reset it or I have no volume. Other wise I like it over all.

I own apple tv, chromcast and roku, each device has its limit . when I get this little device , I am totally surprised , it is fast, It support most of the apps I need. it even support apple tv. so I can watch all my content in a single device.  I just purchased another one with TV control.

This device is an absolute champion of streaming entertainment.  The streaming stick plus is a compact marvel that deftly handled everything I've thrown at it with aplomb.The roku stick plus is a breeze to set up.  The entire process took less than 3 minutes, including adding controls for my television's power and volume (how awesome is that!!)The stick plus pushed 4k content to my TV with nary a hiccup despite being 3 rooms over and two floor up from my router.  Excellent wifi reception... No other device even comes close (I have a difficult time connecting any if my tablets to wifi in that room).The interface couldn't be easier. Everything is laid out intuitively.  And I love the holiday themed backgrounds... Wonderful touch, ROKU!I've had numerous roku devices from every generation.  As I've upgraded, I gave my old devices to family and friends.  I've helped to build our own little roku fan club. Now I just need to get 1 more streaming stick plus and I can pass along my last gen devices to needy tech-challenged family members!

Roku is easy to install and the remote is so simple and uncomplicated. I switched from Directv to Directv Now and, after reading several reviews, decided on Roku Streaming stick + because of my 2K/5K router. I've noticed no difference in picture quality and I don't have to be bothered with losing the feed due to weather as I used to with Directv. I've converted all of my TV's to Roku SS+ and it has been well worth it. With the $90/month I'm saving by going to Directv Now the payback will only be 2 months. Roku also offers Acorn TV which is great if you're into foreign television (the stuff you usually see on PBS.)

If you have family members who don't deal well with change, this is for you.  You choose what services you want.  Some are pay services, many are not.  As someone who doesn't like the idea of machines listening to me, the voice function of this product only works when you press the microphone button.  I've come to really enjoy this feature.  I suggest you try it.  I uttered "acoustic guitar", and it brought up talk shows, documentaries and even free guitar lessons.  Explore the different free services.  There's a Three Stooges app that includes Abbott and Costello and many other old shows I fell in love with as a child.  Yes, I'm dating myself, which should also tell you how easy this system is to use.  I suggest plugging in the power module instead of using a USB plug on the TV.  That saves you the time of boot up each time you turn on the TV.  My wife now favors streaming.  She doesn't need a DVR anymore and she can target what she watches, instead of just hoping something interesting is on.  We're also saving $80 a month on cable services.

I am very happy with this unit.  I also bought another one for my girlfriend.  The voice command works fine.  The amount of available programs that can be streamed is amazing.  Picture quality is great...and it works with my 5.1 system.  Once I add one more to my kitchen TV I will be ready give the boot to my satellite TV system.

Despite a little bit of a headache to first set-up, especially with trying to get the device to be recognized properly, in which I had to use Roku's on-line chat to correct the issue, once the unit was set up it works beautifully. This particular unit is in our upstairs master bedroom, and our router is on the first floor, but there is zero lag in streaming and  the picture and sound are sharp and clear. I was so happy with it that I picked up the Roku Express for our living room.I have not yet experimented with voice control, but I can see an obvious value to it. On the other hand, having the one-source TV viewable link to connect all my streaming services is amazing and well worth the cost and initial effort.

Perfect, exactly what I needed and couldn't be happier. I have different model Roku devices around my house but never got a stick before. This is plugged right into my projector and works as good as my 4k ultra Rokus do. Steam is solid, the stick is responsive and it's pulling an excellent rating from my wifi across the house. I have it plugged into my HDMI port and powered by the USB so no extra wires hanging around to plug into the wall. Now I can move the projector around and have movie night in any room or outdoors... Plus I can stream to the stick like you can with any Roku from my desktop computer so I can do halloween and soon Christmas projections in my window. Simply choose from the bottom right of your start bar the project or connect feature and choose this Roku product. Love it.

We have an older model of a Google tv - initially it was great when it was one of the first smart tvs available.  Over time the apps started falling off.  Google no longer supported Amazon streaming, so we bought an Amazon Fire Stick.  That was great and it extended our ability to enjoy more channels.  We also are big fans of YouTube, especially for music video streaming.  Recently it was announced that YouTube is no longer available on the Fire Stick, so we bought the Roku Streaming Stick.  WOW!!!!  Not only are there so many more options, the video quality of our older model smart tv has improved dramatically.  Maybe someday we'll buy a newer model smart tv, but for now this Roku addition has made a world of difference to our entertainment equipment.

Purchased this on Black Friday for $29.  It's for use in my office so I didn't want to pay Comcast another $10 monthly premium for a box that I will hardly use, but I was concerned I wouldn't get all the channels and features.  Hooked it up last week and WOW!  I can't pause/rewind live TV, but I can view every channel I've wanted to so far, I can view all of my recordings...does the job and then some!  I will be swapping out a few more cable boxes in my house to ROKU boxes...even at $49 I'll pay for them in just a few months.  Netflix and Prime Video also work very well as does Pandora...which has a very cool interface by the way.  Very pleased with the ROKU service...

I have 4 Roku +'s. Interface IMO is better than ANY smart TV or Fire Stick. Roku is the preeminent streaming engine and all of the Content Streamers make sure that their Apps work with them. I have never had a software problem. The only complaint is their Remote w/TV power and volume where getting it to work is a crapshoot. It works with TV Speaker volume but not with any name soundbar except apparently Roku's own sounder. The on/off power intermitant so keep your TV Remote close  as you will need it.Save yourself the $$ and aggravation and buy HD Roku Stick w/the basic remote. Roku should fix their remote problems or stop marketing a product so deficient.

I bought this to go on my 4K TV and the picture is great. Wish there was more 4K content but that will come in time. Easy to use and configure. The remote has an earphone jack on it which is so cool if you are in bed and your partner wants to sleep while you watch TV in bed. Tons of apps and I see more every month. Works will with YouTube, YouTubeTV, NetFlix, Hulu, Spotify, Amazon Prime Video,  Intune-In Radio, Siruis XM Radio an many others.

Very few issues with streaming quality and like the way the home page is organized.  Love the movie trailers that play automatically when movie is highlighted.  Alexa search works well too.One issue is that if a movie is paused for more than few minutes, the screen goes to back to the main menu or somewhere and I have to search again for the movie I was just watching.Finally, Amazon could try to get regional sports networks apps to add.  The streaming services can't do it or don't have contracts with those networks.

This is my 4th fire stick for a 4th tv in the house. I am not sure why but with the last one purchased I have had to re-set it 3 times by simply unplugging it and plug it back in. I have only had to do this on this last stick. The other three have not needed this. The three re-sets were over about a months time.

I already have Amazon prime though Comcast or directly through my smart TV. I bought this under the impression I could screen mirror my Kindle to my TV only to find out the newer generation kindle odes not allow for that. Very disappointed that Amazon took that feature away.

My 4th one, all working, I've learned to appreciate them for for what they are, was a long life satellite TV watcher and satellite installer, so it was a change and adjustment, I'm paying a fourth of what my bill use to be, is it better than satellite? Nope, but it's more than adequate if TV is important to you.

I don’t like this version. If I go to the kitchen and grab something, when I come back, this stick has backed all the way out of my show and the app I was watching it in and it’s back at the Home Screen. It also doesn’t have DCUniverse or Peacock. I also couldn’t download my favorite virtual church app either. Roku is better now

The fire stick - easy install, easy operation and the application worked very well with my home system. The draw back; I found my data usage from streaming went way up. The packages offered in my area data caps are #1 - $40.00 for 350GB, #2 -$65.00 for 700GB and #3 - $75.00 for 1200GB. In other localities 1TB is the data cap start point.  This alone made staying with Direct TV more affordable.

I bought this product because it claimed to have the HBOMAX app on it. After a 20 minute update there was no app on this product or information on how to connect to it.I would not have purchased it knowing this. Amazon was not upfront about this product and should refund me the purchase price.

The fire stick did not work properly. I couldn't install any channel. When I tried to get a new channel, a windows appeared that said "app not found". I tried everything I could find on the internet but there was no fix for it. I tried resetting it, free storage space, uninstalling ad block apps ...I previously had a roku (which I had no issue with) and I am now going back with it.

As an older person, I was nervous about putting this Christmas gift into action, however, my fears were quickly overcome by the intuitive functions and controls.  While we still have much to learn and explore, we are quite pleased with its benefits and we compliment Amazon's developers.

Good budget option for older TVs with HDMI to stream. Contrary to internet searching, Spectrum does not stream on it. Otherwise it is ok. I do have to restart mine often. Not sure if it is a bad unit or bad choice. I don't use it a whole lot to complain about it much.

Love the Roku, hate the remote. The batteries are dead every time we pick the remote up. Looking at specific battery related reviews, people have replaced replaced the remote and had the same problem. So, I guess we will pull out batteries after each use. Grrrr. This seems like the stupidest design flaw.

I bought one of these Roku Streaming Stick+ devices for a technically-incompetent friend, and she's continue to use it and reports no problems.I bought another one of these for my mother -- someone who's just technical enough to mess up anything that's been pre-set with her most-used options, and she was able to use the Roku without error.I'd definitely buy another Roku Streaming Stick+, when the need arises.  It's much easier to use than certain other content streaming dongles from a certain worldwide online sales organization.

This is the answer to the Cable companies finding new ways to rip you off by charging rent on their boxes. Spectrum and Hawaii TelComm are in Kahouts or they are together in price fixing. Both come out same time changing their systems and the pricing is the exact same. They want to charge $10 a box a month which seems minute until you times it by the 5 television sets, and this is ontop of the $160 they charge monthly. You have to go through a few steps and it takes a little while to get used too but it is worth it.  $50 a stick for 5 TVs comes out to $250 one time or rent at $10 a box for 5 TVs and pay $600 a year.  Plus with Roku you get a lot more channels and free movies.

I finally got it running.  Once it's in, it's great.  But I found it very difficult to install.  The whole process seems to be oriented towards capturing your subscription.  it took me a while, and a lot of searching on the internet to figure out how to initialize it without using my credit card for Roku subscriptions.

Bought this because I saw many reviews stating that this was the best streaming device with the best interface The interface is OK and the device as a whole is  just OK but there are a decent amount of unexpected downsides Voice control is not supported on most applications including YouTubeWhen it does work it works very poorly The streaming stick and remote often get very hotIt randomly causes my TV to turn on and off for no reason A decent amount of buffering when watching videos even though the device is right next to my router and I have very good Internet After about two minutes of me not using the remote it turns off completely and takes about 30 seconds to turn back on which can be annoying when trying to watch YouTube videos or quickly pause This could be a feature to save battery but I haven’t found a way to turn it off if it is

Cuando me llegó el dispositivo a finales de julio de 2020, realicé la instalación y todo funcionó perfectamente, hasta hace una semana que el roku no encendió más, me comunique con el distribuidor que convenientemente me informó que la garantía era de tres meses y que ya no cubría el servicio, me comuniqué con el servicio técnico de Roku y me informan que no atienden casos de dispositivos que son comprados en un país diferente al enviado. Me pregunto entonces porque venden este dispositivo a otros países si no van a solucionar los problemas que se presentan, me resulta muy discriminatorio y conveniente para ellos. En fin, no compren este dispositivo, si se les daña y son de un país diferente a EEUU no les van a responder.

I’m a big Roku person, been using them for years. I have two Ultra’s currently and after picking up a new 50” TV recently that I am going to mount on a wall mount I needed another streaming device. I originally picked up a Firestick 4K but I just can’t get all the apps I want without having to use some hacky 3rd party sideloaded apps that are buggy, so I returned that and picked up this Streaming Stick+. So far I’ve used it for several hours and haven’t had any issues with it, it’s zippy and steams 4K on all the major apps flawlessly. I haven't tested the voice integration as that’s not really my thing.Unless you need the external connections the Ultra offers, I’d suggest picking up a Streaming Stick+ instead and save yourself $50 or more dollars!

Two units and both had issues with the remote.  The remote kills the batteries after a short time.  Now that I am past the Amazon return window by just a few days, I am stuck dealing with Ruko who won’t speak to a live customer.  I have to go through email.  Not happy!  Other than the issue with the remote, the actual streaming device works fine.

Works better than the older version. I have no problem connecting to wireless WiFi in my bed rm. WiFi is downstairs and there’s no buffering or connecting issues so far. I’ve been using it for a month. My only negative would be there no main Amazon button they put Disney plus as one replacing the Amazon shortcut. I bought it so I could watch Discovery plus seeing it’s not currently on Amazon. My smart TVs would download the app for some reason?? But I’m enjoying it and it functions!

I had an ancient Roku which was great for many years but I noticed it was slow to load programs or didn't load them at all. I thought it was my internet so ordered this model with the internet boost feature and what a world of difference, it works like the tv that sits next to the wifi modem. Quick, efficient, no lag time and the newer features are A+, very happy with this purchase and wish I would have thought to do it long ago!

Garbage.  Remote barely worked for a couple months.  Had to keep hitting the buttons repeatedly to get any response, even after checking the batteries with DMM, & trying fresh batteries.  Stick kept freezing up, meaning that the stream would stop & continuously clock, wouldn’t connect to the network, wouldn’t load a channel or app & kept saying that there wasn’t enough space to launch an app.  Tried resetting to factory new settings & setting up fresh again.  Works once or twice & goes back to all the same issues.  Completely useless!!!

The added antenna is definitely worth it.  I couldn't use the usb plug in the tv because it didn't push enough juice for the antenna so grabbed a space usb adapter for a wall plug.  I've had mine for a few years and the only rear issue I've  had and it's lately is that it seems to be loosing the volume on occasion.  The trick seems to be to unplug it and let it cool off because it's fine afterwards.  I was able to bend the tip a little being careless with them back of the tv but it still works.I even bought two more of these for my parents and they're happy with them too.

I'm 65 a just had both knees totally replaced the hardest part was climbing up on a ladder. Oh one thing worth mentioning is the stick itself was underneath the packaging. The way it pulls out in the tray it appears that everything is in the plastic tray. It's not pull the packaging out completely because hiding down underneath the packaging is the stick itself. Once I got that far it was easy peasy from that point on. It will be for you too.Don't let some grandma show you up. Stop whining and set up your Roku yourself. Then you'll feel good about accomplishing the hook-up all on your own. So if someone complains to you about watching TV in the middle of the day tell them "I deserve it cause I just set up the Roku all by myself." Then make the motion of dusting your self off - with a big grin on your face.

excellent compared to the two older models of Roku I dealt with first for my mom starting 2010 or 12 & 2016 the speed is very good on the menu and it looks better or is setup a little different somehow I am a 36 year computer geek/tech and I can honestly say I love it, I was using my ps3 for my streaming media but when I ran across a professional review for this in a comparison format I decided to get it especially for this price $45.36 so if you have an hd TV (doesn't have to be smart) with a USB port for convenience of power source (not a necessity) I highly recommend this Roku  you will not be disappointed

I replaced an aging roku with this model.The speed that it loads as opposed to the older one is drastic this one loads fast, at 4kThe quality is superior, I'm very happy with it.He only downsize it's because it's a stick and it doesn't have an infrared remote sensor my TV remote won't control it.

Works great with the Xfinity app and all of the standard apps. For some reason it dosen't have a regular YouTube app, but none of these are perfect. Compared to a fire stick this is a hundred miles ahead of it as far as the interface, apps, remote and overall usability.My only complaint is that you can't get a remote with numbers on it. That makes using the xfinity app a little challenging because you can't go directly to the channel you want, but if you setup favorite channels it isn't so bad.

I had a Roku 2XS connected to the TV we use with our treadmill. While the unit served its purpose, it was time to upgrade. The streaming via WiFi was getting slow and some apps like YouTube kept crashing. While the operating system was up to date, the Roku 2XS was just not up to the task.I purchased the Roku Streaming Stick+ | 4K/HDR/HD as an upgrade since it supported HD and Wireless N/5ghz.Since I already have a Roku account, setup was easy and the unit picked up our faster Wireless N signal from our router.The streaming was fast and the apps are updated and don’t crash compared to the Roku 2XS.The remote is great. It detected our TV resolution and it can power on/off the TV and control the volume. Since the Roku is plugged into the HDMI port behind the TV, it also doesn’t need to be in the line of sight as with most infrared controllers.The output on the display is nice and the Roku auto-detected the TV outputs 1080p.Treadmill workouts are now great with the newer Roku, and I’m happy with the upgrade!

When the device works it is awesome. However, over the last 3-4 months it has continuously gotten worse. A couple times a month it will lose connectivity entirely - which will require me to reboot it. Upon reboot it freezes over and over and over when trying to access the network settings to reconnect to my internet.I’ve talked to customer support twice - the first time they told me to just hard reboot it. Which works. But also kicks me out of all my services and requires me to sign in, over and over and over again. Not scalable or a great user experience.The second time, after hours of troubleshooting, they agreed to replace it as faulty. Except they want me to send it to them, and pay for shipping, and wait while they validate the issue, after which they’ll ship me a replacement in 3-5 business days. After 30 minutes or arguing they decided I was a valuable enough customer to issue me a replacement “in advance” and I can send them back the faulty one.Terrible experience with them as a company. Just pay the extra money and get an Apple TV 4K so you never have to worry about quality, customer service, or wasting hours of your life troubleshooting these things.

The Roku is the BEST way to go to make it possible to have a streaming app or opportunity that your device may not have automatically or included. For example, if your a Spectrum customer, to have their app available to your TV (especially on older TVs, but even on NEWER ones too). It also gives you the opportunity to get other, more mainstream apps, that didn't come installed on your DVD, BluRay, DVR, or other devices. Like for people looking to get the Apple+ or Disney+ features. Not ALL apps might be available though, at the current time - but the option is possible because the Roku gives you the option.

We don't use Alexa...by choice...for privacy/security.We do love this Roku tho. Lots of research to find the right one for our needs. This was plug and play set up for our older Vizio TV to get rid of Spectrum box. It's already on the app, which isn't the case for the Amazon streaming version product. Wished we'd have bought Roku first ffg or simplicity of set up. Bought more for other TVs. Happy with the higher PPI and ease of remote. No bulky remotes or rabbit ears any longer. A great bonus!

I can't get over the Fire TV. It's so versatile. The music selections are so cool. Amazon Prime Video streams flawlessly. There are so many possibilities. The only saving grace are all of the music channels that help me get to sleep once I can pull myself away from experimenting with all the various apps. And  Alexa  is educating me on various actor bios after seeing them in a movie.  As is probably evident, I'm darned excited about my new  toy. Thanks Amazon!

I have this Lite and the Reg Fire Stick.. Both are absolute winners.. Fear not you will be super happy with either.. 69 years young and cut the cord last month.. OH MY GOSH WHY OH WHY did I take so long.. Have more TVthan I did with cable... Walk don’t run to your Fire Stick n buy!!!!

We love our fire sticks. We have 5 now and use them on all of our smart TVs. We like them better than any of our tv app set ups. We bought the first one bc our smart tv wouldn’t load Hulu and the tv was less than 2 years and customer support was no help. I will never buy another smart tv.

My old Firestick got stuck in the updating cycle so had to buy a new one. This one works fine so far and other than having to update it as soon as I received it, I haven't had any issues so far. Still think the price is a bit high, but that would be my only complaint.
Love the style and look and everything it's just that sometimes the volume will go completely blank and you have to restart it

Works great, very easy to add memory to, very happy with the fire sticks lite, I never  use the TV buttons on my 4k so don't miss them at all, as far as 4k video I don't know if it's worth the difference in cost. I've bought two more, all the specs are the same as any other fire stick so guess I'm happy.

I got this firestick in order to watch some streaming services which were not available for my Samsung TV.This is great so I no longer need to watch Apple TV or Disney plus on the iphone or ipad small screens.  I recently took it to my vacation home and am so happy that it is easily transferred from the TV

It's good for the price and it works great one problem that I have is when I ask alexa to change the volume she says "i can't" or she does it. (Because I have a roku tv paired to alexa so I can control it) otherwise no problems!Update: (December after the new ui update) the alexa problem has been solved she fully controls my tv without any problems and like it was a good product I even bought annother fire stick lite good quality 10/10.

sometimes the streaming pauses in the middle of a movie.  Every time we want to use the stick we have to unplug the cord and wait a second or two and then plug it back in order for it to work, really disappointed. I was going to sent it back but I threw  the box away

I like the firestick much better than the roku streaming sticks I returned (that acted up on me a lot. One died within 30 days and the other kept freezing up). This is my 2nd firestick. My first one (2nd gen I’ve had many years) is still working well but I wanted to be able to add USB storage so I went with the new firestick lite + an OTB cable + a USB storage device. Everything works great!

My brother bought me one of this on black Friday fire stick lite 2020 version is very fast compared to the previous one this one I notice that the apps install very quickly apps are very responsive great buy for watching movies and tv shows I'm very happy with this fire stick lite

I'm in love with my Fire TV stick. It connects me to all my favorite apps instantly. If you want a user-friendly controller that has a few buttons and the capability to help you navigate and discover new apps. This is the device that you will appreciate having as part of your entertainment system. Be good and be safe!

After using my original Stik for several years, I was pleasantly surprised at the increased speed of the newer generation  Fire TV Stik. The processor speed is what I think makes the difference. This one loads the Apps much quicker. I opted to not go with the HD version because I live in a rural setting that is not served by broadband, only cellular based internet. I doubt that the large providers will ever consider us worthwhile to provide service to. But, this new Stik serves our needs and works very well at the speeds we have. Thank you Amazon.

There is nothing bad to say about Amazon Fire Stick Lite.  The set up was easy.  Plug it into HDMI port, log in with Amazon account, and wait for it to update.  That's basically it.  The only thing that is slightly negative is that there is no way to lower the volume level of the fire stick.  Other than that, I love it.  Wish I had purchased it sooner but better late then never.  Thank you, Amazon, for turning my TV into entertainment central! 😊👍🏻

I don’t have cable just have internet so the fire stick is wonderful for viewing this way. Having Alexa is quick and easy to use. It helps to go to what you want without having to do a lot of searching. I now have 3 tv’s with this on and will be ordering the last one soon.

I was given an advertisement for the Firestick 4K tv on sale for $29.99. The next day I went to purchase it and the sale was gone, the code I was given one day earlier did not work and the fire stick 4K was only available for $39.99 which was outside of my budget. The Firestick lite was on sale for $21.99 so I purchased it. The very next day; after the lite was delivered, I was given the advertisement for the 4K stick for the $29.99 again. I was very dissapointed as I would’ve rather had the 4K instead of the lite. Lite works ok but dissapointed with the Amazon service and discount issues.

Everybody keeps going on and on about how awesome their fire stick is.  I ask them "isn't it the same thing as Roku?"  They're like "no, no, this is so much better."  No it's not.  It's the exact same thing.  No better, no worse.  If you already have a Roku, don't bother.

This is my first Fire Stick and I am very happy with the ease of setup an d quick response from the remote and software. I also use the Dish Hopper 3 to watch Prime, Youtube, and Netflix and the Fire Stick is much more response and requires no reboots every so often, unlike the Hopper.

The remote control is deceptively simple and user-friendly - not too many buttons, for a change - BUT why did a designer think putting controls on the SIDE of the remote, instead of on top with all the other buttons,  was a good idea?  I did not see the side-located buttons, and did not feel them with my  aging hands, and could not figure out why my television was mysteriously muted then not, and volume going up or down without cause. Then I accidentally saw the side-located buttons, and viola! the mystery was solved!  Stupid, stupid location for those critical controls!  But I will live with it.  The television seems fine, and if it serves for years I will be very happy.

I bought this as a replacement for my old Fire stick that stopped working, it was the very first one released, so it was about time to upgrade.  Love the voice command.  It's a lot easier to use than going to every letter with the remote when searching for a show to watch.
The ROKU is easy to set up and navigate.  Great Product!  Lots of selections of things to watch.

I had been streaming over my TV via a laptop for over a decade and it was good but the RUKU will stream 4K on my TV and that made a wonderful difference. Glad I got it. Plus it opened up the door for other things to watch, even though I usually only watch things in the evening if I choose to. I still miss having my connection to other things I watched on my laptop though.

We've gone through more batteries on this remote than what we've paid for it.  I've reached out to customer service, which by the way is NOT an 800 number so you can't talk to an individual, and am waiting to hear back from them.  From searching online, I see that this is a known issue, but I don't see any type of resolution online.  I will update this when I hear back from ROKUUPDATE:  ROKU has contacted me and advised that I plug the USB port into the wall outlet and to not just use the television as the power source.  That appears to be working now so I am upping the rating to 3 stars.

The unit is handy to use but there is no way to shut it off. therefore it drains batteries continually, every 4-5 days???Another disappointment: everything you watch comes with loads of commercials. ??  It is relatively easy to setup but the way it eats batteries is ridicules.  With my apple tv, I only changed once a year at most.

This works great but has an issue.  I first connected this using the TV USB port and that was a huge failure.  Went through batteries in a day or two.  Dropped my issue into GOOGLE and found this to be a known problem.  Stopped using the USB port to power the unit in favor of a wall plug and my troubles went away.  Unfortunately, using the electric plug for me is not a clean installation.  I have a second wire to look at and I specifically purchased this unit to prevent this kind of connection.

The  Roku Streaming Stick + does a very good job at streaming long range. The stream quality is better than my older Firestick.  One major drawback is that I wanted to used it to stream broadcast live TV from my HDHomerun Prime.  I cannot see all the broadcast channels, only a few. My older Firestick can play all the channels streaming from my HDHomerun Prime. I contacted both Roku support and Silicon Dust support about this issue and found out that  the Roku was designed to play web streaming video and does a good job of that but broadcast/cable TV only works for some at all because of some overlap between the formats it uses and one of the streaming formats and also that broadcast TV does other things that streaming doesn't, then it will not play. This differs with each Roku model. Hopefully this will be examined further and one can hope for a fix in the future.

UPDATE: As you can see from my original review, I was very happy with Roku after my first purchase. I continued to be happy for well over a year when I starting having problems with the Roku screen freezing when I transferred from my Directv to the Roku stick. The problem persisted until I finally decided to buy a newer stick, thinking it would, of course, clear up the problem. Unfortunately, the setup on the newest purchase (just last week) did not go well. Lots of things went wrong, but I finally got it up and working...until I realized I couldn't sign in to my Showtime account, which is purchased through Roku. After being on customer service chat for at least an hour, they finally gave me a fix. And then...a day after that, I started experiencing the exact same problem with the remote--it freezes when I pull up Roku. The only fix I've found is to unplug the unit, plug it back in, take out the batteries, and pair the remote with the TV again. Nope. I've contacted Roku again. If they're not able to offer a real fix, I'm returning the stick. This appears to be a known issue (read the one star reviews). Why in the world isn't Roku fixing this?!ORIGINAL REVIEW: I've been using an Amazon Fire Stick for several years, and, though I love Amazon, I was never totally happy with it as a media device. It was very limited and balky, and in recent months it needed to be rebooted every time I wanted to use it.I'd heard good things about Roku, so I grabbed this at a great deal. It works like a dream! It' much more intuitive and user-friendly than the Amazon Fire Stick (which has now been relegated to a less-used TV).I heartily recommend this device. You won't regret it.

Easy set up and use. Bought the Roku stick as our "Smart TV" was not so smart anymore! Able to subscribe to more streaming services which is the main reason for buying!Did my research between the Roku stick and Amazon Firestick. Everyone I talked to that had both, recommended the Roku stick over Amazon Firebox or Firestick. Even the comments I got from people who had one or the other recommended the Roku stick!

I have both Fire Stick and now Roku. Sorry Amazon, Roku is wayyyyy better. Remote is so nice and so much easier to use than the Fire Stick. I am in my fifties and want a easy to use, nice remote. Streaming service is also much more user friendly. I am really happy with this purchase and rarely write reviews. Wanted to put my two cents in on this one. Five Solid Stars.

I had been puzzled why so few of the newer 4k products (DVD players, TVs, projectors, etc) won't allow you to add new streaming apps--or if they do, it can be very difficult.  So, when I discovered this little unit for just under $40, I was very happy. Playback is nice and sharp, and audio quality is also superb. It's also very user friendly--easy to navigate and find what you're looking for, and installation couldn't be easier.

I like this alternative but wish the menus were the same as the original interface.  I can find some things but would appreciate standardization.  I do not like going from one device to another and finding it different and having to figure out where it is on the other interface.

Amazon Fire tv is just awesome!  I've had it on my smart TV for a few years and don't know why I didn't put it on my non-smart tv in the bedroom.  I finally did and it turned my non-smart tv into a smart tv.  Now, I can turn on relaxing music to go to sleep by and get everything else I get on the big living room tv.  Awesome, awesome device and it's only twenty something dollars!

The apps are much smaller with the new layout and make is hard to see. As always with the fireTV, very hard to read the blurbs for shows, font cannot be enlarged. Accessibility magnifier works, but is frustrating that it greatly enlarges just one portion of the screen. Would prefer that you could just enlarge font.

Was very disappointed in the picture quality after I installed the firestick lite, dark harder to see images, some blurring in the picture quality, had higher expectations because my older firestick worked so well. Figured this one would surpass the older one in quality.

I appreciate being able to “recycle” my older TV by making it smart instead of buying a smart TVS. This device took a total of 10-15 minutes to setup including logging into a few of my favorites applications such as Netflix, Hulu, and Disney+. They provide exact steps to follow on the screen in order to be efficient with your time, allowing the option to login with another device instead of typing in the login info using the remote. The voice activation is also handy for someone who’s not good at typing one letter at a time with the remote. For someone who isn’t too tech savvy, this was very easy to use!

Works great but as I was setting this up as a gift for my father in law on my own tv, once I removed the fire stick it changed the settings on my TV/Xbox and I wasn’t able to change it back. My TV was at 1080p and then changed the resolution to 640 x 480 as well as my Xbox - I wasn’t able to change the settings back even with a TV remote to the point I had to buy a whole new TV.

I bought this so I could run my tv speakers through Alexa. Nearly every time I tried to stream a channel--particularly PBS--it would freeze after a few minutes or lose the sound. I'm sorry I spent the $30. My Roku works much better even if I have to listen to the tinny TV sound.

Love my fire sticks, but it has come to the point of using my phone as the controller, because they controllers eat triple a batteries faster than any controller I have ever owned in my life, I feel like I am always replacing them and its super annoying, it shouldn't be draining power like this.

Fairly rudimentary streaming device, no extra ginger bread, just good value. Set up easily and quickly and best of all my sign in passwords are remembered by firestick/Amazon. As far as not having TV controls, I don’t regret saving the money at all it’s no big deal.

It doesn't always play right yours have to go back behind the TV and unplug it and plug it back in it freezes up a lot A lot of times the audio doesn't work till you disconnect from the back of the TV and plug it back in other than that works like the old 1 I have

Roku streaming stick.  I could not get this to connect with my wireless network (which had just been upgraded along with my modem and router. There is no way to talk to a human. I sent in a ticket, received an email back and did what it said. Didn't work and they referred me back to the website. Of course I just missed the return window so I threw it out.

I had a Roku 2 for years with no problems. I decided to upgrade to the Roku Stick, but every day at some point the sound became distorted and garbled. I tried everything, different HDMI ports, different cables, even brought the Roku stick that was working perfectly on another TV and hooked it up, everything that could be changed was changed and nothing helped. So I had to send it back. Then I then got a Roku Ultra because it has the option of a direct connection rather than WiFi. It's better, but still distorts occasionally. I am still a big Roku fan because the interface is very user friendly and in all other ways, it works perfectly.

Since I am working from home I wanted to have a way to wirelessly mirror my laptop to my TV. It's an older one so it doesn't have any smarts built-in. Hooked this up and it works beautifully. I keep my security cameras pulled up on the TV at all times while I'm working to keep an eye on the house. Haven't used it for streaming or anything but the Rokus usually work well.

I have 2 LG Roku TV's in my second home, so I decided to get the Roku stick for my primary residence because I really like the features of the Roku Service and my Samsung TV's at home don't have all the apps that you can get with a Roku Stick.  I've never had a problem with streaming, however, I have an Eero whole home mesh system so I don't have any WiFi dead spots in my home so my streaming has never been interrupted.  For me the best thing is all the streaming services available on Roku that are not available for Samsung TV's.  The voice command is a nice feature too, although, I always forget to use it.

Had an old one that was regifted a few times before I broke the chain and actually opened it up to use. It was so slow and frustrating to navigate, especially through YouTube. I know part had to do with being at the edge of max range so better WiFi capabilities was my prime focus for replacement. This new Stick+ is like a Bugatti Veyron in comparison. I love it. It is so fast and getting strong connection at the furthest points of the house through all the walls and ceiling. Good job guys

Easy setup. Good video output for online streaming to a 55" screen. I've had better luck with some of the Roku apps (youtube, pandora) than the equivalents built into samsung TVs.The remote with this device is infuriatingly unreliable; Hitting the Pause/Play button might work, it might not work, or it might have a 1-2 second delay. I've had to kill the power and re-sync the remote once in the last month when it completely lost connection. However, the phone app for controlling it is fantastic! If you need to enter user info or do searches, use the phone app so you can type on your phone's keyboard.Occasionally, it has network connection issues, but my internet connection is somewhat unstable.I got it to access services that didn't have native apps for my tv. Some paid services really need to work on their interfaces.

Streams fine and has all the major apps.  Super annoying bug - the remote frequently becomes disconnected with the device and needs to be 'reset' via a button in the battery cover.  Also drains batteries FAST which is surprising considering it has no displays, lights and is not doing anything 99% of time.  Support sent a weak response about headphones draining the batteries (??).  I have no idea what that means, but I would like the to address this issue which seems to be pretty common.Also annoying, they do not include the flexible HDMI extender with the stick which they really should.  You have to request it and wait for mail.

We love these ROKU Streaming Sticks! I installed these on a Samsung 55", Sharp 70" and Vizio 55" and they worked perfectly on all TV's. These are older Smart TVs that do not allow the ongoing addition of apps. They only have Netflix and Amazon and we wanted to add more. Easy to install and simple directions. Just plug into HDMI. They enhance the Wi-FI signal so that there is no lag time or buffering when in use. The search and screen functions are super fast. So easy to add new channels/services so we are now cutting the cable TV cord! Remote is also uncluttered and easy to use. I looked for quite a while until a friend recommended this particular ROKU model. Exceeded our expectations.

I have not been able to get on Netflex or Hulu (daughters accounts) but not Roku's fault.  Also volume buttons don't work but probably something I am doing wrong.  At least I can get Prime so far.  Will give a call to those two streamers for about the 5th time each to see why I can't get back into their streaming.  I had a regular Roko stick and after several years the remote went bad so tried to upgrade.  That is probably where the problem is, probably should have stayed with what I knew.

This is our second Roku box.  We like Roku on our main TV and expect to enjoy this too.Main complaint is that the claim that you just plug this in and start streaming is literally a large blatant lie.  There are about 100 screens you need to work your way through to set up the Roku stick.  And then a bunch of things to do on your computer too.  Setup worked for us,  but I'm not that fond of being lied to.

It was easy to hook up and download the programming just by following the prompts. I rated it as a 'Four Star' because I've only watched one movie so far, that makes it difficult to evaluate the overall performance of the Fire Stick right now, but so far, so good!

Not a simple 'plug and play'. It came with no instructions, nor any link for instructions. I ended up having to buy a book to figure it out. But it works well for what I needed, which was to stream PBS.org shows to my LG TV whose browser doesn't play nice with PBS.

I have to keep unplugging and plugging back in to get it to work. Sometimes it loads the apps but no sound, then unplug and plug again and suddenly sound. I don’t get why this lite works sometimes and doesn’t other times. Should’ve just got the regular fire stick.

Received this as a gift. Pretty straight forward install. Pretty straight forward integration with Alexa. Pretty user friendly remote control. This model did not have volume control, but that would be pretty handy. All-in-All a pretty thoughtful gift. I am able to access Prime options easily, and the device allows me to access other media providers with a click. Pretty Spiffy!

I own 3 Fire TV Stick, previous to the introduction of Lite. sideloading apps ran smooth, but not with this Lite version. I have read the numerous reviews and everyone seems to have the same issue, the solution to which is to wait for an update of the Lite version.
This is my 5th firestick. I bought this one because it was described as having 8 gb of storage, but only shows 5 gb as the older ones.

This thing lags and freezes every other day, I constantly have to unplug it and reset it. The voice recognition is trash, if I wanted to still have to select an app after using the voice control, I just wouldn’t use voice control. Then my internet went out and came back on, every device in my house reconnected, but with the fire sticks I had to reset them. The idea is nice, but I expected something a lot better from a company like amazon.

This Firestick deserves 0 stars. I ordered this on Black Friday. I have to unplug it from the wall in order to get the home screen to pop up. I've called tech support 4 times. The 1st rep was clueless and seemed annoyed, the 2nd wasn't much help either. The 3rd rep had me to do an update which seemed to help one of the issues(no volumn) so I thought. I had to reset it again, then the sound came back, but I still have to unplug it in order to get the home screen when I turn the TV on so, I called again, explained the issue to the 4th rep, and asked how do I go about returning this piece of crap and order another one, and this rep hung up the phone. 🤷🏽‍♀️

It took less than five minutes to set up which is great for me being someone with no patience at all.😀 and this is my first remote with voice control which is amazing; no more fumbling around trying to see when you’re watching in a dark room. And the best part is she understands what you’re saying unlike some voice assistants. I’m impressed already.

Was pretty much already set up when I received. Amazon took care of that. My part took about 5 minutes and that includes taking everything out of box, setting up and finishing programming. Should have gotten a fire stick way sooner. Made streaming much easier and quicker.

I brought this fire stick because the one that I had was a generation 1 and was give us trouble.. I was kinda skeptical when I purchased this. Once it arrived I hooked it up. It was very easy to install, and because of this I ordered two more because of this price.
Great little streaming stick. Simple to install and immediately ready to play.  Selected after careful reviews of the competition.  Glad we went this route.

1/26/21. I got some calls and emails from Amazon,  but nothing was fixed, nor replacement was sent. Still dealing with the same problem. It’s getting annoying now, especially when you’re all planned out for a family night. The girl Crystal said even if it’s past the return window, I can still do so because she already put a note about this case. I honestly don’t want to return, and just wanted a replacement that works.It was working fine. But last night, there’s no sound whatsoever. We tried other shows, same. We went back to the tv to check, the volume work fine. Back to fireTV. Still no sounds.

Every thing went normally as you expected when first plug in.  However, after turn off the display and turn the display back on I don't hear the audio.  First I thought this is from my display but the problem is from the fire stick itself.  This happen randomly, so I have to decide to return this one.  Bad experience for me.

The interface is chaotic, jumbled and confusing. It's like yhey made it the layout look terrible to make sure you didn't forget it was the cheap model.  I have 2 fire TVs and Firestick 4K on a third TV and I was setting this us as a gift alfor a parent and thought... Nope. This is gonna be a catastrophe.

Not intuitive.  Difficult to set up.  Difficult to find apps.  Roku is so much easier.  I thought I would try the fire stick because the price was great.  I’m keeping it and learning it and I’m sure it will be fine eventually.  Knowing what I know now I would have just bought another Roku.

This is our third Fire TV stick. One that we have had for 4 years or so finally quit. We use these a lot while traveling, when staying in VRBOs or motel rooms. Overall they are great and make watching Prime Video a snap. Wouldn't make a long trip without one.

As good as others but comes with the free shipping .But as all the other providers does not have enough shows, I want to watch .Needs more older shows like Gunsmoke the Walton's etc. New show are trashy with every one climbing in to bed and that sort of stuff .

Have three other ones on different TVs and wanted something for one in the garage. Doesn't have TV controls, but that is not big deal. It installed itself and connected to our wifi automatically, which really surprised me. Works as well as the others we have.

This is amazing! I was worried about my mom who just turned 70 and she doesn’t like change and she isn’t technology friendly & she is getting the hang of it. With COVID-19 & me being out of work I had to cut back on things that weren’t necessarily needed but my mom needs her tv so this has been a win win

Update: Dec 18 2020, 12:56 (approx 20 minutes after I placed the review.) Amazon Customer support called me, confirmed my account, and walked me through updating and resetting the fire stick. It works! They are going to follow-up with me next week.NETFLIX, Hulu, Crunchy Roll and HBO Max crash multiple times a day. I went back to using my PS4 to watch tv. waste of money.

Roku again has done what it does best after a while...It stopped working. This is my 2nd and last purchase of any Roku device. I’m not sure if it’s deliberate, to force you to re-purchase or just simply not caring enough about their product or customers, but the remote has stopped working and has become non-responsive....again!There’s no customer service to speak of and the company doesn’t seem the least bit concerned about keeping their customers. They probably figure there are so many more out there, why bother addressing the same recurring issues with "a few customers".Of course these are my own beliefs because I’m trying to understand why a company would ignore customers who are clearly having trouble with their Roku remote freezing or dying, for no good reason....more than once?That’s another $60 wasted. Time to try the Amazon Firestick.

Work when connected to the TV, but not when I connected it to the home theater. Roku provides no technical support through telephone, "because the pandemic." Seems like every other company has been able to figure out how to provide technical assistance, and it's just a veiled excuse at being cheap.I also could not email them. Clicking on the email link led to nothing.  Hopefully the Firestick will work. this doesn't.

This was obviously a used product.  Wasn't happy about it but tried it out.Can't understand whatsoever how this gets positive reviews.  I will break it down so no one else buys this POS.1. This stick can't stream live TV.  Don't bother if this is what you want it for.I bought it hoping to stream TNF in 4k.  Impossible.  It heats up and can't perform.  I had it plugged in with the wall charger with the extension as the instructions recommended  but the fully buffered 4k lasted for about 60 seconds then went back to VHS quality.  My wifi router with 1000 mbps ATT fiber is literally 3 feet away and this is the speed this POS picks up.  Unreal.2. I thought maybe it was just my stick because it was obviously used, and perhaps it was too much for it to handle live 4K.  But then I was at a friend's house who has this same stick and he was using it to stream YouTube TV in regular HD and it continuously buffered for the entirety of a Sunday night game.  It was unwatchable, would've been better off with an antenna.  Would only get a clear picture for about 2 minutes at a time, otherwise it buffered worse than if you used an Emachine cpu from 20 years ago.3.  When this stupid piece of junk isn't streaming live TV it also will make you want to pull your hair out trying to sign in to apps.  IT. IS. SOOOOOOO. SLOOOOOOWWWW.  It even delayed on the keyboard to type in emails and passwords (with no shortcuts).  It took at least 5 minutes just to sign in to NFL app, god forbid you mistype your password!  Good luck starting over from scratch!4.  This has me reconsidering my Consumer Reports subscription.  What are they possibly giving this good reviews for? Maybe it's fine for Netflix or something but isn't that app on your smart TV anyway? I love my LG 75 inch 4k but it lacks in apps.  The picture is incredible when i use the apps built in (Netflix, Prime, etc.)  but I had to buy a supplementary device for ESPN, FOX, etc. but brother let me tell you, THIS AIN'T IT.In summary, package showed this was used by a different dissatisfied customer, it basically doesn't even work, an old school chromecast or firestick not built for 4k works 10x's than this for even the most basic streaming.Say less you say????  DO NOT BUY.

This is my first Roku, and I really like it! It is easy to add and remove "channels" either on your account in the web browser on a computer or on the stick itself. I have had a Chromecast in the past and really liked it, but needed something that would be easier for guests to use. This Roku stick has been great for that! Picture quality is great and setup was fairly easy. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I haven't been able to figure out how (or even if) the remote connects to my TV to control power and volume. It doesn't bother me that much, but it would be nice to have one fewer remote to worry about. I can't comment on voice control as I haven't tried that out yet.

Our Roku 3 notified us that we needed to upgrade it with an SD card.  Since this is an older model and the remote didn’t work the power or volume on our tv (we had to use the tv remote for that) we figured we would get the Roku Streaming Stick+ because then we would only have to use one remote and not have to deal with getting the SD card for the Roku 3.  We already have the Roku Streaming Stick + for our other tv.  They are great for us because our TVs are not smart TVs.

I had a Roku with the tiny receiver device.  I was tired of the base always twisting because of the cord so I got this on a flash sale.  Not only does it plug into the HDMI and USB of the tv, eliminating the power cord, but the remote is much better.  With the addition of the power button and volume (mine synced to my tv with zero effort on my part) it is a dream.  The ONLY issue (minor) is that they didn't include a INPUT button so you can switch over for gaming.  While I didn't see the need for the voice control, it actually is nice because I can say "put on the Matrix" and if the movie is on any of my services it will tell me.  If not it will tell me who I can buy or order from and the price.  Nice little feature.

The app I think is the best streaming app out there as of this review but the product quality of roku devices is not.  Remotes start losing strength so that u have to get closer and closer to the roku transceiver to work within one year. Two of mine of the three in the picture no longer control the devices. One of the smaller express unit also stopped working with in 2 years. And now my roku tv remote is also starting to die.  I used to have the fire stick but opted for roku for their app.  However that 5 year old device still works....slowly but it still works. Roku..if your reading this get a different manufacturer for your devices cause they are crap right now.

I used this for an older smart TV that does not have Roku type integration. I love the existing TV and the Roku Streaming Stick+ is great! Now I don't have a reason to buy a newer TV to get the added features! One thing I didn't understand about the stick (because I didn't see it, or it wasn't explained well) is HOW it would work with my older TV and internet situation, this piece of information made it take me a while to try it. It works with WiFi and your TV's HDMI (in) port! In my case (living out of town) you want a good Internet Provider (NOT HugesNet!!!!) with plenty of speed and bandwidth - for general internet needs anyway. I guess my only complaint at all is that the stick doesn't "turn off". If someone has watched the Stick (HDMI) input and turned the TV off, and I turn on the TV to watch Antenna TV the Roku stick is still on, and I have to change inputs back to Antenna, that is my ONLY complaint - not a big deal. I do not have Alexa, and I have not tried "voice" commands.

I was very disappointed by this for several reasons:- the stick needed to be plugged in, even on a brand new 2020 TV hdmi port- the audio and video are out of sync- the colors and contrast are all messed up, my Roku 3 that’s like 8 years old looks way better than this stickDon’t buy it. I’m packing to return right now.

I bought a roku stick and loved it so I bought another for another television in my room. Ten months after purchase the original roku stick suddenly stopped working. My TV said no signal HDMI - 3 check if the device is connected and powered on or press the input button to select the input for the source device. I did everything including trying the stick on another TV on which a ROKU was working and hard reset but nothing worked. I came onto amazon and it said my service term of 6 months had expired. I am extremely disappointed.

Love that we save $10.00 per box and remotes for a total of $70.00 per month on Spectrum.  It does have a learning curve, but once learned it's fine. Great price for the savings.Suggestions:I wish Prime was a button at the bottom rather than sling. The mute button is too close to the volume button and too low on the unit. It would be better if it was on the upper left side. I don't understand why Roku reboots at night for no reason. I have to find what I was watching to resume, that's a pain in the b-tt!

I don't know if it's because I lived overseas for so long, but this voice recognition doesn't work very well for me at all. But, I have the previous version of Roku without it, so it wasn't the main reason I bought this one. I like the HD quality of the streaming, because we have a 4K HD tv and it's nice to be able to stream in HD quality. We ditched cable by getting YouTubeTV through Roku and we are seriously saving $150 a month. It's costing so much less that we splurged and got the NHL center ice package enabling us to watch all out-of-market games. Our Bruins games are on NESN which is included in the YouTubeTV package. Perfect!

This is my first Roku, it's much more user friendly than my old Apple TV, but I've had it since Christmas and I've had to replace the batteries in the remote 4 times. The last time was 3 days after I put new "tested" batteries in and wasn't even using the remote. But you can watch classic Batman with Adam West on the Roku Channel so I'm not too mad.

I bought it during the black Friday sale so the price was right. Netflix streaming via wifi is xlnt from about 40 feet away in my case, no dropouts yet, and my wifi speed is minimal. A few free channels are a bonus, but most of those have commercials. The remote is fine but not easy to use in low light -- I wish the buttons were back lit -- or easier to ID via touch. The voice search is clever but takes you to channels you may not be subscribed to, so I end up not using it. Maybe there's a way to limit it to your personal channels, which I would prefer. Overall, as a low budget streamer, Roku does a good job.

We bought this Roku+ about a year ago. About 2-3 months ago, the remote started to eat batteries like candy (so glad we have rechargeables). Now, occasionally, the Roku seems to get "confused" and require a hard restart (i.e. unplugging its power and letting it sit for 30 seconds, then plugging it back in).It works, usually. The voice function works when we use it, generally.Probably should replace it because it often freezes these days - at least a couple times every month and a half. But overall, it works fine. Figure it cost me about $7/month if it only lasts a year. That's quite a bit considering I have to pay for most of the things I use on it (Hulu, Netflix, etc). But, maybe we will get lucky and be able to use it for another year. :)

Complete piece of garbage. I had a roku from ~7 years ago and it works fine, but pretty slow. Figured I’d upgrade.Plugged in the roku to the tv and it made me connect to WiFi, of course. Entered in my password 3 times, wasn’t able to connect, asked me to restart the device.Did that, and my remote stopped working. It would accept one input then freeze for ~20 seconds or more.Restarted my tv, and was able to enter my password for WiFi. I actually connected, and then it said it needed to install updates. OK, of course.It installs updates and says it needs to restart. It restarts 5 times and then freezes on a gray screen.I restart the roku, and I’m greeted again by the welcome screen asking me to enter my password.All of this was repeated 5 times before I gave up and returned it. Do NOT buy!!!

Estaba buscando una alternativa para el casting en mi TV, puesto que antes usaba Chromecast, pero con esto del veto a Huawei se me complico un poco la vida y por eso decidí comprar un Roku que de alguna se mantiene en terreno neutro y lo importante es que o tenga Google, Chrome o por lo menos la App de Roku instalada en el smartphone. Aunque falta expandirse mucho más con el protocolo que maneja Chromecast para que cualquier app permita la conexión, me ha servido mucho y me ha gustado incluso puedo conectar con facilidad mi PC con proyección inalámbrica sin necesidad de instalar el molesto come RAM de Chrome :). Le daría 5 estrellas si me pudiera conectar a todo, y si en mi país (Colombia) sirviera el reconocimiento de Voz y Alexa con facilidad, por el momento me reservo la estrellita mientras lo implementan.

Remote stops working for no reason except for power on/off. Same problem with the replacement that Amazon sent. Works for a bit, then stops. Only buttons that work are power on/off and volume. Tried Roku's suggested fixes of unplugging Roku, removing batteries, remote resync. Works for about a day or two at best, then stops again.RUBBISH!! Roku for god's sake fix the problem with your infra red remote, and stop fooling folks!! Returning second replacement.

I had been using my XBOX or Playstation to stream stuff since we did not have smart TVs in the past. I had no idea this was so simple! I would have done this so much sooner. It's SIMPLE! I got the most basic one, so I can't rate voice command or Alexa etc. However, with the most basic one, the install, set up and use is and was, SO SIMPLE! It's compatible with EVERYTHING I use including Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, Peacock, Youtube, Crackle, Disney plus, and just about anything else I could think of. Roku itself had tons of free stuff to stream and we use it all the time! It's easy enough for the youngest child in the house to use, and the oldest adult who is a little electronic challenged at times to figure out as well. We're all happy with it. We got a second one for another room in the house less than a week later. Paid under 30 bucks a piece to stream everything I thought had to be done a smart tv or video game machine...wish I had gotten this sooner, I could have ditched the XBOX in the family room years ago LOL. Now I don't have to hear video games anymore cause they are ONLY in the kids rooms. :)

This is the first fire stick lite that I’ve bought. I’ve had three regular fire sticks and decided to try this one because it was half the price. It seems pretty comparable, but the quality of the lite is a little bit inferior. So when I have to buy another one I’ll buy the original.

Previous model was very slow to boot/reboot and just turned off at random times for no apparent reason.  Firestick 4K boots so much faster and no more random shutting off for no apparent reason. No more interruptions in the middle of my movie. So glad I upgraded.

Works great! Just make sure your tv even if recently purchased has ability for voice recognition w Alexa. 2 out of 3 of our tv's it works with..all are smart tvs though...its not a firestick issue it's a tv that doesn't have the Alexa capability. We haven't had any issues w the firestick at all.

We were unable to get our Disney+ on our COX cable TV. We were able to use the fire stick to access our premium services with our smart TV. We don’t have Alexa and haven’t tried voice activation. Fire does require much higher volume number to hear appropriately.

I had a FireStick with voice and TV controls that I'd shuttle between home and work, finally decided to buy this one so I can have one at work and one at home. I love the new interface for firetv. It's very sleek, easy to use and I don't miss the volume controls tbh.

This product advertised that it supported Netflix.  There was even a picture of Netflix on the box.  I had to call support and I was dealing it as it sent me to the Philippines.  My experience with the customer service rounded to the Philippines has been awful.  While the people answering the phone are kind and patient, they are rarely trained well.  This was with other companies .  My Amazon experience was great!  The young man I got listened and fixed my problem correctly in a short amount of time.  He actually had to take over my screen and download Netflix  I believe his name was Arnes.

Ease of set up as usual..on fire. Quality of product is still great. Loved saving some cash on full fire stick which only thing missing is power button for tv, but it gave me a great excuse to hit dollar store and I made a cute caddy for both remotes for $2!!!

The device works well when it works. Almost daily it locks up and needs to be restarted. Software interaction and remote use is fine. Even the voice recognition works well when the device IS NOT LOCKED UP. Did I mention that happens almost daily and needs to be restarted?**update** Amazon tech support reached out to me and help update the device. Seems to be operating better now.

I have many Amazon devices including Firesticks, this was my first Lite version.  It works great I had no problem setting it up and loading my apps.  If I had any complaints it is that it runs a little warm, but that has not effected its function as of yet.
