Had 4 of these of various generations and needed another for another TV. I don't use the Alexa function, and wanted just basic functionality at a good price so this was my choice. I highly recommend the antenna-Recast-Firestick combination for cord cutters.

I had been using a Fire TV box for the last couple of years. When I first started using it there were few problems and it worked as advertised. I occasionally had to reboot it but not too often. Over time I had to reboot it more and more often until eventually I had to reboot it ever time I wanted to use it. I also had to take out and re-insert the batteries to the remote in order for it to connect to the box. After getting fed up I purchased this Roku and wow is it great. I've not had one issue with it since Day 1. The remote is always connected and much more responsive than the Fire TV remote ever was. The interface is easier to use and moving between menu items is much quicker. The streaming is excellent. I can't recommend this device highly enough. Superb piece of hardware at a great price.

We've been a Roku user for years, but have been plagued recently by streaming services continuously buffering for months. Having only Satellite internet we had turned the resolution down to 480p in order to watch anything. After reading other reviews and betting on the long range wireless extender fixing our issues we were not let down.  The new Roku player streams at 1080 resolution and I can't remember the last time we had to wait on a show to buffer.  This new device has really made a dramatic difference!  The device is also fast to respond to the remote and when booting up only takes a 1/3 of the time the old device did.  Overall very happy we upgraded and if you have limited internet options I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
Got this to try dropping DirecTV. Signed up for Hulu and almost through the one week free trial.....will be dropping DirecTV.

My first Roku early last year was the "express" stick. It was far better than my FIOS service in choices picture quality, options and value. To be honest I was amazed and wished I had made the move to a Roku sooner! I would have enjoyed netter TV, and saved a LOT of money. Still it occasionally had some buffering on the wireless as my TV is a fair distance from my router. After I did several hours of research I decided the best value would be the RoKu Stick Plus. Wow! I hoped it would be a lot better, but I didn't expect a quantum leap in every category! Oh MY GOD! It's incredible! Even more free TV! More choices! More movies! More quality! MUCH faster! No buffering even when all my kids are gaming online! Just WOW! I cannot recommend this device highly enough!

I already have LG smart TV with its default OS. Even though it has fancy stuff like cursor, the connection was a nightmare. I always need to connect to Wifi manually and netflix gets disconnected multiple times making TV watching a bad experience. Since it is a big screen, I thought I'd go for the top stick option.Installation was a breeze. Remote is simple and easy to use. Interface is just perfect. Smooth, fast and simple UI experience. No issues with any apps I've used so far. Not sure about the advantages of this item vs other sticks from Roku. But Roku stick, any type/model, is definitely something you should invest in if your TV OS isn't good or slow.

Roku is definitely the way to go if you're interested in cutting the cable tv scene. Have been using a new Streaming Stick + for a couple of weeks. Setup was reasonable, adding channels as well. However periodically, sometimes more than once a day, the remote stops functioning. This can range from zero function to volume up/down is the only thing working. Having to power off the Roku, remove batteries, wait briefly, and start back up. Have not gone through a re-paring the power off/battery out has been working.Still believe this is the device I want. Will be trying a re-paring setup again.This would all be 5 stars if the remote wasn't flaky.

The Roku Stick+ has enabled my Viszo m70-3c Tv to be worth a darn.  I bought that TV 2.5 years ago and if never worked well - crappy app interface, no Disney+ app (even a year after launch), PLEX didn't work, and the Sonos speakers sounded muted.  However, once I plugged the Roku Stick+ in all that changed and I am left with a wonderful User Interface, great sound management and the Disney+ App.  this piece of equipment saving our TV and it is now a place we can watch our streamed content (we don't have cable TV).

I decided to cut the cord.  I bought this along with the Apple TV 4K.  I have returned to Apple TV.  This little thing is a beast.  It streams virtually every service available and does it without issue.  The interface is simple.  The remote on the Roku+ is awesome in that it also controls your TV and volume.  So, you now have this one little remote to literally everything if you have cut the cord exclusively.  Also, through the app on the phone you can stream pictures, videos, music from your phone (which is frankly the main reason I bought the AppleTV for ease of streaming from my iDevices).  I would buy this again without hesitation, and I have done so for the TVs in my other room.

Bought this for vacations after I lost our older version (sorry hunny!).(SKIP down if you already own a Roku).  All Roku devices have essentially the same setup, menu, and features.  It’s very easy to get started, find apps, and navigate.  It has minimal advertisements and less “in your face” suggestions as compared to an Apple TV.  We are an Apple family and have switched to AppleTV twice...then promptly went back to Roku.  Unfortunately Roku’s search is still a mess and more-or-less useless.The only issue we have with Our Roku’s (we use 3 different versions of them scattered through the house) is sound quality.  If you stream through a high end home theater system, be aware that Roku and PLEX do not support much more than basic 5.1 channel surround.  This is a problem for audiophiles but no biggie for others.(ABOUT this Roku vs others)-  we bought it for traveling.  It plugs into hotel TVs easily.  Make sure to call the hotel’s tech support and they will register the Roku’s MAC address (found on the back of the Roku stick) so it will connect to WiFi.Finally the remote can control your TV. This has been a common complaint for some time now and I’m so happy it’s finally an included feature.  This makes it easy for the kids to navigate the hotel TV and we don’t have to use the nasty public remote.The only con, and it should be expected, is speed.  The Roku sticks are ALWAYS slower than the Roku boxes in our experience.  If you’re going from Roku Ultra or even a Roku 3 to this you will notice everything takes about twice as long to load.  Menus are still responsive and navigation is fine but actual loading times is noticeably slower.Still the best “cord cutting” device out there vs FireTV/AppleTV/etc.  This is also a worthy upgrade over the older streaming stick with the improved video quality and universal remote.Update:  We took it to Disney and did not have to register the MAC address.  We just plugged it in, selected the WDW guest WiFi, and away we went.  Bonus that WDW uses Samsung tv in their rooms and we have one at home so I didn’t even have to program the remote.

I have an older model Roku which works fine, but when I moved it to a TV in an upstairs bedroom, it could not connect to my wi-fi.  I thought about upgrading the wi-fi, but in the meantime, searched the newer Roku models and found this one which promised better wi-fi connectivity.  And it delivered!  It works perfectly in the far upstairs corner of the house and I am thrilled to be able to expand TV choices in that room.  Great buy and works great.

I got this for a kids room, 8 yrs. old. He has no problem using it. It does fine but sometimes stream slowly. He watches a lot of youtube videos. It is no problem. I just disconnect it from the back of the tv for a few seconds and the problems are resolved.

have been using Roku products for about 6 years and have been very pleased so far. I have an A/V receiver in another room that controls my tv and surround sound so I plugged the stick directly into the receiver. Everything works great, until you let it sit for a few hours and it goes into some kind of power saving mode. The remote will no longer connect to the stick without walking into the other room and pressing a button so it will reconnect. I tried every setting I could find and had no luck. The range on the remote is amazing once it is connected, but it was very annoying to lose signal constantly. I am returning this product and have a Roku Ultra hooked up to my receiver right now...which is working just fine. I am a big fan of the hard-wired connection available for the Ultra and the ability for the device to accept a usb stick to stream media. The other really nice thing is that I can control my tv power and the volume of my receiver (which, remember is in another room) all with the Roku remote. I know that I have a unique situation, but Roku still had a device that works for me. I do wish that they would note the range of the remote to the stick when pairing. Overall it is a great product, just not for my setup.

I like it. The internet and the processor seems to be faster on this one with great picture quality. I own 3 different models of the firestick. They changed the layout which I'm not a big fan of. That is why i gave it a 4 star. Other than that works as expected.

This was the least expensive Firestick I could find. It works great. What it lacks is turning a television on and off and volume control. But who cares - it's in the guest room for their convenience. PS This replaced a ROKU that worked but the remote didn't!

I use this for video streaming and music. I previously used a DVD player, but it frequently would have to be powered down to reset it before being able to continue using for streaming. The firestick has been continuously reliable with excellent performance.

The fire tv lite overall looks great if you using a 1080P TV if you have a higher resolution than that you should go for the 4k version. The control of the fire tv lite feels cheap but it does the job, you probaly have to be carefull with kids using the remote control they might brake it do to how light it is.

This is so much better then my vizio cast smart tv it controls everything even though it doesn't have volume control alexa can still change the volume on my tv with voice command and she. I don't want to disturb the spouse I just out on my bluetooth headphones and watch tv without disturbing her.

This is my 3rd firestick. I love them, and have them on every tv in the house! I love the new interface on the home screen, it's a different set up than on my older previous versions. The only difference in the lite version and the more expensive one is that the more expensive one (in addition to 4k)has volume control, and I couldn't justify paying extra for that when I have a tv remote. The lite version is perfect for me, because I don't yet have a 4k TV and don't plan on buying one anytime soon.

keeping this short and simple.Love our firestick so much I bought a second one.Controls easy, set up easy, i push a button and say what i want to watch and it gives me a price or what platform to find it free. Like Hulu, Netflix or whatever else I have then I oush play and it takes me to where I have it on all my apps.  Great product

Set this up and purchased Disney+ only to have it respond with error code 41 every time I selected a show or movie. Netflix worked but I specifically bought this to have Disney+. Spoke with multiple ppl at Amazon help. Told me to unplug, uninstall, reinstall. Nothing worked. Was told it was a Disney issue even though it worked on my phone. Was not going to waste more time and effort trying to figure this out so I returned. Got Roku and it’s much easier and faster to set up and it actually works!!

This was our second fire stick for our house.  We have one we use for our workout room and one for our normal tv watching.  We love both our fire sticks and them easy to use.  We stream mostly netflix, amazon prime, beachbody on demand and occasion ESPN+.

Purchased a Roku Streaming Stick+ to avoid utilizing my Sony smart TV to stream PlayStation Vue, Netflix, Google Play, Amazon video and youtube. Much simpler to use for streaming than the TV with a a simple interface and easy access to apps (you choose what is shown on the homepage). Also like that the Roku smartphone app allows you to listen to the audio via headphones. Roku's  PlayStation Vue app is far superior to the app that came on my Sony TV eliminating many of the issues I experience with PlayStation Vue. Picture quality is excellent.  I highly recommend the product and wish I had purchased sooner.

I have seen so many great reviews for the Roku Streaming Stick + I felt had to order one for myself.Just opened up the package and started reading the instructions and noticed the instructions say batteries are included.  I am assuming they would normally be in the space in the bottom right corner of the packaging (image attached.)Not sure how they are missing.  Possibly a returned unit and the person that originally order it kept the batteries?I'm noting 2 stars because of the missing batteries. While I could (and ultimately have to) buy ones to use, being they were supposed to be included this is an additional cost that I will incur before I can set up the unit.

For less than $50, its excellent product. Turn my old TV to  Smart TV. So easy to install n make it work. Just attach directly to tv USB, setup wifi. Then down load an app forgot its called, I am not at tv now, then watch youtube from phone to tv. Now my wife can watch her youtube in bedroom not occupying tv in family room..and I can watch my own youtube movies....great product, didn't know dumb tv is still useful with this low cost device. Highly recommend it.

I have 2 roku tv’s by TCL, so when I upgraded my 32” tv to a 55” I decided to LG OLED. The LG app line-up can’t beat Roku app library. So I decided to buy a roku streaming stick, because my kids and mrs are all use to the roku interface. The Lg doesn’t even have the disney channel, pbs, and locast.I don’t even think samsung interface can beat the roku app library.I did try to use alexa with the roku stick and it does not work. Good thing I didn’t buy the roku to work with alexa, otherwise this will be a lower star review. The roku voice remote does the voice commands well, so I don’t think I’ll be using alexa to control my tv anytime soon.

I cut the cord on my service provider because prices kept rising. Like it after a month.  Easy to install, but had to buy  new router because mine was old.  Also bought a new modem because I was tired of paying rent of $14 a month from my provider.  Should have made the change long ago!

The purchase was an upgrade to the same model from 2016 or 2017. Did everything I wanted, including a higher resolution picture, which is as good as any of the other video input devices I have for my 4K monitor. I also got some extras that I did not expect in the lowest price model. The best new feature is ability to use the Iphone speakers or Iphone headphones/earbuds. So I can watch Hamilton on Disney+ cranking the music on my high-quality headphones without disturbing my sleeping roommates.

I got a recently cable bill with a sizable increase so I thought I could cut the cord and look into streaming devices.  I recommend that you do your homework to find the device that works best for you.  For me the Roku was the one.  It is very easy to use and I like that they make free viewing a part of the home screen.  I also subscribed to a streaming channel that has almost all my favorite cable channels for less than half the price of my ever increasing cable bill

This particular roku model is only 2.4 ghz. Other models can handle 5 ghz. This is important bcz I use free wifi supplied by my apt complex. 10 buildings, 13 apts per building. This means hundreds of users. All using 2.4 ghz networks. Soo frustrating, with so many users you just keep getting bumped off, " buffering" they say. You can't even get 5 min into a movie or video. BEWARE! BUY ROKU STICK MODEL=5 ghz capibility and no problems!! Good luck

As the home entertainment industry continued to change, I have been in search of the best vehicle to stream through the most, access enough of local programming, and essentially pick/choose the channels I watch all the time. For years, I watched Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV, etc. I always returned to Roku. With its multiple levels of models for the bedroom to the multimedia room at its great price points. I don't think anyone could choose better unless there is a specific feature not provided. I bought the first and after playing with that, bought two more each of a different level. Direct TV will be leaving my home shortly.

So, I had a Roku which looked like an over sized, thick coaster and it was requiring it to be re-booted about every other day.  It would simply lock up.  So, I purchased this Roku stick figuring I just had one which was not functioning well.  Well, the Roku stick fails to play UHD from VUDU and defaults to the HDX version.  When I use the VUDU function on my TV I never have a problem with the UHD playback.Also, the remote this comes with requires re-connecting, also about, every two days.  It will not keep a constant connection.  You have to reboot the stick and then reestablish the remote connection every other day.  I kept with Roku as the other devices do not seem to include VUDU which is where my movie library is located.  I gave it a one star as when it works, it is fine, it just has tantrums every other day as well as no UHD.  And, yes, I have attempted all of the 'fixes' listed by Roku regarding the remote problem and I do have the two mhz bands on my router.  No joy.

After having T-Mobile's TVision for a little over a year (after cutting Comcast which I had for over 10 years), I carefully researched the newest and latest competitive TV streaming devices and decided to get the Roku 4k+ Streaming Stick.  Very easy install process (pretty much plug n play), good interface and unlike T-Mobile's streaming with constant buffering, looping and outages; haven't had any issues thus far.  Excellent picture quality and a boat-load of streaming options (albeit some repetitive).  All in all, pretty satisfied and the best part is, you can't beat free programming!  Certainly you have options for additional paid subscriptions and premium services but hey, the objective was all about saving some money and eliminating escalating cable TV prices.

This Roku works great I’m happy with it. I had a chromecast that sucked constantly disconnected. I had a free basic roku that was ok also disconnected. But I heard the other reviews decided to try it again paid a little more and got the streaming stick plus that has better long range wifi signal strength and I am definitely happy. It doesn’t disconnect anymore. All my apps and channels come in strong and in HD. Very happy very worth your money definitely get this one!!

Quiero regresar este roku porque me quieren cobrar por actualizar no es como los pasados yo solo ocupo que me deje ver Netflix y YouTube pero la verdad fue un caos porque me llamaron de roku para activar y me quieren cobrar $60 dólares y en mi pantalla muestra que la activación es totalmente gratis y es lo que yo nuevo un roku sencillo que me deje ver lo básico porque no me interesa agarra plan con roku
We were having issues(no sound) and when we put in a different Roku, it worked fine. Unfortunately we can’t do anything about it now, but I would have thought it would have lasted longer.

After turning in my cable box for an extra tv to Spectrum to cut monthly equipment rental costs, I was left without my customary cable channels on my family room television.  I ordered this to have the capability of downloading the SpectrumTV app, as well as the convenience of other apps like  Netflix and  AmazonTV.  The device was super easy to setup -- i just plugged it in and powered it on, then followed the on-screen instructions.  I have a RokuTV in our kitchen, and another Roku stick in a spare bedroom. Love the way their product works!  I wish i had ordered this sooner fur the family room.  So convenient!

Arrived earlier than promised. Nicely packaged. Plugged into my HDMI in back of TV, put batteries in remote..and ROKU TOOK OVER! Easy as pie... All apps from my previous Roku3 were installed and on screen prompts enabled other functions including volume control and TV on and off features. The Roku also provided a  separate 4K app which allowed me instant access to lots of 4K HDR movies free and also those with nominal fee. In addition there are many 4K HDR  travel documentary apps Venice, USA, etc and the picture clarity and depth is AWESOME, a huge difference from my Roku3. A great buy at a great price! Thanks.

I bought this for my guest bedroom (which is very far from my wireless router and through many walls, so I was nervous about this alleged "Long Range Wireless" claim) - but I was delighted that it works flawlessly with no stuttering or blocky artifacts. My mother is visiting form overseas so she can keep herself well-entertained with great Netflix/Hulu/etc movies and shows while I'm at work.The only downside is that the included power-cable option for the stick is *really* short at about 1-foot long.

ROKU must be a foreign company with no one to support the product. I can't log on, they say they will email a link to update my password but they don't. Call their support line 816-272-0000 and listen to the automated message.  What a joke! I signed up for a monthly subscription thru YouTube TV and can not cancel it. I am writing the FCC and asking for them to research the company for FRAUD....

Remote constantly disconnects. I have had three of these streaming stick+ and they all had the same issue. The first one I had for a year with no issues and then it started being extremely slow on start up with the remote unpairing. I bought a new one and the issue was even worse so I swapped it out for a new thinking maybe it was just defective. Nope, the unpairing is even worse. I have a regular streaming stick for over a year and that's never happened. I changed HDMI inputs, TV's, Remotes, HDMI extender, power sources, called customer support, everything and nothing helped. Everything else worked fine and picture was great but it's useless if I have to repair the remote each time I use it.

I received this Fire Stick as a gift. I love it, now I can watch movies on my TV instead of on my Kindle Fire. It was easy to navigate once someone showed me how to run it and explain things to me. I will buy more Fire Sticks for my other TV's. Thank You -

Bought this for my mother's tv but maybe I'll switch for use on my projector cause it's so nice and simple, doesn't have a volume key so it would be better for me and I'll give her the fire stick 4k I have to use on her tv since it's much better suited there

This was to replace a set top box in a guest room.  It occasionally loses the sound, but that is remedied by turning off and on again or disconnecting it and plugging back in.  For the price I paid vs money saved for set top box rental, I'm happy with it.

I can’t remember what I paid for this when I bought it three yrs ago. But it could swear it was three times what I paid here on Amazon. I just wanted. To say, if you don’t have a smart TV or whatever they’re called, this is a must. Even if you buy one next month, what’s the harm. I got this for my parents. They watched everything downstairs on their smart TV. Now they can watch separately and my mom can enjoy her absolute favourite hobby while watching The Crown- folding laundry on the great wide space of their bed.

Worked fine during the sent up and everything. Go to use it the next day about wouldn't read in any HDMI ports. Tired four different ports that worked with my cable HDMI. Should have expected you get what you pay for. Poor design. Couldn't be more displeased.

When it works, it’s great. when it doesn’t, I have to reset it. I ran diagnosis on my tv, the WiFi was working fine, my other tv played the applications no problem with a ps4 connection. I reset it in the settings and it started to work again. I believe the average amount of times this is happening is once a week (I bought this last month)

I have had several fire sticks and one fire box. I really enjoy all of the content and the fact that the search looks in all apps and gives you options to watch. There is so much free content I like that I couldn't even watch it all. I would have given it a 5 star except this newest stick I have to scroll down 7 levels to get to the show I was just watching or search again. I like to see the most recent and select from them until I'm done watching them. Amazon please fix this!

Already had a firestick for my biggest tv, but it did not have the Alexa voice feature like I did on another tv.  I like the voice feature because there are so many options on firestick and this makes searching easy.It is also very easy to install if you know your wi fi and Netflix passwords.

Great value for the price.To me it's not as good as the 4k firestick but way better than 2nd and 3rd generation sticksMy lite was having a little trouble with the new layout. Hopefully techs will iron out the bugs. The streaming is wonderful.

First off, I was a bit anxious that they wouldn’t work because some people didn’t get theirs to work. Thankfully it connected smoothly and I had no issues whatsoever. The quality is better than I expected also. I’m so happy that I took a chance and bought this fire stick!

I am learning to use wifi streaming and a Roku was recommended. Setting it up was actually very easy and I did have to request help with a code and the Customer Service was patient and very helpful, excellent service. She also madevitbperfectly clear that the service is totally free and Roku will never ask for any fees or charges.I am frustrated with the Voice recognition, it continually says it does not understand what I said. I speak perfect English, and speak slowly and distinctly, then when it finally and rarely understands, ( like one word commands) ie:” news, ” it sends me off in the wrong direction. I just use the letter search instead.

I bought this November 2019. I've replaced the remote batteries last night for the third time. I've had to unplug and reset the device at least 10 times over this period. At least 2 or 3 times a week it just shuts off without explanation. On top of it's technical failures, the platform is not nearly as easy to use as Fire Stick from Amazon, and really could use an update. The worst part of the device is how incredibly slow it is. I also bought a ROKU TV, which I find is much faster. On average it takes at least 4 minutes to get this running sometimes longer, sometimes it just freezes.

I've purchased 3 of these devices and all are working well. Setup is a little wonky (had a couple of hiccups with having the mobile app on my phone installed - setup does not really recognize the mobile app and forces you to long into website via browser). Also wish there is an easier way to coordinate the panels on the home screen between all the controllers - should be able to sync all the home screens to one setup. So far works well and I'm able to get rid of my cable tv subscription and just use all my streaming services.

At first i bought ROKU Stick+ to make my tv smart. Roku is really nice product.. But it doesn't have support to web browser, what means that you can't enter directly to the websites. What is good if you live in a country where you have free movie streaming websites. Even browser screen mirroring apps are worst on Roku.  So i made some research and found out that Fire TV Stick have several web browsing apps. And now i'm using Fire tv Stick, it's little bit sluggish then Roku but do the job perfectly. Otherwise both are good product and do the same thing.

We don't use the TV we have this connected to that frequently, but in the 1.5 months we have had it the remote stopped working. We put new batteries and then it worked. Disappointed that the remote seems to be draining batteries in less than a month's time with little use.

I haven’t hooked it up yet; but I bought this because it had Disney + on the remote.  It is not the remote pictured.  For $60.00 you would expect to get what is advertised.  I hope it has Disney + on it or I’ll be returning my first ever Amazon product.UPDATE!! I hooked it up and kicking myself fir not buying this sooner!!! Having all apps in one area is so nice!!! It does have Disney + but not on the remote as pictured.  Still, best thing!!  You can also use the app on your phone as a remote for your tv!  Great fir people with 10 remotes and can’t find the one you need!

I'm a long time Roku user and love the products so I decided to give the stick a try. This "stick" is larger than you might think. Because of where the HDMI port is on my TV it would not fit. Roku knows this because they will send you a free adaptor but it takes 3-5 days. Why not simply include it in the box? I guess to provide a substandard customer service experience. Also not clear is the "stick" gets its power from an external adaptor that is included.Once the part came and I got it installed it worked very well. Even getting a more reliable internet connection from my WiFi.Save your self some time and just get the standard box unit. It comes with everything you need to get up and running.

The headline pretty much covers it. This is the 2nd Roku+ Stick 4k that has failed for me! Roku tech support is slow to respond and gives a lot of solutions none of which include sending a new stick or remote which I believe is the underlying problem since nothing else they've told me to do has worked. Save yourself the trouble and only buy the Roku set-top devices, not the sticks and you'll have a much better experience.

I use Roku for everything.  It's really helpful since I have a subscription to Netflix, Prime Video, and Hulu.  We don't pay for cable, just the 3 services I mentioned above, and Roku comes with a ton of other options for watching regular TV shows and the news.  Haystack TV is my favorite free app that comes preinstalled on Roku, as it lets you customize which local or world news programs you see, and then it plays them all in rotation one 3-5 minute clip at a time. I love it. Every morning with my coffee I'm able to watch local news, world news, and the weather within about 12 minutes (and only on channels I prefer).

Roku requires the user to create an account to use streaming services on their device.  This isn't an issue in itself...but they also require a payment method (credit card or PayPal) and address despite the fact that I have no desire to purchase any services or apps from Roku directly.  Additionally, they serve ads to the user.  Now, I realize this isn't an issue for many, but these reasons are sufficient for me to return the device.  I will not surrender my CC info, phone number, and address to yet another business - especially one who I am not intending to purchase services from.  And I will NOT be served ads on a device by the company I've paid to provide the device.  I don't want your ecosystem, your proprietary services, or your ads - and I especially don't want your data scraping BS, selling my viewing habits and demographics to ad agencies to further your bottom line.  Give me just the hardware that can play my chosen streaming services!  That's what I'm paying for.  For these reasons, I'll hard pass on anything Roku in the future.

I don’t use the voice function or Alexa integration but I stream movies, music, and shows with no problems. No pixelation or buffering, great audio and video quality, and it has all the apps I like to use. Frequent app updates keep them running smoothly and download fast enough that I don’t have to wait on them to watch something.

The system got frozen more than too many times, and the live programs were not really alive but, were more like shows in advance because they were from the east coast area, and while I had only two other devices connected to my WiFi  it was getting freeze much too often

I knew this didn't have the TV controls on it (power and volume) and was ok with this for a spare bedroom, but it doesn't work as well as the "normal" full control Firestick. It glitches and I've had to restart this thing twice since I installed it 4 days ago. It is slow to load and movement around the apps is slow. I hate it and wouldn't recommend it at all- just spend the extra money because this is a mistake

I had a first generation stick and didn't realize what an upgrade this was going to be! So much faster, better resolution, the home page is personalized with your top apps. It's awesome. It asked me during set up if I wanted to transfer all my settings from the previous firestick, so there was almost no set up!

I just got this today, but am giving it five stars for ease of installation!I bought Chromecast two years ago, and I needed about four people to get it to work. Ugh.Anyway, Fire TV Stick Lite looks like a good bargain to me.  Thanks, Amazon!

There was no voice I had to return it T hey me another one n I had to send the other one bac and I did bout 2weeks ago now there saying that I didn’t return and I did they need to check there records!!! This has never happened to me before I’ve been a prime member for year’s very dissatisfied

I absolutely LOVE firesticks! I own 2 others and bought the 'lite' version for a kitchen TV. Mistake. I miss the extra features available with the regular firestick, especially the ability to operate the TV. Again, GREAT product that works the same as a regular firestick except you can't control the TV. So please consider that before you order lite and spend the few extra dollars for the regular firestick. I wish I had now.

Love the fire stick. This is my third one, and I’m gonna be getting another. I gave my other ones to my brother and mom. Easy set up, and the accounts link; so if I buy a movie, mom my can watch it on hers as well. I love the voice recognition because you don’t have to manually type everything, it works great.

Revised: Works great, much faster than the original version. Initially reported that the unit rebooted often, but it was searching for a wifi signal. Relocated the unit to another HDMI port that allowed it to access the wifi signal better. No more reboots.

When I canceled my cable I decided to try the Google Chromecast… That thing was always losing connection it was always causing issues and when we’re  trying to watch anything. One of the gifts my boyfriend got me this past Christmas was the fire stick. It’s now been a month since I’ve been using it and I have not had any problems at all. Streams everything just fine there’s plenty of apps and a lot of free apps as well. I highly recommend

I bought this to stream Hulu tv. The performance is terrible: constantly buffering, voice/video out of sync, no images when fast forwarding so you have to guess when the commercials end, skipping/missing time in shows. It works fine with Netflix and Amazon Prime though. I’ve switched to Xbox One for Hulu and it works great, so the problems are Hulu specific.

I purchased this item to replace an old Roku Stick that had audio distortion. Now I find that this one has distorted audio as well, perhaps even worse than the one it replaced. It's not the TV. There's no distortion when I listen to other sources using the same HDMI port on the TV. I've tried all the HDMI ports on the TV, and I've tried the stick on other TVs. The distortion follows the Roku stick. And I followed the only Roku-recommended solution of powering off the stick and the TV and restarting them, but the distortion persists.Additionally, the stick frequently fails to respond to the remote. It does eventually respond, but it sometimes takes up to 30 seconds to do so. It doesn't appear to be a problem with the remote, because the TV controls on the Roku remote (power, volume and mute) still work even when Roku is frozen (sometimes it freezes while on the Roku menu so that I'm unable to navigate, and other times it fails to respond when watching a channel (e.g., doesn't respond to the back button or the home button).All in all, I'm thoroughly disappointed with the product and will be returning it.

I had on old original ROKU that I suspected might be making my HULU freeze up and reboot constantly.  Turns out I was right.  I ordered this for $10 less than my local W-mart (wouldn't price match).  Plugged it in and HULU works pretty well now with very few hiccups.  I recently cut my cable provider and decided to try streaming.  HULU worked best for me with sports and locals.  Voice recognition is excellent.  Power and volume buttons for tv work great.  Wish it had a mute button and a channel back button though.  Also no longer has an Amazon shortcut key but has Netflix, ESPN, HULU, and Sling.  ROKU let's you access quite a bit of content too.

I am on my second Roku Streaming Stick+.  I returned the first one to Amazon thinking it was defective for eating batteries.  The second one does the exact same thing.  I went onto the ROKU BLOG and found many other users were having the same issue.  I contacted ROKU customer support and am waiting for them to send me a new remote that is supposed to solve the problem.  In the meantime their solution is to use the Smartphone app as a remote or try plugging the ROKU into a wall outlet (both are pretty sub-optimal suggestions).  Apparently the USB power option through your TV could be the root cause of their product defect.  I am a big fan of ROKU products and have had various ROKU's since their inception.  I do not have this issue with my ROKU express which is the product I would recommend buying until ROKU solves this product defect.  I will update this review when ROKU fixes the Streaming Stick+ remote defect.

I was very excited to use this product as I have a Roku device that has never failed me in over 5 yrs.  I recently brought a 4K TV and thought to upgrade the Roku system.  Everyone loved the ease, look and remote control...Fast forward 3 weeks:  The device started taking a long time to load, then started jumping to the starting screen, a few days later would continue to display "no signal".  Now every time we turn on the tV it prompts to pair the remote to the device and does not advance to actually pair.  I ended up disconnecting the stick from the TV and reconnecting the 5 yr old Roku and happily watching TV once again.  What a big disappointment with this Roku stick!  $50 wasted!

This is probably my fifth or sixth Roku stick and I am officially done with them.  I let my wife and I get used to them just dying after 5-6 months so we bought extras for when the next one died.  Then they started overheating on a regular basis which meant unplugging them and turning off the TV until they cooled down.  Then I got errors requiring me to unplug the Roku stick and my TV for everything to reset.  I'm done.  The Amazon Firestick is a superior product.  Bye Bye Roku

I got the Roku stick just for the xfinity ap so we do not have to pay for a cable box.  The claim of this product if to have a great remote and better range for WiFi, not so. Our Firestick on this TV has NEVER had an issue to the WiFi range but this Roku stick has terrible range and flat will not work. We even installed a mesh system and still have problems.  We have followed all the steps on the troubleshooting, and even got the hdmi extension  and it still does not consistently work.  We are pretty much at the stage of sending this back.  Firestick works MUCH better and we get access to pretty much everything  Roku has with the exception of the xfinity app.  I wish the Firestick had that ap.

Was on the fence between this and a Fire TV Stick, but CNET highly recommended this Roku streaming stick, so I decided to try it.TERRIBLE.The remote wouldn’t even pair. After trying several troubleshooting steps, which I had to google because Roku’s support site was such garbage, nothing worked.Definitely returning this and going with Amazon Fire TV stick.

I bought this to replace a Chromecast.Pressing the play/pause button on the remote while in screensaver mode (which, you will go into when paused so this happened to me a lot) "installs" channels that you don't want and didn't ask for.  It will also exit the app you are watching to do this. Infuriating.Ads plastered on 30% of the main screen.The Chromecast was simple, too simple.  In many ways it did more, and at least it was selling my data in the background instead of in my face :)Update: I have ditched this and got a "Chromecast with Google TV"  far superior, but you wont find it on Amazon because of of a Amazon/Google spat.

It works well until it doesn't. I have had every expert here or on the phone to figure out what's wrong. HULU, Netflix, My cable provider came out in the the truck. He said it's got to be your Roku. He said it might help to update firmware. I checked and it was up to date. I reset it. Then I completely tried to do a factory reset and it won't connect anymore.

The performance is great and it's easy to install. I wish that I had bought the unit that would control the TV volume and on/off. then we could get along with just one remote.  We use it with a Dish DVR and can do away with a couple of wireless Joey devices which are $7/month

If you don't mind using a second remote, the one that came with your TV, this is a great price for the LITE version. You probably have to use a second (or third) remote for your cable/satellite anyway so why not save a few bucks? The programming is excellent.

I got a firestick because cable is just to expensive so I decided to try it out and good for what it does but their are two thing I don't like about it number 1 the app selection is very limited compared to other streaming devices and number 2 is the remote I think it the biggest problem with the fire stick line it so cheap sometimes I will press the buttons and nothing will happen if they can make a better remote that will works 100% of the time I'm down. Apologies for the way I wrote this

I’m so in love with this Fire Stick Lite! I’m using it in my master bedroom and all the updates are wonderful. It was easy to connect everything. A lot of apps didn’t need me to sign in at all. The graphics are clear and very easy to understand. I’m so glad I upgraded.

I’ve been a faithful fire stick owner for like, a decade? And this one is crap. Not sure if it’s because it’s a “lite” or what. It runs sooooo slow & can’t seem to handle just Netflix and Hulu. I’d return it, but decided to just put in on a guest room tv that never gets used. Meh. I miss the fire tv :(

I bought the Lite version for my daughter so she could watch YouTube and I immediately noticed how much slower it is than all my other fire sticks are.  This will be the last one I buy.  I would recommend spending the extra money on the full version.

I got tired of waiting for Xfinity to add a streaming app to allow me to watch HBO Max on my TV, so I decided to purchase a device that would give me access to it. After reviewing the pros and cons of all devices that provided access to HBO Max, I decided to go for the Fire TV Stick Lite.In addition to HBO Max, it offers access to many streaming services. Best of all, It was very easy to set up.

Works great! One thing I didn’t know though: you apparently have to unplug then replug the fire stick to turn it on and off. It’s fine but I wasn’t aware when purchasing. I will admit I regret not buying the fire stick with volume control but it works perfectly fine and does what it’s supposed to.

I ordered this after several friends told me how great it was. It was perfect until it just all of a sudden stopped working. I tried the troubleshooting, everything recommended even after resetting back to the factory resets. But I really REALLY liked this product before it went out on me.
This firestick is so easy to set up.  It works just like the original one I bought for a better price

Works great with my super slow rural internet. I've always had Roku devices and I really like this firestick, which I bought to replace a many years old Roku stick. When it's time, I'll replace them all with firesticks. The internet browser alone is a game changer.

the price was right so i was willing to try and since then i purchased a few more for other tvs . now i can watch where ever i go. the only bad thing is that not all tvs can have it directly into the hdmi port but the extra extension makes it work.
It wouldn't stream properly so I sent it back and got the one with tv controls for 39.99 and it works perfectly.

I didn't know the difference between the 2 Firesticks meaning Regular/Lite. It's not noted when your looking to purchasing a Firestick. If it is I didn't see it. The controller doesn't illuminate, so at night it's hard to use the functions.  No closed captions option. My original TV controller no longer works, so it would have been nice to have these features. I should have done a lot more research before purchasing. I would have went with the regular Firestick. Also extremely disappointed that I signed up for Live TV then get an email 2 days later rates that are going up $20.00. Now I'm really saying WTF, this was a bad idea.

Fire TV Stick Lite is perfect. My TV remote actually works with it, so I didn't need the higher-priced Fire Stick. The Lite version is super-fast, very easy to install and makes it so easy to watch any program and app you want. Great, great product.

The remote is not design to control your TV or volume. AS some customers has stated some apps will display with a black box so you'll have to read which app it is to distinguish it from another. Overall it does everything that my other firestick(s) does so it's good for the low price. I have it installed in a spare bedroom.

Don’t use the voice recognition or volume control however this stick was so easy to set up it made me suspicious.It works much smoother than the old stick and acquires and keeps a signal whereas the old one wasn’t doing that any more.

Had Fire Stick for TV in family room. Added this to be able to use in Master Bedroom. Works well. Voice Recognition is work in progress obviously. We don't use Alexa for much so it is wasted on us. No Alexa in MBR; no need for spy in our bedroom.

As soon as i get this device, it started working fine fora few days and all of a sudden stoppedworking properly to the point of not working at all. Ive tried all settings and setups and nothing.i tried contacting the seller AMAZON but they just show you videos of how to reset and connect the device right but no customer service at all.

Easy to use and very reasonably priced. I got mine for $25 bucks and I love it!!  I had Roku before the amazon stick and I hated it. The Roku is much slower and doesn’t have voice control, the amazon stick was fast and program was easy to learn. Recommend over anything else for sure! Can’t go wrong with fire stick.

I have bought two of these and they both have the same problem where they stop recognizing the wireless receiver making the stick useless.  The full size versions to not have this problem,  if you go on ROKU forums you will see tons of people with the exact same issue.  Save your money and avoid this version at all costs!

Would recommend this Roku streaming stick+. Had issues with one of the two I purchased failing, but it was replaced, quickly. Cut my cable TV off months ago and these sticks have saved me tons of money. I'm a prime member, so have the benefit of prime video, which is perfect. They work on two, 10 year old TV's. One 58" Plasma and and another 32", basic flat screen. Have had them for about a year now and still working fine.I don't use the voice recognition or Alexa, so cannot comment on that.I gave the sticks a 5 star review but left the voice recognition and Alexa blank, so I hope that does not lower my 5 star rating.

I couldn't be more pleased with this Roku stick. I have a Samsung so-called SMART TV that is, frankly, an idiot.  The television is clunky, streams horribly, and super slow with the apps.  I got this Roku primarily for the Disney+ /Mandalorian/ series (which is awesome), but it's so much more than I bargained for.  First, it streams in 4K, and I didn't know my television was 4K!  Second, once it loads, the interface is /fast/, and my downloaded apps work /fast/.  Basically this inexpensive stick streamer saved me from throwing my Samsung television out the window.

Have had this for just under 6 months and now it has to be reset every day to be able to use it. Very frustrating to have to keep doing the setup on it anytime I want to use it. Last night we had to reset it multiple times before it would work. Not sure how much longer will be able to use it. Of course it only as a 30 day return policy so I'm out of luck getting a replacement. Says it was updated for 2019 but this must be older model hardware and only the software was updated. UPDATE: saw some other reviews that said something about the batteries. So I tried replacing the batteries before hitting the reset button once again. This worked, but I should not have to replace the batteries every day. So far 2 days in a row I've had to replace the batteries. UGH!

It's fast, and it's 4k... but that's all that's good about it. I have been having problems like so many other people have had with any 4k Roku. I will be watching something and it will go black with no sound for a few seconds then come back on. Poor streaming quality with a lot of the apps, like blurry for a couple minutes when I start a show. I have tried all troubleshooting there is for this device, I have read all the articles about these problems... nothing can be done. I wasted money on it. I have a 4k TV and I'll need to buy a 1080p Roku for it. What a waste.

This product is a terribly designed piece of equipment. They rely upon your wifi for the remote to work and it's a known issue that they cause problems between wifi routers and these remotes. Either your wifi will work or the remote will work. They both don't work at the same time EVER. Do a search for Roku Remote Keeps Falling Asleep, and Roku Breaks Wifi for a rundown on the issue. Roku customer support has been TERRIBLE on this issue, and despite this being a known issue, all they do is offer to send a new product out, which has the same exact issue. It's an amazing fail.

I purchased an Amazon fire stick first before this was so disappointed with the buffering. But this Roku stick is awesome!! We have used it in lieu of a cable box to stream live TV and it has worked flawlessly. It even worked in the furthest corner of our house in the garage! Very easy to set up and use. Only glitch has been the remote, a couple of times it seemed to freeze but after taking batteries out and putting them back in it works fine.

If you purchase this item you will have to pay 99.95 to get it hooked up at the last minute. I paid 69.95 because I told them I would not pay 99.95. I did not know there was a hookup charge, they don't tell you that until you have it all hooked up. Then you have to call them to complete the installation and that's when they want to charge you.I would not recommend this product because of this. I don't like surprises like that. If you are honest you would tell people up front there is a hookup charge.

I bought a couple of these.  The product works pretty good when it's working.  The wireless is unstable and doesn't connect sometimes even though I have a nearby brand new WiFi6 router.  The remotes are flaky and stop working for no apparent reason.  Sometimes you have to re-pair them to get them to work again.  They also eat batteries at an astonishing rate.  The wireless situation seems better after using the provided power adapter, since it's on all the time, and you don't have to wait what seems like an eternity for the wireless to connect.

Stopped Working after 90 days. We keep getting a "Low Power" Window that opens comes up every time we try to open up Roku Streaming Stick+ | HD/4K/HDR Streaming Device with Long-range Wireless and Voice Remote with TV Controls (updated model for 2019).  The original /standard Roku we purchased for our family room is still working well in our Family Room after several years.  I can't recommend version I'm reviewing with "Voice Remote" because it stopped working. Buy the less expensive version without the "voice remote".

I wish I had known to purchase this sooner. I almost bought a new tv just to obtain the smart feature. Installation was very easy and I was thrilled to find access to Netflix, Prime and Hulu plus much more. My cable service is very iffy when switching to Netflix and often freezes. Now it is so quick and smooth. Going to be a cable cutter very soon as this is the solution for me. The reception seems clearer than my cable service with no pixellation or problems receiving a channel - Only negative is the remote is small and seems cheap, doesn't light up like my cable provided remote - It does have volume control on it.

Cut the cord from satellite. Streaming via dsl for 1/4 the price of dish and directv. Super easy setup and install. Tried the voice recognition and it was more trouble than just clicking about I found. It did not like me yelling “ No that’s NOT what I said” at it repeatedly. And sometimes in the middle of a show the roku will suddenly go into reboot mode and make this crazy bloop bloop bloop sounds. Then I can restart my programs and watch all those great commercials agin on youtubetv that I used to able to skip until they raised their price by $10 a month. Still saving $100 a month over satellite though so I guess I can watch those endless Car commercials and erectile dysfunction ads.

I've loved Roku and want to put it on more TVs here at my house and replace the F i r e sticks I have here.  But the remote that came with mine has to be reset 3-4 times/day.  I loaded the Roku app on my phone which works well as a remote so not a huge loss, but the worry about the remote functionality prevents me from purchasing more just to swap out my fire sticks .

After a ton of research on ways to decrease our cable bill WITHOUT losing the services we love I found Roku which is one of the only streaming devices that can stream Xfinity. So I bought on Black Friday for $29 each and plugged them into all the TVs in the house and got rid of the physical cable boxes with exception to one - the main “set top DVR” box which you have to keep but runs $10 for rental... ok better than the $60 I was paying each month for all 6 boxes with a one time investment of $145 for all the Rokus which literally pays for themselves after 2.5 cable bills!

We have cut the cable and in my TV room which is in the back of the house the reception was horrible.  Lots of spooling time, pixels, sometime so bad I would turn off the TV.  All of that stopped when I plugged in the Roku wireless stick.  I now enjoy shows uninterrupted by any of that. Also, I am not the most techy person and usually have my daughter set things up for me the  first time, but I was able to set it up myself.  I am very happy, so much so that I bought two more for Christmas gifts.  Try it, you won't be sorry.  And if you are, hey it's Amazon they will take it back.

I did not like the fact that the same product I ordered on Tuesday evening dropped $10 the day the I received it two days later on Thursday.  Doesn't seem right.  I should received a 10 credit!!  Had I not set it up last night, I would have returned it and bought another one for $10 less.  $39.99 not $49.99.  Credit please!!!!

The new policy of Roku of not letting you code in until you call them.....then they want all of your personnel information, including a credit card number. Will not do business with Roku in the future.

This is my 2nd roku device. Bought this one for basement tv, however the activation code would not work and it prompted me to call help number. They informed me that in order to have more than one device I’d have to PAY a $75 configuration fee. WHAT?? You think they would want you to purchase multiple!  Never buy another of there products!!

I bought this device because one of my smart TVs constantly loses connection while streaming and the hope was that this device would improve on that. I saw Roku Streaming sticks for about $20 but I wanted to buy the best quality one available. This device was easy to setup outside of the remote control accidentally turning off my Roku TV in another room. The picture quality is excellent, there is a great selection of apps and I've yet to see any interruption with streaming.  Highly recommended!

Using these to save money by not having to pay monthly costs for a cable company unit.  However I do not like it as well.  You have to go through the entire process each time I turn it on.  It also runs about a minute later than the cable boxes, which is very irritating.  I have only one hooked up at the present time because of the delay.  I may like it better once the other TVs on this floor are in the same mode.  Prefer the cable boxes but not the price.

This is my fourth Roku device, I purchased it as a replacement after my previous Streaming Stick+ stopped working one day during quarantine. For some reason, I am repeatedly getting an error message that my device is overheating. I have the issue when it is plugged into the TV directly, as well as when plugged into a surge protector. I’ve tried other plug adapters, and I’ve moved it to different rooms and will get the error periodically regardless of any of those factors. Perhaps it’s just a faulty stick, as I’ve never run into this issue before using my previous Roku sticks and my little express never has the issue either.

Roku worked well for a year. However, the remote doesn't communicate with the main player anymore. Thinking it was just a broken remote, I spent another $20 for a new one. I followed the steps:1. Remove the power cable from the players, waited 5 seconds then re-connect it.2. I waited for the home screen to appear and insert the batteries into my remote (old and new one).3. I pressed and hold the Pairing button down for 5 seconds until I saw the LED status light to begin flashing.4. I wait 30 seconds for the remote pair with the player.Nothing happens so I repeated steps 1-4 10-11 times. NOTHING. ROKU is terrible! Doesn't last!! I'm not buying another player for it to break again.

I bought a second Roku because I liked it better than Amazon firestick;  the controls on Roku remote are very intuitive but NOT on Firestick so I found myself constantly turning on the lights to figure out where the controls are on the Firestick; mind you, it is fair to state that I purchased the Roku and Firestick at the same time for both my TV's and use them equally;  I also like the menu much better with the Roku;  I will not be returning the Firestick because it is not broken but it is certainly NOT for me.

I own a Apple TV, Amazon Firestick, and this Roku stick. I hooked this up to my 4K tv which also has the fire stick and this thing blows it away. I love how the remote can turn my tv on and control the volume so I can do away with the tv remote. The 4K quality is very good. Finally, the tv’s USB port provides enough power so I don’t need to plug it in. Something the firestick couldn’t do.This is hands down the best device on the market.Bonus - you can chromecast through the YouTube app.

We purchased the Roku to replace Xfinity boxes in our house that they charged rent for.  The Xfinity app they offer works pretty good on the Roku and has saved us a lot of money.  We went with this unit to have one remote to control the tv and the extended wifi range.  It has worked everywhere we setup and like it overall.  There are some corks with the Xfinity app and the function, but that has nothing to do with Roku.....it is the 3rd party app.

The Roku Stick is an update for our home, and install was fairly quick and easy. The "stream" issues are that the company we have for internet and Roku are in a pissing match and we cannot use Roku with that companies app until they resolve their issues. So, have to use the older Roku (which already had the app) until agreement made and can download the app to the newer Roku. You think these companies made enough money already to avoid these kinds of issues, but no.

Not what it's cooked up to be this Roku stick. There's lots of channels, but the content of the free channels is totally out dated, programs from decades ago and the movies are no block busters, only the pay channels are worth it but it's like having cable but by different providers because.... yes you have to pay.

I bought this to replace a 2-year-old Roku Express that was getting slow and buggy. Wow, what a difference! The Stick + is so much faster. I love how I can use its remote to turn on/of the TV and adjust the volume. I also love how it stays hidden behind the TV. It was easy to set up and I haven't had any issues. It's also easy to deactivate your old Roku and unlink it from your account.It's important to note that there's a scam going around that wants you to pay $70 to activate multiple Roku devices. This is false. Be sure to go the Roku activation URL directly instead of Googling it. The real Roku won't ask you for money to activate.

Seems to stream OK. Seems to understand voice requests OK. The mute button on the remote is in the worst possible spot. I am constantly accidentally hitting the mute button. It sucks. I can’t believe I have to scroll through so many advertisements to get to the streaming channels, which are the reason that I even got this thing. I am a many - year fire TV user who is not yet impressed with Roku. I will try it long enough to get in the habit of using it.

Great product my only complaint is that the batteries in the remote have to be changed every month.  Found some posts online apparently I am not the only person having this problem.  Roku needs to fix this issue.  Replacing batteries every 3 to 4 weeks is unacceptable.

I originally got a this for my toddler to replace the older one but with the newer version wants the passcode to get into everything instead of just things that are age restricted or that would cost money so it didn’t work for what I originally wanted it for but now I get to have a fire stick in my room too 🤣

Works ok, though I wished it doesn't require an amazon account in order to use it, also wished it had google play store installed, without it I had to side load some of the apps and I can't install some of the awesome apps I bought on play store.

Hey, I am almost 70 and have arthritis in my hands, this tool makes it easy.  Speak to the fire stick and get what you want.  Alexa please play my favorite rock station. Alexa, please open Amazon Prime Video.  It works for me.Richard Viers.

I honestly cant tell much difference between this one and the regular other than the feel of the remote. One big complaint though is Amazon cant seem to come to terms with HBOMax so Im still unable to watch it on the service. I will raise a star once they quit doing this and fix it.

The only thing that I dislike about this version of the Fire Stick is that it does not have FreeTime for it. I bought this for one of my kid's TV specifically for FreeTime only to find out that it doesn't have a compatible app for it. Nor does it tell you that in the details from the site.

The Amazon fire TV stick opens up a whole new world of entertainment possibilities for you. Thousands of channels are awaiting you, along with all of the latest and hottest apps for viewing of TV shows and movies and more. This was the Best purchase that I have made in a long long time. The fire stick is easy and seamless to use.

We have a non-smart tv in the bedroom and for this small price we no have what is a effectively a smart tv with all the apps we have on our smart tv from the living room. It was easy to set up and the voice recognition makes it easier to access.
Mi screen tv se volvió smart. Con el fire stick es asombroso. Se baja aplicaciones y se puede ver lo q uno desee. El comando de voz muy efectivo. Recomiendo este producto.

I bought this for my grandma because her cable bill was ridiculous! Her favorite channels and shows were costing more. Now, she can watch all her favorite shows as a decent price and I can support her with any technology issues she may have. It’s pretty simple to navigate and it only took a little while to introduce the process. It also helps that there is Alexa attached because of my grandmas poor eyesight, it helps to just say what she wants done!

Set up the Fire Stick Lite for my bedroom TV. I already have a Fire Stick on the Family Room TV and enjoyed using it.  After setting up the Fire Stick Lite using the provided plug and cable. Using the HDMI Extension cable to keep away from the TV, the Stick tends to over heat causing the it to glitch or shut down.

I love the newest Fire Stick! It has many more features and the picture is great, especially on YouTube (I also have a ROKU so am able to compare). And no, I will not get rid of my ROKU. :) I haven't tried Alexa yet; don't like talking to machines. Maybe one day I will. lol

I love the lite version of the fire stick however i do not like that little tv button at the bottom it’s so useless and I wish it wasn’t there at all because then everytime I accidentally hit it it takes me out of everything I’m doing. Highly annoying over all its a great lite version

Great product. It does everything I need as far as Watching my streaming apps.It also has a web browser which makes it lightyears ahead of Roku.I used to be a Roku guy, and this made me switch up.The only thing is that the app gets confused if you have shudder, and its NOT through prime.

It was letting connect to my amazon at first but it then logged itself out and now it won't let me back in . and it is starting to get really annoying and i have not been able to use my fire stick at first but now it won't let me in anymore.

This remote is easily my new fav!! It is quite simple to operate and I enjoy the voice command function. Set up took no time at all and the interactive menu is top notch. Makes watching all my streaming services a breeze, highly recommended

This version of fire TV is more affordable than the 4K. We have both at home and I like both but the volume and power TV control buttons on the 4K version are helpful. I didn’t notice much difference in picture quality though for streaming.

i dont like the new format. its not as user friendly and easy to navigate as the original. i recvomend returning to the original format.the device itsself functions wonderfully. my family loves the fire stick, sreaming and Amazon prime

I really don’t like the new menus. I’ve had several Fire TVs and sticks A d the menu is too difficult to navigate with the newer smaller home widgets. It’s difficult to know if you’re on a main home widget or on something else like an add for a non Amazon product.

I am glad I upgraded my firestick. My old one was glitchy and starting to get very annoying. The new one gave me new options and more channels (of all things). I am really enjoying the speed and the many options of finding things to watch.

For under $20 Amazon fire stick lite IMHO is best streaming device i ever owned and here is why.  #1. Price can't be beat.  #2.  So simple to activate that even i had no trouble.  #3.  Alexa voice recognition actually works unlike the Roku's that i previously owned which were more than double the price.  #4.  Simple control buttons and ease of use. I am so happy i tried the fire stick  lite. I highly recommend it , low price, high quality.

I used this for the TV in my kitchen . I don’t mind clicking  through all menus to get to my channel line up in my xfinity app. But I thought once there I would be able to voice command to another channel and it doesn’t work like that. The voice command is only good to get to different apps. That’s why I gave voice recognition a 3 star rating. But this appliance with xfinity app ( Comcast cable)  allows you to watch your taped shows, on demand, favorite channels ( which need to be set on cable first) all from your roku. It’s pretty cool to not need to pay for a monthly cable box.

for the past  week, it is a 50 50 shot at having this Roku work.  I know it is not the TV or the connection, because when it doesn't work, I change it out for an Amazon Fire Stick and everything is fine.  I have even swaped it out for a different Roku stick and that one works.  My choice would be a Roku because it controls on/off and volume, which my Amazon Fire Sticks do not.  But the most important thing is to have it work,  Very disappointed, it is my most expensive TV device. and it is too late to return it.

Much to my wife's bemusement I cut the cable. I promised the great new world of live TV streaming. Well, Roku Streaming Stick + just doesn't deliver. The remote is randomly disconnecting, the stick doesn't always start. I returned one unit thinking I got a lemon and got the same behavior with another unit. It turns out the unit may not like being plugged into the HDMI as it degrades the remote performance. Why the hell is it then designed to plug into HDMI?? So I ordered an extension and run it away from TV. I still have issues with it coming on. This is utterly disappointing.  Two stars because it works well when it works. But random failures to start and remote disconnections are really frustrating. My Cable TV came on when I pressed the button. This should too.

worked great for about 6 wks, then remote failed, only working maybe 10% of the time and only when 2 feet or less from the receiver, which I can accept if I had an option to return for a replacement because that could just be a 1 off defective remote, however same issue with my other Roku remote. I have 3 in my house 2 do not work after light use for 2 months or less.  I tried all the "fixes" multiple times with no success, so 2 stars is probably more than deserved.

Great product , second Roku device, got the cheapest one about 2 years ago for the living room and got this one for my room since my room is far from the wifi, thought this would be better , and it’s great!! Haven’t used all the features yet but it’s cool I can control my t.v with the Roku remote (on/off and volume) and since I only use my tv for Roku it’s like I don’t need the t.v remote! So it’s one less remote to worry about. Fast and great picture. Can watch all my favs , including all of my anime apps which is fantastic! I am very happy. If I had one complaint it would be that it was supposed to come in a week but it took a little over two weeks. But other then that it’s great.

I bought 2 Roku Stick+ with the intention of getting rid of cable and going with a streaming service, then discovered our cable is actually cheaper, so, now the thought is to just use the cable's app and return our cable boxes and cancel DVR service since most all my shows are On Demand or on apps anyway. I just love the voice thing that lets you say the name of a tv show or movie or even the name of an app and it finds it. That saves me from having to type everything, and they will pay for themselves with the money I will save from not having the $8 per box rental and $10 DVR fee every month.

Only recently did I get rid of my cable as the bill for my cable and internet ( package deal) had risen to over 170.00 per month and I just couldn't do it. But by keeping my internet and  using this Roku, I am able to save well over half of that money and get almost everything I could ask for with no extra monthly fees. Yes, there are some channels I could subscribe to for a an extra fee but I don't need them. there are hundreds of movies and dozens of free channels for TV, plus I can. also get anything local on my computer ( weather, news, etc.)  Setup was fast and easy  My only regret is not doing this sooner but then again, I understand that this newest edition os a great improvement over the earlier efforts. Highly recommended.

I got rid of Directv about 6 months ago and got a Roku and an antenna. After 6 months I have ZERO regrets. I use the antenna to get all my local stations and use Playstation Vue for the other ones. The Roku offers a cloud based DVR which really is not a DVR. It basically will keep the shows in the cloud for x number of days before they drop them but it works fine for me. I use the Vudu app to rent movies and there are many on demand apps that you can use as well.My only complaint (otherwise would be 5 star) is there does seem to be a small audio lag issue with this model. You can fix it by setting the Sound to stereo but it does not seem to be just me. I have googled several times to check forums and it does seem to be a known issue so hopefully Roku will get it fixed.

I absolutely love Roku. We just switched to Roku and ditched cable for good. We also purchased YouTube TV so we have local stations and the cable stations we previously had. Due to the depressing news I find myself watching Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime shows more than anything else. Make the switch, you won’t be disappointed!

Bought the Roku Stick received it and hooked it up and nothing it wouldn't even power on so sent that one back and  exchanged it for the same , that one showed up hooked that one up and it does the same thing nothing called Roku Tech and he says try a different TV I said it shouldn't matter what TV or what HDMI port you hook it up to . So to keep the Tech happy I tried a different TV and it didn't work just like I told the Tech it wouldn't work.I told him its pretty bad when you buy a Roku stick and have to call Tech support first thing because you are selling defective crap.

After an hour long call with tech support, it was determined that my fire stick was non functioning. Got a credit and had to purchase a new one. I do not have Alexa and Amazon does not make a Firestick without that capability. That stinks.

My son and daughter-in-law gave a Fire Stick for Christmas. What a wonderful gift!  It is easy to use and I really like how I can watch pretty much anything I want to see.  If they had not bought it for me I would have bought one for myself.

Yippee! Now my parents are able to watch things like Netflix, Disney +, and other things. They are NOT tech savvy but I installed it and showed them a few times and they are pros. It also takes an old TV and makes it able to do the stuff a new one can with a much cheaper price tag. Great product.

I didn’t know what I bought honestly. My home entertainment system was run by Google and I wanted to try Alexa Firestick. It was on sale and I went ahead and bought it.I didn’t like that I cant control the TV volume with it and there is no volume control in the remote as well. It’s a big deal.It was my fault I didn’t read the description well though and for $18 you cant go wrong. I can live with it.

Before I used fire TV stick I used a cable to stretch across the room to my computer.  A pain to hook up and put away. Plus a hazard for someone walking through the living room.Now I just change the TV input and bring up the programs I've subscribed to.  Very ease.

This one works for now. My experience with these is they don’t last more than a couple of years. Maybe this is because periodically changes the operating code and the remote doesn’t work with the new system and a new fire tv must be purchased. There should be a way to upgrade the remote so it will continue to work

At first I wasn't sure I wanted or needed one.  Well, I really love it!  I use it a LOT for Amazon music.  It saved my sanity when all of the politic commercials  were on.  I enjoy its many uses, calling people hands free, information that I don't need to turn on my pc or phone to find out.
All works great except the sound. It has to be unplugged to reset every time I turn my tv on.

I moved into an apartment complex where internet was included. My Roku tv was not connecting to WiFi and I was concerned I’d need to purchase internet with own hardware or buy a new tv with Ethernet. My tv has hdmi so I wanted to try firetv first. I ordered this in the morning and Amazon delivered later that day. I opened the package plugged into my tv and my Roku tv was connected in less than 3 minutes!Thank you Amazon for fast solution to my problem. I’m also loving that Alexa works with this and my echo dot.

I would like a visual listing of programs with dates and times for selected locations such as Prime App Box.  It takes some time to become comfortable with how everything works.  I have found many things quite by "accident".  When in doubt I ask Alexa but even then Alexa doesn't always know the answer. It is challenging at times.  The equipment works as intended but moving around in the apps takes some time to master.  I would purchase Amazon Firestick again.

I purchased this for my office thinking it would be an easy way for me to stream shows.  I was pleasantly surprises with all of the apps and the included browser.  My Roku stick does not have that.  Neither does my Xfinity app. Very easy to hook up to my home network and use.  Everything came in the box.  Caught it on sale.

Ok all the features work, however I was hesitant to purchase this one from looking at other people’s reviews. After a month of use, the sound wasn’t working. I checked my tv alone and also with another stick just to make sure. I unplugged the stick and shook it a few times then it worked. A week later there was the same issue. I wish I had kept the box to return. Now will have to buy another.

I bought this for my upstairs bedroom. I have used Roku many times before but have had an issue with some of the sites buffering because it is so far away from the internet box. This has the long range wireless and seemed to take care of the problem. I don't have the buffering that I had before. Everything is crystal clear. The voice command works very well which is great for my granddaughter when she searches youtube. The channels with Roku are seemingly endless and it's fun to just search around seeing what's out there. If you're thinking about purchasing, this is a really good one.

I just ordered a 2nd fire stick for another TV.  The functionality and convenience is outstanding.  I was able to load HBO Max and can now watch content from the same without having to cast it from my IPad.  I’m disappointed I did not order one long ago.  It really opens up excellent streaming functions and all with simple voice commands.  Great product!

The lite version isn’t anywhere near as good as the new firestick with the built in volume controls. We need to manually reset the lite version to get the sound to work every single time we use it the next day. The one with the volume built in controls the TV power and the volume on the sound bar. I wish I’d bought two of the one with sound included but now they aren’t on sale and it’s too late to return the lite.
Well the one I bought said TV that’s why I bought it. But it doesn’t control me TV nor volume. I didn’t want to be without fire stick any longer than I’d already so that is why I didn’t return it.
