Why make a remote you can speak to that doesn’t turn your tv off and on ? Or control volume? Great product but they dropped the ball on that part, I bought 3 for gifts well received for certain.especially for the kids TVs that aren’t smart TVs

This is not what I thought it would be.I'm not a Technical person so not having a volume button throws me off, and I  still need the cable remote to turn my T.V off and on. But it's ok I guess since I  no longer have cable just internet.

I've had Firesticks before but recently bought 2 over the holidays and both are junk. Not sure what is going on both frequently restart on their own repeatedly to no positive effect and often the sound doesn't work until unplug/replug power supply.

This is my second Amazon Fire TV Stick because I was very happy with the first one and decided I needed another one for the TV in my bedroom.  I did not program it for Alexa Voice Remote because I don't use it but the instructions are very easy .

It was time to cut the cable cord so I figured I would give this a try.  I'm so glad I did!  Easy to set up; took about 10 minutes.  A lot of free apps that can be downloaded at no charge.  You can find anything and everything that you would want to watch.

Tv was set up so Fire TV was a smart tv selection but I did not like the ability to focus on its use alone. So I purchased stick to go in HDMI 2 and it seems to work more easily but it did take a bit of time to get thr smArt tv to accept it.

Well , I am so pleased with customer serviceI had posted a negative review, Regarding my fire stick because I could not hook it up and a friend could not hook it up. I thought I had a bad remote control and I was just going to count it as a lesson learned. Amazon called me after I posted the review and a sweet young man helped me hook the fire stick up and it is working perfectly so I am so thrilled. It takes an older not so smart TV and turns it into some thing I can really enjoy so I am very pleased with Amazon customer support

This was easy to install but I needed a little help from my friend on how to get started once it was installed. In these pandemic days we wanted more choices of tv shows and movies  I didn't have a smart tv and the Fire Stick converted my old Samsung tv and I signed up for Prime.  Best thing we could have done.  My husband is watching an episode of Jamestown as we speak.

I must say this product of the firetv is amazing! Definitely a great invention. For people who don’t want to have cable and pay so much money. This is definitely a great alternative that is worth the money. Very genius idea! 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Don’t mind the college textbook in the back. That does not come with the package lol

I've been avoiding upgrading my old firestick for a while because I'm leery of remotes with "smart" features that turn themselves on unexpectedly. No worries with this remote. My Amazon Prime experience has improved dramatically, streaming is seamless, and the picture is better.

I have to unplug it & back in sometimes twice, EVERYDAY when I turn the TV on because there is no sound?? I know for CERTAIN it is the FireStick cuz the sound works if I switch input to cable or DVD etc. Spend the extra $$ for the one w/the TV controls. I have 2 of those on other TVs and no issues.

Someone tampered with my box, batteries were removed.  Quite frankly parts of my supposedly new device looks used, starting with adapter end and remote.  Surprisingly remote took awhile to pair. Waiting un software to install currently

Basically, the only thing this remote left off is the tv controls. You can't use the Amazon remote to cut the tv on and off or to control the volume. It requires you to always have to use 2 remote. Didn't realize this was the lite version, do NOT recommend.

I bought this for my 8 year Son. It’s really hard to set parameters without paying additional for the Kids Software. This was my first time using a Fire Device and I assumed the Apps would all be on a separate page but they are literally inter grated into the Amazon Video screen with access to all the Movies and TV Shows I was trying to keep my son from.

Very clitchy compared to RokuTried to over look the freezing and when you pause something long enough for the screen saver to come on you can’t just press play you have to go to the main menu then to whatever app(Netflix hbo max Amazon prime)you were on then find the program you were watching then resume playing itBut the clincher for me was the audio output suddenly went from 5.1 to 2 channelI switched over to my Directv and had 5.1 back to fire stick 2 channel,hooked my Roku back up and glorious 5.1 againDo yourself a favor get the Roku way less clutter and no performance issues

I have owned roku 1, 2s and 3s and ultra, I purchased 3 or 4  of these for the sole reason is that these can control your TV power and volume,  Since I was cutting the cord with cable.  They all have remote problems, one of them I switched to the built in smart TV, 2 of them I went back to a roku 3 and the last one I keep having to go and unplug then reply in. If it's been on for a bit and you don't use the remote for a couple hours, it quits working....on all of them. Maybe they have a conflict with Google wifi

So me and my girlfriend just moved into our home.  We are first time buyers and are very new to purchasing our own cable and how channels come bundled.  After settling with a tv provider we soon realized that our tier although was 80$ for tv and internet a month .. our favorite shows were considered premium...Now that every show/channel has an app on  Roku we just use our other family members log in who pays for the premium channels and use his log in for the Roku app.  We toss him 20$ for his bill and we get all the channels and shows we want .As far as performance goes .. I would say I’m about 20 ish yards away from my router and I get no lag .  My router is high performing though so results may vary * lol.  Remote is easy to navigate things and it shows a battery charge icon which is nice .  Great buy for family members who don’t have smart TVs .

I like it a lot. This is my third Roku for a new tv, and the old ones are still working like a champ. I like the Roku over the default webos interface. My only complaint is that the remote will not switch inputs on my TV. I even tried with the voice option to switch inputs and it did not work. If the remote had a switch input option so I could switch to the Xbox without using my other remote, it would have been a full five stars.

The sound was going out on my TV. Thought it was the TV. Further investigation showed it was the roku. I am constantly having to unplug the device and plug it back in as sound continues to go out. Not a happy customer. Additionally, you pay for return postage. And have 30 days for refund. I won’t be buying this product again. No option to talk to roku customer service

I had the first version roku stick for 2 years and had started to get a wide blue line thru picture. Didn't know if it was roku or my TV but ordered roku streaming stick+. Setup was a snap. (I was able to skip thru credit card info - that's VERY offensive to me.) Got thru setup, added new free channels, and my picture is now perfect - no big blues. Seems like original should have had more than 2 year life but I'm happy to have good pic now.  I don't use alot of the bells and whistles but there are some things I will check out. From what I've seen and heard from friends, I'm glad I stayed with roku rather than going to Amazon Fire TV.

2 services that were hard for me to get are Amazon Prime and Netflix. This Roku addresses those and much more. Set up was easy - system is very intuitive. Wireless ac is a plus as this helps with speed and traffic on my house system. I have a Smart Samsung which has a wired connection to my network, but Netflix was choppy. The Roku seems to provide a cleaner access. My other installation is on an older Runco tv where I enhanced the audio with a soundbar. This was a little bit of a problem as the Runco does not have an HDMI ARC input and the soundbar is wedged between some other components and one of the "Hints" is that if you have poor wireless reception, move the Roku away from other stuff. However, the reception is great and all seems good.

Be careful where you purchase. Roku has no activation fee. Attempted to load this and when tried to set up, hte on screen prompt was to call a 1-800 number that asked for a $80 activation fee. Clearly a scam. Do not purchase this item from this seller.

After 20 years paying exorbitant fees to the local cable co., I decided to ‘cut the cord’ and I couldn’t be happier. Had I known about streaming sticks before, I would have ditched cable much earlier, but most people still think that cable or dish are the only choices available to them.I’m 59 and use the Roku mainly to watch movies and news, although I’m still exploring the possibilities and finding my way around. I’m glad I can have a lineup of favourite channels in order to avoid those I don’t care about. I’m also very pleased to be able to watch international tv channels through YouTube. One thing I wished, though, is there were more free educational channels available, but I might end up finding them.

I love the Roku.  It is so easy to install and streaming is awesome. I am able to get all of my streaming channels in one place. So many free movies I can watch. I don't mind about the commercials. Don't know why I took so long to get it. I love that I was able to use it in my RV when we are in places that internet for me to connect to. I was able to use on a vacation with our granddaughter and get the Disney Plus. It is well worth the money

I've been using the original Fire stick for several years and didn't really want to get a new one -- fearing a steep learning curve.  Now I'm glad I switched.  This Fire stick works better than the original, and it was easy to set up.

I have a roku which i love and recently purchased a fire stick because i was talked into it by all my friends. I like it and i'm happy with my purchase. It works well, integrates well with everything i already have and i can use it with my alexas. Worth  the money

This was an upgrade to the first gen fire tv stick that I had been using for years.  The Fire TV Stick Lite is a lot better.  The menu and programs load a lot faster.  I like the simple remote, however the one thing that could be changed is the location of the guide button, which is right below the play/pause button, because I find myself accidentally clicking it.  The Alexa addition is a nice feature to find shows or movies quickly.  Overall, it was a good purchase.

We switched from Roku to Amazon Firestick Lite for YouTube Kids access and have had nothing but problems ever since.  We have 2 of them and have to unplug them at least once daily (if not more) because they freeze when they go into slumber.  Profiles won't load or the apps won't load.  It's frustrating, but until Roku gets YouTubeKids we are stuck with these garbage sticks.  Disappointed.

The one bad thing about this device is that it interferes, actually stopped my television's normal connection to the internet. So in order to watch the NetTV apps installed on my tv I'll have to disconnect the firestick. That's annoying.

I have held off streaming and remained on only cable tv forever.  After seeing this, I thought it was time to give it a try.  I have not been disappointed.  It is easy to use and the quality is amazing.  I'm having so much fun exploring all the possibilities.  Hey, old ladies can still learn new tricks.

I had the old fire stick and I am still getting used to this new one. Looks like the same but many more options and improvements. I made the change because the other one start to not working and at the begging I was a little bit piss off but now I am very happy with the change. I love that I have the tv option so accesible!!

I just live my fire stick, best invention ever. Have one of the older flat screen televisions and the puctures that come thru are just spectacular. I do recommend this to anyone that wants to save money on them expensive cable bills.

Perfect for small or older TV that is only up to 1080p.Only thing lite I see is the tv volume button is in the non-lite version.Give new life to a older tv that have old clunky smart function or no app support.

The Fire Stick is just so easy, I’ve not used anything else... I have no complaints or ideas to improve this product. You install it in about 5 minutes, then pull up You Tube, Amazon, Hallmark, Disney...it’s all right there in seconds!

This is my second streaming stick with Roku and I love them! My first was the original which eventually no longer had a compatible replacement remote and began to run slower (still not too bad, just had more times it needed to reload here and there along with Aldo not updating with a few apps) so it was time for a new model... and this one is awesome! Still the same great performance and more!

So, this is the second one of these we have bought. The first one stopped working after 6 months. Roku never responded for support and Amazon refunded that one. We bought a replacement. This one made it 10 months before it started having issues connecting to WiFi and the remote. Contacted support and they outright said I can't return the item. Amazon won't refund this time.What's amazing is we have a 1st generation Apple TV on the same TV and it still works. So, now that YouTube TV is on Apple TV, we will be switching to that. No more Roku products for us...

I originally bought this for my bedroom TV, but when it came in, my dad said "Just hook it up to the TV in the living room. I want to see what it's all about." Needless to say, it is now my dad's Roku. He guards the remote like it's his job.  He loves it! And my dad is NOT electronic friendly. He can look at a laptop and break it, but the remote for the Roku is so easy to use and now he's discovered how to download APPS! He's in heaven and I have to admit, it's nice to see him enjoying it. As far as the product goes, I couldn't be more pleased. It works just like it's supposed to work. Streaming is smooth, picture is great and the remote is the best remote I have used in years! If I could rate it higher than five stars, I would. :)

We're very happy with our Roku. We had been using and slowly killing our xbox by having it on non stop and running the apps through there. So the roku hookup and operation is really simple and easy. We have some of the worst internet in the world - we have to use a cell repeater and then got a mobile hot spot with that and we have had zero issues streaming. (We use a tmobile franklin hot spot) I am very very happy with it and highly recommend!

Bought, used for a month, left alone for 4 months now not working.  ROKU says replace the remote.  BS.  Customer service is email. NO PHONE CONTACT. Convenient. They tell you how to try and reconnect your ROKU. Already tried that and now their recommendation is replace remote.  Really?!  Been there, done that, did that.

This iteration of the Roku Streaming Stick is outstanding.  It receives our WiFi signal really well even though neither of our two routers is especially nearby.  We don't have problems with skips or picture quality.  The interface runs very fast and smoothly on the SS+ versus our original version Streaming Stick.  Apps start much quicker on the SS+.  Probably the best part for us is that the SS+ remote also operates the basic functions of our TV (i.e. power and volume).  We had previously had a really basic cable box on this TV, and the remote from the cable company didn't operate the TV and it was more of a hassle than we expected to juggle the two remotes.  The Roku Streaming Stick+ was a big "quality of life" improvement in that regard.  Also, Roku devices are I believe the only streaming devices that carry the Spectrum TV app, which is vitally important for us since we are Spectrum subscribers.  All in all, we are extremely happy with the Roku Streaming Stick+.

One year after purchase my only complaint is that it occasionally overheats when watching 4k/UHD even when using the extension cord provided that is designed to correct the overheating issue.  Also my remote occasionally un-pairs itself from the TV.  My workaround is the ROKU app on my phone to navigate the on screen menus to pair it with the TV again.  Friends have operated it and then complained about their Fire TV Sticks crappy operation in comparison to my ROKU operation and selection.  Specifically this has xfinity streaming which is provided via xfinity cable company in this area.

It’s a great streaming stick. It’s UI is well done and the remote is a joy to use when the batteries are not dead. Which is most times. A fresh set of batteries will be completely drained in 5-7 days even if sitting unused the whole time. I have been through 4 sets of batteries since I purchased it about 2 months ago. Most of my time spent with it I need to use the App because I don’t have that many batteries available to just burn up like that. Working the device through the App is fine but the appeal of the device is the remote itself. So that’s a bummer.

This has trouble with 4k. Our stick often overheats (yes we contacted roku and they sent an extension stick for it but it still overheats) when we watch in 4k so anymore we don't bother with 4k options. Streams 1080p seemingly fine but we get a much better picture when we stream from our ps4.Alexia works sometimes and it more depends on the app you are wanting it to access.Overall it's great for everyday viewing but for those serious about picture quality save your money. I think the issue comes down to processing power and this small stick just doesnt have it for 4k. I really like the roku remote, the d pad selection and quick buttons makes it real easy and responsive.

I have a Samsung “smart” TV, but it constantly glitches in connecting to the WiFi, or there’s a lag between turning on the TV and connecting.  There are also streaming quality and continuity issues as well, so even though I have two other Roku ULTRA 4Ks I decided to do a streaming stick because this TV is wall mounted.Works great!  Streaming quality is outstanding and rarely have any issues.  Two things that bug me a little.1) Whenever I turn on the TV, Streaming stick goes thru its boot up sequence where the word “Roku” bounces up and down for a few seconds.  “Doodly-doo, doodly-doo”2) If the stick has been on a while, it gets a little hot.  I wouldn’t ever normally notice this but took it out to plug into my projector and was like “Wow, that’s a little hot.”

Samsung firmware updates had rendered my wifi and lan connections on my 5yo $2400 smart tv worthless.  Had even installed a new wifi card which worked a couples days until they bricked it also.  First tried and alexa to get my tv back on my network. Networking was unstable so I scapped that idea.  Now I've got a roku and this seems to work much better.  Now I can play my home content on my tv again.  Nice try samsung, I will not be buying another tv from you in this lifetime!  Word to the unwise, if it isn't broke, don't think that a manufacturer is going to make it better. Just say no to firmware updates!

I have always purchased Apple TVs for my streaming device.  I bought this for a spare bedroom so guests could enjoy movies if they wanted.  I didn't want to spend a bunch for this low usage room so I experimented with this cheap Roku (I see cheap but paid a little extra for the 4K version because of course).Wow, what a pleasant surprise.  Set up was so easy, has everything you could want, connects well to the Wifi even though it is furthest from the router.  Great product.

For some reason, this new Roku (an upgrade over a cheaper Roku unit) is prone to crashing Sling almost every time I get into a Sling show. It crashes back to the Sling menu within 20 seconds.  Restarting the show seems to work.  A lot of FF and rewind can also cause crashes.  I am using 5 Ghz which seems slightly better than 2.4 Ghz. I have changed channels a few times too, with no improvement.  All other devices using WiFi work fine showing a strong signal well beyond the TV where the Roku is plugged in.

Very impressed. I have a brick house with concrete walls on the inside of my garage, large over hang outside, 8 inches of snow on the roof and live in an old neighborhood with large trees and I have hills to the north. Local TV tower is 30 miles away to the north. I have 4 foot long large roof antenna in my garage attic that didn't pick up channels unless perfect weather. This powered unit on long range get 39 channels. Only CBS from major networks not picking up.  Buy it

The Roku stick +  boots up fast and no issues with connection to wifi network.  The only negative thing is the device gets warm to hot to touch sometimes.  We only use the device about 1 hr per day as a secondary tv so the heat issue is not that important.  We fixed some heat issue by hooking up an hdmi extender cable from the tv to roku stick + which seems to remove some of the Heat issues.  Recommend getting 3ft hdmi extender cable with purchase of the roku stick + .

I've purchased two of these Roku Sticks and am please with how easy they are to install. It took minutes to setup Roku on my Samsung and LG smart TVs. These sticks are nice because they stay out of sight up behind the TV. My older Roku system consisted of a small box that was attached with a cable to my TV. Two criticisms: the remote sold with this new Stick model lacks the headphone jack of the older remote. I liked the option of simply plugging my headphones into the remote. Also, the new remotes also have several buttons for quickly accessing channels like Netflix, Hulu, etc. I am not a fan of these buttons for proprietary/subscription channels. In short the older remote was better - simple and easy to use with headphones.

Followed all their troubleshooting steps and the remote wouldn't pair with the stick. Customer service - which despite being through email - is based in India and they seem unable to understand the concept of "not pairing". Instead they try to deflect by continually asking questions I've already answered and saying they're trying to check if my brand new device is still under warranty.There are plenty of other choices for streaming devices, so returned this.

Not entirely Roku's fault I suppose but my main reason behind purchasing this unit was so I could get and use the Spectrum cable app for my cable subscription.  Apparently Spectrum likes the streaming option nowdays.  But after using it for a minute, I realized there is no way to direct dial your channels.  You have to bring up the guide and scroll through it to get to what you want.  I place this one 50-50 on each.  The remote could use buttons and Spectrum could have built a numerical keypad of some kind into their app.

I purchased a ROKU to be rid of a second cable box in my bedroom.  Well to my surprise and with the help of a tech smart friend I not only got rid of the second cable box on a TV I don't watch, but I was able to get rid of the expensive upgrade things which brough my bill down.  I am very untechy it is a family joke . I can barely send e-mail. However, I can mange the ROKU just fine and have improved my tech self image.

The box smelled like mold, but I tried to install the Roku anyway.  It took several minutes to enter a single character during setup.  After an hour, I gave up.  I returned the unit for a replacement, which arrived today.  I did not open it, because I could smell mold.I have bought several Roku sticks over the years for myself and family, so I know how this works.  What is going on?  How is it that I received two moldy smelling units?

I love Roku! Unlike some people, I really like the simple home page where I clearly can scroll through my apps without ads and recommendations. The voice thing is really nice, as my LG TV remote doesn't come with that smart function.  You can ask: "show me films with Michelle Williams" and it will give you a list of all the films available ranging from free to paid, in order of price. This is a much, much cheaper alternative to Apple TV and I love it!
It is very fast, clean interface unlike firestick which comes with all amazon crap dumped into it. Remote is easy to use as well.

Not using voice recognition. wanted to get rid of satellite dish and cable and after a lot of research I decided on the Ruko Streaming stick  it works great no interruptions easy to install and after getting Hulu live + and netflix  I am set.  I get football and all other sports and thousands of shows and movies to watch.  I am saving over 5 hundred dollars a year.  No more climbing on roof in winter to clean snow off satellite dish and all show are in HD.  I am so happy I got a second one for the other room.  If there is a down side that would be it you need one for each tv you own Happy Watching

Worked wonderfully for about 6 weeks. Then nothing but problems. Went and got a second Roku, that one was better and lasted a little longer but then the remote stopped working. Had to buy a new remote. That new remote worked for about 2 months then stopped working again. Terrible unresponsive customer service and unable to RMA for replacement. Waste of money.The device started to not stay powered on. The screen will flicker off, and after about 10 seconds turn back on again, then 10 seconds later will turn off. The only way to fix this right now seems to be that I need to unplug it from the back of my receiver and power it off completely for about a minute to reset it before it starts working again for about a day.This doesn't give me much faith in the QC. Not sure if it is overheating or if the software is just very buggy. I wonder if Roku has a fix for this.

Used to have the Chromecast but never again. I love love love the Roku. My only complaint is that I can stream things from my Mac, these tech companies need to put their petty conflicts aside and put the customer first for once. Also, I don't trust voice activate remotes since they most likely are listening in on you. I always take out the batteries of my remote when using the Roku so no one can listen in on me. Other than that the Roku has it all. The best apps and most options. If you're trying to choose between all your streaming device options choose the Roku 💯

We tried to set this up in our home, we’re already Roku fans. We paired the remote and then proceeded to connect to our WiFi. The remote would respond for a few clicks of use and then stop responding. We reset and followed all of the instructions several times over. After an hour of trying we decided to return it.

I purchased 2  Roku Streaming Stick+ in November 2020 I put the batteries that came with in and set them up. Went back to use after about a week the batteries were dead in both remotes So I put another set in and they were dead in less than a week only 1 use. Took forever to get any customer service from ROKU (TOTALLY USELESS) but finally got two new remotes 1/31/21 put new batteries in and dead a week later. Now it's past the time to send back so i'm stuck a CRAPPY PRODUCT and TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE to deal with. DON'T BUY........ UPDATE 03/07/2021 After finally getting some help from customer service and plugging the ROKU into an outlet the remotes are working and not eating batteries.

In all of my tvs, the roku stick will not fit requireing ordering an extension cable, the probnlem is that in order to get the extension cable you have to provide the Roku device serial number, wastin 2-3 more days. What good is it to irder with Amazon Prime when in order to use the Roku you have to order and wait several more days to use the Roku stick.Because we are used to the Xfinity interface with channel numbers we find the Roku interface more difficult.Lastly the mut switch is right next to the volume controls thus I seem to always hit the mute function whenever I try to adjust the volume.

This ROKU is a game changer. It is surprising easy to set up.  Picture quality is better than cable. So I finally cut the cord and saved $230/ month by disconnecting cable and just using their internet services. I spend $50 a month on HULU, Discovery Plus, Netflix and amazon prime all with out commercials. Just love it. Strongly recommend!!! I have 3 Roku devices throughout the house and can play all my apps at no extra charge.

If you like to surf the channels, good luck. Takes forever to find your channel and then there is a long lag before loading the show. Once it starts, it streams seamlessly but it drove me crazy waiting to have a show load. Don't waste your money.

Item is defective. Constantly shuts off volume and requires a system reboot. Won’t allow you to exchange as described. Makes you go in circles when you request the exchange once purchased, then requires you to talk to an agent... THEN Customer service blows and requires 21 troubleshooting questions as well as your address and CC info to request an exchange. Do NOT buy from this vendor. Shady as f***.

when i first turn it on the sound doesn't work at all. I have to remove the power cord and plug it back in and then the sound will work ok for the rest of the day. Other than that I really like it and the new programs I can get. Thanks

It’s great but I thought it was the hands free because I was told so. Come to find out that it’s not but I used it for about three days and then gave it to my parents because I bought the fire tv cube which is hands free. I love it!

This fire stick really kicks other smart tools I've used in the past such as Chromecast. For example, Chromecast will only let you cast into the tv... and that's it, however, Firestick has a pretty UI with apps and even games.Everything is really smooth to use and Alexa's voice recognition is a beauty. Say anything and Alexa will look for it. Once again this is the best option to make your TV into a smart TV.*I used on my RCA smart TV because there is no way it can compete with the firestick.

Es muy útil usarlo con comandos de voz, la rapidez y fluidez del dispositivo es mejor que lo que esperaba con una interfaz sencilla e intuitiva y coge en cualquier televisión led o antigua y a costo accesible a comparación de otros.

I'm a low-tech old lady with Lyme Disease and did NOT mean to get Amazon Prime and have little use for this item. Tried a few times to figure it out but didn't get far. A friend helped me at least use it once, but I'm out of touch with movies even (and more so tv), so didn't like the selection much. Wanted to see the Tom Hanks movie about Mr. Rogers but not available without paying mucho. Watched something the system SAID was a comedy, My Uncle Frank, and it was not even remotely funny. During these Sad Times I so need humor.

This Amazon Fire TV Stick Lite was a gift to enable streaming on an older non-smart TV, and for that function it has been outstanding.  The menus leave much to be desired, but the voice remote can be surprisingly good (I have not tested Alexa compatibility).  Setup is fairly simple. As an inexpensive route to stream, the Fire TV Stick Lite has performed admirably and, thus far, reliably.  I intend to update this review once I explore more options

I have issues since I got it. I even contacted customer support with no resolve. It needs unplugged and plugged back in each time I turn on the tv. It needed registered over and over again. It keeps throwing me out of Hulu and the screen gets crazy quite often as well as many other issues. I have four other fire sticks and no issues with any of them. This one must be a dud

This is crap so many issues, it’s impossible  to get out from kids prime keep looping even after entering exit password, many of the apps trying to install getting msg app not found including YouTube, error message for launching prime Vedio felt like I received garbage

Bought this second one to update 2 year old one and cover bedroom tv.  Have to use regular remote anyway to change inputs so volume control not imperative, once set. $10 saved. I do have to download and setup the my additional apps.

I have been using a PS3 for at least 8 years to stream media through Netflix, then Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, and YouTube, but this year Sony will stop updating the Playstation Network for PS3, so they have no way to stream Disney Plus. Also I feel the security for your electronic billing just won't be there. As we aren't gamers, and a new Playstation is hundreds of dollars, this was a quick and cheap fix. Set up was pretty easy. Interface is incredible. Streams smooth as can be with no lag. Image quality is outstanding. I'm really happy with this purchase.

I've had cable, I've had dish. A couple of years ago I bumped up my internet package and switched to streaming. I'm so happy I did. I have a Roku on every TV. My favorite model is the Ultra, but I put these in my office and the bathroom. I can enjoy Netflix, Sling, Apple TV+, Disney +, and so many more. The remote is easy, the interface is easy to figure out. I even got one for my mom and she loves it. My only gripe with the streaming sticks is they seem to buffer more than my Ultras. I like things neat and tidy though, so I like that they are invisible behind the TV.

My six year old Sony Smart TV was starting to get dumb - streaming channels took awhile to load up, would frequently lose connection, and always started on the TV antennae input despite rarely watching it (I had to watch Judge Judy until everything loaded up!). I thought maybe I needed to buy a newer TV. This device solved all those problems. And the remote has all the buttons on it that I typically use. Watching TV is no longer a frustrating experience!

Really like this Streaming Stick. I had the cheaper one but my Internet connection isn’t that strong. Well very happy to say this upgrade is working beautifully. The voice recognition of fabulous. Also being able to turn on my Tv and volume is excellent. Had to use tv remote with the cheaper one also.I highly recommend this Roku device to everyone both Family and Friends. Just ordered another one for my 92 year old husband who can’t wait to get it.Arrived on the day expected and packaged very well.Thank you Mary Lou :)

***Wish I saw the reviews FIRST***I ordered this 12/13/20 and it arrived today 12/16/20. Fresh out the box and I was so excited to use this—unfortunately that did not last long. This device won’t connect to ANY of my WiFi networks and when it finally tries to connect to one.. it keeps restarting itself and updating. It never moves past the “Let’s Get Started” portion. I have been sitting here for the past few hours connecting and reconnecting this thing to no avail. Highly upset because I was truly excited to use this. Will be returning ASAP!

The remote control to this device is so sensitive that if you said it down the wrong way it will turn off your stick. Also, the volume down button on mine sticks and often turns it all the way down. Perhaps they should spend a little more time on quality control.

I bought this on a whim and assumed the claim that it would still work good with a bad wi-fi connection would prove false. So glad I was wrong, I have the worst internet imaginable, the cheapest you can find, and yet this Roku never slows down and although there are moments where the video quality suffers, it always fixes itself in a matter of seconds. I'm honestly amazed at how great this device works, to the point where I'm wondering if witchcraft is involved somehow. My only regret is not buying a Roku stick sooner, if you have crap wi-fi this is a must-buy

I tried to hook it up and it won't go past the point of me entering my email address....  I rebooted and started over and each time this is where it gets stuck.  I am not able to do anything after this point.  The online support was horrid.  The guy initially said the Remote is defective and when I said I am using the remote, so that can't be the problem, said well the Roku is defective and would be sending another device in 3-5 business days.  So far no email from them indicating they are doing this.  They instead sent one suggesting I complete my set up by choose my streaming channels etc.

I had a 2012 46" Smart television that was having serious issues loading Netflix.  I contemplated buying a new television, but thought I would try using a Roku stick.  I am so glad I did.Roku picks up so many different channels and loaded Netflix immediately. It even allowed me to load a themed background for the menu screen.  The remote works on both the Roku stick and the television volume/power.  Perfect for my guests in the room.It is only the first day so far, but I am giving it great marks unless something happens.

Last Month I made the decision to fire my overpriced satellite dish provider and jump in the streaming TV wagon. I needed to find something that was reliable and very easy to use to avoid a potential TV/new technology crisis with the wife.Reading all the great reviews on this brand,  I Decided to take a chance on ROKU, I have not looked back.My wife and kid absolutely love it and once I set everything up it took them about 90 seconds to learn how to use it.We love these so much we bought 2 more for our bedroom TV's.This Roku stick+ is easy to program. Fantastic 4K picture, so inconspicuous and unobtrusive. Simply an amazing product that I highly recommend.

This is my second one. Not sure what was wrong with the first one. It stop working so I ordered this one to replace the first one. We have Roku’s on the other TV’s and never had any problems with them. I wanted the fire stick for one TV is the only reason I keep buying. If this one messes up, I will go with the Roku

I am happy with this Fire Stick.  Don't really use the voice controls much, but am impressed with the speed and quality of streaming and applications available.  It is easy to update regularly.  No problems so far.  Glad I bought it.

Received quickly and was easy to set up. Works fine so far. Takes a little getting used to, it being different than my last one. And a different interface than even the Amazon Fire App on my Android phone. I don't use Alexa, so I can't rate it for that.

So disappointed in our new fire stick.  Our previous one was very old and laggy so we thought it was time for a new one.  I dislike the new layout but worse than that, this one freezes up ALL the time.  You can do better Amazon!

I love that I don’t have to remember which platform a show is on.  It’ll just play what I ask and show me recommendations .  It didn’t matter to me to have the volume control on it, so I’m glad I didn’t pay for the upgraded one.

Great Product. Just as advertised. The only difference between the $29.99 version (Fire Stick Lite) and the $39.99 Fire Stick is the volume button. The cheaper one doesn’t have it. You really don’t need it because you can control the volume with your tv remote. I have both and would recommend either one.

I purchased two-- one for the bedroom and one for the living room. Good price and works well. Obviously, as described, it does not come with volume control so you will need to be mindful to keep the remote for the volume nearby.

If you have Hulu Live make sure to keep your software up to date or it will work correctly. Also spend the extra money and get the Firestick with the volume and tv control.I am updating my review of this product. The thing has turned out to be worthless and would not recommend it to anyone. If you are trying to watch live tv such as Hulu Live and especially sports it is totally worthless. It keeps rewinding itself and will not come out of it and the same plays keep repeating. Save your money and buy something else. Mine is currently collecting dust in a drawer.

Very good integration with my Amazon account and apps and add on’s. Remote has a good range, with good latency and nary a lag.Streaming quality is very good, with 4K programming coming in great.Simple to install and setup, simple and intuitive to use, great user interface.Haven’t used the voice recognition or Alexa integration that much, so can’t really attest to it.On the whole, a decent solid streaming choice.

Before I purchased the firestick..I asked a few friends for advice on these things because I am not smart about this stuff. I went with the firestick for both mine and my husband's tv. We are both happy with this item. I got rid of a $111.00 dishnet bill and I am down to $20.00 for all the channels I watch. I AM VERY HAPPY!!!!

I switched from the Amazon Fire stick to the Roku after I got a Roku Tv and I love this stick! It can plug straight into the tv so I don't have a long cord to the outlet, which is incredible. The user friendly design and functions make Roku my favorite streaming device. Clean, quick, and to the point, I would recommend the Roku to anyone considering streaming!

No Bluetooth, my first time using roku and this is the first time I use this kind of device without Bluetooth. 5ghz wifi only works with 20Mhz. 40Mhz and 80Mhz are not working. this problem decreases the internet speed by 3/1.Limited applications can be installed on this device.It's not like Android.i am using a monitor, i cannot turn the volume on or off and it is silent and the device does not turn off. Because it doesn't support.I wanted to connect it to the other TV, unfortunately I noticed the roku device was longer than necessary. HDMI extension cable is required and is not included in the box. I know the HDMI cable is given free but I am not in America, I asked, I was told it could only be delivered to America.Frankly I'm not satisfied, unfortunately I got it from research, I didn't think it would be like this.My rating for the product is 2My rating for Amazon is 5

This is actually the 2nd roku I bought to replace my 1st roku. With in a week of using it, the roku remote controller starts to "have a mind of its own". Sometimes, pressing any of the arrow button jumps to voice search, sometimes to new channel installation.  Now just after 3 months, the remote totally gave up. I have tried changing the batteries, pressing the reset button. All failed. I replaced my 1st roku also because of the remote: frequently used keys requires very heavy pressing to work. But after 3+ years of usage, that's understandable. But the new Roku remote kaput w/in just a couple of months that sucks!!

Been using for several weeks now via a wifi extension with no problems. Easy Install -  Roku has many options under it's own site.. Lot's of other optional sites available and can add many more. We basically have added Youtubetv (could make you consider cutting the cable cord with this alone), added Netflix, and Prime Video. We live in stormy area and  hurricane zone. Satellite TV goes down more often from June to Oct due to storms...Cable TV has become much more expensive, Internet stays up more reliably. AND, is cost effective.

I own this Roku TV stick for less than 8 months and the remote is no longer working. I replaced the batteries and tried to reconnect the remote to the stick but nothing works. Their phone number is the worst too as I can’t get to speak to customer service representative either!Update: I finally talked to a representative and they are sending a HDMI cable extension as a potential solution.Update 2: The short HDMI cable extension solution worked! 5 starts for Roku's customer service!!!

I spent the extra to get the dual band coverage, extended range, and the ability to control my TV.  Signal strength is very good, and the setup is easy, including the TV control, which is done with an auto-detect.  As well, the size will make this Roku very nice for travel.And now I just bought my second stick, for another TV, after using the first stick for over a year.  My TiVo and Samsung Smart TV apps have always been buggy, whereas the Roku just works perfectly all the time, and has a lot of apps the TiVo and Samsung TV do not.  I've had other Roku's over the years, but this stick is the best by far.

Have been using the Roku Streaming Stick+ for about 2 weeks now and I have to say this by far is the best Roku for our needs. We have two other Roku players in the house. The new Streaming Stick+ is being used in our basement gym and the wireless connection has not given us one bit of trouble even though it is a floor away and on the other side of the house from the router. I love that the remote also controls the tv volume and power. This is a great feature so you only have to deal with one remote. I generally only use the Roku for exercise apps and it is working flawlessly. I would highly recommend the Roku Streaming Stick+. An added benefit is that you could take the stick anywhere, vacation, friends, etc.

I love love my Roku Streaming Stick Plus. Purchased about a year ago. However, in the past month or so, I have been having very frustrating problems with it. Won't open up home page, doesn't respond to anything using remote even after putting in new batteries. I have to unplug router, unplug power to Roku stick, changed HDMI port, and so on. Also there is now a problem with audio syncing with streaming video. Off sometimes by 2-3 seconds. The return date has come and gone. I have an older Roku stick bought in 2014 that works better! Quite disappointed.

This was $29 on Amazon and it's a great bargain. I don't see much difference in performance compared to the 2017 Roku Ultra I have on a different TV. The remote is smaller and clumsier to handle. It does not have a jack for headphones but that was not important. Hookup to an unused HDMI input and a USB port on the TV was easy and neat. My channels from the Ultra were ported over so I was up and running quickly.

It didn't take 24hrs to realize this Roku Streaming Stick + is worthless. The video was stair stepping and I thought I had setup something wrong with my set, AND THEN I saw all the reports of overheating, just like the original streaming stick. This is pure garbage and Roku knows it is. Their Quality Control is nonexistent. Customers going through the trouble to take the case off and drill holes to remove heat, or putting heat sinks on the control is a sign this is a horrible product.

This is how products are supposed to be. The packaging was exceptional from function to aesthetics. Instructions and setup process were seamless, intuitive and simple. It's easy to use, even for technophobes. I was deciding between Roku, ChromeCast and a few other options. It was the reviews I read that steered me to Roku, and I have no regrets. So far, it seems like it was the right decision.

I'm a big fan of Roku. We have them on four TVs since we canceled cable TV.  Some are wired, others wireless.  I love that you can cast your laptop screen to them.  Took one star away because I still can't get Kodi working on it and I've never been able to get their media player to play movies from my file server.

This little device saves me about $100 a month! I stream all of our Netflix, Hulu, Disney +, and Amazon Prime videos, as well as watch the news from CNN and you can download all different "stations"  some you'll need to pay a subscription and some are FREE. I also downloaded a free app to "Screen Share" photos from my phone. Would totally recommend it! 5 stars

I bought an older one a whole ago and wanted to get a second one for another room in the house so I got this one, which is supposed to be faster. It was a night and day difference between the two with the speed. Granted, this is an updated product, I ended up buying a second one of these for a different room!The speed is great and the connection is much improved. When it starts up, it's quick to go to the main menu with the apps.I may be crazy but I may be a third one for my Samsung Smart TV because there's more apps on the Roku!

Took a bit to get it installed (1.5 hours - the instructions aren't the clearest), but after installed it's really great and easy to use.  Particularly the voice feature - we just call out the name of the movie we want to watch and it searches several sites to find it.

Work great for hotels and dorms. WiFi can only be used through your cell. If the WiFi needs a password like inside your home it connects easy. If your in a hotel or college dorm room where you have to except the terms and conditions and use thier code you need to use your cell phone to connect no it dose not use your data if it’s connect to WiFi from ur cell. Turn off data just in case on your cell. Mirroring iPhone to Roku is not possible. Android works only! iPhone dose have the remote app android too. Only thing you can’t do with an iPhone with Roku is watch stuff off your cell.

Roku is far and away the best streaming hardware we have used.  We also have an AppleTV and a FireStick, but Roku is more user-friendly, the remotes are laid out better, and the availability of apps is superior to the competition.  Apps seem to take longer to get support or added than on the other options.The voice recognition is great, too.  I wound up replacing one of our Roku tv remotes with the new voice remote, and pairing was very easy.

I have an integrated smart TV that delivers 4k flawlessly in my house.  I have numerous computers and tablets which deliver streaming content without issue in my house.  For this Roku 4k device I had a specific need for it in my home theater room.  Thought it would be great for Amazon HD audio (which does work fine btw) and streaming 4k with Atmos for Disney + and Netflix 4k with Atmos.  This unit does neither.  In fact there is a posted forum discussing the issue with Disney incapabilities and the Roku folks have  stated there is no fix imminent.  Wish I could return but it I passed its return time.  Hate it when products fail to deliver on the key element for which I purchased it.

This stick gets extremely hot!!! Super hot after a few minutes of being plugged into HDMI port.Fire hazard!  Or hazard to tv!!!Had same problem with roku 2 box that connected via cable!!Would not recommend.Easy to connect and set up but such high heat coming off a device is not worth my tv or home burning down.Amazon Fire Stick - no such problems!  No high heat where connected to tv HDMI port or at outlet.

Nice idea and great picture but has major overheating and reliability issues. Indicated 113C (235F) during a true 4K stream after receiving on screen overheating warning. Routinely runs over 100C with 720/1080p feeds. Subsequently, remote functionality became, and has remained, intermittent and also experienced periodic screen blanking (out) on brand new Samsung 4k set, with no previous issues. Returning to Amazon. This was stated as a refurbed/like new model from a highly rated seller, however, the only Roku I'd consider, at this point, is the Ultra 4k, which runs 30-40 degrees cooler than this stick. Rated 1 Star due to above issues.

I wonder why I did not get this item way before now?!! love the fact that I control what shows I watch & when I watch them - love the amount of free channels & have actually been able to find shows that I couldn't find on regular tv

Excellent, Excellent product! I highly recommend the Amazon Firestick over any other streaming device. You can search for any programs with Alexa. The Amazon Firestick gives you more programs to choose from especially with Amazon Prime. 10 stars out of 10! It was easy to hook up and connect. I had NO technical issues with the Amazon Firestick. Thank you Amazon!

Sometimes doesn’t give all options for apps you can watch a show on. Especially if it’s free on Netflix and not anywhere else it will show up for everywhere but the place it’s free. Have one for each of my grandmothers and they love being able to watch any show at any time.

1 month after getting, the interface chanced. The old one was pretty bad, this one is really bad. Called "intuitive," your apps are really small and it looks like it is more for advertising Amazon products. PLEASE let me go back to the OLD interface which wasn't that great.

I love this product. It save the customer money from adding accounts and TV channels. All you need is the internet and then go shopping for your favorite channels with little or no cost. I love this device so much that I use it on all 4 of my TV's.Best deal ever.

I have three fire sticks for the tv's in the house.  If this one had been available I could have saved some money.  Works just like the 50.00 one only you have to use the tv controls for channel and voice.  Don't be lazy, I'm not.

This version of fire stick freezes on certain apps. Netflix, Youtube and other apps this stick freezes on or will not load from time to time. I have 3 of these fire sticks. this this the first time I had this one (Lite). I'm returning

Very pleased with the Fire TV Stick.  The interface is fast and user friendly.  I've used the voice commands once in awhile if I get too lazy to push a button.  Overall, I would recommend this to anyone, even non-tech savvy users.

Well worth the sale price of $18, this will turn any TV with HDMI-in into a Smart TV, running an Amazon-skinned version of Android that is compatible with many native Android apps, and even more if you sideload. What's not to love? One of my favorite purchases of the holiday season so far.

I’m not using the voice recognition so I can’t speak on that. However this device is a huge deal! Ordered 2 at once so me and my children are enjoying using these fire sticks!!! Great price and love the size of the remote. Super happy!!! Thanks

The customer should be able to read the terms & conditions BEFORE DOWNLOAD,so if you agree ok if not then the customer should be able to go BACK and continue their business with out all the bull.then after thinking about it then go back to the app and download it,I feel that I'm being forced to accept! I'm from the older generation and navigating a website is a little confusing.

I had to change my review, user error. And Amazon called me after my last one to walk me through the set up. The only thing I don’t like is the HDMI connector doesn’t work very well, you have to plug it in your TV directly so I needed an extension for the power

Just bought this for my mom as a birthday present, been trying to set it up for an hour and it’s trying to update but won’t. I’m about to throw the thing in the garbage disposal. Looks like Amazon needs to train these kids that make these a little better

I got this to mainly stream movies.  It is Android based so be aware of that.  It is pretty slow though.  I've done all the tweaks to make it run smoothly and sometimes it is still like using a tablet from about 5 years ago.

Cut the cable cord and bought 3 of these. I love them. Easy to use and lots of free content. I stream netflix, disney plus, prime and amc plus and tons of free apps like tubi, crackle, pluto, ect. For the price you cant beat it.

I have a 32" JVC flat screen that is at least 15 years old and the Fire Stick worked just fine with it.  Needed an alternative to cable after I canceled it and the Fire Stick came through with flying colors.  As long as you have an HDMI port, you are good to go!

I should have reviewed the description a little closer.  This is a second remote for the home and this one doesn't have a +/- buttons for volume, not an on/off button.  Voice commands work well and it has been working for our needs.

Works as well as the other firesticks I have. Bought this one because it was only like 18 bucks . Does not have volume control or power button being why it was under 20 bucks. Dont matter to me . Worth the price . Went on a older TV.

I don't know if I received a dud but I have nothing but issues with this fire stick. It loses signal after you turn off the tv and then turn it back on.  No sound at times.  Have to keep resetting this product everytime you turn on the tv. Overall very unhappy with this product. Was expecting so much more.

After using other devices to access my streaming channels I decided to try the Firestick. All of our problems and issues were solved! In fact, it worked so well we purchased a second one for our home theater. Great product!

I have played with this all night and i must admit i have been enjoying this little gadget i have heard of the firestick for years and never purchased one until now i am happy with the purchase getting rid of DirectTV today! 😁

this is the second "stick" so the installation was even easier than the first, if that's possible.  features are exactly the same as the first and it works great.  don't use voice recognition or alexa.....just a personal choice

I absolutely love it!  I was trying to find a way to set up my room so my daughter can be near me while I clean and organize the room, and thus helped.  Its easy to use and has great voice recognition!  I love having all my apps in one spot and not having to cast from my phone.

The button actions take a few seconds to recognize what I push so it has some serious lag. My other device work perfect fine so I know it’s not my internet. I also can’t use voice since the remote doesn’t do a good job and listening. It works for an older flat screen so it’s not too bad. Definitely a lot to be desired

1. does not work properly all the time  2.streaming locks up 3, selection response will  skip several YouTube icons at a fast speed instead of responding one click one icon. I plan to return this week and pay more and try again

Quit working after 2 weeks . Tech support was an absolute joke. Wasted more than hour trying to resolve the issue. The best support they had was  disconnected the power and try again. After 4 failed attempts I gave up and tossed it in the garbage.

Very easy to install, instructions very concise and easy to follow.  This Fire TV Stick replaced and older model. Soooit was easier the second time around.  The voice (Alexa) makes to very easy to get what you want to  watch.

Works great.  Trying to eliminate cable completely and this has everything I need.  We are an “Alexa enabled” house so I really like the integration with our smart devices. I did cheap out and get the “lite” version with no volume controls.  I do wish I hadn’t.  Those are a nice feature on my other fire stick.

Extremely easy to use. Set up went smooth! I love the availability of apps on the firestick. I love that's its voice recognition too. You just ask for a genre of movies or a song and Alexa finds it for you. No more scrolling through a million things!!

I use at home in bedroom, believe me it's nice/useful to have, I've gotten lots to watch now!Stream sometimes more often will take more time than the others.Or I'll have points i come to during watching it'll stop completely.(whenever it happens you don't really have to do much besides backout from channel/Streaming service then open up were left off.) it's not huge problem for me, but i m sure it could get annoying to a point or others not so forgiving like 🙃 😼🐈 i-m almost always.|🐪they'll leave you out in an ocean of sand, where not even the camel's want to be left!|

Great bright colors compared to Roku.  However, even with an ethernet cord connected to the modem, the picture sometimes buffers or freezes on HBO Max.  It does not do this on the Roku.  Overall, I expected more with the ethernet adapter combined with the Firestick.

I don't like Alexa because a computer is listening. What you say does matter. Ask the Chinese then read Orwell's 1984. I also suggest you read Animal Farm. And if this review is published I will have a deep respect for Amazon.

The screen will often go black and I have to change the output on tv and then back to firestck to get the screen back. This was a gift and my first time using a firestick product. I mainly use for an app I downloaded on downlader.

Easy to install and very user friendly. Once you know your applicable device can even use a Fire TV Stick,try it out. Voice recognition and command makes it easy and cool for watching your TV. Brings viewing to the next level.

Fantastic product. $17.99. Two hours to set it up. I replaced my Xfinity flex box. Gets all the channels my Xfinity flex box did. Better interface. My flex box was always buffering. The fire stick lite runs smooth. Excellent performance.

Very easy to set up and use. Using Alexa to find movies is great. The to that I have is older and does not have a lot of apps to download. With the Fire stick I am able to view Hulu Disney plus prime, Netflix, very happy with purchase.
Has issues connecting to the internet and even after uninstalling and re-installing Netflix several times ive just given up on the idea.. dont waste your time or money on this product!

love this little thing, even knew my name from someone else's having me in there page. also told me where the areas they work in and what they do for a living. strange as my phone is hacked also they have hacked Amazon. would of never known this if now for Alexa.

It was easy to set up but everytime I hit the home key it changes the hdmi input on my monitor. Quite a hastle to change everytime I want to put it to sleep. I'm not saying don't buy it I'm just saying it doesn't work for me.

I love my Firesticks, they're all I use for TV however they really don't last very long, maybe a year-a year and a half. I watched regularly but usually not for hours on end. Otherwise,  the ease of use,  accessibility and streaming quality are great!!

Just dropped cable, saving ~$50+ per month...and that was for Basic Cable...stream free from my library...Roku channels...all this because my Smart TV couldn't stream Disney+...so, I added ESPN+ and Hulu to my already $6.99/mo. commitment to Disney (for another $6/mo.)...so much entertainment...so little time. What blows my mind is the Comcast/Xfinity idiots raising my Basic Cable bill $31/mo. (for 12 channels).. that decision must have been made by a former so-called CNN journalist..."what could go wrong?...you moron!!

I bought this so our second TV could function as a smart tv.  It works great!  I was worried our internet signal wouldn't be good enough, but this stick picked it up with no problem.I'm very glad we invested in this.  It's just like using our other TV, which is a Roku tv.

I like it.  The usb port does not keep the stick charged so it is still plugged into the wall (I think this is roku error not tv, just needs more power than they like to think), which kind of defeats why I got it,  so I didn't have to run cables through wall BUT the reason I kept it is that the remote does not have to be in direct sight like other roku types AND the remote also works tv volume and power. You don't have to see roku sitting around a tv hanging on the wall. Streaming speeds are great, no buffering on wifi.

I've had my Roku Streaming Stick since last July. About a month ago the remote's connection with the stick kept dropping. I did everything to connect it. I took out the batteries: reset the stick; undid the power. I tried everything. It would work for 2 days, and the connection would drop again. I wasted nearly $70 buying this stick. I'll never buy another Roku Streaming Stick again. I will try the older box type Roku. Seems to be more reliable.

It's a Roku.  Their interface is responsive and easy to use.  Being a more open platform some of the channels you can get can be something someone threw together than may not be well designed or have good content, but the mainstream apps are all fantastic and the ease of setup and ease of use of Roku is exceptional, especially for the price!.  I actually think their remote is more comfortable and easier to use than the last Apple TV I purchased.  4k and I like having TV and volume control on the remote, compare the different models to make sure you get the features you want.

I have been using Chromecast the past year +. I eventually bought 4 when I dropped DirectTV (very worth it!). I was unhappy with the continual buffering during sporting events and the fact that it wasn't easy for my wife to figure out. I bought the Roku and am extremely happy! It is very easy to initially set up and you need to spend some time linking the channels that you want to add to it, but once that is done is works extremely well. The picture quality is excellent (I have a 4K tv) and it is extremely easy to use. I will be incorporating these onto my other tv's.

Don’t buy it. Was good for 1st month and now it keeps over heating and I did all they said to restart, was away from the TV and connected to my AVR. Did customer service trouble shooting and they said I have another data running alongside that may be contributing to the over heating. Outside my return warranty.My 4K stick from Amazon is much better and runs cool. I used to like Roku, but this stick just doesn't work well. Get the Amazon 4K streaming stick instead.

UPDATE: This thing is awful. The audio is constantly out of sycn and I need to restart it every time I want to watch something to fix the audio. Roku used to be good, but I'd buy something else instead.Buggy and always struggling with audio problems and the remote. Needs to be restarted frequently and had to replace the remote after one month.

The TV where this Roku Stick is used is far away from the router, so I went with this version of the Roku and it did not disappoint! There are no issues with streaming despite how far it is from router, and the remote works well, even 25-30 feet away from the TV. I bought a second Roku for use in the room where the router is located, but not the + version because I didn't think it was needed. That one has trouble getting a signal through the TV which is about 6 feet away. Get this version instead and you won't be disappointed.

I like this for the compact design, but the WiFi range is pretty poor. When my laptops and phone can easily get signal from my router, this thing struggles. So I need to connect my phone to WiFi, then hot spot the connection to the Roku. Not ideal, but it works. Other than that, I have issues with the remote going haywire sometimes for minutes on end. Possibly the Roku having issues or the remote not projecting the signal out strong enough. New batteries didn't fix.

Edit:  The first couple months of having the Roku was great.  Now however, the remote has quit working.  I've changed the battery, tried repairing it to the TV and tried it on a different TV.  Nothing works.  So I downloaded the roku remote app on my phone which worked for a while.  Unfortunately, it has become really hit or miss.  Sometimes one or the other remote will work, I'll watch a show and when I try to change the channel or turn the TV off the remote will no longer work.  It's very frustrating.I love my new ROKU!  I was using a firestick and had problems all the time.  I finally decided to try a ROKU, and I'm so glad I did.  We'll be putting a ROKU on all of our tvs!

Bought the Roku after I was fed up with the FireTV's lackluster performance.  CNNGo would regularly buffer and cough up error messages (even though none of the other devices, e.g. Apple TV on my network had any issues. No such issues with the Roku - works like a charm.  Trashcan, meet FireTV....

It does the job of streaming great content and then some.  I never owned a Roku before but had different older streaming devices.  Friends of mine do have a Roku so I knew what to expect.  One reason I did get a Ruku over other streaming devices is you're not limited to content because a certain device isn't brand owned or is a competitor service.  Another benefit of this model is  portability so if I ever go somewhere I can have most of my content and services.  The main reason I described I needed a streaming device I my Bluray player does not support Disney+ nor a few other services I use like the Xfinity app.  My brand new 4K 50" Vizio TV in my bedroom also doesn't support Disney+ or other services as well but does have different Casting options ( Chromecast,  Apple Airplay) but not everyone knows how to do that.Con:  nothing to do with the physical product but you need Credit card information before to even setup an account to use the device.

The Roku was easy to set up and I did so before going on a two week vacation in Mexico at a resort with it. Picture quality was fine and it is easy to use. You have to consider other factors however such as the Wifi speed and ability to plug it into mounted screens. The free Wifi was fortunately good except during prime time in the evening when people at the resort were more likely to be using the Wifi for computers or other purposes. The TV was cable connected so that wasn't a factor but in a hotel where the TV also depends on WiFi you may have to purchase a faster plan. One of the TV's was mounted and it was difficult to plug the Roku stick into the side plug. Also, Hulu was not available outside of the US so take into consideration whether the service you want to stream will do so internationally. Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO and the like were all fine. Good and easy to use product but set it up at home and on your computer before taking it with you out of town.

I upgraded to this model last June after my first Roku stick kept failing due to connectivity issues. At first, this one worked well in my basement TV room, but over the last few months it’s been more and more unreliable — by now Prime won’t load at all, Netflix cuts out frequently, and even Hulu sometimes fails to load. The promised “4x the Wi-Fi strength” is nonsense. I assume there’s a planned obsolescence strategy in play and a new “improved” and more expensive version will soon appear or I’ll be obliged to invest in a Roku TV. It’s a shame there aren’t more competitors in the streaming device market to keep standards higher.

Until Roku addresses the battery drain issue with their remotes, I can not recommend the Streaming Stick+. Drains batteries about every 2 weeks. This is a known problem by them for over a year and still no fix. Go to the Roku Community Forum and read page after page of complaints. CS is no help. All they will say is their engineers are working on it.

This is a rare find that does exactly what it says. I have a TV in my bedroom at the far end of the house from wifi router. Streaming, especially YouTube, was always hit or miss. This stick and remote installed with no drama and now the TV streams instantly. The difference from the old stick is astounding. My only complaint is the position of the Mute button on the remote. Care must be taken when scrolling not to hit Mute.

When I first bought this Roku stick, I was blown away. I was getting 4K video, plenty of apps, and a simple user interface, all for a low price. I couldn't figure out how Roku had pulled this off. Well, now I know--by cutting corners on their hardware. In the past year, I have gone through not one, not two, but THREE failed Roku remote controls. Every single one has spontaneously stopped working within a few months (and before you ask, yes, I tried changing the batteries, thank you). At this point, after buying the Roku stick and now a fourth remote control, I've spent enough money that I could have bought an Apple TV. And frankly, that's probably what I should've done in the first place.

I love my Roku streaming stick! It has great streaming speed and quality and it’s easy to set up and use. This was a fantastic solution for me because I don’t have a smart tv but I wanted to be able to use my apps on my tv. Thank you Roku! The stick can also be used on laptops, etc. Anything with an HDMI port (although it’s probably redundant on a laptop or other device). I highly recommend the Roku Stick to anyone needing an easy solution to not having a smart tv!

Roku keeps promising to fix the problem but there DVR & anything in the buffer is useless with Hulu Live.Finally giving up & changing back to Comcast, I'd rather pay more for a reliable product anyday.  Roku problem over 5 months now & NOTHING!

Unit it plugged into TV HDMI slot as it's supposed to be.  Not in a cabinet plenty of space between wall and TV with plenty of air flow.  It keeps stating it's overheating.  Seems to be a common issue.

FANTASTIC PRODUCT, JUST PLUG IT INTO A HDMI PORT, PLUG INTO A POWER SOURCE (IF YOU HAVE A USB PORT ON YOUR TV) USE IT AS YOUR POWER SOURCE, ANSWER THE FEW QUESTIONS AND BINGO - DONEI WILL BE BUYING 4 MORE ! - THANK YOU !

We have a 2016 OLED from LG which is great but the app selection doesn't include all streaming services. In addition the interfaces can be chunky and the apps are updated slowly.  The Roku has everything, has a better interface and simple remote that gets the job done, possibly better quality than the native TV apps and is cheaper than other options (i.e. apple TV). The only thing I miss is airplay for sharing a phone screen. Amazon fire stick is similar but it seems the Roku has wider streaming options since it isn't aligned with it's own Prime streaming service - and the Roku won't try to "push" their own shows.

I love Roku. I use them on everyone’s tv in the house. It’s the best streaming device I’ve had. Easy set up and easy to use. Has apps for everything you would want to stream. I’ve never had a problem with the roku not working properly or loosing connection. Cut cable and stream on a roku. This roku allows you to play around with volume and the one in my room is older and doesn’t have that’s I’m jealous.

This is the 4th Roku I've owned. Bought it to replace a Roku 3 that had a broken remote. Was tired of using the phone as a remote. The Roku 3 was in a spot fairly far away from my router so I decided to go for the streaming stick+ because of its claimed stronger wifi. Well, guess what... The streaming stick+ barely connects and constantly downgrades the stream due to the poor connection. It is in the same exact spot as the Roku 3 on the same exact network. In fact, I can plug the Roku 3 back in and it works fine with a good connection. The supposed stronger wifi is a downgrade from years old technology. Don't buy.

I was trying to replace my Fire tv since Amazon is going downhill.  I thought I purchased the one that supports a headset, but that feature got lost in all the other features you have to look out for.  Then I realized the reason they have a headset jack on some of their models is because they don't support blue tooth.  Function of the buttons on the remote are also very spongy compared to fire tv.  You have to push the buttons several times and point the remote in the right direction to get it to work.  In today's day of electronics, this needs to go back to the 1980's.  Roku should be ashamed of themselves.

I had trouble and had to hire someone to come in and set up the Roku.  After several tries, he got it working, but it buffered every few minutes.  I bought a new router and that seemed to fix it.  Now, after it working from January 1, 2019 it quit working on May 15th.  I tried everything, new batteries in the remote, rebooting my smart TV, rebooting the router.  Hired the tech guy AGAIN, he unplugged and plugged it back in 5 times and then it worked.  When I turned off the TV for the night, the next day it wouldn't work again.  I even tried it on a different TV.  HOW DO I GET MY $58.00 back?????

First, it would like to get to know the other devices it attached to, TV for example. I have an older 1080p 43" Panasonic (7 years) took a few goes to get the vol set up, will power the tv up but not close it. Every internet TV program service needed me to go to my PC and put in a code to make it work, units programs have nice touches but really not needed, screen saver, themes. Overall not impressed. Amazon has a better product, but it has faults too. By the sounds of the customer service horror stories shop with amazon products IMO. you'll get a better all-round package

While using this stick and my roof antenna for local channels i found that it interfered with my reception antenna from the stick while plugged in to the electrical power.I kept wondering why i lost signal from a good local station since i had it before and the station came in real good in my living room.Had to unplug unit from electrical outlet to get my station back.I will go back to using my regular Roku 2 player which worked fine w/o problems and use this for the guest Bedroom.

I purchased this simply due to the addition of the mute button.  My previous Roku worked fine, but for me the cost of a new one was worth it just for the mute button.The downside of Roku is the buttons for Sling, etc, that I don't use but periodically, which is highly annoying.  If they would make these so that they could be disabled or reprogrammed, this would have been a 5-star review.

I really like Alexa added to the remote. It is a great away to rewind quickly and find movies. I do wish there was a game controller like the 1st generation had. I hated given that up but had to when my old fire stick died.

I bought this after my 2nd  Roku streaming device had issues with connecting to WiFi.  Fed up I splurged and spent $21 for this gem.  I love it.  Works great.  Menu easy to navigate and my Rokus are both in the garbage now.

I got this for my 14 yr old. The fire stick works as described & she is happy with it. My only complaint is that even when it's off it still tries to connect to the internet. The only way to solve this is to disconnect it.

Its total and compete junk. It shuts down constantly.  Lots of storage..limited apps installed..tried everything I could find on chat and Youtube..one Google tells you how prolific the issues with these are..buy another brand product tgat does the same thing

It's a good all-in-one streaming stick (Amazon, Netflix, Hulu, Roku, Disney+, etc.). However, 8 out of 10 times the Fire Stick TV Lite goes back to Home screen when I'm at TVision app going to guide and selecting channels.

I got this and the 4K versions for my parents place. One of the TVs is not 4K so it did not make sense to spend more on that one. This is a solid device that helps you bring smart features to any TV with HDMI and internet. Definitely worth it.

I love this thing!!! If you are in the market for a Fire Stick, search no more!!! My bedroom is on the second floor and my router is on the first and I have no issues with streaming, the remote is easy to use and it’s updated.

Not much can be said, because this device is so "out of the box" easy, it's wonderful!Plugged it in, followed the simple on line instructions and 5 minutes later , I'm watching HD TV as clear as cable ever was......

The new Firestick starts up without volume repeatedly since the last software update. I have to unplug it to reset to get volume back. I disconnected it and went back to my old Firestick. Very disappointed.Addendum:  Amazon called me. They offered to "troubleshoot" the defective device. They also offer to have me scrounge up a box and task the $18 item to the post office, so they could do a refund. I did neither. Frankly I thought they should just send me a working replacement or credit my account.
Great little streaming device.  Easy to use.  Works great on my "dumb" TV.

There is nothing blocking the ventilation of my streaming stick +, and I am sure that it is connected properly. Yet and still, my SS+ continues to overheat when playing 4K Video!! I don’t know if I received a faulty stick or not, but this is unacceptable!UPDATE: still overheats when connected to my 4K TV, but doesn’t overheat on my regular HDTV. Same amount of ventilation. I bought it for 4K, so the fact that I can’t use it for what I bought it for really sucks. I even ordered their little extender thing and it still overheats.
