I didn't realize just how slow my old Roku HD was until I got this for a different TV.  This thing is blazing fast to navigate.  Reasonably small, so you can travel with it and watch your DVR or Netflix from your hotel.Range is excellent.  I actually have it at the opposite end of the house from my router, but there's been absolutely no issue with it at all, I'm very impressed (in comparison the Samsung TV that it's plugged into has 'smart' features that barely work).I'm now toying with replacing my Roku HD with one of these, even though there's nothing wrong with it - it's just so slow in comparison.Y.M.M.V.

ROKU has many models but I found this Roku Streaming Stick+ model to be very versatile with the ability to take with you on trips. Its reception works very well in my home with xFinity WiFi.  The many choices for viewing are awesome and in my opinion, really make a great way to save money over normal outlet and receiver prices to expand your access to entertainment from the cable companies. I highly recommend this product.

I just had knee surgery, and can not sleep very well.  I end up sleeping on the recliner because it supports my leg.  The noise of the tv makes me sleepy, which is great, so I would leave the tv on all through the night. After doing that for about a week, I started losing streaming channels.  And after a few days of that, I could not lock on to any channel.  My other roku's on my other tv's worked fine. But if you have it on continuous for a week, to my surprise, it burns it out.

Our previous worked great but did get a little light  pick up on wifi although it was located nearby. Very rarely it would buffer. Albeit our internet is now much better, it still falls in the low range compared to those in less remote areas. The stick picks up internet incredibly well. Love, love the volume control. No more searching for tv remote and Roku. No complaints. Better interface. Happy.

I purchased this for my son because his tv is an older "Big Screen 55 inch" that is not a "Smart TV" and did not come with pre-installed app features. Once received, all he did was plug it in to the back of his tv and he was all set! He had everything my "Smart tv" has and them some! Even Voice Control! He absolutely loves it! It works remote as well! Definitely worth the money, sound/picture quality fantastic. Would definitely recommend for purchase!

What a disappointment.  This is my third, maybe fourth Roku.  Have always been a fan.  Bought this, plugged it in, followed the instructions, the unit updated itself, I chose auto-resolution, and now it is blank.  I have a black screen. If I reboot the stick, i get a welcome screen (dancing ROKU letters) then a black screen.  I have a 4k LG tv.  This should not be happening.  Searching online shows lots of others with the same issue, and no apparent fix.  My only hope is that there's an auto-update and the matter is resolved.

Step up from my old stick! but after 2months the remote would not pair. i looked to the online community help on roku z webpage first and tried everything . before going to the live support . wow ! and i’m taking back my 5 star rating while i wait 3-5 business days n see if they do me right.  if so all good i guess. i’ve enjoyed roku for many years. i’ll post the entire conversations on here if goes south ! back then for end resalution.!

Our Fire TV stick was slow and glitchy. I gave this Roku stick a whirl and am still very happy. As of right now, there are the things it does better than Amazon Fire Devices:1. Has a native YouTube app (FireTV does not)2. You can use YouTubeTV app (Amazon / Google fights)3. Phone app allows headphone use (not available with FireTV right now)4. There is a CometTV app (none on FireTV)5. Pretty much faster in every way.6. Resolution control - if you have an ISP with a data cap, you can set this to only 720p.One thing I do not like is the Roku Plex app. The Plex app for FireTV is far better.

Bought this and it won't fit the back of my tv. Turns out I need another hdmi extender cable that it does not come with. The cable is free but on back order for another month. I am going to a local store to see if another option that will work. If I have to I will return this thing.Edit*** I went to my local walmart and spent another $10 on a hdmi coupler and a short cable just so I could plug this into my tv. The free cable that you can order for this is still a month away from shipping to me...Other than that it seems to work well

The Fire Stick works great is compact and hides nicely behind the TV. We don't have Alexa in the house except for the Fire Stick and are happy to keep it that way.  Fire Stick gives you access to a wide variety of programming which is wonderful.

It is great, but It randomly will stop working then this is how it came, with the batteries completely scratched off and the whole materials with the residue because of it. You might as well just buy it at target or Walmart.

Product works well. There seems to be a little lag between the remote and fire stick. For the price difference just get the one with tv control. The price for the remote itself with tv control is more than the device itself.

I love it!! I bought it because the Netflix on my Dishtv freezes and won't work. Dish told me it was a Netflix issue. Well it does the same thing with the stick so Netflix has some issues to fix. But the stick is great!!

I got this to take my second TV off the cable system, because their app service was inconsistent. This fire stick is getting the apps I was looking for. I'm still getting used to it, but so far, so good. I don't regret the purchase.

I bought the lite because it was $20 cheaper (on sale) than the regular version and it was for an older tv.  It works well , but not controlling the tv was a mistake.  So, next time it will be the regular or 4K version.

This new version is unbelievable.  The performance is off the charts.  Way faster than my previous Fire Sticks.  I didn't expect this, but its fast, responsive, and really a pleasure to use.  I will upgrade all my sticks to this version.

I really like this model of the Fire TV Stick. You save a little money by cutting out the tv controls (mainly the volune button) and the voice controls (which I don't use, anyway. I don't want any of that Alexa stuff.) I'll buy another one, in the future.
2nd one I've had. The first one lasted over a year, this didn't last a month!

We bought this for the remote because it was cheaper than buying just the remote.  It doesn't have a way to turn the TV and unit on and off though.  The rest of the features work ok with our existing fire stick and TV.

This thing is great. I was using my PS4 as a primary streaming device and my Netflix experience varied from “I think that’s a person but it’s hard to tell” to absolute microwaved garbage. I plugged this in and it was a night and day difference. Before Roku, I couldn’t even load a lot of shows or it took a long time to even see them in the Netflix dashboard. Now they load almost instantaneously and without any buffering mid-episode or drop in quality. I went from kind of being able to stream 1080p to easily streaming 4K UHD HDR content with no issue. I’ve been traveling for the last week or so and the Roku stick is amazing for hotels. Once connected to the hotel WiFi it’s as solid as at home and brings your ability to relax after a long day of “vacationing” to a whole other level being able to watch shows you’re actually interested in, instead of grainy hotel cable. I found that the Roku is a more powerful device than the TVs in the hotel rooms in which I stayed, meaning it can push higher quality content than crappy hotel TVs can even accept, creating a bottleneck at the tv. If you are getting tired of a slow connection or weak connectivity, get this thing and watch shows as they were meant to be watched. I didn’t even realize I was living in squalor.

I've had Rokus since 2010in the first few days,consskipping frames on 1080, on netflix and amazon,"arrows" on remote work 4 out of 5 presses. very annoyingcompletely lost wifi connection, all other wifi devices remained connected and operationalprosvolume and mute on remote is useful. non-IR remote is greathowever, returned this because of picture and wifi issues and too many other reviews of over heating, and went back to a previous generation rokuhope that helps

Awesome value for streaming content. Easy setup and wifi connectivity. Unlike other devices I am able to watch live local live tv with the My Spectrum App. Installed. Tons of free content on various apps. Very fast and easy to use user interface.

Ideal for anyone who wants to switch their TV's OS to a better and more intuitive interface with the largest app library.  I switch to ROKU because my Samsung OS was clunky, getting slow and missing newer streaming apps.  This stick makes the switch easy and is plug and play.  Highly recommended.

My Roku is 6-7 months old and I have had nothing but issues with the remote for the last 3 months or so. Bought this product at the end of June, 2018. It worked great for the first 3 or 4 months, but after that the remote started having issues. At first it was easy to repair the remote and it stayed paired for a decent amount of time. Lately the remote constantly disconnects and does not always repair with the device. I have tried every troubleshooting tip suggested by Roku including the free HDMI extension cable and nothing has worked permanently. I sent an email to Roku support and am currently waiting to hear back. Hopefully they will be able to resolve my issue. Will update if issue can be resolved

This was the best purchase ever !  I have wanted a Roku for months, but was unsure of which one to get.  For the price of $49.99; this Roku is a great deal & worth every penny.  It is super user friendly & the set up was simple also. This is my very 1st Roku & I had no issues setting it up, nor with adding additional channels.  The streaming & picture quality is also fantastic !  I'm 100% happy with my Roku.❤

I have an older LCD tv that I lost the remote to, but was saved by Roku.  Once connected, the Roku remote works to control the volume and power on the tv.  Plus the Roku stick is fully contained on the back of the TV, simply plug it into the HDMI port, then plug the power into one of the USB ports, and you're all set.  Follow the on-screen prompts to connect to your wireless network, and you're all set!

It doesn't have the most beautiful interface, and you might have problems if you lose the remote, but other than that, I love it.  I've use a few other streaming devices including Amazon's, and this is great.  I especially love this version, which you can use the remote to turn the TV on and off, as well as the volume.  It's simple.  It plugs into and HDMI and power source and you're good to go once you've hooked it up to Wi-Fi.  I have two of these devices, and I'd buy more if I needed them.  Runs all the major apps you'll want like Netflix, Hulu, Sling, YouTube TV, Amazon Prime TV, HBO GO, etc., etc.

I bought this product because I could download the Spectrum app and watch our cable on tv’s that do not have cable. I hooked up everything very easily. As I was installing it gave me a code and an address to enter to verify my acct. I did so and was redirected to a person to assist me. The assistance was being told that I needed to pay a fee of 89.99 for 5 years. It was something new. I argued because no where does it state any additional fees. They said as of Sept 10th my regular roku tv’s wouldn’t of worked anymore either if I didn’t pay this fee. I asked to speak with a supervisor. I was basically told the same thing. So I asked to speak to HIS supervisor. I was told due to the high call volume his supervisor would return my call in 30 minutes. It’s over an hour and a half later. No call. My roku TV’s are no longer working which they were BEFORE this phone call. Neither is my log in info so I can’t edit anything. I have searched and searched to try to find a way to contact roku. I was finally able to get on hold with their technical help. My time is climbing. I have been on hold for 30:58 and it was at a 38 minute wait when I first called it’s now at 44 minutes. What a bad business venture. Seems to me to be false advertisement. No mention of other fees. They state it isn’t an activation fee it’s a registration fee for the account but you can’t use the product without doing so. Don’t waste your time.

This is remarkably easy to set up and to use. Streaming quality is excellent. Remote hooked up to my TV in just a few seconds. I have not tried the Voice Control, as I have an aversion to our future Robot Overlords.  This is as easy to use as a Firestick (which I also have) but as the Roku also allows you to access Amazon Prime through it, I find myself using the Firestick less and less.

I don’t like the fact that I have to unplug the thing and plug it back in when I want to watch the fire stick. It doesn’t have a power button and I have pressed every button or combination of buttons to turn it on. Please respond to this.

Got for Black Friday deal. Great little piece made my tv feel new. It does not do volume control or on off. I brought the 4K one as well which is much better just due to volume and power but ruin which you get used to.

What?  Why is this a PERFECT add-on for a TCL ROKU?Because LAWYERS.  HBO MAX now supports FIRE (yup, I've tried it).  And this device also supports IP Web Cam PRO - I can now drag up my Dahua Security Cameras :).

I love the intergration with the Wemo plugs. My Wemo never worked to my satisfaction on its own, but now that I use my Alexa devise it is a snap! Alexa please turn off “the name of the device” and it is done. I can get into bed, tell Alexa to turn of the light and it is done. Best thing ever!

That cover for the battery is the hardest cover I have EVER tried to open! I had to look it up on YouTube to see if there was a trick to it. It took me about 30 minutes to finally get it open to put the batteries in.

It's very fast and snappy. The new interface is great to look at. The new remote design is great and very sleek. The arrangement of the batteries in the device compartment are perfect. Plan to order another Fire Stick.

The firestick lite is a really great option, if you don't care too much about having multiple remotes (which we don't, so it's a win for us). This little gadget turns any tv with an HDMI port into a smart tv and we are really pleased with it so far. We haven't had any issues streaming content or loading our preferred apps. Navigating the apps is a little different than if you were to use them on a smart tv, but nothing is difficult about it at all. Very pleased.
Everything works good on this the remote really been fixed from the old style no more bugs

I like the easy set up. Voice recognition is a plus . LOVE IT!!! Simple to use. I hope they come out with a new model that has a light installed on the remote so when you’re  try to use the remote at night you can see the buttons.

If you are prime music unlimited with the fire stick and then take in to account all the other benefits that go along with prime, nothing else compares to this service. Audio quality and video quality are top notch.
I just luv being able to download outside sourced apps to be able to watch movies for free

This is a replacement for my original because of an undetected battery leak in the control unit. I have always liked it. Have owned the original for years. Easy to operate. Nice. Why change when I am totally satisfied with what I originally owned.

simple set up and easy to use. i’ve had other devices with alexa, and works great on this device. i never had any problems with it. bluetooth connected easy and fast to my sound bar. planning on replacing my roku devices with the fire stick, hence, the roku don’t connect to the sound bars.

I had one of the earlier versions of the fire stick.  This newest version is fantastic.  I can speak into the microphone and everything works exactly as it should.  It seems to respond quicker as well.  Good stuff.

It is very slow and awkward and though I have blazing fast WIFI this new fire stick is VERY SLOW! It sometimes takes several minutes to respond to a command either via voice or on the buttons!!!! WTF is that about?

I bought this for a smart TV that is only 4 years old so it doesn't have the newest apps on it.  The Lite version is exactly what I was looking for to have all of my streaming services on this TV.  It works well for what it is intended.

One of my TVs wouldn’t play but 1 channel, with this I could watch everything and some.  I also used it on a tv with no cable and it worked great.  I can now sit in that room and watch tv again.  Glad I bought it .

Didn't realize when I ordered this that it didn't have volume controls.  My other Firestick did so I assumed it would be the same; I just figured they updated the name..  Makes it a pain to have to use two remotes.

I am quite unhappy so far and may be sending it back. I have to reboot it daily or more. It freezes or loses sound. Every time I turn it on it does one or the other, what a pain!!  I have a Roku stick on other TV and it works much better, wish I bought that instead.

I have a "dumb" TV so I needed something to get me to stream.I saw the Amazon Fire on TV and ordered it and never looked back.  At the age of 88 I feel I've accomplished what the younger folks do and don't feel so alienated.  I'm enjoying Netflex and Discover plus.

Added to an older Samsung TV. Setup and adding to existing Amazon account for the recipient were both easy, and navigation feels simple enough. The ability to install the HBO Max app was the distinguishing feature.

After the latest update the home screen resembles a billboard and you cant even download youtube "for your convience". without putting in a home address. when i first used the device this was not the case. if you dont want a future where you need to scan your government id to use the internet, you should reject devices like these.

I hate the new home screen. I have an older fire stick without Alexa, and it's much easier to find my apps, purchased content, and what I was just watching. The Alexa voice control works ok, but doesn't always find what I'm searching for. I find it easier to spell out the selection in the search category. I guess if you're a poor speller, Alexa might be helpful, but I wish I had the option to change the home screen back to work like the first gen. fire stick.

I lost my fire tv remote and it was cheaper just to buy a new stick. Love how small it is and the little remote. I also bought a magnetic mount remote holder for it. I love that I'm able to watch all of my apps from one place.
I have not made it work yet. Operator trouble with me the operator.

Locks up and is hard to reset even by unplugging.  The return to TV button is close to the pause button and easy to mistake for pause sending one on another unwanted adventure.  I went back to my old fire stick and am happy never to see their new one again

I have own Toshiba Fire tv for almost a year when we purchased Disney+.  Disney+ worked for us one month and then it stoped working.  We can watch Disney + on our computer but not on the tv.  So customer servicetold us that our Toshiba tv was no longer supported and recommend a roku device or fire stick.  I bought both the Roku and Firestick.  The Firestick did not work on neither the smart tv or the old tv, but the roku works on the existing smart tv and old tv.  I get error code 41 as of 11/27/20.  They may need to update the software.

I like the price when on sale and I like how I can use my own TV remote to control it. If your TV has HDMI-CEC (which a lot of TVs now have,) you can just use your TV remote for almost all the functions of the Fire Stick.

I have three TVs all have direct TV; one has Roku; One has Amazon Prime, and one has Fire Stick; giving me different options in different rooms. Due to COVID and being stuck at home, I like the different options.

The only problem I have with this is that it needs to be unplugged a couple times a week in order to keep working.  Sometime there is no sound other time it get stuck in a loop where the show stops them repeats itself until I unplug the power and plug back in, it is just annoying.
Volume and mute bottoms no longer work after only having this unit for approximately 3 months and an the eligibility for return has expired. I am a very disappointed customer.

This was a good product at first but it has been terrible for the last 4-6 weeks, very much making me regret spending the $50  on this and not on the fire stick (which i already have one and just bought a second one because this has been a piece of crap lately). It is always giving issues saying it can't connect to the internet, then I got to settings, check it and there is an excellent connection. Also stops playing in the middle of shows so I have to get up and unplug it then plug it back in to get it to work, which it only does for a short time then I have to do that again.Just buy the Amazon Fire stick and save yourself some time.I'd also like to say that I did my research before buying this and thought it was the better buy for certain features, but not worth it when the other stick does everything exactly the same.

Product does not work well. The app for the remote operation does not work correctly either. The customer service is poor. The system tries to force you to put in your credit card information, when it should be just allowing you to setup your account. After a month or so the tech support will let you know that you don't need it. Most things require another account to access.

i like to think that the mu-mimo wifi on these is why ive had 0 issues streaming 3 of them at the same time. the roku remote app for the phone appears to compensate for signal delay, making quiet/private listening a breeze. (sometimes glitches but updates seem go have cleared that up more recently). ive even listened through airpods while my phone is charging without issue. menu is responsive enough and the included remote doesnt need line of sight :-).todo: setup with an hdmi audio splitter to bookshelf speakers via mini amp, plugged into a dell ultrasharp monitor via displayport conversion

the devise is easy to install. the remote is a nightmare to get it to work. The signal doesn't get to the tv so I spent too much time pressing the channels really hard and it still doesn't get the signal well. The app works but it has commercials and you have to look at it as you change. Is not like the physical remote that you feel the buttons and don't have to look down to change the tv. do something with the remote, otherwise it could be good.UPDATE: 10/1/2019 I called Amazon they comunícate it with Roku  and they will be sending a new remote.

my first roku since the first-gen "box" way back when, which i ditched when i switched to a smart tv.  however, the smart tv in question (an LG) keeps phasing out support for the apps i use, and the interfaces are abysmal.bought this for xmas and haven't looked back.  UI is straightforward and intuitive.  has apps for everything i stream - amazon, netflix, cbs, cw, etc etc etc.  setup couldn't be simpler - plug it in, connect it to wireless.  only downside: no way to assign a static IP address, so if you generally do that (or if your router is twitchy about dynamic assignments) you're SOL.solid A.  would buy again.
Small and hides behind my tv. Remote is great, and the apps run fast. It’s my third Roku and I recommend it to everyone.

I recently "cut the cord" like so many others have done since cable service was costing me close to $200 a month...I reduced my service to internet/Wifi only at my house...I have a Hisense 4K Smart TV that I really like but the smart apps are built in and you can't add to them....so, i read about the Roku Stick and decided to try it...it was so easy to set up and I found a service that gives me the local channels I want plus a few other news channels...the picture quality is amazing on my TV and the system works quickly and smoothly!  I am sold on this product!  I am ordering another one for the TV in my bedroom...

Love Roku.  This device works great and can't believe for it's size what it can do.  For those looking for a mute button beware that the exact model number has not changed between the one shipped with a mute button and one shipped without the button.  Mine ordered on November 24,2019 was shipped without a mute button.  The item was clearly advertised with a mute button.  Now to be fair Amazon support did provide a resolution for my trouble.  So be prepared to possible receive the wrong item as presumably they clear out old inventory.

I got this to replace my glitchy Fire stick, and so far, it’s been great. I’ve had no buffering issues or any other issues with streaming content loading. My only complaint is that the volume controls on the Roku remote can’t be paired with any sound bars other than ones made by Roku. There are better sound bars available for the money than the Roku ones, so this was disappointing since I was looking for the simplicity of one remote for everything.

Absolutely amazing piece of device. Bought this as a replacement for my Apple TV Gen 2, and couldn’t be happier. Been using for 3 months now and there is not a single issue at all. Much much more affordable and very user friendly. So happy that we bought a 2nd for the bedroom and decided to get rid of our Apple TV for good. It would have cost us so much more if we were to upgraded our Apple TV. Thanks Roku, and keep up the good job.

When you get it & call the number provided to set it up you are led down a rat hole, where the people at the other end claim you have to pay an extra amount for a subscription to a service in order to get programming. They get your credit card # and charge $112.99 for a "Roku Premium lifetime" service. If you don't pay, you get to sign in, but only as a limited time "Guest".  You're not *supposed* to have to pay anything extra for Roku... this is a misrepresentation at the minimum, if not a scam.

I needed to Roku for my upstairs bedroom because that flat screen wasn't a smart TV.  The previous streaming device I owned buffered quite a bit and seemed to suffer because it was so far from my wifi router.  This device has no problems though.  Works great even though it's all the way on the other side of the house.  No issues with lags, freezing, or buffering.  Great little device.

We recently got rid of cable and went to internet TV.  We had a few smart TV's but bought this Roku stick for the ones that weren't smart.  We have had no issues at all.  The signal seems to be strong and it works just like it is supposed to.  I would highly recommend this to anyone deciding between different products.  It's very user friendly and I was able to get all of the aps that I wanted.

We bought several of these so we can stop paying xfinity to rent their cable boxes.  They've all been great, but one of the remotes in my last order doesn't work.  It controls the Roku, but we specifically bought the version that would also control the TV and in settings, Roku says that the remote is not configured to control a TV (even though it was in the same box that our other Roku was and that it has the same volume buttons on the side of the remote).  The Roku works just fine, but the remote is super disappointing since it does not control our TV.

We cut our cable a few years ago and invested in a Vizio smart tv.  We watch all our shows on Netflix and Hulu.  However, the tv network "The CW" was taken off of Hulu so we then had to download the cw app on our phone and plug it directly to the tv in order to watch our shows on that network (The vizio smart tv doesn't have an app store.  You just get what you get...).  This got really old!  We have friends who have Rokus so I decided to do some more research.  They happened to be on sale at the time and I also had an amazon gift card so we decided to make the purchase.  We are sooooo glad we did.  No more plugging our phones into the tv and there is also a great selection of all kinds of other tv shows and movies.  This is absolutely worth the purchase.  The reason why I got this specific model over one of the cheaper ones is because of some of the specs.  Faster wifi connection, voice control, better remote, etc.  These admittedly are kinda nit-picky and unnecessary but I like my tech so I went for it.  I would encourage you to compare the specs of the different models and if those upgrades don't matter to you then go ahead and get one of the cheaper ones.  Make the purchase, you'll be happy you did!

and the reason is that the stick is too long to use in any of the HDMI connections on any of 4 TV's I tried out.... Well, you can get a cable to resolve this for free from roku. But you have to go on their homepage and apply for it. So they get all your data, phone number, email and so on...Sorry roku, but that's a bunch of BS. So I have not tried it if it works , as I am waiting for my adapter cable, one I purchased from Amazon.

I bought a projector to stream content on my wall in a room without a TV. I added this Roku so I could load content directly from the stick to the projector. It works great! I bought the Roku vs the Fire Stick because I wanted to be able to use Peacock so I could stream The Office and Parks and Rec. it was really easy to set up and now I’m back to watching my two favorite shows!

I would give this piece of junk negative 15 stars if I could. One month in the remote completely stopped working. I cannot use the app as it consistently says the device is not on the network even though every other thing streams movies and shows just fine, including the smart TV that it is plugged into. The worst part is, I fought with their horrible customer service to get a replacement remote and they have been telling me for weeks now they are out of them. The frustration is unreal. I will never buy another garbage Roku item again, nor will I recommend it to anyone.

I always purchase new preferably from Amazon or sellers w/100% satisfaction rating. Have purchased a few as gifts choosing the HD/4K/HDR Streaming Device with Long-range Wireless and Voice Remote with TV Controls option to ensure it's compatability w/newer TV sets/computers. I do not skimp bc all players are not the same this one is the best one afaic tho there's another more expensive one that is a small rectangular box which uses an JDMI cord whereas this plugs into HDMI port on TV or other media device.

I love it. It's fast and easy to use. Be sure to buy this one that has the volume and mute button on the side. I had bought a different roku without the side buttons and that one was terrible and very slow. When you activate beware of side scams charging money. I didn't have that problem but I saw  some reviews stating that and the real roku site warns you to beware of the scamming sites. I hope you buy and enjoy.

Do you want to start streaming an internet TV service like YouTube TV? Then you can't really go wrong with this Roku Streaming Stick+.  I use Xbox One, Google Chromecast and Apple TV to stream YouTube TV and have found that the Roku handles it the best, plus gives us additional channel options, including Netflix and Hulu (separate subscription required). The interface is smooth and responsive and I have not had any issues with watching content.  I highly recommend this.  The other nice thing about this Streaming Stick+ is that it is small enough to slip into a backpack or bag to take along when you travel.  Since it plugs into an HDMI slot, most TVs you'll encounter can be used to watch what you want (or what you want to keep your kids entertained while you do something else).

This Roku is useless. I have owned Roku units since their first model. This garbage stick refuses to even boot up the first time. I will connect then I connect from my WiFi. I plug a 4 year old unit from another room into the same HDMI slot and it works perfectly. The speed test on my phone in the exact position the stick would be is 46 GPS. Don’t waste your time with this “long range WiFI” device.

Plugged right in, on one TV. Wouldnt fit on the other, had to ordered HDMI extender cable.But TV recognised stick right away, put my email and PW in from my other Roku unit, and away it went.It loaded and updated just like it was supposed to.

Loved it. Easy setup for a guy who knows little to nothing about electronics.I bought this for a 15 year old HDTV that has no smart capabilities, and for which I had lost the remote.This unit setup quickly and easily and works great.

I bought this Roku Streaming Stick so I could watch Disney+ on my older Smart TVs. I have a 2014 version and this newer version is pretty similar but it's definitely sleeker and technologically updated. I like that you have the option to plug this into the wall OR just plug it into 2 spots on your TV (which is what I chose). The set up was really simple and the remote is very responsive. I was so happy with the quality of this streaming stick that I grabbed a second one while it was still on sale! Can't beat it!

Got this because I purchased brand new LG 4K UHD HDR television and this 4K Roku makes my TV look amazing I would recommend if you have a 4K TV by this 4K Roku and then when you are watching TV you can press the info button on your TV remote and see what resolution you are getting but everything I have been watching with this Roku has all been in 4k looks amazing five stars all day

Always loved Roku devices & their interfaces but i have no idea what wrong with this one. I'll have it working but as soon as it I turn my tv off & back on it'll either flash a broken Roku screen & stay blank, or my tv won't even recognize there's anything plugged in. I'd have to unplug & replug the stick everytime which is pretty frustrating. I've tried everything to fix it. Different tv settings, different Roku display settings, different HDMI ports, absolutely nothing works.

I keep going round and round with Roku support because my Streaming Stick runs the batteries down in roughly a week and I need a replacement under warranty. After 12 emails or so they are still "Reviewing the Matter".

I have several different brands and Roku Is one of the best. One other that has the voice recognition is Amazon Fire, but like the way Roku lays out there menus better. Faster to find what your looking for, very little confusion. I'd send a picture but my router is down and I am connected direct to my computer for the next few days till I get the new router and server set up. If you do want a picture of one of the functions you can ask in a few days and I can send what you need I hope. If not maybe can explain what your asking about.

I highly recommend the Firestick light. I was aware that the remote did not come with the power button, or volume control, for the tv. I am one of those people that did not mind. I have the remote for the tv, so there really wasn’t a need. It’s just a nice little extra. So, if you are like me, you will be highly satisfied!  If you are not like me, I’d go with the regular - not the Firestick light. The Light is the way to go, especially if you are on a tight budget . I received fast shipping to make everything that much better. Thank you!

I could not make it work with my older TV which two ports like my new TV. Found out it needs more power if bothDirect TV an Fire TV are hooked up at same time, must disconnect one or other too make it work

My son bought me this Firestick as a birthday gift to replace my 9 year old one. It’s worked great and I especially like the voice remote feature. The voice remote makes finding a movie, series, etc a snap. So happy with it.

Hard to set up screen cast using phone hotspot for signal but works OK once you set it up. It uses much less data if set it up with phone hot spot and screen cast using phone Prime program on low data setting. A good value for what it does.

It makes things so EASY. We can control light and other devices from the remote as well as turn the TV on or off. It is WAY EASIER to use than our old ROKU. It is much easier to find movies and hunt channels.

One thing 2020 has taught me is that being a couch potato is good for your health! Thank you Amazon FireTV for making this relationship a meaningful one...everything at the click of my control....if only Alexa could cook and deliver food...

It started out good. Now every other day it needs a hard reset or it does not have sound. I went to this from the 1st Gen fire TV which was a box. I wish I had just spent the extra money for something different.

Works great!!! Purchased because our tvs do not get Disney plus. So this solved that problem. Works great!! I really enjoy that I can tell Alexa what to play went laziness sets in and I dont want to get the remote.

The voice text to the TV has never failed me but I have to use my phone to change the channels the remote is actually worthless and cheap and the warranty is no good at all at least one year should be honored

Came in a day, put batteries in and set it  up quickly in place of my Living room Fire stick.  I downloaded the  data off of my wife's account and it loaded her saved settings. Once completed I took it to the bedroom  and plugged it into our second TV and it works flawlessly.

The roku + works great, with prime and netflix and all the other free stuff we no longer need cable. Only problem I have encountered is from time to time it does over heat even with and extender plugged into it.

I have never before used a Streaming stick. I had read several Technical reviews online before choosing this one because it had a great assortment of reviews. I am so glad that I purchased the Roku Streaming Stick+, it was so easy to get it set up and super easy to use. I was so pleased with it that I purchased a second one for my bedroom. I was happy to cut my cable off, and this product helped to make it so worth it!

Any Roku device pays for itself against the cost of cable subscription. It's always very easy to use. My favorite features are these:1) The "Plus" versions of these devices allow you to control your TV power and volume so that you can have a "one remote" experience which is easier for both you and especially for guests.2) Even without the headphone jack of the Roku Ultra, I enjoy the "private listening" mode by using the smartphone app and connecting my headphones to my phone.

Within a  few hours of use I got “your device is overheating” message appear. This isn’t something one would expect, but after a search, it seems to be fairly common Roku stick issue. Device was almost too hot to touch. Very dangerous! I had to unplug and let it cool down.

Got it to stream xfinity so I could get rid of my box. With Comcast u must have at least one box and any other room in your house you can use one of these sticks and download xfinity the app. You can’t order movies with Comcast on demand app but that’s the only thing it’s missing which is fine bc you can just order movies with other apps like vudu etc. I bought a roku years ago and threw it to the side bc it wouldnt update. I bought this and after I saw how great it was I plugged in my old roku and it updated as well so they really came a long way with updates I’m impressed. Just make sure you have the stick plugged in to your faster USB port(tv may have a couple) Mine is plugged into my (HDD) 5V 1A port. I plugged it into the slower one (5V 0.5A) and it showed a message it was overheating. Since changing the ports I never saw that issue again. Yay!

I have 4 cable boxes that charter was charging me $8/month for each box.  With this Roku stick, which sets up in about 10 minutes, I am saving $24/month.  If you did the math it does not add up because charter says that if I have their cable package I have to have at lease one box.  During setup I added spectrum tv and now I have all of the channels I had before.  These Roku sticks will pay for themselves in about six months.

Everything about the stick itself is great. Easy install, great implementation of 4K, easy navigation. Why only 4 stars? The less than stellar remote. Putting the volume/mute buttons on the right side, not top, of the remote right where your fingers are holding it was a bad idea and needs to be rethought. I often accidentally mess up the sound simply by holding it in my right hand.

Just cut the cord with our cable company and needed a streaming device for our "dumb" TV. I've been using a Roku on another TV for a while and I like the interface better than the fire stick. But having to use 2 remotes was a pain. This solves that issue with the TV power/volume buttons. It was very easy and quick to set up and link to the TV. Works great - I am very satisfied. Just one nit pick would be that the mute button is located in a spot where I frequently push it by accident.

The unit works fine. It goes through a restart process every time you turn on the tv which takes time, unlike the older model. Upside is that you can turn your tv on / off with the roku remote. The voice control is handy and works most of the time. The remote sucks battery life like an energizer succubus. We use name brand batteries and it eats them like candy which is BS.

We have a clunky old BlueRay system that also has internet access for Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc.  It has always been glitchy - especially with Hulu, and then it stopped supporting Hulu (not that I cared too much).  My wife has been advocating for a Roku for months, and I finally decided to go acquiesce to her request as a holiday / birthday present.  Little did I know that the present would be mine.  This is so easy to install, so fluid in operation, so simple to use that we don't even use any of our other remotes any more.  We love it.  So, I hate to admit it, but my wife was right - my only regret is that we didn't switch to Roku sooner.

The stick is fine, the problem is the remote,  the batteries die quickly. Google the roku remote problem, and you'll see I'm not the only one with this problem, called roku, they'll change it, new ones arrive in a month, none it stock.

I took a star off for streaming because some things have a little more difficulty streaming but that could be my internet are the streaming service itself not the device. You may not have that problem. This is much easier to use and faster than my old Roku. I use this with my phone's mobile hotspot. It also communicates back and forth with your phone really easily and instantly

This is one of the fastest installs I have done. It took me more time to get the Roku stick inserted in the HDMI slot behind the TV due to the wall mount space restriction. Do note, this requires a power source, so do ensure a power strip or outlet is nearby as the cord is a few feet long not very long (understandably); the other option to charge it via a USB slot on the TV; which worked well in my case.Once installed, the interface finds your Internet connection and connects to it (pwd. required of course).Will be buying another for other rooms.

The Roku Streaming Stick + is an excellent product in every way! Set up was simple and fast. Within ten minutes of receiving it I was accessing all of my accounts  (Netflix, Hulu, Prime) and tons more! I am not the most tech savvy person and it was simple for me to use and a lot smoother running than previous Roku products that I have purchased. After reading reviews I ordered this and am not in the least bit disappointed! We ditched our satellite television service a few years ago, raised an excellent antenna (also from Amazon) and started streaming video instead. This purchase will definitely enhance your entertainment options.

After years of being at the mercy of monopolistic cable companies which provided mediocre service for very high prices, I have jumped ship. Made no difference where i lived, each place had one cable company that ruled --- and while some were better than others, none really bothered to provide top notch service. They didn't have to! My ROKU is great --- I get all the TV I had before with cable, plus MANY more options, for less than half the price even with the extra options stacked up for super premium service. What a breakthrough! Waaay LESS than half the price PLUS really really good service and waaaay  more of it!

I love Roku!  This is my second one. My first one lasted almost 10 years!  Then the remote died. That is an awesome lifespan for technology, IMO.Roku is completely awesome. The screens are intuitive, it’s one remote for my tv and sound bar and the Roku. It has quick buttons for Netflix and Hulu. It remembers where you are in a show when you pause and you can come right back to that spot at another time.My wifi is about 600’ away on another floor and the streaming is uninterrupted.Fabulous. Don’t buy anything else (ie the Amazon Fire stuff - my friend has it and it is terrible). Buy this!!

So glad I choose this set over the other less expensive ones. Bot until I received it did I realize it could even control the volume of my TV. The only negative is the remote is very sensitive. The volume more sensitive than the other buttons. The home button even changes my HDMi for me.Love it and use it instead of streaming directly from my TV due to it is just easier.

I was a loyal Chromecast and Chromecast Ultra user for a number of years but frequently had problems connecting to it from my laptop. The Roku is absolute dream: setup is easy, the remote is simple yet effective, and the UI is **incredibly** responsive. After having using Netflix apps in countless hotel rooms that were slow and laggy, the incredible speed of the Roku UI is like mana from heaven. Great channel selection and also works effortlessly with my Plex server. I now have one in the living room and one in the bedroom - I love this device!

It constantly reboots itself and we have to sign back into everything.  Does not have enough memory to store seemingly any apps.  Roku Customer Service (which I would give zero stars to) says it is because the tv does not have enough power and it needs to be plugged into the wall (I have tried it on both of my relatively new Sony TVs).  That would defeat the whole purpose of having a streaming stick.  I have several other Roku products which are fine but this streaming stick is completely terrible and you should definitely not bother with it.

Bought this to replace an old Chromecast I had. One of the best purchases I’ve made in recent years. The connectivity and response is superb. After I purchased I went ahead and upgraded my Netflix plan to the premium Ultra HD and couldn’t be more satisfied. I used to access Netflix and Amazon on my PS4 before but after I purchased the Roku the difference is night and day.

It seems like amazon is making the electric cord shorter and shorter. Since TVs are hung on the wall, the cord should be at least 5-10 inches longer just to save everyone the headache of getting another extension. cord.Thanks.

Great product! The only thing I would change is adding a power button. I have tried to google to see if this remote might have a power button like the home button or something but nope, other than that I’d say don’t lose the actual tv remote 😂 but great for a heads up if you are expecting a power button like the other fire stick!  Works great, voice recognition is 5/5 stars.

Absolutely useless to watch live tv. All “live “ tv apps are  unavailable. Bought it to work on our older 2015 Samsung tv since sling app won’t work on it. Fire tv  says it’s unavailable. Tried the stick on my 2018 Samsung tv which has the Samsung App Store sling tv installed. Still says unavailable. Deregistered , restored to factory default, logged in using husband’s account. Still live tv unavailable . . Useless junk!

I bought this for my 87 yr mom for her birthday and she is very happy with it. You still have to use the tv remote for on/off and volume, but it’s no bother for her since she keeps both remotes in the same spot.

It works great. I already had one of these for my downstairs TV so I bought this for my bedroom TV. . Now I can watch all of my streaming services on both TVs. It was a great deal at $17.99. Couldn't pass it up.

The reason I gave four stars and set a five is we have three fire sticks the first two have been great the third one that we bought the voice command does not work at all so I guess there's some inconsistencies.

Like the voice recognition ,smooth app interphase. Just leave an option so I can some of the junk bloatware preinstalled that can not be removed that slows down the firestick considering the low storage capacity

Bought this for Christmas gift. I have one on each of my TV's and absolutely love this product. I  Got rid of my cable severally years ago and replaced it with the fire stick. I love it super simple and money saver

This tool / device integrates various tv / media actioins and activities in ways that I don't fully understand.  I'm sure that media / tech savvy users will find it very flexible and valuable.  I'd be glad if I could manage to make use of even half of its capabilities.I'm not likely to ever take full advantage of this device's funtions and options.  I'm sure if you can use it you will likely be most pleased.

Was super excited to get this but then.....I opened the package and that’s when everything went wrong. 😒😒 my remote buttons don’t work or they get stuck like a 5 year old with barbecue fingers was playing with it.....it randomly turns off, (I had my mom come by and sprinkle holy oil everywhere) and you have to unplug it just for it to come back on....whyyy??? Send the hot delivery man back to come pick this..Im going to meet the plug in 20 to get a fire stick!!!  😡😡😡😡

Absolutely perfect! I bought three of these. One for my home tv and two for my rv. I wanted to be sure to get the long range wifi capable stick as I will need this for camping with the available wifi. Let me tell you, it definitely works. High quality picture and high speed stream. My husband remarked several times about the great picture on the TV. We have youtubetv service as well as Netflix and other streaming services and using them to watch TV while camping was perfect. Highly recommend 👌

I was a little nervous that the device only connected wirelessly to the Internet (I thought perhaps an ethernet/wired connection might be better), but I've been mostly happy so far with the quality of the image. It's not quite as high-def as I had hoped, but it looks pretty good. The Roku interface is very easy to work with, and it makes cute sound reminiscent of Nintendo Wii. And because of the USB connection for power, there are no unsightly cables hanging down from the TV.

This did not work well for me and wasn't able to get help from Roku support except to move the router or the TV. It's 65 feet straight down my hall to the TV and device kept signing me out and pausing to spool up. Not an enjoyable way to watch a program. I gave it 2 stars because it may be my internet, but being to get only stock answers from Ruku was no help. They kept sending me a link to hook up by ethernet cable, but that's not the Roku I have. Communication was a big problem.

I've actually purchased 3 of these for my house. (big house!) And I'm quite happy with them. I did need to use a wi-fi booster for the Roku in my living room. Big house, brick walls, etc...needed a booster. Nbd. It works fine now. Two of our tv's are newer, so they power the Roku. One tv is a bit older (still a flat panel) but it cannot power the Roku, so it's plugged into the wall for power. Again, nbd. But other might want to know about it.I like the remote. It's lightweight. Buttons are easy to use in the dark. Menu system is not complicated. Easy to install! I am not tech savvy, and I didn't have a hard time with this thing. :)

what a joke bought 3 of these, worked fine for a few weeks now have a message appearing on just 1 tv that reads;  the USB port on your tv will not power this rook device, contacted ROKU support, they will fix the issue, do an update for $49.95,, what a joke. Never heard of a FREE streaming device that u have to pay for.  As#hole Rep. Tanya claims its not a serve fee or annual fee, just a one time set up fee..... check into this before you buy

We really like this device.  It has a very user friendly interface for navigating the TV stations.  The best part is that it lets us load all our TV streaming subscriptions on it and then be able to use it anywhere we go....in hotels, at friends houses, etc. and it knows exactly where we left off on each series show.  We bought a second one for our downstairs TV as well.

Well, I should have searched the inter webs about this.  It get super hot while streaming (too hot to touch) and will lock up and be unresponsive after sitting idle for a few hours (even though it has not heated up). I have another streaming stick plus purchased last year that works perfectly.  In face the older one it plugged directly into a Samsung 4K TV while the new one if plugged into a long HDMI cable that goes to my AVR.  Talking of AVR, this stick will not control the AVR.  Come on, Roku - up your game.  And while we are talking about issues - no HBO MAX, boo.Time to look at the ChromeCast with Google TV.

Just got the device tonight at 7 p.m. it is 9 p.m. and we have still not finished the setup. Had to add credit card , personal information, answer a bunch of questions. This Saturday night is shot. I will write another review if we can ever make it work

This worked for me for about a month with my projector before failing and giving me constant HDCP errors. I tried to unplug, restart, reboot, change the resolution to 1080p and 720p, but nothing helped.I have the old Roku which is working fine when I switched it in (although Hulu is now discontinued on that version). This basically means that the updated Roku versions have issues the old ones never did. Frustrating I spent $$ on something thats supposed to be better technology and is now basically junk to me.

Ill get straight to the point. Xfinity was nearly $200 a month for 1 DVR box and internet. Tired of playing the cable game every promotion. Bought Roku, Signed up for Hulu Live TV and keep just internet (60 MBPS) all for around $95/month.FANTASTIC Interface with Roku. Easy Setup and it just works like any streaming stick should. Quality is top notch. Has not buffered once while watching live TV. Beyond happy with my purchase. Id go as far as saying Roku+ gives Apple TV a run for its money! Also all the Apps it supports are great. YouTube, Netflix etc. Destroys the interface my Sony TV has for apps. A+Thank you Roku.

Fast and compatible with all major apps. Wifi reception for either 2.4 or 5GHz. A persistent problem is with the Disney+ app. The fire stick has to be reset or the cache and data cleared to get it working.

I bought this as a gift for my mother-in-law to replace her old fire stick that stopped working. She loves this one so much more. The voice recognition is fantastic for older folks who can't figure out how to use the interface.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   When I receive the product it was working but first the control star to get problems so I have to upload the control app from my phone and for the next time the fire stick wasn't working anymore. And I tried to contact with an expert but they never reply my question.

This is a handy device for streaming on my not-very-smart tv. (my smart tv doesn't include the ability to stream Disney+ or CBS All-Access.)  Because my cable company is not covering the  local CBS station due to contract disputes, I got this to stream live tv.  This didn't work with the Fire stick. The live stream froze almost instantly.  Otherwise, the Fire stick works well.  I am able to see live tv when I access the CBS All-Access through Amazon Prime which my tv does have built in.

The fire stick is so easy to setup and use.  I ordered this one because I did not need the volume control. I use it for a home office/2nd bedroom. The price was excellent! I have 2 others. I do not need cable in the other 2 rooms either, but want to access Netflix and Amazon on the Tv's. This does it so simply.

This inexpensive Lite Firestick is fully functional, easy to use and setup, and has lots of free apps and all the necessities for a cord cutter like myself.  I put it in my spare room and guests love it.  I highly recommend.

Horrible. Tested with 2 TVs (different brand) and I'm required to unplug it every time for it to turn on, then home screen is unavailable half the time, then once I've chosen a show it will play and there will be no volume. So sometimes turning the TV off and on returns the volume, otherwise I have to repeat the process of unplugging it.Our old firetvstick is awful too, but at least it works 80% of the time.I give up, grabbing a book.

Very happy with my fire stick , i am able to look at youtube videos and streaming movies.Live the Alexa voice command thing, missing from other streaming devices, this feature alone made me buy the fire stick.Thank you amazon..

It doesn’t come with an off or on button nor volume and you have to always keep the adapter connected. Like who wants to be getting up to turn off the tv or on or when you wanna do your make up and if you’re comfortable you have to get up and do it manually. I recommend you get a roku remote instead. I want my money back!!!! Also someone called me from the company and as I was explaining the situation they hung up on me and never called back. I want a refund like asap!!!

A friend got this and I liked it so much that I bought one! I haven’t really used it, but in the couple of days I have, it’s been pretty great! I love how I don’t have to go to on demand and scroll through a hundred things and go through a bunch of steps to watch my shows on TV and being able to watch them on my TV instead of my phone, frees up my ability to use my phone for other things during my “marathons”Edited to add: my friend has the “lite” version and I bought the “full” version since it was on sale and the same price as the “lite” version

I have tried everything to get the remote working again. All troubleshooting! All resetting options! I am out of options. My original Roku stick and remote that I bought years ago still work. Why is my brand new remote not working anymore? Very frustrating! I would like answers!

I have purchased two Rokus in the past (over 2 years ago) and have had no issues. Unfortunately, this Roku seems to have some tech issues. The remote would not re- connect with the Roku each time TV was turned off and on. Roku tech support suggested removing the batteries, however the batteries are impossible to remove from this remote.  Purchased a new TV as I thought the old TV was possibly the issue, however once Roku was plugged in, the TV stated "HDMI port hot." I could not get this Roku to function and it is brand new. Unfortunately, need to return.

For some reason, this product didn't want to work by simply using the USB cable.  After a bunch of trouble, I had to plug it directly into an outlet.  That was fun considering the HDMI cable attached directly to the unit is about 10 inches long!  We'll see how it works now.  I also might have to use an HDMI extender.  I found that out when I spoke via chat with someone at Roku.  It's free on the website, which I could not find.  I had to contact Roku.  They sent me an e-mail with the link.  Sigh!

The device was too long to fit right intonout TV. Called Roku and, after some problems, they sent out an extender, which we received about five days later. So far it works well but we're only giving it 4 stars because, even when powered off with the remote, it still streams. We plugged it into a Wemo and, hopefully, won't get a usage warning from Xfinity next month.

I have had trouble since day one with streaming in my basement bedroom. It's as far away as you can get from the WiFi router without being outside. (Actually, you get a stronger signal on the front porch... but I digress.) It typically would take me about 90 minutes to watch a 45 minute TV show with all the buffering and stopping and starting. (Some days were better/worse than others.) I ordered this because some reviews said it worked and IT DID! I have had it hooked up since I got it last week and it has not lost the signal once and the picture is crystal clear! I have always loved my Roku and this made the experience that much better. If I could give this 10 stars, I would.

I am very frustrated. As long as I have had this it has been a struggle. The remote drains batteries incredibly fast and is frequently unresponsive. It makes you think you are using an ancient computer that is crawling, but it seems to be a remote issue.

I don't have much to compare it to--this is the first streaming device I've owned, but it works well and is pretty intuitive to use.  Sometimes there has been a bit of delay in getting new streaming services on board--for instance, it was a few months behind the curve in getting HBO Max--but since it's streaming you can always catch up on any show you really wanted to see.

Ok so this is a good product but before I bought this it doesn’t say that you have to pay a 19.99 fee to activate the product I had to call a 845 area code number somewhere in India to activate product and I was lied to by the sales rep that told me it was a 9.99 feel and got charged 19.99 that’s so wrong that amazon doesn’t tell you this.

I had Xbox one S and it works great, but always sucks with remote and logging in streaming apps take FOREVER... I am so tired of it, saw this Roku with 4k and the price... are so nice, I decided to give it a try. (I used to have 1st generation Roku which I hate it). After install and it was so easy to set up and fast! And also its nice that this remote can take care of tv remote as well, so you don't have to use two remotes! (tv power, volumes). The remote batteries are so amazing it last much longer than the Xbox controller! If you guys want to use Xbox console for streaming, you'll be more than happy to have this better than Xbox! --- Time to sell Xbox! :)

I bought this Roku + streaming stick and did not realize that I would be getting a refurbished one (it has a sticker saying “refurbished“ right on the stick). Since day one we have had issues with it staying connected to the WiFi and finding the signal. We have 6 TVs - 2 of which are in rooms right next to this one - all of which have Roku sticks and no issues with connection. Do not buy a refurbished Roku unless you’re looking for a bunch of headaches and dropped shows.

My husband and I waited a long time to get a Firestick, thinking we wouldn't use it.  Not the case..we really like some of the  sites, and are having fun exploring the contents.  Definitely recommend this!!

I have a number of Roku devices and TVs with it built-in, so it was an easy choice to add a Roku stick to my workout TV. It worked fine initially, but due to the recent struggles with services like HBOmax and Peacock I lost faith that the Roku will support current and future services. I replaced it with an Android device (Tivo Stream 4k) - it's slightly less intuitive at first, but supports every service under the sun as far as I know. No more Rokus for me.

I'm sure this is a good product, but be warned that you can not view HBO Max thru this devise. I have an HBO account thru my cable TV provider and I have HBO MAX at no additional cost on my Iphone. I purchased the Fire Stick in order to view HBO MAX on my TV. Unfortunately, Amazon informed me that I must purchase HBO thru them and also purchase Amazon Prime. I returned the Fire Stick and purchase Google Chromecast which allows me to cast HBO MAX onto my TV without any additional cost.

Like others, I struggled to open the battery chamber for the Fire Stick remote. I contacted Amazon Returns (it took 2 interactions to resolve my complaint) and was sent a replacement which opened seamlessly.

This product was very easy to use. Even for the older people like me it was simple to install, must follow the onscreen directions. You must use the volume controls on your tv remote. The voice control with alexa is easy.

I had a very old FireTV stick and it was so slllllllow to add any movie or app. This new one is MUCH faster to load anything! It takes seconds compared to minutes. Well worth the Black Friday price too.

This very inexpensive device is able to get enough Wifi in my apartment in a room that's far from my router and my apartment has plaster walls, whereas my new Samsung Smart TV can't connect with the Wifi.

Bought the least expensive version to try.  Live in rural community and wasn't sure we would be able to get strong enough signal.  wish TV volume could be controlled through stick as well.  Otherwise system works well.

I love the fire stick I would tell friends about this.it is to cool I've seen TV shows I haven't seen for a long time.and adding things that you would love even the library site this is better than cable.

Didn’t really upgrade the connection which is what we wanted. Everything still freezes and now the sound goes off and we have to reboot.With that said if youLive somewhere that has great internet it probably helps.

This is our 2nd firestick lite, we waited till this deal so we could get this and are happy with it. We are able to use apps like hulu and netflix and pluto tv and prime video all without having to purchase a new TV

It’s easy to set up. I’ve had a Roku before and in comparison I was disappointed that this remote did not come with the option to control the volume or a power button for the TV. So in the end I prefer Roku more just because it’s more convenient to have one remote for everything.

I gave it to an elderly friend. After I set it up he found it simple to use. He is pretty set in his ways, so the lack of TV controls worked out well as he insisted that he would continue to use the cable box's universal remote for everything other than choosing something to watch via the Fire Stick Lite. He had initially been concerned that he would have to learn a new remote. He loves it.

This is my third roku. I have absolutely loved every one other than this one. The biggest complaint is that the remote won't sync about half the time. I have to power cycle the stick to get it to work with the remote. Controlling it with your phone always works though. I'd recommend just going for the box. I fully regret buying the stick.Update: the batteries in my remote go out in two weeks. That's the last straw for me, and this is definitely my last roku stick*.

Installed on a decade-old Sony "smart" TV, which had long-since stopped receiving firmware updates.  Not quite enough power from the Sony USB port, so I used the included power adapter.  Works great on 2G and 5G wireless; only a minor drop in signal strength from the latter, despite being relatively distant from the router.  No apparent latency from the remote; the response is instant.  Best performance, by far, from Netflix, Pandora, YouTube etc. compared to other streaming devices in my home.  Voice commands work as advertised.  Overall, this device exceeded my expectations.

We've had other Roku's in the past and have loved them.  They're simple to use and set up and I like the interface so I decided to order the 4k version without hesitation. Turns out I should have read the reviews first. I noticed within the first few hours that the remote simply will not stay paired. This is insanely frustrating. You need to restart the device, pull the batteries out and sync the remote again. The remote would then work for a bit and then quit again. After about 4 days of doing this I got so fed up I ordered the Fire 4k stick and returned the Roku. The fire stick has been working well with no issues. I just wish it had the TV guide update for Hulu live like the Roku did.Side note, I was able to return the device to Kohl's. Super slick. Got my credit within minutes.

I can't believe I waited so long to try this. I am super impressed.  I am about to return all boxes to my cable provider and CUT THE CORD.  This was super easy to set up.  I love the voice functionality on the remote.  This has given me flexibility  to place televisions in areas of my home that did not have cable wiring including my sweetie's man cave/shed.  This allows flexibility to set up multiple televisions in my entertainment area just like in a sports bar.  And, I can take it with me when we go to the beach house, etc.  Again, I'm super impressed.

I have tried to use it in my garage & haven’t accomplished anything but frustration. My fire stick works just fine in there. I do not have too many devices hooked up & have a booster device which works great. I just acknowledged that Roku is the only device that won’t work in there so far. Yes I tried all of the old tricks like resetting the device, router, etc. Nothing. O well.

Pros:It is step up from the previous model. I do not need TV’s remote to control volume any more!I use it for Netflix and Youtube only, full HD mode.Wireless connection is good, the distance to the router(tp-link ac3200) is 6 meters including a wall.The picture is as good as it could be on my five years old Samsung plasma TV.No lags. No lags even when I rewind Netflix forward or backward, the rewinding does not affect picture quality.Cons:Volume button is on the right side of the remote control unit which is not convenient.I did not find Roku application for Amazon Prime videos.

We recommend this product for adding streaming capabilities to a 'not so smart' TV. Beware when activating. Only activate through ROKU as directed. Numerous scam companies online that want to charge a fee to activate. No rating on Voice Rec...we don't use.

I bought this because my Samsung smart TV had the worst functioning interface in the history of smart TV interfaces.I absolutely love this Roku streaming stick. It's faster all around. It loads faster. Apps load faster with no lag. When I click a button it responds immediately. I had previously read some reviews elsewhere about how the interface wasn't that pretty. I can't speak to what interface that writer was comparing it to, but it is much more pretty than the Samsung smart TV interface. It even has themes to choose from. And again, it just works, and works very well and fast.It also has what seems like hundreds of apps to choose from. Way more than I was able to add on the Samsung smart TV interface.This Roku streaming Stick has made TV pleasurable to watch again. I was so frustrated with the Samsung smart TV UI that I dreaded getting ready to watch a show. I had to make sure to give myself an extra 10-15 minutes before hand so that I could plan on having to disconnect the power from the TV and wait five to ten more minutes before I could ever get a show loaded.Well it may seem dramatic, the Roku streaming Stick has changed my life for the better.

This is a fantastic product if you don't have cable and want to access all your movie apps. The only complaint I have is the pre-labeled buttons for movie apps on the remote. I wish I could customize which apps launch when I press those buttons because I always accidentally click Sling or Vue but don't have any plans of subscribing. I also went online to request an HDMI extender because all the ports on my TV wouldn't fit the Roku stick; however, each time I requested one the website said they were unavailable and to check back later (no luck there). I finally caved and bought one at the store

We have truly enjoyed the firesticks that we have installed in our home.  Started with one and now have 3!  The voice feature is nice as well, although I must admit I forget to even use it and go old school pushing buttons.

Love all my apps in one place. Very easy to navigate. Only problem is that the sound cuts off on it often... Maybe once a day... And you have to unplug the unit and plug it back in once maybe twice in order for it to work again.... Don't know if anyone else has this problem..

I bought the Firestone because I don’t own a smart tv and it was the best money spent! I can finally watch Netflix and Disney+ on my tv without having to plug in my laptop. Highly recommend! I have no bought a Alexa doc yet but that will be coming soon because I do like the product.

Love this for my second room. Dislike no volume control, yet love the simplicity of use and setup. Great value for $20! I will be getting the new one soon! So nice to no longer have a cable bill!!! GOODBYE XFINITY!

Purchased this device and literally none of the applications work. I sign into them and can’t Watch anything making this equipment useless. I have the customer support and they are giving me the run around and not trying to replace the device. I am completely disappointed. This is just such an unfortunate experience.

I had previously bought the original FireStick Tv (with TV controls). Since i liked that one a lot, i went ahead and bought two Lite versions on the last Black Friday. I have to say they are a complete dissapointment. The interface is overall slower than the original, it looses  internet connection over and over again (it is not a network issue, since the original FireStick works fine). and the overall experience is a lot poorer than the standar version. I would reccomend to just spend a bit more and buy the original, or buy a Roku.  This one sucks
The on screen instructions were very easy to understand and complete.  It works great with our Amazon movies,  we love it .

Every time I turn on the Fire stick I need to do a hard reset in order to hear any sound. This is both time consuming and frustrating. Spoke with customer service for an hour after which the representative said they couldn’t solve my problem, a tech should call in two days for further trouble shooting. I had better things to do on Christmas Eve than take that phone call so I’m still resetting the fire stick with every use and still disappointed in this product

I like that this new one that I just bought has voice recognition. I have not had any issues with speaking directions yet. My other Amazon fire stick was messing up and this one has been great so far.

We have Dish TV  Unfortunately, you can't get Amazon Prime or UTube on the additional TV's called the Joey'sThis is an easy fix. Now I can watch those channels from my tv in the den.  Very happy with the purchase.PS.  Had a couple of questions during the initial setup.  Amazon tech support is great. Always answer the phone and very nice to deal with.

No me gusta no trae el botón de volumen ni el de encender el televisor ósea no me di cuenta que no lo tenía hasta que lo comparé con otro que ya tenía  y me ofrecieron una dichosa suscripción gratis y ahora resulta qué hay que pagar para obtener a los canales internacionales no jodas

This one doesn’t control the volume.  However, one thing we have noticed upon installing that sometimes we have to restart the program or movie at the Home Screen to get the volume to come on. The user interface is great as well as the picture quality. Do wish there was an easier way to make a show your favorite so it would show up more easily.

Amazed how well this works compared to my Shield. The price is outstanding. Coupled with the Recast DRV and you have a marvelous streaming and recording system! A+++++ Voice control works really well, also.

I received this item for Christmas from my children. It’s very cool. I don’t have Alexa so I’m. Or sure how it would work, but this definitely allows me to watch Disney+ and Amazon Prime on my TV. it’s pretty easy to use.

Its a good attachment to get streaming services to a regular TV. What I found though is that the audio does not always work.Have to turn the stick on and off. Spoke with tech support and they acknowledged that this is a product bug.

This one roves between our three secondary TVs.  We have a Cube in our living room for the main TV.  I like the fact that Lab126 seems to have created the ability to copy all relevant settings from your main unit to these secondary units!

We do not use Alexa or voice recognition, even though it is most likely listening all the time, so I cannot comment on their use or quality. For streaming, it is a pleasant upgrade from the basic firestick.

The round button is a pain. ROKU is easier to use and your fingers don't slip off the disk. I also find the roundness of the remote and it's being very thin forces you to hold it with 2 hands since it slips.

I've been streaming since the first Roku came out in 2008. I have two old gen Roku XD's, 1 Firestick, 3 Chromecasts one which is the old generation and two new gen. The Roku Streaming Stick + is by far the best and for several good reasons. 1: Faster processor 2. An advanced wireless antenna built into the stick extension (specs says cable of receiving Wifi signal 4x further so helps if your router is further away from the TV or if you live in an area with neighbors WiFi using the same Wifi channels this could make a big difference in your reception. 3. 4K vivid but blazingly fast display seems sharper on older Sony LCD. HDR playback. 4. Also includes a TV control remote which can control volume. I love that I can control the TV volume. Channels pop up almost instantly. I love my Firestick and you can't beat Chromecast if you use Youtube TV but this is the best all around streamer I've tried yet!

Ive used alot of the kindle sticks.  this one is just okay not sure if i like the interface it seems like they have allowed alot of surface area for advertising movies and apps and not enough foom for the apps that users choose to use. I rather the older version

After talking to my son and viewing lots of You Tube videos my wife & I settled on the Roku Plus streaming stick, I was amazed at the install I've been known to go crazy trying to get things set up on our  Vizio TV, within 5 min. set up was complete. Roku Plus walked me through it made me look like an expert. This Roku Plus has channels that will satisfy even the most discriminating viewer, I admit I've never owned a streaming stick. Its awesome so tiny you can't see it the remote is so easy to use & understand.  The best part is when I end up replacing the TV the Roku Plus is easily removed so I can use it on the new TV. You owe it to yourself to get one... Make your TV experience great again!!
Great streaming service. Follow included official instructions and it won't be held hostage. The remote drains batteries so take them out when not using the device.

This product was the fourth ROKU I've owned.  I like the UI and it is generally my preferred steaming platform.  I bought this streaming stick at the end of November 2019.  It worked great for about 2 months.  Then I started having an issue when I switched HDMI inputs and came back to the ROKU the screen was blurry and it would not function.  The only way to fix it was to power cycle it.  I lived with that problem for a couple of months.  Then the remote stopped controlling the TV.  Now it will not function no matter how many times I power cycle it.  In not even six months of use, it's garbage.  I checked the website and they only warranty them for 30 days.  I would be cautious about buying this model.

I was apprehensive about this. I had the "OLD" roku and it would overheat and was just BLAH!!! I needede this for my bedroom TV that isn't a smart TV. And we don't have cable.
