So I needed it to access my streaming services. But this one is amazing. All the free channels on Roku TV is the best. Easy to use. Easy to install. I have had zero issue. Works great for me.

My friend got this smart TV that stopped working correctly the second it connected to the network - the smart part stopped working leaving her with a dumb tv that was incredibly hard to use. The Roku stick is a perfect fix for this since it was made to boot up with the TV, when connected to the TV for power. This means the second she turns the tv on, the Roku automatically boots and displays on the HDMI port I plugged it into. In addition, I like the Roku interface. The remote makes sense,  different streaming services show up as different tiles, and the remote has useful HOME and BACK buttons to get back to the selection screen.

Unit received with dead batteries for remote.  Signal level indicated is "fair" instructions to move stick around to try and improve.  Very difficult to do without a HDMI extender cable.  Roku will supply a very short cable, delivery is  probably a week or more, for free.  Ordered an extender cable for next day delivery from Amazon.  Even with only fair signal level unit appears to be working with no buffering.

I've had multiple TiVo devices, and I still have an earlier Apple TV, an Amazon Firestick, two SmartTVs, and now 3 Rokus.  I doubt I will get anything but Roku from now on - it's just good, cheap, and easy.  Yeah, there are corner-cases where other devices come in handy:  Firestick supports Alexa, Apple TV supports Airplay.  But if you mainly care about streaming, nothing beats Roku.  It is to streaming TV what the iPhone is to the mobile phone ecosystem.

Where to begin. We tried to activate by using the info on the insert. The website provided gave us a series of errors. Called the phone number and some foreign guys couldn't help. Kept saying. "No problem". Eventually we talked to the third expert who told us that my computer was too old and tried to sell us a Sisco firewall! WTF! Found out the website they referred us to to activate was wrong and and that there is a Roku scam out there. Thank god I got a refund. Jeez !!!!!

We bought this on a recommendation and it may be the worst purchase I have ever made. Perhaps my home has too much interference but it continually drops the internet connection. It is unuseable. It is set up correctly and every couple of days we may be ale to watch a show. It finds my network fine and indicates a full strength signal but still says it can't connect. Sometimes, when I re-enter the internet password it will connect for a short period then drops again. As in the title, it is totally useless. i have ordered another streaming device to replace it.
We have a six year old Panasonic Smart TV and could not stream Disney, Hulu, HBO Max or CBS as they were not programed into the tv.With our Fire stick we can and get exceptional clarity as well.

Had original fire stick and it was starting to not work well. Got in new stick and great improvement was seen. Easy to set up and it is much faster. Would highly recommend that anyone with old stick upgrade to the new version. You will be highly satisfied.

I have used the traditional 4K firestick for a few years on 2 TVs in my home with no issues.  When I ordered this new FireStick Lite it unfortunately would not allow Netflix, Prime Video, or Disney+ to stream on the TV I intended to use it on (but worked fine on the other tv).  After several customer service calls I was told this Firestick Lite does not connect correctly with the intended TV (even though my other 4K stick works just fine).  Will be returning,
I like the Firestick. Cable TV almost requires another job just to pay the bill. The Firestick has the channels that I watch most. It's a good device for those on a budget or just want to save money.

It works great! It does everything the Fire stick 4k does buy does not have controls to the tv. So no volume controls or powering on or off the tv. Other than that, (it clearly states it does not do those things too) it's great!
I wanted this for our little kitchen tv.  I just use the regular remote for the tv to control the sound.  I have an alexa but haven't needed to use it with this fire stick.  It is my third firestick.

Bought for an office setting to stream new channels & holiday movies. Didn't need the volume controls, was the right price, and does exactly what I needed. I own the 4k and the volume control versions at home as well..all are a good buy.

For the price, this fire stick is awesome. Works great with my TV. I have an older model TV that didn’t get all the extra Chanel’s my daughters new TVs get, that’s why I bought the fire stick. Worth the price
I bought this as a second one for our house (this one in our bedroom) and am very happy with it. Works well and we can use Hulu, Netflix, and Disney+ on it (if you have an account for those things).

Exactly as described - really great product -This is all part of my plan to migrate away from cable boxes and subscribe to Internet only and use YouTube TV (I also have Netflix, Hulu and Amazon Prime)!  (FYI - YouTubeTV is NOT the same as YouTube!!!)I'll cancel my cable subscriptions very soon - !!!  AT LAST!!!QUESTION - How do I get "normal channels" plus movies?I use YouTubeTV on Roku Streaming Stick + - this combination delivers normal TV channels as well as Comcast and Verizon - with more choice - all in High Definition and at much lower cost!Also looked at - and rejected:Apple TV - just as good but at 2x price, maybe slightly nice interface.Chromecast - doesn't play well with Amazon PrimeAmazon FireStick - just awful with YouTubeTV, you have to watch it via a browser - YUGGH.  Slow and virtually unusable.And YouTubeTv includes full DVR capability - record and replay anything at any time!  On any device!!!I'll cancel my cable subscriptions very soon - !!!  AT LAST!!!

When it finally turns on, it functions fine.  The problem is the light indicating "ON" does not turn on immediately. Conversely,  the light indicating "OFF" stays on for a long time.  Very frustrating.  Is instant-on and instant-off not a feature of this product?And furthermore, good luck trying to find any Customer Support contact information on their website!!  You have to dig deep to find an email address and if you're lucky they might get back to you.  Why do they hide behind their internet screen?  To screen the in-coming complaints?  Not a good idea.  Why is there no phone number listed for easy problem resolution?!I WISH I HAD PURCHASED SOMETHING ELSE.  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH ROKU!

The Roku Streaming Stick+ was amazingly easy to install.  I had worried that its placement in an HDMI port on the back of my tv would make the remote awkward to use - no such thing.  It works flawlessly. I had also wondered how to program the remote so I could power on/off my tv and adjust its volume.  That was a seamless process - it asked me if I could hear music, I said yes, and it was done.  The streaming quality is outstanding and it is very quick, no blips.  I’ve used Roku for years on multiple TVs, and this one is the best one yet.

Just got my roku and so far I love it. I am primarily a google/android user so at first I was considering the android TV but decided to get a roku instead as Google isn't really working on android TV anymore and it hasn't had an update in a while. First off I like the fact that roku is an independent company that support both google and amazon. It also has many channels to chose from. There are plenty of free as well as subscription channels. Some of which are international like Viki. The interface is simple and easy to navigate. The remote has the ability to power on my tv and control the volume which I love.

Be Leary of this device. I activated using the phone number included in booklet with device. I was charged $70 streaming fee for 5 years. Today when I was setting up my roku account I discovered it could not be linked without changing my account info and resetting to factory settings. I was told Roku does not charge. Fee. I’m now concerned that a scamming company was able to send info in a product I bought through Amazon.

This streaming stick + is fantastic.  I purchased one because we needed Roku in order to stream an international channel that is only available with Roku (or screen mirroring to an Apple TV which is a bit more complicated).  Setup was very easy, and everything worked perfectly right out of the box.We only needed the international channel on one TV, but we are cord cutting at the same time.  What I found was that the stream through this Roku was vastly superior to the stream through our TVs app alone, so I ordered a second one.  We use an Apple TV in one room, I find the stream quality to be similar but of course this stick is about 1/3 the cost of the Apple TV.  Very impressed with this Roku device!

When my Roku is working it's a beauty. Unfortunately that's less than half the time. More than half the time I turn it on and nothing happens becaue the remot got disconnected from the stick. So I start the process of pushing a little button on the stick on the back of the TV, followed by pushing another button on the remote. Even then, it's hit and miss and may not pair and work. Today, the remote lost connection to the stick while we were watching a program making it impossible to pause without restarting the stick and going through the pairing process.

This product SUCKS, I have two of them. First, they eat batteries all the time, they need to be replaced every 3 or 4 weeks. Tell me what other remote control does that, that's right none do.Now it is glitching all the time. Sometimes it will connect and sometimes it won't. It has a mind of its own.I don't know how this company is in business when they can not make a streaming device that works.

The product arrived with a remote for the Amazon Fire Stick, as was discovered when trying to "pair the remote with the Roku. Apparently tis was a return that was sold as a new item.Thanks so much, Amazon! /sarc

This is the 2nd 2020 Streaming Stick + I have had to return for an intermittent high pitch squeal. I've tried multiple hdmi inputs on my 4k Samsung with no change. The first stick squealed from the beginning. The 2nd was perfect for 2 weeks, then began to have the same issue. I have no idea what the deal is.  Not only that, both of these sticks - only when used with Prime Video - displayed audio lag. I have searched the web high and low trying to solve these issues. I finally just gave up.

Get this, we just love it. Not sure how we lived without it...okay j/k but.....Roku expanded our options to the point we don’t miss satellite tv. I have Amazon Prime and that took things even farther. I can binge watch Masterpiece Theater and my husband has ESPN and all the PPV channels so he can watch recent unnecessarily violent movies again. It’s a win-win.

I like the voice command but was disappointed the mute button was eliminated. I've had to replace the batteries every few days which is annoying. My previous Roku was a much better unit. I should have returned this one as I believe it is defective but it is too late.

This is a great solution to multiple remotes for streamers who use Roku (best app organizer in the world,). However it badly needs a MUTE button.  Hope their next one includes a mute function.  The other observation is that there’s a considerable lag from when it’s turned on to get to the “home” screen, sometimes it’s unresponsive and I have to go to the back of the tv (where the ‘stick’) is located and press home on the remote to get it to respond.  I have 2 of these, and they’re both the same way.  So kinda buggy, but I’m sure they’ll improve.  Otherwise works wonderfully to control sound and apps.

The stick works.  It performs as promised, but it will not work until you provide your credit card number first.  After you do that, the upsell requests begin for you to add premium channels...free trials, etc.  Roku asks for demographic information that has nothing to do with the function of the device.  I have no problem with the function of the Roku stick, but its backdoor marketing efforts left me wanting to take it out of the tv and send it back.

It's on a vizio tv, it gets really hot but there is nothing around it blocking air flow. i've even since put a fan pointed at it but it still gets hot and gets stuck in the screensaver every day.  i use this one in my office and every morning i turn my tv on, have to press the reset button on the roku, wait for it to boot, then i can watch whatever i want.  also despite having an enterprise class wireless system in the house it refuses to roam access points even if it's connected to the WAP on the far side of the house (there is one 5 feet away).  the wired roku premiere + with ethernet works way better

So far so good other than it arrived with dead batteries for the remote.  At least it works (unlike the fire stick which was a waste of money from day 1!). Changing review to 2 stars.  Remote works for maybe 2 weeks if I’m lucky then I need to replace the batteries.  I’ve owned it now for 5 months and remote it totally corroded and unusable.  I’ve been using expensive batteries and it’s not acceptable.

A good device...when it works. I have had this device less than 6 months and the remote has died.  I have done all of the troubleshooting on go.roku.com/remotehelp and it is still not working. So now I need to spend another $20 and some change for a new remote. Oh wait, I can’t. It’s backordered because apparently all Roku remotes are terrible. If you are considering Roku, I would suggest looking elsewhere. This is just a terrible product.

Recently bought two to replace a Roku HD and a Roku 2.Installation was a piece of cake... I didn't even open the quick reference, just followed the instructions as they came on the screen.I love the increased range of this version. Same with the ability to turn on and off the TV and control the volume. Voice control is a bit flaky, not understanding what I was saying. I hope this has adaptive learning to better understand my Kansas accent.I like that it goes right to the start, rather than continuing the same long intro over and over. I've been doing that anyway, but manually (the Roku 2 did the same, but not the XD.Remote is great but I do miss the skip forward, guess there was not enough real estate to have it.Reliability has been perfect. I've read a couple of reviews that said they had hardware problems, but I think is is just specific devices and all of them. Sed it back and get a new one.All in all it's as good as any electronic device I've had in the last few years.

This is my 6th ROKU purchase.  I'm sure that everyone has a preference when it come to choosing a streaming device.  I've now purchased a ROKU for college kids (now grown and flown), senior parents (90+) and again for kids moving into their "new" apartments as a gift.  I've updated mine in order to receive the disney+ channel, etc.  honestly, couldn't be easier, just plug in and use.  Easy to follow prompts to set up. And it great to travel with.

Roku remote drain battery very fast, it only last 2 weeks, I have to replace a new set of battery. I searched the web and found a lot of users to complain the same problems. I contact the Roku support team but no solution.

The best part for the tech challenged this is a no brainer.  I did it all by myself and didn't even cry.  It is a really easy to install and use device.  Works as intended with no calls to my son.  Yeah
Ease of attachment instructions are ok for someone who is not technology savvy. Great gadget for the price good program selection. Good user interface and the more you practice the better you get.

The name "Fire Stick Lite" had me thinking I was going to have less available apps or something. The only actual defecit with the Lite is no power or volume control. Beyond that it's an excellent product. Surpassed expectation.

The fire stick light was more than I hoped for.It was easy to set up-Alexa did most of the workI just switch to fire tell Alexa what I want and it happens.I am very happy with this and have already recommended it to others
Liked it to be able to get more and be able to use Disney+that xfinity doesn’t support yet and we started paying for it in December 2020.Used a splitter and it works great for our older smart tv

This is so much easier to use and love that you can tell Alexa to open Netflix from the remote. I saw this deal and had to jump on it. I have all Roku's in my house so I wanted to try the Firestick and I love it!

I have the regular fire stick previously.  My dog chewed up the remote and a replacement remote cost the same as a whole new fire stick.  Luckily I found this Fire stick lite for half the price of a regular fire stick (I bought it during a special sale). It works just as good.  The only difference I've noticed is that you can't control your TV with the remote.  For me though thats not a big deal.  I would recommend it if you're on a budget.

We love our fire TV devices. One issue that has happened with every single one, though? The remote doesn’t work! I have two current devices that the remote won’t work for. I have to use the app on my smart phone (which doesn’t always work either). So I decided to order a new one for my living room so it would have a remote. Well I got it in and hooked it up, after ONE DAY the remote is already not working again. I don’t understand why they never work, but that’s where we are.

unit has to be rebooted at least once a day to regain audio. I know the volume control is off your tv remote, plus power on and off is on your TV remote. My other fire stick gives no problems. Sorry I purchased the cheaper one

I bought this model for my daughters room. I have other versions in my home as well, this one is by far my least favorite. I feel like it freezes often and does not function as smoothly as other models I have.

For some reason the stick is glitchy. It lags to turn on some times. It sometimes doesn’t turn on. I have an older stick and it works better than this newer version. It came formatted in Spanish, which was difficult to reconfigure back to English. I’m sure we got a refurbed crappy one.
It never works. Only one or two apps will work and nothing else. Don’t bother with CBS All Access, or BeachBody, or HBONow, or a multitude of others because you’ll wait endlessly for them to load.

Told Alexa: YouTube Billy Blanks Tae-bo workout. Alexa took me to Amazon music instead. I repeated take me to YouTube  Billy Blanks Yea-bo workout. Finally took me to YouTube but not Billy Blanks Tae-bo workout but to music section. Sometimes Alexa responds correctly but it’s like 60/40 ratio and it’s annoying. The Firestick as a whole is awesome except when I go on Hulu as it plays 15-Sec of a movie and then surges and starts over never getting passed the 15-seconds on the movie. Not sure why. Alexa is 60/40 accurate, the rest works great.

It doesn't have a volume button, a mute button channel up/down or power button which are all  super helpful to have.  So being the lite version takes away a lot of features my other fire stick has which I use daily.
I received this item as a gift from my son. I've been coupe up almost all year stuck in a wheelchair. I got bored watching reruns on cable and the firestick gave me more options to entertain myself.
Works great. I was using Chromecast. I'm so glad I switched over to the Fire Stick. It so much better to have easy access to apps and remote control access. The voice controls are an added binus.
I am very happy with the amazon Fire Stick. I had an older version but upgraded to this. It works great on my Samsung TV. I am thinking about ordering two more for the rest of out televisions....

Nice upgrades to the 2020 version of this Firestick.  Easily to set up and it has the Apps I used the most including the new Discovery plus.  It has greatly improved my older TV that does not offer the Apps.

This is the first streaming device I bought. I purchased it based on a friend's recommendation.  Although I need to watch many YouTube videos to learn to install APP on my fire stick.  It works great.

I like the fire stick lite, I wanted the fire stick for my basement TV. I have a universal remote for the other devices so I didn’t need it to control the TV. There is a new stet up with this one which I enjoy. You log into your user account and it allows you to keep track of your viewing history. You can have 6 users on the account.
Fairly easy to set up. Wish it was a QWERTY keyboard when trying to put in passwords, but I’m just used to that. Easily finds stuff.  Only tried Alexa a few times, because I don’t really need/use it.

I have owned a fire stick for two years and have no issues. However the new one with voice recognition works for several minutes than cuts out and restarts on it’s own. This cause me to have to have to find what I was streaming and start all over from the beginning and than fast forward to the point it stopped working. I am in the process of returning it to QVC. Hopefully they will simply replace it. However I will not be able to stream until if and when a replacement arrives.
Roku is more user friendly.Does not support Spectrum TV App.  Roku Does.
I had an older smart tv that wouldn't download new apps, so this was exactly what I wanted.  It let me get Netflix, Amazon Prime movies, and all the other apps I wanted on my TV.  Perfect price too.

Mine is defective I’ve tried talking to many representatives but they all ghost and leave the chat without helping me certain apps don’t work at all and the ones that do work doesn’t let me watch everything certain shows load not all. I want a refund but the only option i get is to talk to someone and they wanna fix the device and ignore my requests. Please give me a new device that’s works or give me my money back if u give an option to refund follow through and not force us to have to interact with customer service.

Within minutes, we had the fire stick plugged into the TV and had Netflix within a few minutes.  For non-techy people, this product is perfect because it is so easy to install and use.  Highly recommend this product.

Works fine, easy to ad apps to tv. I do not have a smart tv so I needed a streaming platform. Haven’t used/tried the voice recognition yet. I would recommend for older un-smart flat screens. Streaming quality is good. No problems here.

Have various other firesticks, regular and 4K. This works just as well as them (of course without volume control which is no big deal).  Bought two, because the price was right. Expect to take one or both on vacation to plug into those TVs
I don't like to use voice recognition features ~ Alexa, Google Assistant . . . so, I cannot answer any questions about those features.  The Fire Stick works, I can open my apps and watch what I want.

Easy to use and set up. Remember you have to use the television's original remote for on/off and volume. It has one button that does nothing.  Disappointed they dropped prices just after I purchased it.
Not happy with this at all. So ya enter your credit card information and away it goes. With all your  money too. Had credit card fraud after entering my information onto my account. Never again!!!

i liked this so much i immediately returned the cable box to the cable company. i have free cable but the box had the tv guide and some additional channels. i used the box rental fee to subscribe to hulu . i did get the roku+ because of the better wifi connection. i live in an apartment and sometimes the wifi can be weak. the roku took about 3 minutes to install and 20 minutes to remember my netflix password. picture is excellent and the sound was even better than the cable tv. i had the very first roku on my old giant tube tv in the past. when i replaced that tv i should have got a new roku right away.

We have had this for about 6 months now. We have had other roku devices last years. Well, here we are 6 months and either the device or the remote just isn't working anymore. It stops working in the middle of watching something. I've reset the remote multiple times and it will work for about 5 minutes and then nothing.  I think its the device because its doing the same on the Roku app on the phone.  Disappointed.

Device works well while running 1080 video streaming. As soon as you run 4K video for over 30 minutes, you will get a message about device overheating. There is a link on the message on how to obtain a HDMI extender. Roku promptly sent me this extender but the issue was not resolved. I like Roku products but this is a flaw on the streaming stick. It's going back, sorry Roku.

The Batteries last 3-4 days in the remote. Have used new batteries and tried different brands but the result is the same...the remote stops working after 3-4 days. Insert new batteries and it works just fine only to stop working a few days later....frustrating.

ROKU HOOKED UP REAL EASY.....I PLUGGED THE STICK IN MY HDMI SLOT....ATTACHED POWER CORD TO IT.....WENT THROUGH THE PROMPTS ON THE SCREEN......ESTABLISHED AN ACCOUNT ONLINE AND I WAS IN...........TOOK ALL ABOUT 20 MIN........THEY HAVE FREE CHANNELS, I LIKE YOU TUBE, YOU HAVE A SEARCH BUTTON OR VOICE SEARCH TO USE. THE ONES THAT COST THEY TELL YOU UP FRONT, NICE TO KNOW. I LOVE THE WIRELESS SO I DIDNT HAVE TO RUN A INTERNET CABLE CLEAR FROM MY BEDROOM TO MY LIVING ROOM......IT WORKS VERY WELL, VERY HAPPY WITH IT.....HIGHLY RECOMMEND WIRELESS OVER INTERNET CABLE VERSION...

It’s was nice and all being able to turn the tv on/off with it. The ease of clicking through the menus was very easy. My main concern is that is uses up batteries in about 2-3 weeks. I tried several different brands and eventually went to rechargeable a that were always charging in the room with it. I eventually pulled out my appletv and resumed using it. I just wish apple always had a way to turn your tv on/off, change volume, input and use the full tv menu features.

Finally upgraded to Streaming Stick+, went through the set-up process and then when I got to the last step, which is to wait for an activation link via email, however, it never came.  Tried several times and each time--no email with link. Chatted with Roku support, however, they could not solve the issue.  Returned the stick and am now considering another model.

I really enjoy this electronic in my life! I decided to spend a little more because long story short, I feel free internet at the moment through the school I work for and the box is way far away. Like one floor up and four rooms away. Through cinder blocks away.I love it! I bought Netflix to use it, but honestly I don’t even use Netflix that often, I use the free apps and channels or whatever they are called and watch free tv most of the time.Totally worth it and has been a life saver it. I had antenna and using amazon prime tv for a year before this. Now I use just my prime for buying (although I could access it on here) and my antenna is on my floor.

I can only give this product 2 starts for the following reasons. I plugged this into my new LG C8 4K TV. While setup was pretty easy I began to notice the following problems over the next month. I am going to be returning this product soon.1. Roku boots up (goes through bouncing Roku screen) and then gets stuck at black screen. I never get the Roku home screen. This becomes more problematic if you turn on the TV and play Xbox. Switching back to HDMI with Roku never gets off black screen.2. Roku home screen hangs frequently. When the Roku reaches the home screen, often the Roku becomes unresponsive. I see that the Roku stick light flashes when I click on remote but the home screen is stuck.3. Left 1/3 side of the screen is lighter than middle or right. I got an OLED TV specifically for the "true black" and unfortunately the Roku apps (Netflix, Xfinity, etc.) all have a light ghosting on left 1/3 of screen. I tried plugging it into different HDMI ports but found the same issue. Watching Netflix on the Xbox works just fine with no ghosting.So the Roku stick is most useful for moving between TVs in my home if kids are playing Xbox and I want to watch TV. It has some neat features but just doesn't work well enough to justify keeping it.

I am Adding to my review because I tried everything and this thing doesn’t work. I should’ve have to triage issues, you guys should just fix the problem by refunding the cost to my account so I can buy a device that will work.This doesn’t even work. Any time I start a show wether on Hulu, Netflix or whatever, it plays to the first commercial, plays the commercial and then starts over again. That happens on every channel. This thing is garbage and I’m very disappointed in this product!

Used for the living room. Since we don’t have Cable anymore we thought this would add a few more apps to watch for free and best of all bought it during Cyber Monday and spent less. More bang for my buck.

The fire stick lite is ok it does what its supposed to but sometimes in other words, at least once a week loses its sound and i have to unplug and plug back in and the YouTube stops out of nowhere which sucks because it happens often and i have to restart idk if its because its the cheaper version but i recommend get a higher price to save you the trouble of all of this because it’s infuriating to be honest overall its a good product
I love my Fire Stick and what it allowed me to do with my older TV. I subscribe to several streaming services and the Fire Stick allows me to be able to see my programs on my older not smart TV’s.

Once I got through some confusion with my account. Wrong phone # put on my info after my new echo was reported stolen. I spent hours on the phone trying to straighten it out. Everyone I spoke with was very nice and all my new items, 2 firesticks and 4th gen echo are now working. However, my 2nd gen echo, which I've had for a few years, is offline and will not set up. Just don't have the patience to get back on the phone to figure it out, yet. I do love my new set up and way less $ than cable.

La versión LITE aunque a primera vista parece un dispositivo muy básico y limitado, realmente es un gadget potente con una agradable interfaz de usuario, y muy intuitivo. Tal vez el apartado de configuración es un poco tedioso por la necesidad de registrarlo en una cuenta de amazon prime video, pero por lo demás, es muy fácil de manejar, y la calidad de audio y video es superior a la de muchos set top box android que existen actualmente.Viene con los implementos justos y necesarios para su funcionamiento y es sencillo de ensamblar.
No more cable/satellite boxes for me! 1 and done.Streaming bliss. Alexa rocks...spooky good.Only issue is, internet providers are charging more now the cable t.v. is dead.
Better than roku. I replaced all 5 roku with these. Much faster and no more waiting for the stream to catch up or voices to match sound bar. When you push a remote button it responds immediately
Okay I am not a techie person. I am having trouble finding what channel I am looking for. I don’t have paid TV. This Fire Stick is wonderful. I can watch more channels now. No antenna. This is great.

I liked it so much that I decided to get the control with the volume control, mute and the on/off.  I am extremely pleased with the units.  I am in a old folks home and with the COVID 19 causing us to be confined to our rooms, this device has been a real God send to me.It is more than I expected and the ease of hooking up is just a joy.

Just got this Roku streaming stick with voice control. Was disappointed that the voice control does not work within apps. It’s useless to me. Also I set the remote up and it works to control the sound and turn TV on but will not turn the TV off. Go figure.  It would be nice if it had lighted keys so you can see it in the dark.In my opinion, there are too many steps to take to watch a program within an app. Why can’t you click on the show and it immediately comes on instead of having to click again on “Watch”. It loads slow.

We're big fans of Roku (and have like 3 in the house), but the streaming stick has been our least favorite product from them yet. I selected the streaming stick specifically because the remote is supposed to be MORE responsive, and the results were the opposite. The remote loses connection frequently - literally every night now - and seemingly at random, forcing us to resort to clunky phone apps to control our TV. And some of these phone apps even have ads. My wife had to watch a 30 second commercial last night just to hit pause on the 'Ted Bundy Tapes.' Why is this a thing?That said, the streaming quality is great, the picture comes in in 4K, and everything else is as advertised. It's much smaller than your typical Roku which is a nice space-saver too. But that remote is a useless piece of garbage that broke immediately and now only works inconsistently.

Bought this to finally replace my PS3 as our bedroom media center since it stopped supporting stuff like MLB.tv. Working really well so far. Some of the apps(like the aforementioned mlb.tv) are kinda barebones, but others like Plex are very well designed. No issues with streaming. Really digging the remote as well. Being able to use as to control my tv works great so I only have one remote to use and the volume rocker on the side is a nice touch.My one complaint so far is that I wish the remote buttons were either backlit or glow in the dark, since you can't see a thing if the lights are off. Oh and the stick is a wee bit bulky compared to something like a chromecast, but it fits for my tv.

I bought this because I eliminated cable but kept their internet service in order to use the Roku device. I didn't know that if you don't have cable TV most of the content from many channels on Roku won't be available and you have to pay for whatever material you don't have access to. So cable always finds a way to pull a fast one on you. Other than that I'm overall satisfied with the tons of free material Roku has to offer. Setup was a breeze and the HD is so crisp and runs so smooth that you forget you're even streaming.

How is it that they haven't fixed the remote battery drain issue yet? Should have believed the forums that there is no fix other than getting a new remote. Also why does it drop connection when switching to an advert while streaming on the Roku channel? Though this doesn't disrupt the show or movie it is annoying. Also weird that streaming through Roku app on an ancient outdated Android tablet is better than the latest stick?????? So after reading multiple forums and trying checks, resets, uninstalls etc no change so bye bye. Anyhow easy return with Amazon thankfully and back to the other streaming stick brand that works.

Easy way to hook up a TV when wanting to get away from a cable box. Recognizes cable companies without requiring a box. Perfect for a seldom used TV by eliminating a cable box charge. I use them on two downstairs TVs which I only use a few times per month. About $40 each and I eliminated a $12 per month cable box charge for each TV — so about a 3.5 month payback. Not bad. Of course, as soon as we sent the cable boxes back to the cable company for credit, our monthly cable charge immediately went up by about the same amount. Good grief!

Has upscaled my tv - this is my 5th roku- Best yet!  ***I am updating my review and changing the star rating as this has only worked for 8 months, at which point the picture was distorted. Tried the stick in a different port and it was just the same, it was also very hot. I checked on the warranty which it says is 12 months, but you have to go through their customer service , and the only way I could do that was to register an account with them and give all personal details and have a payment method on file to proceed - I wasn't comfortable doing that. I bought off Amazon so I will talk to them next.

I was very hesitant to buy The Roku Tv Sticks.  Mostly because I am NO high techie.  Not even close .  So I watched a couple of How to videos on You Tube re: Roku Ultra and Roku Stick.  I have 2 TVs in my home.  I have to say that I am quite pleased with myself as I was able to easily set up and connect both of my TV Devices ( ROku) with ease.  I mean it when I say with EASE.  All you have to do is plug them in to TV and Power and follow the simple instructions on the TV Screen.  I am ready to ditch my cable TV and save a bunch of money.  I only have to pay for my High Speed Internet.  I feel so free :-)

I bought two Roku’s and two Amazon Sticks. I really like the way the Roku is set up (Menu, volume control and power on/off right on the Roku, etc), but they don’t last long at all. They last about three months...that’s it! The Amazon Sticks last a lot longer.  I hope Amazon comes out with the volume and power button on their remote. They would be totally superior to Roku at that point!  Roku...what a disappointment. 😕

First...I had to order an extension for the stick.  When it finally arrived and everything was set up, the remote wouldn’t pair. Doesn’t seem to be working. So now I either order a new remote or send everything back. I’m really frustrated!

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Plugged it right into the projector and it did the rest. Loved it.
I like that this is a separate device from my TV, it works great, unlike an older fire tv box that I still use on another tv. Easy setup and use, recommend to anyone thinking about a purchase.

We have an LG tv. Great tv. With lots of downloadable apps. However, the tv wasn’t running Disney + well. And other apps started getting sluggish. I thought it was the ISP. But other people recommended the Roku stick.Ordered one. Followed the easy to follow install instructions. Everything is working great. Not glitching or video/audio sync issues that we were having before. The roku made it easy to load all our fav apps, and the stream quality is fantastic. We don’t have to use a bunch of remotes because the roku does it all.Extremely happy with my purchase.
We have decided not to use Alexa.  We enjoy Amazon Prime Video and Netflix.  We previously had Direct TV.
I did away with cable, saved $100.00+/month and stream Netflix with Showtime included, Hulu with Starz included, Prime Video, Discovery plus and vs $100.00+ for cable, I now pay <$30.00/month.

I should have just spent the additional dollars and bought the regular fire TV not this scaled down version. Not worth it. Way too slow especially if you like to play a poker app such as Poker Championship.
This model did not control TV or have Alexa access...I traded it for 4k

This is exactly what I needed to be able to stream beachbody on my TV without having to go out an buy a new smart TV!!! So impressed. I can watch movie and stream other shows that I can't get with my current cable!
i had the first edition fire stick which doesnt get the UI update. this one has it and its a 5 times better experience.my old one was slow even after a wipe, this one is spunky and quick.
Got this to plug into a projector to get streaming apps and it works great. Set up was simple tho it was annoying having to update the software on the fire stick... other than that, no issues.

Love the many channels I have access to now. My only complaint is that it looks for cable channels to add some of the channels to a different tv. I'm trying to cut cable, so I was hoping it would give me those channels without keeping cable service. If anyone knows a solution, I'd love to hear it!

I didn't get it for Alexia I got it bc we have a big screen that isnt a smart tv.  It is so amazing to have all our viewing apps available.Prior to this we were only able to watch Funamation on a phone.

I like the FireTV Stick Lite. I had an older model and wanted to upgrade, while it was on sale for Black Friday.  Immediately, it appeared to be a bit faster than the one I had for a couple of years. Other than that, I haven't noticed anything that was much more different.

I only purchased this device because I wanted access to HBO Max.  It is such a downgrade from Roku.  Luckily a week or so later, Roku and HBO Max reached a deal and I haven't had to use this device since.

Works fine...until it doesn't.  Works fine one day, then next time you use it, it shows a blues screen and says  "no signal" (yes, wifi was working fine)  You have to unplug it and plug it back in, then it will work again.  What a pain in the a**.  Not happy!
I’m actually pretty pleased with this product. This is my first experience with Firestick. I tried Roku and I was very disappointed. I’d like to see a Firestick remote control with a number pad.
My “smart TV” is no longer smart. Can’t update to the latest Hulu or download Disney+ and this firestick has these apps. I’m able to watch these streaming services without buying a whole new TV.

Being stuck in quarantine in a hotel for 2 weeks, this has been a godsend! I’ve watched so many movies and shows. Only drawback I’ve found is there isn’t a Frontier or Peacock app available yet, which I really want.

I like not being held a slave to cable TV anymore!  Nothing but propaganda on most channels, anyway.  However, before watching anything on firestick I always have to unplug it from power source for about 15 seconds and then plug back in.  Otherwise, no sound.

The Fire TV Stick Lite is inconvenient!! HATE IT!!No on/off button. To turn on or turn off tv you have to pick up remote, hold "microphone" button, and tell Alexa what you want. Any verbal commands require holding the the "microphone" button. But 'microphone" button does not work for audio. You must use your tv's remote to control volume and mute.Totally my mistake for not reading the package. Threw the "Lite" stick away and bought the Fire TV Stick with the necessary buttons.
it serves its purpose. Just a little disappointed this remote doesn’t come with on/off button AND volume. But that was my fault for ordering the wrong fire stick. Overall it’s a good purchase

I bought this to use on a tiny tv in our office which is hung on the wall. There was no place to put a traditional Roku box. The stick goes into HDMI port and a small cable runs to the USB to give it power. Apparently my tv couldn’t handle this and a message came up that I needed to use the included plug and plug it into the wall. The roku works perfect, but I took a star off for needing to also plug this into an outlet when it’s made to not have to.

I love the fact that this thing exists. We’ve been getting literally robbed for decades now by cable and satellite TV providers, and this little sucker finally gives us the freedom to tell them to f@ off once and for all!Simple to set up and use. The remote works good, and it’s literally the size of a thumb drive. No more need for bulky receivers, and messy cables cluttering up the area around your TV. If you don’t already know, you’ll need a wireless internet connection for this.

So very upset!My entire family are Roku  users. So the main tv roku was several years old and finally was not working well at all.So bought  this one an was hard to do to begin with, I have my little granddaughter and a disabled husband  and live off my paycheck alone and its not enough to even cover bills.So after I bought this we were so happy to have again.We can't afford cable so this is the only entertainment. And 2weeks later it just quits completely. I took and tried on different TV at work, no luck it does not even turn on.I have no funds to package and return.So now we have no TV to watch and are using our cell phones  to watch movies and cartoons for little ones. Don't buy the stick  Stick with the good old cheap Roku much better and will last you many years.

Initially worked great, but after 45 days my Roku is now dropping connectivity every 15 minutes. Gives message that there's no internet connection but signal is strong on all other devices and speed test is fast. I've performed factory reset but still not working. 30 day return window is up. Should have purchased warranty. Would not recommend this product.

I just wanted to say, though conceptually this is a great product, I’m absolutely mortified that the usb male to female that goes into the main power plug is a 4ft.This did not give me ample room to actually plug it in, so I had to order one that’s actually long enough right out the box.Simply could have added a single 6 footer standard to mitigate this.Flawed from the start. For the price point this is a huge oversight.

Set up took maybe 15 minutes by creating an account and finding the TV, it streamed nextflix and YouTube perfectly. I still need to use TV remote to turn on and volume. For some reason my Rocky remote wont work with volume and on or off, It stated it couldn’t find my tv and I went through all 53 possibilities. But my LG that’s 3 years old doesn’t seem to have a connection with it. Overall though it streams great!

I really like the idea of this and it seems to work great.  BUT,  it overheats at least once every couple days.  I have to remove the stick from the tv and let it cool down.  When I remove it,  it is extremely hot!  This seems like a huge fire hazard and an issue waiting to happen.  I've done some research on this issue and there are no real solutions offered. You'd think that Roku would be interested in ensuring this issue is resolved quickly as possible as to avoid any possible lawsuits in the future.

Ordered this July 2019, its now June 2020.The remote control stopped working about a week ago now, (this has happened multiple times, but resetting the roku stick it'll work again.. but not this time) I've tried all the at home (restarting) by unplugging everything. Changing the batteries & even resetting the actual roku stick.Nothing has worked, my remote will not pair to the roku, the app for my phone won't connect either & tech support is not taking calls!... seriously? Should have just stuck with the fire stick

I've had various Roku models over the past several years.  I bought a new TV recently and wanted the most advanced.  The streaming is flawless and picture is great.  I haven't tried the voice control  - the buttons are easy to use and all I need.  I have a friend who has an Apple TV streaming device.  After he tried my Roku stick he bought one and replaced his Apple which he found too tricky to use.  Price is well worth it.  Only way to go.

I have an older Samsung "Smart" TV that was constantly disconnecting itself from the internet even when wired directly via a LAN/Ethernet cable.  No more with this and I think there is more variety/options with the Fire Stick.

It eats batteries. I have to change batteries in the remote every 2 weeks. It’s ridiculous and super expensive.  I called customer service and they said they are aware of the problem but can’t do anything to fix it. They suggested buying rechargeable batteries. What a pain and expense. Update. Amazon said they were mailing me a new remote. Instead I received a refurbished Firestick. I didn’t even need the Firestick and now they won’t send me a remote unless I pay $100 for it. What a crock.
Constantly have to unplug it because there is no sound. Other than that (which  is a big deal) it works fine. Maybe there will be an update to fix this in the future

Who makes a remote without a volume button??? I guess I should have done a little research, but I never would have imagined a remote with no volume button! Would not recommend, buy the regular version that lets you control your volume!!!

Love having such a special feature to watch.  My husband and I are not a techie couple, thankfully my daughter set this up and got it going. Love the voice feature, so I can ask for what I want, if I can't find it.
The specs on this Tv Fire Stick states it has 8gb of internal storage when infact it only has 5, this is my reason for the low rating.

I bought it to stream TV from a Tablo DVR to other TVs in the house. The Firestick Lite works perfectly and is the most economical device to do this.With a firestick on each TV, a single Tablo DVR can send live and recorded television programs throughout your entire house.

I purchased this to replace an older Fire stick that wouldn't update and many apps wouldn't load, or it would have problems connecting altogether. What an upgrade! Love the new layout of the home screen, too. Works great with Alexa.

Everything works as it should I got this for my kids tv because he doesn’t have a smart tv and it was worth every penny. He can now stream Disney+ Netflix STARZ and Hulu and he even got a bunch of free channels for kids too. He can even play games on there with his tv remote. Best quarantine present ever!

Was purchased for me as a birthday gift. Installation and set up pretty straightforward but does require some back-and-forth with codes and security measures so pay attention. Also, in a previous review someone left I read you couldn’t get HBOMax with the Amazon firestick but that is not true. I was able to get it among other platforms like Netflix without any problem.Takes some “tribal” knowledge to figure out all the features. Helps if you know someone who already has it.

We bought this due to buying a new tv. an LG Smart TV with WebOS. We went from an element Roku TV in our living room to the LG. We don't even use the 'smart' features on the LG anymore due to getting this stick. Roku is far superior to any other OS on a TV so far. It has every app we want or need, plus a lot more, and the picture quality is always crisp and clear. It's so ridiculously easy to set up for first use as well.

The stick is too ling to fit in the HDMI port on my TV. The ports are on bottom of TV and would normally have enough room but the stand attached to TV (when not wall mounted) gets in the way. Ended up having to give this one to my teenager and using his older box version. 😣

This was an upgrade for my mother and it works great. We don’t use Alexa integration or voice recognition so I can’t review that aspect, but the stream quality is great and the volume controls on the remote work. The setup is easy and you can either plug it into the wall, or you can plug it into the usb on the tv to eliminate the extra power cable.

Love this product! I have had multiple fire stick tv models previous to switching over to Roku and Roku absolutely wins every time.Interface is nice and fast which is what I expect from a streaming device.The only complaint I have is that, unfortunately, Roku does not support Twitch Live Streaming like Firestick does but other than that, Roku FTW!

This works as expected and is easy enough to use. Neither harder or easier than a Samsung smart TV interface.One star deducted because during the mandatory registration it tries to obligate entry of a credit card, though I have no intention of buying something through the unit. I managed to get around it, but it was a pain in the behind and is clearly unnecessary.

I am using Playstation Vue as my service. The Roku Streaming Stick + will not fast forward through a recorded program while allowing you to watch the progress. You also cannot watch a show from the beginning while it is being recorded. Maybe it’s an issue with the PlayStation app but it would have been nice to know this prior to my purchase. I checked with PlayStation and there tests netted the same issue on there Roku devices. This is unfortunate because without the ability to monitor the FF progress, you are unable to know when to stop. I can’t believe that I am the first person to notice this issue. I will be returning this devise and replacing it with another Amazon Firestick which works perfectly with PS Vue. One wish is that the Firestick remote provide a TV power and volume feature like the Roku device.

I like the on TV screen installation instructions for Roku Streaming Stick +.  Instructions were easy to follow.  Apps were also easy to download and install.  Very responsive remote.  I have had no problems with Roku and I put this on an extra TV we have in our basement.  On main TV came with Roku so I was already familiar with Roku. Our internet download speed is between 350 and 400 Mbps which is helpful for installing Roku and various apps.

Totally worth it!  Purchased this to go in my guest bedroom where we don't have the television hooked up to our cable box.  I was laid up after hip preservation surgery for several weeks and stayed in that room.  Love the variety of tv stations, streams our Comcast cable channels beautifully, very easy to set up, and so easy to use.  If I can figure it out; anyone can.

I love my Roku devices. This is the 3rd one that I have owned and they are great and easy to use.  There is a top comment that says that you can only own 2 before you have to pay to register a 3rd device.  I am not sure at all what they are talking about.  This is not true for me at least.  My only thought is that they want to use an app that only allows 2 streams at one time.

This doesn't support casting and also does not have a functional web browser app. Also can't side load apps. Completely useless when compared to similar products like Amazon Fire Stick or Chromecast. Cannot recommend to anyone who uses anything aside from the basic mainstream streaming apps like Netflix -- even then, no reason to buy this over any other similar product as it also seems considerably slower to run those apps which it does have.

I've bought a few Rokus and this one is my favorite. It does require a power source (USB or USB to dongle to standard outlet). The power button and volume buttons worked on a few different TVs (Samsung, LG, Vizio, and Panasonic) that I have installed this on. The remote is of high quality. The only thing I don't like is that the remote does work off of 2.4ghz and can interfere with your house/work WiFi signal. I would definitely buy this again!

We have two other Roku's in other televisions which are working fine.  Since I just cut the cord from ATT, I wasn't sure the standard Roku would do well through our 2nd floor to a bedroom.  This device which has the 4x attenae for wifi built in works well and I am pleased with the signal I'm getting.  Everything started as it is advertised and I connected it to my current Roku account.  Plus I will give a plug for Youtubetv which we pay $40 a month and get many essential channels I want.  I love it since it runs seemlessly since Google/Youtube know what they are doing.

I had an old tv that had a cable box hooked up to it for me to watch tv, but this Roku changed it into a smart tv.  I was able to get rid of my second xfinity box because of the xfinity app Roku has.  The nice thing is I am able to watch all netflix and all my streaming apps on my old tv now.  I was very close to getting rid of my old tv because it sucks when you can't get all your streaming apps on the tv.

Great way to cut the cord.  After researching the available options, I chose Roku because it supported YouTube TV which appears to be the best value for streaming services.  It offers only the channels I want at a great price.  Roku takes care of all the other channels/services I need.  I have both a stick and the player.  The player is on my large 4K TV and the quality of the image is great.  The headphone jack in the remote is handy when wanting to watch the TV after my wife goes to bed.  The only improvements I would like to see is the voice control in the remote controlling all the services - now it only controls the ROKU based apps and for some strange reason there is no MUTE button on the remote.

Roku was my first streaming device and to this day still my favorite. I had the original, then version 3 (could use headphones on the remote) and now this one. The previous two were replaced just because I wanted to, not needing to.I bought 3 of these and they replaced: Roku 3; Amazon Fire Stick; & Amazon Firebox. Why? Quite frankly I prefer the Roku over the Amazon streaming devices. I think they work better, easier to navigate which is vital when you are engaged to someone not so tech savvy.I would have liked them supply a cable/dongle. This device isn't exactly small, and by design of the TV I had to obtain a dongle. My only complaint if you even want to call it that.

It’s a good product, but it’s awfully wobbly in the “hole“. Doesn’t like to stay in that slot in the back of the TV. And I have never, and I mean never, had a remote drain batteries like it does. Not even a month these batteries are brand new and I’ve already had to replace them. And I haven’t even used it very much. That’s a pain in the assassins.

I have been using this 'Roku Streaming Stick+ ' for over a year now. I recently changed smart TVs and expected a long painful setup after switching TVs. I did a little reading at the Roku help site and was able to set up the remote to control my new TV with a few button presses. All of my previous streaming settings were retained in the Roku. :)

I purchased this for a larger TV, and a Roku Premiere for a small TV. The Roku Streaming Stick was very easy to set up. I followed the directions step by step and once done, the Roku was streaming with no issues at all. I would recommend this Roku product over the Roku Premiere. I have not integrated my Alexa with the Roku yet, as I wanted to get it working so I can cut the cord on cable.

I've had Chromecast for a couple years and when it came time to upgrade, the reviews for the Chromecast ultra were not exactly lighting my fire. I'd never used Roku before but I liked the fact that it's more "free range” than a fire stick. I equate the fire stick to an iPhone whereas the Roku is an Android. I've now had it for two whole days and the only thing I keep thinking is, "why did I wait so long to try this?" The signal is stronger, the picture is way more clear, and it's much more user friendly. Very happy I switched. I can't wait to actually play around with it to see what it can do.

This remote is fun to use. I spent my first few hours acquainting myself with this remote mostly playing with the voice search. I was a little hesitant of purchasing the voice search due to security yet I do appreciate the easability of getting close to my end result much faster. Considering I don't have anything to hide I purchased this device. Figured it was a baby compared to Alexa.
I was gonna just order a replacement remote but since this was on sale as around the same price as the replacement remote I just decided to order it and give my other Firestick to my mom.

Why didn't I buy one of these before?! I can't drop $500 on a smart tv so this $18 gadget is a steal. Easy to use and install. Might buy a 2nd one for the 2nd tv.Edited: bought a 2nd one. Still awesome!

Lo compré en oferta de lanzamiento, una ganga. Aquí en amazon me salió para calificar control de volumen pero yo no he visto esa opción por eso le doy 1 estrella en ese aspecto. Pero de ahí es un gran reproductor.

Accidentally bought the lite version. Compared to the original fire stick, this one is missing two key features we were looking for: on/off and volume control. This was a late-night purchase and I didn't realize.

Within a week of having the product,  the volume would go out. I would troubleshoot it, and have to unplug it for about five minutes,  then that would stop working.  This is my fourth firestick I've been sent as a replacement,  and im not waiting to see how long it will take to stop working.

I love using my Fire Stick to binge watch tv shows that I can’t get the earlier seasons anywhere else! I also take it traveling with me for hotel rooms so I’m not stuck with their boring tv selections.
We can use our xFinity voice remote to call up Prime Video and Netflix besides regular and premium  channels. I'll give it 5 stars because initially it was fine.  We just didn't need it.

I am quite impressed how well the Fire stick performs and how many apps/channels/ probrams are available! I would have given 5 stars. However, after using the Fire Stick for only a week, the volume went out for all programs. Luckily, in the help section, it was advised to unplug the power to the Fire Stick for 3 minutes to reset. I did and it works just fine! Just concerned this may reoccur again in the future.
It takes over 20 minutes for this device to go to FOX NEWS every time I try. Other channels are not nearly as difficult.Is this purposeful?

I can’t believe I haven’t purchased one of these sooner! I’ve been bouncing back and forth from old chromecast and Apple TV models and neither were very user-friendly compared to this. I highly recommend this.

Bought this to replace another brand streaming stick because it would lose connection several times.  Since installing the Roku, have not once lost the connection.  Very easy to set up.  I especially like that the stick turns the TV on/off and has the volume control (and mute) button on the side.  Don't need to have separate remotes.  Another plus is that the audio is in sync with the video, unlike my previous stick.  Love, love, love the Roku!

This is our first Roku player.  It's about what we expected.  The only part I find annoying is the power cord, for our wall mounted TVs, it's not the easiest to squeeze the player into the USB then run the power to the outlet.  First world problem I suppose.  The interface is fast, it was easy to setup, and there is lots of trivial free stuff to be found.  No signs of being flaky.  Of course, now the kids all want one for their TV.  Maybe for Christmas!  Overall, we like it so far.

Works great. Using 5ghz finally. Love the extended range on the wifi. Haven't had a buffer yet since we got it. I wish Roku allowed programmable buttons. Otherwise, every time we get a new device it just gets faster and faster. Not sure what these other people are talking about calling 800 numbers or getting errors. I register my devices online and have never had a problem or had anyone ask for money.

I thought this was pretty pricey for a streaming stick and small remote, but when I got it and started using it - WOW!  What a difference!  I'd been using the Roku express streaming stick and remote.  I might keep it for travel, but I'm almost tempted to get another Roku Streaming Stick + and giving my express one away.  Very easy setup, streams SO much faster than the standard Roku stick, super responsive, great only needing one remote.  Totally worth the price!  Love it!

These are great devices,  the bad part is the stupid WiFi based remote control.  What were they thinking.  This thing acts as another WiFi broadcasting device on random channels which can cause interference with the rest of your setup.  Yes I know Bluetooth can mess with WiFi as well,  however the signal levels tend to be much weaker.  Ohh and I have a 6Ghz spectrum analyzer so I can see all this interference.Should you buy one,  yes...they work great.  Stupid WiFi remote issue aside.

For the price, this thing has more features than you will ever get to. Honestly. I am very technical but will never have the time to go through all the cool features of this Roku. I think it is marvelous.Voice Recognition is so nice. Remote in comfy. Thank you again.

I bought 2 of these at separate times, same models. These are great devices and I am able to take full advantages of their features since I do have Spectrum TV cable and Internet and some international TV packages which are all supported with this ROKU device. In addition, ROKU provides various show apps as well as screen saver like a computer.  I like the speaker feature to allows you to speak the channel app you want to go instead of pushing buttons. This comes handy if you are watching in a dark room. :-)  I have an Apple TV and Chromecast, but I feel that this ROKU device is better out of the 3 devices. Overall, I am very happy with the purchase.

I first bought Amazon Fire Stick. I had problems with it so sent it back and after reading reviews on Roku decided to try it. Loved the ease of use, clarity of pictures, sound and a much better variety of shows. After my first roku, I purchased two more. I m buying another one for a Christmas gift and I m replacing my not smart LG TV with a TCL Roku Tv. I m not real tech savvy and the ease of setting Roku stick up and navigation through the channels has definitely won me over. I m hoping Amazon or someone offers the 2018 TCL Roku 4K TV on sale Black Friday. Then I think my Roku family will be complete.

I always liked Roku devices, and this is best so far I have used. It provides a great wifi connection, and all input commands are very fast.Also, you only have to use it a few times before the controls become very intuitive. The remote is easy on batteries as well. Like most wifidevices, a good stable and fast signal is imperative if you want the best performance, or you are not doing it justice.Compared to similar products, this is one superior IMO to AppleTV, and other stick devices I have tried.You get a lot of good programming choices with Roku as well.

This wee media stick is useful and a pleasure to use 85% of the time. The user interface is excellent and the voice recognition works for everyone in the house. Only gripe is that 10% of the time, the streaming continues but the remote becomes nonresponsive and I cannot stop the stream or exit to a menu. Another 5% of the time the startup freezes and I cannot get to a menu. Either way unplugging and replacing the wee stick resolves whatever was stuck and media steaming can resume. But that’s a bit irritating when it happens 15% of the time.

I have purchased many earlier Roku devices and this one is a winner with me. I have the previous version of Roku Stick and this is a definite upgrade and super easy to set up. The remote is a big improvement. The ability to control volume, power, mute, voice recognition and not have to use another remote is the best! I also enjoy that you have private listening using the app if you want to do late night streaming without disturbing the household.The performance and stream quality are excellent, the best Roku for the money yet!

I used it to turn a basic simple TV screen a tv that shows all my favorites such as You tube, Pandora, Spotify, Amazon prime movies, Netflix etc.  5 stars from a technophobe who hates setting these things up!

Description says it is compatible with any tv with HDMI.  I got this plugged in and started going through the setup process and kept getting an error message saying it was not compatible and it would not let me continue. My TV is a 2016...its not so old that this shouldn't work.  I returned it and bought an Apple 4K which works flawlessly.

Worked great for the first few weeks. Then would start with the sound "blinking" on and off followed by a warning on the screen that the unit was overheating. The unit was in fact very hot to touch. Looking online for troubleshooting and found this item is developing quite a history of overheating problems. I would recommend staying away from this product until Roku comes up with a permanent fix.

After trying all forms of streaming devices, I always go back to a Roku, I got this stick because in this instance, I got fed up with a sketchy Vizio "smart" TV that is rather slow and stupid when it comes to streaming (Advice: never buy a Vizio smart tv, they lag like crazy), I just plugged this in and it turned that slow, useless tv into a fast, reliable streaming TV...

This streaming stick suddenly stopped powering up (no power light) and since it has been longer than 30 days, Amazon can't help me, they only put me on hold and attempted to contact Roku for trouble shooting help. Finally giving up on being on hold, they gave up promising to call me back tomorrow.. Since Roku warrantees their products for 1 year I thought this would be easy enough to resolve if I contacted them myself. I ended up spending hours on a chat board with Roku repeating over and over again that I tried everything to decipher that it was a device issue. (tried different outlet, different working power cord, hit reset button). After all that, the company will only replace it after I sent it to them (at my cost) to an shipping address I have to wait for in an e-mail that should come to my inbox in the next 1-2 business days. Then I have to wait for them to confirm that it is a hardware issue, then send me a replacement. I live on the east coast and I think they are in CA, so that will take a while. Meanwhile, It was plugged into my kitchen TV and I used it every day for news and such. This is very inconvenient. I could buy a new one and have it the same day but I shouldn't have to!!!

Easy install and setup, took the TV off the mount to paint put it back up. doesn't work anymore. Very flimsily power connection. My 2.2 connection was on the side of the TV it I just kinda hung there. When it worked it was great too much resetting and unplugging to be reliable.

If you have a DNS sinkhole on your network, you’d be surprised how much tracking your media devices try to track... While it’s probably expected of Amazon and google devices, and any app you install, I was a little surprised to see Roku doing it too, as I naively figured that they got most of their revenue from device sales. Whelp... nope... they collect and sell data on you like everyone else...If you’re moderately technically-inclined, look into setting up a pi-hole on your network.

Had the old roku for years and upgraded to streaming stick. Easy to install and set up. Voice commands work great.Remote control shows you when batteries are low.Adding channels is easy.No hiccups or lags and I've used it with different cable companies.

Audio only works on tv. If used on Bluetooth speakers or headphones, the audio is continuously out of sync. I've reinstalled the channels several times as suggested but, the issue persists. Also, I've used two different phones and a tablet so, I know it's the Roku that it's causing the problem.Streaming works fine with Netflix and Youtube, not so much with prime video. Sometimes after rewind, it keeps buffering for a long time or starts playing without sound. Other times, it just crashes.I've tried to screen mirroring my laptop, pretty much useless because of video lag.The volume and power buttons in the controller are useless because the Roku won't recognize my tv.So, probably I'll be returning this device and buying a better one.
I bought the Fire Stick on a lightning deal.  I’d been watching for it to go on sale. It arrived in a couple of days. It was easy to set up, and now I can stream all my channels on every TV.

Everything that was needed to get it working was included. The flexible adapter was needed because the FireStick was too thick to plug into the HDMI port on my TV, so I'm glad is was in the kit. It was easy enough to program and get working. It took less than 20 minutes. The onscreen instructions are very easy to follow and the link to Amazon to enable it actually worked (sometimes I have trouble with links). Works well. too.

I loved the Roku stick but the remote gave out after only a month. I didn't mind because I had the app download on my phone but we recently changed Wifi providers and I can't reset up my roku stick without the remote and the remote on the phone app doesn't work. I don't think I should have to buy a whole new roku stick if I haven't even had this one a year.
I didn't like how they advertised volume control but when I received it, it didn't have volume control on remote. I'm definitely leaning towards zip code discrimination with many companies.
This little gadget connects my older tv to the world of streaming--actually makes my tv a Smart TV. I can seamlessly connect to Apple TV+, Netflix and Amazon Prime by just asking Alexa. Genius!
I like this fire stick. So far so good. I got a for a couple bucks under retail but it's something to have to if you don't want top of the line streaming device with all the bells and whistles.

Very dissatisfied. Can't download Youtube and Netflix on Fire TV as they are mysteriously "Unavailable." Further, I have a Prime subscription but it keeps telling me to rent or buy movies. Very poor selection for the stuff included in the subscription. Compared to Netflix, this experience is terrible. At least on Netflix, everything is available since you're paying for a subscription. But on Prime Video, you're paying a subscription for nothing.

Allows me to stream the shows I love. As far as voice recognition, I just couldn't get it to work, but I don't need it. The biggest issue I have is that I have had to unplug the device and then plug it back in way too much, It loses sound a lot and that make me have to reset it, a lot.
Was/am very disappointed in this. No volume controls and wouldn’t intergrade with my tv. Bought it to replace previous fire stick control the dog chewed on.  Works no better than chewed one

Easy and fast set up, we were watching new shows within 30 minutes, after delivery. I wish I had opted for the unit with TV controls, I would have one less remote to keep up with. We will be buying a second unit for another TV.

The Fire Stick Lite worked perfectly for setting up a temporary outdoor TV for Thanksgiving Day.  The Firestick was integral enabler to get this to work.  It took less than 10 minutes to setup  Firestick, Computer monitor, Bluetooth Speaker. The  Firestick easily paired with my OontZ Bluetooth Speakers.
Excelente Fire TV Stick, Netflix, Disney etc
Works as designed to do. I love using these fire sticks! Turns your tv into a smart tv without having to purchase another one! The price of these things right now are amazing! We bought three!

I wish I could review it but unfortunately I was never able to connect it to my WiFi. Support told me that I needed to be within 10 feet of my router... I know this is not true but either way, I never did get it connected. The TV I was trying to use it on is 22 feet away.  Back to my Apple TV.

I was skeptical in getting the device, but with all the buzz of streaming and not knowing what to do I first purchase Roku but returned it because I did not know how to operate it. I saw the fire stick on QVC and really loved my purchase. I wish some of my fav movies were available for free but I am experimenting and found Tubi so I'm able to look at movies there as well, no regrets. The kids also have there fair share of kid friendly programs.
The Fire Stick is a nice device and work-around for me to get my channels and apps on my smart tv which is older and cannot access all the channels streaming. Great addition for not much cash

The FireStick was easy to setup and use.  Having said that, there were No instructions regarding how to use it or what the different controls were for.  If you have the patience to do trial-and-error then it'll probably work out okay.  If you're a streaming novice, it may take you a while to figure out how everything works.
Couldn't get it to work at all. Maybe got a bad one.
I have a Roku, Flex and now this nice Firestick.  So many programmes, movies, etc.  Love it.  Have not purchased any pay services as I think this will suit my needs.  Setup Is pretty easy.

We have an 8yr old TV that could no longer accept or run Hulu updates. This Firestick solved that and gave a lot of new functionality to the TV. The Firestick is fast and stable, we're going to get another for a second TV.
Yesterday it would not work, until I had to do a manual reset of the fire stick

The Roku was easy to set up and works flawlessly so far. The updates were quick and I had no issues connecting to my network. I was agonizing between the Fire Stick and Roku. Ultimately I chose the Roku because I have read it has more entertainment options and a better interface. IDK. I will probably get a Fire Stick down the line to test it. I downloaded the Quick Remote app which is supposed to integrate with Alexa, so far I have not had any luck. Waiting on my Google Home assistant and if it works with that I'll just move my Echo dot into the second bedroom and use that instead.

I have no problem with the picture, sound and versatility. My problem was the remote control. After a couple of weeks the remote stopped working so I thought the problem was the battery. I changed the battery and it start working again. After a couple of weeks with the new battery the remote stopped working again. Can’t turn off the tv, can’t change the channel or even the volume. The only way to make it work is to open the battery compartment and remove it and put t back. This is a waste of time and not fun at all.

EXCELLENT...dual band, supports 2.4 and 5g, I need the 5g to have smooth streaming without the lag...I am very pleased with this unit, I went through a few roku models because I read reviews saying it supports 5g only to find out it doesn't.  You need dual band to connect with 5g.

This is my second purchase of a Roku streaming stick.  The first one lasted 14 months, which was quite a bit less than expected!  I had to keep re-pairing the old one until it finally gave out altogether.  Who knows if it was the remote or the stick itself that failed?  I'm glad I bought the purchase protection for $5.99, so that's all the new set ended up costing (plus a few bucks higher on the price).

Worked fine for four days then problems started. Now at the end of every show either 30 minutes or an hour it gives an error message and you have to go back to the beginning menu and start over. then it will load the channel and work. but this is after or at the end of every show.Also the favorites menu disappeared. its just a buggy piece of poo.

Got this for Black Friday price (30) on a whim as I already have the Nvidia Shield TV arguably the best streamer out there but also the most expensive. Video quality and audio passthrough is very comparable. The big difference is in the menu and interface lag. The faster processor (and I assume more RAM) of the Nvidia really outpaces the Roku. BUT... actually watching a movie or Amazon Video? You would be hard-pressed to be able to tell them apart. It's a great bargain at $30-$50.

I've always liked Roku, but with the changes to this one, I love it even more. The voice recognition is a nice touch, and I like the volume controls on the side. It works faster than before too.  For someone who wants to watch all their channels in various rooms, and not just those with a control box, Roku is the tool for you.

We bought this to use as a Comcast streamer and save on monthly rental fees.  Works well, no issues with streaming and the user interface is pretty easy to navigate.  The voice command doesn't work very well.  If you search a movie it doesn't seem to tell you all the streaming services are playing it, similar to the way Xfinity or Firestick does.

This thing is garbage. The remote has constant problems connecting. Half the time I turn the TV on the remote doesn’t work for a minute, or I have to reconnect the remote to the steaming stick. It’s crap.Get the cheaper Roku with the box. We have that in our other TV and it never has a single problem because you just need to aim the remote in the general direction of the infrared receiver on the Roku.The streaming stick is twice the hassle for twice the price. Not worth it.EDIT: now the damn thing stops working as soon as I get a foot away from the TV.

I have a Vizio smart TV, and while the picture is AMAZING, the interface for the smart apps sucks. Plus there's no Disney+ or Apple TV.
