So, I got the Roku Streaming Stick+, and in 10 minutes, I had my channels up and I was watching Hulu with no lagging, like on the TV app. I have one in my living room, one in my bedroom, and I have no worries with either of them. They communicate and I haven't paid an extra penny. Maybe they updated their systems, but I am happy. Also, if you have an older Rokus, Netflix won't work, so you may as well upgrade. This is so much better!
Been using a few months and it keeps randomly disconnecting from the internet with NO way to fix.. Will not purchase again and would recommend the firestick instead

I like the quality of the image an product in general but right now they are having quality issues with the remote control, you can check in the roku forums or searching “roku remote drain batteries” it eats the batteries of the remote in less than 4 DAYS. It seems that they are sending replacements but you will have to wait more than 1 month. I don’t recommend to buy until they fix this issue.

After hooking up the unit it gave some kind of warning that it couldn’t find device. Turns out USB on my newish Samsung doesn’t have enough amps to power the Roku plus. Plugged it into wall then couldn’t get the remote to pair. Then the original warning came up again! Gave up after an hour of screwing with it and am sending back to Amazon. Junk

I bought this December of 2018 for $49.99.  One yr. and one month later (Jan. of 2020) refuses to find a connection always have to pair the remote. The remote always has a 3-4 minute lag from when I press a button to when it actually happens. Now I see they only cost $39.99. Roku support non existent you are stuck using the FAQs on their website. When I go through the remote pairing, pressing reset on the remote, unplugging and re plugging the stick going through the whole set up process then it will work. Turn it off for even a minute and you have the same problems all over again.

I have a half dozen things I prefer on the Roku to FireTV. Quicker to boot by far, quicker to click the remote from watching something else and be up and in. Better and more configurable GUI. Streams nugs.net where the FireTV cannot. MUCH easier to configure. Some things Not so much as I would prefer to have a preference to hide the side menu until I want to use it. A handful of small things like that. But in general, I'm glad to have both devices.

The remote seems to disconnect from wifi and takes longer than expected to reconnect. If you're watching a show and don't use the remote for a while and then go to hit pause or select another show there is a serious lag in reconnecting. Finally we've started to notice that sometimes if we hit the back button while watching a show the screen goes black and will not reappear. You can here the roku receiving the controller inputs, but nothing happens on the screen. I end up having to power down my TV and let the roku reset before it will work again. The picture quality for wifi is great though!

Works great! Very easy to setup and get going right away. Streaming quality is nice. I upgraded from a Roku 3 to this and I’m very happy with it. The added TV controls is soo nice. My only issue with it is it can’t turn the TV and sound bar on/off, only one or the other. The Fire TV stick can do both without issue. If you like Roku I’d say buy this unless you need to have the sound bar control option. One thing to note is it can control the volume and turn sound bar on/off if your tv and sound bar have Hdmi cec support. Just takes a bit more setup. I like the Roku interface better which is why I went with this but I have a fire tv stick and I miss not having the extra control features for tv with sound bar. Overall I’d recommend it!

Very few quality streaming devices on the market, ROKU has it's quirks but considering the alternative it will have to be my choice until something better comes along.  Be aware purchasing subscriptions using your ROKU device, if something goes wrong with the subscription, ROKU will not refund.  Happened twice to me.  Best to purchase using the app for the subscription if one exists.
This device works really well. The voice recognition is excellent and all the other features work perfectly. This is my third different Roku streaming device and all three have been excellent.

I have a "non-smart" TV in the bedroom and needed an easy way to get streaming content/access to my Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Hulu.  I saw the Fire Stick lite on sale and purchased it right away.  I don't need voice activation on my remote and I just use my TV controller for volume, it truly is no big deal.  I am delighted with the price I paid and the fact that I can now watch all my streaming accounts on my bedroom TV!
seriously? even free apps like youtube wont install until you enable oneclick buy and all that bs to bait people into mindless spending, oh and if you want volume control thats $10 extra
Very easy to set up with our basement TV. It will be used for mainly the nieces & nephews so I didn’t really need the fire stick to have TV controls. Great price! I love my fire sticks!
Mine is fairly new so it still works smoothly.  After time these can get bogged down.  But so far, so good.  It's much, much faster than a Gen 1 stick, even after that old one has been cleaned up.
This is nice wished it came in the 4K but whatever I guess, not a whole lot of difference in my opinion. I had a 4K stick and wanted the new looking platform that comes with the light.
The Lite unit works great. Really like the new format on the updated FireStick. If you’re still using one of the original FireSticks I would recommend upgrading to one of the new ones.

The volume control doesn’t have to be turned up too high. Great sound. The picture quality is great too. Don’t need to make any changes. It’s like being at the movie theater. The remote is easy to use. Just like using ur tv remote.

So by day two it freezes and gets stuck and won’t load Amazon or Netflix movies. Super disappointed. Tried to replace item, that option isn’t available so I wanted to trade for another type of fire stick but I don’t have the originally packaging so nothing to return it in for a exchange or refund. Other fire sticks work in house , guess this version just isn’t up to par. Kind of pissed.
Works great, wish they made voice control replacement remotes at a lower cost, my dog chewed up original so had to get another one.. plus we bought another fire stick lite for a gift!!

Seriously, how much is a power and volume button, id give it a lower rating if it was on my tv and notnthe kids for this fact alone because we all know kids cant keep remotes on hand to save their lives!

This product is so easy to setup and use. We've used several versions over the years and the stick is another great product. By the way, I saw some reviews about people frustrated that roku charges now for activation. This is a scam and it says so in the roku instructions of which I provided a picture. Enjoy!

My Smart TV is somewhat old, and apps have been dropping like flies (Hulu just disappeared off my TV, and Disney+ and YouTube TV are too new to even be on it).  Roku made it possible for me to watch all my subscriptions AND it loads almost instantly, as opposed to my TV needing a good 3-5 minutes "loading my settings."I haven't tried using the voice technology but the app works great to turn your phone into the remote.

Enjoyed the product for the two weeks that I used it, although the volume had to be adjusted with every program. Then the remote quit working. I contacted Roku and they said they’d send a replacement. It didn’t show up so I contacted them again and they said it was out of stock and they didn’t know when they would have one. No one bothered to notify me. Unfortunately I will have to return the entire device because I have no way to access Hulu.

This roku streaming stick sucks the life out of the triple a batteries in 2 weeks. Batteries are to darn expensive to have to change them every 2 weeks. I only use this roku about an hour a day!! The batteries should last at least 6 months!!!!

Roku seems to work easier and more accurately than the Amazon Firestick. I personally like the way it feels in my hands and the buttons more. I don’t have an Alexa so I can’t attest to that part though. This Roku seems to not have a sleep timer though, like the other ones do. But it literally have everything else I was using before.

Love Roku! It has HBO Max, Amazon prime, Disney+, Netflix, spectrum TV, Starz and much much more. There is lots of free product to stream. Easy to use and great picture quality. Will recommend to anyone. The remote turned on not on the Roku but also the TV and volume. Roku even tells you when batteries are low. This even beats Fire Stick and Chrome cast.

Excellent.. here is what i think:1. They produce much better sound than FireTV "stuff"2. Volume rocker to control TV volume4. 4K Video5. I can control TV power on/off w/ this remote (Through HDMI Arc)6. Amazon Video App is not that great, but everything else is fantastic. Amazon let others live too :-)7. Great price (Bought them for $50)8. Great Wi-fil (MU-MIMO, search on duckduckgo )very happy w/ the purchase.

I've had a Roku 3 and thought to upgrade it to this Stick+.  Overall, I'm satisfied with the speed and quality of the streaming.  Sometimes, the remote connectivity isn't that great even though I'm only about 7 feet from the TV.

I bought a new TV and when I finally updated to this stick, boy could I see the difference on picture quality. So, if you have a 4k HD TV, you need to update to a HD ROKU. I've used a ROKU since cutting the cord several years ago.I learned the hard way to use the power cord and adapter for this, don't power it from a USB on the TV, it denigrates from the heat generated off the TV. The power cord pulls it away from the TV and the stick doesn't get hot, and eventually fry, from no air flow and TV heat buildup.My experience w/ROKU customer service as always been good.

The Roku line of products is great for beginner and intermediate streaming devices. The devices and remotes are simple, easy to use, and are high-quality parts. The UI is quick and easy to navigate. Streaming is good and covers all the major apps available.Top of the line is still the Nvidia Shield TV in my opinion, but that is not needed for secondary TVs. I love the Roku devices for this role and they are much better than FireTV in my opinion. If you are looking for a good streaming device, you can't go wrong with Roku!

As someone who has never used an Amazon fire stick, I have to say this is pretty great! I was able to set it up with no issues. My apps installed perfectly and I was able to watch it. Sadly my Samsung tv wasn’t supported anymore with many apps for some reason so that’s why I got this. $17.99 isn’t a bad price! I definitely recommend this and look forward to possibly buying another in the near future.

Constantly have to manually check for upgrades and install upgrades otherwise, it does not work correctly.  Have to reboot almost every day.  Very dissatisfied/disappointing experience with Firestick Lite after such great experience with the Firestick 4k.

A rather buggy and iffy product. When is works, it's great.  It frequently does not work. Also, the ability to cast has become increasingly proprietary, meaning that I can cast almost anything to my Google Chromecast, but only select things to the Amazon fire stick. There's room for improvement.
Purchased this for my dad and he loves it. Easy to use and has so many great streaming options. The price was a plus. I plan on purchasing another one for myself. Definitely recommend!
I bought this specifically to run the Slingbox App on a spare TV. So we can watch football games outside. The App starts but the controls don't work, so it is not useful. I returned it for refund.

The box came without the USB cable. Luckily for us we could use a USB cable from our phone. When I called customer service to get a cable they said I would have to send back everything and they would resend another  one. They explained that they couldn't just send me a cable. Guess I'll just continue to use the phone cable cause I don't want to go thru the hassle of setting up another fire stick with all my programs.

Purchased this as a gift to send to Mexico, only to find out later that the device does not work outside of the U.S. (confirmed by tech support). Read through the item description several times and there’s nothing in the description that warns of this item not working outside of the U.S. very unfortunate.

Alright, at first it was working fine. But after 2 days it stopped working so I unplugged it to reset it and plugged it back in. It started working again...until the next day...when I had to reset it again...then it happened the next day...and the next...and the next. Well I have to reset it everyday. So I'm unplugging it for 5 minutes each day so it'll turn back on. But other then that it works perfectly

I just received my firestick for christmas this year and I cannot say that I have anything bad to say about it. It has a lot of features and is compatible with most screens. I would say that new buyers might want to just by the upgraded one with volume control so that you only need one remote but other than that I love this one
Excellent product I have 2 of these at my home works great .Awesome easy to use and setup if you are looking to connect TV with Amazon prime and other channel i would recommend this
This new firestick is perfect for a seldom-used TV in a guest room. It's cheap because it doesn't include volume control so you will need the original TV remote to control the volume.

For some reason the sound does not come on automatically when I start the new firestick Lite. I have to unplug it, turn the tv off & on to restart it for sound. That’s never happened before & it’s only the two new Lite ones that do it. Not happy with this product. It gets stuck on channels and doesn’t move.
For us this is all we need. Seldom do we use voice (just as easy to press buttons. Where this one is used the TV control (or lack of it) doesn't matter. Works just fine for streaming.

Immediately after the Firestick app updated last month, the voice action stopped working. I briefly chatted with an Amazon rep, but gave up when realizing they were going to make me jump through their many hoops in an attempt to resolve the issue, no doubt in their favor. Here's an idea for the the second wealthiest company in the world......just replace the damn thing.
I finally got a streaming device that is not a headache to set-up. It connected easily to xfinity wifi, and after few minutes I'm watching Netflix, Youtube,etc...And yes, it has sound!

works fantastic. i use it for my Disney, Amazon Prime, and Netflix. did not know this was an option on the device but there is an internet browser that works about just as good as my iPhone, a little bit slower but good for watching videos not on the main streaming sites

I bought this not knowing it was not like the ones I have. This version is very simple and the lack of the volume button really was a no go for me. With this version you will have to have both the firestick remote and TV remote which not at all what I wanted. I did return this product and will buy the updated version.

I'm just not all that into Alexa or talking to remotes. Frankly, I've not tried it yet. But, this thing couldn't be easier to use. I'm living in pandemic weirdness and needed this for survival mode kind of existence and dang if it didn't work. Cool little device.
Its a nice product, Ive had these for years and this one is nice. I keep one in my semi truck and I stream right off of the hot spot on my phone with unlimited data so go get one, lol
I really like this. I've always bought Roku products but could not beat this price! Does everything I want it to. I like the Alexa feature a ton. Super easy to setup too! Great purchase overall.
I bought this to make a large non-smart-tv a smart-tv.  It does the job admirably.  The most valuable feature to me is the screen mirroring.  Now I can mirror my tablet onto the tv.
The Firestick allowed us to downgrade our cable plan and save money. We had to keep basic cable to get internet unfortunately. At least now we get more programming at a lower cost.

Perfect. Easy set up. Great picture quality. Extremely responsive. Great WiFi connectivity. I use this in my RV where I used to use an Xbox to run streaming apps. Much lower power consumption and easier navigation. Buy it. Value for dollar one one the best purchases I’ve made in the last year.
I have found thee programs enjoyable and I was able to add additional memberships which almost turned my conventional TV into a Smart TV. The Alexa feature helps me find movies and programs easily.

I bought a fire stick lite for myself, my mom, and my dad for Christmas after receiving the recommendation from a family member. My parents had some difficulty setting up the device on their own, but once we helped them set it up it couldn't be easier to navigate. The fire stick makes it so easy to connect to all of your streaming services and also provides access to TV channels that we wouldn't have otherwise. I highly recommend fire stick lite if you are looking for an easy to navigate, online streaming platform.

This works great! The Alexa integration is particularly powerful, and the inclusion of Facebook Watch (which I can't seem to get on a similar Roku device on another tv) allows me to access some specific exercise workouts without needing a laptop.
3 generation this one audio stops and needs unplugged to reset. None of my older fire sticks do this! I buy a new one and it is defective.. but Amazon are replacing it. But i hope this works!
I purchased this so that I could get HBO Max on my TV rather than my computer since Dish no longer carried HBO. It has worked very well for this and other channels  it can access.

All in all I like this product.  Setup was easy.  Quality is good.  The only complaint is that the on-screen interface is a bit funky.  No really user friendly.  I'm sure after a while using it' I'll get batter at setting up menus and apps.
Getting music, TV programs, info, You Tube, etc. could not be easier. Who wants to type and go through all that frustration? Great sound quality and video and you cannot beat the price.

I absolutely love Roku. We recently bought a tv for our bedroom that already has Roku. I loved all of the options it has and you can even get free tv from major networks when we were paying a ridiculous bill every month for but could have had Roku for FREE! I purchased the streaming stick for my daughter's tv bc we loved it so much. She had a fire stick but we by far prefer Roku. Great buy, worth it.

Except for the fraud number that came up on installation, it’s great. I was out $119, but disputed it and had to get a new credit card. Not happy about that one!! Roku kniws about it but maybe you should have a heads up also.

I have  2 other roku's the 3 and sreaming stick. Both are indeed great. Sadly I have had many disapointments with the wifi networking performance of this + stick. That is suppoused to be one of its strongest selling point! I have a netgear ac band system in my house and no other devices have issues with my wifi. This device gets only around a 6mb connection and drops connectivity all together often. It is powered buy the wall plug not the tv and is on the 5g band. All other devices connect in the multi hundreds of mb to the wifi router.

We purchased this for our sons tv.  It has a great picture and streaming quality. The only thing I do not like is the roku stick does not come on when you hit the power button, we have to jiggle the stick in the back of the TV to get it to come on.  We have tried all the HDMI ports on the TV with the same result perhaps the stick has some kinks and is defective.  Otherwise great product.

I bought this as a gift for my sister who had a TV Hung that her Cable provider refused to hard wire. With this Roku Streaming Stick+ the provider's app she can get live TV and have access to all the streaming Roku has to offer! I have 2 Roku TV's and have had other Roku devices through the years so I am willing to give them some benefit of the doubt when it comes to the one annoying problem she has regarding the stick. After getting the Roku to recognize her older led tv every time she turns it off it comes back on by itself. I assume it's the tv not Roku's fault but I could not get it to work properly so am not positive.

Decent, performance could be a little better, start up is a little slow and also lags occasionally.  But after the “warm up” it’s pretty good.  One other annoying thing is why does it occasionally asks you for confirmation after you’ve clicked one of the dedicated app buttons?  For example I click Hulu, then it asks me if I’m sure, click the left arrow to get to YES then click the OK button.  That’s two extra, unnecessary clicks.  Isn’t the point of the dedicated app button to avoid unecessary steps and go straight to the app? It doesn’t do it all the time, just sometimes, which is weird. Interface and remote are easily the best on the market and very easy to use.

I purchased this because of the enlarged antenna in order to receive the best WiFI  signal from my router. This works and signal strength is very good. I have other ROKU's and have experienced no problems with them.This one, however, is junk. It overheats. It goes nuts and throws a black screen with an error and several steps to correct. The correction does not work for long and the error repeats. In addition the voice if often out of sync with the picture and the picture itself lacks the quality of my FireStick.I contacted ROKU via their website support and discovered the worst customer support I have ever encountered.I am hoping that my device is defective and a replacement will solve the problem but I am getting nowhere with ROKU.So bottom line. My recommendation is not to buy this.If I end up getting a replacement I will update this review with whatever new data I have..

The Roku device itself works fine, but you must subscribe to a ROKU service to begin to use this... The minimum price for this is $90.00.  This gives you access to several entertainment channels that you are probably already paying for thru your cable company.  This may be a benefit to some users, but I would have preferred to know the terms before trying to install this...

Cannot get it to work even after contacting customer support. I had purchased this to be able to watch a football game on sat since firestick doesnt have youtube tv. When I hooked it up, I found not get my remote to sync. The lady from customer support told me I needed an HDMI extender. That should not be the case. 1. I tried pairing the remote right next to the Roku stick and if that didnt work, the extender isnt going to work. Secondly,  I needed what I bought to work right when it comes out of the box. Not get it and wait 2 weeks to be able to wait for a part that is not going to work and then still try and wait to figure out what's wrong with it. I'm highly disappointed.

The RokuTV stick is absolute TRASH. We have had this for less than 30 days and dealt with constant freezing of the actual stick - not an internet problem. Today, it froze so many times that we had to engage the “reset” functions, which makes you set up the stick like “new” which is pretty inconvenient. More inconvenient is the fact that it never got through the entire setup without freezing again. It is now completely unusable. We have 2 amazon fire sticks that we have had longer than this and both work perfectly - no freezing. What’s more - the cost is higher than the superior fire sticks. We only purchased this because it’s the only device Xfinity allows for streaming of their live tv app, but it’s not worth it. We are returning and will never buy another Roku product again. We also hated that there’s no mute button on the remote.

Bought this Roku because my older tv wasn't supporting any of the streaming apps, and I didn't want to buy a new tv.  It was very easy to set up and it's really easy to use.  Being not super tech savvy, I always expect a learning curve with any new technology, so was pleasantly surprised at how user friendly it is.

This piece of junk is lucky to play one out of ten videos when streamed from my local hard drive. When using their apps I constantly have to log in, like daily, due to timeouts. Overall it’s useless. Every other thing out there plays Netflix so who cares if this thing does? As far as the things you would buy this for it barely does the job, if at all.

I love my Roku! I had the Roku - Premiere 4K Streaming Media Player an earlier version that I had trouble keeping it stuck to the  larger TV in the right position. I moved it to the smaller bedroom TV and it works much better on the smaller tv. The Roku streaming stick it’s perfect for the bigger TV in the living room and it works amazing. The stick was great because I could just plug it into the TV. Very please!

I am extremely disappointed with Roku's lack of support and knowledge of their product. The reps were rude and treated me like I was an idiot. I spent hours with them, Amazon and Comcast trying to get the Roku connected to my Wi-Fi network. I specifically asked if there were any password restrictions and was told no. We did a replacement drill that took another couple of days with the same results. As a last resort, I changed my Wi-Fi password to a simpler one with no special characters. The Roku connected immediately. Roku support has yet to follow up with the ticket they created 4 days ago. The password requirements should either be addressed as a Roku software issue, or published as a restriction. At the end of the day, I had to change over 20 devices in my home to use the new password (laptops, phones, iPads, cameras, doorbells, thermostats, alarm systems, printers etc.). Now that it is working, I do like the Roku picture and sound. But the effort to get it set up and poor customer support really soured me on the brand.
This item was listed as "Condition: New"  When it arrived, it had 2 profiles and a connected email account.  I reset to factory default and continued on.  But, when I pay for new I would like new.

Turns TV on by itself unless you take batteries out of remote. I shut TV off go to bed to wake up in the morning with the Roku page playing!?!?  This starting happening after about a months use, had to email Roku (only way to get in touch with their customer service) and no replies except for the computer generated one. Now after multiple times trying to get in touch with them still no help.

Never had a Roku before but I like mine. Easy to use interface, works well with my cable service provider, and has all the different apps I could need. Only problem I've run into is when I'm using YouTube. While watching a video, the app will quit working, and an error message will appear on the screen. Other than that, It's definitely worth the money not to pay for the equipment and go with something like this.

initially, it didnt work out of the box. was stuck in an initial setup loop (seems to be a known defect from Roku) and Roku Customer service swapped it out no problem. Second one came and it worked perfect out of the box. Its a great streaming device, but just know that the Streaming Stick+ by Roku does have a known defect for setup when it is brand new.

This thing and Hulu Live doesn't get along at all .. Constantly rebooting when watching live tv.. Other apps seem to work ok.. It's also throws a 'low power' error messages frequently (even when using supplied power source) which requires a reboot to get working again.. I have tried different hdmi ports, different power adapters, stayed current with updates etc. The remote is the only Pro i can think of.. I can't reccomemd this product at all.. Going back to fire stick..

I had (actually still have) an original Roku streaming box.  I've had a few others over the years including the original purple streaming stick.  I bought this to attach to my projector for movies in the garden for my family and it works great.  Roku has the best options and channels and they've pioneered streaming.  The Roku works for me and maybe some day I can work for Roku :)

We love the firestick!!! Much better than a roku has the kids section with time limits the remote works from my bedroom so my son cannot try to turn on the tv perfect if you want a smart tv but don’t want to pay much extra this is an instant to upgrade
Easy set up and use.  Now I can easily view items from my watch list wirelessly.  The selection of shows from Prime offer much better viewing options than most of the junk coming through my cable.

I love the fire stick lite. It’s pretty cool. The interface is much different from the fire stick 4K model so it take a couple minutes to get used to.One thing I wish Amazon would do though is to create an app so you can access the fire stick from your mobile device and also if you lose your remote that it’ll give off a signal or create a noise so you can detect it. I love it, it was great and I caught the sale for $20
Muy bueno, lo recomiendo  al 100%👍

This fire stick as I understand is the cheapest one they have on the market. And it's biggest problem is, it won't work with all your apps especially HBO Max. Buy the one that's about $40 that also controls your TV and you won't regret it.

I gave old man cable a proper burial and immediately purchased and fell in love with Alexa’s fire stick. We have been together for awhile now and I love how she keeps the relationship alive by constantly making improvements.
How come no HBO max?  I guess I may change if it does not show up soon.

Fire TV Stick Lite Better Value than 4K Stick, Lite stick has better picture than 4K Stick on 4K TV. I like the new menu on the new stick way better than the old menu. Sound is not great & remote is a little cheaper.

We are Prime Members so we get a more movies than we can watch for free. Lots of free TV inside this fire stick. Tell Alexa to find you a movie and she will bring it right up. We have already canceled our Direct TV that was costing almost $100.00 a month. If you have decent internet service this is a no brainer.

Okay, I’ve had this fire stick since it came out. It worked great at first but now it’s giving me black out screens, getting stuck on screens, and some apps (especially Hulu) has a really bad problem with getting stuck. It’s just basically not functioning as well as I thought it would. Considering this is my first fire stick to ever own i am honestly not happy with it. It was great at first but now it’s turning into a waste of money. Tired of unplugging and rebooting my fire stick every few days because of this.
Great product. Love you like to feature

I bought it to replace my outdated RCA mini.  This device is super slow.  I have it right next to the modem and the wifi and it's still always buffering yet, I have 1 GB wifi.  Roku TV in the other room works just fine and Roku stick on the other side of the house works fine.  But this is always crashing, buffering, losing connection.  Since it's 17 for this item.  I will most likely replace it with a Roku stick.

As someone who has tried All of the streaming devices , this is the absolute best , it has unlimited possibilities and options, has the most channels than any other device , and I love the voice recognition 😀 I give it 5 stars all around
So pleased with my  Alexa Voice Remote Lite with TV controls! Took all of 5 minutes to connect with my Firestick Lite! Now I can turn my TV on/off without using my TV remote! 😊

We bought this to have television at a rental unit we had in Yuma, AZ. We at least had television but finding shows was not easy. Too many point and click options. I'm used to a guide channel for simplicity. Scrolling through all the available apps was a pain. But if you have no television providers then it's nice to have.
Some movies after a while stops and begin to buffer.
My old fire stick became slow so I got this one. It was pretty cheap $14.I like the new Home Screen look and it seems faster than the previous fire stick I had.Works well!

I had bought 3 other firesticks and needed another was in shock when I seen how cheap it was but that’s because NO VOICE CONTROLS which I didn’t even read (my mistake) didn’t know there was a firestick lite  just had hit BUY NOW, you can’t control volume with remote kinda sad but other than that works the same.
Firestick is great get upgrade from the old one I had. I do have an issue where the sound will disconnect when I start it up unplugging it free plugging it back in makes it work
Got this for the TV in my kids room. 4k isn't necessary for that 1080p TV so this fit the bill at a good price. It's responsive even though I'm powering it off a USB on the TV.

My parents are in their 70s and not technologically adept.  This has been perfect for my mom who has been able to now compulsively binge watch Netflix.  I won't say she has become adept, but on a daily basis she can access Netflix and Hulu and isn't stuck with her crappy cable TV.

I find the remote to be horrible. It will sometimes get stuck. I find myself pressing it more than once to get to different apps. Also, I am not sure this 4K. I look at my firestick and there is no lag. That is my only negative. The positive side is that it has a lot more channels that are free than any other streaming device. Also you can control the volume and turn off the TV with the same remote. The firestick 4k also has the turn on and turn off using the remove. Also, the volume control work with my TV. I have a Samsung series 6 4K TV

Even if you already have a smart TV, put a Roku on it anyway.  I haven't met a "smart" TV yet that has an interface as good and easy as the folks at Roku have created.  It is also nice that all of my TVs look the same to me since they all have Rokus.I haven't played with voice commands so I can't comment on that.  I have never found a need for them.

The set up was a breeze.  The picture quality is great.  The remote synched to my TV which is a Samsung Smart TV we purchased in 2012/2013.  I can turn the TV on and off, volume up or down and navigate with ease.  I mainly got this in order to watch Direct TV Now but I can easily access Netflix and and Amazon Video, both apps with which I have subscriptions to.  I also downloaded my News12 app for free which, by the way, was a big reason why I did not want to switch to a streaming stick in the first place because I wasn't sure how I would watch my local news channel (watching about 40 years).  Overall, very pleased.  I have Optimum 200 speed for my WiFi and I have not experienced any buffering.  Love it!!!

Roku works fine and seems to be the best and most content neutral/friendly streaming device out there.  "Point anywhere" remote burns through batteries like I've never seen.  It also takes 30-60 seconds to sync everytime you turn it on.  It's hard to get used to and even harder for toddlers to understand why they have to wait for Blippi when the TV is clearly on.

I think it was a little misleading that you have to power it with USB. luckily my TV has one but that should be a little more obvious. Setup was easy and I'm excited to have all these streaming options. In an unlucky twist I literally was one day late on the Spectrum TV app being pulled. Hoping they bring that back cause it was the main reason besides the price I went with ROKU

If your goal is to cut the cord, be aware that many usable apps require a fee - including some over the air programing - such as CBS = all access to name one. Buying a good smart TV gives the user many of the main apps that is needed for viewing pleasure but if you want more "B" rated movies and special interests programming ROKU can help, but to be honest YouTube has a good venue. Is it worth it? Yes... if you don't have a smart TV and want to connect to the internet (for YOUTUBE, VUDO etc..) . If you already own a smart TV then it is 50/50... if it is in your budget and it will save money as long the user doesn't subscribe to too many fee based subscriptions.

I eagerly opened up my package and started setting it up as soon as I got it. It won't power on. I tried several different power sources as well as two different TVs. I contacted roku customer support to try and resolve and was only directed to the troubleshooting page, not even for the issue that I was having, when I asked again clarifying my problem I was again directed to a troubleshooting page that did not help me. Now I've gone and processed a request for a return when all I want is a roku that actually works. Considering how long it took to arrive I don't know if I will be buying another.EDIT: This item was not listed as refurbished anywhere on the listing. I got one that was clearly refurbished (it literally had a sticker that said refurbished)

I own several Rokus and this is the first time I've had this problem. Roughly half the time I open Roku Streaming Stick it will not connect to my internet. I need to turn it off and on 3-4 times before it will lock on and 1 time I needed to physically disconnect it from TV and reconnect to get it synced to Wifi. Once connected it works flawlessly. The Wifi modem is within 2 feet of Roku and I've checked the Wifi when it does this and the Wifi speed pings at >100Mbps, so I'm baffled.  If I had to re-do order I would buy an earlier version.

I love my Roku! At first, I was really frustrated while setting it up because it took a lot longer to connect it with my university's WiFi than I expected, but once I managed to figure out what the issue was it went by smoothly. The video quality is great, and goes along with the best my TV picture quality has to offer.My primary motivation for getting the Roku was being able to watch SlingTV without having to use my laptop plugged into my TV via HDMI cord (because PS4s don't have the option of a SlingTV app). I am more than happy with the fact that all of my streaming services are now located in the same place. I highly recommend this product.

Finally cut the cable!  These were easy to install, easy to connect and are easy to use.  A little bit clunky after having cable for 30 years, but i believe it is the user as opposed to the equipment.  I did not rate for Alexa integration as I have not tried it.  Highly recommend if you are going with another content provider for TV.

Had it about 2 weeks and already had to go through a lengthy remote re-pairing process which is an enormous pain. Will be returning the roku if it happens again.UPDATE****It happened again. Returned the first unit, got a second unit and had the same issue. Something is wrong with the remote controls for the Roku sticks. The remotes work and then they don't. The remote would still control my TV, but would not talk to the Roku stick anymore, requiring a tedious re-pairing process. I bought another one and returned the first thinking I just got a bad unit. Nope replacement unit had the exact same issue. Check the other reviews, I'm not the only one this has happened to.

Got  This  Roku  to replace my  defective  FIRE STICKS.  I had  2  Fire Sticks  and  both  were  defective  one  immediately  the other  quit  functioning  in  a couple  of months  and  took forever  on updates  ROKU  is  superior  to the Fire Stick in all ways.  Easier  to set up,  updates  without  disrupting  your  viewing.  Clear  Streaming  now  One  remote  to  use  for the TV  and  the ROKU.  Roku  is  a streaming  device  you can  rely on

These were easy to set up.  I decided to cut the cord to my expensive satellite and go with a streaming service.  My niece has no problem finding something to watch.  I still have all of the channels I used to watch and can switch between my live tv service to prime or netflix very easy.  I've had to restart them a few times, but no problems so far.  The only complaint I would have is that I wish the fishtank screensaver were the default on the sticks like they are on the more expensive Roku player.

I have only had the Roku for about five months, and I’m already having issues with it. I tried to contact customer service, but after 30 minutes, absolutely nothing was resolved and they kept sending me to different departments. It was very frustrating, and absolutely nothing was resolved. They told me they would send me contact information to then contact the manufacturer.
Our TV is around 4-5 years old and would not stream programs. this was very easy to hook up and works perfect . we also got another chanel to stream with it. way to go ROKU...

We love the Roku and this Roku stick is our 3rd Roku device in our home. However, we have not even had it for one month and it died. Very disappointing since our others have not had issues and we've had them much longer. After spending time messing around with it I found that power supply box is what died, so if we get a new power cube for it then it will work, but definitely should not have died after less than one month. So, overall, we love Roku, but not sure if their newer ones are made as well since this one didn't last a month.  Would give 5 stars if it lasted longer and we probably just got a lemon.

The remote doesn't pair at all. The first I time I tried to pair the remote it took me to the page where I would enter my password for the network connection, but it popped back to the let's get started page. I've never gotten past the chose the network page it always goes back to the lets get started page. This is my fourth Roku, I know the pairing process. The main issue is that the Roku will not connect to WiFi. There is no customer service.

I did my homework before buying this Roku Streaming Stick+.  So, if you've done yours, then you already know why I bought it:  it has higher speed & longer range WiFi than most other models, has up to 4K resolution, has an easy setup, and offers more streaming possibilities than Amazon's Firestick products.  What the Firesticks can do that this cannot is play games, but that was not very important to me.  I also do not like that the Firestick menus are more complicated AND they tend to throw their own Amazon products more prominently rather than other streaming options.  All in all, the Roku line is simpler to use right out of the box and this model has excellent features as above.

The Roku Streaming Stick+|HD/4K is an excellent product!!! It is so easy to set up even a two year old can do it. This version of the Roku product line comes with the Roku Stick a USB to AC power cable a wireless signal range extender and a Roku remote. It is pre-loaded with app access to either pay to subscribe to services for a nominal fee or you may have access to entirely free app services where you may watch movies and other programs for free. As a sports lover I subscribe to a service that provides me access to sports across all currently existing sports networks.

Bought this product brand new about a year ago.  For the first few months, five stars - completely reliable, lots of content options, perfect way to ease the family into cutting the cord from standard cable TV service.And then it got flaky.  Random reboots while watching content, frozen screens when powered up, flaky network connection.  Tried multiple reboot/restart/reset strategies and ended up finally getting a RMA and returning the stick to the company (which is a bit of a painstaking process in itself).After a couple of weeks they mailed back a brand new stick.  Which of course worked flawlessly.  For a while.  After another month this one went into an endless cycle of repeating the boot screen (where the Roku letters dance).  Rebooting, resetting, nothing - just the boot screen, over and over.  After a couple weeks of trying resets, unplugging, etc. the device froze up completely and the HDMI input reports no signal.Seriously, the MOST frustrating piece of electronic equipment I've ever owned or dealt with.Roku itself is awesome.  We also have an Ultra box connected to another TV, and just replaced this hideous stick with another Ultra box.  In the same year of ownership our Ultra box has had zero issues.I'm happy to throw this particular streaming stick in the trash and move on from it.

It's the second time in several years that I bought a Roku. These devices amaze me every time. The WiFi connection is the best I have ever encountered in any device. It connects to my WiFi router (on another floor) when other devices (like the TV) fail. I bought it to play Netflix, VUDU, etc. because my smart TV stopped being smart after two years and now cannot properly connect to those services. The Roku has everything I need and more. I also take it with me when I travel, so that I can hook it up to the Hotel's TV and watch my own movies.What a great company.

This is our 3rd Roku item in our house and we have had nothing but issues with this stick.  Reset it all the time and finally today it just quick working.  Replaced batteries 3 times - no good.  Replaced it with an old Roku we have in another room and that one works fine.  This 3810X is not worth the box it was shipped in.  Of course can't return it or get any assistance.  Well I think I am moving over to a Firestick.  Time for a change

I lost my remote for my TV (used the satellite remote for 3 years) and needed to connect to my streaming channels.  I have another Roku in the house so knew the set up. But the integration with my TV was perfect.  It recognized the TV (Samsung smart TV) and after two steps to verify, it was connected. Simple and easy to use.

The Streaming Stick + is a snap to install and set up.  The menus are easy to navigate and searching for channels is simple.  Using the Roku is intuitive but it did take some time to activate a handful of services I've purchased.  The video and audio quality is pretty good but not spectacular.  Physical discs definitely out perform streaming media.  The mobile remote app is just ok.  It mostly works but can be a bit cumbersome to use.  Overall, I'm happy with the Roku.  It's a good value and a great way to get into streaming media.

I bought Roku Streaming Stick+ | HD/4K/HDR Streaming Device with Long-range Wireless and Voice Remote with TV Power and Volume.I have three other Roku sticks, older, which do not have the same problem with the FPS.  Roku solution - auto adjust the fps - does not work.That is why I am returning this stick and getting an older version.Most channels are awesome.

Definitely buy the Stick Plus because it is the least expensive with dual band so you have better chance of connecting to your wifi system. I cut the cord with Comcast with Roku and Im very happy. Also dropped Xfinity for YouttubeTV which will save me money too. Goodbye Comcast!! (Except for wifi and now cell phone.) But no more cable!! Yea !

I use this with my Tablo Over The Air DVR, as well as with all the streaming services. The best feature this has over it's competitor Fire TV, is that I can control everything with the Roku remote hand unit. It not only does the usual Roku stuff, but it turns the TV on/off, and controls the volume. It's a small thing, but there is a lot less screwing around looking for and changing remotes, especially in the dark. This is my second purchase of a like Roku and my 4th purchase of any Roku. I prefer these over Fire TV of which I have two of. The Roku voice search also gives a more detailed list of what's on where at no charge.

I am very happy with Roku Streaming Stick, I should have listened to my kids and got this ages ago.  Setup was connections was so easy. I have had this a little over a month and It is great.  It arrived quickly and I had it set up in a few minutes.  If you are thinking about buying one, stop thinking and order it !!

Problems with the remote out of the box, after a couple months it doesn't work at all.  Tried all the troubleshooting steps, apparently the only thing worse than Roku quality control is their support.  Opened a ticket over 2 weeks ago and followed up twice and still nobody has reached out to me!  Awful experience, will never buy Roku again

I have been using & loving ROKU for 7 years. THIS is Better ! What makes it better is it has 2 Internet Browsers and a FANTASTIC Voice search on the remote !! The unbelievable price this was, was WHY I bought it, $17. But if you don't already have ROKU..........Get THIS at Twice the price.

Looses audio almost daily, needs power down to re-establish WIRED connection. I expected better for a latest generation Firestick device but Roku still beats Firestick in speed, simplicity of menus and overall ease of use.
This doesn't have volume control hence the cheaper price. I didn't buy it for that I just needed something to use and this works great. Got it for $17.99 can't beat that price.

Works like the original fire stick but much faster. If you already have one of the older Fire Sticks, it is well worth the less than $30 for one of these much improved models. You will be happy you upgraded!

0 isn't a low enough score. 3 of these in a row didn't work and they couldn't fix. Decided to give up on getting one that works, and now I'm stuck with defective products as they "can only replace, not refund". So I now have 3 useless sticks.
Able to program other home TVs with programs purchased through the smart TVs. Able to enjoy tv shows with a hard of hearing individual who needs to connect hearing device to special box.

On our second one that the sound doesn't  always work on.  After sitting for a while the sound does not work.  Should have gotten the one with power and volume control as it is more convenient.  I knew when purchased it did not have those controls.
Works great. Turns my LG TV into a smart TV and I save hundreds over the price of buying a smart TV. No complaints. Not for use with an UHD TV since the resolution is too low.
Works just like any Fire interface. Basically, turns any TV into a Fire TV. But don't try to plug it into the USB port on your TV. It needs more power than that, so use the wall-plug adapter.
I love the firestick but the only thing is it sometimes freezes and the voice recognition doesn't pickup sometimes which can sometimes be annoying if you want to voice search something.

Where has this been? We were streaming through our blu-ray player and it was becoming nightmarishly frustrating with all the re-starts and not playing of episodes. This device steams perfectly without a single glitch so far. Very easy to set up and use, very easy to add channels, and I was very happy to be able to watch “Bill & Ted Face the Music” on premiere weekend with it. I love having the remote app on my phone. We haven’t tried integrating it with Alexa yet, but I plan on it. This was so worth it.

While it's simple to plug in etc., all the screens are mainly focussed on junk to buy.  Simply streaming YouTube isn't simple or clear.  So far, it works fine, but I find it cluttered, complex and annoying.  I don't like having to create a Roku account either.  If you want to instantly want to instantly pay to subscribe to Netflix, ESPN, Hulu and spend your life on a couch, maybe you will like it a lot.

This was not a good quality streaming device. It uses WiFi instead of a wired connection and had frequent lags (delays and loading bar showing). It stopped working after only 8 months - 2 months after the return and support window ended. Save your money - DON'T BUY THIS STREAMING STICK. Get a regular Roku. Those at least work.

It works much better than the firestick for sure. Streaming is consistant and picture quality is really good. I do like the sound leveling feature. It makes watching Netflix much more enjoyable. It is easy to use and navigate which is something I personally prefer. I dont need unnecessary bells and whistles that I will never use getting in my way. Netflix and Prime play very well through the Roku, now I just wish Sling would fix the glitches in their systems and I would have the perfect, inexpensive, television system. I am still glad that I got rid of cable though.

I'm a fan of Roku and their interface. The stick worked fine until it didn't under two years later. I'm guessing the antenna crapped out because it wouldn't connect to wifi and can't read the remote. Unfortunately I'm out of warranty and really can't recommend this as Roku Support has been unhelpful. Welp.

I just received this and the installation was easy and it is great!!!  love this product got disney plus on a vizio tvHad this now 3 weeks and it overheats every 15 minutes do not buy seems to be a common problem will return and try another product.

We purchased this item thinking we could get programs for free but... While trying to register they said I they 3 packages I could choose from lowest one was $99.98 and up to around $ 200, you would never have to pay another dime I suckered in and bought the $99.98 package which I still couldn't get much live and most I would have to buy. Rip off I contacted Roku they gave me a real runaround with no results. I then contacted Amazon, returned the Roku for full refund for Roku but had to call company that was on my credit card and thankfully the gave me my $99.98 back. I don't recommend this product.

The new Roku Streaming Stick+ cost me over $68 worked fine for exactly two months, and then it froze on the Roku Screen Saver Page. Customer Service was pleasant and nice but unable to resolve the defect issue. Since it was out of the 30 day return limit but still under warranty, I had to ship it back to Roku Returns at my expense for a refurbished replacement. Still waiting for the replacement Stick and have purchased a Amazon Fire Stick in the mean time.

Still owned some very old roku boxes that stopped working. Glad they did because these have come a long way. Very easy to setup and I just love the remote. You can set it up so it's all you need to use to control your tv and the stick which is great for the elderly who sometimes don't have the ability to control several remotes or can't figure out the complexity of each. Roku has one of the best UX interfaces.

Don't use the voice recognition or Alexa, so couldn't give it a rating. It works great and easy setup. Only problem is that on Hulu when I start to stream a video there is no sound. I have to pause, stop the playback and play it again and then I have sound. Only happen with the Hulu app. I have 4 other Tvs with Roku and it doesn't have that problem, only this stick.

I am using it on a TV that is the farthest from our WiFi router. It is in the kitchen and we had just gotten a brand new Toshiba small screen; but larger than our old TV that we replaced. It has HDR. I'm not sure yet what 4K means so can't comment. The HDR is fabulous and the player is much faster in terms of viewing and navigating the different channels such as NetFlix. We are very, very pleased with it as you can see by the rating. :BIG SMILE:

It takes a lot for me to change. I'm not one to need the newest and best. Just a pragmatic kinda-guy. But WOW! The Roku Streaming Stick FAR EXCEEDED my expectations. My old Roku was so stinking slow! It was slow to boot up. It would pause to upload during a show. It was even slow to receive remote commands. I got a ChromeCast for Christmas but since I don't have a Smart TV I found it almost useless. I exchanged it for this Roku Streaming Stick and am absolutely delighted. Super fast at all the above. Voice commands are solid. Vast selection of FREE Streaming Channels. Easy connection to my subscriptions. Computer screen casting is as easy as the ChromeCast (at least for Macs).

This cheap device is perfect for us. We only have Hulu and I watch a lot of docs on YouTube. I love that I can cast YouTube from my phone! I don't have to search for what I want on the TV keyboard. The picture quality could be a little better but for a bedroom TV that's really just for me, and I'm not picky, I would highly recommend.

The set up was pretty easy, but a little time consuming mainly because I input account info for the premium channels and streaming services we subscribe to. Excellent and easy to use home screen. Nice remote that lets you power on TV, adjust volume - easy to see. I didn't use the voice recognition yet or hook it up to Alexa, but I'm sure it will be fine. I bought one for everyone in the household. Love it!

Remote is garbage. I bought two of these in about three months ago because my cable provider has access to their content only on Roku. I found the one remote was going through batteries like crazy. Recently my wife said do you hear that high pitched noise. It ended up being the remote making an audible internal high pitch whine. The other remote we have doesn't do this. Faulty equipment I've never had these issues with any of the fire devices I've bought. Im not happy with the quality if this product.

I bought the cheaper one for my tv and i loved it so i thought i would upgrade for another one of my tv and bought this one.  I couldn't get these one onto my computer and i called and they said that i need to pay a monthly fee.  So i returned this one and bought they cheaper one, which is 30.00 .  This one does not have a monthly fee to use it.
This was easy to install and comes with preset buttons for Hulu, Disney Plus, Netflix, and Sling. My old Roku did not have all of those. It came with batteries and  was set up in minutes.

The only device in our household that cannot retrieve an internet signal, despite repeated attempts to reset device and router. Roku and Amazon support unable to resolve. And since the issue started after the 30-day return period, I now own a $45 piece of plastic. Incredibly disappointing all around.

I have used the roku since the Roku 2 and LT model.  This is a great improvement.  I was having problems with receiving wifi with the older Roku Ultra model but after replacing it with the stick, the wifi came in perfectly.  Amazing considering it is much smaller than the ultra.  The TV I put it on can't display 4k, only 1080, but who cares, at least I have strong wifi and its another TV I can enjoy my programs on.

This was virtually painless to install. I've had roku for years now and it's always been a huge headache just to get it up and running. Not with this. Simple to install, did it in under a half hour as most of it was loading and signing into roku + channels and viola, finished. It was that easy. I can't comment on the voice recognition or alexa because I don't particularly like to use them.

I bought a amazon firestick light jail broken and the jail broken part did not work the way its advertising and not even a month later i had to reset the firestick and the jail broken part is no longer on the firestick so i am disappointed but everything else still workes great i wish the jail broken part still worked or that at least gotten a movie app free for a month for part that is no longer their
As streaming sticks/boxes go it is very nice. The voice feature works well. My only complaint is that there are some channels that are not available with Fire (such as VUDU) that are with a Roku.

As I joined the cord-cutting movement, I opted for Amazon’s firestick. While I am slightly dismayed that the cost savings where not as eye-popping as I’d hoped; due to the need to subscribe to some app subscriptions to continue viewing some of my favorite shows, the savings I sought where there. Though I’m not yet overjoyed by the move, I am still happy I made the move away from the ever increasing cost of cable television and am pleased with the service the firestick provides.

I originally had the original fire stick and this one the fire stick lite with Alexa is so far advanced there’s no comparison! It’s so much quicker down loading and streaming. Alexa is such a helpful addition to find what I am looking for. I am very pleased I updated my fire stick.

I’ve had the Roku for 3 years. My mother has the Fire Stick. When I seen the Fire Stick on sale on the Amazon App, I purchased it for my Christmas gift. I LOVE IT!! Wished I’d bought the one above the one I got. But the Lite is great too! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!! 👍🏽
This product is fun using with Alexa. Only one thing is missing to control the sound of TV using Fire Stick only. That is doable I know, just waiting for the upgraded one for now.
I dislike that I have to turn off the power and turn it back on after the tv has been turned off for overnight or a long time.Once on it works ok and Alexa works good.

Every title I go into says it can not be played at this time. I have Roku in my other 2 rooms and do not have an issue. Everything is hooked up, but the only show I can get it to play is schitts creek on Netflix. I’ve checked all other streaming services and nothing and even on Netflix it tells me the title can not be played at this time.

Got this for my husband's early Christmas present. He's very excited lol well so far he's liking it. His only complain was there is no spectrum TV. He almost return it because of that mater. The no tv control seems to not bother him at all..

I have an older smart tv so I didn't really NEED a fire stick, but it's very nice to have for the newer apps that aren't available to download on my tv. The only app I wasn't able to download was Peacock. But it was easy to set up and use and transfer between televisions. I'd recommend it to just about everybody.

Love new look n upgrades only bad is some apps will not show ivo for puts generic one for such as mobdro otherwise easy to use and nice increase in memory the little bit makes big difference from last generation

So this was an error in my part but it doesn't actually control your TV so you'll still need 2 remotes. We love fire devices in this house though so it's always worth the buy to have another fire device

Extremely disappointed! Bought to use in place of my Roku, here after couple weeks it’s having on going problems playing Netflix and Hulu amounst other apps. Only one that  works is prime video. I deleted and redownloaded the apps cleared cache everything. Sadly I did have to hook up my Roku again but everything’s been fine since.

The devide is great for searching the various streaming videos (we have Netflix, Prime, Disney+ and Hulu) but I did not realize that I needed to buy the more expensive version to control volumn and set turn on/off.  In retrospect I very much wish that I had purchased the units (I have two) that allows control of on/off and volumn.

This is my 2nd Fire stick &  have it on my bedroom TV & even though I don't have Siri or Iphone etc, this still works when I press the voice icon & speak a command.  Love it.  Wish my 1st one had this on it.

I purchased this to replace a first generation Fire Stick.  Overall it works very well with an excellent picture.  My problem is that to get it to connect I need to unplug and replug power from the stick.
I really think this was a good purchase and I plan to purchase another one. I just got it so I am still getting used to it. My favorite part is being able to talk to Alexa through the tv.

I have rabbit ears only so I thought i was hopeless but when i got the Amazon Fire Stick i was opened up to hundred of free channels which including movies, commentaries, sports, and anything you can imagine. The price was $23 but well worth it.
A great item to add to any tv that’s not on cable. It’s easy to install, hook up, and use. This little Fire stick brings you tons of tv and movie watching. Easy to use too.
I purchased this "lite" stick for my granddaughter.  Only thing different on this one versus the Firestick 4k that I have is that there isn't a volume control on the remote.
It was a little confusing to HBO Max set up but it worked out.  I think Amazon wants to make all other streaming services one step more difficult so you use Amazon Prime first.
bought for friend as a gift. he is enjoying it. he had one that his tv remote took over the firestick and he didn't understand how it worked so I bought this one for him to solve the issue.

I purchased this and it worked great for a couple of weeks. Then all of a sudden it would not work anymore. I exhausted all options. I checked my WiFi and it was good. My internet worked good. Everything was fine. It just stopped working. It was definitely a waste of money. I know these things don't last 10 years, but I figured it would have lasted a lot longer than 2 weeks. Maybe it is defective, but I'm not happy with this product at all.
I purchased this, my 3rd Fire Stick, for my mini projector. Worked out great, no issues. Have had my other 2 for quite some time. They still work perfectly. Great product.
I love the fire stick! It’s an amazing addition to my little movie room and works wonderfully with my projector. It was an amazing deal on BlackFriday and I could not pass it up!

We bought the Fire Stick for discovery+ and found it very easy to install and connect.  Voice recognition works well on both male and female voices.  When we get an additional one for another tv set, we'll probably upgrade to avoid swapping remote controls a lot.  Since we're both quite ancient (I'm still waiting for DOS to come back) I would have liked more complete written instructions on its operation.  Not a real problem once I found lots of tips on line.
Just received this Fire TV Lite Stick.  I am still learning all the options that are available on this device but for the price I am extremely satisfied.  The picture quality is excellent.

Had this fire stick lite for about two weeks.  Was easy to install and set up.  I wanted a low cost option for streaming to add to my not-smart TV and this fit the bill.  Only issue I have had is sound went dead at one point, one time.  I had to unplug power source and unplug the stick and then reconnect both the stick and power.  Sound came back and has been working fine since.  Other than that minor issue, fire stick lite was just what I expected and has worked out fine so far.
I don't know why I waited so long to get a fire-stick. I love that I can have Disney plus and amazon on my tv. my tv is not a smart tv and my playstation is about 10 years old so .
We were really hesitant to switch over to streaming instead of dish - it was so easy to set up & even easier to use! Love the suggested shows once the profiles are set up

We use this Roku on an upstairs den TV, with our wireless modem being downstairs, and this has zero issues with streaming quality. There are some app issues that Roku itself has (can't get HBO Max, certain features within each app), but aside from that the Roku works great (better than the Fire Stick we were using that constantly needed to be unplugged or reset). One of the best features of this Roku is that the remote can be programmed to control the TV power and volume.

I got this to replace our fire stick in our master bedroom. I like the fire stick (now in our guest bedroom), but I like the Roku remote better because it controls TV too. It’s a little more convenient to have just one remote for everything. This Roku stick has great streaming quality and was easy to set up and use.
