   he comprado este producto imaginando que seria un buen producto, pero no es asi en realidad este roku tiene demasiadas fallas en el hardware, desde que he actualizado el sistema operativo del dispositivo roku surgio varias fallas sin poder solucionarlo nunca,se cuelga el dispositivo y me sale varias alertas sobre problemas de alimentacion usb, he probado usarlo conectando el dispositivo conectado directamente el puerto usb del televisor, tambien he intentado usar el dispositivo roku conectando usando su cargador externo y lo mismo no funciona el dispositivo en ultima instancia el reseteado de fabrica el dispositivo con el boton "reset" y no soluciono el problema, todo esto surgio desde que he actualizado el sistema operativo del dispositivo roku, es una lastima he gastado mucho dinero comprando este producto para nada, seguro el vendedor no aceptara reembolso ni reemplazo, es de esperarse por eso les sugiero no comprarlo.. adjunto imagen

I have every streaming device that is out there and this is by far the worst. I have a very well setup TV with a strong high speed wireless connection. All devices (except the Roku) can stream in 4k resolution no problem and function well. I have tried 2 different Roku devices and both stream in low quality no matter what I do. Both consistently cut out and need to be restarted.  And both have very poor interfaces and general functionality. I will NEVER buy another Roku product.

My first day without TV Service and I am already pleasantly surprised. I received my ROKU today. It was very easy to setup and choose the apps for which I have subscriptions already, such as Netflix, Prime and Pandora. There are many free apps that will let me watch the news and TV shows. The whole process is easy and, so far, without issue. I just saved myself $100 a month! Yes!

The Roku Streaming Stick + delivers what it promises. I'm not a techie person but it was quite easy to set up. The streaming movies are very high quality and there is zero hesitation or pixelation. I still have not figured out how to use all the features, but I do NOT anticipate it will be a difficult.The best part is that the Roku Streaming Stick+ represents my family's first step in cutting the cord. Our cable bills were getting pricey and we did not watch 90% of the channels on our Direct TV package. We immediately cut our premium Direct TV channels and have not missed a beat. You truly can not beat the value it represents. Overall, the Roku is well worth the money upfront plus you save each month by cutting the cord. You will not regret your purchase!

If you are debating on getting this do it. We have a Roku tv in the bedroom and wanted a smart tv for the living room but didn’t want to spend the money. We have been using a chrome cast which doesn’t work half the time and was very frustrating. Finally we decided to get the Roku stick and omg it works so good and the quality is 10x times better!! We didn’t realize the quality sucked so bad on the chromecast until we got this. Also we can watch cable through the spectrum app so we literally only need this one remote now.

I bought this ROKU stick and plugged it into my brand new Samsung TV.  It worked for a month.  Then I started having problems streaming any of the channels I paid for.  Netflix, HULU and Amazon Prime will not work on this TV.  My other TV's that don't have the ROKU stick work just fine.  I took the ROKU stick off of my TV and everything works just fine.  I am stuck with a piece of junk that I can't use.

Bought 3 of these! They are amazing! I turned my 4 spectrum dvr cable boxes which saved me $150+ per month. I can download all kinds of apps for tv watching [spectrum cable (pay for streaming only which is less), Netflix, Hulu, espn, hbo plus, start, Amazon, etc.] I just plug it in my hdmi, connect it to wick, and viola- I got streaming! I even travel with it. Great buy and easy use!

Great product if you want to avoid a cable TV bill or want to put TV's in rooms where there's no cable hookup.  I don't use Alexa or voice recognition as I'm using the Xfinity streaming service, but it avoids the monthly rental fee for a basic/standard cable box.  You will need to cut the power to it now & then, but it works great.

Roku will never fix their remote!  You have to take the batteries out of the remote daily.  You also have to unplug the Roku stick every day because taking the batteries out of the remote and putting them back in again only works for about an hour or so, then when that stops working you have to go back and unplug the Roku to have a 50% chance that it fixes the issue.  Roku knows this is a problem and they refuse to fix it!

I bought a Roku TV earlier this year and immediately fell in love with the interface and options, so I bought this device for my non-smart TV. Its really easy to use both the controller and interface, its easy to add channels, especially if you have a Roku account, it automatically downloaded all the apps I had on my Roku TV. The voice is like any voice-activated device, it gets it most of the time. It loads pretty quickly, and it sinks to the TV, so I only use one remote. Definitely happy with the purchase and would recommend it over other streaming devices. And yes, you can link your prime account.

10 months after purchase it just stopped working. Unplugging and reconnecting power would fix it for 10 minutes or so and then it would fail. Tried this repeated times with same results.UPDATE Roku customer service promptly offered a new device if I sent the old one back, which I promptly did. Awaiting acknowledgment of the return and the receiving a new Roku Streaming Stick +, that ideally will work for longer than 9 months.

I have 4 Roku Devices, 1 high-end device, and 3 basic sticks.  I got sick and tired of replacing the batteries in the Roku remote every few weeks.  And NO, I do not plug headphones into my Roku stick.  Finally moved to another device.  RIP Roku.  Don't believe me, do a search for "Roku remote draining batteries".

Quick and easy to install.I don't use the voice control so I can't rate that function. I don't have Alexa so that function is not rated by me.I installed the device on a standard (none Roku ) older model TV and had no problem.Several channel options available with th Roku streaming stickVery satisfied with my device

Fast response, even though my television set is on another floor from the router.  Have noticed that the Roku has "frozen" a few times, which is fixed by simply unplugging and then replugging into the HDMI port.  Given that I can easily reach the ports without moving anything, this is a minor inconvenience.  If it were to be plugged into a hard to access HDMI port this could be a bigger problem.

I love this device and all the apps I am able to use with it (Netflix, HBOGO, Amazon Prime, Pandora, BeachBody OnDemand, etc). My only problem is after about a month of use, I've begun to encounter daily issues with Roku dropping connection. When connection is lost Roku freezes and it's difficult to even get back to the homepage so all I can do is reach behind my TV and press the reset button on the Roku stick. This occurs whether the TV has been off for several hours or even while I'm actively watching something. Everytime it happens I check my Wifi connection and other devices and there is never anything wrong. So then I have to reset the Roku, sometimes it takes several tries before it connects again. I have my internet router positioned directly beside the TV with the Roku stick. I have the Roku stick connected to a power outlet (using the cords and adapters provided by Roku). None of my other devices lose connection like this. It's unfortunate because otherwise I'd say this is a fantastic little device.

Purchased in part because it’s supposed to turn tv on and off to eliminate the need for multiple remotes. TV is 2 year old Sony so should work. Roku support is poor, said it’s a common issue yet could not resolve. Msg says remote does not support voice control. Said they will escalate but not calls back no timeframe to call back. Called  back today, same story but no help. Waiting for call back. This item may be going back. I have 4 Roku devices, where is the service?

I have used Roku’s from the first generation, this model is my favorite for a few reasons:- fast performance (no noticeable difference between the speed of my 2017 “ultra”)- able to be powered from TV USB port- remote includes power and volume function for TV. This is a game changer as we only pull out the TV remote to change inputs occasionally now.

We bought this as a replacement for our older ROKU; however, it has proven to almost non-functional.  It overheats, even when placed in a position with nothing but open space around it.  It continually displays a HDPC error message, which requires a hard reboot to correct.  Reboots typically take at least 5 minutes to accomplish.  I don't need to sit around waiting for this to happen, with no guarantee that I won't have to repeat the process multiple times, when I want to stream content.  Our Amazon and Chrome devices to do not exhibit these annoying characteristics; I would recommend one of them.

This device is terrible! Every time we use it the remote or Roku freezes. We spend 10 min pressing the same button over and over, sometimes it will eventually work and other times we just give up. The remote will always adjust the volume so it’s definitely a problem with the remote/Roku combination and not the tv. We have used other Roku systems without a problem but this one is junk!!! I would give zero stars if I could.
Our Netflix was not going to be active on our TV starting in December so we needed to do something. The ROKU works great and was easy to install and get setup.

Great device!  Snappy in response (I use Portal), and would recommend that if your TV has always-on USB, it stays live and ready in an instant, if not, use the included USB adapter to keep the power on the Roku.  We love it!

Roku Streaming Stick+ | 4K/HDR/HD streaming player with 4x the wireless range & voice remote with TV power and volume (2017)









  
  
    
  Having the previous generation Roku Premier+ on our primary TV I was getting frustrated with our Gen 1 Chromecasts on our other TVs.  So I picked up the new Streaming Stick+ on Black Friday.  One word, Wow.  It grabbed our channels from the Premier+ and set up the Stick+.  The unified remote is great.  At least for my Samsung TV.  I haven't played with the voice search yet.  But I haven't had any issues with the unit.  No dropped connections.  No lagging (Google WiFi mesh).  Donated the Chromecast to a local school.

Menus are a pain to navigate compared to a standard cable box and the signal will randomly buffer for seemingly no reason, but that is more an issue with my cable company and their app than the Roku itself. They could probably do a better job if Roku used a full sized remote with number buttons and all that jazz though.

The Roku stick + worked fine for when I had its app up. I never have been able to get it to control volume on the TV. Also it will not turn the TV on or off.  I have another stick for another TV in our house and it works fine.  I tried to get help from Roku. Could not get it to work with web site help and could not find a phone number for technical support.

This is my third Roku.  I like the interfaces.  The remote on the streaming stick+ is excellent.  The power button and volume buttons work great on my TV.  Thus, I can use the Roku remote all the time.I rated it only 4 stars for the lack of Dolby Vision.  If you have a Dolby Vision TV (and don't want to use the built in smart apps) then consider using a streaming device other than a Roku.  In my case I use the Rokus on my older HD TVs, and use a 2019 Nvidia Sheild Pro on my main 4k TV with Dolby Vision.

Cable is getting so expensive in our area, and is going up even more in a few days, that we finally decided to "cut the cable".  After doing alot of research, we decided to get a Roku stick.  I hooked it up on my small kitchen tv and I couldnt believe how clear the picture was.  Very easy to hook up and the Roku practically set itself up.  So I ended up sending for another Roku stick for the bedroom tv, and the Roku Ultra for the living room tv. All tv's come in as good, or better than cable. Wish we would of done this long ago.  The only negative thing I have to say is there is no mute button on the remote. Very happy with this purchase =)

It's a great picture, Great Menu an easy to access but tiny Remote.The one drawback is the volume is on the side and it's gets accidentally Tripped all too often, you can use your cellphone but that might get heavy.

I bought this to replace a Roku 3 in a bedroom.  As it plugs right in to the TV's HDMI & USB port for power I don't have to see the box hanging about or keep it plugged in to a power socket.  It's highly portable and I've traveled with it.  Seems faster than the Roku 3 and of course is 4K capable.  Great for streaming off a media server across the house as my Roku Ultra in the main room is connected directly.  Paid $50 on Prime Day but worth the retail price.
I love this Firestick so much, For $29.99 it lets me watch so much different TV, it integrates well with the Alexa and love the voice command. Great value for the price

   Es la primera vez que pruebo uno y la verdad me encantó fluidez y rendimiento están bastante buenos, lo único que me hubiera gustado es que la alimentación fuera por el mismo puerto HDMI para no tener que poner más cables conectando el cargador, fuera de esto está genial, espero comprarme ahora la versión que soporta 4k y está obsequiarla.
Works great at my little lake house where I used to only get only three channels, but now I receive my Netflix, Hulu, Disney and multiple other channels that work great.
Works well got a good deal. Just Renee there's not tv buttons on a lite but it's a better deal! We actually purchased 2 more on sale from QVC because Amazon's $ we t up

I love everything about Fire stick, especially with the Alexa portion of it.  One thing I do wish was different, is when u trigger the screen saver, it doesn't hold yr place in line.  It goes back to something else, like another show or back to the beginning to the home screen.  Then if u forget what episode you're watching, u have to go back through all yr episodes to figure it out

Wanted a second fire stick for our bedroom because we recently set up a projector. This Lite version is perfect because the projector and sound are separate so we didn’t need those buttons on the remote. Other than that it works the same as our normal fire stick. This was a perfect option that was a bit more cost effective. Would definitely recommend.
I cant review this item iam still having trouble setting it up on my tv iam 70 yrs old this stuff dont come easy for me if I dont get figured out it's going back to store.
We are in south Florida for the winter and wanted to stream tv on our old RV TVs.  This was the best option because it was cheapest Fire TV  available.  Having voice recognition was a bonus.
I love the amount of selection you get on this Firestick, and there is very little buffering. I’ve got a southern accent, and Alexa understands what I’m saying. A great price for a LOT of enjoyment.

I love that it has voice recognition and volume control! For one, I don’t have to search for buttons anymore in the dark and two, I don’t have to bother with a second remote. The Firestick has been perfected.

It goes blank sometimes and audio is off. I have power off and on constantly. I was told to reset it to factory and also remove 3" hdmi cable. This is on my Emerson tv that is 10 yrs old. But that shouldn't matter. NEVER had problems with audio or anything till I installed the fire tv lite. It's a piece of crap.
Love this device.  I am so tired of cable bills that keep going up and offer hundreds of channels that I don't want or watch and don't off channels that I would like to have.
I bought this to replace an older firestick that I use with a second TV.  It works well for me.  I use it to watch Amazon Prime, Hulu, and Netflix.  I haven't tried the Alexa voice features yet.

The new firestick worked out great for me. It was just what i needed to add extra room for apps.And the price was GREAT you cant beat it and it works super. Good buy don't pass it up great Xmas gift for some lucky person.
We had the old fire stick which was out dated and not working right. Finally upgraded to this one and it works great, easy to use, set up, and happy that we finally upgraded.
Got this lite firestick to go with my projector since it isn’t 4K or anything. Honestly this thing awesome. Does the job and is half the cost of the others. Highly recommend.
It is useful device . Easy to operate. More and more features available . I enjoy many features of my liking. The buyers will never be disappointed with this device.

I use Apple TV and Roku devices on multiple televisions.  I got fire stick primarily because it allows vpn apps.  Its been more than a month now and i love it.  For the price, i will highly recommend fire stick especially if you want to use VPN

This was perfect for my guest room TV.  The voice recognition is great!  Works excellent with Alexa!  This was a great purchase at a great price!....You get a lot of channels to stream!  We are very satisfied with this Amazon Fire stick!
I don’t recommend this model to anyone, due to lack of TV controls.  tried it just to see & it’s not worth the bargain price.bluetooth transmitter seems weak too.

I love this! I finally cut my cord and bought two of these for my 2 TVs. If I had known how easy it was to set up and get started I would have done earlier. I was replacing cable with my TiVo box with this and although I find the UI not quite as good as TiVo, it’s pretty great. I have all my apps set up and watch live tv when I want through YouTube tv. The remote works well but a little flimsy but I do like that Netflix (and others) have their own button. I haven’t yet used my phone for remote but it’s great that is an option, especially since the buttons on the remote don’t light up.If you are even thinking about it, just do it. It’s a very reasonable price for such a high quality service.

Piece of garbage. It does not connect to internet despite being the extended range model and have 75 percent of WiFi. To fix I undertake the following: restarting the device for 30 minutes, unplugging and restarting until 50 percent of the time it connects. Often I have to reset the device and completely start over with it, which takes about 20 minutes anyway.  I’ve attempted to contact roku to resolve the issue (replace) and they do nothing. I own three other rokus and two of the other three work pretty well. All seem to suffer from connection issues. I’m trashing this one and getting Apple TV I don’t see the same issues with them. In the end don’t buy this, doesn’t work as advertised and if you have an issue expect no help from Roku.

I don't like writing bad reviews, but I feel like I had to on this specific device.Before you'll starting reading inside I'll just say in Advance: I have no idea if the device is good or not since I've not used it. the low score comes from the awful feeling I've gotten from it.By no choice, take this rating as "the device is bad and you shouldn't buy it" but just as my feeling towards the device.So, I've ordered the Roku Streaming Stick+ 2 months ago since I've started using netflix, and my girlfriend wanted to watch it on her TV (which is not a smart TV). Fast forward a month, the streamer has yet to arrive, and once I contact the support, they tell me it's probably lost in the shipping, and that they will send me a new device.After another month of waiting, the device finally shows up. I'm going to my-girlfriend house to try and start-up the Roku device, and it fails. trying to figure out what I am doing wrong with all the troubleshooting guides inside of Roku's site without successes, and after contacting the Roku's live support, it turns out that my Roku device is probably just a defect and I'll need to wait another month if I want another device.Now, I don't know about anyone reading the review, but I wouldn't like waiting 3 months for a single streaming device, and therefore I've asked for a refund.I'm writing this review mostly because of my disappointment, and the waste of my 2 months. and I've gave it 2 stars because I feel as the live support representatives were nice. I for one, will probably not order this item again, But as I've said in the begging, I have no idea how to device works, or if he's good enough once he's working.Thank you for your time reading my review.Nir.

Wow. I feel sooo stoopid!!! I should have bought this when I first heard of Roku. it's so much better than cable!! It's super easy to install, easy to use....User friendly remote. I bought Hulu plus so I can stream live TV as well...I am now saving $100 a month vs what I had been playing for cable! Side note, I also bought a modem, so all I am playing for is internet.

A good answer for someone looking to get rid of cable box rentals, the rest of the content is a welcome bonus. It really is great for streaming. I also have fire sticks to get what isn't offered on the roku. I actually got the fire sticks first, but unfortunately they don't have the Xfinity app available.

I liked be able to see the channels that I like. I did not use the voice recognition nor alexa with it. I found it was easier to add channels to the roku, by using my computer instead of the arrows on the remote. The streaming to the roku was much better faster than when I tried to use the computer alone.

So far this item has worked well.  However, I can't give them five stars because I have been having trouble with the remote.  In one day's time, the remote quit two times.  I have had to shake it to make it work again.  I'm afraid it is going to quite working completely.  The actual stick words very well and is easy to install.I am happy to be able to give Roku five stars --  I had trouble with my first remote and they quickly sent me a new one.  Everything is working fine and canceling my Frontier TV and buying a Roku Streaming Stick was one of the best moves I have made. I now have much more TV access and at a lower rate than ever before.  There is no comparison between Frontier TV and all the great access you have through using a streaming device.  I liked the Roku  stick so well that I bought a second one for my other TV.

Update: I discovered from several online forums there is an issue with Samsung 4K HDR TVs and Roku. You must force the Roku to use regular 4K and not the 4K HDR display setting to avoid the terrible image quality. Still not perfect but at least watchable now.Original Review:This device is awesome with 60 fps channels and regular tv at 30 fps but is unwatchable with live sports at 30 fps. With Youtube TV the local sports channels are transmitted at 30 fps and the on screen image is horrific.Since I bought because I could have online DVR on sports channels I cannot use this devuice. Bought a Nvidia shield and 30 FPS is watchable even though its not as good as DTV 1080i.

I originally bought a Firestick, and was cool with it...But it didn’t have the Xfinity app available to watch live tv on my outdoor projector.This may not be a deal breaker for some, but it was something I wanted for my outdoor viewing.I gave the firestick a 4/5 star, so for that reason, I give the Roku 5 stars.

We finally decided to do away with cable and got the Roku Streaming Stick Plus and our only regret is that we didn't do it a lot sooner! It was easy to set up, and very easy to operate. The only issue we have is that occasionally it will freeze up on the welcome screen but we just have to unplug the power from the Roku stick for about 10 seconds and then plug it back in to reboot it and then it's fine. We used to have to do this with our cable box as well so it could just be our internet service. If we decide to purchase another streaming device we'd definitely stick with a Roku!

I didn't know what I was missing.  I was upgrading my old Roku.  It is so much faster.  With my old one I couldn't get Hbomax to come in.  I have Amazon and the new format is wonderful.  I wish I has the money to replace my other Roku.
I have to unplug it and plug it back in every time I use it!

We decided to cancel our cable to save money by going to streaming video.  I was sick of paying so much for channels we never watched.  I have Cat 6 Ethernet cables to all of my TV locations, so I initially purchased two Roku Ultras, which support Ethernet connections.  They work great and I'm very pleased with their quality and performance.  I decided to try the Streaming Stick+ to test a wireless connection to the TV in my office.  I am also very pleased with the performance of the Roku Streaming Stick+.  I intend to purchase additional Ultras for the rest of our indoor TVs and move the Streaming Stick + to the outside TV on our deck.  I have recommended both the Roku Ultra and Streaming Stick+ to friends who are considering cutting their cable.

It allowed me to have an inexpensive way to update my system. My 10 year old Sony Blu-Ray DVD player is no longer supported by Amazon Prime or Netflix (and probably many more). With this Roku streaming device, I now can get those services. And, the update cost me <$50. I was able to set it up myself too!!!

   Really good investment! I was going to buy a Roku TV but I didn’t want to pay $400 to get the same size TV that I already have and I didn’t want to downsize either. If it wasn’t for the Prime Day deal I probably would’ve never thought to buy it. It took 5 minutes to set up and BOOM, I have a Roku TV 🤷🏽‍♀️🙂

The Roku worked great for the first 2 months.  After 2 months the remote started to drain the batteries.  Within 1 week the batteries were dead.  There is ABSOLUTELY no customer support from Roku.  They make a great product but if a problem happens you have to buy a new unit.

definitely better than the entry level roku.  cleaner installation and power/volume on remote is much more convenient.  one quibble...bought this brand new, not refurbished.  after 2 weeks, the remote batteries were dead.  minor inconvenience, but remote batteries should last for a year, not a couple of weeks.

Have not used voice control.  Volume control works well with tv.  This as the fastest loading ROKU so far. Can’t say the extended antenna works any better for WiFi signal strength about the Same as older version, but no problems and good picture quality.  Would buy again.

So far have loved everything about the Roku Streaming Stick.  It's extremely easy to set up and use.  There are,  between all the different channels,  1000"s of free movies,  TV series,  or access to your favorite TV programs.  Of course you can subscribe as well,  but right now,  we're very happy with what's free.  I have since ordered a Roku Sound bar and still waiting for it to arrive.  I highly recommend the Roku Stick.

Love this Roku, easy to install and I’m saving about $100 a month from cable including the apps I’m paying for. Just be aware that when your internet goes out your Roku will too so keep that in mind when dumping cable.  We lowered our internet to the slowest cheapest speed and no problems. Glad we switched

Love this little stick!! It works great! I don’t have very good WiFi strength in my bedroom so I got this stick because it has a WiFi extension thing on it. It obviously works cause I don’t have any problems now! The only downside for me is that it isn’t comparable with my TV which is strange. I have a new “element” brand TV. Maybe that’s not a big brand or something?  All that means is that I can’t control the volume with the Roku remote. No biggie though! I really like it and I have recommended it to a few people already. I’ve had it about a month so far.

We recently went from cable to streaming tv, it was a little iffy at first so we purchased several of these Roku sticks and ever since the streaming service has been fantastic.This stick turns any tv with a USB port into a Roku tv, this allows you to stream your tv service rather than use a cable or dish service. It's easy to use, similar to choosing an app on your smart phone but you're choosing it on your television screen using a the included remote. We have no issues with streaming hanging or buffering since we added the Roku stick.Great product, we are very happy with the purchase and it has helped to save us hundreds monthly using Roku and a streaming service over cable.I highly recommend this product.

I only rate it at 4 stars because the mute button on the remote is in the worst possible location. They should fire the designer because you keep accidentally hitting the mute button just holding the remote.

First time ever to use a Roku. Quick and easy to set up. I cut the cord 3 years ago and had been using a Samsung Blue Ray player to stream Netflix & YouTube to my 2014 LG Led HD TV (not a smart TV). I thought it was really great, until I received the Roku on December 21st. I watched a video on Amazon.com to see how to connect it to my TV. It took maybe less then 5 minutes total for me to have the Roku all set up and running and then I continued watching the movie I had been watching earlier on Netflix with the Blue Ray before the Roku came to my door, but now using the Roku. WONDERFUL!!! The quality of the picture is fantastic! Love that I only need one remote now. I am so happy with this product. No cords hanging, just used the HDMI (2) slot and the USB port and that was it. I still have my Blue Ray in the HDMI(1) spot to watch DVD"s. This device is incredible! One of my brother's asked me, "is it legal?" With all the stations available, with many FREE movies, I will NEVER go back to a subscription TV service again! THANK YOU ROKU!!! Best Christmas present ever!!!

I am disturbed by the fact that Roku doesn't tell you that their voice recognition is not compatible with YouTube TV.  In other words, if you want to stream CBS News (as an example) if you're using YouTube TV streaming services, you will not get the streaming from YouTube TV but rather the 3rd party app supplied by Roku.I've been mistakenly using the voice commands and getting the 3rd party streaming versions, and if you do not know, they ARE DIFFERENT from what's on YouTube TV.  I paid $20 extra each for 3 Roku Steaming Sticks + for no reason.  Maybe they'll trade down for me?

I normally dont write these but this is the second ROKU device I bought over the last week. Both have had issues. This one wouldn't let me watch tv. It kept saying HDCP error 020. I followed the instructions on the screen and nothing helped! I know its not my inputs since I have used them with the xbox but I wanted something smaller in my living room. So annoyed! I want to love this since sooo many people do but I didnt spend 50 dollars to buy my own HDMI cable and hope it works! I will be returning it.

I've been thinking about getting out of the Comcast monopoly for awhile now, and this Roku allowed me to pull the trigger! I switched to a slower 20MB internet with small local provider, but I still get HD quality on my TV! Surprisingly I feel like the picture quality is better than the xfinity X1 platform. I opted to go with PlayStation vue streaming service which I am enjoying thus far. Also easy to access amazon TV and Netflix. I'll save about 2,000 this year using the roku player, well worth the price.

Roku is great for streaming.  Being shut in during COVID, we enjoyed  watching Amazon Prime movies and shows.  I hoped to mirror my  Windows 10 PC,.  The computer recognizes that there is another screen and a Roku device, but it will not mirror.  All the community instructions are for a Roku app on a windows phone, not a PC.  I am disappointed.  Roku has no support.

I've been using Roku for years and years. I'm amazed that this little Roku "stick" is way more powerful that the old Roku 3 box that I was using before. If anybody's interested in K-Drama, I use this Roku almost exclusively for "Kocowa" - it's a Korean Drama channel that has a special (Roku only) feature: It allows you to watch in without subtitles unless you use the replay (skip back) button,  then it shows you the English subtitles for that part only. Good for anyone learning Korean.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! AAA+++

We had issues with our DVD player that we also used to stream video, so we purchased the stick. It's worked extremely well. Easy to set up. The voice search is tons easier than typing in items. The only reason for not giving it five stars is a feature few devices now have: showing the running time of what we're watching - you have to hit pause to see that information. This feature might be possible on the Roku box, but it didn't offer it, so we got the stick. If you're having issues with your DVD player/streaming device, definitely go with a Roku.
I didn't like this at all
Works as intended. Not all functions used. I  could probably benefit with some personal demo. Upgraded from earlier model so now I have 2 TVs available to stream.

I hate it because all my friends want me to install on theirs. But to install kodi takes a few minutes. Easy peasy...until you have to log into stick. Always wants to connect to my Amazon account.  That is only drawback If you are going to install kodi on a friends. Do it at their house saves you time...I can't believe how well and fast these work.

Works great for most apps. The reason for the lower rating is because Amazon still has not figured out how to get Disney+ to work properly. I have 2 fire sticks for 2 different tv's. Disney+ only works properly on the Roku
The Firestick is attached to a TV in my guest room.  The setup was very easy, and it's easy to use.  I have not set up the smart features since it's a guest room.

This particular Fire Stick (Lite) is good for integration with a Projector, but not really good for today's new television.  If looking to integrate with a television please purchase the 4K Fire Stick with tv and volume control.
This is all we use in our home, and I’m so glad I could get another for my sons room. It makes a huge difference passing about 20 a month for subscription than 150 plus for cable.

Alex is pretty good it’s almost like having a maid I mean she won’t make you eggs and coffee but if you need to know what the weather is like or you want to hear your favorite song when you wake up or listen to how Biden‘s inauguration went Then you’re in luck a definite for stars out of five Another cool feature you can find out what’s playing at a theater near you or if you wanna catch a show or you’re in the market for some thing at Amazon Alexis got you covered four out of five stars.

Lost the remote to our original Refurbished Fire Stick and ordered this version.  I immediately noticed a difference in how fast this new one responded compared to the old one.  Was easy to setup and migrate my apps and settings over with the QR code’s and ability to use my fun to login and sync the apps.
I'm really happy with the voice recognition to change channels and especially to go forward or back. So much handier than 30 seconds forward and 10 seconds back.
I have an old Smart TV and the OS is out of date and apps were slow.. Bought this to replace the smart features and this little stick is very fast!  The TV is like brand new!
Great product for the money.  Does what it says and very reliable and easy to use.  Great value for lite version.  The only difference in the remote is no volume control.

Terrible device. Buffers constantly. Freezes entirely occasionally. My roku never has ANY of these problems. I literally only bought this thing to watch twitch on my TV, and it can't even manage that. Amazon should be ashamed to put their name on this device.
I bought lite, so no volume control. Replaced an aging Firestick that was blowing through batteries every 10 days. Since I replaced it, none of the previous issues.

we got this so I could add HBO max to a television that is a couple of years older. I really like the way it integrates all of your tv apps and creates a personal home screen integrating all.it also works with my echo dot and I can give voice commands insite the app.  I will be adding to other tvs.. great value for the price to update a television to get the latest!
My system is controlled by Control 4 and I saw no way to integrate Alexa into it, so the lite Fire TV was a basic compromise and it works well but requires the Samsung remote
Best streaming device ever! My home is fully equipated of firesticks. I prefer using this one instead of roku because firestick is more interface friendly. Highly recommended

I like watching comedians and ran out of standup shows on Netflix. This opened up so many new apps with shows to watch. I grew up with commercials, so having them interrupt some of the shows is not really a big deal for me.
Personally, Alexa creeps me out. I probably won't use that feature much. However, I do like my Firestick. Everything I could possibly want to see at my fingertips.

I am so angry to learn this was already linked to my account and had my login info on it already.  Why is the box to do this already checked when you order it? How many even notice this? Then we innocently give it as a gift and boom, our log on info is all there. NOT SMART AMAZON! Not smart at all!
Best firestick ever.I have the original in my living room, so I bought this one $25.99And it rocks. Its faster at everything and hook up was a breeze
I have multiple sticks and Fire Tv's but I bought this one for my mother. I got it set up for her but now the fun part, teaching her to use it. Wish me luck. Lol

Try this before you buy a smart TV with the same definition. The voice recognition is spot on, the stream quality is excellent, and the Alexa integration works great. The same as my echo dot, but you have to press the button instead.
Love the new Fire stick Generation 3 it's a lot faster no lag can watch the movies without it searching consoling trying to find the movie it is wonderful thank you

It stopped working after 2 months.  I have two others with no problems whatsoever.  I tried the stick on my other TV's and it just doesn't work.  The TV's don't recognize that this particular stick is plugged in.  It's just defective from the beginning.  It was almost impossible to plug into the port, the power cord was just as difficult to plug into the stick.  Will need to determine if there is a warranty.
Volume control doesn't work.Alexa activation is hit-or-miss.Definitely not designed for a hybrid television setup (regular cable service on HDMI 1 and Firestick on HDMI2).Do not recommend.
There is almost nothing on regular TV or DirecTV which my husband and I have had for 22 years.Firestick is the only place for us to see any new (at least new to us) TV.LOVE IT
The alexa works ok.  I find that it doesn't understand me half the time.  The TV functions are great though.  We watch prime, Netflix, hulu, and disney+ with it.
Fire Stick Lite works just as well as my other regular Fire Sucks.Voice recognition and Alexa integration are the same on the Lite.I will order more.
Nice device - inexpensive, easy to hook up, large selection of apps, smooth streaming and picture is very clear and sharp. I'm using it with ethernet adapter and without Alexa.

Moved outside of a Comcast area and made the decisison to cut the cord. ROKU is amazing and runs well off a 25MBPS internet connection. Everything is on demand and with the additional Hulu subscription it is better than cable or Satelite. Setup is easy and quick. Love this thing and we have 4 in our house now. Also, you  an place TVs anywhere and you don't need to worry about running ugly coax cables all over the room.

Would not buy again, it's not worth the frustration of having to install new batteries every two to three days even with little to no use during that time frame. Brand new Duracell batteries lasted 4 days. I'm absolutely unhappy with this device's remote, will be returning it for a refund.

This is our first time using a Roku device, or any live streaming device for that matter, and I am not impressed. We use the Roku for Hulu live TV and the Roku is constantly disconnecting from the internet (we have 100 mbps, can't imagine what it's be like with slower internet) and we are forced to restart the Roku every time. This is all after only having the Roku for a day and a half. Needless to say, we are going to be switching back to cable.

Returned to Roku as we had tried a different kind of streaming product that did not work. The other product kept making my TV freeze up and the voices would get out of sync numerous times during shows, and I even had to turn some programs off because of it.  Never have this issue when I'm using Roku.

Seems like a great little unit and was fine for a few months but then started having little glitches... freezing, running slow, even once got an error message it was over heating... lately has started loading and showing connected but just won’t do anything. We’ve been able to get past this for a couple months by turning tv on/off or just waiting 3 minutes but now, nothing. New remote batteries, disconnected from tv, unplugged and reset tv... nothing it just stopped working. Disappointed roku has always been so good. Shouldn’t have to replace electronics in less than a year.

This product was most annoying.  One has to hit a button several times while shaking or jarring the remote to get it to work.  IT IS THE WORST thing I have ever experienced in a remote.  I wanted to return it but I didn't know what the time frame for return was.  I have another ROKU that works perfectly in another room but it doesn't have voice capability.  I was extremely disappointed.

Would never buy again. Remote stopped pairing after a year. I’ve tried all of the troubleshooting and switched batteries a ton, the stick and the remote just aren’t pairing. I can’t even control the device through my IOS app as a backup because the ROKU has dropped from my network, but I can’t re-connect the stick to my network without the remote. I also can’t add the device manually to my app because I need the remote to check the settings to get the IP address. What a waste of money.

The remote died after 6 months.  Impossible to get a replacement for a decent price.  The Android app connects maybe 1 out of 5 tries and only then after 5 minutes of searching.  Of course, it forgets everything if you turn your phone off for more than a minute.  Piece of junk, I'm going back to the Amazon Fire.  I didn't like the UI of it, but at least the remote works even after my dogs got ahold of it and chewed it up and it stayed in a rainstorm overnight.

This has awesome quality. No problem setting up. I was NOT asked for a cc #. BUT my stick and plug was HOT TO TOUCH. I returned and was sent another one. Same problem. I'm not going to bother with a third. It's sad to say that after I researched 'over heating' in reviews quite a few appeared. Now I dont know what to do :(Thanks to Amazon for making returns painless!!!

Had this for just one two months and the USB power adaptor cord is bad. Was intermittent and then just quit. Amazon doesn't have the replacement and their customer service was horrible (thanks Somit)  Told me to contact Roku, which I did and just had to pay another $20 to get a working cord. Great service Amazon (not)

I got a deal on an LG 32" TV smart TV that has a great picture, but was extremely frustrated by the clunky interface. The Fire Stick Lite changed all that! The voice control and easy-to-use remote unit provide excellent, intuitive control for Netflix, Amazaon Prime Video,  Youtube, and all of the other standard apps that we use. Works great!
Horrible, makes my tv lose sound until I unplug and plug back in. Also you have to scroll down past a bunch of Prime Video ads no one wants to watch. Returning.
I just wanted a simple streaming device to access YouTube for cycling videos. No bells or whistles. I really like the simplicity of this the device. And, "The Price Was Right!".
This was a gift for my husband. He LOVES it. We haven't tried Alexa yet so I can't say anything about voice recognition. But this is definitely a good product.

My son got a TV for Christmas so I bought him a firestick so he could watch Disney plus and other kid friendly shows. I love the voice recognition feature so I don’t have to scroll to a show I can just talk into the remote. We have had no issues and everything on my sons TV is perfect for a 4 year old.
I need Help, I can not , turn off the fire stick, there is no power button, so when I turn off the TV the stick is still on hope someone can help me with this problem.

Used up All (90%) of my data just from being plugged in for the month. I have a 1.2 TB data limit. Never in my life have I came this close. I had no idea it used so much data and ended up costing us for overages. Unplugged and won't be using again...
Didn’t realize that the “Lite” version didn’t include the ability to control the TV. So, we now need two remotes to control that TV. Should have read the description better I guess.
The only fault I have is if I don't use it in a few days when it comes on there is no volume, quite annoying.  I reset it and it's fine, but feel I shouldn't have to.
Presently not working properly,it goes to free tv on our stream tv and can not get it to go to anything else,changed batteries did not help. Only had 2 months.
I was able to set up the device is less than 10 minutes. A lot of apps for TV, movies and music. The Alexa function works great and doesn't interfere with my home Echo device. Recommended.
I'm used to another streaming format but needed another hook up for an older non smart tv.  Was able to get this on a Prime Deal so I'm happy with the purchase.
Amazon product has changed to  the worst
I, for one love the firestick ANYTHING.. This lite version, I bought for my disabled brother. So, of course it will work and with amazon prime, it's a win win,,
Item arrived on schedule, sadly, it work just as good as the one I want to replace.Return Reason: It does not work. I did the change of battery, etc.,etc.

I am so happy I bought this! It was super easy to set up. It came with very understandable instructions on how to set up. It works great. I love the extra alexa feature. This is such a great price for an awesome item. Im so glad I got it. Ive recommended it to others.

I have owned several Firesticks and love them. They are a basic necessity these days and once they are set up they deliver the streaming with no problems. I used this one on an older TV and was not sure the TV would support the Firestick technology but it worked perfectly. Highly recommend this product..
I purchased this Fire Stick recently and I must say it is super smooth. The menu layout is nice hence the ability to switch between profiles is lightning quick also.

I would probably rate it higher if we did not have to get up and disconnect and then reconnect the power supply every time we go to access it. It is the only way the unit actually works and powers on...otherwise we would be forced to watch a blue screen, that’s as far is it goes by itself. :(
I really like this device. Its okay that it doesn't control the volume because you can do everything else. The apps are great, the new menu is fantastic and I don't know what I'd do without it!

Got this to replace my FireTV once Amazon made it impossible to access YouTube anymore.  I like it better and I don't think I'd go back even if they sorted it out.  Volume and power control on the Roku remote.  Buttons that go STRAIGHT to Netflix, Hulu, Sling and Playstation Vue.  Takes commands through Alexa if you're willing to spring for a $1 per month subscription to Quick Remote.  All around worth it.  I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

I have about 5 fire sticks over time them seem to start having issues and my LG smart tv has had its wireless fail and the direct connect constantly disconnects and reconnects so I purchased a Roku streaming stick. It has a very nice and easy user interface. The Roku has worked so well this is my second purchase. I will look to replace the fire sticks with the Roku streaming sticks. over time

We love our rokus. They are so much more user friendly than any of the smart tv’s we’ve owned/used. We got this one for my dad and step mom for Christmas and they are loving it too. We love that you can just say what you’re looking for vs. searching through everything and everything is fast to load.

Just hooked up the roku I have the fire stick and actually like the roku better so far it’s very clear and I love I can get the xfinity on there and my recordings as well. And appletv what more can u ask for in a device

This is way better than the firestick. User interface is much better and I can actually get to my vudu. Love how easy it was to add apps and the quality is so much better. Only complaint is the remote sometimes is really unresponsive. I have never tried the voice recognition part.

I've had a Roku 3 for six years, and it still works fine. Upgraded a few months ago to a Streaming Stick, mainly for the supposedly improved remote, and connected the old device to the downstairs TV. Unfortunately, the "improved" remote  cuts out on a regular basis, sometimes for a few seconds, sometimes for way longer than that.  My wi-fi hums, and the Roku app  on my phone works even when the remote cuts out. So the problem is the remote. I've changed the batteries, re-paired it with the stick, shaken and stirred it. But nothing helps for long. I'd ask for a new one but nobody's minding the store.Called customer support 3x today and it was unreachable -- phone tree goes in circles, eventually tells you to try again later.  Website's no help. May fall back on pairing my old remote with the stick, which of course would leave me with a defective remote for the Roku 3. Can you say Apple TV?

I bought this to replace an Amazon Firestick I used for a treadmill in my basement.  I cannot believe how much better this works.  I have another Amazon Firestick that I use for a TV that is 4 feet from my router.  It works OK, but the Roku is MUCH better at a distance and much easier to use.

I chose the Roku because my Amazon Firestick wouldn't recognize YouTube TV. Aparently there is some sort of trade war going on between Amazon and YouTube? Anyway, I installed the unit and it immediatly brough up the easy to use menu and applications. The remote was easy to program to my Sony TV. The setup was easy and worked right away. Everything works really well. I don't use the voice commands often. But they actually work really good too. Very happy. And happy with my YouTube TV package too.

It smells like it has been sitting in a old moldy warehouse and once i opened the box everything inside smelled like old musty books too.Need to figure out how to get the smell out of it especially the remote controller.Let me know how to get the smell out and why does it smell so bad.I gave it 2 stars because it works but the smell is why it only got 2 stars.

There is NO support from Roku in setting up device.  We already had Roku, just got new one (12-16-20) for another TV, directions for setting up unclear.  The 3 phone numbers for Roku ALL had same msg: not taking ANY phone calls, referred to their website for assistance . . . Which NOT helpful.  We saw negative review from 2019 about same issue.  Figured by now there’d be no problem.  WRONG!  If you order Roku for Christmas present good luck on setting it up unless you have a computer whiz.  Of course Roku makes sales so they are not concerned with customer service.  They are a TERRIBLE company.
La mejor compra para nuestra television no inteligente! Lo unico malo es que no puedo controlar el volumen con el control remoto que viene incluido. Pero lo demas es perfecto
Not as easy to setup apparently.  Already have a Disney account but it didn't sync without having to use a computer.  Device didn't recognize it through Prime.

Worse than the older fire stick. Many times this device refuses to play any sound and requires, at minimum, one restart. With this quality it's as good as crap. Going back to my old one that actually works.
Very easy to use with the voice recognition, very easy to install and navigate. I would definitely recommend this fire stick, turn any modern TV into a movie powerhouse.
I love that you only need one remote since it controls the tv volume. But.... It will randomly change your tv channel so you still need that tv remote close by.
This little guy arrived a day early and was uncomplicated to set up. I am using it for YouTube and Disney+ and Netflix. Everything works great. Nice gadget!
I ordered this and sent it to my wife who is away camping in our rv.  She installed and set up the firestick without any problems and she reports she loves it.

I got this product because I just bought a projector for my living room. I heard that the projector would struggle with mirroring apps. I plugged the fire stick and it was easy to install into my projector. I love how it is simple to use and has lots of apps. Highly recommend!
We have smart TVs in the house but we purchased this device because Disney app wasn’t available and it’s so easy to use that we no longer use the smart TVs
The voice activated programming makes it easy to maneuver from program to program, it was a little confusing at first but is easy after getting used to it.

DO NOT BUY ROKU PRODUCTS: Worked great for about a month. Then I started having trouble with the sound coming on with the system.  But cut it off and back on the sound would work.  Then it started freezing up in the selections.  It would work then suddenly it would not move to another movie or tv show in the list of choices.  Again a cut on and off usually fixed it but not every time.  NOW? nothing. All it will do is the purple ROKU bouncing icon.  I have tried everything listed in the forums and online vids to fix it that I can find. NOTHING works.  for roughly sixty bucks shouldn't it work a year or two?STUPID ME: bought a second one. You know. Give them the benefit that maybe it was just a "bad one". HA>....This one has stopped working now.  Roku turns on. Shows my channels. I can move from channel to channel.  Can search up/down, left/right all I want. That's it. WHen you push the selector to have a channel open up to watch. NOTHING HAPPENS. You hear the beep.  NOTHING HAPPENS. NOTHING OPENS> NOTHING can be watched.  Wrote Roku support.  They would get back to me soon in a standard email.  It's been two weeks and NOTHING HAPPENS from ROKU SUPPORT. DONT BUY THEIR CRAP they are ripping us off and AMAZON is helping them do it.

We switched from Direct TV to Cincinnati Bell which is much cheaper. Our square Roku box, about 4 yrs old would not sync with the new signal. I had ordered this unit for our newer TV so were happy it worked. My husband loves being able to use his phone as a controller. I have read that you must have the original remote if you move the stick to sign in to a different TV.
I love this stick it was a game changer allowed me to keep my big screen TVs that we’re not quite up to date. I have two of them and I use them for all my watching of movies.

It’s a small, easy to use remote, and the device itself is easy to set up. The good news is, there’s a Disney+ button. The bad news? It doesn’t do anything. The good news? Supposedly, you can get HBO Max on Roku.  The bad news, only by using your iPad Airplay function. I’m using it, but before you buy it, you should see if there’s a streaming media player that does more.

I bought this less than 2 months ago. It sat around in the box for a little while before I finally set it up. It was easy to setup and my first impressions were positive. However, my kids are now complaining that they get a few minutes into a show and it shows an error message about overheating and shuts off. Sure enough, I touched the stick and it was burning hot. I've had lots of streaming devices, including previous Roku devices, and have never seen this before.

Having always plugged in my MacBook Pro to whatever TV I own at the time, this wasn't a must-have product for me. It was more of a convenience, a way to watch Netflix without needing to move and connect my laptop, and anything else would be a bonus. I owned a Smart TV while living in Germany and had too many problems to justify spending the extra money on one again when I could just use my laptop. (I travel a lot and usually only live somewhere for a year or two, so the less I can spend on a TV, the better.)I must say, this little streaming stick went above and beyond my expectations. I have never written a review for a product on Amazon before, that's how much I love this thing. Being in SE Asia now, I don't have access to a lot of content, but with Netflix, Plex, and YouTube, it's already more than enough. (Having Spotify would make it perfect, but that's not Roku's fault.) And with silent listening from my phone, I can watch at any time without needing to worry about waking up anyone else in the house. (Perfect for roommates or significant others trying to sleep way earlier than you want to.)The icing on the cake, though, and what drove me to leave this review, is the advanced wireless receiver. My bedroom is down a long hallway in the house, and my laptop and iPhone have a hard time picking it up during the best of times. Not so with the Roku. I was getting HD quality content on the TV. I might even be getting better quality content in the main room where the router is because of this. Maybe I'm still so overly impressed and it's affecting my judgement, but I could swear that it never looked as good when I was using my laptop.Needless to say, I'm going to be using this for a long time to come. Maybe next time I'll spring for a 4K TV, but even without one, this thing is seriously amazing. Best value for money I've ever spent.

Great product,  used a fire stick before this for a couple of yesrs, really no comparison the Roku is so much better. So glad I purchased this device! Purchased the unit with volume and now only need the one device, Roku also turns on tv. You won't be disappointed if you purchase this, so glad I did and very easy to set up.

The person who said she was charged $70.00 to set up her roku got scammed. There is no charge no matter how many you rokus you have. Sounds like she clicked on an unofficial site for help and got scammed, so beware. It's happening to other customers according to what I've read.  I'm happy with the device, have several and paid nothing to set them up.

The remote burns through the pair of AAA batteries on a weekly basis.  This appears to be a known fault with many customers reporting the same issue on the Roku site.  Each report gets an ambiguous response to send a Direct Message (DM) to a guy named Danny for more help.  I sent 3 DMs to Dany without any response or support.I wanted so much to like Roku but this is an annoyance.It is a faster streaming stick than the competition so my answer is to buy rechargeable AAA batteries from the same competition.  Call me crazy :)

I love the ROKU streaming devives ( I purchased two) However, the remote to one of them stop completely working after just a couple weeks. I had to download the remote on my phone & this is what I use to operate my Roku device. The 2nd one I purchased, I haven't used yet. Though I purchased 1 in November & the other in December, I didn't set the one im using up until Feb because I still had cable. Now I have to contact ROKU C/S to see how or if I can purchase a remote. Hopefully, I won't have this problem with the 2nd remote. My sister has had her ROKU for years & never had a problem with her remote.

I was so excited for this to start using and Amazon did a quick job in delivering before time but The device is getting overheated. When I don't even start any app the temperature is 80 deg Celsius. If I start streaming then it goes above 100 deg Celsius which is more than a boiling water. I will wait and watch few days and then possibly return it as I don't think I can watch on it for even 2-3 hrs. Also I am not getting Dolby Atmos output from it as advertised even though I have Dolby Atmos capable speakers and have enabled Dolby Digital Plus in Roku Audio settings,  so it's very disappointing

O.K., I was wrong in my first review. I did mention that I was still learning. A week with Roku, many rustrating moments. Getting to know the territory is not what I would call "user friendly."Now the Good PartMy daughter, who is my 45 years younger then I am said: You want "Sling" and the blue package, (Cost $20 a month)I loaded Sling, again not too easy, but after about three hours I had it done. If you need  help, I will respond.It sure is a lot better than $150 to $200 a month for cable. Sling has "Live On Air" shows as well as videos, movies, cable and more. It saved my marriage. My wife is glued to MSNBC, The "Blue" package has it, on air!Now "I Love My Roku" I am about to buy another.

Roku is the best streaming player, but needs to add Multicast capabilities!! Please find a way to support this feature on the ESPN app to watch 4 games simultaneously on 1 screen like AppleTV. Roku does a better job than AppleTV of keeping the streaming resolution quality high while streaming. Roku will stay at 4k resolution mostly while AppleTV will drop in and out from 4k to 1080p and it gets annoying.

Roku is really great.  We got Amazon Prime with out flat screen downstairs.  Using Roku to stream same services to upstairs bedroom.  Works great.  Ridiculous amounts of shows.  Makes you want to become disabled, so you can watch 24 hours a day, 7 days a week!

We had a older generation of Firestick that required you to reboot it almost 3x a day. With the Roku, you turn it on and it stays on. There is very little issue with it requiring restarts or signal loss. It looks like the people who created and coded this device knew what they were doing.

Very happy with ROKU just not this model.  The stick overheated!!  The TV displayed a banner reading “The ROKU is OVERHEATING!”  It was extremely hot to touch.  Be careful.....it could have easily caused an electrical fire.
they really should say in the description that it will not work without you giving them your credit card info!  felt screwed!

This is our first venture into "streaming" service, and it works very well. We use it for Amazon, YouTube, Netflix, Disney Plus, Hulu, Peacock, and many other services we have either found or were loaded on the Roku.We do not use any type of voice recognition, so not able to review those accessories.

The Streaming Stick + I received from Amazon was not new.  It had been initalized and registered by another user, which made it impossible to link it to my own Roku account. I only found out because I wanted to add another streaming service app; had I wanted only the ones preloaded, I would never have noticed. I had to contact Roku for support (and the agent was very helpful). The box is sealed with transparent seals, and I don't remember now whether they were already cut when I received it.  Amazon shouldn't be selling used products as new.The stick itself seems to be working correctly, but setup took a long time because it was previously registered. The antenna on the side isn't conspicuous.

Purchased two units abd love the platform and streaming. Very easy setup and nice selection of options. I want to love this and give 5 stars.HOWEVER BUYER BEWARE!Their remotes eat batteries like nothing I have seen.  What money you save you will lose in cost of batteries.No one seems to review this part.  Major Achilles heal on unit. If it were not for battery issues I would say Best Buy ever!  But the remote and battery issue is a killer.

Got this for someone else but use Roku myself.  They are all good with the exception of voice control which is not up to par if compared with Fire.I just got another one for a neighbor again and found something strange.  This one used the "mini" USB power plug instead of the "micro".  I have not seeing anything was using the micro for some time and can't even find them in stores.
Did not have app for peacock. Disappointed ☹️

Bought this for the toy room. Good reception. Good quality picture. Only problem is the 4” dongle. We have 3 roku’s and two of them don’t fit in the TV HDMI Slots because they’re too long. This forces you to buy an adapter. The adapter should be automatically included, or change the design.

I have always used a roku. I just upgraded to this one. It stays hidden behind my tv. I cannot rate the alexa integration or the voice recognition because I personally havent used them. the roku is super easy to use and set up what you want. I have never had any problems using one (4 years)

Absolute garbage product. The extended power cord is incredibly short and cannot reach an outlet for a mounted TV. The power it can get from the TV’s USB, which is their work around, does not generate enough power for most users so the software then crashes repeatedly. Absolute useless junk, do not buy.

I would not recommend this product to people living outside the USA. I did find it easy enough to set up, and the quality of streaming was excellent. I did find from the get go that the remote was a bit iffy, or it may have been occasional very slow response. Geo-restriction is a problem, and I could not access Amazon Prime. (I could watch Prime on my Smart TV).I signed up for Acorn TV, but could not load it from the Roku channel store. Roku support told me Acorn was geo-restricted, but Acorn said not. (Again, I could watch on my smart TV).The worst has been Wifi related. Often, when I was downstairs watching Netflix, my wife would call me upstairs as the Roku had stopped working. It had dropped from the wifi network, but was easy to reset, at first. Finally, the unit lost wifi connection, and just would not see my wifi, although it variously saw 3 to 7 of my neighbours' networks. This happened Tuesday, by Friday there was no response from support. So, like the curate's egg, good in parts, but not something I would ever recommend to a friend.

I like Roku, it has a lot more applications then my smart TV.  The custom home screen is a big plus, remote controls the power and the volume. Overall i'm happy, HOWEVER just a warning, this is the 3rd roku hardware we purchased  and twice already the Roku remote just simply stops working after a few months of use. Batteries are fine, it just stops paring to TV, no matter now many times you reset it, unplug it, nothing works. So its possibly that we just has a faulty hardware (twice) and got really unlucky.

Roku has been our "go to" for streaming device for years. I honestly cant compare to other devices for that reaaon but i am very satisfied with all of thier products that i have used. Roku is easy to use and i love the remote that operated the tv power an volume. I highly recommend this product.

I like the minimalist remote and device size with a user friendly interface that works with your phone or PC for logins and/or setup. FREE LOGIN AND ACCOUNT! No paying for service just the apps that you own or wish to use. I'd I wasn't a gamer this is all I would have period. YouTube tv, Hulu, Netflix, and others are available. I only need 3 or 4 😐 so in my case worth the money. And if xboxlive/PlayStation Network go down you actually have something to watch 😁.

My 5-year old Roku was single band and seemed slow.  I ordered model with the fewest extras and was rewarded with a homerun hit.  The external antenna on a dongle makes a difference.  Set up was easier than the previous model.  The payoff is faster loading.  We have had cable TV and a sound bar.  The on/off and sound volume control features don't work with our set up, and we didn't expect them to.  What does work is the ability to link to the highest of the dual band settings of our router.  Faster performance.  Easy set up.  No need to contact tech support.
Returned the item as I could not get it to connect to my WiFi.  I have since learned that the issue was that I had a symbol in my password and Roku will not recognize a password with a symbol in t.
The layout has changed from the original, but I like this one much better. Its fast and stable. Im able to stream all my shows/movies, and use the apps, both preloaded, and purchased.

When I turn on my TV I have no sound.  I have to unplug the fire stick and plug it back in. Then it will work. It’s so annoying !  Never experienced this with my other two fire sticksNot sure why this is happening!!

Nowhere can you find how to playback recorded shows.  They had shows that could be marked for future viewing but now that doesn't exist anymore and all there is left is to record shows, but without any means of locating and playing them back what good is that.  I tried contacting the technical support of my local TV and internet provider - LUMOS - and they didn't know anything about it.  So now I will try to contact Amazon I guess and see if they are any help.  Very Frustrating!

Casi no me gusta la interfaz, pero eso igual depende de los gustos de cada quien. Sería buena la opción de que en el app se pueda escuchar en el teléfono con audífonos y que no suene el televisor. Por lo demás me ha parecido una gran compra.
No cable hookup in my son's bedroom, so this was a quick, easy, affordable alternative. Set up my Disney+ and Netflix along with Prime Video, and now he's good to go.
This is the Lite version. We have three of these already. No problem with this one. The one I purchased is the Lite version so no volume control and does not work the TV.

Worked fine the first day. Next time we used it we didn’t have any audio. Called customer support and she had me factory reset the unit. Worked then. But next day again no audio. We unplugged several times and finally got audio. Today again the audio did not work even after unplugging several times. I plan to send this back very disappointed as we have 3 other fire tv products that are no longer available  for purchase. I guess you do get what you pay for.
Funciona muy bien, excelente producto.Solo tiene un pequeño fallo, cuando dura un tiempo sin usarlo se le va el sonido, hay que reiniciarlo para que se normalice
We love this product and the streaming is so much better than my blue ray player. We will eventually get Disney plus and wanted the option. Great product!
I was so happy with the ease of installation.  So much better then expensive cable.  The choices in add ones are endless and still less expensive then cable.
We have one on every tv, i loved that this one was cheaper because no volume control. one of our tv's can't be controlled by a remote so this was perfect.
Love the integration, I guess I had a older apple TV none-the-less swapped it out for this fire stick for the price and the features and quality this is amazing.
Did not work as exoected
very pleased with the service of the fire stick so far.  We had the last one for a really long time and that's why we purchased another one like  the last on we had great service!
In retrospect, I should have purchased the full version instead of the light. I still have to keep up with the remote to control the TV. Otherwise, no complaints.

It's just your run of the mill media player. Nothing too special. It's convenient  and cheap, that's about the best thing about it.It's also easy to use for someone who is tech literate. Someone who is not tech literate will have difficulties if not taught how to use it. The control itself is a bit confusing for people who are not tech literate as well.

This is a wonderful Mini fire stick. I use it for my TV and my kitchen while I'm cooking and it allows me to do everything I need to do in that small area!Now if you need bigger and more memory and all of that, I don't know anything about that stuff, but it works great for me I'm able to watch all of my streaming channels and that's all I need

I bought this as a christmas present to myself but I was too excited to wait for the holiday so I opened it immediately upon its arrival. I only paid 30.00 for this item and it is worth every penny as it instantly transforms any tv into a smart tv basically. I've had no glitches or malfunctions and I've had it for about a week and a half now and I am now going to buy it for my mother for christmas.

Our TV is over 10 years old but it's still good and can compete with many new TV on the market today, only downside is it's not smart. So we decided to give a try to this stick rather than buying new TV, as to watch Netflix was a pain every time connecting through hdmi cable. This stick changed our lives, the old TV is now as smart as it could get, so easy to install and convenient in use. Love it!
My first fire stick and I love it. Using it in a room that has no dish connection. My internet is terrible slow but the fire stick is still working great!
We love our fire sticks! My kids can go from watching Disney+ to Netflix easily. And with the Alexa feature, it’s even easier. Setting it up was also quick and easy.

We were really enjoying watching from our Firestik till a few weeks ago and it quit. No Signal. Did everything Technical support said to do and no such luck. Come to find out, this is a common occurrence and the only solution to do is buy another one. Well, every couple months or less is not for me! It was great while it lasted! Wish it was still working! Can't return it now either! You can't get quality these days!
Quick setup used for bedroom tv i like alexa changing my stations by voice also finding my music this one dont have volume on remote thats ok for my use
I got 2 of these and works really good but Does not work with all apps and one on them sometimes restarts by itself out of the nowhere that’s something it needs to be improved
We have multiple televisions in our home, but only one is a smart tv. The fire stick is a great way to have all of your streaming services in one place.
It's  great. Does more than my smart tv would let me do. Turned my husbands old plasma ( which we love ) into a smart tv. We should have got them sooner
This replaced a firestick I bought years ago.  The old one was slow and did not always connect.  This one corrects those problems and has Alexa to help out.  Love it.

I have to restart my firestick at least twice a day otherwise it doesn't work. Terrible version.I had two stars now I went down to one because the fire stick is causing my television to have no sound at all I have to keep restarting.
disappointed the tv controls were removed from the remote do not see improved voice or tv stream

I really liked this unit for a little over a year. A couple weeks ago, it kept shutting down with a pop up noting there was insufficient power to support the Roku unit. I started by moving the stick from one HDMIport to another on my 2yr old Sony 4K tv. That worked temporarily. I had to move it back and forth several times a week. Frustrated as there seems to be no recourse.

I got this to replace my Sony combo Blu-Ray / Streaming player since Hulu is not supported on it any more. This device is great and so much better than what I was using. It's easy to move from TV to TV, doesn't crash and lose all your account info, and has so many choices of both subscription and free streaming channels. Worth every penny and I plan to get more as Christmas gifts for my friends and family who need a better streaming device.

My experience is that my Roku sticks have been faster and more trouble-free than my Fires, w more content.  I heard Google’s is faster still, but I’ll mainly “stick” with Roku.  Been a good search engine but not a fan of G’s intrusiveness.  To each their own.  That’s why we have choices.

DIDN"T have the earphones  as advertised.????????????? I was disappointed. Otherwise the product works fine.  Can't get all the channels that I wanted. Was trying to get away from all the big charges for the TV channels BUTif you want the PRIME channels them you must PAY for them or have a TV carrier.

This Roku product is fine.  We started with more basic sticks from both Roku and Amazon, but both of the more basic sticks could not maintain a streaming speed in our location to prevent interruptions of the programs being watched.  Thus, we bought the Roku Streaming Stick + because it was advertised having more range and a faster processor.  So far, we have had no streaming problems with the Roku Streaming Stick +.  It probably deserves a five-star rating, but I would like to see if this stick maintains it streaming speed on all sources before moving it from four-stars to five-stars.

Bought this product in early April, we already had one and loved it. 10 weeks into occasionally using ( it’s in a bedroom and used infrequently) it’s no longer working. It’s a good product but don’t buy from Amazon.Had I bought it anywhere else I could have returned it but the return window was closed through Amazon.

I originally wanted an Apple TV, but didn't have the cash. Needed something immediate and this was a good buy. I was really impressed with the device and the countless apps available on it. Unfortunately, HBO Max isn't available on it yet, which forces me to use my Xbox One to play that lone app. But the playback and quality of the device led me to have it on every television in the house. I may get an Apple TV later on, but I'm definitely not in any hurry.

They did not indicate that these were refurbished Roku before ordering. When I opened the box I was surprised to see Refurbished Rokus', feeling deceived AMAZON MUST DO BETTER!!! Refurbished working ok for now, will see if it is still working in 90 days. Update Refurbished ROKU is working without any issues. One of the remotes did not work, I contacted the supplier and they shipped me a new one in less than a week.

I give this item one star and 0 stars for streaming. I’ve had it for an entire week. It worked great the first 2-3 days then suddenly was disconnected from the network. After this first instance, it NEVER worked again! I’ve tried EVERYTHING even switching TVs and it does the same. It will not connect to the network. I’ve read all I can, watched many YouTube videos, reached out to support, they can’t help. I got so aggravated, I just disconnected it. I’m very unhappy with this product!!

I bought this for my dad, he is not tech savvy and very old school.  He wanted to be able to watch Netflix, and Disney+ (Marvel Movies). I was able to it up on their TV in 10 mins, and showed him how to navigate in and out of the different streaming services in about 15-20 mins.  The remote that came with this purchase has buttons to Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ and another services, this makes it so easy to go in and out of different streaming channels.  My dad is almost 80 and loves his Roku, if he can use it anyone can!  Very user-friendly.

My 2018 Samsung smart TV wasn’t as smart as it needed to be.  I switched to AT&T TV for my service provider.  The AT&T app was not on that TV and I could find no way to add it.  This is where The Roku stick came to my rescue.  Setup was easy-Peezy and it contained the AT&T app I needed.  Problem solved at a reasonable price.

I rarely give 5 stars, but this one rates it I believe.  I just recently purchased a Samsung 4k tv and wanted a compatible streaming device.  The setup is a cinch.
