Automatically detected my screen resolution and 4K settings (Also gives you additional choices if you wish)  The picture is stunningly clear and the audio channeling through my sound bar is excellent.  Took just a couple of minutes to log into Netflix, etc and away we go.  I would recommend this to anyone wanting  the latest tech, and to those who have 4k capabilities.  The $70 price tag is definitely worth the investment.

I'm a Roku fan, think the interface, the remote, and capabilities are first rate. But with this particular product, playback of media that has subtitles is a real problem.  The subtitles will either disappear or lag seriously against the on-screen dialog.  This is not a problem when connecting directly, wired, to either the smart TV or a wired Roku box.

The Roku is easy to remove from the packaging and set up to my tv. Takes a full minute to turn on and load. Often the first buttons I press when turned on do nor register. The screen is user friendly and uncomplicated. I love that my remote is used for the tv volume. Streaming quality is OK only, at times the image clarity us poor or a show may pause. Overall, happy with my purchase.

I have tried other streaming devices and after buying a ROKU TV, I decided to try a ROKU stick for my other large screeen that is not a smart TV.  Between the choices, features and price for my stick- voice recognition on the remote at a price of 29.99 the choice has turned out to be unbeatable.  In addition anyone who streams has suffered buffering or freezing of your program.  I have experienced that ROKU does a better job of holding the stream and recovering than Chromecast.

This unit has worked fine for 2 months. Two weeks ago started having slow internet issues. Checked wireless speed each time and over 100Mbs so not the network.  Now the unit is freezing and/or turning off.Winter in New England and plenty of ventilation around unit. Disappointed. I have two other Roku units but not this new 4K version. Maybe a design/heat issue.

I like that it gives a lot more options than what my smart TV gives.  I was hoping that it would pull in the signal better, but i'm not sure that it does.  Signal strength is certainly as good as the TV, but i'm not sure it is much better.  it is close.The apps and the remote are very responsive.  I do not use voice commands with it.. That just seems wrong to me.For the price, I'm very happy.  If you don't have a smart TV, this is the ticket.

I have an older Roku works great, but this one not so much. Constantly having to disconnect it from power so it works and that’s a maybe.  I can turn the tv on and then choose my hdmi port where the roku is connected but the home button, the arrow back button, the settings button ok none of the buttons work. The only thing that works is the volume, so it’s not the batteries. Very frustrated. I got a lemon or a refurbished one that doesn’t work.

I plugged it in and started the setup but the remote does not pair. The message on the screen keeps saying pairing with remote... I restarted the stick, unplugged the device, etc. at no success. I returned it and bought Amazon Fire Stick Lite  for even cheaper $17+, and its remote is paired immediately when turning on, and the rest is sailed in no time. Roku should look at their quality control of products, definitely some issue there.

Works fine if no interference/shielding. I have 2 Roku 3s and 2 Roku sticks. I use the sticks in locations that don't result in interference/shielding issues (buffering circle of death). Since I already have 2 Roku 3s I use the sticks in locations that don't produce the buffering circle. It's kind of a hard engineering challenge since they plug directly into the back side of a flat screen between the metal/circuit board of the TV and the metal wall mount plate (at least in my situation). So, they would not work well in some locations but okay in others. I love how transportable they are.
I had an old version of the Fire Stick and it just wasn't working well at all. I decided to see if a new one would work better and it does. No issues at all.

I have bought multiple Firesticks and I got this one because I believe it was on sale. There is no button to turn on your tv  or change the volume with this remote. Its inconvenient needing to use the tv remote and the Firestick remote. Will be returning and buying another version
Works great and i think  its been improved. I have one from 2 years ago on another  tv and that one has some issues loading sometimes. New one has none.
The addition of Alexa was a great plus.  I was able to hook it up easily myself.  I don't like having to unplug and plug it in to turn it on each time.
My wife wanted a small tv for the kitchen so I got her one that was not smart and had to add the fire stick to it. It works and does a great job. Happy wife, Happy life

This is my second fire stick. I don't like how Amazing keeps charging me fees for movies no one is watching. There is no way to stop them and the fees are random. It is great for streaming, but keep an eye on your bank statements
Works great
Not sure why amazon would sell a remote without volume control.
This is way worse than my 4K one

I've been using it for over a month and when I'm browsing through HOME it lags so much! It's honestly so off-putting, I tried ignoring it but it's testing my patience as the days go by.The streaming itself is 10/10 but navigating through apps is a pain.I also bought one for my boyfriend and the same thing happens. I'm definitely going back to my old Chromecast and keeping this as a backup.

Had a couple of Sharp Roku TVs before buying what reviews suggested a better Vizio Quantum M series TV. From the start I thought the Smartcast interface was ‘meh’ at beat, but what really sucked was the TV’s inability to catch a proper WiFi signal, which made the TV pretty useless. Bought this Roku stick, plugged it in, set up the WiFi, and started watching. Never looked at Vizio’s interface again. Ever.

I "upgraded" from a 2014 model Roku with no volume button. I cant say this one is any better. It is extremely slow on bootup and pressing the home button no longer automically turns on the tv and changes the input. I wish i wouldve kept the old one as its boot times were alot faster.

Works great as we dont need to provide separate power to it if the tv or projector has a powered usb port.The remote doesnt have to be pointed at the device which is a big help.Stream quality is superb with no lags.Detects devices display capability well. Initial setup maybe tricky to make it understand what the resolution of the device is.Remote has a lag.

The remote struggles to interact with the stick even if you point it at the stick it reacts slowly to select the apps. Volume on remote is perfect however. Im not sure what the deal is but the remote also goes through batteries really fast. My tv remote batteries last a year but the roku is a monthly change. Recently the roku needs me to reconnect the internet through its app anytime i turn on the tv. My router sits 1foot below the stick so and i test at about 30 megs while sitting on the couch or walking in the kitchen which is about10- 20 ft from router. I think the roku is good for the short term but it needs to be replaced in less than a year. Currently debating apple tv and a few others. Too bad honestly since it could be a really good product with a better remote and a more consistent connection. A month ago i would say five stars, but here i am about to have to find another device to stream with so 3 stars is as nice as it gets.

Fantastic reception with this device,  Very PLEASED!  This is my 3rd Roku in the past 8 months or so, using on 3 separate TV's. Just one observation,  noticed the remote control for 1st one I purchased, which I use most often, seems to burn thru quality Duracell alkaline batteries. These are not old batteries, they are no where close to expiration date. Just changed them again tonight and had to replace about 2 months earlier...again each time with brand new alkaline batteries.  Wondering if other folks have had this experience??

El Roku Stick 4K es un excelente producto, muy compacto y con un alcance a la señal WIFi muy buena garantizando una gran experiencia de streaming. Tiene las principales plataformas Disney +, Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO Go, DirecTV Go..., todas con muy buen funcionamiento en Colombia.
The cable TV alternatives offered by Roku save me $$ and no rental fees for equipment like DVR and modem. The interface is simple, which I like. I wish the remote was backlit.
This has a very user friendly user interface. With the Spectrum App, I was able to get rid of my cable box and save on my monthly cable bill. I will be purchasing more of these in the near future.

The Roku Streaming Stick+ is a great piece of hardware. I've had every Roku since the first one and the remote on this one is outstanding, easy to use and fits the hand with ease. I was so impressed with my first Roku Streaming Stick+ that I quickly replaced all my other streaming devices in my house with the Roku Streaming Stick+. The best feature was to link the remote to my tv, cable box and dvd player. With one button I can turn on Roku and start watching within a minute! And being able to watch in 4K is fantastic!

Gave this to my father-in-law because the Amazon app in his Samsung TV wouldn’t let him FF some shows that worked for me on my Roku. He lives this thing.  PS, he was afraid it wouldn’t work on his tv because of something he heard on the news about not working with old TVs. He has a 3 year old 70” 4K tv, lol. I reminded him that my own tv is a 10 year old 720p Panasonic and it works with Roku just fine.

I bought this so I could get rid of the cable.  I don't watch that much on TV, but the news that I watch is available on YouTube.  I like being able to access Amazon Prime, Netflix, etc. in one place.  I haven't found too many things on the free channels, but there is lots to choose from.  For me it has been an excellent investment.  The picture quality is excellent - better than my cable was.

Bought this Roku in December 2019 to replace an older model that wasn’t working well any longer. It stopped working in the second week of February 2020. Tried it on our other TVs in the house and doesn’t work with those either. Tried new batteries to no avail. Internet in the house is fine. WiFi is fine. The Roku won’t connect to the internet and the remote doesn’t seem to work any longer.

We love our Roku tv, but to save money we opted to buy the streaming stick for another tv in the house. It’s super easy to setup, user friendly, and a good purchase. I love you have the ability to move it from room to room if needed.

REMOTE DOES NOT WORK :( :(I'm extremely disappointed.  Due to work schedules i could not install the product till now (2 months after i received it)The remote is very very laggy and unpredictable to the point that i can't even enter my WiFi password.I looked up Roku troubleshooting pages and YouTube videos. No luck.I even ordered and received the *free* HDMI extender attachment from Roku to overcome HDMI interference.But, no luck.  The Roku Stick gets pretty hot (temp) and does not react to the remote in a predictable manner.Since i was beyond the returnable time for this Order, i'm stuck with it.  Really don't know what to do with this defective Product.Would really appreciate it if a replacement could be provided.

The streaming quality and far reaching wireless range is excellent. Just keep in mind that the only Dolby Atmos content is on Vudu and just one series on Prime called Jack Ryan in Ultra 4K.I will say however, that if you are watching that series, the Dolby Atmos is not there all the time. I never had this issue with Vudu movies that state "DOLBY ATMOS". And yes, my stick is connected to my Onkyo receiver in the 4K compliant hdmi input.

This is the first Roku we purchased that was the stick.  We liked the size and that it powered from the television.  With that said, every time we turned off the TV, the Roku needed to restart.  As it is much faster than the older model, we didn't mind that much.  What we do mind is that it doesn't seem to work anymore.  It is just over 2 months old, so we are annoyed to say the least.

Do not really know if made in China, but from now on all products I buy will be researched for an alternative to China. Look for USA made first  or any alternative to China.Need programmable buttons, I do not use Sling, Disney+ or Hulu,Netflix fine, need to program YouTubeTV, Prime, etc..

I have four of these...  easy to set up and stream...  no problems there.  However, the remote run the batteries down within a couple weeks.  Between the 4 I'm changing batteries out weekly.  Trying to contact customer service is like non existent.  I now have the batteries out and have them next to each remote to save the life.  What I saved in purchasing roku over another streaming stick I've more than lost that in purchasing batteries!

Poor quality! This item stopped working in just under a year of purchase. (We don’t even watch a lot of tv.) My original Roku device prior to this one lasted me 8 years. We even just bought a replacement wireless receiver (ALREADY) and it still isn’t working properly. It turns on but won’t work even when we reset it.  It is too late to return and is put if warranty (in LESS than a year?!) I am totally disappointed.

I can still use it to turn the Roku on and off, but HAVE to use my phone app as the remote - VERY annoying! Swapped out batteries multiple times, tried different brands... This malfunction started almost immediately after installation, a few weeks in! I would NOT buy again or recommend!

I own 2 of these for 2 televisions so I don’t need to purchase a smart tv I have my fire stick(s).  This purchase is for a Secret  Santa gift, the purchase price was great! Whichwas why I chose to gift this item, plus I love this product.
good so far.  takes a while to find everything.  when nothing on regular tv, have been able to find something to watch.  have not used alexa yet.  but will.
Streaming isn’t to bad. Message keeps coming up that memory is almost full but it’s not also can’t get voice recognition to work miss having volume up/down option.
I needed this to watch YouTube TV on an older Panasonic tv to replace my fire tv box [v1] that couldn't get YouTube TV.It was super easy to hook up and it's working perfectly.
I wanted a place to put prime Hulu Disney netflix... in one place . So its great for that and if I want a 🎥 its all there. I don't have Alexis  so I don't know if it wks.

I have kinda old Vizio smart Tv and Hulu was starting to crash.  This was a nice easy solution.I watched the YT vids and configured it so all the options are turned off and it was only using its resources to run apps.  Very cool to have silk web browser on a TV too.-ALF

It streams just fine, the UI to find apps and channels is ok, but discovery is difficult and it is often very, very slow. Often when waking it up after the TV has just been turned on it either crashes or there is no sound.This was to replace a Gen1 stick for which I lost the remote; that was rock solid, this version is disappointing.
This was a replacement for an older model.  It works just fine, but your memory of streaming services is lost and passwords etc. must be re-entered to get up to speed.
This is the second Firestick lite I purchased..the first was for my bedroom TV.  The second one was to replace an older First generation FirestickIt’s a great product...

I purchased this product to listen to audible. It worked like a charm the 1st week then my audible library was missing. I've contacted Amazon and of course they haven't resolved my issue. The fire stick itself works wonderfully, but the reason I purchased it doesn't work so therefore this purchase was pointless.
We do not have a smart tv, so Firestick Lite is a good tool so we can watch Netflix and Prime TV.  We have not really used the Alexa feature that much.

I love the Roku. I have an Apple TV - which doesn't get Amazon. I have a Firestick too which I like but I don't like the navigation for Hulu or Amazon at all; it's hard to browse. I love the ROKU's navigation the best. I had to get a new one because old one must have been too old and was crashing and not picking up wifi well. This one has better wifi reach. And I love how the new remote controls the TV so I don't have to hunt for remotes in order to change the volume or turn the TV off. The other great thing about this is it can travel with you. Just plug it into a Hotel TV or at your in-laws and you can watch your favorites on Amazon, Hulu, Netflix and many more.
Good price on this product. Just what I needed when my former Chromecast quit on me. Once I got this set up it's been a breeze to use. May buy another for my other tv.
Seems to do what my Apple TV box does. I have a regular, now this lite (no tv control _ I don't use it on the other one anyway) and happy with both.
Working great.  Needs a couple apps to be complete.  Spectrum and apple.  Opens up an additional room for kids to watch tv without having to mess with wiring or cable box.
Great product. Simple to setup and use. Remote has what you need and nothing extra in the way to complicate the issue. Best smart device i have used.
we liked it so much we bought our second one for our downstairs TV.we were having issues with just a stanard antenna, we needed something more without paying for cable.this works great.

At 75 years young, my kids thought I had slipped a gear. I ordered the new Fire Lite with Alexa voice remote to help me learn to stream. Well, thanks to easy instructions and a learning voice control, I now stream as well as they do.

I don't know really why a company like Amazon don't simply add at least 15 languages to its devices at least keyboard not the operation system, I ask them more than one to add Arabic without a clear response
not qhat i expected. you can't get all your channels that you have on roku.  the voice recognition works well but the drawback is all request are for pay not free play.
I’m glad I purchased this item. It works as advertised
pre programmed channel buttons are worthless.give the consumer programmable buttons, rather than the buttons for channels no one subscribes to.

I hate my Roku, I bought this instead of a Fire TV Stick based on online reviews. If you're considering buying this, don't. Get a Fire TV. The remote is unresponsive, I constantly lose network connection despite a strong connection. Everyone I know has this same issues. I bought an Amazon Fire TV Stick on Prime Day and I'm far happier with that. This thing is garbage. Do not buy. I cannot stress that enough.

My Mon is using her iphone 8 to watch her favor channel on YouTube all day. so I get rid of my mom regular Antenna in her room and buy this product while Amazon was on sale. My mon is 78 years old and she has no problem to operate ROKU controller . Now she can watch her favor show on ROKU device anytime she turn on TV. She is so happy and told all her friends.

Roku is the best streaming device.  I’ve had a couple Firesticks and they don’t compare to the ROKU.  The remote is heads above the Firestick.  I like all of the free stuff on ROKU and the free live channels that come with it.  It’s very quick and easy to set up.  Very intuitive.

This Roku has made my life so much easier! I only have to deal with one remote for the TV and the streaming. I had bought the top of the line brand née Apple TV and absolutely hated it. The remote was way too sensitive and would jump from one station to another just by setting it down and I sold it within two weeks. This remote is sturdy and responsive but not so sensitive that you have to handle it with kid gloves. The volume control is easy to use. If I had any complaint at all it would be that the mute button is on the side where you sometimes hit it by mistake. But honestly, that is a minor flaw. The voice recognition is only so-so but I rarely use it. I love this remote.

I'm saving so much money with this instead of paying for an extra cable box. It has great quality and is easy to set up. There are free movies and TV shows, but I use the Xfinity app and other apps on there to watch TV and movies.

I havent used the voice command nor streamed yet. There are so many free channels including piano, knitting, how to use YouTube pod cast for beginners and more.  I get emails almost weekly with notifications about new free channels. The set up is time consuming but so are all streaming sticks. So far, very happy with the product. Custom reports & YouTube reviews states Roku is rated high.

Bought the Roku on after talking to a friend who had one and loved it.  I was paying almost $7 a month for a second digital converter box for a second tv in our house.  I plugged in the Roku and in less than 10 minutes I was up and streaming!  Super easy setup, great picture quality, lots of great apps.  The Roku will pay for itself in a little over 6 months - I liked it so much that I bought a second one.  Would absolutely recommend this product!

New remote, right out of the box, won't pair!  I can't even get the pair LED to flash.  I've tried everything - removed power to stick, removed the batteries from the remote , plugged stick back into the HDMI port and re-installed batteries.  I then pushed the pair button - NOTHING!  Okay - I can still use my phone to control the Roku stick and all is good but I really bought the Streaming Stick+ so I could power up/down my TV with the  Roku remote and have voice control.  CHEAP, CHEAP remote quality - think I'll cut my losses and buy an AppleTV!!

This device eats through batteries at the rate now one set every 3 to 4 days, I have two other (Different) Roku devices and they work perfectly. The Roku stick + is a device that eats batteries, never have I had a device that when you think the device its off it drains "Kills" the batteries.

This is the one to get. Some of the more expensive Rokus don’t work with 5ghz Wi-Fi. Some of the cheaper ones quit working after a year. This is the sweet spot. Has 5ghz, 4K, etc. I don’t use the voice or Alexa stuff. I just want a reliable way to stream on my TV. I use this instead of the terrible Samsung smart TV interface the TV came with.

4k Magic.  I remember when a wifi adapter was more than twice this size and it has that and so much more.  Roku has some amazing wizards that can pack all of that tech in such a small device.  The best part is that it works so well.  Not one issue installing it and the guided install is ridiculously easy.  The price, the performance, and the cool factor make this a no brainer.  Just buy it.  Even if you already have a Roku, this one is better.OK, one complaint.  My tv didn't have enough room for the stick to plug in directly because of the shape of the back.  I had to use the flexible hdmi adapter/extender from my chromecast.  See objective.  Enjoy.

Easy to use. Add streaming access to your TV including Amazon Prime, Hulu, HBO a other providers. Use remote which includes voice control. East to I stall. Just plug the stick into an available HDMI port on your TV. No membership fees to Roku.

I have a stupid TV and was told a device like this would make it smart.  It did!!  I live in BFE and our only alternative is satellite service which isn't very good.  My internet provider suggested I get a streaming stick and what a difference.  I am thinking that I won't have to renew my Dish Network service when it comes due.  Great product!

I’ve been using a previous Roku Stick for 6 years and love it. I decided to upgrade to this model because I’m moving my WiFi router father away and wanted a better connection. This new stick performs great.I gave it 2 stars because the USB power cable extender is defective (cannot insert male into female) and unusable. I was able to use an extra Apple extender, but such poor QC for a simple cable is worrisome.

Piece of cake to set up; so many options ... free and for pay; simple remote. Only complaint is placement of volume and mute button... hit it accidentally when holding the unit. World with xfinity streaming, if you care to keep paying an arm and leg for the service. Not really needed!

I'm in my 50's and I am not good at all at tech devices. This was a snap to install and setup, and the streaming is seamless, unlike the apps that were preloaded on my smart tv. It's so good, that I'm cutting the cord and am gonna save over $100 per month. I'm hooked on Roku!

Was very easy to install and use, so far.  I set up my Roku account first so I was prepared to enter the link code when it appeared on the TV screen.  Haven't tried the Voice Remote part because I do not like talking to things, so I can't comment on how that works.  Still checking out the free stuff that you can access before deciding if I will subscribe to other offerings.

If you're looking for the best streaming solution for the cost, look no further!  I always grab these on sale around the holidays and they are a great deal!  Provides access to every platform you could need and stream quality is always fantastic.There are plenty of other streaming options out there but none seem to do it better at the price than Roku!

I've had this fire stick lite for a few days now and love it!  It's a perfect addition to our home entertainment set up.  I just plug it directly into our projector.  Set up only took about 10 minutes and all of my streaming subscriptions are conveniently in one place at my command.  Works splendidly!  The firestick Paired with our projector can allow my family to enjoy  the "big screen" experience wirelessly from anywhere on our property!

The stick did not work from day one. I powered it up and it flickered in and out on the screen. I was able to get through the setup and screen cleared up. But the next day it would not work and even locked up the rest of my TV. I could not change anything on the TV until I removed the firestick. It was only $17, and I already threw away the packaging, so I did not contact Amazon for a replacement. I will just buy the better stick and avoid the Lite.
This fire stick is a big improvement over my old one, its faster, improved picture, and a few more apps added. I haven't tried the Alexa voice yet.
The Fire Stick ensures that I have access to the latest streaming apps, rather than relying on the supply of apps in my televisions Samsung App Store.
I love my fire stick lite It recognizes my voice it’s plays my music, & weather. It also helps me set up other features...ask what can u do?Awesome!!!

I gave the Alexa and integration a 3 because I don’t really use them. But over all theFire tv stick works very well.  I don’t miss it not controlling the tv.  Once it’s on for streaming nothing on the tv changes any how. Pause , forward and reverse work great.  And watching a series after one finishes the next one is right there ready to go.

It does okay for a while, then you turn it on and there’s no sound and you have to restart it. If the thing would actually power off when the TV gets turned off, that would probably solve the problem.

This was very easy to set up. Adding additional apps was very simple. I have not used the voice & Alexa portion (nor do I intend to) so really can’t rate fairly on those. Not sure that I’ll use a lot of the apps that came with it. I mainly got it so I could make my non-smart TV ‘smart’. Loaded Disney+ & Discovery+ so use as well as a few that came with it.
This is so easy to set up, just takes minutes and then you're off to your favorite programs. The thing that takes the longest is the software download.
Great price and great product, I use these two Fire TV Stick Lite to watch Amazon Prime videos in my two floor top projection TVs. It works great!

I have an external speaker system for the TV so I have to use a separate controller anyway versus getting the full version of the Fire Stick.  This lite version is perfect and works much faster than the older Fire Stick that I had.

I have a tv of a brand that did not play well with my HULU app on the tv, so it occurred to me that the HULU app on the Roku stick might not have the same issue. Tried Roku stick and my HULU issues are over.  I mainly use Roku for accessing HULU and Netflix, and for national news (CNN and NBC). There are other options on Roku, which I haven't explored much, but perhaps I will in time.

Remite “broke” after 32 days, seems to be a common problem. Who can’t make a durable remote?! 2 days past return period.  I’ve tried everything to get it working, tons of help on line but nothing works.  I assume Roku just makes crappy remotes. Their final recommendation is download their remote app but that has to be linked every time you turn TV on.  Pain, I can’t wait until someone makes a better product so I can trash my Rokus.

The biggest issue I have with fire TV is that it does not "wake up" after going to sleep.  Pressing buttons on the report will not work, i have to physically unplug the device from power and pug it back in.The controls are quite clunky, not very user frindly.

Not bad for Lite.Pro - it's works very well.Con - If you side load the icons don't show but you can still use your side loaded apk's. Hopefully an update will fix this. Been trying to get the icons to appear from sideloaded apk's but they don't.FYI - Firesticks do not fall under the category of "Jailbreak or Jailbroken", that's an iOS term, not Android.
The product setup is EASY! anyone can do it!Almost automatic.The most used streaming apps already installed!Definitely a good addition
Easy to navigate content and easy set up. Alexa functionality if you don't already an Alexa device in your TV space. Plenty of free content, so it's well worth the money.
Everything worked fine for about a week. After that it just randomly turns off and on when ever it feels like it. I can’t get it to even stay on any more.
Glitchy
Save so much money getting this and canceling our cable!!! The code they gave us for the Hulu promotion didn't work but o well. bought  2 of them for my home!!

I don't use the voice control or smart tech so I didn't want to spend a bunch of money for things I wasn't planning to use.This puts all my streaming services in one spot and I love it!Easy set up, log in and good to go!!!

We’ve tried so many boosters & Internet options since “cutting the cord” & now  we are kicking ourselves that we didn’t make the switch to Fire Stick sooner. It was so easy to set up & using it has been even easier! 1 room has difficulty with the internet signal & we’ve had no issues since plugging in the Fire Stick
Love the Fire TV Stick Lite. Bought 2 for my car entertainment systems. Easy to set up and with the Vehicle hot spot the kids can enjoy tv while in the car.

I am so thankful to have found this product and that it works with our older flat screen TV. Many times some of the newer technologies doesn't work well with the older TVs. While our TV is only about 4-5 years old, its not a smart TV or have the latest specs desired, but we don't watch a whole lot of TV which is why I wanted the Roku as we finally cut the cord to our TV subscription to use this instead and its so amazing! the best part? It handles the power on and off, the volume up and down, and everything else!!! So grateful for such a great product! Thanks Roku!

Bought this so I could stream spectrum upstairs in my Bedroom bought it for Christmas.  On Dec 17 2020 Roku decided to drop the spectrum app from their App Store.  Apparently Spectrum and Roku are in a pissing contest.  I guess I will go to the extra expense for the Apple TV.

I had a previous Roku that died after 2.5 years.  That had been easy to install and use.  The new one was difficult to get connected to my TV(incomplete instructions).  Then connecting to Amazon Prime was impossible.  Amazon wants me to sign into App 1st and Roku sends me right to the activation code, which Amazon won't accept.  Between the 2, I can't watch Prime Video (that I've paid for for many years).  Customer service nonexistent for both.  I give Amazon and Roku both lowest rating possible.

This one rates the best for me, ever better thanAmazon Fire Stick Generation 4.The remote control is very easy to operate.It also will allow you to add additional future channels -- like You Tube TVThis was not mentions in the original ad on Amazon.

We are sending back, after having to reset the device with almost every use. For no reason it freezes. It will still control the tv and volume but the home button doesn't work- constant resets. Roku customer service is terrible, they make it difficult to find contact information and when I finally did get to a contact page after selecting from several drop down menus, it would not give me a phone number or live chat option- strictly email. I want to resolve the issue now, not days from now. So it's going back. It's too bad because I enjoy the interface and the size of remote. Just doesn't work consistently and Roku Customer Service is lacking.

I can’t afford cable, so I decided to buy this. It’s actually really good, having the ability to play Netflix, YouTube, and Hulu, my main sources of “TV”/Entertainment. It sometimes has a lil trip up on my voice recognition, but otherwise it can pick up on my commands, especially when I only use certain channels. It allows you to personalize it to where you can choose from the dozens of channel options and the background color.It’s a bit pricey, but I believe it’s worth it.(Btw- it can play Spotify and other music streaming services)

I actually prefer the Fire TV, but the Roku has a couple of services not available on other streaming boxes/sticks, such as access to your Ultraviolet collection through something like Vudu. It also has all the standard streaming apps you would want.Very easy install, and so far seems to actually run faster than the Roku 3 box. The remote app for controlling the Roku on your smartphone/tablet is great, as is the ability to output audio through the app.One complaint I have is that there is no Bluetooth. To get to a Bluetooth speaker, you have to use another device running the app to output audio.

Me ha servido para sacar provecho de mi TV que no es smart, pues puedo ver netflix, proyectar de mi pc al tv sin cables, hace cosas que no podía hacer antes en el. Una lástima que no tenga la posibilidad de un navegador de internet, pues aunque puedo hacerlo desde mi computador y proyectar, pienso que sería bueno que pudiera hacerse sin depender del computador. Recomendable 99%

This is my second Roku and I just love this product. This is the first time I’ve ordered this product from Amazon but it came intact and ready to use. If your debating between a Fire Stick and Roku, let me tell you, after owning both there is no comparison. Purchase a Roku.

For a pretty low price, you can turn a dumb TV into a smart TV with this thing, as long as you've got WiFi and an available HDMI port on the TV.  It's great in hotels and AirBnB's, because I'm used to watching programs at home off my DVR, where you're not a slave to the TV schedule, like you are when you're away.  This way, you can watch your own stuff on Netflix, Amazon, Youtube, etc. etc., including all the premium channels that you already pay for on your home cable or satellite TV.The power cord is pretty short.  If you're traveling with it, bring a short extension cord.

I dont know if my remote was defective, the stick was broke, or this product sucks. I Have the old Roku with the little box and i love it, so when i bought a new 4k tv i thought it was a no brainer to get this. After setting it up I noticed that the remote wouldn't respond right. To scroll up or down I would have to hit the button like 10 times and it would move once. So I went to the back of my tv and aimed it right at it and it worked flawlessly. So I went and sat back down and it wouldn't respond again. It seams the tv blocks the signal wich pretty much makes this product useless. I either have to put out more money for the next one up or go back to fire stick.

This was my 3rd Roku device. The other 2 are the little hockey puck type. They plug in and sit next to the TV. This one plugs into the back of the TV.The nice thing is that you can't see it.The problematic thing is that it is behind the TV. This may mess with your Wifi reception depending on location.It did install easily but  I will probably replace it with a puck type Roku when I get a chance.As far as Roku itself? Nothing better!

Not a lot to say really. Was easy to setup, it guides you through it, and works well. Good to note though is that you will need  Alexa or similar to have the voice operated feature.There are a lot of choices as far as channels available. That takes a little bit of digging, but its easy once you get the hang of it.If there is a drawback, it is that you can be spending a lot of money if you start signing up for all those channels!
I've preformed all of the troubleshooting suggestions a number of times.  Replacing the batteries works but only for a day or two.  This is my second roku with the same remote problem.

It's ok, but my biggest issue is that there's no TV Sleep Timer. That's very disappointing. I have a sleep disorder & always relied on a timer to turn my TV off. Now my TV stays on too much. Not too happy. It has helped some with the streaming signal & it was an easy setup.

I bought this to use in lieu of a cable box with Specturm cable and it works just fine. Just note if you intend to use it for the Spectrum app, that app is no longer available from Roku so consider an alternative. Since I had already downloaded it previously it works for me.

I had an original Fire stick and then a 4k Fire stick. Wanted to stream Comcast/Xfinity and switched to Roku since they had the Xfinity streaming app available. I have to say that in my opinion it is better than the Fire sticks. Just works better and I like the interface better also. Highly recommend. I have not used the voice option so I can't comment on that.

The streaming stick is next level awesome combined with the remote, you can access it from any direction and it’s so sensitive (almost too sensitive sometimes with kids). So happy to have purchased it. Such a great, quality product for the price. So much better than Apple..
I love having the fire stick. I have smart tv’s but talking to the fire stick makes everything so quick and simple. Bought another for my second tv. 👍

I TRIED COSTUMER SUPPORT AND IT WILL NOT LET ME TYPE WHAT THE PROBLEM IS... MY REMOTE DOES NOT WORK TOTALLY.... I CAN CHANGE APPS BUT IT WILL NOT LET ME VOICE OR ALEXA IT... IT SAYS TO COTACT COSTUMER SUPPORT.

This was a faster stick than my others. (I have 8) Then they updated the menu system. Small Icons and menu system in the middle of screen! Not at top. I don't know who thought it out but it's bad enough that I took the new Lite Stick out of service and put the old one back in service. C'mon Amazon. At Least give us a choice on the menu to go back to the menu it came with! New GUI is confusing.
Since i installed this new fire stick most times i either have no audio or two programs running at once. If my old hadn't bit the dust I would still be using it.

This has been a great purchase. I don’t know why I waited so long. It works a lot faster than the apps on my “smart TV”. My TV had no HBO max or disney plus apps, so that’s what made me look at it in the first place. I haven’t tried the voice controls yet, but I’m watching tv & movies through the fire stick more than on cable now.
My very picky preteen daughter is happy with this replacement for the one I lost. She says the UI is a bit different, but she likes the smaller device.
I have 2 firesticks myself, and both of my sons have one.the only issue I see is the limited space, so do not go crazy on apps.Otherwise, I love it.
The newer version of the fire stick is much more responsive than the earlier version. Really like how fast it responds, and it’s simple to set up too.

I've owned 2 other fire sticks, this is the first lite I've owned. On both tvs it did an endless loop of the fire tv logo. If I did manage to get to get to the apps it would work but go back to endless loop. Maybe I got a lemon. Returning it going back to the normal fire stick.
WONDERFUL. A MUST WITH PRIME MEMBERSHIP.  I AM ENJOYING THE FULL BENEFITS OF THE PRIME MEMBERSHIP. I CAN WATCH ON A BIGGER SCREEN VS. MY PHONE.A MUST
I like the fact that the Firestick is compact and easy to assemble. I wanted to add more channels to my Antenna. The Firestick is easy to upload to your television.
This Fire TV Stick Lite with Alexa Voice Remote Lite exceeded my expectations. The free apps alone made the Fire Stick more than worth the price.
Arrived within days, very simple with a nice little instruction book.This was a test to cut the cable, will be buying two more in the future.
Liked everything it's able to do.  If I seriously signed up for all the different video streams I would update to the more sophisticated versions.
We are using these to upgrade our tv's. They are easy to install and use. We have been able to get rid of the cable boxes in our house. We are really enjoying them.
The only negative thing about this is the fact that it doesn’t have a power button . The other fire stick we have allowed us to control the tv with remote. Other than that it’s great
Easy to install and use. This stick has no power or volume control for tv. No problem for me as it is on a tv that is barely used. Got this to cut the cords from cable.

This is a good firestick for accessing amazon video services.  We also use if to access STARZ and YouTube.  Setup is pretty easy.  Sometimes when we haven't used it in a while, we need to reset it by disconnecting the power, but it always boots back up, ,ready to go.  We really like it, and don't mind that it doesn't control the TV set.  It's a great, inexpensive option.
This is working excellent on my spare bedroom TV, 1080p. This is the one you want if you don't need 4K. Had it up and running in just a few minutes.
My disney plus and my Netflix are paid for why does it keep saying to check up on my both apps??? When I use my roku, my roku no problems at all.
Alexa on here is frustrating and doesn't know how to do simple tasks. There are problems with no sound. I have to unplug and replug it constantly.

I love the way this searches through all of my streaming subscriptions. The only reason that i didn't give it 5 stars is that I'm not really a fan of the suggestions on my home screen. They are not as great as the ones on specific subscription home pages.
We had one of the early firesticks so it was time. This new one is intuitive...if you take a breath and use all the new wires sent with it. I think it is just great.

So I got this because my old one wouldn't update anymore and it was having issues, needless to say my old i bought back in 2016 so 4 years in technology life is a long time. however i did discover that i was not the only one having issues with the old one. I set up the new one absolutely love the lay out of it.
Even with hearing aids, I can't understand much TV speech, but with this firestick, I can get get programs that I can enjoy, especially musical.
This was a quick, easy set up. Just plug and play. Got good signal strength. this is the third fire stick in our house hold, very happy with it.
Not sure why I'm asked about the Volume Control and Remote Control, since it's not included in this product. Aside from that, it works wonderfully :)
Got this on sale during Cyber Monday deals and it is working great.  Gives HD quality streaming even when I am on my 2.4GHz band.  Would definitely recommend.
I don’t have Alexa or use voice recognition, but this is really helpful. I plugged it into my projector and it works fine, have no issues. Super easy set up.

Streaming often stops, reloads and continues. Frequently asks for my cable company and a new code despite it being added the day before. I find it frustrating that it doesn’t retain codes the way it should.  Router I. Next room and is strong enough to cover entire house and porches.

I have a Firestick but was having difficulty with slow connection speeds in my bedroom. This ROKU version eliminated that issue completely. It is larger and seems to run a little hot.I really didn't care for having to give credit card info to complete my online account setup which is why I couldn't give 5 stars. I don't believe in the potential exposure when I don't plan on paying for additional services.

Includes tv on/off button and volume controls along with instant access to Netflix,Disney +,Hulu and Sling !!!Now one remote is all you need !!  Will also access Youtube TV....Great Product for streaming!!!...Get one for every TV in your house....no limit to the number when streaming , unlike Cable TV ,which requires you to rent a box for every TV !!!

This would be a good product if the remote worked. Right now I have to reboot the thing a bunch of times to get it to talk to the remote. Roku tech support took 2 days to even get back to me, and that was just to ask if I was still having the problem (and offer no actual assistance.)I really wanted to like this thing and would love to use it to finally get rid of cable TV but it's pretty useless to me so if Roku can't fix it soon for me it's going back to Amazon.

This was an upgrade from the standard Roku Stick.  We enjoyed the Stick, and expected some improvement... but this was way better than expected.  It is very responsive and we really like how the remote includes IR support to turn off/on the TV and manage the volume.  Our TV also automatically switches inputs to the proper HDMI port when we hit the Home button on the Roku.  So, the Roku remote is now our only remote.  We can also control the Roku with our various assorted phones, smart watches, tablets, etc.

This has all the options I want for online streaming and is very easy to setup and use.  I love that the volume can be controlled with the remote since that is the only thing we ever need our actually tv remote for.  You can also use the app on your phone for private listening , so if the kids are asleep I can still watch tv without worrying about the noise waking them.We did try out firestick tv but it just doesn’t have the options for channels that we use most frequently

I bought the 3810R streaming stick plus and  do like the roku overall but I really got it because the remote had a volume control.  But the remote is configured all wrong I am left handed with big fingers and thumbs. Have several times thumb on the home button and leave the program which is frustrating,  not sure at this point why a home button is needed  or its badly misplaced.  if the home key is kept at the top then place other keys between the arrows  and the home. The pause row should be right below the arrows including left arrow.

Constant audio cutout. Happens about every 15 seconds in any app. Similar reports all over the internet and Roku has never addressed them.  Apps built into the tv work fine and Apple TV works fine. I’m amazed that a company that builds one device can’t get it right. Garbage and it wasn’t even that cheap.
I bought this for the free streaming Xfinity app and love that I didn’t have to buy another Xfinity box for this extra TV.  The quality is great and it was easy to set up.

I bought this because we no longer had free cable boxes provided through XFinity.  While it does work, I hate almost all of it's functionality. It doesn't show you where the program is while fast forwarding.  When you delete a show that you have watched, you have to completely exit out of the program and go back in, otherwise it freezes.  These are just two examples.  I will be upgrading soon, I've learned a lot about these  sticks, and will research accordingly.

We bought this Roku in Nov 2017.  During the last few months, the remote has stopped working several times. We keep having to reset the remote and system. Going to get a new system because we are not sure if it is the remote or the system that isn't working.  We suspect it is only a matter of time before it stops working all together.

Remote now has a Disney+ button!We've had this running for a few weeks now.  So far, so good.  No complaints come to mind other than the unit is always on.  To remedy this, I have a power strip that has master/slave control, so the Roku is plugged in as a slave to only power up when the TV (which is plugged in as master) is powered on.

This thing sticks, literally, it smells horribly of mildew. I plugged it in and couldn’t even finish setting it up as the smell was so strong.I purchased Prime Day 2020 and had a shipping delay, purportedly due to a lack of stock; I’m not sure where the stock was stored but it reeks.

The volume buttons don't work properly.  When I press, it changes the brightness of the screen and doesn't change the volume.  Lately the audio is on every time.  When you press a button it tells you what you are doing and reads the descriptions.  I have tried to turn off in settings , but it stays on anyways. It is very annoying.  When I tried to use the speaker, it doesn't recognize what I say, bo matter how slow and precise I annunciate.  Other than all that, it works fine...but not loving this whole experience.

We have a Roku tv and love it! This is our first Roku stick. And most of the time it’s great. I don’t know if it the ones we got has so glitches because my mother-in-law has had hers for a while now and never has problems and hasn’t changed the batteries in about a year. We have had issue with streaming and I have to change the batteries all most every 3 weeks. Anyone else have that problem???

When I was trying to do set up it would not finish per their instructions. So an alert came and gave me an 800 or 855 number to call. When I called I was told I have to pay 99.99 in order for finish set up. I told them I had been diagnosed with cancer this year and had no money to give them. He them hung up on me. When I tried again the same thing happened, when I ask where is it written that one would have to pay this he said its not. Told him I would be returning he said very flippantly fine send it back. I feel this is a very deceptive practice by Roku, shame on you.

Watched a 4k movie on HBO MAX.  The Roku Stream Stick+ overheated to 193 degrees and stopped working.  It will work again when cools off then stops working even on 1080P.  Tried all of their online suggestions but none worked.  Sent an email to tech support and got no answer. Found out that many other buyers had this problem.  BOTTOM LINE-DO NOT BUY THIS DEFECTIVE PRODUCT.

I have an older smart TV that wasn't able to receive some of the newer streaming services.  The Roku Stick+ fixed all that.  It was easy to set up and I had it working in 30 minutes,  The voice-command remote really speeds up the viewing process.  All-in-all, this was a great purchase.

Ordered on June 16, 2020-the remote seems to eat through batteries quickly. 1/2021 having trouble with the remote responding. Have changed the batteries twice within the last 30 days. Have been happy with the product up until this month. I would think the remote would last longer than 7 months.

Caution!!!!!!!! Ordered a second Roku unit for bedroom. Was unable to activate unit after entering code shown on TV at web site. Called listed support phone number. Talked to someone very very hard to understand and with very loud house sounds in background. Was informed that I was required to pay $89.00 charge to get second Roku unit to work.Went back and re-read all listed into and could not find any statements about added charge to activate a second unit. POOR!!!!!Am returning unit and installing another Firestick. Roku unit required to watch church streaming. Firestick does not allow streaming from what I can understand.
I bought this strictly to watch free-with-prime movies, and am delighted.  The quality is great!  This least expensive fire stick is a bargain.

This version sucks! The original is way better. I hate that I cant control volume with this remote so I have to keep both next to me while watching tv and the "smart" features are stupid. Idk why Amazon even made this and I really wish I hadn't bought it

Liked all the apps it brought to the table, good selection good price.The voice feature isn't as good as I expected. It doesn't seem to understand things like "Replay last XX seconds," but the remotes' manual features have that functionality.
The installation was easy and the unit is fast at streaming.  The selection of apps is excellent. I choose to use the remote rather than Alexa.
I love it. Had to buy it in order to get Disney plus on my smartTV.  It was not an android model.  Works great. Easy to install.  Would highly recommend.
I was hoping to get a replacement remote, because I already a Firestick. The price of the stick was affordable to settle for the complete system. Now what to do with the old stick.
if you have some older non-smart tv's like i do this is a must have- i have 2 of these and i love them! just make sure your tv has an hdmi port
Love it! Cancelled paid subscription. Access to so many free apps and services. Enhanced viewing my Amazon Prime. Wish I had discovered sooner.
My almost 10 year old smart tv's software was starting to get outdated, so I got this firestick. Works perfectly with my TV, and now I dont need to buy a whole new smart tv!
Will not hold my wifi had to go back to the old ones. These new ones SUCK!Never going back to the new ones till they fix this problem!!!
The remote has died already. Trying to find and purchase a cheap one. But all tge replacement remotes cost as much as buying another firestick

My router is at the opposite end of the house from my TV and was worried if the wifi signal was strong enough.  Well it is and the picture quality is fantastic and having Alexa makes it very easy to find a show.  Great product.
We had Apple TV, but with the changing of apps we needed to do something different. This is user friendly and much cheaper than other options.

I had firestick a few years back and liked it so when I saw this firestick lite I was a little skeptical at first like "What is a lite?" so when I saw that it's just a control with a non volume button and saw the price, I had to get it!  It's been working great since taken out the package and I would definitely buy again.
Great product, our first one for our non-smart tv in den, easy setup, easy to use, overall pretty impressed. Would highly recommend to anyone.

I was so excited to have the amazon fire stick for our living room TV as we have gotten rid of cable and our smart tv seems to stop being smart. When I get to the box (out of amazon box which was also damaged) it was damaged. Looked like it had been ran over. :(
This is the lite version with no extra controls.  Item is as described. Still not bad for the buck if you're just a light streaming user and not looking for much. Definitely recommended.

This is a great product although I wish it was like the one I bought prior and had a volume button not a TV guide button..I bought this for my kids and im glad I did so they can watch Disney+ or whatever without interrupting our tv for nap and bedtime!
Love this option to watch feature films on Netflix, iTunes and Amazon has some great offerings.  Alexa works great finding items. Well done !
Operates much better and more responsively than our older Firestick. Setup was quick and easy: just plug it in, login, and you’re good to go.

Returned, the picture quality was so bad.  I was hoping to cut the cord of DirecTV, but this was no alternative at all.  The regular, 'studio' channels I might live with if I had to, but any sports programming was worse than the old standard definition.
Such an upgrade from the older version.Streaming, quickness of screen change all so much better! Graphics and layout of the homepage so very improved as well!!

It was very easy to install and worked very well for a year. I have a TCL Roku TV that allowed me to cut the cable cord so I bought this device to access streaming on my Sony TV. the USB stick always ran hot so I had to unplug it whenever shutting off the TV. The remote stopped working at that point even after troubleshooting as recommended. Rather than buying another remote at this time, I opted to buy the 2020 Roku Ultra which was also very easy to install and get working.

I love the voice search option. Especially at Christmas, I didn't know which app to use to find shows like Rudolph or Frosty. A quick voice search, and it pulls up all the options, including apps which I didn't even have downloaded. This was great because we were able to watch many things for free that I would have paid for without this search function!Another unexpected perk! You can Airplay Apple products to the stick. I didn't realize it had this function when I bought it, so it was a pleasant surprise.

I heard about Roku but had no idea how it worked. I had both major D streaming services paying a fortune for nothing. So I started investigating costs, service available, and the price was so cheap I bought one. Easy installation, connections to Netflix and Prime easy, so many movies, tv, you name IT you can stream on Roku. Roku services are FREE. I bought two more for other TVs, everything works great.  I don’t miss those high monthly premiums for bad tv.

Overall I just kind of found this Roku stick to be boring. My biggest problem is the limited apps that I can download. It seems like every app I download is removed from the official Roku appstore after I use it for a month or two. There is no Twitch support anymore which was a big disappointment for me. I don't see Roku as being relevant anymore since the firestick is so much better.

First Roku stick used. Easy to get going, adding all our various accounts, Netflix, Disney +, Prime, etc... works great in our projector! Ready for those backyard fires and movies on the big screen! No issues at all with wireless distance. Works everywhere through our little 1300 sq foot house.Totally recommend the Roku stick.

Absolutely amazing - very fast, very easy to use, the interface looks fresh, the voice control is good, and the ability to cast directly to your Roku with IOT devices is pretty awesome. This was my final pick after considering Chromecast and Firestick as alternatives. I think it hits it right out of the park with quality, ease of use, features, and of course, value. Going to buy a couple of these for family members less keen on tech and using streaming devices. Perfect for mom, dad, grandparents, etc. and great for us to just snap up and on the TV with no hassle.

Easy to set up, worked immediately.  I am however still learning how to use prime and some other channels offered. I was surprised at the charges for different channels,  like British channels and music? The streaming is great when you can keep track of what you watched last. Bought 2 for second TV but havent set that one up yet.
Amazed at what Roku offers! We ditched the expensive cable bill and are enjoying so many wonderful shows and movies, all for free! Have recommended Roku to many friends.

Works great, faster than the TV apps. One tip - they recommend you plug this into a wall. If you do it will get warm and stay warm all the time. I haven't noticed it getting hot doing this (my brother's overheated) but if you plug it into a USB port on the TV that doesn't happen. I've noticed no difference in streaming quality either way.

I ordered the Fire TV Stick Lite wit Alexia voice on 3/7/21- it arrived the next day!  I installed it on 3/13/21 with no problem and watched my church service the next morning.  It was easy to install even for a senior citizen.  Due to health issues I still cannot attend church- now I can watch my church service on YouTube every Sunday.  It sure beats watching on a small cell phone!  The picture and sound are really great.

What a perfect little instrument for the guests room!.  It took me literally 10 minutes to connect and make it work.  The price was just right with Amazon, came with batteries included. I didn't have to ask anybody for help. Looks great, sounds great, love it and I know my guests which are often in this household  will too.
i love how it is working with my TV now. it was easy to install and just took a couple of minutes for it to work.i haven't tried it with Alexa though :)

Can I rate this zero stars?  Or negative stars?  It doesn't work.  It takes 20 minutes for it to come on.  Until then it flashes like a strobe light.  I bought it to access HBO Max, which I'm paying for with my HBO account.  But, though Amazon advertised having the agreement with HBO to do this, I find no app to allow that.
Cachinbergolilludo
Does the job, good selection of apps. Also supports chrome cast which is awesome.

It’s a great product only thing I wish you could completely turn it off instead of sleep mode. I’ll fall sleep watching it wake up to a blank screen turn the tv off and forget about it but feel since YouTube/Netflix is open my WiFi takes a hit. Be nice to just turn it off and let it reconnect when powered back on. Other than that nothing to complain about and didn’t feel it was a big enough thing to take away a full star.
I don’t normally watch tv but got this as a gift and now I’m hooked on watching old and new tv shows with different apps I can watch movies too!
We have a fire tv in the living room and firesticks in every other room. My son is getting more into TV so i got him one for his room. Perfect.

I'm pleased with this purchase. I'm still exploring it's capabilities, but et does everything I want without any hesitation. The TV controls  ares a wonderful improvement over the firestick I had been using. It looks like it offer a bigger selection of options too. I set it for 1he 1080HD setting , as that's fine for the size of my TV. I watch so programs on Youtube that I really enjoy, and feel that it was a "bargain" for me.The cord for the power supply could be a little longer, but I found that the USB port on my TV works fine, so no problem.

Had a problem setting up due to communication between the Roku unit and the remote. I didn't realize they were not getting the signal. Contact support via chat and they steered me in the right direction. They were great. If I do not have the remote in the right location it loses communication with the unit. I am learning where to hold and aim it to achieve the desired results.

We had the first version of the Streaming Stick. This works better (power connection is stronger, features are better). Of course, you can't see any cable or satellite TV channels unless you also subscribe with a cable or satellite provider in your area. And it is a bit of a challenge to avoid all commercials, but the total cost of Netflix and Hulu, the main non-commercial streaming channels, is only a fraction of what cable and satellite companies charge for programming that mostly has commercials!

It was working fine until this week when it refuses to connect to the WiFi network that it has worked on for years.  And the signal quality is all bars - excellent.  No other device on that network have problems.  I've restarted and powered off with no luck.  It sees the network, it just won't connect to the network.I'm contacting Roku support.  It's been less than a year so according to the warranty it should be covered.  But I've not seen anything positive about their customer care.  I'll update with my experience.I've rated this 2 stars because I have another one that hasn't lost it's mind yet. So there is that.

There are several problems with the Roku unit. First, we have had multiple times where we get an overheating message. Secondly, there is a significant lag before the remote is able to communicate with the stick. You will push on the buttons and nothing will happen. Finally, and most vexingly, the stick will declare that it cannot work with the TV---unplug it and see if that works. This will usually work, but not always. With our set-up, it is a significant pain.I would like to give the unit a better score. The remote is well laid out, the menus are intuitive, and the overall package, when working, is very nice. In general, though, it has become an object of ridicule within our family with questions of, "Why do we have to use the Roku again?" (Chromecast is not supported by Amazon.)If it works for you, it is a nice unit. We have had continuing problems with it and I would not recommend to friends.

We picked up a non-smart TV (Emerson) and wanted to find a device to give us web connected content without a lot of fus or compatability issues. This Roku stick has really been a fantastic tool and I highly recommend it if you are wanting to add some additional functionality to your TV.

I got this for my mom-in-law.  I like that it can control the TV (power on/off and sound) with one remote, but the voice command wasn't very useful.  We're streaming multiple Roku channels and it seems it just finds Roku channels, not the channels or shows within a channel.  Even when I asked it to play the Frndly channel (my mom likes Hallmark), it kept wanting to go to another Roku channel.

Solid device with a set up time of under 15 minutes. I wanted to get my mother a device that functions simply for all her streaming needs. The device tunes itself to be perfectly formatted to your tv upon setup so everything looks it’s best right away, even worked on my 12 year old Toshiba. The remote is easy with few buttons that feel great to press. Still no HBO Max app but it could be coming soon.

We upgraded our old Roku device for this one. We had a very old Roku stick (maybe 1st generation) and the wifi connectivity wasn't great. There is absolutely a huge difference changing to this stick. It is so much faster, probably triple or quadruple the speed of the older model we had. I also love that it comes with a power button and volume control. If your Roku is slow and you're wondering if it's worth getting a newer model, I would say it definitely is!

Everything about the roku stick is great...Streaming, picture quality, user interface but that stupid remote always seems to have issues pairing or actually working. We've only had this device for a year and a half and the remote constantly has been unpairing or just not working altogether even with new batteries. These issues really started to manifest themselves about a year in.When it does work it works awesome, I can pretty much do anything from any part of our living room and the fact in controls the TV power functionality is great. We have our TV mounted and it sits behind the TV out of eye sight. If Roku could just make sure the remote was more reliable this thing would be a 5 star.Considering the fire stick or apple tv as a replacement now just because of the remote's unpredictability.

Everything works well, and so do most channels. ROKU ought to monitor the channel offerings periodically to insure they work as advertised. For example MLB.TV apparently does not at this time. However Netflix, VUDU, and the channels I use all work extremely well, and, when the content allows, the 4K HDR 60fps is brilliant. The device itself deserves five stars, but ... Customer support is dismal.Update: Contacted Customer Support again and this time the support was excellent. No BS, no did you plug it in? type questions. Just straight forward answers to straight forward questions.

This is a marked improvement from the old Roku I had. It picks up wifi perfectly (it's got some kind of small booster in the line behind the  TV) and I love that you don't have to point the remote right at a receiver for it to work like you do on others. Also the remote controls TV volume and power now which is especially outstanding if, like me, you watch mostly Roku in a room and therefore don't need to change the input very often. I definitely recommend it.

I see now why people are given there's such high reviews. It is fantastic!!! I bought it for my son and he loves it. Especially the voice activation part of it. It's super well-made and it was easy to hook up.I bought this to replace his old Roku 3 that wore out. This worked beautifully.
Got this to run xfinity streaming TV since the app is not available for my Firestick.

Changing my review I originally left when I purchased. I've had nothing but problems with it and have gone back to using the old version. Shuts off in the middle of a show, the whole system shuts down and Roku starts back up as if it were the first time!  It worked well the 1st month only.

All is great, except it gets pretty hot. One TV we used it on didn’t cool as well as the others, and we ended up getting a high heat warning and the thing was very hot to the touch. So much so that it was hard to handle.We swapped it to another TV and it works great. Big fan of the Roku product line in general

Cut the cable and my big smart tv wasn’t smart enough. This did the trick. I left Dish and now just stream with this, Netflix and youtube tv with dvd cloud. Happy I didn’t need to buy new tv’s. Have one in the living room and basement family room. I get a strong wifi signal with this one. Worth a fee bucks extra. The remote is all I need to turn the tv on and operate everything. The voice doesn’t always understand me but we are working on that. Love that I got rid of the cord mess. Plugs into the HDMI and USB ports.

Love this. Quite a step up from the first one I bought years ago. This must be the 5th or 6th one I’ve bought. Never a problem with any of them.I just like the on/off button on this one, the volume control, the mute button, and the voice control is nice. I’m just not yet into the habit of using it.

Just needed a Roku for Spectrum services which my 3600x Roku did well. But then I subscribed to AppleTv and it was not compatible with the 3600x .Was tired of having to switch back and forth between the 4k Firestick and the Roku inputs. Now I'm able to have all the services I subscribe to in one unit.  And it's 4k as well, so no longer need the firestick.

Fades in and out if you dont use plug... dont call cust service at night will get india and scam...batteries are low so you will need new ones right away... follow directions and use website to get access code... real easy if yoj follow directions.  Totally love it ...voice recognition works good too.... 80 year old mother can turn on and off too!10/19/19had a month and works great no wonder their stock is up!!
I purchased this on sale & I wish I would have gotten more than 1!! I don’t pay for cable anymore! This is a perfect device for cable-less streaming.
Easy set up, great addition to our viewing choices. Makes a TV without smart capabilities a smart tv, adds great function to the tv and your viewing pleasure. Easy set up, and use.
Got 2 of these and neither one loads Disney plus. I get stuck on the profile screen. Everything else works great Netflix, amazon video, etc.
This is our third one have been very happy with all of themMy daughter also bought one and she is happy tooEasy to set up and use

I can't comment on the voice control as I don't use it. I bought this because we could no longer update the apps on our Smart TV. It handles the streaming faster and more efficient. In fact I like it so much I switched over all my apps to the stick. Good value.

I only got this because google told me the Spectrum TV app could be downloaded on it since I was using the fire stick on a non smart TV. After 2 hours of trying, I realized I could not download the app and I was really disappointed. It works great otherwise, I didn’t have any problems navigating- Alexa didn’t understand what I was asking half the time over voice command though. Ended up returning it.
Before I bought this I had to watch my streaming apps on my laptop. Now I can watch them on my tv. I have no idea why I waited so long to buy one
If you would rather talk than type, this has ROKU beat by a mile.I didn't realize how much my Roku could do until I saw my Fire Stick Lite do it first.
This was a replacement for one I accidently put though a load of wash with my sheets!! :o{  Love the firestick for  all my streaming need :-)
Love our Firestick so much I got the Lite for the bedroom. No cable needed and I can watch anything I love by choosing Discovery+ and Amazon.

We purchased a second Roku streaming stick + in February, set it up and did not start to use it until 2 weeks ago. It will heat up after 15 minutes of use to over 113c. We notified Roku and they sent us a wifi extender. received that last week. Same thing, heats up and unable to use after 15 minutes. Notified Roku, they advised the stick was under warranty and we needed to return it at our expense to receive a new one. No problem, its been 4 days now and they have not emailed a return label or responded to our emails on an address to mail it to.. The window to return it back to Amazon has expired. No one is manning the phones. Its difficult to get anything resolved during these trying times. Stay Safe everyone.

Really good product. Had a little trouble with Roku customer service initially. The extension cable for the A/C adapter was defective; it would lose power randomly. After diagnosing there was nothing wrong with the product itself I attempted to procure a replacement cable from Roku. The customer representative wanted me to send the entire unit back to Roku and they would send me a replacement unit. When I insisted that I only needed the cable and not the whole unit replace I was told I had to send the whole unit back which was frustrating. Ended up keeping everything and just throwing the cable away. No problems to date since. Makes it a lot nicer to stream on our tv instead of a computer. There are a lot of apps available for different channels. One thing that is frustrating though is there is no antenna app built into the streaming stick. It seems that you have to buy a roku tv to have the functionality of not switching between an hdmi connection and tv itself. Also I have noticed that you cannot just turn off the roku stick itself. I've found that the stick creates some kind of interference that will block over the air reception. Often we have to unplug the power to Roku stick to get the over air reception to our tv. While a little annoying it doesn't outweigh the overall good things the streaming stick bring to our television experience. If your looking for something to use streaming services to your tv and have the ability to add other things down the road like stereo hookup or portability this is a great buy.

Bought this to use xfinity stream app instead of renting additional cable boxes for our additional TVs. Pays for itself in a matter of months. Watch live cable tv (xfinity), plus a bunch of other apps - Netflix, Hulu, etc.

I bought the Roku specifically because I wanted to stream Disney+. And I have to say it does not disappoint. It is very user friendly, you can even control things from your computer--makes downloading different services a lot easier and quicker. Only downfall for me is the voice recognition doesn't seem to work very well, basically not at all. But that's a minor thing that doesn't particularly bother me. I would totally recommend this item if you are on the fence about it.

The Roku Streaming Stick + I had the Roku Express Devices hooked up to both my Big Screen living room TV & Smaller Screen TV in the Bed Room. But Since i got the Roku Streaming Stick + What A Big Difference, The new 2019 Roku Streaming Stick + Has, 4X The power!!!! The Picture Quality is So Crisp & Clear, HD & 4K/HDR. Plus The Roku Remote Has Voice Command & Volume Controls, Plus you can Turn Your TV's On & Off With This Roku Remote. A Must Get, Makes a Great Gift or Christmas Present. Easy To Set-Up. I'm Loving My New Roku Experience.
Easy to use and many free channels. Wish I bought this years ago. Great deal. I would gladly pay twice the amount for what you get. Plus it's portable and holds all your info.

My Roku was getting hot even after I got the free extension from Roku. Support, after several contacts, decided I should return the product for a new one. They provided just an email explaining how to return the product.I had to PAY for the return. I find this ridiculous. I will not buy another Roku.

We bought 3 of these to save money on our cable bill.  They work great and so far we have had no lag.  Very easy to set up.  We had them all set up in about 10 minutes.  The only negative for me is not having numbers on the remote, so you are doing a lot of scrolling, but worth it for the  $ I am saving each month.

I purchased this stick and I can watch hundreds of movies all for free. The choice of channels is great. Easy to set up, easy to use. I used to pay $200 a month in satellite TV and now I have a streaming service for $49 a month. I highly recommend. I can't believe I was living under a rock and did not know about Roku!

The setup and activation were easy, it just took far longer than I thought it should. But then I have a lot of channels on my Roku account.My only issue is that I get an onscreen overheating message. It is plugged into an HDMI auto switch on top of my media cabinet. Not anywhere near another heat source. I finally moved the switch over so that the ROKU was sticking out in the air off the edge of the cabinet. That seems to have mostly stopped the messages. The previous HD ROKU stick was also very hot. They need to put cooling fins in the outer case. If this issue continues I will probably stick a heatsink on it.
So much better than a roku box.!!  I really like the microphone that's on the remote control. Really like the web browser too!! So easy to use and set up.  I'm so glad I ordered this!!
Very happy with the product, but disappointed that Amazon dropped the price significantly between the time I ordered mine and the time it arrived. Bad timing, I guess.
I love it! I got rid of cable and just use it to view movies and local news as well. The picture is excellent and crisp. Should have done this years ago!
Love the fire stick so far. Haven't  used it much yet. I would  recommend  this to anyone  that wants to get rid of cable or satellite  TV.
It was so simple to hook up and download all the apps. From taking it out of the package to plugging it in and watching tv took me less than 20 mins.
This was bought to replace the last one that didn’t last very long. The new one works great but hopefully it lasts longer than my last one.
No trae botones es para subir y bajar el volumen y ya eso te obliga a usar dos controles el del tv y este,tampoco puede bajarlo con el control de voz, para Internet si esta bueno y fácil de instalar

I connected it to my television.  It asked for my wifi password and then synced.  It then said that it needed to do a software update.  After that, it will no longer sync.  I've had it for a week and haven't been able to use it even after trying all of the troubleshooting tips.

Received.... went to set up and it did the software updates, show the "firetv" symbol and went black. Called amazon and there is not technical support for this at all.... it was you send back to receive refund or we will send a replace and you have to send this back. I bought one before this and it lasted 6 months before it would come on and then go off then go and come back on. At 6 months its passed the return date. Totally unhappy!
Buttons weren't effective, had to push several times to have an effect. Ended up just buying new Fire stick at best buy on 1/2 price sale.
