My family finally left cable and thanks to the fire stick we didn’t have to go out and buy a smart TV. This saved us a lot of money and with parent controls it’s easy to keep children from buying things.
This fire stick was new enough to make an older TV able to utilize streaming services. Previously I thought I would have to get a new TV. Great investment.
There is no power button or volume button on the remote so you always have to have 2 remotes! I would have returned them but you have to pay to return these you can't take them to Kohl's!

This is perfect for my second home so I do not have to get cable service there.  I just stream using the apps connected to my home cable service.  The only station that is a pain is CBS since they do not allow you to stream outside your local area.
Cannot use this. Everytime I plug it in this device crashes my internet, resulting in the stick not working and my internet completely goes down. Returning. Very disappointed.

It’s an amazing device. It connects very well with my wifi and doesn’t suffer any issue or quality downgrade while I’m watching my favorite shows. I was able also to activate the developer features for me to install 3p apps which is also great. Five stars ⭐️

The manual said it came with a usb cable for power. The wall adapter was in the box but there was no cord. How do you forget the power cord? What's funny is even though there was no 2$ usb cable that should have been there, there was two fire sticks in the box instead of one. Jokes on you amazon I got a drawer full of cords! But seriously it was pretty annoying.

It is a lot faster than the previous model and more capable. The surround sound is sharp, clear and very well defined. Easy to install. Get your Amazon prime account, start the installation and let it ride step by step. Very easy.

Didn't research enough as to why it's the "lite" version of a normal firestick. Didn't like that you still need the tv control to turn on/off and change the volume. Otherwise, its similar to the "normal" firestick".
The sound keep going out. It only happen when I'm using the fire stick. To fix it, you have to restart the fire stick which is annoying. I should have returned.

This Roku Stick with voice remote is the best device of 5 I've purchased over the years. It is faster and works well for streaming phone content to my TV. I got it on sale and, in hindsight, I should have purchased 2 or 3.This one allows adding the Xfinity Stream app. That app, however, doesn't allow functions like pause, rewind, etc but that's not the fault of Roku.

Its a great product, easy setup and lots of channels to choose.  What I didn't like is Roku is a menu driven operating system where some channels are aggregates of many channels, such as Xfinity Streaming having over 500! The only way to get to channel 266 is to scroll to it.  Not terrible, but if I had one wish for the remote designers, I'd ask for a number pad.  Forget the fast keys to dedicated channels, that's a waste.  Overall, I'm still super happy with product.

One, the remote will not turn on or off the TV and it has been. I can turn the TV on with the TV remote and get to the Roku page but I cannot go to any channel or any other feature. Amazon says it is beyond the time for return and I am stuck with a Roku that does not work.Update, embarrassing, batteries were bad in the remote.

The remote control doesn't work anymore. Right about the time my return date expired is when it stopped working. It's so frustrating to have something that you depend on to watch TV with and it doesn't work. I've replaced the batteries I've done everything I could think of doing to get it to work and it still won't work. I can't send the remote control back because the time frame to send it back has expired. I honestly can't recommend anyone buy this product because of the remote control issue. You can't use the Roku without the remote control.

I am very pleased with the streaming service options and the picture quality. Recently cut the cord  and this is a great way to consolidate all of the streaming services onto one platform for access individually. The voice recognition seems to work pretty well. I am happy with the purchase and ease of set up.
Easy. Works. 😊 If "I" could set this up, a monkey can. No clue why I waited. I'll save $120 yearly by just returning ONE cable box. Best part is my awesome TV has 1 cord, period 👌

Took a few minutes to setup, went off without a hitch. Very snappy and responsive. There is no calling to activate your roku device like you may see in some reviews, those people are *ahem* not suitably equipped to deal with the real world.The only complaint I can really lodge against it us how many different models there are to choose from, it's crazy.

We have a Roku upstairs and our lower level tv never got used because it needed to be rewired for our new service so we only could use it for games or dvds.  We ordered this and our son was able to just hook it in and start watching. I wish we would have bought this sooner!

Full menu of apps (Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, Disney+, etc.), tons of free TV shows and movies, compatible with our Google Home. Would have given it a 5 except for 2 things: it doesn’t work with our sound system so we have to use the TV’s speakers, and it gets very hot. But it’s a really great value for the money.

Had it for just over a year and  four months and suddenly it stopped working. Can’t seem to get the roku remote or app remote to pair with the Roku stick. I even unplugged the darn thing for a day and still I got the same screen after it boots up”pair your remote”. This is usually an easy fix for me because I’ll usually unplug the power cord for a few minutes and replace the batteries with new ones. Looks like $60 down the garbage.

Did ok for about a month but after that things went downhill FAST. Doesn't connect, video freezes up every 2-5 seconds, error messages around network connection are nonstop. Meanwhile all the other devices in the house are absolutely fine, network strength is fine, everything is working as it should except the roku. Not sure if we just got a defective one but overall impression is very bad.

This roku was better then I thought it would be.  I got it on sale over the holidays and couldn't be more impressed.  I have always been a fan of the user interface which makes things very easy.  The setup took less than 10 minutes as well!  The remote with voice recognition was a sweet surprise and works extremely well!  Picture looks great and there is no lag in watching shows.

**1 1/2 month update**The remote keeps draining new batteries, contacted Amazon, and Roku, working with warranty replacement.Original review after purchase:Love that I can use the hdmi to usb and power from my TV set. The only downfall is the small remote.

I have been with Roku since their very first Roku box that was the size of 5 CD cases stacked on each other.  I liked the offering then, and I really like the Stick+.  The Stick+ is fast, easy to setup and use.  The only beef that I have is not the item itself but rather one of the Roku Channels, the Media player channel (Or App.  However you want to look at it.).  I wished it played more media formats than it does, but it's a very minor thing.  Overall the thing works great.

You have to give them your DOB (why????) And a credit card (why .??) To get it set up.  If you have a smart TV, you do not need this.  This turns a TV into a smart TV.  Not sure that the so called free channels have much content that is not readily available elsewhere.  Voice works well.  You have to set up almost every channel you want to watch and link each channel to you home internet provider. But once setup, works well

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   The Roku stick worked fine out the box, but 9 months later the remote stopped working and all the apps glitch. Using the roku app worked for a week or two until none of the apps work. Is it worth the cost? You decide.

This streaming device knocks the Amazon fire stick out of the water. The picture quality is so much better and most importantly it does not drop the wireless connection every time you change a channel.  The set up was easy, anyone could do it. Highly recommend and will be buying more.

I bought this product on May 20,2018 and have had it on TV since. It worked great until 10/8/18 when remote would not control the on/off/volume. I called Roku and they sent me another remote but it didn't work either. I continued using the remote without those features working. Recently another problem with Roku arrived. The unit will not connect to Spectrum unless I unplug the power cord and reboot it. Sometimes this takes several tries. This unit is very frustrating and I doubt I will buy another.

Very easy to set up.  Screens are easy to customize.  Have not tried voice or Alexa.Minor irritation: the volume and mute buttons are on the side so I find myself frequently hitting them when I grip the remote.If I could change a feature I would allow for the headsets to work AND the TV volume to stay one so those of us who don’t hear as well can enjoy the show while others can hear it on TV...just sayingOne thing though...pay attention  to the price, I bought it for $59 and a week later it was $49.  Fortunately, Amazon is good about stuff like this and I was able to swap purchases.

I've had a TV for years that I never really used, I always watched TV on my laptop or iPad. But this Roku makes it so I can watch TV on an actual TV! It linked all my apps (Hulu, Netflix, prime) in one place where I can easily watch. The only thing that didn't work with the Roku is volume control, but my TV (Westinghouse) is a weird brand I guess. But all other features are working, including voice control. Definitely worth the purchase in my opinion.
My son lost his so had to replace it, he loves it! Voice command works excellent. its a compact remote. Good quality & easy to use as well as set up.
I have been using a Fire stick for years but I do sometimes get buffering, I have not had that issue since I changed to the Fire Stick Lite.

Occasionally the firestick will freeze on a black screen but once I figured out how to reset it it was fairly simple to get going again. works great! I'm happy and I have another remote for the TV controls and have no trouble keeping track of either.

Works without internet!Screen mirroring from phone or tablet is all I've got. Press and hold home button until mirroring enable appears on Firestick! This is a huge feature and it works beautifully!I highly recommended this little beauty!
I love it,  seems to work/connect much faster I don't recall it buffing since I switched from the 4k So even if it has it's not a problem because I remember the Buffering I was dealing with
Well these are so simple to set up and use they're truly plug in and watch. PRIME gives you a ton of movies,series etc. Internet and a smart TV Enjoy.
I keep losing remotes so I buying new fire sticks because a replacement remote is basically the same price as a new fire stick.  Easy to use.
This is a replacement for a Fire Stick that stopped working.  This one is fine, however, I had to replace the whole unit and not just the remote.  It's the remote that stopped working.
I just can't get Alexa to communicate with my TV, it is a Samsung old model. Have to manually turn my TV off, where all the rest of remotes never need to .

Everything is good on this product but I Just will like to share that my factory seal package was missing the USB cable for powering the unit. Must be a factory packaging error but will like to know if anyone that recently ordered the product did encounter this same issue. Thanks!

Set easy and wifi connection simple.  Roku streaming device worked so well that I bought a second one for another TV.  Also dropped Comcast to basic on one TV and eliminated it on another as there are so many streaming channels that I hardly every us cable except for some live news reports.  Great to watch movies and TV shows, especially PBS.

The first Roku Streaming Stick+ would not connect. A replacement was provided fairly quickly and installed easily.There's a bit of setup involved in connecting to subscription services, but as long as you have your passwords available, the process is straightforward and menu-driven.Navigating through other setup aspects, such as changing the order of channels, is not intuitive. Once the instructions are reviewed on Roku's website, the changes were pretty easy.I deducted one star because Roku support is email or community only, so effectively non-existent for any unusual issues, such as I experienced with my first Roku.

This thing is great.  I bought it to use on my trip to MX in the hotel room.  Setup was a breeze, nice & portable, streamed with hotel wi-fi easily.  Finally there’s more than 3 channels to watch while on vacation.  Highly recommend!!!

Worked great with the items included in the package until this evening. it just so conveniently stops working after the 30 days are up to try to exchange or return. i try to call both roku and amazon help line and can't get thru. What a waste of money! Purchased 7/9/19 and quit working today, 8/13/19. Edit*** husband found out that it isn't getting power. when plugged directly into tv thru another hdmi port it works. So boils down to a faulty adapter plug or chord. Sucks that it is taking up a hdmi port that i could use for another device.

I purchased this to replace a roku that was suddenly not working. When installing. Kept coming up with error code.. called tech and suddenly i have to pay 80 bucks to get it working.. a new account thing , with so called better security.. no where anywhere is it stated new or updated account needed..if i cant use it ,i returned it. This policy is not advertized anywhere, it is sold..i looked everywhere..

This is the best Roku I've ever owned, and the first one I am pretty much completely happy with. The new power/volume buttons on the remote control are a game changer, it means you can put your old remotes away and do it all with Roku now. This unit is also much faster and more responsive than the previous generations. They had to really improve processor speed and memory to make sure it could handle 4k video. It also seems to have a much more reliable wifi connection, the one furthest away from my router has no problems streaming high definition content, unlike my old rokus.  I also love that you can plug the USB into the back of the TV and so don't need to use an outlet or have anything visibly connected to the TV. It's completely invisible.

The remote stopped working 1.5 years after purchase. I tried all sorts of fixes from roku's webpage and didn't work. I downloaded roku app but my phone can't find the device, even though both devices are connected to the same internet signal. My last option is to buy another remote but I haven't decided if I really want to spend more money on it. I like roku better than Fire Stick but after a few years, my fire stick is still working with minor incidents here and there.

I ordered two different devices and they both performed the exact same way.  Intermittenly the screen would go blank and an example of the source w appear on the screen then the video would continnue until seeming no reason the same thing would occure.  I saddened me as I was enjoying everything else about the performance of the device...the blackouts became annoying enough for me to ask for a return of the product.

Amazing device! Simple plug and use setup. Connects and works great with my protector! I picked this particular Roku for the voice remote feature and the quick access buttons to Netflix and Disney+. Money well spent. Can't get enough of this and can't wait to travel and take all my entertainment in my Roku with me!!!

Very happy with this device. It was the only device that gave me HDR with Dolby Digital 5.1 with Netflix, and Vudu with my Sony X900e  and Sonos 5.1 set up (Beam with ARC connected).  No need for any high speed HDMI cables, and able to cut down on wire clutter by having it powered by USB port right on my TV.  (Very little lag when waking)Previously, was using an Apple TV 4k which was spotty between needing the correct high speed HDMI cable, and most Itunes HDR movies only available in Dolby Vision ( not supported by the Sony 900e). The 900E built in apps did not allow me to get HDR  picture either (Have to cast from your phone to the TV)Highly recommended.

The Roku Streaming Stick + is almost perfect!  This is my 6th Roku device. It is certainly the best. The install went very well. It correctly paired the power and volume controls with my old 32" Samsung TV.The HDMI1 port on my TV sticks straight out the back of the TV. If I hadn't ordered the free HDMI EXTENDER from Roku, the TV wouldn't have fit close to the wall. I advise everyone to order the extender. This stick is so long, it likely would not fit the main HDMI port on many TVs without the extender. It should be included in the box. Took about a week to receive after I ordered it from Roku.I used the included power adapter rather than take a chance with my TV's USB port. Many TVs were designed not to deliver enough power from the USB port.The power and volume controls on the remote work great on my TV.The WiFi reception is very good.So far, I am very pleased with the Roku Streaming Stick +!UPDATE: I have bought a 2nd Stick+ and use it on a 39” Element TV powered by the TV’s USB port. When TV is first turned on, the TV frequently doesn’t have sound. To get sound, the TV must be repeatedly turned off and on until sound returns. Problem may be caused by the Roku being plugged into HDMI 3.

Barely 5 months in and it continuously dropped the pairing between remote and stick, and now the remote has stopped working completely. I've had reset and paired the remote 6 times in the past 2 days and today it just stopped working. And there is no way to contact seller/support via Amazon?

Another useless product.  Could not pair the remote.  After a search online, looks like this is a common problem.  Users report trying multiple sets of batteries in hopes one set will finally work.  Didn’t for me.  Why is it that a company expects the user to troubleshoot a brand new piece of equipment?

I wish I had read the reviews before I purchased this stick.  I too, ran into a problem in activating the stick and called the number shown on the screen and was told by someone that I had to choose a "package" and pay a one time fee to activate it.  What a bait and switch.  Nothing in the description states there will be a charge to activate this service.  It should be written on the packaging and in the description for Amazon!  I'm returning the stick and won't consider anything from ROKU again.

We bought this Roku stick to stream a channel we didn't otherwise get. Every time we try to use the stick, we have to unplug it, wait 10 seconds, and plug it back in. We have had other Roku boxes that work find and do not require a constant reset. I'd personally NOT purchase this item again.

Came with instructions, easy to follow, hooked up quickly and we were aa go. Later tried the wifi antenna and it again was easy and works great. Had the old system which had gotten tired and now no problems. I like the controller on this one, turns on TV, control volume so I am not always looking for and changing controllers.

I have a Roku Stick that I misplaced the remote to , and enjoyed it. I looked into Fire Sticks but ultimately chose this Roku Stick + and I have been very happy with my purchase. I LOVE LOVE the volume controls on the side so I don't have to keep track of two remotes (TV & Roku) which was a previous frustration of mine. Also the feature to power the TV with this Roku remote is also a plus!! (No pun intended).

Organized, easy to use, easy to set up on my Samsung smart tv  Roku streaming enables you to set up a  Home Screen where you can delete useless apps and include only those you use  Samsung smart tv built in streaming is disorganized and not user friendly Roku streaming becomes the default and you only use the Roku remote
Now our 6 year old dumb TV navigates our favorite streaming services faster than our two year old smart TV. The voice recognition works very well, too.

Amazing!!  With my Roku I can use one remote for everything!  I love this device!  So easy to setup and use!  My friends told me about this device but I was skeptical, Not anymore!!  I can watch all my subscriptions and there are lots of Free TV and movies.

I've been using this ROKU since Jan and all of a sudden it started saying no input found. I would unplug and set back up. Now it just plays sounds,  says my HDMI cord (which I don't have.. it plugs directly into HDMI port) may be bad and is not 4k compatible. That's the main reason I bought this one. And I've tried YouTube and Google to correct issue with no luck.

The roku stick itself is very easy to set up and use.  However the remote batteries die every few days.  This has become quite expensive to use with the battery issue. We have started leaving the batteries out until we need to use it (even while watching TV we remove the battery until we need to adjust volume). I bought two of the kits and both have the same issue so it does not seem to be a defect. Very disappointed with the battery issue

This is my 3rd Roku device that I've owned over the years.  I started with the first gen a decade ago and now this.  This unit is replacing my Amazon Fire TV due to quality issues that was having.  This is my first streaming device that I'm using with wifi as I've always made a point to use an Ethernet cable for the best connection.  Setup was simple as usual and it connected to my 5ghz wifi with no issues.  I've been using it for a while now with absolutely no problems whatsoever.

This used to be a device that you bought, you downloaded your services, and you streamed. You were the customer. Not any more. Now you buy the device, but you can only stream from services that Roku can monetize you with, either by taking a share of the advertising, forcing the service to integrate into and/or provide content for, the Roku Channel, or letting Roku take some of the service’s ads. You are now the product, not the customer. So if a service doesn’t cave to Roku’s demands, you can’t watch that service on Roku and need to buy an additional, neutral, streaming solution that let’s you watch your content.  Not cool.

I gave up on my Apple TV box, which was (I think) 4th generation. The remote was awful. In comparison, this Roku stick is a pleasure to use (and a third of the price of the stupid Apple box). Easy navigation. Voice commands work quite well. Recommended.

We RV and just bought a new 5th wheel.  It did not come with a smart tv like our previous trailer.  I did research and Roku was most recommended streaming stick.  This was the best price and arrived new in box in the time estimated.  I am very happy to have tv reception again.  Great product!

Fairly easy to set up.  Mostly intuitive.  Do not use the voice recognition very much.  So far, seamless streaming with the Roku stick.  Content far exceeds what we had available through satellite television.  The monthly savings from switching from satellite tv to our Roku stick has enabled us to purchase a new tv and we are thrilled.  Can’t say enough good things about Roku.  If you can, cut the cord and go internet through Roku

Came with a great remote that can control my panasonic TV; a must for me.  It is a lot more responsive than my old prime stick.  If you like the more expensive Ultra, get this one for cheaper.  Not comparable in performance with Ultra, but definitely will suffice
Works great when it works. I have had two of these fail on me the last few months. One of which was new and the last one was only a year old.  The devices are cheap but beware they break easily.

Love it. It gave me stranger things!!!!! And X-Files. I loyX-Files. Special Agent Scilly is my first big girl crush, so it has a special place in my heart. And 11 just flat out rocks. Anyway, back to the device....Very easy set up. Great quality. No lag or interface differences from the roku box. I’m blind so I really appreciate the voice input search feature. Get it, you know you want to.... yeah!!!! Do it, Doug!!!!!!

The Fire TV Stick Lite works perfect for our "non-smart" TV. The only difference compared to the regular Fire Stick is that you cannot control the volume and cannot shut the TV off with the remote. We don't even notice the difference to be honest. I would recommend especially if you're not ready to upgrade your TV.
Great price, great video, simple to use, but I don’t have volume control on my device. I don’t know why it says it does but I tried everything on the remote.
This thing is super fast compared to my older model, happy with it although I am not sure of volume control, maybe that's another model?
Great cheap way to be able to stream on a non-smart tv! Why even consider and pay so much more for other brands when this works just fine?
I bought this on sale for about $18. It doesn’t bother me at all that I need to use the tv remote to control the volume. Well worth the price.

We upgraded our Fire Stick because our original version was slower than slo-mo videos. This version is super fast and user friendly.  However, one of the reasons we upgraded was to stream Apple TV.  It does not stream Apple TV - even though it has the Apple TV log on the packaging.  Google searches told us that this version has not received the upgrade in order to stream it - but it's likely coming.  So we are back to watching it on our iPads for now.
I purchased this newer Firestick because my older one did not support YouTube TV. It works great and is a lot faster than my older version.

Overall it's great but I can't log into ESPN using my Directv account. I've searched and have tried several "solutions" but still can't get it to work. From what I've found, there are other TV providers that have issues as well so be warned.
I’ve purchased 7 fire sticks over the past couple years (for different locations), each one better than the last. Loving the new upgrade. Highly recommend to everyone who asks.

Got this for my dad. He’s 50+. He loves his current TV so he won’t upgrade to a new one that can can connect to Disney+ and Prime. Now he’s able to watch on both and it’s easy for him to navigate and he’s not the most tech savvy person.
Turned my dumb tv into a smart tv , but don't expect free tv this is only helping you get apps to buy and free has tons of commercials.
I like the convenience of eliminating a cable tv bills, clarity of HD tv, & choices of free/discounted stations. It is reliable and easy to operate.
I have purchased quite a few fire tv sticks over the years, this is a very nice simple version. Great addition to my bedroom television
Checking for updates for hours...... never left the screen !!!! This isn’t 1990s dial up. It’s 2021. Updates shouldn’t take more than seconds!!
I use this fire stick for my bedroom TV. I already have one in the front room. It is great being able to see all my streaming shows on either TV.
I recently bought the Firestick Lite.  No problems with setup, easy to use, but it loses audio sometimes which requires a reset.  Can figure out why.  Very frustrating!
Very easy to set up and easy to use.  I have 2 other Fire Sticks and this one was for my mom and I was able to easily show her how to use it.
I had an old GoAll TV stick. Needed to upgrade and I have only had it for about a week but so far I am happy with it. Does just what I expected.
I could not get Disney Plus to play. Sometimes it would let me get as far as asking who is watching and then freeze up. I have several friends that have had issues with the “lite” as well.
love these firesticks.  We have been using firesticks/tv for about 6 years and wouldn't have it any other way.  The price is affordable and it gives you everything you need to stream.

Having a problem with the install. Wont work without going thru the blu-ray player... As a stand alone product this is unnecessary. This was going to be used instead of the blu-ray.  Still working on this. This TV is not connected to cable or sat. Only used for subscribed channels.It does work nicely though thru the Blu-ray. So far have not used the voice recognition.
Upgrade took care of some problems I was having with my older fire stick. I appreciated the sal as well as I am a school teacher on a lower salary.

This went to upgrade our projector with ROKU capabilities, but the bonus of the RF remote working while this is plugged in behind our receiver is excellent. We have a ROKU capable TV and this seems significantly more responsive than the TV remote itself.

There was not enough space on the back of my TV and where my HDMI port is to plug in the HDMI Stick (the stick is too long).Its obviously an issue since ROKU offers a free "HDMI extender" and they note it in the set up guide.Its also an ongoing issue since its all over Youtube (I should have looked there before ordering).Bottom line is ROKU should include it in the package as a "just in case you need it" or at the very least put a warning up to measure the space available on the back of your TV.

I couldn't love this more. We had two Roku TV's upstairs that were so cool we bought the streaming stick for our family room & finally cut the cord on our cable. ZERO regrets! We have everything we had with our cable package plus SOOOOO MUCH MORE!!! For 1/4 of what we paid for cable, seriously. Buy it 😉

Besides being delivered to the wrong apartment, the actual set up was super easy! This device brings ALL of my streaming services together & includes the movies/tv shows i bought from Itunes. Its so nice to have them all in once place. If i had one issue, it seems there can be a random lag & the quality of youtube video is not the best. But overall, this is definitely worth it!

I have two of these and they are pretty excellent streaming sticks. Roku seems to have good support and there are an amazing number of 'channels' that can be added. Performance is great, most of the channel apps launch quickly (but some are slower than others). Only issue I've had is one of the devices had issues with the remote 'disconnecting'. Roku support recommended the HDMI extension to solve the problem - sounded like hooey to me, but it did resolve the issue. While not as cheap as some other streaming options, I have zero regrets.

The roku is not all free streaming! There are add on apps that you have to subscribe to. Also much of the free content is old or movies even God has not heard of. The remote looses its interface very frequently so you have no control of the TV or Roku. Also BEWARE!!!! There are some Roku sites on the internet to help you set up RoKu for a FEE. FAKE sites!!!! If you need to contact Roku all of their help is FREE! Be forewarned!

I have several versions of the Roku products and replaced 2 with streaming sticks. There were a few issues at first with picture quality, but they were easily resolved after re-calibration. I use them with monitors and they work great with few to no loss of signal issues.

The unit works with the ROKU app on my iPhone. However the remote control  interaction with the streaming stick is quite unreliable.  Almost daily I have to remove the batteries from the remote and execute the steps to pair the unit with the remote. Sometimes this works the first time but often it takes more than 2 tries to reestablish the connection. I am returning the device.  I had the same problem with a ROKU 4 unit.

This is a great product at a great price. But beware of two things:1.  The dedicated app keys on the remote are: Netflix/Hulu/ESPN/Sling.  This does not match the picture which has HBO NOW and Prime.....major disappointment.2.  Streaming Sticks do NOT work with OEM remotes that combine Roku keys with programmable TV/Sound bar keys into one single remote.

I have enjoyed using the fire stick but mostly my great-grandson has enjoyed it. I have it in the kitchen and he watches movies all the time. I have to ask him to remember to put it back on TV. He showed me the feature on the controller to switch to TV and watch local stations. Great fire stick.
Navigating is painfully slow and so are load times compared to the 4k version. But for 17 bucks this is a great deal. It runs on Android and will install apk files.
I had a knowledge of the Fire Stick and was pleased that the install was as simple as I had been told. Have not used the voice recognition function.
I absolutely love the firestick. Definitely better then paying for cable and gives you the ability to monitor what your kids are watching.
Updated version is a little faster on response time.  Customer agent told me it had more memory than the old one, but it did not.  Both have 8gb.

These new fire sticks are complete garbage.  I highly recommend trying to find one of the older ones the new 2020’s don’t have volume control and you have to buy an additional $20 component a fire tv blaster to be able to turn your TV on and off or to be able to turn the volume up and down. Way to rip your customers off Amazon. Greedy bastards.

I'm an avid Apple fan, and have used the Apple TV for years now. I needed something more updated but didn't want to spend over $100 for a new device. I got the Fire TV Stick on sale for about 17.99. (can't recall the exact price right now. This device had everything my Apple TV has/had and is much more personalized to my taste! I love it and I'm sorry I didn't try and buy it sooner!
We have really enjoyed having the fire stick not only to watch NCHC hockey but using all of the other features it offers and programs that are free.

Have this hooked up to the TV at my treadmill.  Does the job for what I want—-watching TV when on the treadmill. Since the TV is right there in front of me, I don’t care that this stick does not include TV control.
I wish prime would get something going with HBO max so I can watch and pay for movies through prime and not have to sign up to HBO max
I have a satellite network that no longer carries NBCSCH. I purchased this so I could watch Chicago Blackhawks. I now watch every game!

I only use this to access YouTube because I don't have cable. At least half the time YouTube won't play. Then the next day it will work.  It's not my Wi-Fi, I can access YouTube on my Kindle.  And there's no tech help available that I can find.  I'm glad it wasn't expensive!

I love being able to use all my apps on my TV rather than my laptop individually! The only drawback is finding the the last episode that I watched. I usually use the mic on the controller to find the program and have to search for the episode that I left off on. This might just be me not being tech savvy though.

The set up was very easy 15 minutes tops. I had to switch from wide screen to regular that east too. Everything synced because this is my second fire stick for another TV. In 20 minutes I was watching TV.
These fire sticks are just awesome. I have a regular one in my living room and now the lite version in my bedroom. I use these more than the actual cable too!

cut the cord and my great grand-daughter who is 3 still wanted her cartoons.  works great and I have what I want and it is cheaper than satellite service that I had.  I have the lite version so it does not control the tv or the sound.

There is absolutely no reason why a modern electronic device shouldn't have at least a 1 year warranty. This "broke" one month out of the return window which is 90 days. By broke, I mean, it just didn't turn on one day, again, about 4 months after purchasing. I guess roku just earned a new customer
Got it for my bedroom TV. Good connection to the internet. Fast and without any buffering. Convenient voice control. Would recommend.

I legit hate this thing. I ordered one before Christmas had multiple issues with it. Customer support couldn’t help repeatedly. Finally returned it. Went to my local amazon retailer (meijer) and purchased one! Now I can’t get it to “wake up” without unplugging and plugging it back in. Absolutely ridiculous. Should have gone with the original fire stick like on our other TV. Totally unhappy.

With all of the channels I was receiving with  DIRECT TV, and now am receiving with ROKU I have cut approximately fifty percent off of my monthly TV bill!  That being said, it obviously is well worth the money considering, that in my case, I’m saving approximately $700.00 per year!

I so luv everything about Roku it’s new and awesome . Recently I purchased a 85 inch screen TV it was on sale great buy . If I had a choice it would be Roku so I purchased this streaming stick and it’s as if I’d bought a Roku TV . Works great and if you already have a Roku TV you can understand lol . Enjoy

It’s a pretty great product, but I got it for hotel travel and I struggle to get the Roku to connect to most hotel wifi. I struggle to blame the device because I’m sure the wifi signal is hot garbage, but I’m typically able to connect with my computer so the device deserves some amount of culpability.
After 5 weeks the Roku started to display temperature warnings and reboot randomly. Roku has plenty of air flow.

After trying different projects, Roku by far has been the best experience.  Setup was easy, and the wizard even how's through programming the remote with my tv.  I did not have to look up codes or anything. Roku also has all the applications that I needed, YouTube, YouTube TV, Netflix, Amazon prime video, sling, direct TV now, HBO go, Starz, showtime...  and many more.The device is fast there is almost no wait to open applications or even to start.For a cord cutter, this is the device I would recommend.

This is a great replacement for our Spectrum cable box, it has eliminated the monthly cable box fee.  Lots of apps. This is our third and contrary to another review here, there is no fee to have more than two of these registered to the same account.
Problem with these remotes not functioning and using battery quickly. Roku has problem they won't admit to. Don't buy.

Great product. I have used Roku for years, but this model is excellent. I was concerned at first that it may have difficulty with bandwidth for streaming, but it works perfectly. The remote control is a big differentiator, it not only pairs wirelessly (Not vie IR, Infrared) that allows control of the Roku without line of sight, but i also has an IR transmitter to allow control of the TV to turn on/off and volume control. So now I only need one remote control. It is fast to respond and was very easy to set up with many fine tuning features and options.
I bought this 3 months ago and have had nothing but trouble. The remote doesn’t work properly and when I chatted to a tech online, they wanted to charge me $69.99 to update it!Rip off!

The interface is better than Fire Stick but the remote is unreliable. It often doesn't work, and I have to go through the cellular app to connect, and even that sometimes fails. Also, when you launch, it sometimes tries to install apps you don't want without you asking.
This is the worst fire stick possible it doesn't have sound control it's confusing I wouldn't spend a dime on it for sending it back.
Really easy to set up and use. I have three Fire Sticks and love the separate profiles. My Wife and Daughter each have their own profiles.

We bought this because our (3 year old) Roku did a horrible job of streaming anything from Amazon on our TV. (Our Roku worked great with Netflix but not Amazon Prime) Now we have perfect picture/sound quality! Well worth the money.  Also the added  “Alexa” is a great bonus.

The device works as intended - the only issue I have is that the remote feels very cheaply made and every time I depress the circle buttons I can hear the plastic shifting, especially the cover for the batteries. The remote for the other firestick I purchased was not like this. Not sure if it is just my unit but other than that the unit works fine overall.

It’s so much better than the build-in Android TV system of my TV! It’s so easy to assemble and you don’t need to read a thick manual to know how to use it, it’s almost happened spontaneously. I love the app “downloader” in this fire tv stick that allows me to download and install those apps I want. The lite stick is enough for me cuz I don’t need 4K and Alexa voice controls. Everything so far is pretty good.

I have 2 TVs in my house - both original firesticks I bought about 1 1/2 years ago have now totally failed. One refuses to hook up to network, the other is just dead, no HDMI outThey are not real expensive, bought a new one to replace the first, that died, now I guess I need to get another new one.Don't like the user interface on the new one as well as the older one - but it is usable

I purchased this product in December of 2020.  In March (right after the 90 day limited warranty ran out), it stopped working.  When I would turn it on, all I would get is the "FireTV" load screen and nothing further.  Customer service wasn't able to help either.  I would definitely recommend avoid buying this.
I got it because it was super cheap! I had a fire stick from about 7 years ago. It was time to upgrade. It super fast! Way faster than my “smart TVs” capabilities.
Fire TV Stick Lite with Alexa is amazing! It was a Christmas gift to my husband and me from our daughter. It's user friendly, and includes a lot of extras.

Amazon fire stick did not honor My Xfinity subscription so I had Know TV guide, Locked me out of Fox morning live news, and CNN morning news too...Roku allowed Xfinity stations fox news and CNN. Called Amazon fire stick people. They were very nice and helpful but could not resolve my problems and didn't seem as knowledgeable as Roku representatives. were.

I wanted to get a Roku for 4K/HDR streaming. Picked the wrong one at first and returned it. This one works very well with my system. Didn't really use the remote, since we have a Harmony universal remote that we programmed. It connects to my wi/fi without issue, and has plenty of choices to stream so we don't miss cable at all. We also subscribe to Sling, which this pulls in without issue.

I have two of these attached to older TVs (Vizio and HP) to use with the Spectrum app. The Roku was able to detect the TV type and set the remote to be able to turn the TV on/off and adjust the volume for both TVs. The Spectrum streaming app works well. The only complaint is that the channel selection is cumbersome and setting favorite channels is not clear.

I have to pair the "enhanced remote" at least twice a day, which requires power cycling the roku, which needless to say is a PIA.  Roku is sending a replacement and I will update the review if that solves the problem.UPDATE: Didn't solve the problem, still un-pairs, same with the app on my phone so I know it's the actual device.  Since it's an issue that happens intermittently Roku isn't being very helpful.  I would buy an Amazon Fire instead.

Purchased this as a family gift for Christmas. We were going to buy a new TV; Now we don't have to!! This works great and was super easy to set up. Ever the picture on the TV seems clearer and brighter than it had been before. So far, love this little thing.

After having gone through multiple fire sticks. I switched to roku and am glad I had. The menus are so much sleeker and simplistic. I hated how much the firesticks are all advertisements. Plus our roku’s are lasting now months without issues. I had nothing but problems with the Amazon sticks.

Maybe I got a bad one, but it randomly exits channels and I keep getting a warning that it is overheating.  When I checked the stick, it was very hot!  I would not trust leaving it plugged in when I'm not around for fear it could cause a fire.  I'm returning it.

Although it does pretty much as advertised and is tons faster than our old Roku device, there have been a few minor issues that have led to restarting the device one or more times a week. These seem to be variations on a theme: Maintaining good Wi-Fi communication. Usually that is fine, but sometimes sound noticeably lags picture. On occasion a channel cannot be reached or we are told we do not have a subscription to it. Again restart fixes. So, though a big oimprovement over earlier, we do have inconveniences, some likely peculiar to our specific environment.

This is plugged into our receiver and it has performed very well. This is placed too far to use 5.0 signal, but the 2.4 provides 20+ Mbps on our wireless WiFi. using 2.4 channels with no buffering or pauses. Voice is good but not as robust as Comcast's version. Highly recommended.

I'm very biased about this.  The video quality is very very good but the interface sucks.  Roku really needs to redesign it's software interface.  Also, I use a HDHomeRun Over the Air TV tuner and it is not natively compatible with Roku.  I have to use software such as Plex to transcode the signal for the Roku wich degrades the picture quality. I also have an AppleTV and I find the experience with it to be much better.  The Roku is used in a room that doesn't get much use and it was a far cheaper alternative to the AppleTV.

Using the USB power in the rear of the TV seemed like such a great idea as I would have one less wire that I needed to hide.  But I noticed that I was having issues with the remote and it pairing with the device and/or working at all or lagging a lot.  After unplugging a few times I got the Low Power screen that lead me to try the old fashion plug.  Once I changed to the power source everything worked great.  I suggest that if you have a TV that is more than a few years old don’t bother with the USB power source.
Bought to replace older model and it worked where the old One was getting slow. Not sure if it will eventually get slow also or not.

Very satisfied! I love the convenience of all the apps on one. So many free preloaded apps with free movies , music and news. I do enjoy the the speak button for searching.One downside, I would like to see more hot buttons for our favorite apps on the bottom of remote .
I have a fire stick on two of my televisions. The Alexa integration with my Wyze Cams was the reason for adding a second Fire Stick.
Arrived right on time. It was a 15 minute setup and now my not smart TV can get all of the apps: Netflix, Amazon prime, HBOMax, etc.
Item as described, best cable cutter out there for the price. Love the quality of streaming, voice recognition and alexa integration
The remote is extremely easy to use and understand. Play with it a little and you'll find out the various things you can do with it.
This works so much quicker than our last fire stick, it is also nice to be able to click a button and it change  the tv tin mto the right setting
Thought I was going to miss the TV controls but have it in my Receiver with my Projector so I don't matter that I can't control the tv with it

I have had a lot of issues with it losing WIFI connection and having to unplug and plug it back in in order to get sound.  I previously had a Roku and did not have these issues.  I got a Firestick so I could use it with the DVR system but have not been impressed.  I had to send one back because it didn’t work.

I quit cable, was too expensive, and I Don't miss cable. I really feel the Fire TV stick is all I need. And great for the price. A one time reasonable purchase. I also bought an antenna. I am set. No more monthly bill for watching TV, movies, youtube.

The home page looks different from my other fire stick. Whereas Home Apps Setting are all across the top of the screen, on this one it’s in the middle of the screen and my downloaded apps are down below several other apps that are pushed by Amazon. I hate it!!!  No help from support.

My Roku Streaming Stick has a problem. Most of the time when commanded to move left/right or up/down nothing happens for 20 to 30 seconds, also there is a message that appears in the upper right corner of the TV screen "Remote Control".  I have  made many attempts to talk to Roku Support about the problem. The best they have to offer is extreamly long hold times or a connection to a person barely able to speak English and only able to provide the basic setup procedure. I have four Roku's and if it was not for this problem I would have never known how difficult it is to get help from Roku product support.

Came late( it got lost ) but Amazon shipped out a new one and it works great so far. Decided to get this one since my TV is wall mounted and my other Roku required a shelf. I like that this one comes with a remote that allows you to turn up and down the volume, unlike my other Roku .

Works great! I typically use an app for Xfinity, Netflix and Amazon Prime. I've had issues before with other similar products as the wifi is not great in the room, this has not been an issue. I'm very pleased with the product and highly recommend.

Like many others have said before. Roku has an unresolved issue of the batteries being drained by the remote control.  Needed to change batteries after 1 week and contact support.  They’re advised only to use the wall outlet and not the usb option and to contact them again if it continues to happen

It’s so easy to use! My blue ray player recently started acting up, and my friends recommended this. I tried the Amazon fire stick first bc it was cheap, but wasn’t a fan bc it wasn’t super user friendly. This has an awesome interface, and very simple to set up all my streaming services. Wish I got it sooner!

I HAD a fire tv, YouTube tvBut I love my Roku plus. Roku just works.I have 6 Roku devises around the house, even oldone I had to replace for an update.I have Google fiber and a YouTube tv account but fire tv does not have the app for YouTube tv.YouTube tv controller:  is junk. it stoped so much I sent it back for a new one but it freezes the same way. And the remote is the most horable, biggest pain, just worst remote I have used.

Roku devices are great alternatives to expensive satellite or cable packages.  The stick is a nice clutter-free option.  I had 2 older sticks (3500 & 3600 that were getting very slow.  I bought 2 of the Stick+ to replace them.  Just read the clear directions, and installation/setup is very easy and mostly automated.  This remote also controls TV power and volume, which is very convenient.  I'm very pleased with Roku hardware and software.

Ordered a ROKU+ about 6 months ago, worked fine for about 4 months when it began to require constant resetting to keep it operating. According to ROKU, it was a defective unit, and of course, out of warranty. Ordered a replacement, and right out of the box, the remote was defective, having some buttons that were totally non-functional and others that required a lot of pressure to operate. So, I wound up with one ROKU+ that had a defective streaming stick, and another that had a defective remote. I took the remote from the first unit and paired it to the second stick - everything now works like it should have in the first place! So, major problems in 2 out of 2 units! All I can say is, buyer beware! Bad QC? Made in China? How about all of the above?

This devise has enabled me to view streaming programs on television that I didn't have access to before, as well as some excellent movies.  A friend helped me install it, and it's been smooth going ever since.  I now have excellent increased viewing capabilities.

When I cut the cord to spectrum cable,I didn't know if I was going to be sorry I did it.  However I was greatly surprised, As I get more and beter quality of shows to watch.  Mustly free, except for one and that one only cost me $4.99 a month. I did not sign up with hulu or netflix because I have so much from roko that I don't need them.  And every so often Roko will send me an email letting me know of new shows are added.

This was obviously a used and returned item. The shipping packaging was fine, but the item’s packaging was damaged. The box and the interior packaging was ripped and damaged. The plastic that gets peaked off and wraps the Roku had been peeled off and then reattached.

The only issue with this was powering it. The USB on the TV did not provide enough power to consistently power the stick. I had to use the included adaptor and USB extension cord. Easy setup, one remote use (used to have two, one for the BluRay player and one for the TV). Happy with this and will not be going back to connecting through the BluRay player.

I got this for my daughter room TV.Easy to set up and get it working.  Only thing once connected to the TV and turned on it distorted the colors on the TV. Can't get it to correct the balance of colors on the her Sony TV. Don't know what to do. If anyone can send me some kind of information as to how to correct this, I would appreciated it.

Very nice quality streaming devices I have owned all Roku Streaming Sticks and this is far the best one with voice control and 4k UHD HDR picture quality.  Don't buy refurbished unless it's directly from Amazon all other vendors buy at your own risk. Amazon certified refurbished are awesome and you can save up to $20 cash.

I have 2 of these and prefer them over the Fire stick. Although the fire stick can be bought for less money, I still like the Roku better. I have 2 Fire sticks and 2 Roku's. Fire sticks are on TV's in spare bedrooms for when company comes by. These go on special around the holidays and can be bought a little less than normal price if you're patient.

I'm a ROKU fan because of ease in setup and access to all streaming services including Amazon Prime, Apple, Netflix, CBS all access, CW, and many more. The stick even works with my computer as long as there is an extra HDMI port on the monitor.

I already have 2 ROKU Ultra's for our home tv's. Preferred the Ultra for home use so I can connect hardwired to my ethernet wall outlets. Needed the smaller stick for vehicle use in our RV & Minivan and did not need hardwired capability. Works just like our home unit with much smaller form factor. Black Friday sale made the purchase even better.

Purchased to upgrade an aging Vizio 55” tv that couldn’t be upgraded. It took 10 minutes to set up and made the TV instantly better. Most of the add-ons are wack, but Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, and Disney+ work great. Also, pro tip, do yourself a favor and look up hidden apps for Roku

Has changed my TV watching.  So many streaming options, even local channels and very easy to use and setup. My only complaint is backlighting on the remote would be nice.  If not for the data cap on my internet provider, I would have cut the cord due to this device.

I had the Fire Stick Lite up and running in minutes. Good inexpensive version if you do not need tv on/off and volume controls. Great start stick for anyone wanted to try it. I mainly use it for Sling and works fine.
Not a bad device. There are just not as many options in the lite version as in the standard version and they’re not as unlock able.
Nothing I dislike so far! It's easy! faster! so I am impressed by it! would buy again! It's even better having Alexa built into it!
This was the downgraded version of the 1st Firestick I bought that stopped working.This one has stopped working.  Very frustrating
Stream quality is excellent.  So much to watch with prime I doubt that I will ever get Netflix or one of those.  Worth every penny!

Works perfect, I cut the cable and I have a firestick to watch pretty much what I want, with in reason,. The is the firestick light, every works just like the firestick is supposed, it doesn’t control the tv and that’s fine for me.

My first fire TV. I bought six TV top box for my family to watch News channels. So regret it. Fire TV totally changes my mind. I thought small can not be fast enough to watch youtube or event play games. I pretty much can install every app that I need with a fire tv stick After a whole week. I would buy more if I did not buy those tv boxes.
I love my Amazon fire stick and all my echoes this is my second fire stick I use it for when I go camping or when I'm in a motel for work
I love my new firestick! It makes streaming easy and best of all I can bring it with me on work trips to stream my favorite shows!
I have to manually disconnect and reconnect my tv EVERY TIME I want to watch it otherwise I get a bouncing NO SIGNAL box on my tv.

I bought this basic unit to allow my older Samsung TV (2016) to be able to watch my YouTube TV subscription. My old fire stick didn’t have (and can’t be loaded) YouTube tv on it. It was Cheaper than replacing my TV. I wish now that I had bought the next step up with the volume control on the remote so didn’t have to use multiple remotes..
I like that fact that I am able to keep my old model flat screen tv and set it up to watch my favorite movies, sports channels, news, music, etc.
I always love Amazon Firesticks. I have several in my home and these two were for my Nanny. They are easy to set up and work great!
This thing takes forever to load each individual app, doesn't work half the time, and is way more frustrating than our Chromecast.

Roku is better.  This seems to go to sleep and I keep having to unplug it to reset it because it won't wake up.  When I reset it, many times the sound doesn't work so I have to reset it a couple more times.  Tried it out for a couple weeks.  Decided to return it.  I'm often never happy with Amazon made products.  Go with the Roku.

the only difference with the lite version is the ability to control your tv with the same firestick remote - for me it wasn't a big deal and the chance to save some money ! otherwise it works like the fire stick you know and love!
We have a Roku TV, but prefer some of the Amazon TV viewing options.  This Firestick lets us have the best of both  viewing services.  It does take a long time to load the APP onto the TV.
This was easy to install and works great. I don’t know how to control the tv volume/power with the remote, other than that, I’m satisfied with this purchase.
The remote is not the easiest to use, but the Fire TV stick does work well and was relatively easy to set up.  I would buy again.

We have an older smart TV (2014) that doesn’t allow us to download certain streaming apps such as Disney plus. The fire stick is the perfect device to resolve this issue. It’s small so it can be easily hidden behind the tv which is mounted on the wall. The voice recognition works great. I definitely recommend purchasing.
Great little gizmo to bring my older television up to date with. Have not had any issues and has worked flawlessly. Easy install.

I have 2 fire sticks, this and one with power/volume control. I like the other one better, but this was a good deal and is in a home gym, so not too big of a deal to be missing those controls. For a TV you use daily, get the one with power / volume
I was advised to buy & install the Fire Stick in order to watch new streaming platform on my older TV. It's magic! So easy and works like a charm!
It’s like night and day to a gen 1 fire stick. It is fast like it’s supposed to be and does not bog down and die like the gen 1. one piece of advice, get one.
This is a great, inexpensive way to make your dumb TV smart. Reserve some time because it takes time to program, but works great!

When I saw no TV controls, I assumed that meant for cable. It literally means no TV control, including volume. Our old fire stick stopped working after a year so I bought this to replace it. Now we have 2 remotes because this one doesn't have volume control.
Its kind of touchy at times, and I need help getting it going again.  My fault, I'm sure, because I'm not technicallyinclined.
Great price but you still have to log in to each app with passwords,etc.About a 1/2 hr to get it up and running with all uprades
Same fire stick.. minus the other remote.. great price and new menu for home screen on these.. work great as usual.. great price

The voice remote really adds to the view experience...it really saves a lot of time locating things to watch.  It does the searching for you without have to excruciatingly type out what you want to watch with the remote.

Very user friendly.  I really like the ease of use with Roku.  I have the streaming stick for an older TV, but have the Roku smart TV's for other parts of the house.  I'm sold on Roku.  It's made life so much easier for even my older mother.  With less button to have to pick from, the quick Netflix direct button, very self explanatory home button and channel options, she is all set and loves it, also.

I installed and went through all of the connections. I entered password from router and received a green check for wireless connection. When it tried to cycle to  local network  and never got to internet connection I was given a message to add a Mac address provided by ROKU. I contacted my internet service provider multiple times and they kept telling me to contact ROKU. I did both multiple times. I did everything asked to no avail. MAC address was never added as I was unable to do it and could not get help from anyone.  This was a big wasted purchase!!!

This stick hates us. We bought it so we could access our Disney Plus account but the stick and remote stop working almost every day. They freeze up and won’t respond. Even after following the reset procedure (sometime 4 times in one day) we give up and go back to our old remote.... which won’t allow us to watch half of our channels. We can only access Netflix and Amazon because there are direct access buttons are on our old remote. Complete frustration. To the point of cursing.

Purchased to install on my late model LG tv. Easy to install and setup was as simple as can be. My main reason for purchasing was to use the Spectrum app to view Spectrum channels. Using the Roku stick you don’t need to rent a box from Spectrum. It’s definitely a money saver. And, I was able to log into my Amazon Prime account to view other movies and shows. The Roku stick is a great investment. The voice remote feature is great but You will need to spend a little time learning how to access various features with the remote, i.e full guide, previous channel, watch list, etc. overall I highly recommend this product.
Easy to setup and use. I previously owned a Roku Media Player but this stick is much better in many ways.I am happy with this product.

Used these to replace dish network in favor of youtubetv.  Love it!  Saved me $60 a month.  Streams great!  I don’t use voice recognition stuff because I am too old for that now!  Product works great as long as you have decent internet or internet reception.User interface is simple and straight forward, no issues there.

Bought specifically to use with Spectrum as I do with older models.  Turns out shortly after my purchase Roku and Spectrum agreed to disagree.  No new Roku's get Spectrum.  The rest of the features are excellent.  Much faster than older models.

This product streams DirecTV now or any other live TV streaming service beautifully that's why I bought it everything about the layout and the processor speed is not laggy whatsoever I highly recommend this product when using the voice recognition button and you're asking to watch a movie or an episode of something it doesn't exactly send you to where you thought it would so I don't use it it's pretty much pointless everything else is great

Love this! I chose to ditch the dish for the Roku stick and am glad I did. I’m saving a lot more money (paying about $50/month vs $200). If you’re used to cable, dish, etc is harder to just scan and find something to put the tv on because searching is done differently. But there are more shows/movies to choose from so it’s really a lot better!

The remote stopped working in less than 3 months.When the app goes to sleep and you try to wake it up, it automatically starts loading a new app or channel randomly. It seems like it could be a lot easier to work this thing without it forcing other channels on me. And within 90 days, it just stops working.

Didn't 't try voice recognition or Alexa integration.  A bit confusing when installing with a brand new HD TV, but the "on-line" directions (displayed on TV screen) helped a lot.  We now have access to more tv channels than we're ever going to use as well as streaming a couple of premium channels.  Great picture and sound.  Worth the money.

I love the Firestick. My dad got it years ago when I was in high school and now I have one for my home. My hubby and I (and the dog) love laying in bed watching movies and shows. Ive never been a big tv watcher but this is really something else for me. So convenient after a long day of work.

I bought this for adding an ATT TV app to my television. I will buy two more for my other sets.  Strong connection, easy setup, typical ROKU functionality with TV on/off  and volume controls built in. I have not tried the voice control yet.

HD/4K/HDR streaming/Long-range Wireless/Voice Remote with Voice Remote with TV Power and Volume.  Also, purchased Power Cable for Roku Streaming Stick. Roku Cable Designed to Power Your Roku Streaming Stick from Your TV USB Port, instead of plugging in power outlet, this setup means the Streaming Stick is only on when the TV is turned on. Great combination.

Roku can be controlled with or without smartphone access, and it provides access to very many popular streaming services. it is easy to use. Just plug it into an HDMI port on a video monitor/TV and operate with the included remote control.

What I didn't know was you have to have internet to use so I am stuck with this purchase.i needed one with out internet service.so that's the reason .a d the ad did not say you need internet when I purchase the item.ive seen others that you don't have to have internet.

Roku works excellent the voice recognition goes exactly where I tell it to I push the button and say YouTube and YouTube pops up it also has good range for Wi-Fi my Wi-Fi is in three bedrooms away with the door shut and it picks up perfect reception

Great Roku! This is my second device for the house. Absolutely love it! Great streaming quality and amazing 4K HDR! Love it! Makes Netflix streaming a bit better in my opinion. I have had several Fire Tv Sticks but this lasts longer. My other two Fire Sticks died within a year and I’ve had my roku for awhile and no issues.

Our Roku worked just fine for two months. We even liked it but now it locks up. Roku only warranties it for 30 days. Of course, Amazon can't do more than that. We're out $50. Shoulda bought the Protection Plan. Next time I'll know better.Be careful with calling Customer Support. There's some kind of a hack in their system and we talked to someone who wanted to charge $45 annual service. At least the Roku website says there's no charge for service. Not that anyone was available to talk us through whatever the heck the problems is.

BUT, it has had some trouble overheating. I've ordered the HDMI extender adaptor (free of charge) from Roku's site. That should do the trick. I still highly recommend this product. It is super compatible with all the services including HBO Max, Apple TV, etc.

I have had a ROKU TV for quite awhile and am very pleased with it.  I got a regular tv from my daughter and this ROKU+ stick was on sale so I got it.  Very quick and easy install, took about 30 minutes to download all the programs I had in my main tv, after that, it has worked perfectly.  Like I said, quick, easy, and very happy with this.
Super easy and intuitive. I do wish the home screen was a little more simplified, specifically curated to what I watch or have subscriptions to. But over all we love. Second one we’ve bought.
Enables me to access HBO Max via Amazon FireStick when I am unable to do so directly from my Roku TV.  Does the job I wanted at a reasonable price.
This fire stick has all the  abilities to do what older fire sticks do, but is faster.I love it , it’s a fantastic item for a fantastic price
I already had one fire stick and I got another one for the tv in my bedroom.  It was easy to install and is working very well.
This is my third one and they work well for me. One thing I like is that I can view all my photos stored on Amazon via the TV.
Streaming purposes, it works like the regular firestick just a different layout, but the remote don't have the volume control.
Still a pain to switch Bluetooth speakers .  13 clicks .` Recent list gets holes in it and doesn't update automatically .
We are really enjoying our TV Fire stick w/Alexa Voice Remote.  The voice remote is awesome!  No more typing everything in is wonderful.  So far so good, I'm still learning about the Tv fire stick
This thing is a piece of s****. It never works. My iPad connects just fine to whatever streaming service I want but this thing never does. F*** this piece of garbage.

Since the stick is 3 3/4" long and is intended to be portable I was surprised to find that an HDMI extender isn't included in the box. The extender is free but you have order it online then wait to get it by snail mail. Seems a little cheap to me.

Roku is always awesome and this version is ever better. Replaced my 4k Apple TV.I just did not like having to look at the Apple TV black box. This Roku stick is nicely tucked away, and operates my TV and volume. Works great for my entire family.

The Roku user interface is great but unfortunately the streaming stick does not always work. It frequently cuts out in the middle of streaming and goes back to the loading page for several minutes. I have been emailing with Roku customer service for months and none of their troubleshooting directions have worked so I have to assume something is wrong with the hardware itself.

Works great, we now have 2. No cable bill, just Prime & have used Netflix, but now have Sling. U cant beat this, all u need is internet & u get plenty of channels. People on foodstamps can get discounted Prime $5.99 & internet $9.99 (or low income as well) so works great for low bills.

I was already looking to purchase a new larger TV for a bunch more $$$.  Then I decided to try the Roku.  My only problem was deciding on which of the 30 or so models.  I decided to go with this -$70 model and couldn't be happier.  It has saved me close to $700 since I was only going to purchase the new TV to gain some of the new features that my eight year old one doesn't have.  For over a $600 price difference, I think I can live with what I have for a few more years!

This thing is worth every penny. I have a Roku Smart TV and Apple TV. I love them both but I needed something else for a tv that didn’t have anything. This really has it all. If your looking for a cheaper alternative for smart tv or Apple TV this is what you want. It’s fast, it has all the apps you need. And what’s most important to me, I can mirror my phone to the tv. Pictures, videos, movies.Plug it in. Set up. Log in and your set!

I bought this Roku then my husband became ill and I never got to properly install it. It is 9 months later and today I I spent hours trying to get it to recognize my Wifi. I  called Roku and the contract people they hired to troubleshoot it, asked for $69.99 to help me! Outrageous!! I called my cable provider who talked me through lots of tries and ended with a factory reset. All was to no avail. I cannot connect to the internet. What am I to do with this? I think it's awful that the best Roku can do is send you to a number that wants 70$ to talk about your problem.

The remote stopped working after 3 weeks.  Amazon kindly credited me the amount for a new remote and I ordered it.  The new remote will not pair (light should flash but it doesn't) and roku has been searching for the remote for over 30 minutes now.  I only gave 2 start since I can use my tablet to control the screen but that is not convenient.

We purchased 4 of these to take the place of using cable.  They work great and SO MUCH to watch/to choose from!  We should have done this a long time ago.  We can watch all of the channels/shows/series that we like.  Good price and worth the money!  We will be saving about $180/month!

Worked great for about 6 months. Then simply stopped working. Went through all the troubleshooting to reset the remote no good. Add new batteries no change went through all the routine again no change apparently this is only good for 6 months
I found installing was very easy.  Works great on my tv.  It is being used on a guest bedroom tv. So it is not used regularly.  Great item tho.
Comes with only a 90-day limited warranty. Item stopped delivering audio without constant restarts. My fault for not seeing that. POOR customer service on this one as well.

I can not get it to work with my Hisense TV which I bought it for.  All it does is flicker or show no signal at all.  I tried some of the troubleshooting tips I found online and they didn't help.  It did work fine on one of my smaller, different brand TV's.

I bought this to use with my projector because I only had one Fire Stick that I switched from room to room, which was quite the hassle considering how my TV is placed. So far I've had no issues and it works just as great as the regular Fire Stick. I highly recommend this product.
It sucks Bought this and had it exchanged for another that doesn't work either & Amazon refuses to contact me back. Redic!
Worked great for first 5 days then started freezing and no matter which app or change of hdmi even tech could not navigate  it online
The device loses its sound output. I have to reset its power or unplug it to get sound back. Does this at least 50% of the time.
I haven't tried the voice recognition but sure do enjoy having the firestick to make netflix and amazon prime available on my "not so smart" TV.
Perfect fire tv! Extremely high quality and is great for the price. If you want the great features of a tv stick for streaming, get the fire tv stick lite.
Works great, easy to hook up and if you want THE HOOK UP 😉 email me at blakelyl83@gmail.com I take cash app & Zelle enjoy unlimited features..
This is my 2nd Roku streaming stick purchase.  I’m very pleased with the ease of set-up, use & performance of this device.
I like that the remote is much easier to use than the first fire stick. I mean it's more sturdy easier to grip and hold on to.

I let the roku pair to my TV and my volume on my TV dropped to the point where I had to turn the volume up 5x normal to hear my network channels.  The roku channels were then way too loud.  Apparently this is a common complaint about this roku device.  I sent it back and got another fire stick.  That didn't mess with the volume when I hooked up my old one.

How on earth did I watch tv without this?  Super easy, you plug it in and follow the prompts.  I love it.  My sons and I still are finding new shows to watch.  It is a great device and we have not had any problems with it.  I was scared when I read some reviews, but it works great.

The way the four HDMI ports are oriented and recessed into the back of my Samsung TV the stick is about a half inch too long to insert into the HDMI port. So I am using an Amazon Firestick adapter to make it work. Roku should include one in the box for the stick version. I found that I can go to the Roku website and place an order for a free adapter. Roku should have included one in the box.

I've had this Roku stick for almost a year, and am still pleased with it.  Easy to install, just plug it into the tv's port.  The remote is simple to use (I like the quick-access buttons for Disney Plus and Netflix).  I really like that I can remove it from my regular tv and use it in a different tv/location.

We already have one roku and when I saw a good deal on these, I decided to get a second. We are part of the cord cutting generation and use roku for virtually everything we watch on tv, with the exception of dvds. The user interface is awesome and we never had an issue with Wi-Fi connection signal.

I would give a better rating but the remote dies so damn fast!!!!! In one month I've had to replace the batteries 4 times!!! Such a waste and such a disappointment. It's a big inconvenience having to constantly replace the batteries and now it's to the point of hardly using the damn thing.

I loved the Roku streaming stick+ because of the 4K HDR capabilities, its very compact, and I dont need internet or wifi to stream anything from my phone, so I can download all the content I need on my phone and stream it on the Roku when on holiday, the only bad part is,  I am from Mexico and Roku Mexico has very limited access to some channels, I have Amazon prime here but Roku does not support Amazon in Mexico, or Fox etc, The two things that it does supports is Netflix and Youtube in 4k and HDR an with that I am happy.

Although the hardware were good the software seemed to have some glitches. Roku stick kept freezing and acting up. Had to return it. Thanks for Amazing customer service who took care of the issue and stand behind their customer!

Soy de Perú. El producto llego bien embalado, en excelente estado. Fue una grata sorpresa que viniera con baterias incluidas.Fácil de usar e instalar. Muy portátil para llevar conmigo a otros televisores e incluso a otras casas.Recomiendo tener al menos dos servicios de streaming contratados, para darle un uso provechoso, aunque no es tan importante al tener la opción de transmitir desde el teléfono celular, haciendo que puedas ver en tv todo tipo de contenido.
We have returned all boxes to Brighthouse, Spectrum and are streaming thru youtubeTV.  Wish we had done this a long time ago.
Great product. My smart TV is an older model and can't get Disney+. This was a great low price solution. Perfectly satisfied.

I was skeptical because there were no on/off tv controls in this version.  I put it on a tv that I was close enough to not need it and I have no issues with it.  Just as good as the regular firestick!!!  If you could wait I would but it when they have their special sales because right after I paid $29.99 it was on for Amazon Birthday sale for $17.99.  Other than that I love it!!!
Another great amazin device that added more life and value to my unimpressive TV. Smooth interface, fast processor, and great added to controls is awesome.
We have owned a Firestick for several years but bought this one for our winter home in AZ. Easy to install and use.....and great price.

Roku user since 2010.  Been using Fire Stick Lite since release.  Fire Stick remote is alot more responsive and you don't have to point it directly at the dongle.  The only thing I don't like is the small amount of memory and the amount of preloaded Amazon apps installed that can't be removed which takes away memory and takes up some cache.  Otherwise love both of my Fire Sticks.

When it works, it's great.  But you never know when you turn on the tv if there will be sound.  Have to unplug the fire stick from the tv and the connection.  Wait.  Then connect it all, turn on the tv and usually sound is back.  Had it for a month and have had to do this 3 times.  Read how other people have this problem.  Had my original fire stick for many years.  Never had this problem with it.
I love how we're Alexa understands what you say even with children who have a little speech impediment it's cute. A lot of Technology and Care went into this product. Thank you Amazon
