I go this so I could use my apps on my older TV. I do not have Alexa so not able to answer anything about it. It does control my TV volume without 'marrying' the device to the TV. It is easy to set up and use. I have 4 of these. One I lost the control so it's not in use until it is found.
Would be nice if they had more apps for the fire stick. Can't access VUDU or Peacock, forced to download 3rd party apps that suck.
I use it for Prime Video, Netflix, and TVision from TMobile. It has youtube and other apps on there I don't care much about.

We found it difficult to set up.  It did not have the channels we were hoping for, without having to subscribe & pay a fee.  Would not recommend for Seniors, unless you have tech grandkids who could help you.
It's easy to use and let's you install the apps you need, my TV is a smart TV but doesn't let me install new apps so I had to buy this and it's the best thing I've bought this year haha
I could have gotten the 3rd gen cheaper then what I paid for this one if I would've waited until after Amazon prime day.
Got it on a black friday sale. Just took a while to write a review. It does everything it says it does. If you don't have amazon prime you are missing out. Excellent quality product.
Every so often there is no volume. We have to unplug and wait to restart.  Other than that it does what it's supposed to do.
Easy to set up and is a good value.Lot's to watch.Only thing it is hard to add channels or it might just be me.I recommend.
Kept telling me no internet connection or slow connection .Loaded with ADS kept disconnecting piece of junk I threw  it away
The Fire Stick is a great way to make your TV smarter for little money. Easy install. Works well with Alexa. A good deal all around

This is simply not a good product. The remotes are incredibly spotty and the sound has gone out on the Roku we purchased. After seeing the reviews indicating that buying a third roku requires activating a premium account no thank you. We tried the amazon stick but the streaming quality was not as good. Struggling to find a good streaming option.

I love it, it is easy to use and very fast, it works great on any tv (even when it is a ghost brand TV, it works well). If you have a recognized brand it will allow you to control the volume with the remote control of Roku, but well the tv remote control has to be used for the volume.

I bought this a couple months ago so now it's outside when I can return. I didn't hook it up until the start of the COVID-19 quarantine and was excited to have something I could use during that time. Unfortunately, the second time I used it, the remote wouldn't sync and I had to do a series of steps I looked up online involving taking out a battery and pushing three buttons at once, etc.  It's ridiculous. I've had to do that every time I've used it since. Needless to say, it's not what I had in mind for convenience and I'm never really sure if it's going to work at all the next time I want to use it. Unhappy is putting it mildly.

This is our third Roku device and I had no problem activating it. We had a Roku 2 in 2011, and an upgraded Roku 2 in 2015. The streaming stick works so much faster than our previous Roku at a fraction of the price! So happy we upgraded.

I bought this ROKU because I had to stream to an additional TV in my house. It is great. Much faster to rewind or fast forward with this than with the original Roku. I am very satisfied. I do not use the voice commend at all. I do not like it and it does not understand me. Recommended.

So easy to set up. Makes any cheap smart TV work great especially if you're just using the Internet rather than cable. Only downfall are all the commercials with Roku, Usually every 15 minutes. If you don't want commercials don't get Roku

This was a replacement for my old Roku streaming stick that began to have glitches. I like that it also controls the TV without needing a separate controller. I haven't used voice recognition.  The only down fall is they removed the Amazon Prime button and added ESPN (hence the 4 star rating). I'm not happy about that change. I usually only watch Netflix and Amazon and I want my Amazon button back. Otherwise works as intended.

Roku is great but you must activate it on your computer Do Not use the tech support number I did on a second one I needed I was directed to someone in a scam I was stupid enough to pay $89 for hook up On realizing I cancelled my debit card and now my bank is working on it it comes up to pay in a paypal account  Check this out on a google search it will come up wish I had done that first I love roku but they should put a warning on the package

As a Roku fan, it pains me to say this. The device I received is garbage. I couldn't get past the system update portion (third step after language selection and wifi connection) without the device freezing up. The issues weren't always the same, but they always prevented me from getting to the next step of activation. Sometime factory resets were necessary. I have 5 other Roku's and they've been great. I don't think I'll ever buy a stick one again after this. Roku is just so easy, I really hope their quality isn't slipping.

Product was great at first I had no issues with it still have no issues with the actual stick but the remote nowdrains brand new batteries in one day. Every single day if I leave the batteries in it I have to put a new set in. contacting the manufacturer but I find it ridiculous that I have to pay for shipping for a device I have not had a very long. Too late to return it of course.
Limitations may be due to the age of my television set but overall I am very pleased with the results and have achieved the desired outcome.

I’m enjoying the fire stick lite.  I love that I have turned a perfectly good tv into a smart tv without spending several hundred dollars.  The lite does not control the tv volume.  It really doesn’t bother me that I need 2 remotes.
Even though we do not use this on our main set it was easy to set up and use on the tv in our guest room. Provides excellent selection of channels and programming.
Great product. Bought this to go with our projector. Made it easier for outside set up. And with amazon setup, a total breeze to use.
I don't use the voice control. I find the Fire Stick works well and like theNew presentation. It's a lot more responsive than any of my other Fire Sticks I presently own.
I liked that it was easy to install as I am no tech genius.  The directions to connect were very clear and easy to follow.It made my not so smart TV into a Smart TV.
Easy to setup with Amazon account, good video quality, apps can be added as needed but some programs need subscription fees
I only have 4 stars because I thought the remote came with a volume control.  It’s a pain to have 2 remotes. Other than that... I LOVE  my Fire Stick!
Been usinf firesticks since gen 1 and they all are great. This new upgrade is the best value to performance streaming stick i have ever used and it has continuous support unlike those android boxes.
Works great. I needed a new one to replace my last one. I enjoy the layout of Amazon Fire stick over the roku I had. The fire stick is much more user friendly.

We bought this as the wifi reception in the basement is poor and roku markets this device as having 4X better range than its original roku.  We noticed no difference with this device.  It is also no better than our Amazon fire stick.

Kept having problems with CBS All Access not working properly with the Fire stick. Installed this and immediately had CBS picture quality much better than before. Love the Roku channel free movies and TV shows. Extremely easy to install and set up.

Rather than buy a new smart television - I chose Roku as the better choice amongst other streaming services. It's great and meets all my viewing entertainment needs - news, sports, movies, educational and more. Install was very easy "plug and play". Just connect to my WiFi. Easy.

I'm impressed!  Simple to install and use,  It opens an untold number of TV accesses.  I used this unit to "Cut the Cord" with expensive DirecTV and subscribed to one of the internet streaming channels at about 1/3 the cost.  The only issue would be if you have old copper phone lines causing a limit on bandwidth to less than 6 mbps.

I love these! They're so easy to install and use. I've bought 4 (1 I sent back but it wasn't the device, one TV just wasn't capable of working with the streaming service). These are wonderful and I love that the remote is the only remote you need to work your TV and your Roku device so I don't have to have a million remotes laying around. I highly recommend these if you're looking at going to streaming for your TV watching needs.

Great user experience with the Roku stick. Simple home screen layout that isn't ruined by ads. Apps are easy to find, add, launch, and use.It would be really nice if you could install a few of the more tech-savvy apps like Firefox and Kodi (the Fire and Shield allow this). Also, the sticks do not include a headphone jack on the remote, unlike the Roku boxes. You can use Roku's phone app to do "Private Listening" and plug headphones into your phone to hear the Roku's output, but obviously then you need a phone handy whenever you're watching.
These are SIX star now that they support Apple AirPlay!I own two of these now.
The Roku streaming sticks have a big problem with overheating and can be dangerous as they get so hot.  Look online and you will see a ton of complaints about it.

We liked the roku stick while it worked. In less than a month of use, the stick stopped working. The stick would be plugged in with the power indicator light on, but no signal to the tv. We spent hours talking to tech support, unplugging, resetting, trying different TVs etc. but ultimately couldn't find a resolution. Since we were still under warranty, we sent the stick back and are waiting for our replacement to arrive. Unfortunately, we had to pay for shipping the stick back (which cost close to $10 plus the inconvenience).  It's really poor customer service that we have to foot the shipping bill for their defective product. Would not recommend.

We had the rocku 3 and ordered this one to replace it. I love the compactness of this roku stick as well as the picture quality. Delivery was fast. We ordered a second one for our bed room. We also love the fact that the roku remote automatically sets its self to control our tv functions too. It’s wonderful to be able to turn our tv on and off, control the volume and the roku with one sleek remote. Our older one never did that. We highly recommend for picture quality and convenience.

Loving the new Roku streaming stick. Have tried the voice rec and it seems to work well. There are pluses and minuses to storing the user id and pass on the device. I can take it with me and don't have to re-enter all of that but initial setup is a pain!

Nice upgrade from my old Roku. The remote is superior with the voice control, quick access app buttons and mute button. I also really like that it turns my tv on and off so I don’t need the other remote now! It’s also one less box on the tv stand.

I just received this but have not used it since it is a Christmas gift for my husband. I am disappointed because I thought that the Roku I ordered had a place on the remote to attach a headphone so as not to disturb someone who was not watching the tv - however there is nothing on the remote that would do this. I am trying to decide what to do.

Upfront these are great. You get easy access to the streaming apps you like in HD quality.Unfortunately these sticks don't last very long and they lose the ability to connect to the internet. I've had two of these die within a year and half.

I have 2 older roku boxes that I've had for years that have been ok. Also have every fire tv device there is. This stick is one of my favorite devices though. It works great and the picture quality is amazing. I love that I can power it with the usb port on the tv so I don't have any cords hanging. I'd like to get another one!
Don't appreciate Roku pushing their politics and dropping all FOX media from their lineup.What my family watches should be our choice, not the choice of Roku political commissars.

When my family went streaming and updated to Hulu Live TV, we needed to update our Roku to go with it since the older version of Roku we had was not able to have this newest version of Hulu on it. Since the upgrade, everything moves very fast! We love the interface and the ease of downloading new channels. It was a little pricey but well worth the money for everything to be working so perfectly.

We’ve had constant issues with connectivity. We just upgraded our internet to the fastest ATT offers, very surprising how bad this roku stick has operated. Our old roku box runs better. We’ll either need to get another roku box or scrap roku altogether.

I cancelled my satellite tv service, subscribed to a streaming service, which cut my monthly in half. Then I added Roku. Lots of free channels.  Roku stick was extremely easy to install and use. Clear picture,  I own a smart tv and subscribe to internet. I recommend.

What the F is the point of this?  All this does is provides you to other links to watch stuff.  You still have to pay for it!!Seriously, if you have Amazon Prime video, it's the same thing.  And that's already included in your plan.  Don't buy this.
Remote does not work.  Tried other  brand new AAA batteries.  No reaction whatever I did.  It could be a good gadget, but without remote am dead in the water.

I'm not sure what's wrong with my firestick.  When it works, it works GREAT.  But about every 3rd time I turn it one.  I get no sound to any of my services.  Ill unplug it and replug it in, and it will freeze the picture, but continue to play sound.  Its becoming very frustrating.  And I haven't had this issue with my other streaming devices.

I have several fire sticks and have never had any issues, however after this purchase I am disappointed. This device does not stream well at all. We have had to unplug and reset it so many times! Our others in the house will be operating just fine, with no issues and the newest one we purchase won't allow us to watch a program without issues?
Usé el Fire TV para revivir un viejo TV que ya no se usaba porque no tenía capacidad para instalar aplicaciones. Hasta ahora ha sido un excelente artículo. Compraré un par mas para mi casa.
Haven't had the time to dig as deep as I want in order to explore all of the capabilities that it has. So far its "try this" then "go back."

I tried using this for a few days and pretty much all day, I was being told that I did not have enough memory. It was frustrating and annoying because even when i reset it completely with just the basic apps, I couldn't get through a full movie or tv show. I gave up and it is now sitting at the bottom of a pile.
What’s not to like about prime tv devices ? Easy to set up and easy to use. Love the cheaper option and it works perfect.
As one of the seniors that grew up using a slide rule this is helping me figure out and use things of the new technology.
do not be afraid it doesnt have a full remote. it works fine with tv's remote and voice commanding the apps like Amazon prime and netflix is great
I disliked the fact that sometimes it won't work and it linked to the kids fire tablets and was difficult to get it off!!
It does exactly what I was paying for and that is to have the ability to get to Netflix (and others) through a "dumb" tv.

I hated this product. My other fire stick is way better. I want a volume control. Should have returned, that’s how unhappy I was. Too much trouble to do that. My old one for another tv was way better. Had I known I’d never have ordered
Great apps easy to install. Doesn't always do what I ask especially when u ask to play a certain seat is on Amazon music.

I purchased this Fire TV Stick Lite for use on my tv (Vizio HDCP 1.4).  My tv keeps saying that there is no signal.Since the new device is HDCP 2.2, they must be incompatible.  Is that correct?  I've tried using a HDMI to component video converter, but the only ones I can find are HDMI 1.3 or 1.4 and do not seem to work either.  Does anyone have any suggestions on how to make this work?
I bought the older model 2 years ago and love it. Got another tv and purchased this updated one and works just as great! Very easy to set up and worked immediately! Great product!
Don't waste your money. The first one I bought only lasted a year, and the new quit producing sound after just two months.
I love the firestick!  I had one before and it got lost in my move.  I had to have another one for the tv in by bedroom!!
Now we can get Prime channels on our older TV. Quality is good. Got the cheaper fire stick for our older TV. Was good price.
What a delightful difference from the same old boring cable shows. My husband and I thoroughly love the variety of shows and movies. Excellent gift!
Worked great out of the box. Easy to set up.  Has limited capabilities, but I chose it for its low price. Works very well.

My “smart” TV was just a little too old to add some of the newest apps. I had finally given up my cable TV and was switching to just streaming. I needed something that would allow me to add some of the newer apps to my TV. This Firestick did exactly that. I’m not overly technologically savvy but the Firestick was very simple to set up and use.
I added the fire stick to a tv I set up in front of my treadmill so I could get some programming and it works really well.

Works well for the most part. It often has no sound when I turn it on and I have to unplug it and plug it back in to get any sound to come through. Almost a daily problem. That's the only issue we've had with it.
This Lite works just as the other two Fire TV Sticks I previously purchased.  A very good product in a very small package!
Needed a way for our son to watch his favorite shows and this works perfectly. Everything you would expect from the description and for a great price!
If I would have known that this version does not include a volumn control or a power button I would not have purchased it.
I don’t like that it doesn’t have a volume bottom on it and sometimes when I use the voice command I completely lose sound
I have been missing out on the firestick we have 7 tvs a were using rokus... Until I purchased a firestick its so. Much better and easier to use...
I like the Fire stick lite, I also have the original Fire stick, I enjoy the ease of streaming of movies and apps on them, I like my Fire stick lite.
Outstanding fast performance. No tv audio control but wonderful selection of streaming apps and content for a fabulous price. Silk browser app is easy to use too.

We had an older roku and bought another streaming stick and hated it. We ended up buying this one and it’s so much better! Just stick with roku. The new buttons on the bottom with Disney are great. The remote paired with our tv so quickly and the volume control is wonderful!

This was a great buy! Very easy to setup and use. Great instructions, was able to get it going in less than 10 minutes (not hard - we just were not in a rush). Love the remote! It has volume adjustments on the side. Can turn TV on with its power button and it automatically sets it to the proper input.It’s simple to use and we enjoy it very much.  Hope you do too!

This was supposed to be the top dog, but the setup was not plug and play even on a standard newish tv and internet.  Had trouble connecting to wifi even though all my other devices connected fine at that range.  The online/tv setup connection stunk.  Sadly I would never buy this for my parents or inlaws because i know i would be over at their house for a few hours setting it up.  Other streamers they did on their own.

We’ve had this product for approximately 4 months and have started having significant issues with it. It doesn’t always stream - several times a week we have to go into settings and reconnect to the WiFi. And now the streaming device has started overheating - even after watching TV for less than an hour. I would not purchase again - I expect this product to last longer than several months.

I have an old Roku 3 and the new 4K stick. Both freeze and crash all the time and become unresponsive. I then have to unplug them and restart. I’ve tried engaging support and they respond days later with nothing and then say they haven’t heard from you. Lol I don’t know how they’re in business or have such awesome reviews. Maybe this is more recent. I’ve even engaged them on social media and they never respond. I’ll be trying FireStick next because Roku clearly has an issue in their OS and hasn’t fixed/ won’t help.

Never had an issue with any Roku device I’ve purchased. I bought this one to replace the Firestick I purchased months ago. With Roku I don’t have to keep restarting the device as I did the FireStick.I’ll always recommend Roku devices.

I first had this on an old Vizio TV.  I replaced the TV with a new Vizio model and the home screen of Roku shows up but is FROZEN - no response from remote.  I've reset all the published ways I've found and I can't get the unit to work.........would love some better help before I return it.

Doesn’t work with the Alexa speaker. Considering it’s highly advertised that it is compatible, and all it does is turn a device off and on, can’t do anything else. Seems like false advertising to me. Disappointed

The device is amazing, easy to install and use. My Tv experience is improved by a lot .The only issue I'm really pissed at which made me give it 2 stars is that most of the features do not exist for countries other than US and Canada, and some other countries I prosume.The device works perfectly with Netflix which is why I got it in the first place, but please for the love of god add the app to international iOS stores and don't hog on the features the device provides if you're in a different country ( it feels so discriminating)

I have 2 Fire Sticks and 3 Roku Sticks used for HuluLive+, Disney and others. Killed my cable so these are used hours per day. Response from the Roku's is much faster than the Fire Sticks. Only thing I would change is if the shortcut buttons were programmable but that's minor. Will replace my Fire Sticks when the Rokus go on sale.

I have average technology skills and this was so easy to set up just make sure you know your passwords. Streaming has been a breeze and figuring out the remote functions. I am so happy I chose Roku over Apple or Firestick. Voice recognition I don't really use because it never recognizes any commands I give it but that is no big deal to me as I am not an avid voice recognition user in general.

I have 3 different Roku devices in my house, and this one by far, is the fastest one.  I have the "Premier", a TCL Roku TV, and this.  This thing is fast! (menu interface; etc.) RESPONSIVE.Comes with a smart remote which is nice, too.If you need a Roku streaming device, & can afford this, buy it.  I'm impressed.

I liked this while it was working. Then it just seemed to die or go all wonky. Tried everything I could think of to get it to work with my TV but it just isn't happening. If one year is the standard usage, it's definitely not worth it.

I love this model because it powers on my TV and has volume control.  There is little need for the remote that came with the TV.  I use this to replace my Spectrum cable box.  I save the extra charge for the cable box and I live this even better.  The remote is much small, easier to use and there is no visible cable box.

Got this to replace one of the original Roku boxes in our house that was wearing out. It works just the same as the box did, but with a smaller remote and obviously just a stick instead of a whole box. Knocked off a star because the remote doesn't come with a handle to put on your wrist like the other ones do. And, the tag is so skinny I can't clip one on easily. This makes it fall and get lost into the couch more often because it's so thin and lightweight. Otherwise, it's great!

This application freed me from expensive satellite dishes.  I use only streaming services now.  Stream quality is usually good, but I need to update some old equipment.  Voice recognition & alexa integration are both a delight to use.

Loved it! ... until it stopped working. After 7 months exactly, the device no longer wants to connect to the network, or to the remote. Tried all the reset/problem-solve solutions I could find.Contacted customer service; perhaps there'll be an update.

Cancelled my cable for YouTubeTV. I originally bought a Chromecast but lasted less than 48 hours without having a physical remote. I can't stand using my phone as the remote. I googled how to watch YTT with a remote and the Roku was the most practical solution. Returned the Chromecast for the Roku & could not be happier! The remote also turns the TV off and controls the volume.

I really like the selection of channels and content.The remote is really glitchy though. Sometimes the remote doesn't work at all and other times is delayed and will pause several minutes after I had pushed the pause button.

My old ROKU provides all that this does, with the same picture, and it allows my TV remote to control it. With this, I can only control it with the ROKU remote that I don't like -- and I HATE HAVING TO HAVE ANOTHER REMOTE.If I'd known this, I'd have bought an older model refurbished or used. Live and learn.
Needed a better updated Roku for better streaming, and this was it.  Generally works great, but sometimes really overheats.

This is a much better option than the Roku Express due to its duel band frequencies, its range and the volume control on the side. A great option for those wanting to make their regular TV a smart TV and much more economical than buying an Xbox or Apple box. Plus, it allows streaming for spectrum TV channels if you have that provider.

2 thumbs down to Vizio - Only way to play Disney + is "cast" it. Bull Hockey to them - no native app in the offing.So bought and installed this guy. You will need access to a laptop to enter the "link" code that links the critter and your TV. The smartphone app will help - far easier to enter usernames and passwords on it than using the remote (makes phone act as remote - with a keyboard!)

Overall very impressed! The remote works better than expected, it uses Bluetooth I believe, and the whole setup is easy to install, is extremely well made and thought out! I would only buy this one again over any other streaming device, this one allows you to access all the streaming devices as opposed to being limited to Amazon, or Apple TV, or Playstation!I'm really happy with it!

Hung tv with hdmi and built in USB port. Able to eliminate wires showing with this unit. Much faster than an older model streaming stick I had. Only slight issue is battery life could be better. Seem to need to replace monthly.

Bought because supposed to have stronger signalBut is worse than previous stickTried to speak with tech support received mess that due to beer fluNot tech support via teleI guess people cant work from home at the roku

I bought this SPECIFICALLY to be able to access Peacock and HBO Max. There was a huge pic in the description for HBO Max when I purchased this...so imagine my surprise when HBO Max actually doesn’t work with this. Once I saw this, I went back to review the description and - shocker - that HBO Max image is no longer shown. False advertising!

This product is awesome.  The apps are great and the picture is beautiful.  The only downfall is the remote (it's on your wifi).  Sometimes the roku and remote can't 'find' each other.  I use my phone so this isn't an issue.  However, if you don't want to use your phone, find another version that doesn't have the "point anywhere" remote.  I ordered a replacement and had the same issue.  Again if you use your phone/remote app, it's awesome.

Cutting the cable ⁉️Roku is a great alternative to cable TV. I’ve installed 5 to replace the recurring monthly fees associated with the cable company box. Saving $100 dollars a month. I’ve also noted my Electric bill declined by $15 a month getting rid of those hot cableboxes so that’s another $180 in savings I didn’t account for.  The batteries last about a month in a heavily used Roku but a couple of AAA’s month.... pittance.

This is my third RoKu in the last six months.And this particular version is the best so far. It actually has an off switch for the television it’s self. And volume control for the television.These two functions are wonderful additions. Keep up the good work. And you will have customers for life
There is no Spectrum Streaming App possible for this product. Just a heads up...only Sling and ATT work as streaming apps you can download.

Stopped working after less than a month and even though I was under warranty and was told I could get a replacement they did not follow through on that..instead they told me that I could keep the broken device and receive a gift card. mind you I bought the fire stick when it was on sale for 17.99 now they’re trying to make me buy it again for 29.99 when it’s not my fault that it stopped working in the first place do better Amazon

Setup was rather easy.  3 stars as there is no listing for Jamaica to set time zone or location to get weather.  This lack of region support also makes it hard to see from the home screen what content is available as it pushes US content by default.
The Alexa did not work on the remote. I have bought two the first one was perfect. The last one I recently bought no Alexa.
Had to replace my first generation fire stick which was very slow.  Works great.  This is the lite version so this fire stick does not have power and voice controls

I put off buying a smart box for a very long time, and finally caved after Xfinity sent me their version for free and it just didn’t work whatsoever. Im 24 and this has actually changed my life. I’m able to stay up to date on all news relating to my job during stay at home, as well as show/movie platforms in such an easy, user friendly way.
Perfect for our spare room TV. Actually, would be great for any room in the house. Super affordable to get the tv you want.
I bought this for under $20.00 and was able to convert an old dumb TV to a Smart Alexa enable TV.  I am very happy with it.

I suppose I can get used to the new "updated" home screen.  (There was nothing wrong with the last one, btw).  But, no matter what I do I can't get it to recognize there's an ethernet cable attached. My old firestick had no problem with this.  Maybe the old one is the better device.
Pretty weak and slow, no new apps added yet I keep getting messages that my memory is full and to delete unneeded apps.

When my cable provider decided to connect every tv in the box to a box and decided to charge $12 a month I said phooey. Previously we only paid a fee on the single box with DVR.  Well no more!  I have 3 TVs on streaming Roku.

These are absolutely the best stick type media players if not the best all around. The thing I most appreciate about the ROKU players is the basically incorporate everything including Amazon, Netflix, ROKU, and every other streaming media there is pretty much if it is not on the stick itself which most are including Google/Youtube you can get it through apps and ROKU works with all those as well specifically with this on it is capable of UHD and everything that goes with including Dolby Atmos capabilities etc.

Needed to get a streaming device that was better than my Samsung “smart” tv’s ability to manage streaming (it sucks!). Saw that the Roku plus reviewed as top choice and took the plunge. Wow what a cool device! Super easy and I mean super easy installation and set up. Remote pretty much automatically set itself up to my TV. Interface is a vast improvement over Samsung. Streaming quality mad choice of content awesome. I downloaded Plex and use that often on the Roku. Highly recommend!

I have owned several Roku products and this is the only one I did not love. It over heats even with the extender dongle Roku has to send out. Now it does not respond to the remote. It controls power and volume to the TV, but nothing else. I can attach to I and work with the app on my phone, but no luck with the remote it’s self. Missed the return window. $50 paid for a paperweight.

Roku makes you enter in card details to activate the account. I wasn't aware of this prior to purchasing. It also needs a power source, either from the wall adapter or USB. Interface is easy enough to use. Only used voice remote once but worked good.

I would have rated this product much higher if the remote for this particular model didn't stop working after less than 3 months, tried to order a replacement and found out the remote is a discontinued item.  I had to end up downloading the roku remote control app on my phone in order to use or change the channel. Otherwise one of the best decisions I made as far as home entertainment

Have cut the cord and used Roku since 2005. Bought a 4khdr smart TV. The user interface is not nearly as nice as Roku so I bought the appropriate one for my new TV and love it.  The Roku even improved the picture quality..I connected my old Roku to my bedroom TV which is an older smart TV it also improved the picture. Sure wish I had bought the stock as soon as it went public.

Really glad I got it. Only hiccup was Netflix stalling out, and had to unplug and restart. Other than that, Roku is incredible. Got it over Amazon stick because Amazon is all about pay this pay for that, but Roku has so much to offer like freebie channels. Main reason was to get Showtime to play without paying for it through Amazon, because I already have an account. Amazon is lacking in so much lately it's almost embarrassing be cause they have trillions to spend. Roku will always be supreme!

Works quite well and easy to set up. I mainly only use it for NBA league pass and YouTube.I find the arrow pad on the remote a little difficult to use mainly because I'm used to this part of a remote being lower down so I can't always find the arrows by feel and have to look to make sure i have my finger on the right button. Once I have it in place though, it's fine.I also find some of the preset buttons a bit pointless because I don't use Sling, Hulu or Vue so these serve no purpose to me. Maybe these buttons should be programmable shortcuts?NBA League pass works really well. The interface isn't as clean as AppleTV and there is a little lag when switching between days to view games but this is only a minor thing.Once you select the game to play, it loads quickly and streams at the highest bitrate setting. It's easy to navigate through the stream but I wish the right arrow skipped 10 seconds without pausing the video and bringing up the time slider. Because it pauses the stream, you have to press the right arrow and then press enter so make it play which creates an extra step. This is annoying when watching a game a few hours after it has finished as it makes it tedious to skip through breaks in the game.YouTube works well and pretty much the same as on any smart TV. The only things I don't like (navigating, non-qwerty keyboard etc.) are due to the YouTube app itself, nothing to do with the Roku.Overall it's a great little device and works well for what I use it for (mainly NBA League Pass). Would probably give 4.5 or even 5 stars if the navigation of a stream was smoother as mentioned above.

I've had this remote for just a bit over a year - it's not overused (I use another TV a lot more ) so I was surprised to find that the remote just stopped working!  There was some odd, honey-like substance in the battery compartment - I removed the existing batteries, cleaned the compartment and installed new batteries.  Still not working. Checking with friends who also have had issues with breakdown after only a year's use.  I think ONE YEAR is carrying 'planned obsolescence' a bit far.
Works as advertised, easy to operate, I like the Alexa voice control, still getting used to checking out the app options
My Fire TV stick didn't fit with adequate accessibility behind my TV set. They need to make cord and/or extensions more universal for different type and TV brands.
I love it. I wish I'd bought 3 more when they were selling them for under $18, not too long before I bought this/2nd one, for $11+ more. It performs as advertised.
This Firestick, even though “Lite” is MUCH faster than our original one (which was still working) but after our Daughter replaced hers, she recommended we do the same!

Alexa doesn't do exactly what I want. I don't know if I'm speaking incorrectly or what but I just don't use the voice recognition because of that reason. I do like the fact that I have downloaded the amazon internet and can watch soap2day movies on my reg tv instead of my tablet. And it works with my hotspot not just Wi-Fi.
Works great and connects well.Still wondering why XUMO isn't available for this new one. It worked fine on my old one.
I love this little gadget. I got it for our bedroom without the added expense of adding another DirecTV room and this is perfect.
I love this because I use it on my car stereo .. now all I need now is get a iPad mini to use because it has a better pic quality!!

I bought this for my TV in the garage. I didn't too many bells it whistles. It controls the stick and that's all I needed. I haven't even tried the voice feature. So I got a remote for the TV and one for the stick and I'm good.
I actually like this better than the one with TV controls--I had some problems with two of those, but this works perfectly, is easy to set up

I hate that you're required to link a credit card in order to activate your roku account. It's no big deal, but it exponentially increases the ability for accidental purchases, so just be careful around kids and aging parents!

The power adapter doesn't provide enough power for the unit. I have tried different power outlets and it still doesn't work.I have 2 roku ultras that are fantastic but decided to save some money by going with the stick plus while it was on sale.  Maybe I can get roku to send a new power adapter and cable.

Remote worked well for month or two. Had alot issues with it registering button clicks for a while. Had to continuesly reconnect it. Now it has stopped working all together. Not sure if this is the Roku sticks fault or the remote itself. We also have the Roku 4 and have had no issues. Not impressed.

I have a roku express and an older 1080p JVC tv that came with a roku package. So far so good with those two. I really like them, they're reliable. My WiFi is working great also. This streaming stick+, however, has been almost nothing but problems. Between avoiding overheating, having to reset because of freezing, the remote constantly disconnecting, and most recently streaming distorting and going in and out, I finally am giving up and sending it back to Amazon. I also tried customer service to no avail. They were as helpful as they could be but the product just seems faulty.

Should have done this ages ago. Only thing I don't like, is that you are asked to onto your computer (or device) I chose computer as it's easier for me. Submitted all the passwords but yet down on the tv AGAIN your asked for passwords. Why? But the product itself does well - not many free things like I thought there would be ... but overall good item.

I bought this to replace a Roku streaming stick that was not the 4K version (bought in 2016). The old unit had a bad remote which is why I replaced it.I actually think the new one is slower!  It takes forever to load!  I am not using it on a 4K tv if that matters.

Without a doubt, this is the best streaming stick I've used. I also have the Amazon stick and that's fine, but the Roku let's me choose any of my streaming services without having to switch to a separate stick for Amazon. The interface is easy and the connection time is very fast. Because of my happiness with the Roku stick, I bought a TCL Roku TV, so now I don't need any sticks as the Roku is built-in. And on the Roku TV remote there is a plug in for my headset speakers. Very cool.

this player is great but it was really annoying to set up - for every streaming service i had to individually log in and I got really confused about their "roku channel" HBO vs regular HBO. It took me forever to find where to cancel my HBO subscription that I got through roku and not HBO.

We bought the Roku Streaming Stick + in March and everything was great until a few months ago when the remote started not working. We would have to "reboot" it by unplugging the stick from the TV and outlet, then let it "find" the remote again.  It's gotten to the point now that the remote will hardly work at all. It will let us start a show, but then when we try to pause, it will "hang" and stop working. Or it won't work but a foot in front of the TV, if you're lucky. My husband is about to throw the whole system away and just cast via phone apps. In the last hour I have had to unplug the stick twice, and go through the whole reboot process to get the remote to at least do something. So annoying!

Cut the cord. This works better then I hoped for. Setup was quick and easy. The stick found my network and connected. It all took less then 20 minutes from opening the box to streaming Roku content. Installing apps is straight forward and easy. I’ve been using it for a month and still finding new things out. Paid $49 for the stick and saving $59 a month in cable costs. This is great. Our area has fiber running to each home. Streaming is fast. I should have done this a year ago.

Throw that chrome cast to the garbage. I am so sorry that i was recommended it for all people around me. Roku is way better streaming than chrome-cast. If you are using PLEX NETFLIX OR SPOTIFY roku is your best choice.Plex: better quality faster and even easier to use with the remote control. YOU WILL HAVE THE 1080p you paid forNetflix: no more auto brightness adjustment no more auto lowering the resolutionI just love how ruko give you the things as it’s meant to beI am not mentioning the free channels which are good to have

I am used to having a Roku. When I moved and needed a streaming device for my own TV, I researched both the Roku and Fire Stick and I ultimately decided on the Fire Stick. I use it daily and I love it! I don't typically use the voice recognition, and honestly I could go either way with it. It wasn't a hard adjustment to go from the Roku to the Fire Stick, and there isn't anything I miss that was on the Roku.

Love the apps and streaming ability. Don't have problems with it disconnecting from wifi or freezing in apps like the fire stick it replaced.  The remote is horrible though. Have had problems with it not working from time to time.  It also eats through batteries like crazy.

I spent hours researching streaming programs before dropping cable. I purchased ROKU to have access to CBS Sports & live news. I’ve ended up having to purchase another streaming device to get CBS Sports through ROKU. I’ve now spent more than my cable bill for two ROKU devices & another streaming service.

The Streaming Stick+ is a great product but has a bad habit of freezing up. The TV will be playing a show and then the image will suddenly freeze in place. When reviewing Roku user forums the freezing problem seems to have been around for years and apparently Roku has not yet resolved the technical problem. The Streaming Stick+ gets five stars when it works and, of course, zero stars when it doesn't.

I was able to hook this up myself. If you have problems unplug everything and start over. Check the date on the batteries in case the Roku control doesn't work. Also read the instructions exactly. If you take shortcuts and don't follow every step it will take longer to set up because you will miss a step. Don't get frustrated if you do mess up. Just start over and before you know it you will be watching your favorite shows.
In terms of streaming hardware Roku is the gold standard. I actually have a Samsung 4K Smart TV but the streaming on it is problematic at best so I simply got a Roku for it.

Had to buy a new roku since prime video no longer supported my old roku. This new stick was super easy to install. It came with a quick set up guide and it was literally only minutes until it was set up. I like the higher video support, the movies are much more vivid.

I bought this on sale, I already have a bunch of other rokus. This one is just as good and cheaper for 4k but while all other rokus in the house respond to each others remotes, this one doesnt, which causes problems for us constantly.

I wish I would have bought this a long time ago. I got rid of my Directv service and got this Roku stick. It's saving me a lot of money each month and there's so much to watch that it's hard to decide what to watch next.

Does not work. Will not connect to my home network. Customer service was unable to help me on the phone. Thought I ordered the extra part they asked me for but it never came. Now it's too late to return. Do not recommend.

I have another fire stick that works great. That’s why I bought another one. This one, however, has been a source of irritation from the set up. Every time I want to use it, I need to unplug it and plug it back in. It often will not let me on the home page, initially, even though my internet connection is excellent. It’s very frustrating.
This is awesome!I am pleased that I finally got one.Menu speed and streaming speed/quality are better than my paid cable service!

The remote is poorly made.. my original remote only lasted 2 years- the battery contacts broke.Why is it cheaper to buy a firestick (including a remote) than to buy a remote? It doesn't make sense to a consumer..
I have a Firestick and I love it, so I bought this one for my mom. She is happy with it. It is easy to set up and use.

I cancelled my cable tv account and now watch just what is on my Amazon Fire Stick. There is more news, TV programs - old and new, and movies then you would ever need to watch. There is so much that is free that I haven't even subscribed to Hulu, Netflix, or the many numerous sites you can subscribe to. It is very easy to install and use,I love it!

We have not used the Alexa integration with it. We really like the Fire Tv stick. It’s easy to use and worked perfectly for what we wanted. It was also inexpensive. We use ours for Utube and Netflix on our tv.
I use my fire stick to access my commercial free Amazon shows.  Regular t.v. stations have too many commercials...............

I love it! I hooked it up to my projector & it works beautifully. Definitely worth the purchase!! I would definitely recommend. Down side it has no volume control or power button but my projector has volume on the remote & I simply unplug the power source so it doesn’t burn out. Other than that I live it, it’s wonderful. But buy buy!!!!!
I bought 3 of them for my kids room 2 of them have been giving us issues night one will not work at this moment and I have not even had them 2 months such a bummer
Very cool and neat device. It has everything that a smart TV has. The image and the sound of my TV improves significantly.

Love these bought 2 for TVs in the home I am now able to watch my DVR recorded shows on the other TV's without having to get a second or third box and avoid the Monthly fee.  Also love the response time and new feature power/Volume control as oppose to older models.  It would be great if it could control my TV's input selector so I could free up the second control.  I also love the fact I do not have to run a power cable can power it using the TV's USB Plug.

I absolutely love having an Amazon Fire Stick and I really don’t know why I didn’t get one sooner...really I don’t know what I was thinking. LOL! Oh, and I get to enjoy it after I’m done wrestling it from my mother...joking, but she loves it too!
Works fine and you get additional channels from Roku, Prime and Netflix. Would rate it 5 stars if you could control volume like Roku does.
Bought this to access my peloton app on flat screen. Easy setup. Economical since I don't need all bell and whistles.
The product is easy to install and easy to use.This is my second fire stick.I have converted to no cable and just using fire sticks as my TV entertainment.

We absolutely love our firestick! Movies galore and the latest fights right at your fingertips. One of my favorite features is voice recognition. Hold the button and ask to show comedies and a listing comes up. I believe you will enjoy it as much as we do.

I have purchased four Amazon fire sticks in the past 3-5 year.  ALL of them have gone bad aver 6 months or a year.  Always past the warranty, so I lose money every time I buy one.  Amazon needs QUALITY CONTROL!!!!

The voice recognition is a nice feature but does not always respond to the command. Also the volume tends to dis function quite a lot; it took me a while to get it work. Turning the plug off from the connection seems to be how to make it work.  That is why I am giving it 3 stars.
I didn't reallly need this. I bought this because of Discovery +. It was so easy to use.plug it in , update and speak

I have this fire TV stick and I love it it. It was easy to install and the Alexa feature makes finding what you want to watch a breeze.You really need to order this TV fire stick-you won't be disappointed

Works good, 3rd one I've had, difficult to set up but I'm not a techie.  A new channel downloaded with this one called 4k, have not tried voice feature, works ok with the remote.  Purchased newer model as 1st no longer works with some channels.  This one operates much faster than other first 2.

The setup was simple.  Easy to follow instructions. The streaming quality is good, but I have not yet watched any 4K content.  Good selection of apps that are pre-installed but I had no problems installing additional apps.  The remote has voice recognition and it has worked the 2 times I used it.

Super easy to install and setup was a breeze.  Just what I needed for an older, but still excellent, plasma TV that needed streaming capability.  Note: I purchased an HDMI extender so that I could better position the streaming stick where I wanted it behind the mounted TV. My only gripe is the remote can only handle turning the TV off OR controlling the volume on my sound bar, but not both simultaneously...if anyone knows how to make that happen, then I would only need 1 remote.

We finally cut the cord. The Roku is great for enhancing a not as smart, smart tv into the real thing. We stream Sling, Amazon, Netfilx, Youtube and Plex. Great remote, no line of site needed, so you can hide it behind the tv with no necessary velcro sticky thing going on.

I love the features available on the new stick+ such as the option for 4K, faster processor and especially the attached wireless receiver. I think the stick+ is a great upgrade from the older models.  However, I did encounter a couple of issues.  First, this stick is longer than the older model I have and it doesn't fit into the HDMI port on the back of my television.  I have to order a separate 270 degree (right angle) adapter piece before I can install it.  I'm concerned that connecting with a generic adapter may either affect the fidelity of the connection or may not be fully compatible with my HMDI port.  Second, the power cable attaches to roku on the side, as opposed to the end of the stick as my previous roku, so the power cable sticks up and out from the side of my TV and looks awkward.  I would still recommend this stick+ for the more advanced features, but those are issues that I think roku and customers should be aware of.

I love the roku BUT i have more connectivity issues with it then i dont know what I literally can try and go on hulu through roku and it hulu will say not connected to the internet cant load....i switch and watch hulu through the app on the smart tv and it works completely fine...its gets very annoying bc i have very good wifi

We like this way better than our Apple TV that cost $200+ The roku has all the apps I want and it’s easy to navigate. The roku integrates with our tv so you can turn off the tv with the Roku button which our Apple TV doesn’t do. The one gripe I have is that Roku threw errors that our brand new tv wasn’t compatible with HDMI 2.0 copyright and so we had to unplug everything a few times to get it to work. Picture quality is amazing.

Device does not work. Tried streaming a show on hbo, immediately glitched requiring a forced restart. Checked internet speeds/ made sure i was using the latest version. Then tried disney plus. Immediately glitched, screen started flashing and remote became unresponsive requiring another forced restart. Device was very hot to the touch. Let it cool down. Tried different hdmi port. Exact same issue. Possibly defective, or maybe they are all like this. Either way, now i get to drive to an amazon return location which are somehow never close. #fun times.
Generally a very good streaming device.  Has audio drop-outs on occasion.  Can also have HDMI handshake issues on some inputs (ARC).  Picture quality is very good.

I purchased the Roku stick to replace my Xfinity cable box in one of my rooms.  Works great and I have access to all my channels and more.  I also get HD channels now which I couldn't get with the cable box.  Took the cable box back to Xfinity and cut my monthly equipment cost.  Roku has already paid for itself in savings.

Best roku I’ve had, hands down!  Strong connection, easy and useable menu to navigate.  Small footprint, and lots of features.  I cancelled my cable tv service recently, and now just use the roku to access the streaming services I want and use.  Would definitely recommend, and also recommend cancelling pricey cable tv subscriptions and just start streaming with a roku instead!

We have a strong WiFi connection with several devices throughout our home.  All devices remain consistently connected with the exception of the Roku Stick+.  In the 4 months we have used it, connection drops frequently.  Other devices in the same room do not drop connection.  That was frustrating enough, but now the remote has stopped working.  Roku has no customer support via chat or phone, only email.  I downloaded the Roku app on my smart phone, hoping for a solution.  Doesn't work.  Factory reset doesn't work either.  Will replace the Roku junk with another Apple TV4K.

My only Black Friday sale, bought to replace our aging Roku that kept rebooting and kicking us out of what we were watching.As soon as we plugged it in, we noticed the improvement. MUCH faster, a landing screen with more info on it. and no more rebooting during shows. This one can plug a USB right back into the TV for its power so the cord wasn't needed, which was nice. Well worth the (discounted) price.

I have these all over my house and use it with Disney+, Netflix, Amazon, and Plex and it is awesome.I run a hdhomerun with a cable card presented through Plex and use an old PC as the DVR.  Every TV has a Roku stick and that allows my family to watch live TV through Plex and all the other content from the other channels.

We have four Roku devices in our house, and this one quit working after a few weeks of acting up (had to restart many times each week).  It finally gave up the ghost today.  Cheap crap.  Why can't Roku produce products that consistently last?

It works fine when the remote works but to do that I have to remove/replace one of the batteries a few times a day. This seems to be a known problem with the streaming stick+.  I wouldn't buy another one of these.

Here are my experiences with the 2017 Streaming Stick+ Roku.First let me specify my setup.  I have a slow 2.4 (typically) Mbps Internet connection.  Previously I was using a Panasonic BMP110 Blu-Ray player for what little streaming I did.  That was mainly used for trying out the Vudu free movies.  It was marginal; with my slow connection, sometimes it would work pretty well, and sometimes it would complain and give up intermittently.I have a Yamaha VX-477 Receiver.And it all feeds into a 2011 Panasonic Plasma TV.Setup:It probably isn’t very important, but the remote uses AAA batteries, not AA.  I slapped in a couple of Eneloops and it’s happy.I see people complaining about having to give credit card information to activate their Roku.  This is not necessary.  Go to the page made for this option: my dot roku dot com/signup/nocc, and you can create a Roku account without entering any credit card or PayPal information.  I know, because I did it.If you’re wondering about using the Roku with an A/V receiver, that works.  I plugged the stick into one of the HDMI inputs on my Yamaha, and it works just fine.  4K wouldn’t cut it, because my receiver doesn’t really support it.  But my TV isn’t 4K anyway, so that isn’t a problem.Some people are complaining about HDCP errors.  This is probably because they’re trying to use 4K video on a TV that doesn’t support HDCP 2.2.  My five year old TV works just fine, because it’s only 1080p.  If you want to see 4K video, make sure your TV really supports HDCP2.2.  And you need an HDMI connection that also supports HDCP 2.2.  On some TVs that’s only one port.If 1080p24 is important to you, Roku says only the 4K devices can do it.  I had to turn it off; when the movie would break for commercials, the receiver usually flaked out.  I would have to switch HDMI inputs on the receiver, then switch back to the original.  The guide says the screen may flash black; mine mainly went to snow, and wouldn’t recover.  So I’m doing without 1080p24.  It might work better for people who plug it directly into the TV; I didn’t try that.The specs talk about 802.11ac, but it works just fine on my old router without ac.To set this thing up, look at the Quick Start Guide, or just go to the Roku page about your specific device.  Basically I just plugged the stick into an HDMI input, plugged the power adapter into my UPS, and connected the cables.  It started right up.I haven’t tried different models, so I can’t offer a comparison.  But the Streaming Stick+ works great.First you have to pick a wireless network, and provide the password.  Then the stick downloads the latest firmware.When it restarted, mine didn’t connect the first time, even though it indicated it still remembered the password. After sitting for a while with a spinning wheel, it finally gave a 014.40 error, and suggested some alternatives.  I just unplugged the power cable and plugged it back in.  It restarted, and everything was fine.It will go through a few screens, and give you a four letter code.  Go back to the page you end up at after creating your account online, or the page they refer you to.  Enter the code, and you’re all set.  You can select some channel options.  Your stick is now busy setting up channels.And things seem to be working great.  It does fine showing a movie in standard definition.  It  has trouble with the commercials; I wonder if they’re a higher definition.  But it gets over it quickly.Things like rewind and fast forward are far better than on my old Blu-Ray player.So far I’m just using things that are free.  Look around online at the Roku site, and you can see what’s available.So in summary:This thing works surprisingly well with a slow connection.  You don’t get 4K video, but it looks pretty good in old-fashioned 1080p (which is probably really a lot less, as in standard def upscaled to 1080).It works plugged into a receiver that then separates out the audio, and passes the video on to the TV.It works with old routers that don’t have 802.11ac.  And it works with new routers that have 5GHz ac.You can create an account without providing any credit card information.I recommend this device to anyone that needs a streaming connection.
