Like using because it make my dumb tv smart. Like the apps and lie to add my own.

Enjoying this upgrade. My older Fire Stick would disconnect from the internet and we would have to unplug just to reconnect. I’m so glad we upgraded. The functions, look and feel has improved for the better. Even the picture quality has improved. Thinking about replacing my other Fire TV Stick.
Wish I bought 2 of these. Works great. Always looking for the deals.
We bought 3, putting one on each of our TV's and are extremely happy to have been able to "cut the cable cord".  Couldn't be happier!

My husband bought me a roku tv a couple years ago for Christmas and I love it. I love how easy it is figure out how to use and there are so many choices to choose from.  We then decided to get rid of our Directv service and get a roku streaming stick.  It is a great product.  Would recommend it to all my friends and family as an alternative to paying for cable or dish.
Had so many issues with my fire stick. I wish I would have used this sooner! It even has the ability to power on my TV and control the volume!
I haven’t integrated my roku  with Alexa yet so I can’t rate that. The steaming quality is always clear and rarely lags. The remote always recognizes what I am telling it.

Bought this to stream HBO max on my TV and use mirroring of my laptop / phone with Apple Airplay.Overall, it works very seamlessly and the interface is very easy to use.The best function of this stick over the others is that you don't have to point the remote at the stick. Additionally, I love the voice feature as it makes navigating the device very easy.

Does great for fast forwarding pre-recorded shows but not so good for rewinding to a point that you want to watch again. I'm getting some pixelation regularly. I really like that the remote turns my TV on and off and controls the volume. It's fast to load.
I used this for two months, and then it stopped working. While it worked, it did its job. Now it’s just a piece of useless plastic which clearly isn’t worth the price of a functioning streaming tool.

We took the plunge and ditched our cable/Direct TV, it was getting so expensive.  Did research and found that Roku had the options and features that we wanted.  So easy to set up.  We love Roku and have not regretted the switch.The only negative thing I would say is the remote is kinda cheap looking and small.  Could be a bit bigger and more sturdier.

I have two of these in my home and absolutely love them.  The non-IR remote makes navigating a breeze and the ease of having all my streaming services right at my finger tips is second to none.  The claim to better wifi reception with this model is definitely valid as my home is laid out in a way that makes it very long.  As a result the wifi signal isn't the greatest in the master bedroom.  With other streaming sticks/boxes and even smart tvs this has been an issue, but with the new Roku Streaming Stick+, we no longer have this issue.  We are able to stream 4K video to that room with no buffering or grainy video.

This is a great product.  I have several Rokus and have been very satisfied.  The only downside is that this version of the stick is not supported by Slingbox, but I understand that is because Slingbox does not support 4K.  I don't have a 4K TV (yet) so I haven't been able to see how streamingo try that feature yet.

If you lose your remote and still have the Roku app you’re good until the device or Internet gets disconnected then you are locked out and have no way to use the device and the replacement remote cost almost as much as the device itself

Works very well, very easy to use. Only thing I would note here is that if it's having any difficulties with Wi-Fi, connect it to external power instead of the USB port on the TV. It definitely gets better range and a much more solid signal that way. I already bought a second one and am considering replacing a couple of my cable boxes (monthly rental fees from cable company) with these.

Customer service  doesn't exist, I bought 3  of these pieces of CRAP for $50.00 and now they are going for $30.00Find some thing else to spend your money on. You can't believe the reviews. Roku will play you for a sap!!

Super disappointed. I have this in an older version and love it. However, I bought this one as a gift for a family member and upon helping setup, it REQUIRES a credit card and PayPal. Needless to say, its going back.

I love Roku and the streaming stick + is great. The only problem I have is with ROKU remotes. They work but the left arrow key takes 2-3 times the pressure to work as the right key does. I have 2 and they are both the same.
I have Comcast and they charge for renting the cable boxes. I purchased this to replace the box and use Comcast's live TV streaming app. Works perfect! Easy way to save money each month

Fantastic device! Strong wireless signal (wireless-ac) and never a hiccup. Also have the older Roku 3 and this is a fantastic upgrade! My only gripe is that I wish the microphone option worked in-app instead of going back to the main screen and searching all apps. Other than that, it has been a solid device!
Put a tv in the garage and I needed a quality streaming device. This Roku pulls in wi-fi extremely well. Couldn't be happier.
Love love!!!! Haven’t tried the voice command but it sure is an upgrade from our #3. I think I’ll gift one to my daughter!!!!

It's a worthwhile purchase to turn your "dumb" TV into a "smart" TV!  Extremely easy to install and setup, I highly recommend it.Right from the box to complete install takes about 5 mins. The picture quality and performance is amazing.
Perfect! Easy to install and now I don't have to watch Netflix on my phone
Most of Spanish is not understood.  But otherwise everything is OK.

When I turn my TV off and turn it back on the next day, set it to the proper HDMI to watch the fire stick, it won’t turn on with the remote. I have to unplug and plug back in the stick for it to engage? Super un user friendly
Works just like the regular one did. I don't notice any difference.

The device was easy to set up and it works great.  So if you have an older TV with an HDMI, I'd buy this product in a heartbeat so you can view several movie channel apps as well as download so many more.  It's a great product at a very reasonable price, so get it while you can.
fairly easy to set up, good free variety of tv programs, easy to use
I was truly surprised and greatly pleased, by the increase in picture quality with the Firestick over my existing expensive cable plan.
Works great and especially for the price. Voice control works great
Perfect for me. I wasn't ready to upgrade my tv to a smart tv. Great quality
We did not hook up with Alexa.  It was a gift and person did not have Alexa.
What a way to beat high cable bills. It was super easy to install and works great. I can even move it from one tv to another.

Works as I expected and has the the streaming apps I need and more. My 6 yr old 24inch Vizio TV had the USB port which powers this stick. Remote is solid and does not have a ton of buttons on it, just enough. On screen menus are easy to navigate.
Love, love, love! It works fantastically. Was easy to set up. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking into streaming TV.

Super easy setup.  Have not tried voice recognition yet.  Need to research more to see what other (if any) differences between the "Plus" and regular Roku Streaming Stick.  So far, I like both and they are very intuitive.

This is awesome! We were able to do away with a cable box (which allowed more room). We now have more channels with a cheaper cable bill. Our son loves the voice recognition. We haven’t had any issues with the WiFi losing signal even though it’s on the opposite end of the house (apprx 3400 sq ft home).

I'm one of those types who hates paying for Cable.  My kids, however, want *ONLY* CN and Boomerang; mom ONLY wants Food or Travel Network; etc..  For years I was looking for a way to cut my cable bill - no joy... until today.  This looked too good to be true.  When I first bought this, I started out disappointed.  The video quality was excellent, install easy, no additional Roku hidden fees, connects to Amazon Prime, NetFlix, etc., but when I first hooked it up Thursday, the Roku channels weren't all they were cracked up to be.  However, after a little on-line research this morning, I stumbled onto Slack and a HDMI antenna.  Signed up on-line for $20/month (+5 per additional channel set) on Slack and broadcast HDTV, I was able to get *all* the channels we normally get through cable!  Kids have been watching all morning long and COULDN'T TELL THE DIFFERENCE!!!  Now I can cut back to basic Internet for $30/month, etc.  True happiness.  DISLIKES: It's not a seamless experience - you can't pick 'channels' and surf them up and down.  The remotes do have jump to buttons for Sling, NetFlix, Hulu, and Vue - just not the same.  As an upgrade, I hope they add a 'channel surfing' feature where you can select which channels you want to surf.
This streaming stick was very simple to install and performs exactly as I hoped it would, which is to say the stream quality is excellent.  I am very satisfied with this product.

I own a number of Roku devices and with the exception of the older slower model(s), I have had great experiences with them. Due to my experiences, I have continued to upgrade to newer models as they become available. I am now using my new Roku Stick when I travel instead of my old first edition fire stick. I prefer having the same interface when I am at home, camping or in a hotel.

Of course we waited until outside the return window to hook it up!  Doesn’t work at all. Did everything we were supposed to. Followed all the instructions, and nothing. Remote looks like it pairs, but all we get is a black screen.**if you decide to order, make sure that it is sold and filled by Amazon!  Stay away from anything sold by Aplus Services!!
Thought this would give us more TV options. It did not. Can do as much on line with a computer and two subscription services
I like being able to find great movies. I really like that when you stop watching it will return to where you stopped.

I needed a streaming device to pair with a projector for a Halloween party. Got this on sale, loaded up all my streaming services, and was ready tonrock and roll in no time.  Alexa built in means I can also control my smart home from my Fire TV lite.
My kids loves this fire stick Lite because it have Disney Plus....
We received the new Fire Stick. It is much faster than our old one

I’m not a fan.  I would buy one of other fire sticks.  This ones Home Screen is so confusing. You end up clicking on person.  I like other models better.  My apps on other sticks is there and that’s it

i have had several fire sticks, this is an upgrade so it works fine
I purchased a basic model and i am liking it thinking i will renew.

The unit doesn't work with my television. I have to power it down and power it back up every time I want to use it.  We thought it was the fire stick itself.  But apparently it doesn't work with my television.  Kind of frustrating when I have to power it down every time I want to watch a show.
Had an older fire stick and this one is much better faster overall if you are looking to replace an older firestick I do recommend this

Nice packaging, easy set up and simple to add apps for use. I have two of these and love them both.

Great little gadget for streaming. Much prefer this to other brands. Very Easy setup. Easy menu system. Large app selection.

I love this thing. I bought it mainly for the Xfinity app, since I have a room in my house that I can't get a cable wire to for a cable box. This solved the problem. it was so easy to install and setup. It even works my TV without any additional setup from me.

I really like this product. I have 2 of these in my home and they both work really well.  I think the user interface is really nice and easy to use.  I love the fact that I can press one button on the remote and it turns my TV on and goes straight to the Roku interface.  Great product!!

I love my Roku!There are a few things that I love about it: Night listening mode. Private listening (on phone/app) All shows in one place. Ease of use.What I don't like about it: Movies Anywhere, I love this app - but I'm having problems syncing it. Roku says it's the MA app which sucks.I don't regret buying my Roku.
I had the original version for a few years. Recently replaced with the + version and no regrets. Fast and smooth operation.

Works for streaming various videos and such. It is a bit difficult to setup but it works when finished. Has a few more channels than the Amazon Firestick but Youtube works better on the Firestick. Otherwise it is great.
I'm not bad at tech, but usually need help to set up new devicesThis was super easy to set up and use.Happy so far
I bought this just to avoid the comcast 10 per month cable box fee. Works great with the app and I have access to everything on my dvr. I now have 4 of these. Pay for themselves in no time!

We have used AppleTV for years and are actually happy with it until we purchased Roku. This stick surprised us by it's simplicity and versatility. We use it as a second option but I dare to say that, if you don't own an AppleTV device, I probably would go with a Roku stick: quality is great and also the price is right.

It’s a ROKU, what more needs to said. It’s a snap to install. We recently bought a third TV and it now has a ROKU attached. Streaming is very good. Could not ask for anything more.

Bought a 4k TV, needed a 4k Streamer.  The only drawback in my opinion is the power is no longer wall power, because the power-cube/power-brick is so large, it gets in the way when I push my tv back to the wall.  So I'm stuck with the onboard USB power, which means I have to wait for the stick to boot every time I fire up the tv.  In the non-4k model, the power cube was smaller, so it fit behind the tv.  Other than that, the quality is great, the remote works perfect, and the quality is perfect.

Was working great and very clear picture but after 2 weeks the remote control stopped working for the roku stick features but it works fine to control the TV and audio surround sound. Clearly a defective product.
I have several Roku's...this one was for the RV and Traveling.  Easy to setup and works fine connected to my 4G Phone Data.

I love that the Roku Stick+ has so many new and improved features over my last Roku table top device.  Not just by size but by features (can preview material on Netflix by just hovering over it, the remote can power on/off both TV and Roku, plus the remote controls TV volume without any complicated setup.  I've had older Roku Sticks and table top models of Roku but this is by far my favorite.

Love it! Love the voice command. Turns my in perfect shape non smart TV into a great streaming bedroom TV. The pictures are clear, super easy to set up. Love that you can control the volume on this one as well.

Plug and Play.  I have 3 of these devices and this one is my favorite.  Since it plugs directly into the TV, out of sight with no connectivity issues.  Latest Roku features as well.  I would buy again and might for other TVs.
Great product that was much easier to set up than the Firestick I had previously. Software and WiFi range is much better too.

Sorry Amazon, Roku rules as far as streaming devices go, not that the Firestick is bad it's just not as good as the Roku!!!Power On/Off and Volume Control is a HUGE plus for me.Ease of navigation, Roku has this one way figured out.

Somehow my kids figured out that if it isn't working, they go up to the back of the tv, hold the controller close to the Roku and press the home or OK button, and once it recognizes, you're good to go.
It works great with lots of free content, and unlike some other Roku streaming devices, this one does the TV’s volume all for $39.99.
I like this particular Roku it shows a pretty picture Great sound and I like it and it has more apps thank you roku thank you Amazon.

This Roku streaming stick+ is a replacement for a defective one.  The first one only lasted a short time and now this one has burnt out.  I do not want a replacement, just wanted to let you know these are probably defective from the start.  I will eat this one and buy one elsewhere.

I had a Roku 2 XD from quite a few years back and I absolutely loved it. However, recently it seemed to keep crashing, even with a strong wi-fi connection. I figured it was time to upgrade, and I'm glad I did. The streaming stick+ was just what I wanted, and was ridiculously easy to start up. Took about 2 minutes and it was up and running. All of my apps work flawlessly now with no crashing. Glad I made the choice to pick up a newer model. Hopefully it has the same lifespan as my previous model. Highly recommended for ease of installation, navigation, and picture quality. Also connects to the tv volume/power which is really convenient!
hook up was fine... they ask for credit card #, but a lot of free channels, access.  We are happy.

The only thing we don't like is that, when using the voice option to bring something up, it doesn't always recognize what we are asking for.
I really like Roku however it seem to need to be replaced more often then I care for.

Roku must have an agreement with Spectrum & Charter cable service company. the stick will not allow me to stream from my main home account when I travel to our second home. I was told that it would allow me to do so, but it does not. This is the ONLY reason that I wanted the stick, otherwise it is useless to me. I will be returning the product.
This fire stick turns any tv into a smart tv. It works very fast and easy to set up.

So here is the deal. I already have a Roku Streaming Stick 3600R (2016 version) in our family room. We liked it so much that we wanted our kids to have it for their play area TV, which was closer to the router. Since the family room now needed a new streaming device, I decided to go with the next logical step, the Roku Streaming Stick+ 3810.I am not new to the Roku experience and interface. It was still very snappy. The great content apps were still there. It's basically waiting for me to do a TV upgrade to 4K, which I don't know when it's going to happen. :)I also did discover that I can actually turn on/off the power to my Sony sound bar and also control its volume using only the Roku remote. This makes it very convenient.To feel good about this upgrade, I decided to do several tests related to the temperature, Wi-Fi signal (both using Roku secret menus) and then a speed test using Netflix. I know the Netflix test is not a pure speed test because it uses the Netflix servers, but it's an acceptable indicator for me.Please keep in mind that this is not a scientific test. It's more of a test to check for systematic changes between the two Rokus given other fixed factors. I did all testing within the span of 1-2 hours so I hope no major changes were introduced that affected the tests.Test Configuration (things that did not change during testing): - I did *not* change any advanced default settings in the Roku devices (e.g. interference mitigation, power, etc.) - For audio/video, Roku devices were connected via HDMI to a Sony sound bar HT-CT380, *not* directly into the TV. Both the sound bar and TV support only 1080p, not 4K. - For power, Roku devices were connected to Dish Network Hopper 3 receiver's USB port, which is nice because it is on all the time, whether Hopper is powered on or in standby. - For Wi-Fi, Roku devices were connected wirelessly to a Netgear Nighthawk R7000 (with custom Tomato Shibby firmware) which supports both bands: 2.4 and 5.0 GHz.Test Results*** Roku Streaming Stick (3600) ***Temperature: 74 C2.4 GHz Signal strength: 252.4 GHz Antenna 1: 292.4 GHz Antenna 2: 32Glitch/sec: 385.0 GHz Signal strength: 195.0 GHz Antenna 1: 175.0 GHz Antenna 2: 19Glitch/sec: 32.4 GHz Netflix Connection Speed: 14.87 Mbps5.0 GHz Netflix Connection Speed: 15.63 Mbps*** Roku Streaming Stick+ (3810) ***Temperature: 97 C2.4 GHz Signal strength: 212.4 GHz Antenna 1: 322.4 GHz Antenna 2: 34Glitch/sec: 1775.0 GHz Signal strength: 285.0 GHz Antenna 1: 345.0 GHz Antenna 2: 32Glitch/sec: 02.4 GHz Netflix Connection Speed: 35.58 Mbps5.0 GHz Netflix Connection Speed: 75.13 MbpsConclusions: - Roku 3810 runs about ~30% hotter than the Roku 3600. I hope it's still within acceptable range. I did not receive any warnings or anything during use. - With Roku 3810, 2.4 GHz overall Signal Strength decreased by ~16% compared to Roku 3600. - With Roku 3810, 5.0 GHz overall Signal Strength improved by ~47% compared to Roku 3600. - With Roku 3810, 2.4 Ghz Netflix connection speed improved by an impressive ~139% compared to Roku 3600. - With Roku 3810, 5.0 Ghz Netflix connection speed improved by an incredible ~380% compared to Roku 3600.Comments: - I noticed in one of the tests that the while the Antennas (1 and 2) signal strengths were higher, the overall Signal Strength was lower. Perhaps the overall Signal Strength takes into account other factors such as  glitch/sec, interference, etc.? I am not really sure. - Even though 2.4 GHz signal was poorer with the new Roku, I still got faster speeds with Netflix. This tells me that not only the antennas are different, but perhaps the Wi-Fi chipset is improved or something. - In general, using 2.4 GHz band produced way more glitches per second compared to 5.0 GHz, so in my situation, I recommend/prefer using the 5.0 GHz band, especially considering the speed test results in Netflix.Overall, I feel happy about the experience.

Works perfect! Cut the core and have no regrets!!!! The  biggest issue see.ed to be it kept streaming after you went to another app! I have the engineering fix! I are one!!!! Get an Alexa controlled plug! When you are done......Alexa turn off Roku! Easy!!!!

Have been using for a few weeks now. We were able to drop cable and save around $80 a month after singing up for a couple services. Works a LOT better then the blueray players we were using for streaming. Glad we bought it

I LOVE IT!!! I was using Dish Network and paying $124 a month. We never could find anything to watch! We decided to give the ROKU a try from the recommendation of a co worker and we love it !! I did take the $40 a month sling subscription but that is optional ..... would recommend to ANYONE!!!
I bought this to replace my existing Roku unit. The picture had become “hazy”. With this unit the picture is back to what it should be.

I upgraded from the Streaming Stick 3500X and LOVE my new Roku Streaming Stick+ it has so many great new features. I like how I only have to use one remote to operate the tv itself and my Roku, along with having the ability to do voice control. Also like how I can plug this into the USB port instead of into a wall outlet, so much better than my old Streaming Stick! It’s worth the price!

Very intuitive user interface. Easy to find what I am looking for. Quick response. Fair price. Haven't tried out the voice feature yet.  Will be using this when I get rid of satellite TV and go with several streaming services.

Installed it on the TV in my workshop which is more than 75 feet from our house and from our Wi-Fi router with one extender. It was easy to install and the extra powerful Wi-Fi that’s built into this Roku makes it easy to watch TV in my workshop.

This thing makes the old Roku stick seem like the stone ages.  Imagine waiting way to long to get new glasses.  You keep saying to yourself "I'll see tomorrow."  Then one day you get a new pair and say, "I CAN SEE."

I had previously purchased the 'table top' version (slightly more expensive) for my daughter, but I decided to try the stick version for myself. Glad I did. It works every bit as good as the more expensive version, yet it is completely unobtrusive.  This baby is completely out of sight: plugs into the USB port on the back of the TV, and the power cord does also. So it's virtually invisible. Works like a charm too!
I’ve had issues with streaming through my tv / ps4 but this is wonderful. No buffering, clear picture, just works.

Easy to install.  Using it to access Hulu Live.  Occasionally have buffering and sound out of sync.  But typically resolves if powered off and on again.  Takes a little time to set up favorite channels.  More stuff to watch than you could ever find on satellite TV for the price.  Works better than apps on smart TV.

We like the Roku interface and options, but the remote is AWFUL. Maybe we just received a bum remote, but it constantly hangs up and has trouble connecting to the device. This may be a deal breaker. FireStick remote never had this issue. We switched because Roku has the Spectrum app.

i Bought this  for my wife and she love it, very easy to use

Easy to setup. Great channels, including free ones.THE FACT THAT THE REMOTE TURNS ON MY TV AND SOUNDBAR AT THE SAME TIME AS MY ROKU IS GREAT. I AM TYPING IN CAPS BECAUSE THIS FEATURE ALLOWS ME TO BE AN OLD MAN AND NOT WORRY HOW THE DOOHICKY WORKS THE DILLIO AND I CAN JUST WATCH TV.

Cut the string from cable! I tried streaming several years ago with no luck. Roku has come a long way and this device is user-friendly. Easy to use, easy to setup/install. I DON'T MISS CABLE and the outrageous cost. Recommend you give this device a try.

Easy to hook up. Easy to use. Cut my tv bills by 2/3 and I still see everything I want to watch. I wish I had done this sooner. I can subscribe to only the channels I actually use. Love Roku!!

I couldnt be more happy. This affordable media player/streamer not only plays every streaming service in the world, it can play media and videos from a NAS with no problems. Super portable, easy to setup, no added wires, voice commands, and it can control the tv as well. It is by far worth the extra money. No connectivity issues and not limited on YouTube like Amazon fire.

Love the voice remote and volume controls on it, seems to be working better then my old plug in type roku.

Product is great. Really loved all the features. Strongly recommended for others. I gave one star because of terrible delivery. Parcel was thrown outside my house. nobody informed me and found them on road. I m just disappointed for mishandling delivery.

The voice recognition and stream quality are Greaaaat! 👍
The stick version is a neat, clean install and I can move it to another TV if needed. The streaming resolution and sound quality is excellent. Wish I got this sooner!

I had an older Roku (2.4Ghz) and it was having trouble getting the signal from my router. This new unit has plenty of signal and I no longer have to tolerate the buffering I used to put up with. Very pleased with this product!
Best Roku Device Yet. Was having trouble with my old Roku and getting reception in the bedroom, but not anymore. Would recommend this device for better reception.
This was broken out of the box, it always got an error.  Customer service wouldn't help at all, just endless copy/paste responses.  I'm done with Roku.
So happy I bought this on accident! It’s so nice to have a upgrade

It's perfect! DO NOT buy the adapters that are shown as often bought with as they are the INCORRECT ones. All you need to plug it in the back/side of your tv comes with it. The display is crystal clear on my 720hp and since it's made for 4K I bet it's also great on higher quality tv's.

I've read reviews about the remote not working after a while. Mine quit after about 5 months. I took the batteries out and ordered another one, the wrong one. After that disappointment I put the batteries back in the old remote and tried it. It worked. Reboot? I don't know but others with this problem might try it.

Excellent device for cord cutters.  Only thing I would change would be the look of the home screen.  Feels a bit cluttered, but is easy to navigate and find what you want.  Also, wish they would add a feature to shut off a tv show or live tv when the tv is shut off, if the device is plugged into the wall for power.  If it is plugged into the tv for power it will shut off.  Some small updates would be great to improve this but overall very satisfied.  Got out of direct tv and went to hulu live tv and use this device regularly.
We are pleased we purchased Roku and highly recommend.  Easy setup and quality programs and streaming.

I want my money back on this product! I installed it and got nothing but the roku channels even though I pay monthly for Netflix Hulu and amazon but can’t get any of those. I waited in the phone for 20 minutes with roku support who did nothing once they answered but say hang on then disconnected now on with them again and the wait tim has gone from 20 minutes to 30 minutes though I have been on hold for 10 minutes! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!
I'm so glad I purchased this item. It upgraded my tv watching experience!

I was late to Roku having tried all its competitors first, but it’s by far my favorite. I originally bought this just to have something for the guest room, but quickly stole it for my own room. It has every app I need and is far quicker/more user friendly than the others I’ve tried.

Freezes constantly. Have to unplug and replug it in at least once a week. For PlayStation Vue, occasionally the info banner would never go away. No matter what I did unless I unplugged it, would make it go away.  Finally the remote would cease to work at times. Again, would have to reboot the stick to get everything to work again.
Turned my computer monitor into a tv and can also split screen watch and use the computer with the roku plugged in.  nice.
Easy to plug in and use right out of the box.The remote works well.No problems.

At first it seemed to work ok but the longer we used it the worse it got. Whenever it would go into sleep mode I would push every button on the remote to try to wake it up and nothing would work, I would have to go directly to the roku stick and push the home button for it to finally come out of sleep mode. Also after time the audio would get behind the video and I would have to pause the show every 10 minutes for it to catch up. This stick would be good for a guest bedroom that doesn't get used daily. We have used a roku for years so I'm not dissing their company as a whole just the stick. I will be going back to the roku box.

Great product, only issue I’ve had is that sometimes the remote becomes unpaired with the roku so I have to use the app on my phone instead to control it. The issue usually resolved after the roku is restarted. It has a way better interface than the main competitor and isn’t trying to push products to do.
This item is fantastic but watch the price. Bought two more at Best Buy for $10 less. Easy to install and use.
Really like the private listening functions. Two people can use their blue tooth ear phones at the same time.

I shopped around for the right Roku for our family.  But I LOVE the interface and platform of this device.  It is easy to use and has simple instructions to follow.  Had it set-up within 5 minutes from opening the box.  I wouldn't be surprised if cable executives have these, they are that good.
Funciona bien con mis proveedor de servicio. No tiene control de volumen.

I have a window antenna the cable TV just became so expensive I had to let it go but with the fire stick I get everything I used to watch anymore the pictures are great I love it I wish I had done this a long time ago
I like it alot. No more high cable bills. Its easy to use
Used to access HBO MAX that my older TV couldn't access.
I got this for my son to watch Disney + and he loves it.
Really enjoy this addition to our television viewing.  Relatively easy to install.
Great product. I use it to watch Netflix and morphs TV..

Total garbage product.  Spend the extra money and get an Apple TV.  Nothing but issues with fire stick.

I don't know why it took me so long to cut the cord!  This little device is amazing.  More tv than we can watch in a life time.  The remote is simple and easy to use.  Picture quality is terrific.  What's not to love?  <3

Very easy to set up and start using for all streaming needs. No cable needed or in area of house where the is no access to connections. It simplifies the ability to watch different steaming products quickly and easily!

The Amazon stick is good but this roku stick is so much better. It has a Netflix, hulu, sling, and Directvnow button. Not only that the buttons are soft and dont hurt your fingers. You also get the roku channel for free (been watching a lot of hells kitchen on that) and am just 100% satisfied.

I bought two at the same time about one year ago. The Roku itself works fine, but the remotes are infuriating. They stop working constantly. Sometimes reprogramming them works, but usually it seems like there isn't any rhyme or reason to it. The Roku can't be used without it, so the remote kind of ruins the whole product.

I bought this in July of 2020. It was working fine until recently. I’ve been getting overheating issues so I stopped using it. Luckily I have Amazon Firestick on my TV in the living room and the bedroom. It only lasted less than a year.

The product is very good and I do like it but I am very upset because I bought it for $50 two weeks before it sold for $30. I am a very good Amazon prime purchaser and I think that maybe I should have been warned to wait another two weeks. Because I had no idea, I spent an extra $20.

We were a little nervous about the Roku stick but it has been easy to use and was super easy to set up. Still getting use to how to navigate around with channels and apps but it's a great product for the amount we paid for it. It has also saved us a ton with our TV bill.

switched to Roku after using a fire stick for 3yrs. did quite a bit of research on which roku stick to get, there are a few different ones to choose from. Well this one is it, its the most recent one hence the disney + launch button on the remote. love how the remote automatically links up to the tv and even my sound bar! you can control the volume plus there's a mute button and powers tv on/off!

This was a great addition to our garage & back yard. The range works perfectly and we were able to sync it to an outdoor TV that had no working remote. So now we have both a way to watch shows & a remote when we sit outdoors!!!

This product,the Fire Tv Stick Lite, does its job but I have to rate it a one for not having a Volume & On/Off button/Feature- which make this remote worthless because u have to get up and turn on/off the Tv and if ur tv has no volume button then this lite remote is Useless.But my other Fire Tv Stick with the Volume & Off/On Feature is 5 Stars❣️

You will need power for the stick. I though a HDMI was all it required, but you will need a USB port for an additional plug or plug it into a wall socket. I also had to order the free HDMI adapter as the design of the TV back was blocking the large stick from going in by itself.

Roku is amazing. It just works! Very easy to navigate even my 75 year old father knows how to work it. I love the extra strong Wifi antenna included in this plus model. You also get the 4K support at a very reasonable price. This is the most value packed Roku model! Get it you won’t be disappointed!
I liked the user-friendly installation that was fairly easy and didn't take more than 10-15 minutes. It is working well with my TV.

I have 3 other Rokus; 2,2's and 1,3. I needed an updated one for a TV. It's super fast in connection and surfing! I highly recommend this stick. No need to aim the remote at anything. The feature to turn the TV on and off with this one remote is fantastic. I also have Amazon fire sticks and this Roku stick is a great addition.
We just love this, got it so my granddaughter could watch Disney Plus & others withthis on my tv but now I tend to watch Prime & many other things on it as well. Great investment!!

the holiday price of 18bucks made it well worth it, but i like this better than roku.

difficult to integrate and communicate with phone and alexia.

Upgrade from an old 2XS model. We LOVE the Roku family of products that work so well.Don't buy the extra USB cable that Amazon suggests. It's not necessary and all needed comes in the box.I've seen some reviews that the startup time for the Roku when using the TV's USB is a problem. I disagree. The startup time of this Roku stick is quite quick and I've never found myself waiting for it.

Works well. This one is located upstairs, so it takes a short time to connect with the wifi. Our other roku has a direct connect via ethernet so we are used to an instant connection with the other one. This works fine. Pleased with the speed of the streaming. Have not used with a 4K tv but pleased with how it works with our HD tv.

Purchased as a gift for family member inspired by Netflix offerings.  Excellent price (early black Friday deal).  Took a free month of a streaming service and will continue.  Much better in many ways than the satellite service we use now.  Only down side, no local or cable news without cost.

Already have the Roku 3 in the family room. This streaming stick +, was really easy to set up and works great. I have it in my bedroom which is quite a ways from my router and it picks up the signal just great. Haven't tried out the voice remote yet. No complaints here!
This is my third one, and I use them in inaccessible places...  such as wall mounted TV's.  I would buy this product again.  I enjoy the features of volume control, mute and voice command.

I have been impresser with Roku since I stopped Dish and started Roku. Roku TV works perfectly, is half the price of satelite, and follows through on every aspect they advertise. The Streaming Stick + is a superior product, typical of Roku.

Faulty power cable!  Kept getting an “Insufficient Power” error.  Moved the stick to every HDMI port on the TV and plugged it directly into the wall, but kept happening.  I dig through an old stash of cables I keep and found a male to female USB cable (not common) and replaces the cable and VOILA!  Problem solved.  Wish they’d refund about 1/2 the purchase price for pain and suffering while I worked through the issue.

The Fire TV stick was easy to set up and use.  I wasn't able to access my Prime Video with my TV, and Netflix works better than with my Dish Network app.  Love the voice Alexa integration too. Well worth the small price tag!
I got this for my boyfriend's little sister for Christmas. She loves it. It's easy to use and  very fast at loading things!
I love this little plug in! I just bought my second one. Cut the cord guys!!!
Great price.  Replaced old fire stick.  Much much faster

Bought for Disney+ which works very well. $ well spent.

I love my fire stick, easy to set up and use.  It does everything my fire box did
Great product. Bought to use with our projector for summer movie nights outside and I couldn’t be more pleased. Highly recommend easy setup and install.

I recently purchased 3 Roku streaming sticks.  I had to replace the original batteries in all 3 but 2 of the 3 remotes drain batteries within a few days.  There is no obvious reason for what causes the power drain which leads me to assume it's poor internal design or production quality.  The Roko support page has no solution other then send it back and we'll send you a replacement.

When we start using the remote it is usually not recognized. Once it starts working it is fine but rarely does it work when the TV is turned on. I have tried resetting the remote and the Roku multiple times and read different options on the web but nothing has cured the problem.

Roku has changed my way to watch TV. User interface is awesome, easy to navigate, fast response. 4K clarity is very good. This has much more value than Chromecast while you pay less money for it. I like the feature of private listening with Roku remote on iPhone with headphone. Lots of free and quality stuff to watch on Roku and Pluto channel. I am waiting for Udemy app to come on Roku. Break the cord people! This device will help!  Lots of programs and movies that you can access. We stream YouTube TV, so we can get local channels. It was real easy to setup. Great to control your TV with one device with the ability to control the volume with this device..

The best choice I could've made. Love the interface and the option to talk to the remote to search for stuff.Only drawback is that I cannot dictate to the remote when I need to input text on the screen, but I can live with it.

This is an awesome better connection on our 4K smart TV with NO slag, or slowing down on streaming shows.  Lots of programing connections too!  Smooth hook up, and endless selections for your viewing pleasure.

Bought because the smart tv we spent good money on doesn’t stream as well as the Roku does. I love Roku. Super easy to use and set up. Even my parents can use it with ease. The sound when clicking/moving on the main page is annoying, but I’ll learn to deal.

Got tired of cable prices going up so dropped it completely and got the roku stick with voice remote. Paired it with sling and get all the channels I had before, and a few I didn't. (not including the initial price of the roku stick my cost is less than 50 bucks, including cost of internet) picture, sound, ease of use, movies and tv, pause, record.  Should have done this switch long ago.  I would highly recommend going to roku.

We finally cut the cord. So I purchased the Streaming Stick + to attach to my semi-smart Vizio 60" TV. Even though it's not a 4K TV the picture looks good at 1080p. This is our 5th Roku in the house, so setup was easy even setting up to power on and off the TV and volume control.The reason for the 3 stars are for the following reasons:1. Voice control is a bust. All of us tried to use the voice control we all received different results. Not sure if it's a learning curve thing or it still needs to grow.2. Remote not responding after a cold startup. It can take anywhere from 15 seconds to a minute for the Remote Status prompt to pop up and then the remote will respond to commands. Now this could also be a side effect of powering up the Roku when the TV starts, as I use the USB port on the TV to power the Roku, because I know my family will not put the Roku in standby when they power the TV off, so the Roku will continue to stream.4/15/18. Update. After reading the Roku stick troubleshooting FAQ, I discovered that some TV's HDMI ports don't play well with the Roku sticks or cause inference. Roku recommends installing the HDMI extender cable. (you can order one from Roku for free) I bought a 3 and 1 HDMI spilter and set the Roku stick in plain view of the remote and no more remote issues.
Makes sure its the STREAMING +(PLUS) AND YOU WILL BE VERY HAPPY IF YOU BUY THE  STREAMING + PLUS

I would definitely recommend going with a fire stick. The product itself is nice but the customer service and shadiness of how they do subscriptions complete over shadows the product.

Works perfectly! Bought this as a Christmas gift for my parents and they are very happy. I bought a Roku streaming stick two years ago and it's been great! Love that I can watch prime video, youtube, etc.

The Roku was very easy to connect and set up.  Simple, clear instructions worked perfectly.  So far a great value, I'm happy I have it.  It can also be used on more than one TV set, so take it with you when you visit friends to keep up with favorite shows or share great movies.

Zero problems installing and using - and my TVs are relatively old. I rotate one Roku device between the living room TV and bedroom TV using Century Link DSL (recommended.) I share Showtime and Netflix subscriptions with a friend across town who also uses Roku with Cox Cable - no problems. I have to change batteries about every 4 months. I will never go back to old-fashioned cable TV watching. #CordCutter #LoveRoku

Went from a PS4 to this. Why did we wait so long? Super easy to set up, took me literally minutes. Picture it's super clear, beautiful and so many choices for viewing! Extremely pleased and will tell everyone! I will be selling the PS4!!

No me agrado comprar el producto y cuando llegue a mi país para instalarlo, este no enlazaba, no pude instalar a pesar que cumplía con todas las especificaciones técnicas. stopped working after 1.5 years i had much better luck with my old roku 2 which is still working after 6 years and my roku express  that is 2.5 years old i woyld stay away from roku streaming sticks...

I thought it was the batteries so they were replaced but I had to keep slapping the remote in the palm of my hand to get it to work. I'd give it 4 stars if the remote wasn't so cheap and ill conceived!!

Great product when it works. Unfortunately most of the time it is buggy to the point that I give up on watching anythingEdit: Bought a new one since I really want it to work and it is a little buggy too. The screen goes completely black for a few seconds every 30 minutes or so.

Seems I have to repair the remote every day. The repair process never works on the first try. Look elsewhere for streaming products
I purchased for the  Xfinity Comcast cable tuner app. Works well and now have all apps in one place and available Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ etc.
Roku gives me the best options for streaming what I want to watch hands down.  I have other devices and I always watch the Roku.
New batteries can only use for the first time and won't work the next day. Have changed many pairs of new Duracell batteries and didn't use any extra features except Youtube streaming.

Bought this specifically for the ability to use the Spectrum TV app in areas of my house (patio & garage) that do not have coax cable outlets.  It works perfectly, super easy setup!  I have found this little stick is capable of so much more, if I didn't work for the cable company and get free service, I would absolutely cut the cord and go 100% Roku. I love the Roku stick! small, easy to move from TV to TV, fast/easy app interface, quality picture, all the streaming apps you could want.  Bought this to "cut the cable cord" and got YouTube TV.  Also was pleasantly surprised how fast Netflix/Hulu/Prime work vs the BluRay player we were using to stream.

I ordered the Roku Streaming Stick because I just had Spectrum TV put in my home. The agent I talked with when ordering Spectrum suggested that I might want to consider the Roku for TVs that don't have a box or TVs that I don't want the box showing. The Spectrum app on the Roku is actually easer to use than the remotes on TVs with the box and I get the benefit of all the other TV available on Roku. I love it!

We now own 3 Roku and love the ease of it. Roku works great! Easy to install and set up. I am using it with an old tv.  I had to plug it into the wall instead of the tv for a better connection. I only wish the remote was backlit. I added the Roku app to my phone and I am able to use my phone as a remote. I tried the voice recognition. It was easy to use. Streaming quality is good. Only two months old.  Overheated and chased two function.  Have two others that work fine so must have been a product defect.  No way to return so bought another.  Frustrating though that I wasted $49.00 .

I have reset the remote several times and the issue reoccurs on a daily bases.

Can the company please send me a new one or contact me about exchanging it somehow.? I’ve spent so much money this week with internet services and it came to be just this one roku device I have not the others. It’s not streaming the connection in an under 20 feet away! Thank you!
Love the Roku don’t have an Alexa to integrate with but the remotes are wonky and have issues

Love everything about it. My husband is slightly technology challenged so I needed something with a remote that was easy to use. I did some researching and cnet highly recommended the Roku stick. I bought the Roku Stick because my tv remote was messing up and needed to find a way to watch tv and my other streaming devices without paying for it. Ditch your extra Charter boxes and get this instead. Not only will it save you money (will only have to pay for one box), but you also get the benefit of additional apps. All you need is one Charter box in order to use the Spectrum app to watch the cable you already pay for.

I cannot do either one. This is soooooo much better than an Amazon Fire Stick.  I had a Fire Stick for a few years.  It got to the point of being a very frustrating experience.  I really wanted to throw it out the window.  Oh wait, I did!  But before I did that, I got a Roku.  This is such an easy device to use.  Plus there are many stations you can load onto this, not to mention the paid content (Netflix, Hulu, etc.).  My TV experience is much more enjoyable now.

The only way I can use this is if I re-pair the remote every single time! Completely pointless! I have changed batteries, increased my wifi strength, and tried all the advice online. Nothing will keep this remote paired and now it is too late to return. I am very disappointed!

It's a Roku how is it possible that you can go wrong with it it's the number one product in the world for streaming television beautiful is great I own multiple of them one on every television in my house and I give them away as gifts because it's such a great product

After 7 months of use, it is keep disconnecting from the network. It is so frustrating to buy 60$ worth of device and this experience. I wish there was simple return process.It has good functionality and support Xfinity app, Netflix, Prime etc but all this functionality becomes no use if it if keeps disconnecting from network. I have changed battery 4-5 times in 7 months. Reason I didnt buy Chromecast as it does not have remote and your remote keeps acting up.
This works amazingly, I’m super happy with the ease of setting it up.  I’ve had no problems with it.

I like that this mode allows for no hanging wires. What I don’t like is how quickly the remote burns through batteries. I have two rooms with the same Roku and they both have the same problem. I’ve even tried buying extra pricey batteries and it doesn’t make much difference.

Newer model of one already owned.  Easy setup and generally intuitive interface. This is my third and favorite Roku. The device itself is small and easy to set up. It is very responsive. The ability to control TV power and volume is a game changer. The voice search is accurate, fast, and so convenient it is fun. My only suggestion for improvement is to get rid of the dedicated channel buttons on the bottom or make them programmable.
I bought this to enable my older TV to be able to stream Disney+ as well as Netflix, Hulu, etc.  Set up was quick and easy and so far, it works perfectly.

I love the ROKU product but not the remote that comes with this unit. The first one that I ordered was cheerfully exchanged with Amazon but I experienced the same issue with the replacement. This new 4k Streaming stick is slim and fits in HDMI ports without needing extra HDMI extender. Installation is quick.  Wifi acquisition is quick and steadfast. I highly recommend it.

I started getting random video issues where half the screen goes green or the video cuts out. I won't bother to review the streaming stick itself, as other reviewers have already done a great job; I just want to point out two huge issues with the Roku remote: you can power your tv on/off and control volume, but there is no Mute button! Seriously?! I also wish that the shortcut buttons for Netflix, Sling, Hulu, and Vudu could be reprogrammed with your own favorite apps. I don't use a single one of those services. I have a workaround for the Mute button: use the Roku app on your smartphone. Turn your Media volume to "off", then press the Headphones icon (private listening) to mute. A bit of a pain, but at least it keeps me from having to use the TV remote for the sole purpose of muting.

I was looking for a way to "cut the cord" and save money on my satellite bill. The Roku Stick was the perfect way to do just that. Set up was easy. Once I plugged it in, there were only a few easy steps to follow and the remote even automatically synced with my television, making the Roku remote the only one I need to use. Once it is connected, you have access to Hulu, Netfix and YouTubeTV to name a few. The voice remote works great if you want to navigate the Roku menu that way.
Off and on and volume does not work at this purchase and cannot watch HBO Max. Can turn off via the settings and menu  And by one button. Major downgrade from the past

I just upgraded from my old Roku Stick.  The voice recognition is worth the price of admission.  Now I can call out show and Roku will show which platforms stream that show!  And the youtube voice search works great, which it didn't when we bought just a voice remote for our old Roku.

This roku is awesome. We have one that’s a few years old, and it still works great, but we needed one for our upstairs tv. The booster on it works across the house and upstairs from the wireless router. I also love the power and volume button included on this one. Bonus!

So far so good, I love this after finding out that the first instruction for installation was the right one for my 4k tv.  I tried the connection to the tv usb port and, although it appeared to work, nah, my programs froze and wouln't load so on to plan 'A', the first connection instruction and, voila, success, everthing is working like crazy.  Incidentally, my tv is a Samsung so that may have a bearing on connecting, dunno.

Works well and pretty intuitive. Could use more quick launch buttons on the bottom. Easy to sign in and use. I never had any problems until recently the remote would stop working. The only thing that would work is the power button. The only way to fix this was to unplug the Roku stick and reset it.

Quick connecting and simple set up. Great snd consistent wifi connection. I have a smart tv and Amazon fire stick but I still use Roku the most. Easy navigation through a simple menu. Grandkids can easily find their channels. Like the new 4k app. Love that I can control tv volume with roku remote, just miss my earbud connection for my bedroom tv.
I bought it to replace an old Roku and to use it alternating with an Apple TV device I have to say that the quality of the picture of the Roku devices much better than the Apple TV

Super fast, easy to install, and a simple, intuitive user interface. Highly recommend this Roku upgraded from a Roku Express that came free with Sling. This is alot smoother and responsive  when navigating streaming apps and adjusting the time line in videos. Also works with YouTube TV, which is my favorite live TV service.
Battery drains really quickly. Going through a set of aaa batteries every week
Works perfectly with my Comcast account and the voice command is a major plus.

I absolutely LOVE my Roku!!  Cut the cable and went to this and couldn’t be happier!  I love that I can take it with me when I travel too.  I highly recommend ditching your cable or satellite and getting one!

Love it so much in my living room that I bought the express for my bedroom. Really good for streaming movies and series and a lot cheaper one time buy unlike cable. I was paying nearly $200 in cable bills and decided to try streaming instead. Just hook it up and follow the instructions on your tv monitor.
I got this to replace an old one. It was easy to set up and work well.

I speak into the remote what movie I would like to watch, and the search function finds it on Netflix or my Amazon Prime movie accounts. It is a very handy device that plugs into my TV's HDMI port and gets power from my TV's USB port.

I purchased the Roku Streaming Stick + a few months back but have been having persistent HDCP Errors.  The Error would happen every few minutes and was extremely annoying.  I really wanted this $56 device to work so I researched several solutions and found this one on some geek page.  I don’t know what that says about me but, long story short here’s what you can do if returning your Roku Streaming Stick +  is no longer an option and you have an extra $40 to spend.In able to use a HDMI cable that is HDCP 2.2 compliant as the Error page indicates, you must first plug your ROKU SS+ into the input of a HDCP 2.2 compliant HDMI splitter, then connect your 2.2 compliant cable to one of the outputs on the splitter to a HDMI input on your TV.  Since the Roku SS+ derives it’s power through a very short usb cable, I simply kept the splitter/Stick union close to the USB port on the back of the TV to allow use of the provided cable front the Roku SS+ to the usb port.  I happened to already have a 3D brand splitter that worked just fine but I suspect others will work as well as long as they are HDCP 2.2 compliant.I’ve included some pics.  Note you can see both ends of my new, black colored HDMI cable running from the splitter output to the HDMI input on the TV (the HDMI input on my tv is sort of hidden behind the Roku in the picture) and the short usb cable running from the Roku SS+ to the USB port on my LG tv for power.  The splitter has a stand alone power source but when I plugged the USB powered Roku into the splitter it provided power to both the splitter and the Roku and I did not need to use it.  Hope this helps!Two days since I added the splitter to my cable arrangement and so far no more HDCP Errors!  The picture and sound is fantastic.  Finally working like it should have on its own.  Would have gotten 5 stars if it had!

Who needs cable or satellite especially if you can’t afford it? This is my second Roku streaming stick and I couldn’t be happier. It’s too cumbersome to move my current Roku streaming stick from the living room TV to bedroom TV every time I want to watch one or the other so I snatched this one up for a great Black Friday price. Just like the other one it was a snap to set up and took less than fifteen minutes from start to finish. And that included downloading the 265 channels already in my account. Cheap, endless entertainment for all tastes with much of it free, at a nominal cost or for small monthly fee (like Netflix, etc). Spend as much or as little as you like. Cheap, quick and easy. What’s not to love? One note though: you must have internet and you’ll need the code for your WiFi for set up. Once you enter that code and follow the onscreen instructions you’re done. You have to login to Roku’s website to set up an account and also enter a code that will appear on your TV screen during setup. No worries, it’s all good. And very easy.
What can I say, it's a Roku!!  Very easy to use, reliable, and I love it.

I had this set-up on one TV, inches away from the router, and it was iffy.  Powering the unit from the TV is hit or miss, and using the device was not a joy in any event.  So I move it to the kitchen, in a nearby room.  Set-up has proven impossible.  First, the Roku is a thoughtful object, often pausing to consider its next move for a good half a minute.  Restart the unit.  Good idea, except now you pass by one option which, without choosing it, prompts the device to "Connect to Network" which the whole point of the restart is it's not connected.  After satisfying itself that it was not connected, I was permitted to go to wireless set up.  The device often paused for another half minute between password character entries to contemplate the wonders of the universe.  The installation guide says the remote will work through a TV, necessary since the device connects to the back and I, for one, prefer to watch from the front.  It does.  Sometimes.  This is with pretty fresh Duracell batteries and a small kitchen TV.  The device said it had a strong signal. but never connected in the other room.  But I least with have a new remote, so there's that.I give it two stars because the idea of Roku is much better than paying the cable company $100 a year, per TV, for the privilege of watching what you already pay for, and it did sort of work on one TV.

I originally got the Ultra, but after months of frustration with HDMI connectivity issues with the Ultra, i decided to get the stick in order to avoid connecting with an HDMI cable. It worked.  The Roku stick works great.  The Roku interface is the most intuitive....much better than Apple TV (which goes for cool rather than intuitive) or various smart TV interfaces which are generally awful.  Roku is able to get all the apps you want.  I have yet to find a channel it doesn't get.As to the Ultra, I would avoid it.  It works for a while and then out of nowhere it tells you your HDMI cable is not compatible. You need version 2.2.  I kept buying new HDMI cables to meet the stated requirements.  But it was always the same story.  After a while the Ultra would reject my new cable and refuse to show the streaming video I was trying to watch.  It did this on YouTube TV, HBO, Showrime and Amazon Prime channels.  I changed screen resolution settings, rebooted, reset...nothing worked as the Ultra is a flawed design.So save youself the headache and buy the Roku stick, which works very well.

ZERO stars is what this company deserves. I bought a Roku Streaming Stick+ from Amazon on 10/16/17. It worked flawlessly for about five months. Now the remote disconnects regularly and I have to reconnect it several times each evening. In addition, I constantly get a message on my TV screen that the Advanced Wireless Receiver is not detected. Sometimes, I have to to unplug and re-plug the Advanced Wireless Receiver as many as a dozen times before it will work...briefly before it malfunctions again. These problems with the remote and the Advanced Wireless Receiver (both items covered by Roku's One-Year Warranty) have persisted for weeks.I got in touch with customer service quoting the device number and explained the problems with the defective Roku in detail. The only response I received were silly suggestions that other Bluetooth devices may be interfering with my Roku. This is ridiculous. The Roku worked perfectly for months and I have not introduced any new devices with Bluetooth into the room. My recent problems are due entirely to malfunctioning Roku components, not interference from other devices. My internet connection is working just fine as well. I'm not having issues with any other devices in my home that connect to the Internet.I have repeatedly emailed Roku to ask them to honor their One-Year Warranty and send me a new device to replace the broken one. Thus far, they have acknowledged my emails with "Your request has been updated. To add additional comments, reply to this email." but no further response.I have tried calling Roku's toll-free customer number, but over several hours it has been a constant busy signal. I got in touch with Amazon Customer Service to see if they could help me speak to someone at Roku. They tried to contact Roku over the phone, but got only the same busy signal as I did.I have bought many Roku products in the past and - until recently - I would have recommended them to anyone. My opinion of this company has changed completely. They make an inferior product which malfunctions in less than a year. They do not honor their clearly advertised One-Year Warranty against defective parts. Roku employees instead give long-standing customers the run-around and refuse to deal with their legitimate complaints. They withdraw customers' ability to contact the company by telephone. They are behaving very much like a company that is about to go bankrupt and can only hide and cower from irate, dissatisfied customers. I would strongly advise against spending your hard-earned money on any Roku product. Unless Roku's response to customers improves dramatically, Amazon should seriously consider withdrawing all Roku products for sale on their website.UPDATE: 5/8/2018 To date, Roku has STILL not honored their warranty. Roku tech support is the worst! I will never again buy a Roku product. At least with the Amazon Fire TV Stick, I know Amazon will stand behind their product and that I will be able to talk to an actual human being on the phone if ever I experience a problem with my device.

This is incredibly annoying because the TV only has one HDMI port capable of 4k @ 60 Hz @ 4:2:2 or 4:4:4 color, guess where it's located?In order to use this on my TV at the best quality I have to buy an adapter that costs like $10-15.  Roku could have included something like this in the box for pennies.

I am not talking about Youtube TV or Youtube Red here and some times I Utube instead of Youtube, eh? Yesterday the UPS delivered my "Roku streaming stick + 4K HDR/HD" $54 on Amazon; so last night I hooked it up; my Smart dumbed down by Google TV is old; it can't take advantage of the + stuff nor will its usb provide enough power to run the Roku stick; they include a 110 power adapter & cord just in case. I knew all this before but bought it to get VOICE CONTROL and the extra Wi-Fi range. I give it three stars; there is NO web browser on this version! You can sign in to youtube on it with your PC. Google will not let Roku access to your accounts; so none of your history or favorite channels show up nor can you up load videos via Roku. It is hard work finding and moving the Utube app to where you can use it. Every thing else on Roku except Utube works PERFECTLY. Big disappointment "voice control" won't find any thing on Utube but, it will find anything else that is in there; it will find the Utube app after you get it installed; which is real good because it is impossible to find. I was hoping that I could just say "Hickok45" and it would find him; no luck on that but, it does find Utube. Once in Utube with out Google support I can find my favorite channels, add them to a list so they will be there every time(the one thing I could not do with out Roku) it is very hard to work with the Utube app; there are no instructions but before I went to bed I added Hickok45, nutnfancy, some others to a list on Roku/Utube. Very hard work! I did notice as I worked with youtube; Roku was modifying its recommendations for me to watch. So I guess it will improve over time?The ONLY reason for any one with a smart TV to buy Roku is to use the Youtube app and/or Pornhub (Pornhub has the instructions on it on how to install it on Roku; I will up date when I try it, eh?) on your TV. It ain't Roku's fault that they can't make it perfect. They are fighting Google to get it at all and Google will not let me/you give Roku access to our Google accounts to Roku. However Roku knows why we buy it! They could put the Utube app and Pornhub app right in there next to Amazon so we could just click on it to install it. Instead of spending an hour just to find&install Utube, eh? If you have a smart TV Roku is only necessary if you watch Youtube. If you do have Wi-Fi in you house and a dumb TV you might be able to turn that TV into a smart TV if it has "HDMI" slot/slots with even a cheaper Roku stick.

I bought this ROKU Streaming Stick because I had the latest version of the same product and that I already knew what ROKU products were. This year my sister wanted to watch Netflix on her HD TV, and this is what I chose to buy for her on sale at Amazon.com for Christmas. Until now, it seems satisfying and it works fine, but for Canadians, the choice of interesting channels is really limited. In Quebec, the most interesting channel is Netflix, and a few rudimentary games. This product is good for Netflix, The Weather Network, but TunIn is a rudimentary App, there is no Spotify for free, no HULU and other similar Apps just like in United States, no Amazon Fire TV App, No Oviguide App, no ROKU Streaming Channel and other interesting American channels as they are not available in the downloads section. Else other things, nothing negative to say, the thing works fine for Netflix.  For Canadians or people from the Quebec Province that do not have cable TV, there is one interesting channel named CanadaTV for 1.99$ CAD/month that is available and with this service you can have main English and French TV channels available in Ontario and Quebec. It is worth it for the price as I do not have CBC on the cable TV in Quebec. I wish that the ACORN TV APP for British series would be 1.99 $ CAD/month too, but it's 4.99$ CAD/month and I can't have it as it is too much paid for combined services such as cable TV, phone and Internet.

This Roku Streaming Stick Plus will turn any TV into  a Roku TV.  Setup, activation and control of TV no hassle, very easy and quick (under 5 minutes).  Just follow the very simple included directions - that's it.  I have or have had Roku 1, 2, 3, Purple Stick, Black Stick and TCL Roku TVs.  Loved them all and all still work I'm just a tech device junkie.  This Roku is the absolute best Roku I've used yet.  I was amazed that it actually make my super cheap old bedroom TV perform the same as my TCL Roku TVs.  I can turn my tv on/off and control the tv volume with just one remote now. This Roku is super fast also, faster on channel app load and video startup than any of my other Rokus.  This Roku has 802.11ac dual-band MIMO wifi with a super effective wifi antenna.  I have an excellent a/c wifi router, which is a large part of a Roku or any streaming players ability to stream today's high bit rate action videos.  If you still have older n wifi in particular, you may have problems with any streaming device.  So the few bad reviews you see, that the problem, not the Roku. I love this Roku Streaming Stick Plus and want to now get one to replace my Roku Premiere.  Why, because it is so easy to use.  Spouse, family and friends can work this one remote Roku will no problem.  None Roku users and new Roku users are going to absolutely love it.

This review is for the Roku Streaming Stick+.  As a whole, the Roku stick was a good idea.  I installed it on both of my TVs.  I got rid of all but basic cable for local channels and selected amazon prime as my streaming service.  So I'm saving $60 bucks a month now.  I like looking thru prime and some of the free streaming sites to pick things to watch.  There's seems to be plenty to watch....more than I'll ever have time for.  I really like the fact that I don't have so many commercials to endure anymore.  On Amazon Prime, I don't have to look at any commercials.  On some of the free streaming sites, there are commercials, but only a few per every commercial break (not 5 minutes worth the way cable tv overwhelms me with the same commercials over and over again).  There's only one irritating thing about the Roku that I would change and that's the strange thing that seems to happen to the volume on both of my TVs.  When I'm watching a program or movie,  the volume gets (a lot) louder when music starts to play.  I'm not sure what to do about it.  Also, if there's a free streaming program that has commercials with it, the commercials are way louder than the show I'm watching.  So, I have to watch the volume or else I'm blown out of my seat by the immense volume change.  Still, I like the change we made going to roku streaming sticks.  I look forward to completely breaking from cable in the future.

I really wanted to like this, but this model has some very serious lag issues between the remote and the stick. After doing more research I learned that this is a pretty common problem with this Roku model. I have a much older Amazon stick which I bought around 3 years ago, which works flawlessly, but sadly at this time it has been misplaced. To trouble shoot, I disconnected every wifi device in my house but the Roku, which was only about 5 feet from the router, then walked up one foot in direct line of the stick, and still had major lag issues. Batteries showed a full charge, and I even changed those but still no luck. A lot of customers who had this same problem (from the very first day like me) said their Roku remote eventually stopped working all together, and sadly a lot of times past Amazon's return date. I like Roku products overall, and I own 3 other Roku devices, (mainly because certain channels I can only get on Roku, that Amazon doesn't yet offer) and all of those remotes work just fine. Roku really dropped the ball big-time on the remote for this model. I wonder if that is why Roku lowered the price more on this one model (at this time) than all of their others. Amazon as always, was super-awesome, (I believe in giving credit, and not just fault, to those who deserve it) and allowed me to swiftly return it for a refund. If you are in the market for a dependable 4K streamer, I sadly do not recommend this model!

We already had one Roku Stick + that we use for our gym TV.  But I wanted to get another to add to our home theater so I could install Plex and watch Netflix on our projector.  Previous stick was purchased from big box electronic retailers, but I decided to give it a try on Amazon for this one and compare both products.Conclusion:  This Roku Streaming Stick+ works exactly like the one you buy from anywhere else.  Same great product from different retailer.PROS:  You don't even have to get up to buy it.  If you plan ahead, you can order this product few days in advance than you need.  So this way you have this available when you need it and you don't even have to change your cloths or put on shoes.  You will have this great product waiting outside your front door.CONS: Only bad thing about this is you can't get it right away.  You have to wait until your Amazon shipment arrives.  It could be same day, 2 days or longer depending on your location.  For our older Roku Stick, I was able to go to local store and it was available to use right away.  So unless you have planned ahead, you would have to wait.
